hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hello, I am from Tibet, a tour operator and organizer for Tibet. My group of 9 traveled throughout USA between Jan.26 and Feb.10. I organized everything in advance with our distinguished USA guests' assistance and recommendation. Lucky we chose this nice hotel in NYC. And we enjoyed the meal, location and almost one week stay. We were impressed. This hotel location, meals and prices are great. By the way, when we were in USA, we felt very safe to travel around, walk around, there were very few COVID19 cases, while at the same time, there were many in some parts of China and some cities were lockdown and people can not move. How lucky that moment was! But we were so sad to know that just 2-3 weeks later, there were so many cases in NYC, really horrible. We pray hard for people in USA and wish all will go better soon. What we may suggest for other travelers is, stay home and travel later in 2020 due to the pandemic. Worldwide tourism is hardly hit, and Tibet/China tourism is the same. Lets fight together to defeat it. Tony from Tibet Local Guide (Local China Guide travel service's Tibet headquarter)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time to New York, was recommended this hotel by parents who came here! It was lovely didn’t let me down, made the time here very enjoyable, cannot moan about anything, clean, tidy, friendly overall lovely. It’s in the centre of everything couldn’t be in a better location, the breakfast is good quality, but the que can be very long, but goes very quick. On the way back to JFK we got a taxi organised by the hotel, they said the fee included taxi, tolls and the tip in the price they said, but when we got to the airport the taxi driver said it didn’t include the tip which was annoying, but all in all lovely hotel and brilliant and enjoyable time here

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights in March. Lovely, modern hotel and just around the corner from Time Square, easy access to the tour buses from here too. The breakfast and dinner was lovely (too easy to over eat though). Most of the staff are very friendly but the hotel concierge could work on her attitude.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is all all location, location, location.Aside from it, it's a rather average experience from a service and quality perspective. Rooms are very badly isolated so street noise is permanent all night long, so if you are a light sleeper, this is most certainly not the hotel for you. Room size is in line with the average Manhattan hotel room.Buffet breakfast set up has the feel of a large beach resort (like those of this hotel chain in sunny shores): an endless amount of tables next to each other so that you cannot enjoy a private conversation with your better half, feels like a factory where everything is self-service and of low quality.On the plus side, this hotel is a 2 minute walk to Times Square so if location is important to you, then you may wish to consider this property as an alternative which is probably priced below the average hotel room in that part of town.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Sisters holiday to New YorkStayed at Riu Plaza in Times Square early March on a half board basis. The Staff are so helpful and polite.The Hotel decor is modern and spotless. The rooms are luxurious ,Power Showers, toiletries supplied and rooms cleaned every day. Well done to house keeping.Fridge in room is a bonus,bottles of water supplied free.The breakfast and evening meal choice was fabulous, so many choices.Stayed here 2 years ago and would not stay any where else.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights in feb half term, location of hotel is great a short walk from Broadway and Times Square.Breakfasts was nice and lots of things to choose from, staff was helpful but it does get busy and sometimes you have to wait.Rooms are small but has everything you need, small fridge which has bottles of water which I thought was great after a long flight and arriving late.Iron and ironing boards was a big plus for me, nice to have that in the room.Overall was a lovely hotel and if I return I would most definitely stay here, do love a RIU hotel, have stayed in many.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent a week in NYC with two fun mother/daughter teams and wanted to be close to everything. Riu fit our location-literally walked no more than two blocks to Broadway shows. A couple of blocks from Times Square and shopping/subway.Rooms are small but perfect for the limited time we were in them. Comfortable beds, helpful front desk staff (thank you, Natalia!), and the buffet-style restaurant is decent if it’s part of your package-don’t think I’d pay for it, though. We would stay here again for sure! Clean, comfortable, and near the action!Hint-go to Bond45 and have some drinks!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location close to all the main attractions in Manhattan, and the staff was really helpful at our stay, the rooms and the lobby are clean and nice, the breakfast buffet was good and organized, me my wife and kids had a great experience. Thank you

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice staff, clean and presentable rooms. Decor was a bit unless you like purple. Good location, easy walking distance to MSG, Central Park and subway. Just not very sound proof. We were on level 7 and heard horns honking at all hours. Wasn’t that bad, but might be worth requesting a higher floor if you are a light sleeper. Buffett breakfast was a huge bonus. We were in a 2 bed room which was tight, but for Times Square NY, was expected.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights just prior to the Coronavirus pandemic. From check in to departure, our stay was comfortable, fun and enhanced by friendly and courteous staff. Rooms are not the largest, but perfectly adequate - be warned, the glass walls separating the bathrooms do not totally obscure the view of the occupant!! Our 18th floor room had fantastic views over the lights of Times Square - thank goodness for blackout curtains! The buffet breakfast and dinners were superb, so much choice and offering amazing value for money. The Fashion Bar has a lovely quiet ambience serving delicious cocktails. We will definitely return here for our next trip to the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It was our first time to New York at the start of March and it was outstanding! The hotel was located perfectly, the receptionist went through the requests on the booking and even gave a small box of chocolate for my birthday! The room was perfect size for my friend and I with a minibar, tv with wide selection of channels and the bathroom is nice too. We had breakfast at the hotel, there was a large selection of food and they catered well for my friend's dietary requirements. Would love to stay again on another visit to New York!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights beginning of March, everyone was polite and friendly. Our room was lovely and had an amazing view of New York which I very much enjoyed. Very clean. Breakfast was lovely in the morning and very well manned by staff. Thank you very much, would definitely stay here next time I come to New York!
user_name:
RebeccaBelcher
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Last stayed here just before the virus shutdown of New York (and the world), good luck to all. This hotel is beautiful and modern (I like that). My room was very clean and quiet, good blackout curtains and a very comfortable bed.The RIU includes a very comprehensive breakfast, anything you could want must be in the buffet. The lobby bar is great -- try the cosmo. The entire lobby is nice for sitting and watching the world. But the world is just outside -- everything New York has to offer is easy to access from this location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very clean, polite staffed, quiet for the area. good/lots of food, loads of lifts, quickly served, even got an early check in! Charging points in lounge. Friendly welcome. Free water in the fridge. Beds made every day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited last week for my wife’s birthday and have to say amazing on all levels. The hotel is modern and immaculate we got a free upgrade the room was fabulous and overlooked Times Square. Breakfast covers everything and was again fabulous staff polite and we didn’t have to wait at all. As it was my wife’s birthday they gave her a cake and sang also a gift a wonderful touch to a fabulous holiday. Ideal location for all attractions would definitely recommend. Special time making wonderful memories.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Room was very clean, bed was comfy. Room was always made up by the hotel staff when we went out which was nice. Food in the buffet downstairs was really nice and breakfast was tasty. Staff was friendly at the hotel. Great place to stay if you want to go to Times Square of a night as you are literally a few minutes away.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed a short trip to New York,Hotel Riu was in a great location smooth check in with (Jose)Great room on 12th floor overlooking Times Square. Good buffet breakfast, get down early though as it will get very busy. So much to see and do from every direction, we did buggy ride in Central park, visited WTC 9-11 memorial, Did the Staten Island ferry. Had a really good time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just returned from a seven night stay at the Riu Plaza which is a fantastic hotel in a great area. The hotel is very clean and modern when we checked in we were allocated a room on the third floor I had requested on my booking through Booking.com a high floor, I mentioned this to reception and was allocated a room on the 19th floor (room 1916) which had a great view.Times Square is a couple of minutes walk away and the hotel is situated on the edge of the Hells Kitchen area with plenty of places to eat. The breakfast is okay but you need to be down early to avoid an over crowded dining room. We booked with booking.com all fees and taxes were included so we had no nasty surprises at checkout.I would definitely return to this hotel, just a couple of tips / recommendations not related to the hotel - if you want to go up to the pedestal at the Statue of Liberty the first 200 people through the ticket office receive a free ticket. We where lucky enough to receive a ticket, the views were excellent. If you fancy watching a show go and see Moulin Rouge we can not rate this show highly enough and would definitely go and see it again. We booked tickets before we travelled as it does get booked up quickly and it is rare to secure tickets from the booths in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel, great location. Facility fee not mentioned and not authorized. For fitness (never used) and 2 bottles of water (not refilled every day). When we reserve you do not pay attention to the fee acc.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just returned from our 3 night stay, on arrival the hotel is immaculate and very modern (part of the reason we chose this hotel) we checked in with a lady named Sarah who was quite unhelpful, it was short and sweet and only conversation we got was around the payment to secure a deposit. No mention of giving us a map, local knowledge of the area, the hotel information I.e where the restaurants are, toilets etc. So on we went to our room, room was lovely nice wee space and very contemporary design. The thing I would say is that this hotel is very clean and immaculate. Nobody told us about facility fees until we got to check out which my partner is going to query this as this is false advertising and should be mentioned at check in. We also asked reception where we got the hop on hop off bus as we bought the New York pass for excursions only to be told “I don’t know” I mean seriously?!?! It was only that on our last day we saw the bus literally on the other side of the road is the pick up so folks you know where it is if you are looking for this. Reception staff have zero knowledge of the area or might just be simply rude. Catering staff are lovely in the restaurants and always welcoming. Think I will visit another hotel next time. Poor show for a high chain hotel apparently.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a stay in this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed, the hotel is spotless and clean. We had breakfast and dinner whilst their and could not fault the food it was plentiful and good quality. We have nothing but praise for the staff and found them pleasant and friendly, the dining area’s do get busy but we never had any problems with this we never experienced or witnessed any rude staff but did witness rude guests, what is the matter with people who at times wander around thinking they can be rude to people doing their job some people need to have a good look at themselves and their own behaviours.Would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a fabulous hotel! Perfect location, immaculately clean, food was fabulous. The staff were all so incredibly helpful, they could not do enough for you. Check in was swift and straightforward. Our room was stunning, with amazing views straight over towards the Hudson. Rooms were well equipped with hairdryer, fridge with water, USB sockets, a safe and selection of toiletries. There is a charge on checkout which I was expecting and is the norm when travelling now, about $21 per night I think it was. Bag storage on last day was well organised and well staffed. Breakfast can be busy, but we never had to wait long, the staff were very organised in the restaurants. I do believe I could not have found a better hotel. Thank you for making our stay so memorable!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Clean, comfortable hotel right in the middle of the action. Easy check in, had the option to wait for a room on a high floor which was a brilliant view. Be aware there is a 50 dollar a night credit card charge required at check in, fully refunded when you check out. Great selection for breakfast. It’s a busy hotel in a busy city. Times Square is just one block over and you can walk easily to midtown, Empire State, Central Park, circle line cruise and air and space museum in 10 mins away and tube stations everywhere for all the rest.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have stayed at the Riu Plaza Times Square this week from the 4-7th March and have checked out today. I am absolutely appalled that I am having to write this but we had some bags of shopping stolen from our room. On the evening of the 6th March I noticed one bag of shopping was missing.We had the hotel room upside down searching incase we had miss placed the bag but no nothing - we searched for hours. Inside was personalised gifts we’d had made to take home, they wasn’t overly expensive but they were sentimental items we had bought. After searching for quite some time I was assured they weren’t in the hotel room or on the side where I had originally left them so I called reception to report the issue. I spoke to a lady called Grace on the phone and she said the issue would be taken to management and that housekeeping start at 7am so I would be given an update early the next morning. I didn’t receive any update, but then as I was packing our cases to leave I realised that a Macy’s bag was also missing and again it had items in we had bought to take home. I immediately called reception again and said I’ve just realised a second bag had gone missing. I was then told it had been reported that a second bag had gone missing and that I would be called shortly. We waited in our hotel room for another hour this morning but no phone call. We then went down to reception ourselves and the minute we said our room number to the lady on the front desk a manager was pretty much ready and waiting - funny that?! Clearly was ready and waiting to give us the poor excuses that he did. We spoke to a man called Diego who was the front desk manager who was extremely unhelpful. I was really upset , more or less in tears at the thought that someone had been in our room and taken items. They weren’t expensive as I’ve said but it was the principal that someone thought it was acceptable to take our things we had bought. I explained that we’ve now noticed a second shopping bag had gone missing and he was just rude and extremely unsympathetic. The only answer we received from him was “Our cleaners don’t steal”. As a customer that wasn’t the response I’d have hoped for - the customer service received was terrible. After I pretty much had to beg him for something to be done he looked on the system to find out who had been able to swipe in and out of our room and apparently it was just us and the cleaner. The cleaner apparently said that she didn’t take or throw our bags in the bin which I find extremely odd because things don’t just vanish. Clearly the cleaner wasn’t going to say if she had or hadn’t. Finally the manager agreed to waiver the facility fee of $65.40 as we had to go and re buy the items that were taken - that was about the only thing he did to be helpful. It was made out by him to be all our fault, I should be able to leave things in our hotel room without worrying that someone would take them. He tried to fobb me off with a customer service email address originally - theft is a lot more serious I believe than just a quick email to customer service and this should have been dealt with a lot better than it was and I hope a full investigation is undertaken by the hotel and senior management. This was extremely distressing for us and I wouldn’t ever stay here again. When walking past the cleaners trolly earlier this afternoon there was a key card lying around which wasn’t a good sign either - anyone could have taken this card and accessed peoples rooms. A real shame because the hotel was lovely but what with our things going missing and the lack of customer service we received that was enough for me to not come back - it has made our last day in New York not so nice. If you do stay at this hotel LOCK EVERYTHING AWAY. I will be taking this further with a full complaint.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here with our daughter for a three night break. We had a room on the 24 th floor with views over downtown Manhattan. The rooms are clean and well maintained, people complain they are small but we were here to visit the sites not stay in the room. Yes the breakfast area does get busy but we never waited more than five minutes to be seated. There a numerous choices of both hot and cold dishes and food was always replenished. The staff were friendly and the hotel is in an excellent location just a few minutes walk from Times Square and the nearest subway station. The only minor issue was having to take your room card in and out to operate the lift. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently returned from this hotel after our first visit to NYC. When we arrived at the hotel after a long day travelling first impressions of the hotel were good. Very modern reception area and very clean. Check in was ok and pretty quick. They took a hold deposit of $200 for our 2 rooms to cover any breakages etc which incurred whilst there. This was refunded at the end of the holiday and back in my account within 2 days of leaving, bearing in mind we left over the weekend. Our resort fees were included in the cost of the holiday which we booked with TUI and these covered all WIFI usage, bottled water etc in the room. Once checked in we went to our room. I had emailed the hotel prior to arrival and requested 2 rooms next door to each other and on high floor with views. Both of these requests were fulfilled with our rooms being on floor 27. The room was adequate for the amount of time we spent in it. I believe all hotel rooms in NYC are small. There is not a lot of space for clothes with only a small area of wardrobe and 4 small drawers, but we utilised what space we had. Rooms were kept clean by housekeeping staff who cleaned everyday. Breakfast was included in the cost of the holiday. I had read reviews beforehand about breakfast, stating to be down early as after a certain time it became like a cattle market. We were down for breakfast on the first morning at 7am and already it was a free for all. I understand you are in New York and it is hectic all the time but I think a little more organisation would be better. The dining room is like sitting in a school canteen with no ambience and no privacy with tables being so close to each other that you had no privacy to talk to who you were with. Although there is quite a few choices at breakfast, the quality is quite poor for a 4 star hotel. This resulted in us having to have breakfast out of the hotel after only 2 days as we really couldn’t face it any longer. In NYC you expect to be able to eat the breakfast the hotel provide as it does cost a lot of money to go there and the extra expense on top of what you have already paid for isn’t ideal. The hotel is in a great location, only 3 minutes walk to Times Square and also within easy reach of other famous landmarks so can’t fault the location. Some staff are very helpful but some are very rude and make you feel like you are a problem when asking for information or help with anything. Other than the problem with the breakfast and some rude staff the visit was ok but now I have seen it and done it I wouldn’t return to NYC as plenty other places on my bucket list

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Located just off Times Square so easy to reach everything.Subway stops nearby if don't want to walk downtown.Rooms was a little smaller than expected but clean, warm and modern. Had worried about noise from some of the reviews but not a problem at all (we only had a room one side of us)Hotel bar was nice if legs are too tired in the evening.Breakfast -- lots of choice. We were always up early so not too busy, but saw a queue forming as we left. Dinner -- (we got half board for same price as B&B). Less busy, canteen style but again lots of choice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The room was clean and in good order, it is in a prime location for Times Square and access to tubes and buses.The staff are neither friendly or approachable (especially Cristal) it took several attempts to find out why there was a $95 charge for "hotel tax" on our bill? Turns out its for the use of the Gym(Which we didnt) complementary water in the room, and tips, which are supposedly discretionary. The taxi organised by the hotel to pier 61 (a 13 mins drive) cost $55 but the same return journey back $25 ?The breakfast is included, though the food is OK, at one point the queues to be seated were down steps to the gym, but after you get seated (split dining room one side is better than the other) Its all self service.This is supposed to be a four star hotel but I would rate it as a 3 at best and would not recommend it to any of my friends. I would travel to New York again but would not stay at this hotel. On the whole it was an interesting trip and there is plenty to see, but I found the New York people quite rude compared with other places in the US that we have visited.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My search details for Times Square 2 adults, 1 child. This hotel came up with 2 double beds plus free breakfast so I booked it. When my confirmation came thru it said 2 adults with breakfast. I called booking.com and they advised me no problem, they will take care of it at the hotel, your son will get breakfast. Ha! Clearly they have never stayed here. After paying an extra $50 to check in early, we asked them if they could add a note for 3 breakfast. The staff are a mess. No one seemed to have a clue. They were not friendly and seemed to want to blow us off. The check in man (name escapes me) didn’t know what to do, consulted with a lady who I’m assuming was a supervisor who told him she couldn’t do anything either, and we should talk to Diego, the manager later in the afternoon. We returned as asked and spoke to Samuel who had even less clue than the original guy. He was banging around on his computer for every bit of 5 mins before I said to him do u need our name or room #? We asked for Diego, he said he talked to Diego and now he was handling. He gave us some bull story about it needing to go thru reservations and they hadn’t updated yet etc etc. later that evening we checked back and the next guy had no idea what to do and called the night manager over. She seemed nothing short of put out to be bothered. She tapped away & then said no, we cannot five your son breakfast you have to pay. My husband said he found it remarkable that no one is willing to comp my son a breakfast also, she told us to hang on, went to the end of the desk, picked up a phone then came back & said NO. You will have to pay. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. I agree with all the other reviews that say this. You are a number in a cattle market not a customer.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I booked a room to this nice hotel and I had some problem in reaching New York.I contacted them and explains the situation.They have been extremely kind understood the situation and they helped me in this situation. I thank all the staff of this kind hotel and for the future it will have always the priority.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stopped in the Riu plaza New York Times Square with my girlfriend on the 22nd of Feb until the 27th of Feb, the break was booked through TUI and included breakfast. The hotel was great and the location is perfect for people looking to explore New York. When we arrived the check in was swift and the staff we’re very polite and helpful. Our room was on the 19th floor. It was a double room which was a little on the small side but this didn’t bother us as we knew we weren’t going to be in there too much. The room was very clean and modern and had a great views looking out onto the city. The bathroom just included a shower, it would of been nice to have a bath to soak in after walking around the city but the shower was very very good so this did make up for it. The room was cleaned daily around 10am we think and they did a great job each day, every time we got back the room was immaculate. Breakfast was good in the hotel plenty to choose from and good standard for a buffet breakfast. Our advise would be to use the fashion bar buffet rather than the main dining hall. It’s much quieter and better suited to couples and has the same choice of food as the main restaurant. We only had to wait to be seated one morning for around about 15 minutes, best to go before 8am if you are awake. Fashion bar is very chilled and night and nice to have a drink in as well. On checked out staff we’re friendly and helpful, after checking out at 12 o’clock we left our bags and collected them two hours later with no hassle. All In all a very good trip made easy due to the hotel experience, would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a prime location in Times Square but this is the only selling point.The staff were neither friendly or approachable. There is a high turnover of guests and you get the feeling you are just a number.Do not bother with breakfast at one point the queues were past the reception area, when you do get seated it is like being in a cattle market. It is self service but the food is bland and a proportion of it is overcooked. We went out for breakfast as a result and the service in all eateries was excellent in comparison.Do not worry about waiting for your cases to be brought to your room, you take them yourself !The rooms are functional but you do not get any tea or coffee making facilities.This is supposed to be a four star hotel but I would rate it as a three at best. The staff have lost touch with their reason for being there.....THEIR CUSTOMERSWe travelled throughout the city and their are numerous better quality hotels just as well located. I would travel to New York again but would not stay at this hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: With the hotel being located just a few blocks back from Times Square itself means it’s conveniently close but not as noisy. It’s a fantastic base for exploring NYC.Super comfy beds, clean rooms and friendly staff.Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a stone's throw from Times Square, Broadway and a short walking distance from many other NYC attractions. It's pretty new too. It's so new that it's not on google maps street view yet!The room was a decent and comfortable with everything you need. We were on the 14th floor and the views of the concrete jungle were spectacular. The buffet breakfast had a great deal to choose from and was pretty decent too, though I would recommend going for breakfast early to avoid any queues. Coming from the UK, this wasn't too hard given that we were waking up early anyway and wanted to make the most of the city in daylight. Public transport is a short walk from the building (subway or open top tour bus).I would definitely recommend this hotel and would return if I'm ever in town again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for our trip to NY to get married the hotel itself is very nice and in a great location however the reception staff were quite rude - Id lost my hat but they weren’t interested in helping in any way. We had left some food in our room which was quite expensive however it was thrown away without checking with us first when I questioned the reception staff they couldn’t answer me why it had been thrown other than they thought it was rubbish I didn’t even get an apology! They said they’d call me but never did Our wedding didn’t really get acknowledged either
user_name:
br0nif
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is in a great location, and is close to Times Square and Hells Kitchen. There is a subway station just along the street to get around easily. The room was kept clean, towels etc. changed regularly and staff were great. Breakfast has a great selection and the staff are well organised during busy times. Staff are all friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: There is nothing about the Hotel RIU plaza times square that was in anyway bad.The breakfast was very good if not a little chaotic.The room was more than adequate for family of three and the cleanliness each day was perfect. A word of warning to everyone please ensure that you DO put your money into the room safe.I forgot to my cost!!!!!!Would definitely recommend Riu Plaza for a wonderful holiday.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza for 4 nights to celebrate my 40th birthday. The main reasons we picked this hotel were for the location, free breakfast and great reviews that it receives.The location is great if you want to visit all of the popular tourist sights.The breakfast is not so great………we went on our first day at around 7:30am (my actual birthday) and it wasn’t a good experience. It was absolutely packed and felt like a school canteen. The food was average and not worth the hassle of the queues! We didn’t bother with breakfast for the remainder of our stay!We visited the bar on two occasions, both times the staff were friendly and the margaritas were very good!We stayed in a junior suite on the 26th floor, no complaints here! The room was spacious and clean, with plenty of towels and toiletries. Also a lovely extra was the “lounge” that we had access to, where you could help yourself to wine, soft drinks and a few snacks at any time of the day……nice touch!Overall, this is a nice hotel, we weren’t overwhelmed by the staff or their efforts but we can’t really complain either. There just wasn’t any stand out moment in the hotel that made our trip anymore special and although we certainly wouldn’t rule out staying here again, we wouldn’t necessarily rush back. I’d give 3.5 if that was an option!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Picked to stay for 4 nights in Riu Plaza hotel due to the reasonable price. It turned out to be excellently positioned for most of our sightseeing. Staff were absolutely wonderful and very helpful giving us advice on where to go and how best to travel e.g. underground or cab. Only issue was a frosted glass wall between the shower room and the bedroom! Maids very nice and chatty when we initiated conversation. Breakfast was good and provided a nice selection of food and drinks. Would love to go back soon

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked having seen a special offer for a half board break including flights at a really good price.Great hotel in a good location in walking distance from landmarks and transport hubs.Reception - everything explained to us -“resort fees” which must be an American thing, room bond etc.Rooms- clean and comfortable with a good size bed and shower room. Tv and fridge in the room. Good curtain layers to keep light out.Breakfast - some mornings a queue but this was dealt with by staff in seconds and only formed while checking room numbers etc. buffet style breakfast with plenty of choice.Restaurant in the evening also very good with a buffet style service with a number of dishes. Lifts - plentiful and very quick. Good WiFi signal. Staff- everyone was friendly and helpful and welcoming.Hotel was lovely and clean and can not fault anything and I would certainly recommend it and use it again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel in a great location, especially for families. The hotel is modern, bustly, and bright as well as being very, very smart and clean. Food and drink are well-priced, although breakfast time can be busy. Verh helpful staff made us feel welcome and check-in/out was no fuss and quick. This is great base for exploring - close, far enough from the noise of Time Sqaure, 3mins the Metro on 50th, 10mins to Rockefeller Centre, and right in the middlle in a great mix of bars and restaurants. Looking forward to returning.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just arrived home from Riu Times Square NewYork . Great hotel for sightseeing as it’s central . Nice rooms but we didn’t get the room we booked. We were booked into a double delux family room what we were put into was a double standard.apparently it was an up grade. Well it was on the 26 floor with a balcony and we were told on checking in we could use the lounge on 26 with complimentary drinks etc . But when the key stopped working the stuffy young woman on the desk said it wasn’t included. So wouldn’t re do the key . Honestly the women on the desk needs a personality transplant. The guys were fine . They sorted out key out straight away with no questions asked . The Buffet breakfast was included but honestly we tried it twice and It was awful why do they open to the public when they have guests to cater for . It was crowded loud and cold greasy food . We have used Riu before in Mexico and food was fantastic. The cleaning of the room we couldn’t fault the girl came in everyday and changed towels even when we hadn’t left them on the floor. The other thing is noise at night people just slam their blooming doors I think something needs to be put on the doors so they cannot be left to slam shut . Apart from that we had a great week ..

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Adequate room for needs, very close to centre if you like the hustle n bustle. Room lacked hot drink /kettle facility which would been great if in. Bed very cosy and soft. Stopped with half board catering. Food presented well, different evening themes. Just felt lacked little American food touches.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Plaza is a beautiful, clean and well run hotel right in the middle of Times Square. The staff is highly professional and helpful and the breakfast buffet is both convenient and delicious. I would skip the dinner buffet as it was just OK - the food was not very hot and the items were not attended to / replenished often.
user_name:
mikey8642
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is central to everything, across the road is a bus stop for the hop on hop off buses. A few mins walk to Times Square and a 20 min walk to Empire State, Rockefeller Centre. Rooms are nice, beds comfy, safe and fridge in the room. Only thing there was no kettle in the room but Starbucks is a 2 min walk away.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: So my other half booked an amazing get away for us. So it being the last day we had arranged to get a taxi through their concierge service they had booked for a day earlier and when I asked why and then asked if they would be able to honour this as their original deal. I advised when booking that this is for the Saturday not the Friday they advised that they wouldn’t as it’s not our fault and they wouldn’t be able to and have already taken our money, I wen to to speak to the manager of that was in duty and she went and was advised the same thing this is because it is a third party company when the manager and myself went back they then left me to continue to argue with the lady who was there even though we told her what her colleague had done. Furious about this they told us the only thing they could do is arrange for one of us to go! What is the use of this and the manager didn’t seem to care at all. I will be following the complaints procedures with both companies but would highly recommend not using their transfer service for either “third party” or the hotels! Outraged.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing hotel in a perfect location. Our room was on the 22nd floor so views were incredible. Room was very spacious & had plenty of storage. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was really good, we used the fashion restaurant for breakfast and found this a lot quieter & less busier than the main restaurant. We used the hotel private taxi booked through the bellboys back to JFK for $75 which was very good & comfortable. Loved every minute of our time in this amazing city would definitely return & stay here.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed recently for 4 nights. Paid a little extra for the 26th floor with access to the lounge. This was worth it for us. There was water, fizzy drinks, hot drinks, wine, sandwiches, crisps, nuts and pastries to help yourself to.Hotel nice, clean and modern. Room was nice, not massive but big enough. Bathroom clean and modern. Shower does have frosted glass wall but no issue to us! Breakfast was actually nice, wasn’t expecting much having had breakfast included in ny hotels before but this was good. Loads of options. On day we even got champagne Check in easy, bit of a queue checking out so bare that in mind if you have a car waiting.We also booked late check out which was 30 dollars and absolutely worth itWill stay again, thank you

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited the Rui Plaza as a couple from 12th-15th February. Check in was simple, we were given a hand written note welcoming us which was lovely. The staff were welcoming and very friendly. We had to give a card for a security deposit to be held but we’re advised this would be refunded straight back as long as everything was ok. The hotel has a beautiful entrance. The whole of the hotel, including rooms are immaculate and spotlessly clean. We were in room 2008 on the 20th floor and had a lovely view. Like others have said the bathroom is beautiful, with the best shower! The glass is frosted. However you can only see an outline, nothing else unless you lean up the glass. The breakfast was gorgeous. So much choice and was ideal as it saved us a lot of money and filled us up until early afternoon. With how expensive food/drinks are this was a really good thing to have! Staff were so friendly, especially in the restaurant. They were always smiling, singing and checking you were ok. I would 100% go back here and have already recommended to friends. The location was perfect and right by Times Square. We also purchase the red bus ‘hop on and hop off’ passes and the number 1 stop is right by the hotel. We used the airport transfer for the hotel and this worked out much cheaper than a taxi for the 2 of us. We got a taxi to get to the airport and it cost almost $100 compared to $27.50 each on the transfer. The bed was very comfortable... however not a ‘queen size’ as we had booked which was the only disappointing thing. And the fact there was no tea or coffee making facilities.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for five nights from 17 th Feb and have had a great time . The hotel has an excellent location and we were on 25 th floor giving us a great view.The room was comfortable for four people and was kept clean by the maids. We found all the staff very friendly and most efficient.Breakfast was busy however an system is in place to deal with numbers and the longest wait we had was 5 mins.Overall would throughly recommend this hotel and we would definitely use again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently travelled to the RIU Hotel for Valentines Day.So where to start; The hotel location: easy to find on arrival from the subway, literally just down a block from Time Square, situated on the corner of 46 street and 8th Avenue. Very accessible to most things in the middle of Manhattan. The hotel is very modern and very clean, the maid would clean and turn the room down daily to a good standard. The room was an ok size for a short break when you spend most of your time out and about! The views from the room were amazing ( we were on the 18th floor) and stayed in room 1814, which was situated on the corner of the hotel giving us spectacular views of 46street and 8th Avenue. In terms of noise, your in New York City it’s not going to be quiet! It sounds like your in the Movies: fire engines, police, taxis beeping however this did not stop any of us from sleeping! Having said that after walking 23,000 steps a day we were out for the count at night! There is a fridge in the room witch the maid replenished with fresh bottles water each day. Only down fall which would have been perfect had it of been available Was coffee and tea making facilities but we got by absolutely fine without. The restroom / toilet was immaculate: clean, tidy, beautifully warm with rainfall shower head or a hand held head which was great for someone like me with long hair. Plenty of storage was available, with a safety deposit box, ironing Board and hangers. The staff: If I am honest this was the hotels biggest downfall! While we was aware some New Yorkers can be rude I would like to say generally we didn’t see much of an issue apart from with the staff at the hotel. They were abrupt at times, appeared fed up and quite rude when speaking “at you” and not to you. This was very evident when entering of queueing for breakfast! On the 14th one of the head managers were in and there was a marked improvement in behaviours, however once she went they soon returned back to be moody. Breakfast Buffett: good food warm cooked and a good variety..... only down fall is the organisation of the service! Other than that excellent. Over all an amazing hotel, we will be returning in warmer climates for sure!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well positioned, 3 minute walk from times square. Also walkable to central park and top of the rock too as well as empire state.Room was cleaned daily and very pleasant too with a fridge. Breakfast was very varied and lots of it.. from cereal to fruit, cooked, cakes and porridge..make sure you get there early as it gets very busy....Staff were helpful in all ways from cleaners to receptionists. Oh and whatever you are told, you CAN get $1 pizza slices and $2 hot dogs if you look away from times square as well as $1 coffee. Have a great time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A lovely hotel in a fabulous location. We stayed here for 3 nights as a family of four, sharing a room with two double beds.Friendly staff on arrival and departure, breakfast can get very busy but never queued for too long.We paid $65 city room tax for the three nights which included WiFi and bottled water (bottled water not regularly replaced and WiFi was patchy at times so not a great bargain)! A deposit of $150 was also taken on arrival and refunded at check out.The hotel can’t be responsible for some of the other noisy residents at night but you do also still hear some outside street noise, even on the 18th floor.Left luggage retrieval was very busy around 2pm and the hotel reception ordered us a private car service back to JFK airport for $75 plus tip which worked well.We would definitely stay here again.....

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really nice hotel, all staff really friendly, rooms nice(don’t worry about the bathroom set up) , breakfast really good. Checkin and checkout fast and efficient. Loved it, will definitely use this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for a few nights whilst visiting NY from the UK.Nice hotel, great location, good service, decent rooms and facilities, very nice bar area. My only downer was that there where no tea/coffee facilities in the room which for me meant going down 19 floors to the coffee shop.All in all a great place to start if your in the area and want to be in the heart of the action etc and I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited last year and it was really good, alas this year the staff have not been particularly friendly or helpful and we are quite disappointed on our first night and day. The buffet breakfast has lots of food but not really of high quality, the eggs are smashed to a pulp and hash browns overcooked and hard/ chewy. We went to get more food and came back to our table being cleared along with our half cups of coffee. I'm not sure we'll return next year, let's see what happens in our next three days of stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The check in was fast so was in our room in no time , rooms are so nice small but big enough The bedroom the hotel throughout was so clean The views from our room on the 19 floor were amazingThe food was really nice plenty of choice for all tastes Staff were so helpful and full of smiles The wait for a table if busy was never to long , staff were efficient soon got tables ready Would definitely go back

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was excellent value for money. Rooms were kept spotlessly clean and the breakfast was excellent. The hotel is ideally located for everything you need. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It wasn't the easiest check-in at the hotel, but once checked-in we had a very pleasant stay. The hotel breakfast buffet was a great start of every day. The room was very comfortable and well furnished. We enjoyed two Broadway plays that were both less than two blocks away.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 days last week with my husband for his special birthday. Hotel is in a fab location and spotlessly clean. The rooms although not massive are a decent size and the beds were the comfiest hotel bed we think we’ve slept in. Loved the bathroom and the toiletries, the shower was lovely and again spotless. The staff were great and check in was easy. We stayed on the 27th floor but the lifts were modern and fast...took 9 seconds to reach our floor! The view from our window was amazing although it took me a while to get used to standing so close to it. Breakfast was plentiful and good choices, we didn’t have to wait long to be seated and we went down at differing times. Loved NYC and will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in February. Very modern looking and staff were extremely helpful. My only problems were really with the roomFirst of all there’s a big gap between the sliding glass shower door and the wall when closed, if any one goes near the wardrobe they can see you sat on the toilet. Second issue for me was with a hotel chain of this high standard why do you not supply tea & coffee in the rooms?And. My last big gripe being that on the last morning we had the maid who cleans the room constantly trying our door from 08:30 until 11:30. Check out is 12 so unless the keys have been handed In then there’s no need to even try
user_name:
mp8625
Weston super Mare, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently stayed in the Riu Plaza New York Times Square amazing hotel staff were very welcoming rooms were lovely would definitely recommend this hotel great location with in walking distance to everywhere

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the RIU plaza hotel in december 2019. The location of the hotel is really nice, just walk across the street to reach times square. The room was small, but clean. However the hotel isn't as luxorious as we are used to, compared to other RIU hotels. The breakfast gets really crowded.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed when we became engaged, family & ourselves stayed when we were married in NYC & the 3rd stay for our honeymoon Pt1. Very clean, lovely facilities, first class breakfast buffet & exceptional friendly professional customer service! Thank you to you all & for the bottle of champagne during our honeymoon ❤️

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of Feb with my partner and was not disappointed. Check in was smooth however they do hold a $200 amount on your credit card and it is not pre-authortized like they say, it does actually come out of your account...Rooms were lovely and clean, fresh water every day and the bathrooms were spotless which is all you can ask for really, however you can hear alot of noise from the bedrooms next door, doors slamming and conversations - this is not a massive problem and happens in most places it just might be better for a hotel as good as this to install some door slammers and soundproofing.Breakfast was good, you are seated and greeted with a Mimosa. There is not a busy time however staff work well to accommodate you. Food was edible and did the job unless you are critic.Only fault i can give if the check out fee, we was charged $109 for the use of facilities (WiFi, bottles of water and gym) even if you don't use these you are still stung with a check out fee, this was bad as it should be included in the price you pay when booking the hotel and was not made known to us when checking in.Hotel was a 2 minute walk to Time Square and about a 15 minute walk to Central Park, easy to find with many stations around.Would stay at this hotel again and do recommend it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had 5 nights in New York and stayed here in Jan 2020Got a free upgrade on arrival to a 2 bed suite near the top, with stunning views of the city below. It's a great location on 8th Avenue and 46th St.Breakfast was included in the package we took and it was well worth it, great selection of hot and cold foods for all nations to enjoy and really set us up for the day ahead.You can also get a super beffet style evening meal there for $35, which is cheap in comparison to many places
user_name:
IanRochester
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This Hotel was fantastic from start to finish. Quick simple and easy check in room was ready at 1pm for us although check in at 3. Food was great for half board option. The lifts where very quick too being on the 23rd floor, the view was fantastic. Rooms where very clean and tidy, bed was comfy and the shower was great. The staff where so friendly and happy and could not do enough. The hotel organised our car to Newark airport when leaving quick and hassle free. Will defo be returning. Thanks Riu Plaza for a great stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Poor service . No kettle ...no slippers ....no tea or coffee in room . It's a big busy train station ...no personal service . ..yet we paid for a suite . Be careful when booking. Check out marriot . Much better

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good hotel, clean and tidy rooms but be aware of the facility fee when you leave! I got charged £100 on departure unexpectedly. Nice and central however and lots of lovely pubs and restaurants close by!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived were greeted quickly, beautifully maintained, nicely decorated, we travel up to our room and the spacious elevators to arrive to our wonderful room. My favorite part is that there was no rug in the room (love this). beds and pillows the best ever, I still am dreaming of the good night sleep I had there. One wonderful thing I noticed are two hooks at entryway for jackets or whatever you wish to hang. (very helpful). we travel alone and have always never understood why hotels don't put hooks up for hanging anything we might need to hang. the simple things even my children loved. the shower was clean, spacious and beautiful. We loved our stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a great place to stay in regards to location. About a 3 minute walk to Times Squares and a short walking distance to other popular tourist attractions. We were upgraded to a balcony room with a fabulous view of the city and Times Square. That was a nice surprise! Check-in was fast and efficient. Friendly and helpful staff throughout. Hotel was quiet and bed slept pretty well. Very clean room that was cleaned and re-stocked daily. The breakfast buffet was very good with lots of options and available seating. The dinner buffet was just the same. The bar area was great and the bartenders made great drinks. Would absolutely stay here again! I highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was in town for a night to see a broadway show. This hotel was within walking distance to the theater and times square. I visit New York City often from Philadelphia, and this is a great hotel. The rooms were nice and clean. Breakfast had a good variety of foods. It got crowded during breakfast but the staff kept things organized. I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just stayed with the other half for 5 nights. First the hotel is quite modern and stylish. Check in was easy might have got lucky as sometime you walk past reception and it’s rammed due to the numbers checking in. The rooms although on the small side are very nice no tea coffee making facilities but can forgive this. Ice big comfy bed. We were in the 6th floor although we did request something higher it is you get what your given. Great location a few minutes from theatres and time square. Although time square is a nightmare we did our best to avoid it. We were in the half board so breakfast and evening meal included. Breakfast was a large buffet and absolutely crazy so so many people it was all cramped food not the nicest as generally cold. Dinner time not so busy but again food not the warmest. We only ever had tap water with dinner not because we are cheap it’s just the restaurant isn’t a nice romantic place to sit and enjoy a bottle of wine with your dinner. It’s simply full up on food and get out. The hotel charges approx $22 a day on departure for fees. This is WiFi use of the gym and a few bottles of water. You have to pay it regardless if using it or not. You can get a taxi to the hotel at a fixed fee so with a tip looking around $70 the hotel does operate a shuttle service you can book for around $30 each so $60 a couple then the driver expects a tip of 15-20% so more expensive that getting in a yellow cab anyway you choose. The bar is a good place to have a beer but at the prices they charge (all prices in NY are high) there are better bars to try go to 230 5th roof top wow what a place. The biggest issue with the hotel is the noise no not from the traffic outside but the guests doors constantly slamming at all hours. You will be woken up early constantly. Can’t you fit some door closers. New York is a great city to visit with lots to do. Check out my review on NY for some tips. As always would I stay here again. The answer is yes I would. Although the food isn’t amazing and the noise it’s a great location nice clean rooms.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A stones throw away from the beat of Times Square the hotel is bright, clean & modern. Our arrival was around midday, and we checked in and our room was ready straight away, however check in is 15.00 however our room was ready as I stated! We stayed in a queen room which was clean and had a great view we where in room 1722! Cleaner daily and fresh water always in the fridge each day. We went on a half board basis breakfast was busy but always seated straight away great variety of options including salad and fresh fruit, dinner was amazing so delicious and great options. Reception was spacious & great area to store our cases on check out day, the bellboys were very helpful, staff on reception were hit or a miss, there was young woman (didn’t get her name) was working on Saturday during the day who was the stand out one but a few of them are rude and don’t seem like you can approach them which is strange because the city is so welcoming. A great stay and sure I will be back here in this lovely city and would stay here again? Yes I would great hotel, just one thing stop wasting so much paper & Plastics and go digital! 4.5/5

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect if you are looking to be close to the theatre district. I found the hotel ok but nothing more. Unpleasant ‘facility fee’ which was over $20 a night (!) for WiFi, luggage storage and a bottle of water ( that was missing from the room when we arrived). It honestly is a rip off and got me in a bad mood. Room ok with great view but stuffy and warm and airco only sorted that issue every now and then. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was included but not great. The dining room was very loud and cramped. Food was ok as long as you stayed away from the hot meals as eggs often overcooked, pancakes glued to bottom of bowl ...The lifts were very annoying as often it wouldn’t take the key to chose a room and then you ended going up and down without doors opening. Bathroom wall is glass and a bit too much see through if travelling with anyone but partner. Overall, I would not return but ok for a night if you need to be in the area.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nothing to write home about, clean, tidy and very well situated but meals were mostly cold and uninspired and the dining area was very crammed, no tea or coffee facilities in room which meant having to go out to get a drink first thing in the morning,

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We came into NYC from CT for one night stay for some broadway shows. Hotel is very nice and clean , check in took way longer then seemed necessary. Rooms were not ready, that’s ok we were early, came back from dinner and went to the room and it was really hot so I set the temp to 18 from 24. After 8 pm play room was at 23, called front desk and they sent maintenance and by 11 pm room was down to 19. Breakfast is included but it is a huge buffet in a cafeteria type setting with a lot people that seemed like they had not had a meal in days. So if we go back we will plan ahead to be ready to have time for the room to cool down and go someplace else for breakfast!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Got to hotel at midnight with a colleague, couldn't find my reservation.Eventually said they can't find and held money on my credit. Put me at horrible room and telling me its an upgrade because it has 2 beds instead of 1 the upgrade was for- 1st guest floor - the 300's - facing nothing.  Said they will work out by the morning .Coming back in the morning said still nothing changed but if I want a high floor I should pack back all my stuff, bring them to the lobby and wait for room to be vacant. Oh. And I need to do that "immediately"My travel agent got a hold of them - and they told him nothing was wrong with reservation - which is just not true.Will save you the part of repeating my story 3 times without getting anyone to care, and housekeeping knocking on my door 5 times within one hour So rude and non respectful. And to top that on check out they insisted I would sign an "upgrade form" because I got a free upgrade. Unbelievable. Be aware, stay away.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited New York end of January with husband, bought as a wedding gift for him. Hotel was lovely, clean and friendly staff. Breakfast was really good - buffet with lots of variety to choose from. Rooms were well sized and view was pretty good!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Other reviews have expressed how great a location this hotel is in. Yes, Hotel RIU Plaza is only one block away from Times Square. But, what makes Hotel RIU Plaza extra special is that it’s located in the heart of the theatre district on Restaurant Row. There are two major theatre productions on the SAME STREET as the hotel. That means you only have to walk a few feet to get to theatres. It was so nice being able to walk directly to the theatre box office, purchase tickets and eliminate all those online surcharges and fees. If you are in town to catch a show, THIS IS THE HOTEL FOR YOU. If you are not in town to catch a show, this is still THE HOTEL FOR YOU.The staff here is extremely warm and welcoming. I was received by Eladio and he was extremely accommodating. Eladio also assisted me with directions throughout my stay and really ensured that I had a wonderful stay. I arrived at 11:00am and a room was not yet available. This is understandable considering check-out is also at 11:00am. I simply checked my bags, went for lunch and returned at 1:30pm and was given a great room. The hotel is pristine. Hotel staff is constantly cleaning the hotel throughout the day. My room was cleaned and stocked daily and I never had to ask for additional towels, toiletries, etc. Bottled water is provided every other day. WIFI worked wonderfully. My room was located on the 10th floor and despite being close to Times Square, I was able to rest well at night.The buffet, or Theater Buffet as it is appropriately named, is wonderful. Never before have I seen such a lavish array of fresh, high quality foods on a hotel breakfast buffet. There were so many food options, I was able to eat a different breakfast meal every day during my 4-night stay. I still can’t believe this buffet was included. The dinner buffet is splendid as well and for $35, you’ll find it hard to beat in NYC. I recommend you try it at least once during you stay. ¡Buen Provecho!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked a last minute trip here last week, to stay at this hotel for 4 nights. When we arrived we were amazed at how perfect the location was... right on Broadway within a 200 metre walk of Times Square. The receptionist who greeted us was very friendly and welcoming, and we were given a room on the 29th floor with an amazing view! The room was immaculately clean, nice and warm and the shower was amazing. Breakfast was included, which we were pleasantly surprised with. It was a buffet of hot and cold food, cereals, croissants, fruit etc. This could get extremely busy so it’s worth getting down there early to avoid queuing. Staff were very attentive and efficient.Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value, clean and central hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Such an amazing stay here for me and my mum. Reception couldn’t do enough to help and we found all the staff in the hotel to be lovely. Rooms were comfortable and had no issues with the opaque bathroom glass wall. It still felt really private. Breakfast was a great start to the day and really well organised. Made use of the happy hour in the hotel bar too

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a great place, perfect location, awesome breakfast and friendly staff! For a NY hotel the rooms are pretty roomy, and very clean. Spent a night there attending the NY Times Travel Show and party at the Copacabana. Such a great experience, would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We used this hotel as a 1 night stop over before cruise, I have to say we found it bright and airy, very welcoming, staff very friendly and informative, rooms clean warm and comfortable, felt very relaxed and welcome, we had breakfast before our pick up, plenty of choice and staff quick and efficient, tables cleared quickly, would return here if come back to New York, all in all a very pleasant experience

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has the potential to be great. The location is brilliant, and within 5 minutes walk to Times Square and other major attractions. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern and the views on higher floors are great. The thing that really lets this hotel down is their staff. Some of the reception staff are exceptionally rude and a particular lady working on the concierge desk was one of the rudest people I have ever come across. A crying shame as the staff in the dining hall couldn’t do enough for you and were very friendly. The breakfast buffet selection was also lacking and extremely repetitive. It’s worth it for the saving you’ll make on paying for breakfast but by the 3rd day I had grown tired of what was on offer and we opted to go out for breakfast for a bit of variety. I would stay here again, but would be prepared to stand my ground a little with rude reception staff!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 6 nights booked through British Airways holidays.Hotel very cleanWe had a room on 27 th floor great view of Hudson RiverLots of toiletries in bathroom, big bath towels Breakfast great selection but hot food not warm enough needs to be looked at .Bar in hotel very expensive $16 a drink although they do have a happy hour each day and cocktails are reasonable at $8Staff very friendlyThe resort fee at end of your holiday is a disgrace they say it is for WiFi,business centre and gym we only used WiFi and was charge £100 when checking out in my opinion it’s a con as not every hotel charges resort fees!!!!British airways need to look into this or add it on the the price of holidayBut we did have a great time in hotel and would recommend it if you don’t mind paying the extortionate resort feesWould return as so central

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for a week in January, we were on the 28th floor and had some fantastic views of the city from our room which was brilliant. The hotel was very clean & rooms were serviced every day. The breakfast has a great selection of things & the hotel bar was great during happy hour. The bar tenders here really were fantastic and very efficient. Location of the hotel was brilliant, we walked almost everywhere but was close to the subway when we needed it. The only thing that stopped me giving a 5 star review is that it took almost 2 weeks, and a lot of chasing to get my $200 holding deposit back after we had checked out. I was assured upon check out I didnt need to do anything and the money would go straight back into my account. A little disappointing after spending a lot of money on a hotel and causing no damage to the room. I think hotel guest should be made aware of this time delay when parting with their cash upon check in.
user_name:
Lauren R
Hornchurch, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic time! Hotel was beautiful and modern. Took a group of 17 and 4 rooms were together. 1 was one floor above with easy access to stairs to get back and forth. Beds were comfortable with plenty of amenities in the room. Small fridge with water. 2 waters refreshed the next morning. Centrally located one block from Times Square. Great restaurants on the same block. Happy hour in the bar was a great option.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel. My sister and I love staying here. The rooms are so comfortable. We love the breakfast. Everyone is so friendly. Checking in is a little slow. But always so nice. The location is fantastic.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really good hotel, great location, very clean and well maintained Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included and had a very good choice of different foods, catering for all nationalities. Rooms are very comfortable and clean.
user_name:
GillianSkinn
Weston super Mare, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I loved this hotel ! We booked a family suite which was superb for us as a family of four. The suite comprised of two bedrooms ,bathroom with a separate toilet and a spacious lobby perfect for storing our luggage.It was fantastic to find this sort of space in the middle of New York as previously we've had to share beds with the kids. There is a suite lounge where you could get a snack , alcoholic beverage or a soft drink the breakfast was first class. Although its not cheap it was definitely value for money and would thoroughly recommend it .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 days as part of a BA flight and hotel deal. The hotel is very modern and clean. It also has a lovely smell in the lobby that I really wanted to buy but forgot to ask what it was! The hotel was about 55 mins from JFK, we took an Uber which was $80. The hotel is located one block from Times Square, very convenient! Took about 3 mins to walk there! We were on the 22nd floor, our view was nice, nothing amazing but I liked being high up! Especially in NYC! The room was nice and clean, bathroom was modern and sleek, loved the shower! The sliding door wasn’t a problem for us, as we heard a few negative things about this aspect and the door having a gap but the gap is a tiny one at the side so you’ll only see the person in the bathroom if you stand awkwardly near the bed! The room had lots of plugs AND USB ports which we loved! My only negative comment is that they don’t have tea of toffee making facilities in any rooms! Which as we’re brits, we love making a nice tea in the morning! Breakfast was nice, not amazing! But they had options for anybody! A real variety but not amazing quality. We went every morning at about 07:30-08:00 and there was already a few people around so I’d get there as early as you can! I’d avoid 8:30-10! Check in and out was a breeze, lovely staff, very very friendly! We left our luggage on last day as we had a late flight, the bell boy was amazing! Really friendly and made friends with my partner so whenever he saw us, he always took time to ask us how we were! He well deserved a large tip which we gave him! Overall, a very pleasant stay at the Riu! Would go back again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in a family suite. 2 bed rooms. The room was fabulous, lots of space for our family of 6, 2 adults, 2 big teenagers and 2 younger kids! The bathroom was weird as you could see down the gap in the door lol!!!We had breakfast each morning which was brilliant, yes it gets busy but we never waited more then 5-10 mins in line to be seated. Fab food and staff are great. The bonus of a family suite is access tot he executive lounge! Theres sandwiches, fruit pots, cakes all fresh drinks wine cans and crisps! Fantastic to stock up for the day and night. Not even 5 minute walk to time square. Staff fab and location even better. Would love to come back!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location within easy walking distance of Times Square. Nice clean rooms, comfy beds even, had a double bed each in our twin room. The restaurant was very busy, understandably as the food was very good. The cocktail hour was a favourite too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a really wonderful stay at the Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square from the 9th-12th of January this year. We arrived and were welcomed by Eladio who was so friendly and gave us some tips for staying in the city. He said that he would try and check us in a little early, which he did, and we were upgraded to a kingsize room! The bellhop then brought our suitcases up to our room which was great. We stayed on the 8th floor which had a wonderful view out across the city, and our room was light and a good size with a nice bathroom. We had breakfast included and there was so much choice- I saw a few reviews on here which said that it wasn't great but I don't know what they are talking about!! The hotel was in an amazing location; so close to Times Square and within reach of all the main tourist spots of Manhattan. When we checked out, they looked after our bags for us until our transfer was ready which was really useful! Overall we had an amazing stay- we found the staff really helpful and friendly and thought that it was excellent value for money too. Thank you so much!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a lovely hotel - modern - clean comfortable - fabulous hot shower - super comfy bed ! Great location . Everything you need after a long day sight seeing . Such a huge selection for breakfast I found the hot breakfast a little greasy and not to my taste but the continental chioce was huge and delicious . Thank you for a wonderful stay !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived from the U.K. today at 1300.. went to reception to check I and dealt with 2 woman - Alia and Gindy who were so rude, unhelpful, dismissive and who should not be allowed to deal with customers if they speak to people how they spoke to me. I understand that check-in is at 1500 but as I arrived 2 hours earlier it would have been nice to have tried to help me get into our room earlier instead of just saying... NO COME BACK AT 3. I went back to reception at 1430 only to be told the same thing and again at 1445... but at 1450 when I spoke to the customer services desk asking to speak to the manager, my rooms suddenly became available and she also advised that the system had said that the rooms had been available for some time. So why did these 2 ladies not give me my rooms when I asked?? They lied to me... AWFUL 1st impression.. hope it gets better..

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. Right in the theater district & walking distance to Time Square. Staff was very attentive & did an excellent job. Our breakfast was included in our package & even came with mimosas one morning!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is stunning. Its clean, modern and sheek. The beds are comfortable. The showers are superb. Great staff who are always professional and helpful. Breakfast is great, loads of choice as nd plenty of fresh fruit.Due to a 5 hour time difference I was up at 3am everyday. They could do with a coffee machine for guests to use. Or a kettle in the rooms would be great. Loved this hotel, great location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great time. Check in, service at breakfast, the breakfast food selection, cleanliness of the room, everything was perfect. One evening we had a drink at the bar and we enjoyed it very much. The transfer to JFK booked at the concierge desk was on time and convenient.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This place is fabulous. Stayed for just under 2 weeks & we couldn’t fault the service. Rooms are cleaned daily & water restocked in the fridge. The staff are exceptional & nothing is overlooked. The check in & out is seamless, breakfast can be busy but the food is very good. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again or recommend to anyone looking for a hotel in New York. Simply amazing

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is my Wife and my second time staying at the Riu Plaza New York Times Square..This time we stayed their with our two Grand Children...We found it to be as good, if not better, than the first time! One of the reason it was better was due to Kyvellos Hana at the front desk.... He was very helpful and took care of any of our wants and was helpful in answering all our questions !!! I found the RIU lobby,as expected, clean and inviting...Check in was easy and the the room was available for early check in and was very clean!!! Part of our room charge was the Buffet breakfast. Which had many choices and took care our needs as well as our grand childrens wants...The BEST advantage to staying at the Riu Plaza is it's location!! It is centrally located to most Broadway Theaters, great restaurants and easy walk to Times Square and other tourists attractions! Looking forward to returning to the Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square soon!! Also, looking forward to our next Riu Hotel stay in February at the Riu Baja California in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico..hoping this visit will be as good as our first stay!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
