review_body: My friends and I stayed at this hotel (party of 6) for one night during MLK weekend. OMG!!! This place was phenomenal. The rooms were spacious (by NYC standards), staff were friendly, hotel was spotless and breakfast was GREAT!!!! I will definitely share this experience with family/friends.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked this hotel as part of a package with British Airways. Hotel is very modern,spacious and clean. As a family of 3, we got a room with 2 double bedrooms. Very clean and house keeping came daily and did a great job. No tea or coffee facilities in the room but there was a small fridge which was topped up with water bottles every other day. Plenty of clean towels and toiletries if you done want to take your own. Great views of the city from the room and hallways.We had breakfast included in price which had a variety of foods, hot and cold and topped up alll the time, it is extremely busy between 9 and 10am but the longest we waited for a table was a few minutes. Staff friendly and helpful, we checked out at 11am on our last day but were not leaving until 5pm but there is space to leave your luggage whilst you cram the last few hours in the city. You do have to pay a $200 refundable deposit and hotel taxes.There is a bar and additional restaurants if you fancy eating in and not venturing out, we didn’t use the restaurant but did have drinks in the evening after returning for exploring. Hotel is really close to Times Square but further enough away that it’s quiet, I rarely heard anything, expect for the odd siren. It’s within walking distance to Broadway and the shows and of course Times Square. Would I stay here again, yes I would. Great hotel in a good location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Took my son to New York for a quick one day getaway. Broadway show, Alladin and Empire State building w a run thru Times Square. Found this 4 star hotel on hotel tonight. 95 dollars w breakfast included. Upscale small rooms but functional. I would return for sure. Renny the bellhop was more than his title! Excellent customer service assisted me and my son w transportation where to eat inquiries etc. pleasure meeting him. Ask for him when u visit!
user_name:
Shetravels915
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just a few hours after we left the hotel for a cruise we realized we accidentally left a backpack in the room. Unfortunately no one was honest enough to return it even after giving the hotel a detailed description, location of where the item was left, and our room number. I am very disappointed and will not be staying there again. The hotel stores luggage in the lobby and there is no security/attendant responsible for watching them. We stayed in the lobby to keep an eye on them until the room was ready. We reserved two rooms. The hotel is clean and in a very good location for travelers. Since we had a red eye flight I reached out 3 times to remind them we would like to check into one of the two rooms we reserved early if possible. They allowed us to check into one of the rooms early after they initially refused. After placing a telephone call to the hotel, they said they had a room. We had the breakfast buffet and it was very good.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As one reviewer pointed out the hotel reception is quite impressive. Rooms are basic with no tea making facilities but are clean and well refreshed. We asked if we could buy cups of tea from the restaurant downstairs one evening and were told to buy it next door or across the road. Staff were not very friendly or that accommodating. The happiest guy there was the baggage holder, probably as he was being tipped!I was here for my birthday and noted it down in the reservation. All I got was a happy birthday in the queue waiting to be seated for breakfast. (Other hotels in other destinations have made a real effort for birthdays and anniversaries before). The breakfast/dining area is a buffet canteen and although it is noisy and cramped with outdoor chairs, it is plentiful and there is a good choice. This was one of the few hotels in New York that offered breakfast with the Tui holiday package. I think with a few enhancements the hotel could offer such a great overall experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Staff are very unhelpful and quite rude, we had a kingsize room booked and as staying with my 17 year old daughter I asked to change room to a double at the annoyance of the staff it seemed. Followed then by them asking for $65.00 per night additionally when queried I was told the best they can do is $34.00 per night. As we felt uncomfortable staying in the same bed we had to pay. When at the reception the lady dealing with the room went on to say how busy it was and wished she wasn’t there which we could tell by her attitude towards us. When we eventually got to the room no one offered any help with baggage. We then realised that when either of us were in the bathroom as one wall is frosted glass we could see the other person in the shower which is obviously not great. So we then had to shower in the dark!! Our room was not maintained after the 1st night and then when it was, there was horrible stains on the sheets. Also the noise from the street was terrible and could hear pretty much all the noises from 8th avenue. When checking out I explained all of the above to reception and said I wasn’t happy with paying for the room change I basically got a shrug of the shoulders and was told if you didn’t like the room then we should of told them earlier. Most of the issues did not appear until the 2nd day and did not really feel like being mistreated by the staff again!! I was then charged the full fee with no chance of negotiation. Not a great experience would never use again!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On 8th Ave, 46thst just one street over from Times Square. We had a family room which had 2 double beds, desk, sofa bed, fridge, tv & shower room with full toiletries. Complimentary water, but only 2 bottles for 4 persons but on check in the lady said we could dial 9 at any time for more!Great view to the West Hudson River, family rooms are in floor 25.Breakfast was ample, cooked bacon, eggs, sausages, hash brown, breads & pastries, porridge oats, pancakes, cereals, fruit, mets & cheeses & salads. Fill your boots!The fashion bar is reasonable, we ate tacos & nachos for $13 each & a bottle of red for $33, which is fair for a NYC hotel. Would recommend for a short stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was a fanatic place to stay whilst we visited New York. This was our first trip to New York so we had done a bit of research on hotels. The Riu Plaza seemed to tick all our boxes and I’m very glad we booked it. It was in a great location where we could walk everyone. 5 minutes to Times Square, 10 minutes to Central Park and restaurants, shops all nearby. We didn’t have to get a taxi or subway anywhere (apart from airport). The rooms were clean and tidy, staff were helpful and friendly, the wait for the lifts were reasonably quick and the eating and drinking areas were nice. The breakfast was good but I have seen better breakfasts at hotels. But it just meant we had more of an appetite to eat out and try all the lovely food. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were only in NYC for a night and wanted a hotel that wasn’t super expensive, but still close to the action, this hotel did not disappoint! The check in was a bit slow, but it was close to Christmas, so that is to be expected. It is a few blocks from Times Square and close to a lot of restaurants and bars. There is a great food cart right across the street! The lobby was very festive and the bell hops were friendly and very helpful! One of the best things about this hotel is the free breakfast (which doesn’t happen in NYC) it had a great variety of offerings ha and some wonderful coffee! If you stay here, a must is Rudy’s bar, which is a hangout for the locals, the drinks are VERY reasonably priced and you get a free hot dog with your drink!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu is in close proximity of all Broadway shows, only a quick walk away to all theatres. This is our third stay at this location. The breakfast offers a great variety of foods and helped us just purchase one other meal out in the town each day. Room had a great city view and was very comfy and clean. Staff throughout the hotel were always pleasant and helpful. Daily service was wonderful. No complaints at all!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Plaza Times Square is a wonderful hotel in the heart of the city. It's close to everything and the room had a fantastic view. The staff was pleasant and helpful and the restaurant and bar were outstanding.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel location and value for money was excellent, we will definitely be recommending Hotel Riu. We will also be looking to book our next trip with Riu for our next vacation.Thank you for the excellent service

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights at this wonderful hotel in the middle of Manhattan, just off of Times Square. We were greeted well by all staff who were polite and considerate to us, and were patient when we had things to sort out. I.e bookings. The room itself was spectacular with an incredible bathroom and a kings size bed we were upgraded too on arrival. A special mention must go to Eladio who checked us in early as we had been flying for a long period and needed a rest! He also recommended extra places for us to visit and made sure we knew about all facilities within the hotel! The breakfast was a top notch buffet with; hot, cold, savoury and sweet options for everyone. All in all we enjoyed our stay a lot and would recommend RUI Plaza New York to anyone coming to the city. 5*!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After some keen research and not my first time to NY l decided upon the Riu and extremely happy l did ~ my trip was a start the new year with friends see a show and enjoy all NY has to offer ...Check in was smooth and elevators easy and quick to maneuver with key card security.My room was tastefully designed fresh clean 2 beds ... but l believe we have to feel comfortable and the position of room wasn’t right for me so l approached the FD and a very professional lady “Alia” took charge of my request to change my room and change she did and l was very happy !Breakfast was amazing and very rare to be complimentary with a huge variety of hot and cold selection and great coffee ~ each morning before l left for the day l would see my lovely Hk Rebecca who took care of my room with perfection not only was she excellent with her duties but had a lovely persona with politeness ... always refreshing to return my room at end of day Thank You Riu is so centrally located, in the heart of theatre district ~ easy access to subways with a must “l would highly recommend” and no hesitation to return !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is our third visit to New York we normally stay at The Westin which after visiting the Riu Plaza is far superior.Met by rude member of the reception team who was more interested in passing the time of day with a fellow employee rather than making sure our arrival was met with a pleasant greeting.Room was very basic no tea and coffee making , no mini bar only fridge which is given complimentary water every three days should be every day after paying hefty room tax per night !!Wi fi very poor which is meant to be part of the compulsory room tax .We paid for the dining package breakfast chaotic long queues to get seated and food quality poor trays not refreshed quick enough. Have stayed in other Rius where food quality was exceptional . Rooms noisy traffic noise could be heard from road below. Location ok for getting about Wouldn’t stay here again .
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
dcw49
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked this hotel as a deal with an airline our travel agent found. I only had one complaint. Breakfast is WAY busy. So busy if 2 or 3 of you sitting at 4 seat table they will ask you to get up and move. It really annoyed be that we were asked to moved. When we did not move and told the lady there were not seats for 2 people she just said ok well next time come find someone and will find you a seat. We said ok. Then a few mins later another employee tells us to move that we can not sit a 4 person table with just 2 people. So we got up and moved. I really thought that was just so rude of them.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here from 30.09.2019-04.01.2020. The hotel is in a great location, we could see Times Square from our window. Empire State, Rockefeller and Bryant park are all a short walk away.The rooms were bright, clean and were bigger than I thought they would be with plenty of wardrobe space. The beds were very comfortable. The shower was good.The staff at the hotel were brilliant, they were able to answer any questions that we had and they were all polite and friendly.There was a really good selection for breakfast, I'm quite a fussy eater and I didn't struggle at all. We went for breakfast around 6.30-7 every day and it was quiet but it did start to get busier as we finished.I would definitely recommend this hotel and if I went back to NYC I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After booking the hotel and being informed the total cost would be $111.43 on January 7-8, 2020, we went to check out of the facility on 1/8 only to find we must pay a $20.00+ "Resort Fee". When I inquired, I was told that it is for Internet (which I did not require), Gym (Which I did not use), and Business Office privilege (Im retired). The place is nice, the pillows are terrible, and nobody should have to pay a fee for something they do not use, and are not given the opportunity to decide. If they want me to pay the fee, offer me the opportunity at check in and if I deny the charges, allow me to find another place to sleep. This is quite deceitful on behalf of Riu.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After my wife and daughter went to New York 2018 they had such a fantastic time theyconvinced me to go so I thought Christmas Day and new year in New York 2019.My wife stayed in the Rui Plaza Times Square and she said it was a great hotel so I booked to stay there again.Upon arrival at the hotel I was quite surprised it was everything my wife explained the place was amazing the hotel was spotlessly clean and the reception Staff were very helpful and we were checked in very fast.We were given a room on the 19th floor it had two double beds with thick mattresses and a bed settee that had the thinnest mattress possible and was very uncomfortable the springs dug into your back the room was clean and the views were amazing.The room was cleaned and towel change everyday the bedding was changed 3 times in our week the air con failed to cool just heated the room the first night we thought we would die because of the heat we reported it to reception who got maintenance up straight away where they recorded a heat of the room in excess of 90 degrees! They fixed it straight away and we were sleeping well after that.The stay included breakfast which was very enjoyable and a buffet type they had a reasonable priced cafe open in the afternoon must admit we did not have an evening meal there it had a good menu but the food was not what we wanted all in all it was a great stay with fantastic staff.Just a couple of things that I would like to point outIf you have a bed settee try to get a better mattress, if you get into breakfast after 10 tell them you want to eat in the right hand side restaurant because at 10.20 they start coming round saying they were closing at 10.30 and you have to move to the other restaurant such annoyance when you have queued up and just sat down to be moved.Also the restaurant was open to the public for breakfast and the most annoyingly thing was standing waiting in a queue for a table people come in off the street pay their money and was seated before the guests.In overall this was a great experience but I just wish I had checked bill before I went as they charged 799 dollars New Year’s Eve night I would have come home the night before

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great experience of staying here, the rooms were clean and quite spacious for new york. The breakfasts were very good but you have to get there quite early otherwise there can be a wait. Ideal location too for exploring.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Smart, modern lobby area but the rooms are pokey and tired. The deluxe queen room is tiny and a sweltering 26 deg C (in Jan). The aircon makes a lot of noise but doesn't appear to do anything else. There has to be better hotels in New York, my suggestion would be you go find them.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Honestly can not fault this hotel I was so pleasantly surprised when we checked in Staff so nice, rooms immaculate in fact the whole hotel was immaculate. Breakfast was really good loads of choices. And my opinion on location was just right 5 mins away from Times Square and really close to most attractions. I will definitely be choosing this hotel again when we return to New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great stay, comfortable room and all the usual facilities. Breakfast was filling with lots of choice. Ideally located for Times Square. Some good bars nearby and a lovely little Italian a few yards down the road. We would recommend the yellow water taxi and the big bus tours. If your travelling from the airport take the Airtrain and subway to Port Authority station. Cheap and easy

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Second visit to the hotel - this time with grown up children. Didn't disappoint. In a great location. Staff are great. A real benefit is the buffet breakfast which really sets you up for the day. Definitely recommend and if returning to New York wouldn't stay anywhere else
user_name:
Scaz14
Burton upon Trent, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 5 nights at the Riu Plaza in December, the hotel is located in a great part of the city just off broadway. The hotel is very efficient, the reception and check in process was slick and the customer host very welcoming and knowledgeable, the rooms are clean and well looked after, the breakfast is very good with a wide variety of both hot and cold buffet. I recommend a visit to the hotel bar for happy hour.I would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I surprised my Husband to a Birthday trip to New York in November 2019. Having never been to the USA before I wanted a hotel that was near to Times Square as a central base and the hotel did not disappoint. Check in was smooth upon arrival and our room was clean, very comfortable and spacious - we had a room with two double beds and still felt that it was a good size. We found that the location of the hotel was ideal for us and we were surprised that you can’t hear the busy city once inside the hotel and our sleep was always undisturbed. We did have breakfast at the hotel as it was part of the B&B package on 2 mornings during our stay and found that this was ok but we chose to eat out in the city too as we had a lot of early starts. We also used the on-site cafe to get a take away drink as we walked into the city some mornings too which was reasonably priced. We reached most of the main sites on foot but did use the Subway a couple of time’s too and found the stations in easy walking distance from the hotel. All in all we had a fantastic stay and I would definitely stay at this hotel again if we went back to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent hotel spacious room for family of fiveAmazing view from 16th floor .all staff very helpful visited many Hotels around the world and this had to be the best breakfast we have ever had 5 starLocation could not be better on time square Loads of places to visit within walking distance especially Central Park5 nights was not enough so will have to visit again very soon

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights whilst in New York for a city break, The hotel is in a great location, approximately 5 minutes from Times Square and also very near Top of the Rock and the Empire State building. Our room was lovely and clean, very compact (as you would expect in NYC), I would recommend a room on one of the higher floors - we were level 10 but I think the views from higher up would be better. We had breakfast at the hotel on a couple of the mornings, and there is a huge amount of choice, but be aware it is very busy at peak times (8:30-10), the buffet is open to non hotel guests and seemed to be very popular. The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable - overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Firstly ignore all the remarks about noise levels, you’re in NYC not the countryside! You’re one block away from Times Square, in the Theatre area with loads of places to eat and drink. Check in was quick and easy too, about 3 mins and were sorted and on our way up to our room.Stayed on 14th floor, lifts can get busy at morning time but there’s plenty of them and they’re fuel injected I think! There’s places you have to pay for such rides lol!The bar, restaurant area can get busy but we were seated really quickly and there’s plenty to choose from the buffet area. Rooms are clean, and we had great views, you’re there to see NYC not spend all day in bed.Our pickup taxi failed to arrive on way back to UK, no problem within minutes they’d sorted out a taxi and was on our way.Would fully recommend this hotel and definitely would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is very conveniently located, only a block from Times Square. The rooms are smallish but comfortable. Lots of ambient noise can be heard from the outside when the A/C or heat is not running. We were on the 19th floor and every siren, car horn and delivery truck backing up can be plainly heard. Bring ear plugs or be prepared to sleep with a pillow over your head. There is also not a lot of storage space. You have two small drawers in the nights stands next to each side of the bed and room for hanging clothes in the closet, but a few more drawers would have been nice. Staff was relatively friendly and helpful. We had two issues that required correction. Getting missing linens brought to the room took over 45 minutes. And when the hair dryer malfunctioned, we waited 30 minutes for the maintenance man but he hadn’t showed up by the time we had to leave. Coming back two hours later, the dryer was working again. Bathroom is small and has a frosted glass sliding door. Toilet and sink are almost right on top of each other but the shower is pretty big and features two different shower heads. The lights require a room key card to be placed in a slot near the door in order to work. This includes sockets to charge electronics as well. Don’t make the mistake of leaving the room and expect your phone to charge while you are gone. Breakfast buffet is good but food quality is average. Pancakes were awful, cold and tasted like they just came out of the freezer. Nice assortment of fresh fruits. Coffee machine had issues on two of the days we were there. Restaurant spacing is very tight and very busy between 8-10 am. All in all, the hotel was a good value and comfortable enough for a one week visit. I couldn’t have handled any more.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We liked this hotel very much,rooms were clean,the beds were comfy..staff were friendly and very helpful.Breakfast buffet was awesome! Would stay here again! Was close to many places of interest to us!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is the 1st time we have stayed here but we would definitely come back.We had a room that had 2 double beds and one sofa bed so there was plenty of room for all 3 of us. We were given a room on the 26th floor which has great views over the river and we could see the cruise ships coming into dock. Breakfast was included with our stay and it was to a very good standard.... lots to choice from both hot and cold and it was replenished quickly. It was busy though and you had to queue if you got there after 7.45amThe staff at the hotel were all very welcoming and friendly.The location was great if you wanted to be in the hustle and bustle - it’s on the corner of 55 and 8th so a few minutes from Times Square. We arrived at 11.30am after a long flight and we were pleased that a room was found for us straight away even though checkin was 3pm. Would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good hotel, rooms are small but they have everything you need. Breakfast is good, its a very big hotel so make sure you avoid rush hour breakfast. They arent as flexible with early check in or late checkout so plan your stay according. Location is good. Wifi was ok. Bathrooms give you little privacy but the hotel was clean and everything worked well. I had problema getting a cab and the bell boy did not want to help me. So that was bad. But other than that its a solid hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location if you wish to stay near Times Square. Walking distance from a lot of attractions. Lovely hotel, friendly, helpful staff who were extremely accommodating & very clean. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I took my granddaughter to New York City for a graduation present. I can't say enough good things about our stay at your hotel. It was convenient to everything we wanted to do. Talked to a very pleasant lady, Virginia, before our trip, who I met at the hotel upon arrival, that put in my request to have a view from our room. They were able to check us early in our room and upgraded us to a king bed instead of a queen. This made our trip start out wonderful. The breakfast buffet included with the room was the best I have ever seen. I will definitely stay at RIU every time I go to New York. Only a couple of blocks from Times Square. Also, upon leaving, they got us a wonderful driver that took us back to LGA. Thank you all the staff at RIU New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect if you are running! It’s about 20 min walk to the finish line, and close to the buses that take you to the start line. Great breakfast included. Very good service for runners. I would recommend!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights over christmas arriving on Christmas Eve .Hotel reception is lovely and upon check in we were asked to leave a $100 deposit with any Facility charges coming off at the end if we used them .Upon questioning this we were told we would only be charged for what we used so over the 4 days we didnt use there wifi , drink the water , use the fridge , gym or have newspapers expecting to get the full deposit back yet on leaving they took $63 out of the $100 and told regardless of using the Facilitys or not we would have got charged which is not only wrong information given but we paid enough to stay at the hotel in the first place !!The breakfast was ok , nothing special and you need to get there early to get a table and can only go in if your family are all together .The room was clean and the beds made every day but not keen on the glass window between the shower and the bedroom when sharing with your teenage sons ... not appropriate when trying to shower and they can see your shadow / outline plus the gap between the door when you want some privacy using the toilet !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: King size deluxe rooms on the small side but guess it is New York. Noisy air con in rooms and ambience in hotel lacking. Staff could be friendlier, some were but they were the exception. Good location near Times Square for site-seeing but can get a bit noisy at night. Free breakfast a bonus but don’t expect good quality food, over cooked, dry pastries and bread, edible but not great. Coffee machine dispenses there most awful tasting coffee, and some beverage offerings depends on if machine working. Ok overall but nothing special.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The only advantage of this hotel is its location. Breakfast overcrowded, small tables, small rooms, they don’t fill the mini bar in the room, almost lost our loundry. Loud, too many people, AC not working well. For this money you can get a 5 star hotel nearby.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotelWe had 5 days here,the breakfast and the evening Theatre Buffet were excellent.The hotel despite being very busy was was always kept clean and tidy.We also enjoyed the Fashion Bar.Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here with my 10 year old daughter for one night. It was clean, but small. But this is NYC and most hotel rooms are known for being small. We stayed on the 22nd floor and had a cool view of the surrounding buildings (see photos) We could see a bit of the lights from Times Square from our window, but the black out curtains did the trick. About a block from Times Square and an easy walk to Rockefeller Center as well! The walls to the bathroom are glass. You can’t see all the way through but you can see shadows of the person inside. It was fine since I was just with my daughter but that could be awkward depending on who you are with. Also, because of this, if someone uses the bathroom the light shines through to the bed, which could disturb others while sleeping. I’m not sure why it’s designed this way. It’s weird. Breakfast was simply ok. It was edible,But nothing super fabulous. We weren’t there for the food though. Overall it was a good experience and I’d recommend it to others and would stay there again if I ever return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Reception Staff - Rude and NOT helpful at all. Mimicked my husband as we walked off after asking a question about hotel transfers to airport. Breakfast - Disgusting! Food was cold and very unorganised with staff. Tables are too cramped together. I grabbed juice for my husband and I every morning and I found a smashed glass twice out of the 5 breakfasts we had. Guests queuing from 8am which is normal, but guests trying to get in and out of lifts which are right in the middle of the queue to breakfast.Room - Very Clean couldn’t fault the room at all apart from far too hot. Ask reception to turn heat off as it’s far too warm on 25th floor and they put the air conditioning on left the hotel with a cold after 5 nights. Concierge Desk - Need to figure out if the job is for them. As a big part of it is talking to guests and being polite which is what non of the staff had. Location - Fantastic! But would rather stay another block down if that’s how staff treat there guests. Staff - Are miserable and rude on front desk need to move on. Ladies who cleaned room are pleasant and welcoming and thorough.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife & daughters had pestered me to visit New York, as they had been twice before without me, due to other commitments.I booked this hotel on a package from Tui.The hotel is in a fantastic location, only 5 minutes walk from Times Square, and a great base to explore Manhattan.Open top bus tours operate from across the road opposite.The hotel was spotlessly clean, quiet, warm and the beds are very comfortable.Buffet Breakfast was included, with plenty of choice, and of good quality.I would definitely re-visit this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is great. Very modern. Inside very clean. Room was nice, super comfy bed, loved the style of the room, not big but nice decorated touches. Breakfast buffet was included, and it was perfect. Fresh lot of variety meats, cheeses, breads, drinks. Unfortunately, only stayed o one night but they had dinner buffet for $35 which I will do next time. They offer valet parking for $55 which being in ❤️ of Manhattan it's affordable. Will definitely come back, had stayed in other hotels on the area but will be selecting Riu again for future visits.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on our first trip to NYC. Check in was easy and straightforward, however very little information or advice regarding hotel services or local services given to us by reception. Needed $300.00 to hold as deposit, which we didn’t know about when we booked via British Airways. We knew about the Facility Fee, but didn’t know about having to leave a deposit. Took our own bags up to our room, and freshened up before exploring. Very little storage space except for the under the bed storage (which I did not want to use), however room was very clean, modern and bright. And most importantly for me there was laminate flooring throughout the room instead of carpet, which gave it a much cleaner feel!! Lovely views from floor to ceiling windows.Water bottles are put in room alternate days. Hotel is in a great location, close to Times Square. We had booked breakfast as part of the package, however wasn’t told that there was 2 places to eat for breakfast. Instead we were told breakfast was in the Theatre Buffet Restaurant. The setting kind of ruined our breakfast experience, as it resembled a very tightly packed school canteen with everyone sitting closely together. On our last day, we heard about a second restaurant that opens for breakfast the Fashion Cafe. We were told that the buffet restaurant is suited to groups whilst the fashion cafe is better suited to couples. I wish we were told about this at the start of our stay, as this restaurant was much more civilised with more space and felt more “holiday” like rather then just a noisy school canteen. Food was the same in both - usual hotel breakfast buffet food - bacon eggs sausages etc. Nothing wrong with the food, however due to the location of the hotel, I doubt I would bother with breakfast here if I stayed again, as there are so many places to eat outside the hotel which was much tastier!! WiFi in hotel was fast. Check out was simple, and they released the deposit minus the Facility Fee. As part of the Fee, is baggage hold after check out, so we was able to explore further before having to leave for the flight.Hotel arranged our taxi to airport, which was no cheaper then the yellow cab we got from the airport to the hotel on our first day. But I think there is a flat airport fee.Would definitely stay here again if staying in NYC, minus the breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful hotel in an excellent location but beware you may not get what you pay for. I booked, and paid for a room with 2 queen beds, and requested a high floor. I got a single room on the 11th floor.. On querying this with reception I was met with a curt the hotel is full but they would see what they could do the following day. This effectively ruined our first night in New York. Day 2 I had 2 further discussions with the reception staff and eventually was offered an accessible room with a sofa bed There was no apology and no offer of even a free drink at the bar for our inconvenience. Unfortunately this was not my only issue. On the third day we were going to Washington and therefore had an early start. The restaurant for breakfast was full and therefore because we was on a tight schedule I asked if we could just grab a couple of muffins to go. This was rudely refused and I was told that if any food was taken out of the restaurant it would be chargeable. When I asked what difference it made the waitress was unable to answer. To summarise if you want ta hotel that looks all nice a shiny but you can live with atrocious customer service then this is the place for you. If on the other hand you expect certain standards then book somewhere else there are plenty of other hotels many of which are cheaper in the same area.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is really impressive on arrival. There is a bar attached to it via the lobby, which was lovely (we went for a few drinks one night and enjoyed the happy hour options). The staff are really friendly, approachable and knowledgable. The rooms were really lovely. The bathroom did have the glass walls, which was a little off putting if you’re not particularly body confident but it didn’t detract from the room or my enjoyment. The room was clean and always kept pristine by housekeeping staff. The location is ideal and the sleep quality is pretty decent. The bed was beyond comfortable. I couldn’t recommend this hotel enough and if I return to NYC again, I’d definitely not hesitate to book this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I question whether this hotel is actually a 4 star hotel or not. I've stayed in a number of 4 star hotels in the US and elsewhere and this one would, for me, be more of a 3 star. Nothing bad in that at all, just be aware of what you are getting (and, more importantly, what you are not getting).We booked a deluxe family double room with sofabed for our family of 5 (three boys aged 13,11 and 8), thinking that this would be sufficient for us for 3 nights. The room itself was adequate, but small, particularly when housing 5 people. Fair enough - our fault, not the hotel's. On reflection we should have booked a suite or interconnecting rooms, but you live and learn. The room was clean and had beds, a TV and a bathroom, but that's about all I can say that's positive. No tea or coffee making facilities and, whilst there were two bottles of water in the mini fridge, these were never replenished, despite there being a notice on the fridge that water would be replaced every other day. The bathroom had a sliding glass door and a frosted glass wall between the shower and the bedroom - very funky and possibly quite fun depending on the occupants of the room, but a bit of a shock all round in our case! Again, nothing against this but something to be aware of.Breakfast, which was included, was good. A bit of a battle to the death (tongs at dawn) with other patrons, but the food was decent enough, the range was very good (cooked, continental, fruit, cereals, breads, etc.) and we all filled up splendidly.Overall, the hotel itself is fine. The rooms are small, but I guess that is to be expected in a city centre hotel. The position is great and breakfast was very welcome.What really lets this place down, in my opinion, is the front of house staff, with a couple of notable exceptions (in particular, the lady who checks people in for breakfast, serves in the cafe and probably does half a dozen other things in between). The check in staff were surly and unaccommodating and, I found, a bit snippy. Not what you want as the first introduction to the hotel. But the worst culprit is the "Fashion Bar". This place needs a rocket. Three times as many bar staff as they currently have on might go some way to improving the service. Customer service training for the waiting staff would go the rest of the way. Something along the lines of actually looking to serve customers rather than hanging out and chatting with other members of staff would be a start. We waited for over 30 minutes to get a round of drinks, and that would have been longer had I not gone over to the bar to collect the drinks myself. This is a particular bugbear of mine, but if you are going to offer cocktails in a bar, have other bar staff who can serve the rest of the drinks, otherwise you hold up everybody else simply because someone wants a Manhattan. To sum up, this could be a good hotel if the staff were properly trained in how to handle guests (surely not rocket science, given that this is the establishment's raison d'être). The rooms are fine (so long as you understand what you have booked), the breakfast is good, the position is great. But there is literally nothing that will colour the mood more than to be kept waiting for a drink after a hard day's sightseeing and shopping. Inexcusable. I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a great hotel and in the perfect location about 100 yards from the centre of Times Square. The check in process is quick and easy. The rooms are clean and adequate with a good shower, flat screen TV and great views of the City. Breakfast is perfect with everything you need, fresh fruit daily, porridge, bacon, eggs, sausages, pancakes, cereal, toast, pastries, salads, cheeses and smoked salmon. Fresh tea and coffee, with all choices unlimited, a great start to the day. We would definitely return here, the staff are so friendly and welcoming.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights. Breakfast lovely, and plenty up go around, plenty of choice. Location of hotel, nicely positioned right near Times Square/Broadway theatres etc. but not too close to be woken by any noises. Curtains blocked out all light. Beds very comfy and clean. Bathroom was a wet room, shower was always hot enough.Had to wait a while for one of our bags to be located which was misplaced which we left with them before we properly checked in, but a real minor and one off issue which wouldn’t stop me giving this 5 stars. The bag was found eventually. Would stay there again and recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After looking forward to going to New York for the first time for so long for two birthdays I was very diaspointed. Once we arrived and went to room we discovered that the room only had one bed when we had booked 2 beds. After going to the reception the customer service was questionable. We were told they would sort a new room out but were fully booked. However after taking a whole day to sort out we would be put into a new room with a sofa bed, and was a disabled room still not what we paid for. I also asked for an extra pillow for it not to materialise. The hotel is definitely not a 4* hotel. I also found some of the staff to be rude. We also requested a high floor room only to discover we were first placed on 11 floor and then moved to 10th it seemed to me that they don't consider anyones request. The breakfast that was included was also questionable the bacon was horrible however the pancakes were nice. Coffee was disgusting and they like to rush you and close early then advertise. All in all I'm very disappointed and will not be staying in hotel again. Also there is a resort fee and they take money off your card if you use extra things. However you do get this back if you don't have extra things.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It is always a pleasure to stay here. Very accommodating and friendly. The elevators are a little slow during the morning time but other than that everything is clean and great!!! I have been staying here for 4 years now

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: i first booked this hotel to stay in February 2019 with my wife and son. i then booked at short notice to stay last December and then booked for a 3rd time to stay this month with my wife for a special event.Once again we were very happy with our stay. great communications with the hotel when i asked a few questions in the run up to our stay. We arrived early in the morning at 8am and left our bags for the day. Came back at 6pm to check in, met with a lovely guy called David. Super fast check in and got a lovely corner room. Stayed half board again. i love the buffet style of things and the fact there is no wait!! one night there was a group of school children and they ate the entire buffet in one go. The staff worked so hard and in no time everything was replaced. I loved the soup, the salads, the meats and vegetables and deserts. Very nice and lots of choice. Breakfast was nice too. Yeah its busy but you have lots of people around to chat to and top tip - multi task with your breakfast. So while you make your toast, grab a coffee and cereal. you can get everything you need in a few minutes. This is a great plus. The hotel was very festive and the staff were all lovely. Our room had a fantastic view being on a corner, cant wait to come back!! People have commented on the lobby area being busy. You know what, we always got a seat but it is great for people watching and chatting to others (my wife does like to talk). love it love it love the Riu. Also -great location for subways, getting the bus to woodbury (outlets) etc..
user_name:
gheth67
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked via Riu Class for 3 night in December 2019 , easy to reach hotel in the centre of the hustle and bustle of New York. Check in painless - room on 21st floor . The room was clean and well laid out - no issues at all . Stayed breakfast which can get a little busy but all the items on the breakfast buffet were refilled promptly , staff cleaning and clearing tables quickly , in order for other dinners to eat . Checkout again no issues . The only very minor issues was the concierge booked shuttle for our return to the airport was 35 minutes late due to traffic but we reached the airport within time. Overall , i enjoyed my stay and would stay again at this location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Level 10 family spacious room, 2 double beds and sofa bed, fantastic location, clean and friendly staff, value for money to. Highly recommend, staff accomodating as requested two rooms next to each other which we got, Thank you we loved our stay.
user_name:
Lisa C
Saundersfoot, Wales, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: the RIU is always the best stay - I have never had a bad stay at any location. I've stayed at the Times Square location at least 3 times and its always clean. The breakfast is always good. I leave my bags at the bell station and never had a problem.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent location & we had a room on top floor so had a fantastic view . Breakfast excellent but can get very busy so get there early. Buffet dinner well worth the visit as it makes a change from the fast food of New York .
user_name:
peterwA9348NL
St Columb Major, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had the opportunity to stay here overnight during a trip to NYC with friends. Excellent location. Clean, energy efficient room. Breakfast was included and the buffet was just fine. While they do not offer overnight parking (never saw that the did) there was a Parking garage 1 block away on 47th street. Became a suitcase walker in the city. LOL

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Accommadations were great, staff rude, the shower wall was a frosted glass that faced the room, so whoever took a shower their silhouette could be seen. Not good for family travel. Plus, the hotel transfer from the airport dropped us 1-1/2 blocks away. Upon complaining about this at check-in, was told transfer company was independent. I'm a very good tipper, even in NYC, so rudeness of staff had nothing to do with that! Holiday Inn or Hilton from now on.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Possibly normal to US Citizens but to most nationalities a facility fee is questionable. Although you’re paying for the room, and extra for the food. They still charge extra for a faculties fee 87.20 per room. To have the food and room.... you just paid for? The $300 deposit also takes 72 hours to refund. Quite over priced for the hotel. Stay on the Row a few doors down for $660 cheaper.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just at the edge of things, this is a perfect place to stay in Midtown. Easy access by car and subway, and it's close to Times Square, Restaurant Row and other attractions. And after a long day touring the City, there are plenty of local things to do right on Eighth Avenue. The hotel lobby is frequently packed with people, so be forewarned that you may have a bit of a wait to check in or out. Staff are generally friendly and accommodating, with an exception or two here and there, but overall are quite nice. Rooms vary greatly in size but even the small ones are large enough for two people. They're tastefully decorated in a somewhat spartan Euro-style, but quite nice. The included breakfast is amazing, and is also Euro-style (which I love), including cold cuts, cheeses, etc. along with standard American fare. Nice bar but the drinks are outrageously expensive if you don't hit it at happy hour. Check this place out....you will love it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 2 blocks from Times Square, approx 10 minutes walk to Macy's, around 5 minutes to the Subway and right in the middle of theatre land. Very friendly check in and check out. A modern hotel with very functional rooms.only downside is no tea or coffee facilities in room or ice machines on each floor. Breakfast is buffet style and there is definitely something for everyone there, either hot or cold. There was an issue with lifts(elevators) one day resulting in using a fire escape to get to breakfast, thankfully we were only on the sixth floor, would I stay there again? Yes

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had four night break here! Lovely hotel, very good breakfast. It does get busy but there are different areas they open up when busy! Staff all really lovely, helpful. Very clean, saw nothing to complain about. Nice coffee shop attached. And the ther side nice bar, with a happy hour from 4 TIL 7. Would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We’ve stayed at the Riu twice already and have enjoyed each time greatly. The hotel has been remodeled and it has a modern and chic vibe.The rooms are VERY clean; no dust, fingerprints, or smudges anywhere. A great hot breakfast buffet is included with the stay. The Riu Plaza New York is centrally locates only two blocks from Times Square. Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall are a few more blocks away. It’s convenient to several subway stations.The check in and check out process is quick and easy.We highly recommend this hotel for your trip to the Big Apple!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Room was nice, lobby and restaurant nice. Bathroom not so nice, clean but smelled like sewage probably because building and sewage lines are dated. Hotel in area where homeless are visible, outside area of hotel smelled of urine along walk. View of time square nice, but nothing to brag about. Prefer hotels near Rockefeller Plaza.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Large hotel (28 floors) smack bang in the middle of things just on the edge of Times Square - location is absolutely perfect.The whole place is spotlessly clean with a nice bar downstairs and 2 seperate dining areas. I have been impressed with Riu hotels in Europe so thought it would be good, I chose this hotel because of the location and the free breakfast - believe me that's a big saving in New York !The room was perhaps smaller than a typical UK or European hotel room but it was big enough, very modern and smart with a large walk-in shower in the bathroom and a good heating system.Breakfast is a buffet affair with all the usual cooked ingredients and plenty of fruit, cereals, breads, croissants, cakes, etc. Its great to be able to have a good meal to start the day and saves spending a fortune on lunch !All the staff were friendly and helpful and genuinely seemed like they wanted you to enjoy the stay. My only small issue was being charged for a drink (at the usual eye-watering New York prices !) and not even being offered any change. OK, it was only about 70 cents but it adds up when it happens every time you buy a drink, the bar staff don't say oh, you paid extra last time, we'll knock the odd 30 cents off the bill this time ....

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Highly professional staff, exceptionally clean hotel in all areas and a wonderful setting close to everything that we needed. I know that it's so easy to give a five star rating to every aspect yet this hotel fully deserves it. First class all round.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The whole experience of the Riu Plaza was brilliant, the hotel was so clean, the staff extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Food was exceptional and plentiful, with so much variation and choice. The only minor thing was there not being tea or coffee making facility in the room, but minor and did not detract from the overall experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing hotel only thing that let you down is the moody woman working on reception when checking out, completely ruined the experience for me, lack of customer service skills - a smile really wouldn’t hurt!
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
995katieb
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: i lovely new york and hotel iam deaf wheelchair remember and round look shop ..i wish there new york ha ha ha breakfast lovely ...merry christmas everyone and happy new year 2020 ......i like airport long hour 8 hour gatwick to new york

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We just returned from New York after staying at the RIU. For the price, this hotel was perfect. It is very nice, had security, rooms are all updated and new. The best part is the breakfast included. There were so many options to choose from, it was like eating at a nice restaurant buffet. We also chose to do the dinner package everything night. For us, this made our lives easier. We were only there a weekend and found it hard to find a place to eat, even though there are restaurants everywhere, they usually have a wait. Dinner time was from 6:30-10:30, I believe. Again, it was a very nice large dinner buffet with several options to choose from. You are only a block away from Time Square too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We love RIU chain. The location is perfect. It offers many restaurants to choose from walking distance, as well as many Broadway shows and Times Square shops. The rooms are neat, however, on a smaller side. My personal wish would be to have a pool in the hotel. The breakfast buffet is included, has many good choices, and it gets very crowded after 8am. Overall, would recommend Riu in NYC. Came here 3 times so far.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the RIU Plaza New York Times Square, great location for theatres and shopping. Hotel lovely and clean. Great choice for buffet breakfast. Staff friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel is perfect for Times Sq and the surrounding areas. It is spotless throughout and the staff are very friendly especially Eladio on front desk. 4/5 for the reason that breakfast could have been warmer. There is a wide variety of choices but it was lukewarm on 3 days. Which tells me this is a common thing.Room was cleaned daily but sheets not changed.Would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a 4 night stay here and the hotel was superb. The front desk staff we spoke to were all lovely and super helpful, check in and out was quick and efficient and they were happy to hold our luggage for us on the last day as we weren't collected until 2pm.This hotel was booked as part of a package deal with TUI so all the taxes and additional costs were already covered, we just paid $100 security deposit when we checked in and it was refunded immediately when we left.Room was small and basic but immaculately clean and the King bed (Super King to us in the UK) was really comfortable. Bathroom was a good size with lovely walk in large shower, the only thing I wasn't keen on was the glass frosting between the shower and your room so if you wanted to get up in the night and turn the light on it illuminated the bedroom and woke up the person you're staying with. Also the glass door was a strange sliding one which doesn't close properly with a large gap of at least an inch ore more either side so if you want to hear your partner/friend on the toilet then that's great - wasn't my favourite feature though!The location was perfect, just 1 block from Times Square and within easy walking distance of all mid Manhattan plus the piers on the West side for the Circle Line cruises and Intrepid Land, Sea and Space museum.We decided to have a drink at the bar on our last night and were surprised to find we could get a nice bottle of prosecco for just $33, much cheaper than elsewhere we stopped at!I would definitely stay in this hotel again if I revisit New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I wasn't blown away by the Riu Plaza and probably wouldn't go back, though it does have many good points. These include:* Location - it's right in the heart of Midtown and most of the time you can get a yellow cab or an Uber in a matter of minutes.* Staff - everyone we met was helpful and friendly.* Breakfast - this is served in two rooms (we preferred the Fashion Café – you can choose whichever you like) and has a very good range of choices. It's pretty loud and lively, though!* Rooms - adequately sized with new-ish decoration and decent beds, though hardly large (we had a family room).The not so good stuff:* The hotel lobby is a really busy place, with lots of tourists in and out wheeling luggage all the time. Because of this, it takes something away from the pretty cool decor and strips the place of any sense of elegance it may have.* Views looking to the west, as many seemed to do, are a bit disappointing – no matter what floor you're on.* Bedroom walls aren't great in terms of noise-proofing.As for the oft-mentioned and much complained-about shower wall being semi-transparent, this absolutely is not a problem – even with teenage kids – if you simply turn off the light in the bathroom when someone is in there. There is more than enough light getting into the bathroom through that semi-transparent wall for anyone in the bathroom to see what they are doing, and no embarrassing shadows can be seen by people in the bedroom.On a related note, and in anticipation of the dreaded 'gap' between the bathroom wall and the door which some people here have talked about, we took a two-inch cutting off a £4 IKEA paper window blind and basically hung that in the gap (weighted down by a bulldog clip). It worked a treat and provided some extra privacy. An easy fix!While I definitely didn't love this place, it was certainly an excellent base and we felt perfectly safe walking around at all hours. I would say the location, the breakfast and the staff go a long way to making the Riu Plaza a serious contender for a mid-priced Midtown hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for a couple of nights with my wife after ending a cruise. Nice hotel literally a couple of minutes walk from centre of Times Square. I presume Riu of trying to establish themselves in North America is this hotel is a fine example of how guests should be treated. I should have taken the name of the gentleman who checked us in as he deserves a mention here. Went out of his way to ensure we were happy and we had all the info we needed. This was followed by a check up phone call after we had seen the room to make sure we were happy with it. Breakfast was good though very busy on Day 1, Day 2 was quieter. Never met a member of staff who wasn’t really helpful courteous and professional. If your budget can stretch get a lounge admittance room. The lounge is in the 26th floor and has an assortment of pastries sandwiches bites to suit whatever time the eating period is. Finally and worth a mention they sorted out our taxi to JFK which was cheaper than the yellow cabs flat rate and Uber and rolled up right to the door sorted by the hotel concierge. Thank you for a great stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I spent 100 nights in hotels last year (and am on track to hit that this year as I travel for work), and I can unequivocally state that the front desk staff member I encountered here was the rudest of my year. In addition to being rude when we checked in, she also called up to the room after I ordered takeout from a nearby restaurant and accusingly asked “did YOU order FOOD?!” I answered yes and she said “well then you’re going to have to come down here, you know we can’t have them bring it up!” Well, first, no I didn’t. And second, I’ve never stayed somewhere with this policy that didn’t send it up with a bellhop or other staff. But in any case, no need to lose your decorum over it. Rest of my experience: room is small even for Manhattan. Very basic appointments, and beds are very, very firm. Clean but not great. I have a lot of choices of where to stay when I come to NYC, and so do you. Choose somewhere else.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Myself and my mother stayed her in November for a 3 night short break to NYC.The hotel is in a very convenient position, one block from times square and on the edge of hells kitchen.The check in was quick and efficient. The rooms were small but more than adequate for a short break. Very bright, modern and clean. Lots of New York hotel rooms seem dark and dingy but this one is bright and airy. The room had two huge comfortable beds, a small desk and a fridge with water refilled every other day. Unfortunately for us Brits, no tea or coffee making facilities for our morning brew! Excellent heating/cooling system.The bathroom was great, big walk in shower, two shower heads, sink, toilet, a range of small toiletries, big fluffy towels and a good hairdryer attached to the wall. Frosted glass from shower into the room but not a problem at all, you cant see through it, you can just about make out a shadow.Breakfast was busy but well run. Good range of things, from eggs, bacon, waffles, pastries, bagels, fresh fruit, yoghurts and hams and cheeses. Some of a better quality than others but a good start to the day.The staff were all pleasant and the girls at breakfast were very friendly.A couple of slight negatives. One being that, as a riu member and after emailing the hotel twice that it was my mothers big birthday on our trip, the hotel didnt recognise this in any way at all. And two, the charge they put on at check out of over 20 dollars per night for wifi, water and the gym... it's a little steep tbh. The hotel organised transport to the airport for us in a huge comfortable car for a flat rate of 75 dollars, which, after tolls and tip etc was the same as th yellow cab we took from the airport, but much more luxurious. Took us over two hours to get back to jfk though, so make sure you leave ample time as traffic was horrendous. Overall a fabulous stay in a very bright and modern hotel in a great location in NYC. I'd highly recommend it, but factor in your 20 dollar per night fee when your comparing hotel prices.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Second visit to the Riu NYC and don't think I would stay anywhere else. The location is fantastic, love the modern styling of the lobby areas and rooms. Nice (if busy) breakfast buffet, great bar with happy hour prices you can't beat in NYC. Staff were all very nice and helpful. Only odd thing this trip is we ended up in an accessible room, which wasn't requested and honestly I'd rather not have to allow those who need it the space. Wish there was more space in the bathroom for toiletries, very small sink with virtually no counter space. Don't remember my prior room or if this is unique to an accessible space - but everyone has at least a few things you need! Overall good trip, would return again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice and modern hotel, only 3 years old. Staff relatively friendly, what you would expect in a normal hotel. We had breakfast included and again, no faults really, all decent quality. Room was a tad on the small side, although given you’re in New York, you won’t spend much time in it. House keeping were very good as the room was always we play looked after. Actually this is the first hotel I’ve stayed in where they stick to their eco friendly morals i.e. if you hang your used towels on the rack, they won’t replace them. Not too keen on the bathroom privacy as the door is a slider and the walls were misted glass. So if anyone was staying in the room with you and had to do a midnight toilet run, you’re certainly going to wake up with the light...and hear them too. No kettle in the room for tea or coffee, but bottled water supplied everyday. Overall very good hotel, designed very nice and great location if you like the touristy parts of NewYork.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is excellent in every respect,we found the bar to be very expensive,but then we were in New York.Housekeeping excellent,we stayed in room 1019 ,and could not fault it.All staff ,especially Virginia on reception very courteous,and informative,take the shuttle to airport,from hotel ,very good!.Location also excellent,times square a short walk,breakfast included very good,all in all first class stay ,we have stayed in other various Riu’s,Mexico,jamaica,etc.and this one certainly was above the mark ,thanks to all staff.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just arrived home after 4 night stay in riu plaza, couldn't fault it at all. Check in quick and easy. We had room on 19th floor . The room had 2 large beds pushed together. Comfiest bed I've ever slept in and best pillows too. Also had a sofa and desk .fridge, Wardrobe,iron and board and safe. Bathroom has large shower with 2 shower heads. Hairdryer and lots of towels plus complimentary shower gel etc. The decor of room was lovely plenty enough room and spotlessly clean. Wifi worked great. We heard no noise from outside or other guests inside whilst in our room. Breakfast was included plenty of choice to fill up before a day of exploring. Although busy we never waited more than 2 minutes to be seated. We didnt use any other facilities in the hotel as we weren't in it long enough, it was basically a base to sleep, wash eat breakfast and go.All staff we very polite friendly and happy. We had no problems with anything at all. We left our luggage on check out til later in the day, you are given a ticket which matches label put on your cases.Location was great 2 min walk to times square.There was a street cart outside the hotel doors ( lovely bloke) where we would get a coffee on our way back in at night. I can recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay here again if we return to NYC
user_name:
Beccy A
Nottingham, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were 9 days here. It was amazing. Everything was perfect! The food was delicious, the hotel comfortable, the location and the staff friendly and helpfully too. The view was so pretty at night.We defenitely will come back soon.Thank you for all! Attila

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights, had a room on the 10th floor which was dual aspect. Worried about the noise, not too bad but you could hear the sirens.Rooms are small but great for what you need, big bed and large shower, also has small fridge.Breakfast was busy, but only waited once in the 4 days, tables are crammed in and you take your life in your hands as people wander around with hot drinks and food.Brilliant location, close to subways and Times Square, we walked alot. Would recommend the Hudson greenway for walking

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is located just off Times Square and is perfectly situated for Broadway and downtown attractions. It’s a few minutes walk to the PTA Terminal where you can get multiple subway connections, as well as the ticket office for the Grayline NYC Tours. Beware, it’s incredibly noisy 24/7 due to non-stop traffic and fire station opposite. The rooms are quite small and have basic furnishings. They are clean and comfortable, but you’re paying a premium just for the location. The staff are great. Do not bother paying for the breakfast buffet. It’s extremely expensive, very poor quality, and it’s absolute chaos as hundreds of guests are crammed in to a small space. There are plenty of diners, restaurants and coffee shops within a 2 minute walk of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed 3 nights bed and breakfast and it was just gorgeous. The room was immaculate as was the hotel. The breakfast was glorious. Well worth getting up early for. Checking in and out couldn't have been any more efficient. All in all a very pleasant experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a 5 day stay at The Rui. We stayed in a family room. Two bedrooms, one with a king sized bed and the other with 2 doubles with a shared bathroom. The hotel is in a great location being close to Times Square and is located on Restaurant Row with its numerous bars and restaurants. You are on the doorstep of Hell's Kitchen where again there are numerous places to eat and drink. Hotel is modern and rooms are spotlessly clean. A buffet breakfast is provided as part of your room deal. Everything you would expect to set you up for a busy day sightseeing in New York. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I return to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good but not an exceptional hotel for the money. The room was very hot the first night but fixed after that. Eggs were cold for breakfast but they have espresso and cappuccino machines which is a plus. Bacon very greasy. Not a huge selection.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu in Times Square is a very new, clean and modern hotel with all the conveniences of an all inclusive property. the breakfast offered everyThing you’d expect with an all inclusive resort. The staff was very polished and as friendly as you’d like them to be. Being beside the Theatre District there’s plenty to do after a long day of business and places to entertain your customers If dinner is on the schedule.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in Riu Plaza for 5 nights and the stay was really enjoyable. The hotel is in an excellent location just 2 blocks from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. It is well served by transport links, with the Port Authority bus terminal only 5 minutes walk from hotel and several subway stations close by also. The hotel was very busy when we stayed and check in and check out had queues, but staff got through them quickly and efficiently. The rooms were clean and comfortable, my only complaint is that they maybe a little small but that’s to be expected in New York hotels, it’s not a big factor as there is so much to do in New York that so little time is spent in the room. We ate breakfast in hotel every morning during our stay and I would highly recommend it. Breakfast is buffet style with foods to suit all types of tastes. Breakfast in hotel saves both time and money during a trip. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again on future trips to New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here in November with my Wife and 3 children. What a fab place, we booked a family room which was perfect for us, children in 1 room and us in another, fabulous big shower, fridge and safe are all included.We did pay $52 local tax for 4 day, but I think that is more than reasonable. Staff here are what makes this place. Everyone is friendly, helpful, nothing is any trouble for them.Location is fab, out of hotel turn left and Times Square is a few minutes away, subway to ground zero/battery park all within 5-8 mins walk.Breakfast is very good, set us up for the day. It does get busy, but always seated within a few minutes.Would I recommend RIU Plaza? Definitely, it’s a great base for your stay in New York.Hope this helps someone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really great hotel, good value. Booked as a package with BA and stayed for 5 nights with breakfast included. Room was a little small by US standards but big comfy beds, clean and well equipped. Glad we included the breakfast which was a buffet and was varied slightly each day. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for a first visit to New York, just a short walk from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in the Riu Plaza for 5 nights. The location is ideal for visiting all the sights and is close to all major transit stations. Rooms are functional and clean ~ all you need when visiting New York as you will be out so much during the day you just need a base. We booked breakfast and it was brilliant ~ saves quite a lot of money. There is a wide variety ~ cereals, cold meats , fruit , pastries and the standard fried food. Unlimited coffee/tea/juice. Service in the Fashion bar was excellent, staff were friendly and helpful. Area was spotless. We were advised of the busy times at the two buffet bars and avoided the queues ! There was also a Grab and Go which served cakes and pastries plus ~ very tasty food.  Staff were particularly welcoming and friendly.....we were able to use luggage storage as our pickup was 6.00 pm , we were able to check out early , see some more sights and collect close to pickup time.....maybe give yourself 30 minutes before pickup as hotel is very busy with guest checking in and those returning home.We had to pay a holding charge of 100 dollars at beginning of our stay ....has been refunded very quickly. Dinner served in hotel is very good, if you need a restaurant try to avoid the main avenues as there is a plethora of restaurants off the main thoroughfares & can be quite a bit cheaper !!Highly recommend this hotel for location, services, value for money and all of the above

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: From the moment we entered the hotel the friendlyness of the staff was evident. Anything that we needed was dealth with. Breakfast was fantastic with something for everyone. The staff at breakfast were so accommodating. I will be returning. The location of the hotel to everything was perfect.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights with room and breakfast. The hotel is well located very near to the main area of Times Square.The welcome that the staff gave us was warm and friendly. Our room was on the 23 floor and was modern with a high standard of cleanliness. Breakfast was included and was buffet style with every thing that you would need. There is a Grab and Go on the ground floor for coffee and snacks and a restaurant for dinner. Being British we would have liked tea and coffee making in the room even as an option. This did not spoil our stay. There is a health centre although we did not have time to use it. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Riu for 5 nights in November, delighted that we chose this fantastic hotel. Our room wasnt ready when we arrived but we were kept informed by the front desk,they went out of their way to ensure we had a room next to our friends.The room was on floor 6, clean,very comfortable,a great bed ! Lovely shower with toiletries,hairdryer too. Safety deposit box, iron,ironing board and fridge with bottled water included.No coffee making facilities but there is a coffee shop in the lobby and loads of coffee shops within a 5 min walk.Buffet breakfast,although noisy and chaotic was good value and there was a huge selection of food to suit every taste.The hotel is beautifully situated in Times Square, within walking distance of the Rockerfeller Centre and Bryant Park. We used Uber to get further afield and had no problems getting anywhere.Staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful throughout our stay, we loved the Riu Times Square and would recommend it to anyone staying in NY.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was a great hotel choice for a first time trip to New York. We arrived early and knowing we had traveled far the receptionist checked us in early without us even saying a word. All the bar and restaurant staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is chic and nice but the Front desk employees need training to learn to treat the client well. They have no tact and are not pleasant at all. the breakfast girls were extremely attentive 100/100.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here in November 2016 for my daughters Birthday. 4 of us.Very Clean and modern hotel, ideally located and the views from the room were fantastic, the higher the room the better.If I ever return to NYC I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Travelled as a couple in mid September..Room was just the right size for NYC. Spotlessly clean and a well equipped bathroom.The property itself was spotlessly clean and the staff were very friendly and could not do enough to help.The hotel is central to everything and literally turn left out of the door and thgree minutes later you are at the steps at Times Square.Situated on the edge of Hells Kitchen eat in this area as it is so much cheaper than Times Square.The hotel breakfast ensured a good start to the day.
