At times it can be busy but the staff have it managed well.Concierge are superb and can arrange cabs for you to the airport. The hotel has its own vehicles to transport you.##Massive thanks and will be back soon.
user_name:
Chop70
Ashton in Makerfield, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just back from 3 nights at Riu Times Square. Lovely hotel, really nice staff, great bar and so central (approx 5 min walk to Times Square). Rooms were small but not as tiny as others in Manhattan. Huge comfy bed, fridge, iron, hairdryer but no kettle or coffee machine. Huge shower but frosted glass enclosed bathroom so not ideal if you are not a couple????we included our breakfast so went all 3 mornings- just felt like a huge canteen and not the type of place you would sit around over a leisurely breakfast but you are in NYC so you are too busy anyway. Breakfast only gets a 2star from me- it was fine but 2 of 3 mornings Navan and eggs were cold and also everything tastes the same. Cappuccinos were ace though.About 8 min walk to port authority to catch bus to Jersey mills for shopping. Approx 10min walk to fifth avenue. I would definitely 100% stay here again but I’d skip the breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The room was so clean and enough space. I know it’s really rare in NYC. I could stay as my home during the stay. During my stay, elevator had an issue and stopped for a while. The announcement to notice guests was a bit surprised sounds and speed of speech. I felt it was not friendly to the non native English/Spanish speaker.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautyfull hotel in the middle of Manhattan! Everything is in walking distance!Very clean, modern rooms and for Manhattan size LARGE.We had the double twin room so 2 large beds and a nice and.neat bathroom with enough beauty products.The breakfast is crowded but wel managed. Quality of the food is good.Only compliments!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We just stayed 4 nights at this hotel. . Room is small but spotlessly clean and functional. Toiletries are provided. Nice big shower. No bath. Complimentary water in fridge. Breakfast is manic! Generally You have to queue but the staff move the line really quickly and we never waited more than 3-4 minutes. Great selection of food which is constantly replenished. Loads of fruit, cold meats, cereals, bread, cooked eggs, bacon, sausages etc etc, cakes fruit juices coffees teas - you name it, it’s there. Hotel is very close to Times Square. We found it a great base to do all the sights we wanted to see. Also we found the room very quiet in terms of noise from other guests. You can hear the traffic but this is true of any NY hotel in my opinion.Would def recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The rooms are small, but are perfect for 1 or 2 people. There's a fridge, which is good for snacks/beverages. The hotel also provides 2 bottles of water every other day. The breakfast buffet has a variety of fruit, coffee, pastries and hot items. Definitely recommended due to walking distance to nearly all Broadway theaters.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 7 nights for a family holiday in NYC.Hotel apparently relatively new, fixtures and fittings good quality and communal areas well appointed. Staff very friendly and helpful too.Check in/out could get quite busy at certain points, there appeared to be lots of groups arriving/leaving which seemed to give rise to the queues.Rooms are typical NYC, not huge, but cleverly you can store your luggage under the bed, which frees up a huge amount of space.There is a fridge in the room which is great to keep some snacks and drinks in. They do provide water every other day, but this seemed hit and miss and fell foul of my usual criticism of only putting 2 bottles in sometimes, despite there being 3 of us.Views from our room were fantastic (we could actually see Intrepid) and all the rooms are centred around a central lift shaft, meaning walks from lifts to rooms are not bad at all. Lifts can get very busy at peak times though.One point to note, for some reason, someone thought it was a good idea to put an opaque glass wall in the bathroom. It looks fantastic, but if you are travelling with a young child you can’t really use the bathroom lights once they are asleep, as it pretty much lit the room up like Blackpool. Same in middle of the night if someone needs the bathroom.... if this wasn’t the case, this would have been a 5 star property in our opinion.The hotel is in a brilliant location, close to Times Square and near enough to subway etc. Makes a great base to explore from, pretty central.One superb feature is the inclusive breakfast. It is similar to a standard all inclusive breakfast, lots of bacon, eggs, sausages, fruit, cereals etc. Also hot drinks and juice. A great way to fuel up for your adventures and saves a fortune based on NYC prices. It does get busy, they give you a guide to busy times, just be aware and don’t say you weren’t warned!!For any Brits, there is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, however, there is a Dunkin Donut across the street which did tea and coffee at a reasonable price and if you did the surveys each day you could get a free donut to go with it... half decent tea too!! Also a Duane Reade one block up, to stock up on snacks!The bars in the hotel, especially the courtyard bar, were nice and welcomed children. Reasonably priced too.Definitely a good find and would use it again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in a family room for 5 nights during late October.The Riu Plaza is a great hotel and up to the high standards of other, more typical, Riu beach hotels. The hotel is new and everything inside is clean and spotless.Rooms were relatively small, but as a city break, you do little other than sleep and shower in your room, so they're perfectly adequate.Breakfast was good, though pretty busy and noisy at times. Nothing too flash but plenty of variety for you to top up and sustain yourself before the day's activities.Reception does get really busy at times, particularly when people are booking in/out cases for storage with the concierge. As a result, you can wait a good 30 minutes to retrieve a case which is worth noting if you're in a rush to catch a flight.Good points - service, cleanliness, location, food.Improvement points - noise/space at breakfast, overcrowded reception.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic hotel we stayed a night before going on a cruise and another on our return. People very friendly and all areas very clean. You can get breakfast and they have a bar that you can get nibbles in the afternoon. Dinner is buffet style.
user_name:
sharon150830
Welwyn Garden City, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu is a nice hotel located on 46th st. & 8Th Ave. We stayed for one week. It was clean and had a comfortable King bed. Great shower, and closet. The grab & go coffee shop was very good to hit for Almond Croissants. Mayra is a great hostess in there. The elevators need your key card so the security is pretty good. The biggest MINUS was that there is no coffee maker or microwave in the room. Yes a fridge, no coffee maker. Breakfast is included downstairs and is excellent. The ceramic cups are nearly impossible to take up to a room. Plan ahead, bring a travel mug w LID. It is a few blocks from the Schubert if you are seeing to Kill a Mockingbird. All down 46th st to 9th Ave is restaurants. Choose your style. Walk to the Intrepid right down 46th. Times Sq. is 2 blocks away. Consider this hotel..

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Warm welcome with a smile and great attempt to say some words in swedish - appreciated. We got room perfectly on request = high floor and far away from elevator. Our daughter celebrated 15 y birthday and got a greeting from hotel and a nice small box with chocolate. Perfect room for family with 2 double beds AND a sofa bed. Very good for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Comfy beds.View from 28th floor was awesome!Breakfast with highlights such as fresh fruit, fried eggs and waffles. Muffins and great bread as well. Very good refill speed even though many people in lines. I strongly advise to go early in the morning.Overall a very pleasant stay. Safe surroundings even when entering late. This does not go for all hotels close by.Improvement potential: the resort fee of 43 USD extra should include bottled water all days - not only every second day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It makes a big difference when you travel for work to be able to sleep. I had assumed that when paying 690 dollars for two nights that the quality of the bed would meet certain standards. Truly horrible quality.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed three nights in this excellent hotel. Breakfast was included and you couldn’t have asked for more of a selection. Good sized room with all the facilities you could need. Centrally located but far enough away to be quiet at night, can not recommend it enough, helpful staff also. We would return that’s for sure.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: For the second time in this hotel, we stayed in a twin room that was perfectly equipped for the 5 of us, also had access to the executive lounge on the 26 floor, open 24/7 with some snacks, soft drinks, coffee and wine! The breakfast was OK, lot of choice in as well European as American style, but very crowded. Also Good WI-FI.Location is perfect to visit Manhattan, by foot or by subway. Lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood, close to Musicals , Central park and Time Square!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful hotel property - modern rooms with more space than most NYC hotel rooms we have seen. Perfect location close to Times Square, too many restaurants to count and subway system. Added bonus was the breakfast, which was included with the stay and top notch! Not your run of the mill continental breakfast....so many choices to leave you full and ready to hit the streets of NY! Just 1-2 blocks from Times Square and an area where you can feel safe walking all times of day/night. The Riu is definitely a hotel we will stay at the next time we are in NY!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a fab hotel! We have stayed at many Riu hotels and hold a gold members card. This is our first city break in a Riu hotel. Front of house staff were very friendly and check in was quick. Our room was on floor 28, with fabulous views. We had access to the Executive lounge which was great for the odd glass of wine and snacks if needed. Room was small, very clean with a good variety of toiletries. Fridge provided in the room, we were there for 5 days and received water twice. The hotel had 5 lifts which are generally quite fast apart from breakfast time when everyone wants the lift. Use of the lift needs your key card to operate. Breakfast was very busy every morning but staff managed to control this and get people a table real quick and tables cleared and cleaned very quickly. Breakfast choice was huge which included cereals, fruit, yoghurts, pastries and cooked breakfast items. Very nice breakfast. Staff within the restaurant were lovely too. It is quieter in the restaurant to take breakfast after 10am. The hotel is in an ideal location 4 mins from Times Square. It’s also near to the subway making trips out so easy. There is a food street vendor van just outside the hotel. I ate there once and it was good. We also ate in the hotel buffet for dinner $35pp one evening the food was good, we didn’t get to eat there again as there were so many places to eat in that area, you will never go hungry. If you go to NYC stay at the Riu Plaza New York you won’t be disappointed, would we stay there again? Oh yes definitely . Thank you Riu, great hotel & great service as always.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel for exploration of the city. Everything accessible on foot, hop off hop in buses or subway. Staff so welcoming and excellent. Rooms clean and comfortable - just what you want for city break. Great breakfast to set you up for a day’s exploration. Thoroughly rate the Moscow Mule and Mojitios! Thank you Riu Plaza. We will return!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Riu Plaza New York Times Square on 2 separate occasions. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff were helpful and always had a smile when you approached them. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza in early October for 3 nights.We arrived about two hours before the check in time but were given an upgrade and were able to go to our room straight away which was fantastic service. The staff are very friendly and welcoming.The hotel itself and room were very clean and modern. If I'm honest, the room was a little stark in terms of décor but that's just personal preference. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom a decent size with a good shower. The bathroom did have a frosted glass walls and sliding door but you couldn't see anything even with the light on. The corridors were very noisy at night but that is not really the hotels fault, just inconsiderate customers. My only issue was the mirror. There were no plugs next to the full length mirror and where the desk was positioned, there were plugs but no mirror despite there being space for one. I had to set up my makeup mirror on the bedside table and sit on the floor to do my hair.The breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of choice. We didn't wait very long to be seated and the service was great.The bellboys were brilliant ensuring we had transport to the airport on departure. The taxi did arrive about half an hour early so it was a bit of a rush to leave, but not the end of the world.The hotel is in a fantastic location, not far from Times Square or any of the transport links. Overall, I was very impressed with the hotel, its cleanliness and the fantastic staff. I would stay here again without doubt!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked seven nights. Not being too familiar with NY we wanted a central place to stay which includes breakfast. We received all these at RIU. It was practical for usbut too busy. Breakfast with lots of food but too noisy.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived on the 26th quite late having to stand in the Passport queue for nearly 2 hrs at JFK,so not a good start however hotel was fantastic,checked in tired so not really with it until we got to our room,it was a double and not a twin as booked ,so next morning spoke to the checking desk who apologised and sorted it with no problem,so all good from there on ,breakfast was included and I have to say excellent choice,only waited to be seated on one of our 4 mornings and then only 2 mins so again fantastic,staff everywhere ,from desk,bellboy,and bar could not be more accommodating and helpful,the location for our trip was the best,the only disappointment was when we left having booked a transfer through the concierge for 7pm,which never turned up,AND A VERY BIG THANKYOU HERE TO THE DOOR MAN AND BELLBOY WHO WERE VERY APOLOGETIC but it wasn’t them but the concierge (which we were told wasn’t part of the hotel)she came across unhelpful and not at all bothered and again thanks to the door staff she reluctantly gave us our money back,SO BE WARNED,I hope the manager sees this review as I asked to see him to make him awhere that her action tainted or trip and he needs to thank the door staff for dealing with the situation in such a professional manner,that minor issue will not stop me returning and recommending it to our friends and family,once again a BIG thankyou we had a fabulous time,Paul (70) and Kirsti (40)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here with my eight year old son for four nights. I chose it because of its location and I'm really pleased I did. It's extremely close to Time Square and good walking distance from Central Park, Hell's Kitchen, Chelsea etc. The room was very clean and comfortable, and a good size for New York. Breakfast was excellent, there was a great choice and it was great quality. Breakfast was busy but very well managed. Staff were friendly and helpful. There was some street noise which I think is to be expected as it's Times Square, but we slept really well. Recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having just returned from a 5 night stay at the Riu, this hotel has so many attributes which make it a great hotel to stay. Firstly, the location is ideal for Times Square, Hudsons Yard (New retail mall), theatres, subways and Broadway. After a very prompt and professional check in we found our room to be comfortable and well positioned with the facilities expected from a modern room.Also available was breakfast which was included in our price. The multiple dining rooms are very well laid out and staffed with a hearty breakfast available each morning with a good choice.The staff are very courteous and willing to assist on any request. We will definitely return again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just visited NYC and stayed at the Riu Plaza Times Square. Really excellent hotel located so close to Times Square and all buses for all the attractions. Hotel has 30 floors and we were on floor 22 which was lovely and high. Some rooms have a better view than others and though I had e-mailed in advance for a river view we had a street level view which actually proved to be fine. Hotel room was great and clean and modern with toiletries for use, not huge but fine for the two of us. Really good sound proofing and could not hear other guests in their rooms which is often the case. Breakfast was varied and plenty of options although quite busy with everyone getting ready for their days. Staff very polite and helpful at all times.I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great place to be located in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just come back from a 5 day stay in a Junior Suite at the RIU Plaza Times Square.Check in was quick and easy and were given a room on the 26th Floor with views towards Times Square, Room was a decent enough size and was nicely decorated and clean. There was a king size bed for us and a sofa bed for the kids. Bathroom was spacious with plenty of towels and toiletries.There is an executive lounge on the 26th floor which you are given access to if you have a suite, this gave free hot and cold drinks, snacks and wine throughout the day and was great to relax in after a day of walking around New York.We had breakfast included and while it was quite busy in the mornings, we were seated within a few minutes and there was plenty to choose from. It certainly set you up for the day ahead.Staff were all friendly and happy to help.Location was a great central location with Times Square, Central Park, Empire State Building, The Rockefeller Centre and shopping on 5th Avenue all within walking distance :)Nothing to complain about but if I was being really picky and had to find a fault.....I could have done with some firmer pillows.All in all a great place to stay while in New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at Rui Plaza Times Square, fantastic hotel, we arrived at our hotel just after 1pm they let us check in early as our room was ready. Top floor great views, room very clean plenty of storage, bed comfy, bathroom plenty of room complimentary toiletries, there is a frosted panel between the bedroom and bathroom but you can’t see anything. Lifts - most we waited was a few minutes and that was at breakfast time but quick lifts and can get quite a few people inStaff - everyone really friendly, nothing too much trouble Food - we only ate breakfast but was lovely plenty of choice, cereal, hot food, cold meats, cheeses, salads, buns gluten free section hot and cold drinksLocation- just on block away from the red steps of Times Square, Hell’s Kitchen round the corner and about 10min walk to the riverWe loved our stay here and definitely would book again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Super Clean! Check in was a breeze! Deluxe King is not as big as one would think. But we spent most of our time outside so was not a issue. The breakfast is pretty good! Food for all types of taste buds. Lobby is visually attractive & busy! We had one night cap in the bar, pricey! But it’s NEW YORK DARLING! The sliders are so tiny! But the French Fries were delicious & plentiful for two. Outside the doors of the RIU IS the AMAZING! TIMES SQUARE!! Baby! I had a ball! People watching! Being ignored by the real New Yorkers!! Smelling all the street food! Didn’t eat from the carts! Sensitive guts here! Almost tested fate a few times! Didn’t wanna spend my days on the porcelain throne! Although! The bathrooms are nice at the RIU. I came to see the City that doesn’t SLEEP! Went to Sylvia’s restaurant and the Shrine bar in both in Harlem. Shopped on Canal, walked through China Town. Took the train, but mostly LYFT was our transportation of choice! You STILL READING??? Book your room before it’s too late! Have fun!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Delux room with 2 double beds and shower room. Very comfortable beds and large shower. Great value and superb location , 100m to Times Square, we walked to Empire State, 20 mins and Central Park 25 mins.Breakfast included was brilliant with good choice of hot and cold food.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights last week and it was a beautiful hotel. We asked for a high floor room and we got the 23rd floor. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and bedding if you wished. The hotel is 5 minutes from Times Square. On arrival there was a card and a bottle of champagne for our anniversary which was a nice touch. My only negative of the room was the lack of mirror at the dressing table. There’s just a plain wall where there really should be a mirror.There was some noise but you are right on top of Times Square so what do you expect? The bed was comfy as were the pillows. Every morning we left a couple of dollars for the maid. I didn’t eat the breakfast but my husband did every morning and said it was very good and never waited long to be seated. We do plan on returning to New York and would stay at this hotel again. On checking out we had a few hours before leaving so the bell boys took our luggage to look after and called us a cab when we were ready to leave for the airport. An excellent hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just spent 6 nights (and a lot of money) here for my wife’s 50th birthday.Superb location to be fair. Perfect for exploring so I guess that is what we paid for but that’s it.Everything else was just OK - OK is not good enough for this amount of money. Rooms very small, staff very inattentive (some might say lazy) - despite being ‘tipped off’ they made little effort around my wife’s birthday. Bar expensive (buy alcohol at liquor store for 1/10th of the price). Finally DO NOT bother with breakfast. It is stressful and a kind of silly way to start your day. So many wonderful options VERY close to buy better. (Friedman’s) We passed on breakfast 3 mornings due to mediocre food quality and the b**s**t about not queuing at the lifts......you have got to experience this madness to believe it.....100% would not come back........Disappointed with you RIU.......

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: So pleased we chose this hotel, can't fault it in anyway, central location can walk to the Empire State Building, Rockfella and smack bang in the middle of Times square. Location is spot on. The breakfast is fab something for everyone food always hot and large selection. The staff are great all very helpful nothing is too much trouble. We were offered a free upgrade which was absolutely amazing. Our room was cleaned everyday and we had fantastic views. Would stay at this hotel time and time again. Cannot fault in anyway! Fantastic hotel and holiday,

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having stayed at Riu’s before I knew this hotel would be great. Riu hotels never let you down. Upon on arrival, all the staff were friendly and keen to help. The reception area was immaculate, lit up with the lovely classic Riu purple and pink lighting. Our room was on the 18th floor. Fabulous views. The room was smaller which I expected it to be staying in the city. The location is great. 7-8 minute walk to time square. I’m so glad breakfast was included as we found eating out extremely expensive. Breakfast was very busy but the staff had it all under control and was eager to get you seated as soon as possible. Always plenty to choose from at breakfast. Everything was very tasty and a brilliant variety. I would stay at this hotel over and over again. Special mention to the bell boys who were friendly and very assertive.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Staff were fantastic and couldn't have been more accommodating. The hotel was fantastically furnished and spotlessly clean. Food was excellent with an abundance of choice and the rooms were also clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights really clean nice hotel. rooms cleaned everyday. Breakfast the ques was so long to wait in the mornings seems there wasn't enough tablets for everyone. apart from the breakfast i can't fault the hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 6 nights in this hotel with an excellent location. 3 min. walk to Times Square, Broadway shows and 15 min. walk to central park. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are clean. The hotel is off course VERY busy. But it is New York, everybody is busy ;-) Breakfast is very nice with a wide range of different options. But again, expect a line to enter, at the buffet, at the coffee machine, at the juice dispenser etc. It is not possible to take airport transfer from the hotel ,if you travel with a child who is by law in NY obliged to sit in a car seat. Unless you bring it your self. If you order a private driver ( we did), you can ask for a child seat, and the concierge will try to find a driver who can bring a car seat.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for three nights and couldn’t fault a single thing.Modern bright hotel in a great location.The room was minimalistic but very clean and comfortable.The staff were great. Good breakfast included which was a plus.Would definitely stay again if in NY.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a fabulous hotel terrific position wonderful decor very obliging staff nothing too much trouble.What a find.Would not think twice about recommending this hotel to anyone Fab snack bar on the side and great cocktails in the bar

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights for my 40th birthday. The hotel is lovely, nice clean rooms, breakfast buffet had a decent range, the staff were lovely. Could have benefited from tea & coffee making facilities in the room but water bottles were refreshed every day.Only problem we had was waiting nearly 30 minutes to pick up our bag from the bellboy cupboard upon leaving for the airport, it was very busy, but we spoke to a lady working at the hotel to say our airport transfer had arrived and she arranged for the bag to be collected straight away. One warning about staying anywhere on Times Square is that the traffic and noise from cars outside never stops overnight - although this may apply for most of Manhattan!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I checked into the Riu Plaza on 24th September for 5 nights and had such an amazing stay. Our impression of this hotel was off to a great start before we had even arrived, as we had contacted them to request a room that was free of feathers due to allergies. Cinthia. B from customer services replied to our email with a very prompt and friendly reply and much to our relief informed us that the Riu Plaza only uses synthetic material in their bedding. We had a late flight on 25th September and a long wait at JFK security so we didn't arrive at the Riu Plaza until around 11:30pm. The lobby was sleek and stylish and very welcoming. It was almost 5am UK time, so we were both feeling extremely tired but the wonderful Eladio at the check in desk made the process a very swift and enjoyable one. We had an issue with our credit card (completely their fault and not the hotel) and Eladio was discreet and professional as we rectified the issue.Upon entering our room, we were pleasantly surprised to find that it was larger than we had anticipated, we had heard that rooms in NYC are notoriously tiny.Our room was modern, had a lovely shower room and was spotlessly clean. There was an ample sized wardrobe for our short stay, an iron and board, large tv and also a small fridge. It really did have everything we could need! Our room was located on the 15th floor and we weren't disturbed by any of the noisy hustle and bustle of the busy Manhattan streets. Housekeeping were very quiet as they made their way through the hallways in the mornings and they did a fantastic job of making up our room.Our check out was just as swift and smooth as our check in and the friendly bellhops kindly stored our luggage away as we had an 6 hour gap between check out and our transfer pick up.If we are ever lucky enough to return to New York, we will without a doubt be booking to stay here again as we just couldn't fault the location, staff and beautiful rooms.Thank you Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square for making our stay such a memorable one.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu Plaza is located deep in the heart of Tomes Square and the Theater District. Within walking distance of many Midtown attractions. Like many hotels in this area, the price is high. However, our room was clean and the employees were pleasant. Two on-site restaurants; one serves a breakfast buffet. Recommend.
user_name:
Mark A
San Antonio, United States

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: visited Hotel Riu for my 30th last month for a few nights. we had a long flight and it was late by the time we had got to the hotel, but the staff were lovely and welcoming and even wished me a happy birthday. check in was quick and easy with all the info given to us.we were fortunate to be nearly at the top floor so the views were incredible, you should definitely request it on booking. The hotel left me a little card and a little box of chocolates As a birthday gift, it just added that personal touch! Room was clean, had all the amenities, hot shower and plenty of towels and extra pillows etc.We had chosen to have breakfast, which i would recommend. staff we’re friendlyand attentive. very big selection of hot and cold food, absolutely no complaints. location is times square right in the hustle and bustle of the city.When i come back i’m 100% staying here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent six night in a family room and slept well all four The hotel is nice, clean and the housekeeping made a very great work, every day. It is very well situated and you reach Central Park Times Square Rockefeller Center with short walking distance I highly recommend this hotel if you visiting New York and we will come back here next time

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I send 5 customers there and hotel was overbooked,even they show prepaid voucher no help nothing from Manager, customers have to find their way to another place after long trip from France. Some say this is New York, I would say this is not a way to treat people. I will not promote hotel throughout 200 travel shops in France. KarimManager of Travel agency

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hospitality, facilities and food were fabulous. The rooms are spotless and efficient. The reset button the hairdryer was in an awkward area that I could not find. I called the front desk and in less than 5 minute a smiling and helpful gentleman was at my door. Jamil took our bags and was helpful with information during a very busy time. I am a southern girl raised in the art of hospitality and I was impressed with the staff at Riu. The breakfast buffet was wonderful as well. If you are ready for a New York adventure and wish to have a comfortable, clean, and relaxing place to stay....this is your place!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I cannot recommend this hotel enough.We stayed three nights midweek and from the moment we stepped out of cab we had been greeted by wonderful staff. Check-in and check out was great, and they were able to accommodate a late check out for us. Rooms were spotlessly clean, the staff were excellent and the location was perfect for times Square and based on restaurant row so no end of excellent choice for food. Breakfast was lovely, buffet style, couldn't fault the quality. It was my birthday while I was away, in the morning I was wished happy birthday by the staff (I hadn't told them or mentioned it) and then I was brought chocolates Not the cheapest hotel but great value for money. I also couldn't believe how quiet it was inside considering the hussle and noise outside.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are clean and modern with comfy beds and the higher up the better for the view. Wasn't sure what to expect for included breakfast but it was very good, although busy, with a good and slightly different hot and cold selection every day. We chose to eat in the buffet restaurant one evening and again the food selection was excellent, although there is a limited drinks menu. Over all we had a great experience with all staff being very helpful and the bonus of being able to leave our luggage in a secure location before and after check in. Would have liked tea and coffe making faciities in the room, although there is a very nice coffee shop on site.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Make sure you book online or get confirmation number over phone.Was charged over $500 for one night stay!! Quoted rate over phone $270 I gat to the hotel at 3am and was too tired to find another hotel. It was a nice hotel but definitely not worth $500+Because of this I will not be staying in any of the properties.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just got back from a 5 night stay at the Riu Plaza Hotel and were more than happy that had chosen this as our base for our first sight seeing trip to New York.The hotel was really modern and spotlessly clean from top to bottom, the rooms were bright and modern with large kingsize comfy beds.we had floor to ceiling windows on two sides with good views along 8th Ave & 46th Street, and could see the bright lights of Time Square only 1 block away.Although we had tickets for the Subway we chose to walk every day as everything that we wanted to see was not more than 20-30 minutes stroll away especially after a hearty buffet breakfast.Although one day we took the Taxi boat along the river to Battery Park where we explored the Downtown district, walked across the bridge to Brooklyn then caught the return boat back to Midtown in the afternoon, which also takes you past Liberty Island for a close look at the statue.Even the boat rides can be easily accessed from this hotel as the piers are just a 10 minute walk from the hotel at the end of 46th street.As i mentioned earlier we enjoyed a good breakfast every morning which was buffet style with plenty of choice on offer.You could also buy snacks and drinks from the Grab and Go counter if you fancied something to take away, or just sit out front in the sunshine as we did.I would definitley choose this hotel again when we visit New York next time, and would not hesitate to recomend it to any one looking for a good place to stay near to the main attractions.DW 01/10/19

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: come to New York once a year and this was my first time here.I do not recommend this location. Facilities are fine- but there are nicer hotels in the area for same cost. In particular the customer service is AWFUL! Joanne, a manager, who i noticed has come up several times (poorly) in reviews of the hotel needs to be retrained. I had unintentionally left my keys in the hotel room- and realized when i was returning home- which, i get it, totally my fault. But the experience i had because of the hotel made the situation much worse. First representatives at the hotel said to call back an hour later to speak to "cynthia" who when i called back, i was then informed she had left for the day (3:30p) and to call back in 15 minutes to speak to another manager. When i called back again (but a manager was not available) I was informed that the policy was that i had to arrange a pickup with fedex- that the hotel would not assist (which again, fine, but it could have been handled better). I sort it with fedex to pickup between a 2 hour time period, get my tracking number etc and call back and arrange for the hotel to print out the shipping label. The hotel representative ( which id spoken to about at least 4 different people at this point) first gave me an incorrect email- so I call back again (2.45 minutes have passed at this point), I forward the shipping label with a representative from the hotel on the phone to confirm it is received. The Hotel representative states that everything is all set.Next day i do not receive my keys and am informed by fedex that they went to the hotel and the shipping label was not provided and they could not pickup. This is just bad business, and on top of it, the people i spoke to were beyond rude. Leaving the keys behind was my error. But I did everything requested by the hotel, and after spending a lot of money to stay- I was incredibly insulted as to how i was treated and that some inept people left me in a really bad situation where i could not get into my car or home for 48 hours because they would not assist me. I called to speak to the manager Joanne hoping to make her aware of this error, and instead was met with aggression and a very unprofessional individual. When i was explaining the situation she yelled over me and said i would get the keys tomorrow. No apologies were given, instead she used a tone that a customer service personnel should never use. She either hates her job, is bad at it- or both.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Rooms are small but clean and beautifully decorated. Breakfast buffet was VERY good. Breakfast area was crowded and somewhat loud but it was organized and well managed by the staff. Reminded us of our stay at the Riu in Costa Rica, in a good way. Food was plentiful and delicious. Coffee machine was by far the best we have ever had in a hotel in the U.S. Our only complaint was the facilities fee that was added on at check in. We felt that this fee should be included in the rate. That being said, I might stay here again but I would take the additional $20 fee into account when comparing rates. Also, ask for a high floor with the west facing view if you want a beatiful view of the Hudson and NJ. We had an east facing view and watched traffic and another building across the street - not a complaint, would have preferred the Hudson view or a higher floor.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent 3nights here. Excellent hotel in centre of New York. Accommodation first class ,staff very helpful restaurant coped with many guests plenty of staff on duty. Great views from 27th floor night and day..

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at Riu for 4 nights and I was very impressed with the hotel. The staff are friendly, and the room provided was very spacious and comfortable.The location was perfect.Breakfast was included however as a vegetarian I wasn't really impressed by the veg selection.Apart from that I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying here in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: In the heart of the theatre district, this upscale hotel had nice bedding, the friendliest employees and I would not hesitate to stay here again. The pillows are bouncy and not to my liking so I’ll bring one from home. The included breakfast was pretty substantial and included many hot entrees. They even included mimosa on Friday. Close to subway.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As a couple on our first visit to NYC, this was the perfect hotel for our stay. Close to Times Square but far enough to avoid if you want. Walking to Devil’s Kitchen restaurants was a breeze as well as to the Theatre District. Breakfast buffet was excellent. The only issue I would caution is the shower. The walls are green glass and fully visible to anyone in the room. For families I would see this as a no go.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived via train from Boston to Penn station -easy journey and walked 8 blocks up to hotel from station. First impression is a modern imposing hotel in a bustling city - total contrast from Boston. Hotel receptionist was efficient but brusque and not very friendly. We had booked a deluxe room with breakfast and were surprised we had to pay additional taxes per night and $150 was “blocked” on our credit card. Room was large with 2 double beds and sofa - with large shower room, clean modern and comfortable. The surprising disappointment was no tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom - especially in a hotel of this calibre. Breakfast was included and buffet style - a bit canteen like and although food was freshly prepared ( for buffet style!) it wasn’t to a great standard. New York itself was as to be expected. The location of the hotel is excellent for majority of popular sites and we could walk everywhere. Just as well as we visited during the UN Convention and city roads were gridlocked. We were flying back from JFK and took the LIRR from Penn Station changing at Jamaica and picked up Airtrain to JFK - a 45 minute journey costing $25 for 2 people - so easy and so cheap ( comparison with $50 shuttle bus or $75+ by taxi) overall a comfortable hotel and would recommend for location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very clean, great staff! Very good stay at the Riu hotel in New York! Breakfast was included and the food was pretty good! Plenty of it, continental all you can eat!Close to pretty much everything, usual transport systems close by! Amazing views from the roomsWould deffo recommend and stay again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived and check in was smooth. Your room pass is also used for the lift. Our Room on floor 3 was internal and had no view. The room was good, for what we wanted, you get water in the fridge every other day. Breakfast was a good choice and you could fill up for the day if you wanted. The Hotel is a 5 min walk into Time Square. It does have a bar attached to it, but not cheap, quality of drinks is ok, but had better. I would return to this hotel, if I ever visited New York again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights.Room was clean.comfortable and spacious was on 18th Floor.Buffet Breakfast was ample but does get crowded we used to go about 10am as they close one of the other restaurants at 10.staff friendly.they do an evening buffet for $35 does not inc drinks or tax but did not try.the drinks bar is expensive a jim bean and glass of red wine $25 but this is not much more than you pay in the bars in New York.There was one morning noticed flies on the cold meat and salmon section which we told the resturant manager said he would deal with it.the next day the same was still open to flies this food in my opinion should be covered .but overall as mentioned food was ok which is good in New York no kettle etc in rooms plenty of toiletries hairdryer iron safe towels changed if needed and bedding no worries yes would go back here and would recommend

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just back from a stay at this hotel with a group of 7 friends - fantastic. Loved everything about this hotel - fab location, nice decor, great breakfast - buffet with hot and cold options and wide variety, fab location in the heart of Times Square, and staff all friendly. Very helpful Bell Boy who arranged our transfer back to airport. Also their hotel driver who dropped us off at an area we wanted to visit. We would all definetely choose this hotel if hopefully we have a return trip to New York - Thanks Riu Plaza

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location. I’ve stayed in a number of hotels in New York. This hotel is one of my favourites. Welcoming staff, clean rooms, and good breakfast. I will return again In the near future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: + friendly and welcoming staff, excellent and well organised breakfast, spotless room/bathroom hotel with excellent location (nearby Times Square with shops, metro, busses...)- room (7th floor) with some outdoor noise (traffic, airco)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: we stayed here for a nursing conference. great location. affordable cocktails in adjacent bar. room decent size for midtown and 2 people. staff friendly. coffee shop located on premises with affordable pricing

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights, breakfast inc, wow food was out of this world, catered very well. Room was beautiful and spacious. The hotel overall was beautiful, really clean and friendly, cool sitting areas & cafe attached.Arrived with lots of smiles all round from staff, could not find 1 fault with this hotel. Was amazing, high floor room, stunning views. Thank you Riu Plaza for our honeymoon holiday!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel was quiet yet in a great location. Room appeared clean though I assume it as dirty as all the other New York Hotels I have been in. A friend told me to put tv remote in plastic bag as soon as you arrive and use it through the bag. I think I am going to try it. Breakfast was great. Sitting in a comfy chair in the breakfast room with a cup of tea looking out on Times Square the most relaxing part of my day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I've just spent a week staying at the Riu Plaza Times Square and I can't think of a single complaint. We were only on the 3rd floor, but the windows are very good so you could hardly hear anything outside, besides horns... Which are incredibly loud in NYC and used with surprising regularity!! The breakfast is a buffet style which, as well as the usual American / English / continental options you'd expect, also rotates things like cheese and ham flat cakes, eggy bread etc. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, the rooms are smallish but perfectly serviceable. The showers are a good pressure with easy and consistent temperature control. Upon arrival (many hours late due to a cancelled flight) we couldn't unlock our suitcase padlock. I called down to reception at around 1:00am, and someone was in our room five minutes later with some very effective bolt-croppers! Throughout the week the staff have been polite, courteous and helpful. The hotel is immaculately clean throughout. On the one occasion that we had to wait around 3 minutes for a breakfast table, we were supplied champagne and orange and a comfy sofa! I thoroughly recommend Hotel Riu Plaza and thank then for a great stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We splurged with a two night stay based on breakfast reviews and cleanliness. The extensive breakfast buffet is labeled with many options for every diner as well as an enclosed gluten free muffin area. The buffet itself would be at least $50/couple elsewhere, so it is convenient to enjoy breakfast as you watch NYC stroll by. Our king room was very clean, modern, and comfortable for our needs. No street noise and quality bedding. I have tried to save a buck in NYC accommodations before, and I have been disappointed...so treat yourself! Many international patrons and I know Riu is a satisfying stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights hotel lovely clean friendly staff Duvough was an absolute star always helpful and gave us the easy routes to where we wanted to go the hotel is so central for everything you need Times Square is 5 min walk

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently stayed at the RIU plaza in New York, great location just a block from Times Square, hotel very clean and bright, rooms on the small side though not in them long ;) the wall between the bathroom and bedroom is opaque which is ok when you’re a couple but a little uncomfortable for our teenagers who were sharing all in all a great hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our stay at this hotel has been wonderful. All spaces and rooms very clean, very nice staff. The location is perfect ... we were able to walk to visit places of interest. I am really very happy to have chosen this place for my vacation. I recommend it to the entire New York traveler community!! :-)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. A great location and all the facilities you need for a great city break! . The staff are friendly and the rooms were clean with everything you need. Highly recommended

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We went for the tennis and site seeing. Subway near by and bars ans restaurants to suit all pockets the rooms are clean and staff helpful perfect location Broadway is round the corner you can get the q train to coney Island a must the 7 train to flushing meadows for the tennis empire state and world trade centre to.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had an amazing experience. Hotel is located on Times Square, great place. Everything is within walking distance. Hotel facilities are great, breakfast is lovely, rooms are cleaned daily, staff are very pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 2 wonderful nights at the Riu Plaza in Times Square in late August 2019. My wife and I were celebrating our 37th anniversary with 2 nights and two broadway shows. The hotel is a minimalist European hotel in every sense. Clean comfortable rooms, excellent staff and very good food, especially at breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who desires a first class stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very neat hotel, location couldn't have been better as you are just a couple of blocks away from Times Square, so it is close and yet not so crowded. Staff was very courteous. Got amazing price for NYC. Would surely stay again in future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel. It is in the perfect position for midtown and is a perfect location for sightseeing. Food was good and the rooms are well lit and spacious.You are literally 1 block away from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The service was excellent from the time we walked into the time we checked out. The Hotel Staff, Bellmen, Housekeeping was all superb!! Special shout to Sam who checked us in and made sure we had the room we wanted (great view)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a fabulous stay at the Riu Plaza in NYC. Staff were very helpful and hotel was beautiful. Having breakfast before we left the hotel was great and there was a large selection of food. Very centrally for all sight seeing in the city will definitely be returning to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for about a week in august. Its a nice central hotel, very close to times square and close to subway. Breakfast is very good with a lot of options. Rooms are quite small but bathroom feels nice. If we compare to european hotels, its not really a 5 star hotel, but its pretty good and would stay again. Staff is super nice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited with some friends and was expecting a good hotel within the Riu group. To start with the hotel does have some positives. The breakfast was excellent and fresh every morning, a great addition to the hotel. Ok now the issues we had. The room was nice and clean, however we were put on a floor with a group of school children. Now as a teacher I completely understand children can get excitable on a trip to NY. However we were kept up most of the night with doors banging from the running between rooms. They were shouting and clearly the staff had no control....from what I thought! We called security on a number of occasions but nothing changed. The next morning we went to speak to the manager. They would not come out to speak to us. Clearly not important enough or did not feel a customer with an issue was worth speaking to? After speaking to a receptionist I was shocked to find out that the school staff were 5 floors above the group of students? Why??? No answer. Just the way it was allocated......??? We had a number of nights like this and the hotel refused or could not be bothered resolving it. Not what I would have expected from a Riu hotel. This unfortunately spoiled our holiday as most nights we were kept awake and were tired the next day. I am sorry this could not have been resolved in a better way but again we asked to speak to the manager on checkout to give feedback but they would not speak to us, even when the receptionist went to their office to ask. So we left we left the hotel feeling we were not listed to or felt valued. We will not be returning to the hotel nore reccomend anybody to stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely clean hotel centrally located, a block from time square, 3 blocks from the bus station in the heart of all the theatres. Plenty of places to eat right in Hell’s Kitchen. Would recommend for everyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights for our silver wedding and it was a great hotel. It’s very central and new. Check in was quick and easy and we were given a room on the 25th floor with a Times Square view. Also waiting our room was a bottle of champagne which was great. The breakfast was good for setting you up for the day. It was a busy breakfast room but tables are cleared quickly with little waiting time. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a promt greeting we got when we entered the hotel. All staff were friendly ,swift with check in and helpful with maps etc.Room compact but clean and fresh looking.Breakfast was hot n cold buffet, plenty to choose from,with a Gluten free range of bread/cake.I used the gym while there, 3 treadmills ,2 bike, free weights so enough to keep you going.Overall great hotel, great location would definetly go back to the RUI.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a very nice stay and loved to go back to this hotel again.Thanks for your warm welcome and excellent service! The view from the room on the 30th floor was amazing. We loved the breakfast in de small breakfast room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: So I stayed in the riu plaza with my mum and cousin when we went to New York in January, it is such a gorgeous, clean hotel! The staff couldn’t have been anymore helpful, greeting us at the taxi, taking our luggage and bringing it to the room for us, greeting us every morning for breakfast and they where all very lovely, even giving out compliments to customers! Before arrival as it was our first stay in New York and we were celebrating a 21st birthday, we asked for a room with a good view and that’s what we got with the help of staff! So I would like to thank the staff at the riu plaza for making that possible! It’s alsi a great location literally about a 2 minute walk into Times Square and about 15 from Central Park! Brilliant! Will be staying here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: From the moment Virginia greeted us warmly at the reception desk, we enjoyed our stay. This is a new hotel that is bright and well-maintained. The room was small but the outer wall was all glass so there was an air of spaciousness. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was well-equipped with two excellent shower heads. The bathroom is separated from the room in the new European style of a sliding door, which doesn’t give complete privacy. Negatives: no coffeemaker in room; one of us hit his head twice on the metal edging above the bed. The breakfast buffet, included in our reservation, was like European hotels- very extensive with 3 types of eggs, 2 sausages, lox, cheeses, breads, many fresh ripe fruits, cereals, oatmeal, coffees- and delicious . We didn’t use the gym.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Been here now a couple of days. Check in was nice and easy. Rooms are ok . Hair dryer in the bathroom plus your normal toiletries. You get a fridge in your room . Breakfast is a great way to start the day. Plenty of choice on all fronts. Some days you might have a short wait but nothing to bad . All members of staff have been helpful and polite.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was great for a quick trip to NYC. Clean. Good full English breakfast plus plus. Fit 2 adults and 3 kids in room easy. Good bathroom and good views. Staff helpful and efficient. All in all very good and would recommend. Location fantastic. East side is quieter around the Waldorf (where we stayed last time). Little crazy this end but easier to get around. Good value

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: very good location you could see times square from your room. breakfast was great and delicious lots to choose from. the hotel is centrally located in Manhattan and could easily walk everywhere you wanted to go but we did take to taxi to pier 19 for our cruise to the statue of liberty. It is also a short walk to central park and trump tower. it is located on restaurant row so there is many places to eat as a matter of fact id say too many places to eat because it was really hard deciding where to go. the hotel was very nice but the rooms were really small but that's probly just normal for the area.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First impressions when we arrived were how big, bright and clean the hotel looked. Did not wait long at the check in desk-although it was busy! We had asked for a room high up and that's exactly what we got. The views are spectacular both day and night. In our room we had complementary champagne for our 30th Wedding anniversary- a lovely touch and thank you very much. The room is bright and clean. A large television and good storage for your clothes. The bed is large and comfortable. Others have reviewed the bathroom situation negatively, in particular regarding the frosted glass between the bathroom and the bedroom, but honestly that hasn't been an issue for us. The shower is good and there is a large shelf for storing all your bathroom essentials. Room service is brilliant and the rooms are cleaned to a high standard. Breakfast is very well organised. Staff acknowledge you immediately and if there is a queue don't let that put you off. The staff are very efficient and will locate seating within minutes. There is a large selection on offer. Full cooked breakfast, eggs any way you want them! Tea, coffee and juices, cereal, fruit and a selection of pastries all hot, fresh and delicious! Staff are very attentive and will collect used crockery etc very quickly so keep hold of what you are still using!Concierge are helpful and always available to help. We do not check out until the 30th August, but I wanted to review whilst we were still here! Rui Plaza well done we have loved it here, we would certainly recommend it to others and keep doing a great job!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just trying to check in after intercontinental flight with family of 4 and two Deluxe rooms. 2000 USD for four nights and rooms are not ready - upon complaint supervisor puts it lile it‘s our fault. Terrible service. Very disappointed.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent hotel, central location. Loved staying at this hotel the room was nice and clean. Staff very friendly. Couldn’t find any faults with this hotel. Lots of choices for breakfast and didn’t wait long for a table. I would definitely recommend a stay here

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely hated this hotel. Me and my mum came here for 10 days and the first day we got here, there was something wrong. We paid for a twin room and got one queen bed room and it took 3 days to sort out baring in mind I am 17 and no teenager wants to sleep with their mother. Secondly, the reception staff were so rude the whole time and extremely blunt and made it seem like it was our fault however when we got to the bottom of it, it was actually their fault and we received no apology! Thirdly, the stupid $40 to stay an extra couple of hours on the day we leave shouldn't be advertised as our flight wasn't until 11pm and we tried to book our room for the rest of the day but got told to shower in the gym. Lastly, I got hit on by a 50 year old doorman who gave me his number and repeatedly asked for my social media even though he knew how old I was. The only good thing I have to say about this place is the bellboys were amazing and made our time at the hotel wonderful and everything was so close to the hotel. Would recommend coming to New York, just not at this hotel which is extremely disappointing.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel as a family of five, just two nights. We couldn’t have been more pleased with it, the location was perfect, really central and easy to get to major attractions . The check in service was efficient, the staff all very friendly. It was clean and the house keeping service thorough. The evening buffet was delicious ($35) and the breakfast was plentiful with massive choice.A special shout out to the waiter Kenneth, he was so friendly and a delight to chat to. All in all a very good hotel and if you’ve booked you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing hotel in a great location. Breakfast was really good with lots of choice.We had breakfast at 8am and didn't have to queue. There were 4 of us(adults) who stayed here for 4 nights in one room, with my son sleeping on the sofa bed, which he said was very comfortable.We were on the 22nd floor and had an amazing view.Room was clean with a fridge and free bottled water every other day.The staff were very helpful and efficient.We would certainly stay here again.
user_name:
Ian and Susan B
North West England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights in room 2012. Great view from room shown in photo. Close to Times Square...say 5 mins walk to TKTS. Buffett breakfast each morning was ok. Wide choice. Quality of food items just ok. Hotel was clean and ride throughout.Nice modern bright rooms. Almost half the price paid for room at Hilton Times Square 3 weeks prior as part of a 3 week USA touring holiday. Much better value for money.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Prior to our visit we asked the hotel if it would be possible to have a room with a view, we where delighted to find our room on the 20th floor looking out over New York!The hotel room was spacious, clean, modern we received complimentary water every other day - the only down side I found to the room was our beds were two singles pushed together with a void in the middle.We attended breakfast ‪around 8:00‬ every morning, we found the restaurant busy however we only had to queue to get in on one visit. The buffet featured the usual bacon, sausage, egg, hash browns, but also featured american cereals such as  Fruit Loops, you would also find fresh pastry's and muffins. The location of the hotel is perfect, it is a 3 minute walk to Times Square and a 5 minute walk to the theater district however the hotel is situated away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square in a quieter street.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great place to stay in NY and it's not just because of its central location, right next to Times Square.Hotel staff is very service oriented and helpful.We had a problem with our room and they did everything in order to provide us a quick solution.The hotel and rooms are very clean and breakfast is amazing. The selection is very big, the best I had in my current trip in the US.It's not on the cheaper end of the scale but considering everything above - I highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were staying at another hotel and were extremely unhappy there. So we decided to move. We stopped in at the Hotel RIU Plaza and the first thing we noticed the lobby was clean and nice and bright. We spoke to the people at the front desk and they told us they had rooms available, but suggested we book on-line because it would be less expensive for us. We did exactly that and it could not have been easier. Because we booked last minute, the price was discounted. We moved into our room the next day and were so happy we made the move. The location of this hotel is at the beginning of restaurant row and right near Times Square. Because we were checking out of one hotel and checking into another, we asked if our bags could be held at the Riu, they were extremely pleasant and organized. We didn't wait more than a couple of minutes for our bags to be secured.The room was clean and had a wonderful shower with plenty of towels. The bed was extremely comfortable and the view from the window was very nice. We were placed on the 26th floor and had use of the "lounge" that offers complimentary drinks and small bites. Breakfast was included with our room. They told us it was a continental breakfast. It was a full buffet breakfast which was very good. I have no complaints about the food that was in the buffet.I am not sure about the parking situation because we had taken a bus into the city and didn't inquire about parking.When I return to NYC, I will be staying at the Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square! Great hotel, great location and great staff!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A great hotel with a great breakfast. Fabulous views of New York and in the middle of everything. I will definitely go there again. The staff were very helpful, the rooms with two nice size beds (2 adults 2 children age 15/12).
user_name:
leila f
East Sussex, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As members of Hilton Honors, we normally stay at Hiltons whenever we travel. However, this time we got a more upscale hotel in the Times Square area at a much better rate so we chose the Hotel Riu instead. Right in the theater district and walkable to everything. Beautiful rooms and unlimited buffet breakfast are included. Will stay here again on next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 10 nights in July/ Aug great hotel. Great looking hotel and great facilities. Breakfast was included with room price and what a breakfast, 3 going on 4 course. Although the hotel has over 600 rooms and it was very busy during our stay the longest we waited for a table at breakfast was 5 mins and only once or twice. Great buffet breakfast. As for location 4 mins walk to Times Square, 30 to madison square gardens, 20 mins to Central Park, location is excellent close to broadway to. Would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in New York. 10/10 for cleanliness to, and staff although we never got to speak to them to much as they extremely busy, when we had to they did, so all in all staff great.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is a lovely skyscraper with great and clean rooms; breakfast is a big buffet with many kinds of food, nice positions close to Dunkin’ Donuts, Pret a Manger and near some Starbucks, staff is very kind and careful.Recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: From the moment you enter the Riu Plaza New York you are made to feel very welcome. Each staff member you pass speaks to you. This is important to me. The reception area is beautiful and immaculately clean. Check in was quick and our room was on the 28th floor, we had requested a high floor. Upon entering the room we were taken aback. Beautiful and so clean. It was our 20th wedding anniversary and management had arranged a bottle of champagne on ice for us. Fabulous touch for such a special occasion. We had plenty of towels and toiletries. The fridge was replenished every 2nd day with water. Breakfast was included and was buffet. Each morning very pleasant staff greeted us and showed us to our table. Even at busy times we were not kept waiting. Great selection. We even had champagne and orange juice handed to us one morning. We were able to pay for 3 extra hours at checkout and after that time they would have looked after our cases if we required it. When our taxi arrived a lovely staff member(Chris I think)helped us with our luggage. He was very friendly and left a lasting impression. I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again and will be recommending it as its proximity to everything is great and its customer service 2nd to none.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a gem! Beautiful new facility; breakfast included was spectacular; room immaculate; hospitality and service great; price for Manhattan was terrific; location in the heart of theater district 1.5 blocks from times square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good hotel with friendly staff. Room was super clean and comfy. I arrived at noon and they let me check in and go to my room, which was awesome. It is not very far from Grand Central if you’re arriving by train you can walk 4 blocks to the hotel. Breakfast is included and was good, average hotel breakfast. It can be crowded depending on the time which is expected considering the size and location of the hotel. Overall I had a great experience and I recommend if you want to stay midtown.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The property itself is great whether, in terms of location, it's definitely one of the very best locations in midtown Manhattan. The neighborhood is lively but not inconveniently so and it's pretty close to everything. There's a good number of really good restaurants and coffee shops around. The building is pretty nice as well, it's in a great state of repair. Meanwhile, the front office staff are definitely the rudest I've dealt with in New York. By rude, I really mean "rude" not the direct and curt manner of New Yorkers. When I wrote this comment on Google Maps, the hotel's online reputation manager responded by a tirade of denials and used the term "lament" that it's not my impression that their staff is highly trained.I'll give a couple of a few examples that happened with me, on the second of my stay day I needed to inquire about something, I went down to the lobby and I saw a man named "Rashin", he was free and had no calls nor was he talking to any person. I greeted him "good morning" his response was not even verbal, he raised his index at me as in "shut up" or "wait" then went to the back talking with someone and after five minutes he returned just staring at me. My initial response was "I said good morning", then I asked my question.Another example was a customer service woman, she didn't have a name tag. She was handing over some packages to me, she was just being the most difficult and unhelpful.During my stay, I had a business partner staying at the hotel in another room and he also complained about the front office staff. I haven't read other comments regarding the attitude, however, it could be that my business partner and I were targeted because we're from the middle east.Meanwhile, the restaurant staff is just amazing and very courteous, they handle so many clients at the same time with the same polite efficiency. The breakfast itself is really good. As much as I enjoyed the location I don't think I can ever stay there again nor recommend it to Egyptians or Arabs in general.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My partner & I travelled from Australia to NYC, as part of a week long holiday for his 30th birthday. Our stay overall was pleasant & fun! Firstly the location is fantastic! Within walking distance of time square but not too close to the crazy ness/ hustle’n’bustle. The lobby is beautiful & has a lovely scent. The rooms are quite small, but for a couple over 2 nights was just fine. The hotel is modern, the decor is pretty & the room had everything you’d need for a short stay. There is small fridge for use, which was handy for drinks & fruit etc. Most hotel in NYC charge for a fridge, so this place was great with the fridge already included, as well as 2 bottles of water. We did have a small issue with our housekeeping, however this was handled well by Sarah at the Front Desk. She was efficient, pleasant & the matter was resolved. Buffet breakfast was included in our stay... it was satisfactory, with all the general options available. There were two restaurants which guests can choose to sit in during the breakfast hours. However one of the restaurants shuts an hour earlier than the other, a lot of guests didn’t seem to be aware of this. Perhaps it should be posted somewhere or have a little sign to advise breakfast goers. Overall a pleasant stay, fabulous location, clean rooms with a nice touch of colour. If I could give any advice to the hotel (especially if booked/noted in advance) it would be nice to acknowledge special occasions as this means a lot to the guest/s and is likely to be remembered when booking in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a good stay in this hotel. Rooms are clean, modern en comfortable. When you take a high floor, you get cool views and can even see the time square billboards. The bathroom had a walk-in shower and the floor is laminate. Our towels weren't always correctly changed. Once we even got no towels. I had to ask the reception 3 times to get new ones. They 'forgot' my request 2 times. Other than that, no complaints. The breakfast was good with plenty of choices. I liked the coffee (that's something I mostly don't like in hotels). I would recommend this hotel when you visit New York!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great place to stay, ideal location, very close to all the hustle and bustle of times square, comfortable rooms and a great buffet breakfast, friendly staff especially Edwin the bell boy who was very helpful and happy.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We love Riu hotels, this was very different to the usual but just as brilliant. Perfectly located, amazing food options for breakfast there really was something for everyone. Staff were friendly, helpful and all you could want. The hotel was clean, welcoming, the view from the rooms beautiful and i have nothing negative to say. I'd definitely recommend and return myself.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: OMG we had the most fantastic, wonderful stay at your hotel. The room was pristine, gorgeous and just overall beautiful. I have never seen anything like it. The staff was gracious, nice, and so willing to assist us in anyway they could. I believe they went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our time in NY. I will never stay in another hotel again. The Riu is my new favorite. I will tell all my family and friends to definitely try the Riu. Absolutely fantastic. By the way, the breakfast was good too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I arrived at the RIU on July 4th for a 4 night stay to celebrate my 40th birthday. The RIU was chosen by us as we’ve stayed in numerous RIU hotels around the world & love them.The Plaza did not disappoint.Check in was quick and easy. We had to give our credit card on check in where they “hold” $150. $52 (ish) was taken on check out for hotel tax & the rest refunded. We were given 2 room keys (cards) and headed up to floor 25. The room wasnt too small, infact it was great. We had a double bed,a wardrobe, a fridge, a desk and a wall mounted TV. Plenty of walk space around the room. There are no coffee making facilities in the rooms. There is a hair dryer mounted on the wall in the bathroom. An iron and ironing board. And a safe in the wardrobe.The bathroom was a reasonable size with a walk in shower, toilet and sink. Hand cream and soap were provided and also shampoo in the shower. It’s frosted glass separating the bathroom and the bedroom.The maid changed towels everyday, made the bed & re-stocked the fridge with water. The time of day varied when the maid came to the room from morning to late afternoon.The hotel is situated around 3 minutes walk from Time Square and around 15 min walk from the Empire State Building.Our board basis at the hotel was half board which was great as we found eating out to be expensive in NY, we knew we would be set up for the day eating breakfast. We never had to queue up and got seated straight away. It’s a standard RIU breakfast, which was good enough. Cereals, bacon, sausage, toast etc We had 1 evening meal in the plaza which was ok.
