To be honest I’d have been disappointed if we’d have had to have paid ($35 pp) if we weren’t half board.The lobby was immaculate and was a nice place to sit before heading out for the day or on arriving back from a day out.... We took advantage of the fashion bar “happy hour” ($8 cocktails instead of $14) a couple of times - it was lovely sitting in the little courtyard at the end of a busy day or sitting by the window just watching NY go by for an hour... The hotel staff are really nice & very friendly.Our flight home was late at night and because we wanted to sight see until last minute RIU allowed us to have our room until 3pm (we have a RIU gold card so got this for free, it’s usually $40) After 3pm that we left our luggage with the bellboys, you have until 11pm to collect it. My husband and I are returning to NYC next year for our second visit and have just booked the same hotel again......See you next year Riu Plaza :)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a new modern hotel , glass frontage, lovely lobby! Check in was quick and easy. There is a bar and snacks, tapas etc to one side of the lobby, and a cafe type area to the other side. There is also a bar in an open area to the rear of the lobby. The breakfast is included, and the dining area is just by the elevators, this does cause chaos, as breakfast is extremely busy, and you have to queue where people are also trying to queue for elevators! The breakfast is great, loads of choice, fresh and hot, but it is chaotic!!! And tables are very close together! But still worth the hassle!Our room was on the 12th floor, a superior queen, nice, bright, modern and spacious, large walk in shower, with glass walls! Can’t see through them though from the bedroom lol ! Fridge, iron, hairdryer, but no coffee making facilities!!! I assume this is because of the inclusive breakfast, would of given this hotel 5 stars , if this had been included, some people( my husband) like a hot drink before they get up ! Yes it’s noisy, but can only be expected in a major city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in March 2019. Choosing a hotel in New York is no easy task as there are hundreds of them. But we went for Riu for number of reasons really, you know Riu as quality and expect this to be carried through all locations. The Riu is also one of the few hotels to offer bed and breakfast. Also the daily tax is one of the lowest in New York at the Riu Plaza. We made the right choice anyway, the hotel was lovely, clean and modern if a little hot and stifling in the room at times. The staff really friendly and the location perfect. The Riu is a definite value for money, clean and comfortable bolt hole for you to stop off at, during your mad crazy non stop New York adventure

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in a family suite for 5 nights on a family holiday, there were 4 for us, 2 adults and 2 teens. It worked well having 2 separate sleeping areas and the bathroom situated in the lobby between, the lobby also had a small fridge that was useful to chill drinks and snacks.Hotel was in a great location, very central and easy to walk to many of the famous landmarks.We used the breakfast buffet every day, we didn’t have to wait at all and there was a good selection of food and drink. It was a bit chaotic at times and the tables are too close together making access difficult at some tables.As we were in a suite we had access to the Executive Lounge on floor 26 with free soft drinks, wine, snacks and pastries. This was a very nice addition to our stay and was nice to have a relaxing glass of wine before going out for dinner.We ate at the hotel one evening, if you purchase on the day it is $35 per person. Again it is buffet style and there was a reasonable selection of all courses, drinks are extra. I think whether you feel this is value for money depends on how much you eat, there were lots of restaurants nearby if you haven’t paid for half board on booking.We really enjoyed staying in the hotel my one negative is on the layout of the bathroom and toilet which doesn’t seem very well thought out. Given the suite can accommodate up to 6 it would be more sensible to have a sink in with the separate toilet rather than having 2 in the shower area - if someone is in the shower you cannot wash your hands, so if there is every any remodelling it would make this space far better.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 7 nights at the end of May this year and have to say that this was a very good hotel. It was our first time in NYC and we had searched online for ages before deciding to pick the Riu Plaza. One of the main things we had been impressed with on the online reviews was everyone mentioning how clean the hotel is. We were also pleased to hear that Breakfast was included for most bookings.On arrival at the hotel, check-in was efficient and friendly enough. The elevators are excellent and you rarely have to wait more than about 1 or 2 minutes, even at the busiest of times. The elevators are very secure as you have to use your room key to select your floor before it moves.The room was small and basic, but it was very clean and that was the important thing. We knew that rooms would be small as NYC is known for this. We had 2 double beds, a fridge, a small desk and a wall-mounted TV. Cupboard space was sufficient, but there were no dresser drawer units to store any clothes which did not require hanging. As a result of this we had to live out of our suitcases which fortunately fit under each bed (lots of dirt and dust under the beds by the way). There would have been enough space to put some drawer units in, either by the side of the beds or by the desk, so perhaps the design of the rooms could have been better in terms of making use of the space.The bathroom was small but modern, with a large shower unit but no bath-tub. There is a lot of counter space by the basin and under the basin which was useful for storing toiletries etc.Breakfast was generally good for us. It didn't matter what time in the morning you went there, it was always busy, but once again this was not a major issue as everyone seemed to get seated within a few minutes of arriving. The quality of the food at breakfast was pretty good. Cereals, fruits, yoghurt, hot drinks, hot cooked food, pastries, muffins and various other breakfast items were available. Things only really went downhill when you arrived at breakfast in the latter part of the sitting. Food stopped being replenished and you had to ask the staff if things could be refilled. Sometimes certain items (pastries and muffins mostly) would completely run out, so you did not have the full choice expected. Also, during the last hour of breakfast, as the restaurant is split into two sections, they would close one section which meant that the food choices were also impacted as both sides did not always have the same items. For example, only side of the restaurant would have Lucky Charms. The staff in the restaurant, particularly the bus-boys were friendly and always seemed to appreciate it when you thanked them, which is something most people did not seem to do. The hotel has a small business centre which allows you free access to PC's and a printer. This was useful for printing out our boarding passes for our flight home. Also the WiFi service throughout the hotel was very good, although we could only connect with 2 of our 3 devices for some reason.The location of the hotel was excellent. Lots of good eateries close by and it generally felt very safe and secure. It was an easy walk to various sights such as Times Square, the Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and Macys/Empire State. There are quite a few subway stations close by to choose from, so all in all we found this a very convenient location.Housekeeping was good in terms of the room being cleaned well. It was slightly irritating that we had to ask for our toiletries to be re-stocked as this seemed to be somewhat inconsistent. Also, the hotel seems to promote the idea of 2 bottles of water being provided every other day in your room. Well, a) if you have 3 people in the room, would it not be better to provide 3? b) the water was NEVER restocked and every other day I needed to go to reception and ask for the water which had not been provided as it should have been. Most of the time this was not a problem and the receptionist would go to the back office and bring out 2 bottles of water, but on one evening when I did this, the guy on reception seemed to be really reluctant to help. I virtually had to instruct him to go to the back where the other better receptionists had been to in order to get some water. This should not be a big deal and don't want to blow it out of proportion, but if the place advertises this feature then it should be provided. How much is a bottle of water, bought wholesale by these big companies??? And yet they seem reluctant to hold up their side of the deal!Anyway, we enjoyed our stay here and would hopefully return. The only issue may be the high prices which are charged. Our 7 night stay in May/June for a basic double room was around $3000. This may be a factor which causes us to try elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent hotel suited very close to Times Square within walking distance, it was very clean and staff couldn't help any more than they did.Food was great and Junior suites have some great views of the New York skyline.We will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in a Junior Suite on a B&B basis the room was fantastic house keeping was great . There was an excellent selection for breakfast every morning it was always busy but we were seated pretty much immediately every morning . All the staff were really helpful and friendly. The hotel is ideally situated in time square 2 blocks from the subway and within easy walking distance of the theatres and the great central park .I would recommend this hotel as a great base to explore New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very beautiful and nice hotel, friendly & cool staff.Very close to Times Square, if i come back to New York next time i will surely consider staying here again!Wonderful vacation in an amazing city with the most amazing people!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location..clean hotel and friendly staff...great breakfast which was included. Reasonable rates..close to Broadway and walking distance to variety of testaurants..easy can access..felt safe to walk around

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is an amazing hotel only one block from Times Square. Very clean well equipped room with free Wi-Fi that actually works in your room. Our room came with a complimentary buffet breakfast that included both hot and continental breakfast, that was of a very good standard. I would recommend this hotel as a base to visit the New York sites as it is close to the subway and bus routes.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I spent 4 nights here over the 4th of July holiday. This hotel keeps getting better and better. We had a room on the 26th floor with a balcony and fabulous views. We checked our babags for a few hours prior to checking in and they were so careful, even telling us to take a picture of the claim checks with our phone in case we lost the stubs. Great idea,Our package included breakfast and dinner. We felt the food and value was terrific. The location for the subway and Times Square was perfect. Lots of attractions were within easy waking distance.Planning on coming back next year!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Rio plaza in aug 2018 for 4 nights it was the best hotel the breakfast was brilliant rooms brilliant great view of the city. Location was spot on 5 mins to the red steps I can’t say enough about this hotel it’s so so good and will definitely be returning in 2020. Great holiday

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good NightThe service is awful, the staff are unfriendly, unhelpful and some even become arrogant.The food is lousy and with little variety, they are unable to heat a jar of baby food in the microwave, providing only a glass of lukewarm water (which obviously does not do much to warm up whatever it is).The cleanliness of the room seems to be limited to making the bed and changing towels. On one of the days, my baby soaked the quilt on the bed, removed it immediately and put it next to the towels to wash, the towels were taken and the (dirty) bedspread went back to bed. The next day, we returned to put it to wash but it was folded and left on the bedside table !!! And the shower base is also not washed daily!Given the late time of our flight and having a baby, we asked for late check-out the first day, the clerk informed us that we should request it the day before the check-out, when we were trying to do it, The employee who answered us said that we could only do it on the day of departure at 7am, having been extremely unfriendly and arrogant.We had great expectations regarding the hotel, both from the previous experience in Miami (very good!) And the location and room conditions (fantastic), but it was a let down too due to the staff, would not recommend at all!My room number is 8214.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved this hotel - great location a block from Times Square and all the action. Walk to Subways, Central Park, and right on the edge of Restaurant Row. You will want for nothing. Well-appointed if slightly small rooms - very similar to what Riu offers in its Caribbean hotels. Included breakfast was busy but moved fast. A great array of breakfast fare to start your day off right.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It is a beautiful hotel right in the middle of everything. The breakfast buffet was better than I expected. It was convenient and the staff was quite heplful. I am planning on visiting there again in the near future. I would recommend this hotel to friends

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A fantastic hotel close to Broadway and Times Square.We chose this hotel as previous stays at Riu hotels had been great and The Plaza didn’t disappoint.I had requested a high room and was delighted on check in find that we were on floor 27 of this 28 floor hotel.Check in at reception was effortless and the staff were informative, polite and accommodating.We stayed for 7 nights and found the breakfast buffet to be of a very high standard. We had to queue twice but for less than 2 minutes. It was not possible to tip staff as no one served us individually. We eat one evening in the buffet and it was great but there are so many other places really close.The bar has happy hour which is a lifesaver when you have walked around all day. The bar staff and management could not be more attentive, take me back for a mojito.The rooms are well equipped and very clean.Two staff who deserve special mention are Cristian and Davagn who were very helpful and were happy to answer any questions that we had about the area and places to go.The only negatives that I have are regarding the two ladies on Customer Services. We both found them to but curt... bordering on rude. They were unhelpful and dismissive. Such a shame as they let this fantastic hotel down. But remember to focus on all of the positives.I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat!!!!!My first trip to the USA and New York certainly won’t be my last and I will be returning to the Riu ❤️

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our experience from check in to check out was first class. Very close to Times Square. The hop on hop off Grayline Bus was just outside the hotel was a bonus. The evening dinner was good value for money at 35 USD each...couldn’t complain.....staff excellent as they were at Breakfast. Best value for money we have had since traveling from Boston!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having stayed at other Riu Hotels the expectation of quality and service was met. A visit to NYC isn't a normal 'holiday' but an experience. Staff at the hotel made sure your experience was enjoyed to the full. Our room on the 26th floor was modern, adequate, with a lovely large bed. Great views from the room and public area's on this level. Included - Safe, iron and board, TV, bathroom with shower that included gels etc., hairdryer and plenty of towels.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Enjoyed stay at Riu Plaza. Check in was smooth, and requested a "higher room". They met my request - with a smile. Room was comfortable, modern, and classy. Loved that it was with walking distance to theaters, so many restaurants, etc. Would stay again in a heartbeat!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A fabulous hotel located close to all attractions, theatre, museums, restaurants, ferries. Easy walking distance to Central Park and Soho. Hotel is clean, modern and very friendly staff. Breakfast is great, everything from oatmeal to bacon and eggs, fruit, buns and juice. Coffee is delicous.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Times Square was awesome as usual. This is my second time staying there and it is always so good. The staff is so accommodating and nice. The breakfast is superb, you will not get this value anywhere else in NYC!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location is amazing: either work (we visited exhibition centre) or fun (very close to Times Square). Everything is reachable on foot. However, the hotel.. The staff was friendly and helpful, but the room was the tiniest one I've ever seen: there was barely space for turning around.The food was.. sorry, but awful. We had HB, but went for dinner only once since the taste and the food was not the one I've expected. The hotel was fully booked, so during breakfast there were always queues (note: there are 2 places you can eat and when you enter the hotel, the space on your left was always more or less empty and no queues!)On the othet hand, the view from the room was amazing!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My room was very small but nice. Hotel is very clean. The room has a lot of white and for me was a little too bright and overwhelming. The bed was comfortable. The gym is nice and even with several people using it at once didn’t feel crowded. The location is a couple blocks from a Times Square which is nice to not be right on Times Square. The stay was nice but I would probably stay somewhere else next time as the room was very small for me and way too white.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel located at a prime spot for absolutely everywhere in Manhattan, it was on the doorstep of theatre land, only a block just a couple of minutes’ walk from Times Square and walking distance from 5th Avenue and all other midtown attractions.After a long trafficked filled drive from airport the check-in receptionist noticed how tired I was and rushed us through which I thought was sweet.We asked for our room to be changed for a higher floor which was agreed, but I thought it was strange that it was a designated ‘disabled room’ , we paid an additional $78 dollars, (Floor 21 2101). Not so cool.So from now my review is based upon my experience as an abled bodied person in a room designated for less abled bodied travellers.Bathroom was spacious with extra wide entrance doorAll lighting switches and plugs were lowWalk- in shower with a seat but after showering the floor became a massive puddle Mirrors in bathroom was high but there was a full length in the bedroomBathroom was spotlessly cleaned with a good supply of towelsBottled water in fridge but no tea/coffee making facilitiesBeds were high and comfortableSpace around the bedroom limited.Good WiFi access in roomFor breakfast the choice and quality were good but it was absolute chaos, too many people being chaperoned into the same space at the same time At the busiest times the breakfast queue formed across the lifts which then in turn impacted the other guests using the lifts … Chaos

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stay away from this Hotel, they are dishonests! We arrived at the Riu Plaza as the first stop on our honeymoon and because the room was not yet available we left our bags in their luggage storage and after a day in NY we returned in the evening to take possession of the room. But when they handed back our bags we realized that the handle of one of them was practically uprooted and dangling! The porter immediately admitted, apologizing, that the handle of the suitcase had broken when he lifted it. Once in the room we realized that the others also had damage. One was skinned and another was scratched and bruised. An unmistakable sign that they had been badly guarded.I immediately reported the incident to a manager, who assured me that he would make an investigation to understand what had happened and would let me know. The following day and the next one, however, I always spoke with a different person and they all replied that they would let me know also why they had to call insurance. After three nights I left this hotel but continued to solicit a response through my tour operator. Each time I was told that they still had to watch the footage of that morning's cameras (not even the NASA) despite the fact that I had communicated from the start date and time of my arrival at the hotel. After 10 days, impatient, I demanded an answer and here is the prank! They replied that from the images viewed (?) to them it would turn out that the handle and the wheel (what?) of the suitcase were already broken and even insinuating that of this the guest was aware at the time of delivery! As for the scratches there was no way to prove that they had been made there. All a staging to avoid compensating an actual damage caused by less than $ 100! I hope that this review will be read by as many people as possible and will create far greater harm to these unprofessional and dishonest people.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was fabulous. Clean, cool, timely with their room cleaning, and we had a great view of the city even though we didn’t request it. Great blackout drapes if you want to use them. Every time we walked in it felt like the noise and hubub of the area just faded behind us and everything became very quiet. Rooms were quiet too, even though we had people on both sides of us. Also, it’s a fantastic location, just a couple of blocks from both plays we were seeing, and right on Restaurant Row!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel Riu was not a cheap choice and we paid for breakfast to be included. The rooms weren't very big, the bathroom was nice although it was separated from the bedroom by frosted glass, which may not be to everyone's taste. The dining hall was extremely busy and one morning they told us we had to wait for the other members of our party before we could get a table. The food was OK, nothing to go mad about and after a few days, it became boring and we wondered whether we should have booked breakfast for six days rather than finding other places for breakfast. The staff were polite, the bell boys were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is a short walk from Time Square. We thought we had paid for the booking of the two rooms before we arrived but found that we had only reserved the rooms after giving a credit card; we then found that we were charged more due to taxes which we thought we had paid and a reception fee? Would recommend other people double check everything before they go as we booked through Booking.com only to find we did have hidden charges. The dining hall was very loud and chaotic and as so many tables were crammed in, this made it difficult to keep manouvering around to get to the buffet. There was another dining area which closed early so if you want a quieter dining experience, I would recommend setting your alarm to get there before they close. Outside was a food vendor who sold coffee as well, there were no facilities in the room for making coffee or tea, so if you are an early riser, you have to either find McDonalds or Starbucks or use the guy outside the front of the hotel for a coffee to wake you up as the restaurant and cafe does not open until 7am.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent hotel. Perfect location. Breakfast was brilliant. Enough to start your busy days. Loved it and will return. Amazing visit to New York. If you book transfers make sure you don't have a time limit as it can take hours getting through border control.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Family Theatre weekend stay in June 2019 - VERY convenient location/short walk to Mockingbird & Waitress shows. Hectic lobby with average Check In service (Unusual request for names/ birthdates of all guests). 27th Floor Room had sofa bed, great views and access to 26th Floor club (complimentary wine, soda) . Tub/ shower/ bathroom area is open to rest of room and shower glass enclosed = NO PRIVACY. Complementary Breakfast Buffet is convenient/expansive with "cafeteria style" service = No tipping/ drink assistance. Small Gym/fitness room. Good stay but will book elsewhere for better $500/night value and atmosphere.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this hotel whilst visiting NYC. Brilliantly located in Hells Kitchen a 5 min walk from Times Sq. Rooms were good sized and very clean, lobby welcoming and a nice place to take a breather from the madness outside. Good breakfast included, everything you could ask for to fuel up for the day. Could be busy but get up 30 mins earlier and it was far quieter. We were able to walk to good tube stations, Times Square in 5 mins and even the Pier if you wanted to in about 20 mins.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Near subway, stones throw from Time Square and all major shows. Short walk from river. Room very clean-great American large beds large step in shower, daily complementary water in room fridge. Breakfast large and adequate buffet. Charging stations in lobby and pleasant bar. In Hell's Kitchen vicinity with a variety of restaurants including Ethiopian! Lots of great bars to sit at with charging points so people could meet and work. We need that here. Complementary baggage store. Primarily location location location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just stayed here for 5 nights, a fantastic place to stay right in the heart of New York. A great central location which means everything is easy to get to. A warm welcome received when checking in, all hotel staff made you feel welcomed throughout the stay. As others have said breakfast is busy but staff are very quick to get you seated and no issues with any waiting. There was a large abundance of food on offer for breakfast which was great. Meant we could fill up for a day and not even need lunch sometimes! Room was very clean and tidy, with the bed made up everyday. Ideal for a city break. Overall a very pleasant stay and would highly recommend to anyone wanting a central location for a city break!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a very classy looking hotel with glass, chrome and modern decor. The lobby is large and there are comfy sofas along with a swish bar. Reception was manned by professional and welcoming staff. The doorman was very friendly and helpful when we needed to store our bags and call a taxi. We were on the 22nd floor which meant that the lifts were important. There were 5 and were really busy at times but we never had to wait more than a minute and they were really quick. The room was clean, bright and comfortable and had good air conditioning. Bottled water was provided in the fridge on alternate days.The bed was comfortable. There was little noise inside the hotel at night but the car horns could be heard from the busy street below throughout the night. The breakfast room was light and airy with views of the street and got very busy. The staff worked hard to ensure guests were seated as quickly as possible.The buffet was always busy but regularly replenished. Be aware that as with many hotels in the USA there is an additional resort fee to pay on checking in.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was one of the best hotel stays ever in New York. The staff was friendly and professional, especially Sarah! She assisted me with an unusual situation. It was clean &reasonably priced. FANTASTIC!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: So, we had the presidential suite for a few nights. You drop a good few K on this and you expect a bit of above and beyond. We received neither.Firstly, the location of this hotel is pretty cool. Just a couple mins walk to Times Square, and convenient to eat in Hell's Kitchen.Now the service. As above, this is the best room in the place sooooo ....1 Having to ask three times for slippers. A small point but please don't try to persuade we don't have the right to them2. Water. I mean, come on. We're paying thousands of dollars and you don't keep the promise to have a few bottles of water topped up? Even the sign says it's replenished every two days. We just bought our own.3. Special occasion. There were signs around the place saying how this hotel seeks to go beyond. So my GF mailed before arrival to request just a little recognition of my 50th. Nada. She even telephoned on top to request so it's not as if the e-mail went west.4. Oh, and the lie. So not a big deal but the bell hop swore blind the NYC taxi to JFK was metered and offered the house cab. I was convinced the fixed NYC <> JFK was fixed fare but didn't want to argue the point so just got the house cab. Upon my return I looked it up and surprise, surprise, I was right ... Please don't allow a customer to lose confidence in your establishment due to clear untruths.5. Breakfast. It's like a school canteen. Seriously. The food quality was particularly poor (for example, hard bacon, cold and extremely un-cool eggs).6. Ate in the bar first night and ordered some croquettas. Options for ham / whatever. Specifically stated several times NO chicken. After having eaten one ... you guessed it :-)7. The exec lounge. It's the funniest lounge. Teensy weensy.Anyhow, all minor points add up to bad juju. We stayed in many Riu hotels in Europe, and none as bad as this for overall service. Oh, and I mean many, many stays over the years. I truly hope our next visit to a Riu in Europe is aligned in terms of quality to this, i.e. hope it's an American thing as opposed to a chain.Still, on the plus side it's in a pretty cool location :->(BTW, we won't be staying again, so please no comments about next time we'll up our game, or give us a call to discuss. Lesson learned already.)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited with a friend for 5 night stay. Transport arranged from JFK to the hotel. Great hotel, next to Times Square. Double room nice and spacious and spotlessly clean.Breakfast buffet was great and the evening dinner buffet was amazing.This lovely hotel made our stay in New York a joy and we would highly recommend.
user_name:
June D
Lytham St Anne's, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I have just come back from five days in New York, where I stayed at the Riu Plaza. The hotel was very nice, the beds were very comfortable (I don't usually sleep too well when away) and the overall impression was positive. If possible, ask for a high room on the side overlooking the river, the view is spectacular. The only downside would be the food in the restaurant in the evening. It was a buffet for $35 which is good value, unfortunately I found the choices to be very limited. However, the hotel is situated on Restaurant Row and there are loads of good places to eat just outside the front door, so the hotel food wasn't really a problem. The hotel itself is in a prime position, only one block away from Times Square and the hustle and bustle that goes with it. If you fancy a show try the ticket office in Times Square and see what they have for that day - the tickets there are a great deal cheaper, so worth a look. From the hotel it took 15 minutes to walk to Central Park and about 25 minutes to walk down to to the piers where most of the boat tours go from. The one thing I would suggest is, don't forget your brolly or fold up rain mac - when it rains, it rains!!!!! The weather is also very humid. Have fun.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a short break. Check in was quick and efficient. I requested a high room for the views and was given a room on the 21st floor which was perfect. We travelled with our 14yr old daughter and stayed in a deluxe family room which was perfect size with two double beds. The frosted glass mentioned in earlier reviews is odd but we didn’t have the light on when showering and so it didn’t present any issues with privacy. We just worked around it. The breakfast was fab. Reception suggested we eat in the fusion restaurant rather the the main dining room which was much more relaxed. I don’t think this would be suitable for families with small children but was great for us with our teenage daughter. Main selling point for this hotel is location. We used the subway to get to lower Manhattan, walked upto Central Park which was not far. Covered every sight in the Times Square area and even took a stroll down to the pier to see the war ship Intrepid which was about 20mins away. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was amazing. Very clean, beautiful, amazing location close to everything and transportation. Less than 5 minute walk to most broadway shows. 5 elevators, which is super helpful at a busy elevator. The included breakfast might be the best buffet breakfast we have ever eaten.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We picked this hotel due to it being fairly new its location. It cant be faulted on either of those things. It was everything we expected and a lot more.We were on the 19th floor which gave an excellent view from our room window. Water was replaced in the fridge every day except for our last full day before we departed. For some reason it didnt happen, maybe a cost cutting thing.On a previous review someone mentioned about the shower door leaking, which also happened to us.The staff were extremely helpful especially Jose, who is a barman. Give this man a huge pay rise, he deserves it. He helped us out with lots of stuff including local information, tipping, and just a nice friendly guy.Downside was out your operator told us we could pay the local hotel tax with our TUI travel mastercard, which was incorrect. That was the only reason we had a travel card, but the cafe attached, which is also excellent, takes it.The hotel also got us a large black SUV to take us back to JFK for $75 including tip, as we did not want another yellow cab. This price was on a par if not cheaper, with Uber, so the hotel won.The breakfast food is plentiful but fails on presentation. I could not recognise the fried eggs as they seemed to go for bulk not style. Still tasted ok.We did not wait to be seated at any point in time.Buffet dinner at $35 each is well worth it as you could try as many dishes as you wanted, which we did.Overall, we would stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It was our first time in New York and we were very warmly welcomed. One of our suitcases was still in England and the staff on reception were very helpful with where we could buy essentials and liaised the airport to have the case delivered straight to the hotel for us. Our room was modern and very clean, with bottles of water in the little fridge. The breakfast covered all tastes. The bar had lovely cocktails with a bright outside area in the middle of the hotel. This hotel was perfectly situated for Broadway, Central Park, Times Square and all the great tourist attractions and of course the wonderful shops.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: If you want to visit NY you have only to stay in this wonderful Hotel!We was on 26TH floor and we had New York in our hands.Ospitality: 10Cleaning: 10Reception: 10Room: TOP 10In the heart of Times Square!!!Riu Plaza = What you need

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel on 8th avenue - so location is quite central to Times Square, Port Authority Bus Terminal. Room was ok. It had no tea service which was unfortunate and the mini bar was only stocked with water. I've stayed in RIU in Gran Canaria and Ocho Rios Jamaica and sadly NYC didn't really come up to those standards. Wouldn't rush back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I loved the hotel’s location near from Times Square, teathers, 5th Av, all the good stores, the Rockefeller Center, (everything by foot) a lot of subway stations nearby to go to any Museum or anywhere else in NY, the hotel itself is so comfortable, the people at the hotel is very nice and they tried to make you feel good, service is really good, rooms are really good! The space, the bathroom, they keep them clean, the view!! At least the one I had was really good!! (See the picture) the rate I got included breackfast which it was really good! The fruit fresh, a lot of kind o breads, te food in general for any kind of preferences and the quality of the food was really good too. I did had to ask for help a couple of times at the front desk and they always help me and the respo se was really good. I used too the concierge which was really helpfull tough a little bit slow but very nice people and they help me to get tickets for the bus thta goes to the outlet which is outrageous!! And I did get my ticket to the airport shuttle. When I go back to NYC I would definitely stay at the Riu Plaza NY Times Square I really love this hotel ❤️

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here in June for 4 nights as a couple.Pros- room size was considerably big for a New York City hotel- proximity to all tourist areas is excellent. Water taxi to battery park is a ten minute walk away- breakfast buffet included in price - amenities in room are excellent Cons - breakfast is always over crowded with large groups - rooms were not cleaned on request and we were given dirty bedding upon check in - you can here everything in the rooms, we stayed on the 11th floor away from the lifts and could hear them operate along with the rooms next door conversation

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We absolutely loved the rooms at this hotel! NO CARPET - which is always a plus in our books. Small but super clean, and very functional. The staff was helpful, and the outdoor bar was a nice touch. The breakfast buffet was very good. Location was perfect for a Broadway visit. No complaints at all. Very good stay and I would come back. -- also, the concept of putting you key in the on/off switch for electrical and lighting in the room was a great energy saver - great for the planet!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in room 325. I liked that room because it was really quiet. There are only 6 rooms on that part of the floor. The rooms were really clean but small. That’s okay because it is in NYC so we expect them to be small. You can have your car valet parked for $52 or find self parking. We opted for valet because getting to the hotel, we were so stressed from driving in the city, we just wanted to get out of our car. The hotel was reasonably priced for the city. Very close to walk to Times Square and to the show we saw (two blocks). The breakfast that comes with the room was blah. I think Europeans would like it because it’s a lot of croissants, bread, meats, pastry, fruit. Oatmeal, eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt. I’m not a big fan of buffets, so I didn’t eat too much. Coffee was good. Hotel staff was exceptionally nice. I would definitely stay here again in the price was right.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Gorgeous restaurant - not so great buffet. Lots of choices but overall "meh" as they say. A bit pricey and crowded with school groups. Pizza was cold. Soup tasteless. Carving station with no one actually carving.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for three nights and were extremely pleased with the location. We had a junior suite, worth paying extra for, which was on the 26th floor and had stunning views of the city. We booked full board to include the buffet in the evening. It wasn’t fine dining of course, but it did offer a very comprehensive choice of hot and cold dishes, starters, salads, desserts and cheese. The staff were friendly and gracious at all times. Breakfast offered a good choice too, the dining room was very crowded but very efficient and everyone seemed to get shown to a table very promptly. On our last day we had a late departure but the safely stowed our bags so that we could enjoy New York to the full on our last day and we could use the showers in the gym to freshen up. Thank you Thomas for arranging transportation to JFK with a lovely car and driver at a reasonable fixed price. A great hotel, I do hope that we will return

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having previously stayed in Hells Kitchen I would recommend this hotel purely for the perfect location. Easy access to times square, bus rides, subway etc. Staff friendly, rooms spotless and check in/ out quick and straightforward.I would definitely stay here again should I return to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved the location of this hotel. Breakfast was filling... lots of choice but the restaurant could get busy if you weren’t seated by 9am. However, we always got a table and didn’t wait long. The location is great... we walked all over the city and enjoyed being so central. I think we would stay again for this reason. Staff were helpful and the hotel was always clean. Thanks for a great stay... we’ll be back :-)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fabulous location, beautiful clean junior suite with access to the Executive Lounge and a delicious breakfast every morning. Staff couldn’t be more obliging and helpful.....highly recommend to anyone who enjoys a good quality hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I cannot fault the hotel in any way. I had a junior suite and it was very comfortable. The jacuzzi bath was excellent. The room was kept extremely clean and the food was fine, if not quite fine dining. My only reservation is: I booked the hotel well before my trip. It was expensive, but it was my first time in New York and I wasn’t about to quibble. However, a week after my booking the same room, at the same time, appeared at $400 cheaper! I did email the hotel and ask why this was, but the reply in no way addressed my query. The reply suggested the price of the room varied depending on the time of year I booked - not relevant to my query. So I suggest anyone considering booking takes care to look at the price over a couple of weeks prior to booking. My experience suggests it would be well worthwhile.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was the nicest hotel I've that I've ever stayed at. Fastastic room with a view, super tidy and well-staffed. The matresses were excellent, bathroom was impeccable and it felt like deluxe treatment all around. Gorgeous lobby and was great to have a bar on-site as well.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The cleanliness of the rooms was superior. The staff did an excellent job of cleaning the rooms and were detailed everyday in cleaning the rooms. The rooms are well designed and energy efficient. The use of your room card to turn on electricity is and excellent energy saver. The breakfast had a good amount of chooses. The only thing is that some of the food would run out.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Enjoyed a 5 night stay in New York with our 3 children. Location is spot on, a couple of blocks from Times Square with plenty of restaurants etc. nearby. Breakfast was always good. Busy but didn’t wait long for a table and a great choice of food available. We didn’t eat in the hotel other than breakfast. The room was very compact (2 doubles and a sofa bed) but we had seen photos and were expecting that. The problem was with the bathroom. The frosted glass wall meant you couldn’t have the light on in the bathroom or people in the room could clearly see you. Bigger issue was the toilet. We thought it would be separate to the bathroom but wasn’t. Worse the sliding door design left a significant gap, leaving you fully on show. This was a huge issue staying with family so we spoke to reception about it. Only option we were given was to book an extra room (at full price) so people could use the bathroom in privacy. Doubling our hotel bill was never going to be an option. Would have been a great stay but 5 mornings of showering in the dark and using the hotel restrooms took its toll.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very modern, rooms are spacious and extremely clean. All areas of hotel are clean. Arrived staff are wonderful and very helpful. Check in was quick, as usual had to pay a fee which upon check out was paid back within a day or two. Choice of two eateries within the hotel, breakfast was included and had a good choice. It's very busy but staff are quick at seating guests. We chose this hotel for its location, literally short walk to times Square. Would definitely recommend and would return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has a great position on Time Square. It is very modern nice bar and coffee shop. The rooms are small but it is New York they are well furnished good showers great views. The breakfast is ok a bit chaotic food average.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a 5 night stay, hotel is in an excellent position for all the sites and local restaurants. We booked an Executive Room which was smaller than I expected for the level booked but was kept very clean and had a balcony. Access to the Executive Lounge was also useful. Breakfast was a little disappointing, very busy, cold food, not many options.Customer service was excellent in all areas. I would return but would skip breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked two rooms, one for my mum and daughter and the other for my husband, son and I.The hotel was immaculate and the staff helpful.When we stayed, the hotel was fully booked and felt very busy especially in the restaurant area at breakfast. There were queues everyday and the room manic when getting breakfast. The staff in the restaurant worked tirelessly.The rooms were a good size with two double beds in each, fine for one person but a bit of a squeeze for two adults in one bed when you are used to a king size.There wasn’t much storage in the rooms apart from a wardrobe and a couple of small drawers. The bedroom also had no mirror over the dressing table so the bathroom was the only place to do make up and hair. There was full length mirror but the floor was too hard to sit down on for any length of time.The view from our 23rd floor room was great. You could still hear the buzz of New York but it didn’t affect your sleep.The hotel is a five minute walk from Times Square and centrally positioned for lots of attractions and restaurants.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We reserved a king size bed which was not available at check-in so we were given access to "The Lounge" which had free coffee, sandwiches, light snack and wine, colas and water. Located on the 26th floor with TV, couches, chairs and two table and chair sets, this became our daily end of the stop and an extra coffee to start our days. Staff is wonderful and the location could not be any better, near theaters, shopping and subway!! Buffet breakfast included!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We loved the location and decor of this hotel. The beds were very comfortable and it was fairly quiet considering we were inthe middle of the city. The room also had a refrigerator which was nice. They also offer a breakfast buffet. It was just fair. The hot items were inedible. I’m not sure how you screw up eggs/bacon/sausage but they did. Bagels were hard. Oatmeal barely warm. C’mon Riu you can do better!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights with the family: can’t fault it at all. Staff very friendly helpful, clean rooms and a very good breakfast if you book with one. This isn’t usual in NY hotels, but it’s very good. Don’t be put off by the breakfast queues - they go very quickly and the staff have it down to a fine art.The hotel is minutes walk from Times Square and 15 mins walk to Rockefeller Center so very good for walking. A 20 mins walk up 5th Avenue and you are in Central Park.Will definitely go there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel was lovely, had a great room with great views.Choose this hotel after reading other reviews.Was a special birthday for my wife whilst we were there, shame the hotel did acknowledge this, as it had done on the reviews we read before our visit.Reception staff rude.Concierge staff very helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights, visiting from the UK with 3 children aged 11 - 15. The positives first. The location is great. Short walk to Times Square or into Hell's Kitchen for restaurants. Contrary to many reviews we had good experiences with breakfast. Yes it is busy but we were soon seated and there was a wide choice of hot and cold food. Food was replenished quickly, so no issues there.The reason then for the low score is the room. We had a family room which is two doubles next to each other and a sofa bed. With the sofa bed down you can't access the fridge or desk. The big problem (and well documented) is the bathroom. The wall by the shower and toilet is frosted glass. With the light on it is a pure silhouette show. Even worse the sliding door has an almost 2 inch gap which results in people using the toilet being exposed (literally!). Fine if you are staying as a couple but with teenage children it literally became a nightmare.Genuinely don't know how you would cope in the room for storage in the winter given the coats etc.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our first time to New York and we had an amazing time. We arrived late evening and were immediately greeted by the bell boy who took our luggage through to reception for us.Check in was quick, all reception staff were friendly and helpful. We had emailed the hotel prior to arrival and asked for a room mid-floor and this was granted, we were given a room on the 15th floor with amazing views of the surrounding area.The rooms were a good size, we had a family room which comprised of 2 double beds and a lovely big shower. The beds were very comfy. We had breakfast included in our booking and the food was plentiful and very tasty. The hotel is ideally located, with everything on your doorstep,about 5 minutes walk from times square and all the many shops and restaurants. What a crazy place!We ate at the hotel one night and the food was very good. It costs $35 each, for the buffet,but the hotel offers all guests a 10% discount.  I would recommend a visit to the 'Carve' deli which is about a few minute walk from the hotel and sells the most amazing rolls,bagels and pastries!Overall we had a fantastic time in New York and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had the most unfortunate experience of staying in this hotel! They lack customer centricity completely in all that they do. 1. I had a problem with an extra day’ charge for one of the two rooms we had booked here. Well I don’t have so much a problem with the charge as that can be passed off as their internal policy and lack of customer centricity but the way their front desk and the so called manager on duty handled it was absolutely unprofessional 2. Firstly, when they talk to each other when handling customers, they talk in some lousy stupid language of their own just so that their customers don’t understand. That’s totally unacceptable in a city like NY where people from all over the world are expected to turn up as guests and they can’t show such disrespect to their customers. 3. I did show my angst by saying I want to meet someone senior as the manager couldn’t take any decisions and kept referring to someone on the phone for trivial things. This so called manager then used seemingly abusive words in her own lousy language - well I don’t know what she said but definitely from her mannerism, it appeared to be abusive. Definitely unacceptable for one to do that to a customer. 4. We wanted some bags to be kept at the concierge for a while which they refused to and said there is a nearby agency which does this and shared some #. The least they should do if they can’t handle it at the hotel is to facilitate this for clients rather than just giving some # and asking us to handle all by ourselves. Complete lack of customer empathy. It’s like “stay here if you like else get the F out of here” - that’s the attitude these folks show to their customers. I have been staying in at least 8 properties all across the US the last few weeks on vacation with my family and we had a pleasant one at every single place except at the RIU PLAZA. A definite NO to any family stay - unless you want to meet some totally hostile creatures in their front desk and spoil the mood. They don’t even have a customer feedback process - I would have preferred to share this feedback first with some responsible guys back at the management of this hotel so that they can look at some corrective action rather than share this on a public forum but they don’t have any such system of taking feedback. The best you can get to is their front desk folks who are not trained enough to handle customer issues. I will wait to see if anyone responsible from their senior management will reach out to me to take some constructive feedback.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here from the 16th May to 23rd May. We asked for a top floor room and wasn't disappointed we were on the 30th floor.Hotel was fab and we are looking to come back very soon. Fantastic location too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in an ideal location just a couple of blocks from Times Square in the Hells Kitchen area on 46th Street 8th Avenue with the subway at 42 Street so easy access for going downtown. We had a high room on the 30th floor with great views a good sized bed and walk in shower. The room is not huge but this is NYC and it was plenty big enough. Some comments have been critical of the breakfast being to busy but we had no problems and the selection of hot and cold food available was great to start the day off. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again the staff were very pleasant and they did happy hour cocktails in the bar between 4pm and 7pm so take advantage.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel, super clean and a great location for seeing the sights. Breakfast being included was a real bonus, everything was fresh and a great variety. Would definitely recommend staying at this hotel when visiting New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Clean, comfortable with friendly helpful staff and an excellent choice of food. Well located for time square, broadway theatres and subway. Bathroom and shower well equipped with hot water any time of the day. Free safe good sized safe in room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was ideally placed and could not fault the service or food. View from our room was ok which would be my only comment as I have not seen any views from other rooms. All the main areas for Theatre etc are with in walking distance including the Subways.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I am so happy I chose to stay at your lovely establishment. Your customer services was the best and my room was extremely comfortable and relaxing. I especially enjoyed that breakfast was included in the package! I have nothing but kind things to say about my experience. Thank you for your hospitality!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved the hotel, food, helpful staff, however housekeeping could use a supervisor. Ever day we had to call down and ask them to bring the water that was suppose to be left in our room. We also had to ask for clean drinking glasses every day. I had heard that this could be a problem and it was. Very frustrating when you are paying $445.00 a night,and we stayed 5 nights. Plan to let my travel agent know

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Overall good location. Times Square and two different subway stations really close. Walgreens and loads of food places.Before we got to the hotel, we had requested for a room in a higher floor as the reviews here suggested so (lot of noise). They kindly responded that our request was considered and when we got to the hotel they had already arranged this - so, this bit was positive. Nice breakfast, also. Problem was that when the cleaners were on duty, they were talking really loud in the corridors, knocking on the doors nervously and fast, while obviously the doors' soundproofing wasn't able to hold off all this noise when you just want to rest and relax. Also, we got charged $30 for 5 local calls which is something we still try to resolve with them.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a four day NYC break staying at Riu Plaza Hotel. The Hotel is in a perfect location, two minutes from Times Square. We chose this hotel because of its location and also because breakfast was offered as part of the package. Breakfast was buffet style, plenty of choice, and well organized. The staff worked hard to ensure tables were cleared quickly and everything topped up. No complaints whatsoever. This set us up for the busy day ahead and we did not bother about lunch, only a coffee and cake mid afternoon. The hotel also offered a Theatre Buffet in the evening costing $35 per person with a 10% discount if you were resident in the hotel. We decided to take advantage of this and are so glad we did, it was excellent with plenty of choice and the menu changed every night. Our room on the 8th floor was comfortable with king size bed, small fridge with bottled water which was replenished every 2nd day. The bathroom had a great shower with towels replaced every day and lovely toiletries provided. The only downside was the glass partition between bedroom and bathroom. When the light was turned on in the bathroom it lit up the whole room, not ideal for someone sleeping or for privacy in the bathroom. Also there was a sliding door with quite a large gap which again did not make for privacy. Staff throughout the hotel were helpful and polite and hardworking. This hotel was perfect for our requirements and we would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for seven nights during our break to NYC from the UK. We stayed on the 20th floor in a double room which was plenty for a weeks stay of long days out exploring. The room was small, however plenty for what you require on a city break. There was a safe and hairdryer in the room, brilliant as my UK one didn't work. Plenty of plugs and a mini fridge of which was empty but you could obviously fill with anything you required. We opted for bed and breakfast which was ideal as it set you up for the day. Despite breakfast being and seeming extremely busy, you were always quickly seated and food was plentiful. Varied selection, not masses but anyone could find something to eat in the mixture. Location wise: this hotel is brilliant!!! one block away from Times Square and hells kitchen. We found that we walked most places from here (if you're up for it) and equally it had good connections to the subway; uptown and downtown.Not much more to say other than it was perfect for a city break hotel. Our only suggestion which we put to the hotel was that it would have been great to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room. This was not available in our room and we would have welcomed this either first thing in the morning or when you get back at night.TIP: do not rely on the fact that you have the option to keep your room on. We had a late evening flight and was planning on keeping our room on. You have to go down to reception on the day of departure and ask. When we did so we were told there was no availability. As a result we left our bags with the concierge and used the gym showers to freshen up prior to leaving. On review, this was equally as good as paying extra to keep your room on.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We wanted somewhere central and this place is great. Traffic is sooo slow here. It took 45 minutes to do 0.8 miles. You can walk from here to most theatres to Broadway to Flat iron to Grand Central to Top of the rock. And yes to Times Square.Rooms are small for a Riu but big for New York. Great elevator. Breakfast is a rush. But go outside and you realise it’s not bad. You can eat anything here. It’s all plus tax plus 20% tip. Don’t stop if people outside ask you your name. They’ll want 20 dollars for nothing. Just don’t stop. This hotel is great and the staff are fantastic. Made my wife a espresso martini. NewYork drivers are on their horns all day and night.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was so nice and clean, and in a great location to all the Broadway theaters and Times Square.Beds were very comfortable, rooms a decent size for New York standards.The breakfast was very good, and included in the price of your room or it was $20.Would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights from 10 May 2019 and stayed in Deluxe Rooms with multiple beds. Rooms we're neat and good housekeeping. Size a bit tight . Bathrooms are nice but have a frosted glass wall ... Maybe a problem with some people. Also the bathroom door is sliding .. which leaves a one inch gap making it a bit uncomfortable for some people .The breakfast is decent spread ... But the breakfast room is like a canteen . Does not seem like a 4 star hotel . Location ... Is very good. Just stroll down a block to Times Square. And loads of restaurants in the lane itself and within a few blocks. All in all a decent hotel .. but not a 4 star property . Staff is very curt . Also it seems the hotel caters to Spanish speaking clientele. Most of the housekeeping staff can't understand English ... Very surprising in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Brilliant clean well positioned hotel with the most comfortable beds. Breakfast included was excellent especially the pancake guy. Pleasant helpful staff. Shower was tip top. Will happily recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is located in the heart of the city, within walking distance of many attractions. The price-quality ratio for New York is very good. The windows of our room overlooked the courtyard, no noise. Next time will stay at this hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Check is was easy. Our room was on the 30th floor which had some great views. Room was clean, the shower was great. Not the biggest room but we were only using it to sleep in. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great, although we got up early so we could use the smaller, quieter restaurant.Soundproofing was also great. Quiet room considering the chaos going on out on the street below.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived back in England today after a 5 night stay. One of the best hotels I’ve stayed in - from front of house advisors, to bell boys, to cleaners, everything was absolutely spectacular! We are so glad we chose you guys! Breakfast every morning was good, plenty of choice and variety. Rooms very modern and pristine. Helpful and very friendly staff. Big shout to Devaun (sorry if name spelt wrong) for being so lovely and genuine throughout our stay - will miss you!!! Next time we visit New York we would book up with this hotel in a heartbeat! Thanks again team.
user_name:
Brooke W
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was a bucket list trip for me and the 2nd time for my friend. Booked online via the British Airways website. Everything went perfectly apart from a contaminated water issue on the plane which resulted in no coffee or tea for 7 hours. also we were unable to purchase anything on the plane as there were no shopping magazines. Arrived a JFK but it took a further 3 hours to make it to the hotel due to security and waiting for transfers. When we arrived the doorman helped us with our baggage and the checkin process was smooth. You do have to leave a retainer for room tax, this can be done on a card or cash.We were on the top floor of one block..floor 28 and the room overlooked times square. Even tho we were on the top floor you could still here the endless traffic. Im glad we werent any lower. My friend and I had booked a king size deluxe room which was perfect for our needs. The rooms have everything you could want apart from tea and coffee facilities. If you like a hot drink when you get up then take a small kettle. There is a small coffee shop downstairs where you can purchase drinks and snacks from. The foyer is very modern and there is always people coming and going. The bar opens at 4pm with happy hour. Beware the cocktails they are potent......the strawberry mojito was my fave. This hotel provides breakfast and this was the main resason for choosing it. When you first visit it dont be put off by how busy it looks the staff are well trained in dealing with this. We never waited more than a few minutes to be seated and the choice is excellent. No its not 5star cuisine but it doesnt matter. It fills you up before you venture out to explore New York. The hotel is close to Times Square and most things are within walking distance but if you struggle a little bit then get a cab. Look for the illuminated lights on top of the cab this tells you if they are available or Uber is a big thing in NYC so get the app and uber away. They are cheaper and readily available. If want to book trips look outside for the guys and girls in the red jackets they are your sellers or your concierge in the hotel will be able to help you. Check out was painless but the return tranfser was horrendous. 2.5 hours and was nearly late. Be aware Fridays at 4pm is rush hour to the max. Enjoy New York and enjoy this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is nearby times squere and service is excelent. Alse breakfast is what you shouls expert from a riu hotel. Also rooms an bathroom are vers good. My sugestion is to boom room high as possible. Also late check-out was no problem

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a wannabe hotel. I will never stay with this brand again. Although it has “Times Square” in its name, it’s not in Times Square. We had a room for three adults. The two queen beds were pushed together because they had to be. There was a sofa bed that when opened, caused you to be unable to open the refrigerator or sit at the desk. The bathroom was the worst. The door was a glass sliding barn door that had a two-three inch gap through which anyone could look in and see the commode. The wall was glass as well and so whoever was in the shower put on a shadow dance exhibit for anyone in the bedroom. Apparently a room nearby was being remodeled as it was quite noisy. I had to get new keys everyday because they quit working on the elevators and the room. I’ve stayed at Hampton Inns that we’re far better than this “luxury” hotel. I do not recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fabulous hotel, in the perfect location.....just one block behind Times Square. The hotel is fairly new, very large and very clean. We had a twin bedded room on the 4th floor, which was larger than I was expecting, very modern, clean and well equipped. Breakfast was included in our deal, which was a huge benefit, especially as due to jet lag we were up most mornings very early. Whilst we did have to queue most mornings, it was a fast moving queue and the short wait was worth it. There was plenty of choice and the coffee in particular was very good.I would have given 5 stars, however, the service by the front desk and the concierge was very impersonal/uninterested (not what I have previously experienced when staying in New York) I guess this is because it is so large. However, it would not stop me staying there again, or recommend it to friends wanting to spend time in New York sight seeing.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently stayed at the Rui Hotel NY , I emailed in advance and requested rooms high and together ( there were 4 of us altogether) On arrival we were advised that we had been allocated excellent rooms on floor 25 next to eachother however these would not be ready until check in time of 3pm , they could offer is rooms immediately but these would be on floor 4. We decided to wait until later and left our bags with the bell boys and went off on our adventures.Our rooms were ready upon our return and we could not fault them , clean , big enough for our needs and the view amazing. All bathroom complimentary goods were adequate for our stay. The water bottles In the room were a nice touch but a shame these were not replaced daily ( these were only replaced every 2 days )The hotel was clean , breakfast although busy didn't take too long to be seated and the staff were friendly and food plenty of choice for all .The location of this hotel is perfect and staff on main reception happy to guide you The only negatives of this hotel are they are no tea / coffee facilities in the rooms and at $3 plus tax a shot from hotel café was a downside each morning having to get dressed to get one ( this was not open late at night but we used the van outside instead)The other major let-down of this amazing hotel was their bar. We found the staff rude , ignorant and to try and settle a tab would become hard work each night. We also found we purchased drinks one night then were told they were closing after buying drinks but we could not take glasses out of bar - so why did they serve us!!! Huge downside to hotel which I would say is the only thing the management need to review, they were so bad we stopped having our night cap their.. This aside, I would defo return to this hotel ( hopefully bar staff be happier by then) as all other aspects were over and above my needs . Well once they refund my cc they have held as paid the room tax in cash, but I am sure they will do this in next few days

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has update decor, comfortable beds, a nice breakfast buffet and a great location on 8th Ave and a main subway line so access to transit is close by. The coffee shop has good coffee and nice pastry.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here in April and found the hotel clean comfortable and ideally situated for exploring all the sights and surrounding areas. The breakfasts were very good with ample choices and would cater for all tastes. The staff were friendly and helpful and always very polite. There is good access to transport and walking distance to the centre of Times Square. Would highly recommend the Riu Plazza for a short city break and will definitely use it again if back in New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The 4 of us really enjoyed our stay here. Super location in a quieter part of Times Square. The hotel is furnished to a high standard, the reception is quite impressive. The rooms are comfortable and well sound proofed. The breakfast restaurant was busy, but that could not be helped as everyone is trying to start off early for their day of sightseeing. Lovely buffet breakfast, something there for everyone. It didn't bother us if eggs were not perfect, who cares in such a great destination. The staff are friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just forget it. Mass tourism, small rooms, unfriendly staff, horrible canteen for breakfast etc.At breakfast you are allocated a table, if you are lucky it’s clean and you are not bothering others to sit down. Then you need to stand up and get everything yourself, not only the food but plates, cutlery, cups, etc. The only thing the staff puts on the table for you are paper mats. Then it is very noisy, it is a mass event.The food is really bad. For example they fry dozens of eggs, put them all together in a large heat plate. Then you must try to get one out without smashing many other fried eggs...Really incredible, I’ve not seen something like that before.We had a family room, which under normal circumstances I would consider ok for 2 people, albeit narrow. They cram 4 people in there, and there is not enough space for luggage and cupboards. I don’t know where they got the 4 stars from, but I checked a couple of other hotels nearby with less stars, they are really much better and more stylish. This is a hotel I surely will never go back to.As stated in the heading, the location is good. That’s it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Staying at this Hotel in Newyork brings you NO HEARDACKES at all.From the location to the service everything is Magical. A plus is the breakfast in "riu Style". The room is immaculate and perfect with great views. Jesus, reservations Manager was a treat! Please if you are reading this review do no waste your time and stay at thos Hotel. I have lived in New York for 3 years visiting over 20 Hotels and the price x service x satisfaction from this one is just simply 100%.Tahnk you.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel, great breakfast buffet. Very close to amenities and the subway. Staff at check in was a little rude about my Canadian driver's lisence when I presented it for ID saying it was worthless in this country as ID

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel Riu Plaza is a perfect place to stay when visiting Times Square. It is conveniently located in the theater district.The hotel is clean, beautiful and inviting. All of the staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is delicious and plentiful. The dinner buffet looks great although we ere not able to try it.
user_name:
mikey8642
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: If you're use to a Riu hotel in the Caribbean or other vacation country. This is not it. I'm not sure who is rating this hotel in a positive way. Have they not stayed in nice hotels ?I wanted to qualify this review. I have an issue with the hotel itself. I have made a complaint with Riu about them charging me a premium rate of about $150 per night over the regular rate for a standard room. Head office referred me to the hotel. Just be very careful if you ever book a room.When checking out, I did watch a European couple get their reservation denied because the hotel had lost it. Some people have all the luck. The front desk staff. When I checked in with my kid they photocopied his passport. and mine. I don't even think that's legal. Also watched as one of them walked passed us sneakily taking a picture using his cell phone. Unbelievable. In spanish, Familia ??? Si Si .I immediately felt horrified in a gut wrenching kinda way. How could I have chosen such a horrible hotel. Do they normally charge by the hour ??? Who exactly are their regular clientele ???? I'm assuming "working" girls or worse. I felt sick. It's absolutely disgusting but all the other hotels were booked. Enough of that. The hotel itself, Aesthetically it's beautiful on the outside. It ends there.Things of note: 1: The rooms themselves require a key card to keep the power on. A quaint reminder of vacations to third world countries. 2: The floors in the rooms are ultra low cost floating plastic faux bleached wood. The kind that get spaces between them that you can close by slamming your shoe against them to snap them back together. 3: No pool4: You will love their breakfast. Not as high class as Ikea but close. At Ikea the staff smile and you can have individual tables. Very Stalin esqe in a CCCP group camp kinda way. 5: Location. I stayed with my kid. Which was really awkward when we walked out for a day in time square past the strip club next door. The hallways are about as wide as you would expect on a low budget cruise ship. Other than that. Its a hotel. So if all your looking for is a cot and a pillow, your good to go. Oh they do have a nice view. Alternatives. We ended up staying at the Hilton Time Square for the remainder of that trip. Another time my wife and I stayed at the Marriott Marquis. Both much better value.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent Hotel in a truly wonderful location. Perfect base for exploring this fabulous City. The staff are very helpful and always willing to offer assistance. The rooms are lovely and very clean with comfortable beds. The breakfast is superb and offers a huge range of food to suit all tastes and dietary requirements. You wil not be disappointed if you book this gem of a NYC Hotel. We will definitely be back to stay and will also recommend to friends and family. Thank you Rui Plaza staff for a brilliant 4 night holiday at your beautiful hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: From the minute we arrived everyone was so friendly..our room was big! We had 2 double beds. Was spacious(for New York) and so clean!
