The rooms were cleaned daily, the breakfast was great massive variety!! Was a stone throw away from Times Square but far enough that we weren’t bothered by any sort of noise! Couldn’t fault this hotel. Such good value for money & perfect location would defo recommend

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great time inNew York thanks also to the Hotel.The locayion is perfect near few tube's stationsJust far enough from Times SquareRooms very clean... but a bit too small.Great breakfast... only bad point: too many peaople; I felt back to school ;-)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel. Room slightly small for 4 adults and could have done with a bit more storage space. The glass wall between the bedroom and the bathroom would have been better as a normal wall for privacy. Apart from that the room was really nice

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here in April 2019 for 4 nights with my daughter. Breakfast good if a bit crowded - however didn’t have to wait long and food plentiful. Great views if you can get a window seat!Helpful staff, nice room, no noise (19th floor so added view was a bonus). Central to everything - bring excellent walking shoes - our feet ached!Can’t fault Riu Plaza - would definitely recommend. Thanks for a great holiday!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed with my family and we all loved it, great food and location. Room was clean and tidy, consider this hotel for your next stay in New York City. Attractions nearby, right in the center of the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel was nice and modern. Room was okay size but not much space for storing cases. Only a few downsides, location is good to be close to times Square but can get noisy throughout the night. The shower/bathroom is frosted glass and unfortunately when up in the middle of the night the bathroom light is very bright and lights up the full bedroom area. If you are a light sleeper this hotel may be an issue.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a good hotel in a great location. Breakfast was very busy but well organised. Evening meals (buffet) were disappointing as the food was often lukewarm. Be warned on the bathrooms in the rooms as they are frosted glass but easily remedied by leaving the bathroom light off, not ideal with a family and a minor point for what is otherwise a good hotel with friendly service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: No negatives other than lack of tea and coffee in the room. Great location, friendly staff, lovely breakfast and nice clean rooms - really enjoyable. Location particularly is great, you are right in the centre of it all!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Ok lets start with the one negative that made it 4.5 rather than 5 and that's breakfast. Whilst plentiful was bland and No variety so after a few days got bit fed up and we were here for 7 nights. However can eat as much as want and whilst bland is edible. One morning was a queue but longest have to wait is 10 minutes but most days no more than couple minutes.However rest hotel was excellent. We did experience any rude staff quite contrary everyone we spoke to was polite and helpful. We experienced staff on reception and customer services all of which were helpful. However the best staff were in the fashion bar so engaging and helpful that we ended up popping in most nights and occasional afternoon to relax. Also for hotel bar very reasonably pricedRooms are large enough you only there to sleep and are very clean cleaned daily. Little fridge handy we brought drinks and snacks from grab and go and left in fridgeWe had buffet one evening which was very nice and only 35 dollars plus if buy through customer services get 10% discountExcellent location. On restaurant row so plenty varied choice for dinner. Minute from times square and heart of theatre district.Would stay here again and would highly recommend

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic location , rooms pretty small but it is New York and they were very clean and topped up with bottled water in the fridge daily.Breakfast was great and saved us a lot of money we pretty much filled up on breakfast in the morning then had Dinner early evening.Staff were friendly and efficient Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel was very centrally located, extremely clean and nice decor. It was a little expensive, but seemed a better deal than a lot of the hotels once you had factored in their "resort fees". Like others have mentioned, they should just include it in the advertised price. More of an annoyance being added on after, especially when it's only in the $13-$14 range. Breakfast was excellent, and service was spot on. We were on the 11th floor, so street noise was a nuisance, but not that you couldn't sleep. Wished there were ice machines, but having the mini fridge was a bonus. I didn't realize the bottles of water were complimentary until after I had purchased our own. We had no issues with the elevators. Putting the key card in for lights is not a big deal, and I didn't love the fact that you could see the reflection from the shower, but it's not like you'd have strangers in your room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very rude staff (especially the reception and the breakfast ones), room very tiny, not so clean. Breakfast quite good, but in a very noisy room.Excellent location, if you'd like to stay very close to Times Square and Broadway.Highly suggested the room on the top level (as all the area is very noisy).

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well situated about 5 mins from Times Square, lovely clean rooms, pleasant helpful staff. Easy access to restaurants, theatres, and all tourist areas. The hotel offers breakfast - which is excellent and also offers a really good buffet dinner (good value for money)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I have just returned from a weeks stay. There was 4 of us 2 adults, 1 teenager and a 9 year old.. We booked a half board package and this made the trip feel cheaper as we did not have to worry about food in the evening. Breakfast was good with lots of options from a cereals, bacon, pastries etc. The evening meal was varied each night and hot but really was not top notch. Do not be put off by this as the food is good but not great. The room was small for the 4 of us but this did not cause any issue as we were only there to sleep. The hotel is about 5-7 mins walk from Time Square. Would I stay again? Yes. I have now stayed at 4 Riu hotels around the world and would defiantly stay there again. Well done to the staff as they were always friendly and very professional.
user_name:
Adam F
Wisbech, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I enjoyed staying at Riu plaza New York. The room was nicely decorated and modern and very clean. I had a view over Hells kitchen area and I could see 8th Avenue from the window and the Hudson River. The shower had good water pressure and I was lucky in the floor with few access to the self serve bar and snack room with views towards times square. The location was perfect! Only a short walk to the Broadway shows and times square. And the subway stations were easily found. It was a very busy hotel. The breakfast restaurants were huge and very very busy. But this is normal for NYC. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and will come back to Riu Plaza again! Thank you everyone for running such a great establishment!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As others say it's a excellent hotel, very clean, service was good, buffet breakfast a real bonus, never really queued long but would only use the smaller restaurant.Emailed ahead and was given as asked for a top room on 29th floor, daughter given chocs and card on her birthday, nice touch.Location superb near everything.Go to juniors and have the milkshake cheesecake combo unreal !Will be back if we visit again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived in the afternoon, and check in was speedy and easy, given the WiFi code and all necessities were explained, e.g bar area, breakfast times and process.We got the lift up to our floor, (remember to put the room key in the slot, or you go nowhere!) on entering the room, it was immaculate, great space and very clean and tidy.Bathroom excellent and a fridge with water stocked in there daily.The breakfast process can lead to ques back near the lifts, but this is quick to get through, and the food is good, vast choice of all types...... we had a large breakfast for the days sight seeing ahead.Hotel was very busy in the reception area, but the rooms were quiet and you very rarely heard noise from outside (where the city never sleeps) or the corridors/other rooms.I would recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay there again should I return to NYC.
user_name:
MarcusO685
Sutton in Ashfield, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Only had a one night stay but was perfect for our requirements. Friendly and helpful service in a very pleasant environment. Location of hotel was perfect for central New York and very close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location in central Manhattan. Very clean, crisp rooms, suitable amenities (gym, breakfast buffet), and lightning-fast elevator to upper floors. This hotel is particularly accommodating for Spanish-speaking guests.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 5 days here beginning of April the hotel is fab so central, walking distance to just about anywhere worth going to. The room was a bit small for a family room for 3 adults but fine for the short time we stayed there although on arrival we were informed the room had a connecting door it was locked both sides so we thought that would be fine but regretted this on day 2 when the family next door arrived we could hear every word they said, they had a toddler and she pulled on the connecting door at all hours and cried & laughed and talked at the top of her voice along with her parents they were very loud mostly at 6 am, never again, my adivce would be do not accept a room with a connecting door I wish they had informed us that the noise would travel when they offered this room to us it honestly felt as though we were all sitting in the same room.Breakfast was fabulous, varied and plentiful just what we needed to start our day. I would most certainly return to this hotel, minus the connecting door.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Can’t recommend this hotel enough! Location is perfect being so close to Times Square just a couple of minutes walk away. Hotel is surrounded by some good bars and decent places to eat. The breakfast in the hotel was very good, buffet style with a big choice on offer and all food was always being topped up so always fresh, hot and tasted good. The room we stayed in was a very good size and was larger than I had expected and was very modern and spotlessly clean (had daily housekeeping), bed was huge and comfy, we had a good nights sleep every night. The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming at check in and check out and was always smiling and said hello when we walked passed. The hotel bar was very good as well and staff in here were very friendly as well. The hotel overall has a modern and clean feel to it and we couldn’t fault it in anyway. Have stayed in other riu hotels around the world and always found them to be top quality and this Hotel was no exception. When we come back to New York I will be booking this hotel. I can’t recommend this place enough, excellent value for money! Don’t look anywhere else!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights. Great hotel fantastic location 5 min walk to Times Square, close to Broadway , Rockefeller Centre. Good sized comfortable rooms. Great views. Breakfast was included in our deal. Cold buffet , fruit etc plus eggs bacon sausages etc. Very clean , nice staff, nice hotel bar. Definitely recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very convenient, new hotel with good service. One block away from Times Square. Has a good breakfast buffet. Clean rooms. Gorgeous views, especially on 30th floor. Friendly personnel, willing to help.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location is hard to beat, just a few steps from time square, broadway, Madison square garden and all the main attractions of manhattan, very good breakfast, quiet enough in the evenings if you want it to be.The bar opening hours were a little sparse, but being in the part of town it is, that's hardly a problem..If we return to new york, we'll happily stay here again..Thanks

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely, bright, clean hotel. Excellent breakfast choice. Perfect location for getting around in easy walking distance of a lot of anything that you would want to visit whilst staying in New York. Located one block away from Times Square or turn right out of the hotel and you are in Hells Kitchen

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was in a great location, right around the corner from Times Square. Great view of Hudson River from hotel room. Bus tour right across the road from hotel - we got bus tour tickets and the Statue of Liberty boat tour was included as was the night tour which was amazing. Breakfast was great. Unfortunately, the hotel had us booked in for the following week (we booked with British Airways) they had not changed the booking in their system. We arrived quite late at night so having to wait longer was not impressive. We just wanted to check in and have a shower. There is no tea facilities (for all the Brits) in the room. We were celebrating special birthday (mum 60 and sister 40) I had asked for something special and we got a box of four small chocolates (maybe i'm a nit picky and expected more??) Staff very friendly and hotel was clean. I would stay again, hopefully with no checking in problems.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It was a nice hotel, nice staff. Lovely finish to the room and the location is fantastic. I have breakfast included in my stay however didnt make it to breakfast as was out earlier than it started. I arrived much earlier than the check in time however they were able to put me in a room which i was most grateful for. Check out is at 12 and they have a great bellboy service which was again much appreciated. Some parts of the room could be tidied up a bit - for example the power ports on the walls in my room were silver but all scratched off and showing white where the plug goes in. Also the metal had scratched off the plug hole in the sink and there was a large crack in the shower flooring. The rooms are cold and the air conditioning was around a corner in my room so i didnt notice it until a few nights in. There was however extra blankets in the wardrobe which was good. The sleeping pillows are very large and i sleep with quite a flat pillow, there is no alternative so i had to use a pillowcase and put it on one of the sofa pillows to sleep.Its great for location but i think based on the price of what you get i dont think i'd book here again if was visiting the city, there are more competitive locations where you compromise on space however get things like wifi, usb ports around the room placed in useable locations and neater furniture and fixings. WIFI is not included within the price of the room. I paid $20 for 3 days and then a further $10 for 1 extra day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a great stay at this clean, comfortable, central hotel. Was not actually in Times Square so address slightly misleading but it was only one block away and therefore less crowded on pavements when coming and going. Would definitely stay again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really nice hotel, staff very friendly rooms very clean the elevators are well maintained and quickly between floors. The only downside from a personal point of view is the $250 security, which I fully understand but I think this should be confirmed beforehand as during my stay I saw a few people who were unaware of this just to save embarrassment

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I visited with a friend for five nights at the end of March. We were on the 15th floor and even there the Traffic noise could be heard. There seems to be an obsession with horn tooting here !! Despite emailing the hotel, our noughty birthdays were not acknowledged .The Hotel was perfect, spotlessly clean and modern. Rooms quite small but we were not in them for long. The luggage fitted under the beds which was great. Beds comfy. Ideal location and just 5 minutes from Times Square. Breakfast was really good, and food choices were always full , perhaps not at the end of the breakfast service though. It was busy at around 8.30am but we did not have to wait for long. We went in the bar one evening and a G&T was classed as a cocktail and was $18 !! We had wine !! But we found that to be the case everywhere. There are no Tea and Coffee making facilities , but there is a Pret across the road, so we would buy a hot drink on the way back in the evening , rock and roll !! They booked us a taxi back to JFK for 5.15am and advised us what time we would need to be picked up. He was on time, the Taxi was clean and the driver felt safe , unlike the Yellow Taxi we caught when we arrived , who drove like a Formula one driver !! We would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location only 1 block from the bright lights of Times Square. Very modern hotel with amazing views from our 20th floor room.The breakfasts set us up for busy days shopping and sightseeing and as the hotel is in midtown most places were within walking distance.Wifi worked very well in the room, great for catching up with family and social media.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very modern and kept clean, considering the size and foot flow. The breakfast included was surprisingly very good. It kept my children happy, with a good variety of fresh food, which was always replenished and of good quality. The hotel is in great location and within walking distance to many of the sights which is a bonus , but because of the central location, it was very busy around the area, and travelling with 3 children, didn’t always feel safe amongst the busy and sometimes unruly characters and crowds around. We were in a family room on the top floor which fit the whole family. The room wasn’t overly spacious, but was fine for the 4 days we were there. Travelling with the family, I would have liked more privacy when showering , as the bathroom was separated with a frosted glass wall. The housekeeping was very good, and our rooms were cleaned regularly. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very very busy hotel - but efficiently managed so there was no problem. We were on the 14th floor and the lifts were fast and large. Two enormous comfortable beds - spare blanket and pillows in the cupboard, thankfully, as it was not hot. It was sad that there were no tea or coffeemaking facilities - that would have been much appreciated. There was a fridge with water bottles which were replenished every other day. Large bathroom with walk-in shower and more towels than one could ever need. The breakfasts were quite wonderful - porridge was on the menu plus eggs, bacon and sausages - all the usual plus fruits, pancakes - one could eat as much as one liked and it was a fantastic start to the day. Great coffee. All the time helpful staff hovered to clear tables and refill dishes.The location was perfect for Times Square - and for the subway network.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights with family and could not fault the hotel.Check in was very fast and cases delivered within minutes.We were on 28th floor which I had emailed hotel in advance and asked for a high floor as you are in a very busy location and it gets rather noisy,even during the night.Read lots of negative about breakfast as a party of 4 we went every morning about 8.30 and never once waited on a table there was a great selection of food you will not starve.Dinner at night always had a good choice with a different roast each evening.Hotel is spotless clean and very modern in comparison to lots of hotels in area.The rooms aren't huge but think that's the norm in NYC,we had an iron and a fridge but no coffee making facility in room.Hairdryer is ok for a hotel also.Location is fantastic and walking distance to most attractions.I would definitely recommend hotel to anyone.I've attached some pictures of the view from our room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Upon arriving at the Riu Plaza Hotel we were immediately greeted at reception by very helpful and friendly staff. Perfectly situated within a minutes walking distance to Times Square the location was a perfect base for visiting Broadway, The Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Macy’s etc. Central Park was in reasonable walking distances ok. The Hotel was extremely modern throughout and spotlessly clean; the bedrooms were cleaned to perfection. Our adapter had been left at home and the hotel reception were more than happy to supply a spare one they had. It was great to see that the hotel were making small adjustments to be more environmentally friendly; the soap and shower caps were wrapped in cardboard boxes and in the breakfast area reusable cups etc were provided. They also suggested leaving any towels on the floor that needed cleaning. Although this is a great step in the right direction I was surprised to see how throwaway New York is as a society and although they are actively recycling, there is so much waste created it would be difficult to cope with the amount produced. The hotel kindly provided fresh bottles of water every other day, which although great it would be better if they had provided refillable large glasses which the staff refilled. The Cafe connected to the hotel did great hot drinks; but again drinks were in throw away containers even for those drinking in. Moreover in the breakfast area the napkins and table cloths were all throw away and it would have been great to see reusable options. The sauces were on display but you could choose small containers; again throwaway. Despite this we had a great stay and I had a great 30th birthday. This hotel was so great that despite the environmental concerns we couldn’t give it less than 5 *s. But I hope this review will make the the hotel consider these small changes which I think will set the standards for other hotels to follow.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed 3 nights in NYC before a trip to France. The RIU is in the best possible location for seeing a few Broadway shows and having a few good meals in NYC. I would highly recommend it. The room, while small, was comfortable and was plenty of room for two adults. Breakfast (which was included) in the restaurants downstairs was a great way to start the day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I took my partner to NYC for his 30th birthday from 26th March . Riu plaza is a great location for everything in NY. 3 minute walk to the centre of Times Square. 10 minute walk to Central Park. We walked most places, great way to take in the sights. Don’t bother with the buses or taxis. We took the subway twice. So cheap and so easy. Subways are located on most corners. We went to the sights we thought would be busiest first thing in the morning, didn’t queue for a single one. Including Empire State Building. The hotel itself is so underrated. Perfect views (we stayed on floor 24) the hotel is very clean and decorated lovely. The breakfast buffet went down a treat! Everything you could want and more. So glad we picked a hotel with breakfast included, gave us much more time to do more touring. All staff we came across were lovely, will help with anything. A great tip.. get the Revolut card instead of bringing loads of dollars. So easy to use and you only spend what you need. No coming home with loads of money to exchange over. All in all perfect hotel. Perfect holiday.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 4 nights to celebrate our 60th birthdays. Our first visit to New York and thoroughly enjoyed. Found the smaller restaurant calmer for breakfast which set us up for the day ahead. Our room was on the 29th floor which was amazing. We had no problem with bathroom layout and in all fairness even with a light on only you only see outline of person in shower, so no big deal. We have used many Riu hotels in various countries and have always been well looked after.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We looked for a hotel in New York that did breakfast. Riu plaza Times Square was a fabulous hotel. To say it has a lot of rooms we never once had to wait for check in, breakfast, lifts, very very well run hotel. All the staff were lovely and helpful. Hotel is perfect for Times Square and getting on the metro. There is a lot of restaurants and bars around the hotel too. Rooms are clean, breakfast was really good with lots of choice. We would definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I spent 5 nights here and I was very impressed, the room was small, however, I did expect this and we spent most of each day in the city anyway, the room is comfy and modern, the location is excellent, the food isn’t a large choice at night but I found that there was always something, the WiFi was very good in all areas, overall the hotel is very good, I would stay again and I would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Rui Plaza is a very busy tourist hotel in the heart of mid town Manhattan one block from Times Square so you can easily walk to so many of NYCs top tourist spots . it’s easy to see why it’s so popular. Breakfast was fine but we steered clear of the melee in the larger restaurant in favour of the smaller one. The staff are great and look after you. Our only disappointment was the size of the room which was small and had no sofa or arm chair which to be honest we would expect to find in any decent American city centre hotel. The bathroom is a strange affair with a frosted glass screen to separate it from the room. We did not like this arrangement but as long as you leave the bathroom light off your modesty is protected.Overall our stay was fine.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked this hotel as part of my 60th birthday celebrations, absolutely blown away with location, huge spacious room with a view, spotlessly clean and fantastic staff-cannot fault it in any way and highly recommend. This is my 3rd visit to NY and the 2 previous hotels I stayed in were nowhere near as nice as this. Huge choice of breakfast included in the price too! Thanks for making my birthday so special!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel, location, breakfast was lovely. Room was lovely clean and modern we had a balcony. But they still have returnee the holding fee back to our card its now been 7days. I cant get hold of anyone to help.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I returned for a second visit, this time with my wife and son for 5 nights in February. Very nice reception staff and swift check in. We had a Junior Suite on the 28th floor and i was worried the sofa bed would not be quite right for my 13 year old son who is almost 6 foot tall! he loved it and it was hard to get him out of it!! He loved the Jacuzzi bath whilst my wife and i preferred the shower but the dual sinks were great. Access to the club room was great as we called in for snacks regularly!! especially with a hungry teenager. lovely people all round the hotel, immaculately clean rooms, nice cleaning staff too. We stayed half board and that was great. No wandering the streets thinking what to eat, we had our full on buffet every night. Can't wait to go back!! My wife loved the location so much she went out herself downtown on the subway and back and felt super safe which is saying something for her :-)It's right next to one of the pick ups for woodbury commons too depending on the bus you use to no travelling for ages to go and find the bus stop. love it !! we dont want to stay anywhere else!! With it being February it was affordable too to go for a suite.
user_name:
gheth67
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed on 25/3/2019 for 4 nights. Lovely hotel.Great views over the city. Really comfortable bed and great showers. Staff were friendly especially Christian the Bell Boy, he was so helpful.The breakfast was brilliant and set us up for the day. Everything really clean. In a great location and within walking distance of most places.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: arrived here with my partner 19.03.2019 for a 5 night stay .location spot on lobby spotless check in very efficient .rooms absolutely spotless only couple of things the glass partition from the shower you can see the outline of the person in there and if you sat on the toilet the gap in the door you would be seen actually sat on the toilet but not a problem to much if your a couple. And my only other little niggle water only every other day in the fridge .only other thing we were on the 10th floor facing the street next time I would ask for higher floor saying, this the noise was bearable . breakfast was brilliant something for everyone I thought from cereal to toast eggs yogurt fruit pastries beans hash browns etc .I'm a veggie and even I didn't struggle to eat breakfast .the concierge very helpful and knowledgable.check out very fast and if you had late transfer the hotel they keep you cases for free .we had a wonderful stay and this hotel made it just perfect for our first time in new York .I would highly recommend this place and would go back for sure. thank you rui plaza .
user_name:
Aud G
Gosport, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just returned from a 5-night stay at Riu Plaza Times Square. We arrived at about midnight due to huge queues at customs in the airport and road closures and long traffic delays from the airport. By this point we were absolutely exhausted and just wanted to go to bed! The staff upon check in were so welcoming and friendly and made the check in process so quick and easy - just what we needed after a long journey! We emailed prior to our stay requesting a high up room and on check in we were allocated a room on the 3rd floor. I explained that I had requested a room on a high floor and they changed it straight away for a room on 20th floor. The room itself was modern and clean. It was a little on the small size but perfectly adequate for 2 adults, especially as we were out all day and only came back to sleep! The room had a very comfortable king size bed, a small desk and chair, two bedside tables with drawers, a free standing mini fridge with bottle water in every other day, a good sized wardrobe with plenty of hangers, a safe, an iron and ironing board.The curtains blocked out all of the light which was great as there are lots of flashing signs and billboards around. There are also plugs either side of the bed which is great for charging phones. One side had USB ports in the wall and the other side had normal sockets. There was also a huge TV on the wall at the end of the bed. The bathroom was spacious with a lovely big walk in shower - the bathroom also had a hairdryer.There is a glass wall between the shower and bedroom so you can see the outline of someone in the shower but this didn’t both us as we are married. If you are travelling with friends you may find this awkward. The door to the bathroom was sliding and had a huge gap so you could actually see if someone was on the toilet, but again didn’t really bother us. The room came with a free breakfast. I was concerned about breakfast as I have read a lot of negative reviews but I shouldn’t have been concerned. We ate at different times each day and never did we have any problems. There were staff by the doors to breakfast who would direct you to a free table. We only ever had to wait around 2 minutes and this was due to a large family being there first and they were trying to find a table for them to all sit together, otherwise it was so efficient considering how many people were at breakfast. They also have food on two sides so there aren’t queues waiting for food.The breakfast itself was great and I was very surprised. Usually free hotel breakfasts are mediocre but this was really good. They have everything you could want; cereal, toast, rolls, cold meats, cheese, sausages, sausage patties, eggs, bacon, beans, pancakes, waffles, croissants, pastries, yoghurt, fruit etc.. And there were coffee machines and juice machines so you can help yourself. Really couldn’t fault breakfast.We also used the hotel bar called Fashion Bar which is right off the hotel lobby. During the week they had all day happy hour specials, which meant $8 cocktails! One day we were in there and I ended up having 4 cocktails. When we got the bill 2 of them were charged at $8 each and the other 2 were charged at $9 each. We queried it and the staff apologised and went to check, when they came back they said they have taken the 2 that we $9 each off the bill for their error which was really good of them.The staff were all really friendly and helpful.The location of the hotel was also fantastic. You are literally a few minutes walk to Times Square and max. 15 minute walk to other attractions like Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park etc. There are also plenty of subway stations close by and many restaurants and bars so you will have plenty of choice for dinner.Would highly recommend this hotel and will stay again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful lobby, lovely breakfast and wonderful rooms. Excellent service from all of the staff day or night! The room was cleaned every day while we were busy sight seeing which was lovely! The service we received every morning at breakfast was very good and the food was always nice! Not many hotels do breakfast in New York so in choosing this one we saved ourselves a lot of time and money! I highly recommend this hotel to everyone and if I ever go back to New York i would use this hotel again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here in March and found it perfect for our first trip to the Big Apple. It is within easy reach of Theatres, Transport links and roughly 20 minutes maximum walk to most central sites. The rooms are comfortable and clean. We benefitted from the club lounge on the 26th Floor with 24x7 access to drinks and snacks included. Staff were helpful and the breakfast included was a great start with more than ample choice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had to be up at 6am for breakfast as the hotel can’t cater for the amount of guests they, paid for late check out and cleaners tried to kick us out still, booked taxi charged $150 to airport between 4 guests and left change out on side in room - this was taken and replaced with a birthday card. Really poor

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for my 40th Birthday. Previously been to New York at wasn’t impressed with previous hotel. Therefore looked into hotels/locations and was not disappointed.We arrived to a very crowded reception area and first impressions were not good as we were left standing to check in when the two female receptionist had a chat.I contacted the hotel prior to departure to inform them it was my Birthday and requested a room high up with view if possible- sadly we didn’t get this. However room was lovely and clean.We stayed bed and breakfast, some mornings there was a que but nothing major and staff worked to get people sitter ASAP. Breakfast was good and could not fault it.Staff throughout the stay ( apart from check in) were fabulous and could not do enough to help. Location was ideal and just round the corner from Times Square.Only negative I had was that when I was printing off boarding passes, some staff member had obviously printed off information/minutes regarding staff members and disciplinary which was left for people to read. However this did not spoil my time and would definitely return to this hotel x

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights with my daughter celebrating her 21st birthday, the hotel is well located and staff were very nice and helpful. We had a room with a queen size bed which was adequate for us, very clean and good shower, however for a 4 star hotel I expect coffee and tea making facilities in my room. Breakfast was always busy had to queue if went down after 7.30 but it’s well organised by the staff. Plenty of choice at breakfast but I was put off with the fruit as on our 2nd morning I decided to have fruit and yogurt, I was not impressed to find an insect crawling on my melon! I spoke to the waiter who just said he would speak to chef but no apology to me that put me off totally. It was an ok hotel but I wouldn’t stay again but to be fair I won’t be going to New York again been and done it and no need to return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having read some of the negative reviews here our experience was quite the opposite. When we arrived we were warmly greeted and were checked in by Vivienne (I think that was her name) who was lovely. She asked why were were there and we advised it was our babymoon so would be the last holiday just the 2 of us. As a congratulations, we were upgraded to a larger room on the 26th floor which was totally unexpected and a wonderful gesture. We went for breakfast at around 6.30am every morning and were seated straight away. The buffet was good and plentiful. We would have no hesitation in going back. The view from the room was amazing and the location is ideal.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Although the reception area is quite impressive the rooms are not. 3 of us in a tiny room with 2 small double beds & the bathroom is two bits of obscure glass joined together, no privacy whatsoever. We asked for a family room which still had the horrible shower room but at least we had s sofa bed added. It’s no better than a premier inn. Breakfast was plentiful but not great. Wouldn’t go back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have recently returned from our trip to NYC and would without doubt return the the RIU Plaza NYC. The hotel is ideally located 1 block from Times Square and is surrounded by a huge choice of restaurants, bars and eateries. We have stayed at several RIU hotels and by far this was one of the best. The hotel is very modern and has everything you could need for your stay. The staff cannot do enough for you and made our stay really special. We stopped in room 1202, which was a family room, with lots of space. When we return to NYC, we will be booking the RIU again as it was just fantastic!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at Riu Plaza Times Square on March 21st on a business trip. I chose the hotel because of its location in Times Square which is the only good thing about this hotel. The service is horrible; the staff was rude at the Front Desk and in the Restaurants, I came for breakfast at 7:20 am, and I was standing in the line without being assisted when I approached the hostess to ask where I could seat? She left me speaking to myself... I went and decided to come for breakfast at a later time (I read some reviews that if you arrive later for breakfast, it is not that busy). I came back around 10:00 am to a different restaurant next to the elevators and had the same horrible experience, the hostess told me to sit on a table that was dirty and everything looked a mess! Then the cherry on top of the cake: I had a very important business call at 11:00 am, I was looking forward to having this call for a week!! I went to my room and placed the Do not disturb sign outside of the door... Two things happen: After one minute of being on the phone the fire alarm went on!! It was a drill, as per the announcement over the PA system, the drill was for the Fire Department of NY state, however, this is something that they could have told the guest: advise them at Check-in, leave a voicemail or a note so people are aware!!! This totally ruined the call that I've been waiting for months!!! Finally, the fire alarm went off and I could continue with my call (very embarrassed with a very important client).... and on top of that, the housekeeping knocked on the door!!!!!! OMG! Check-out is at 12 pm, it was 11:10 am, and I placed the do not disturb sign outside of the door. Many things went wrong, I was at the RIU for 15 hours and everything absolutely everything was horrible! Many things could have been prevented! Never coming back. If you don't care about rude staff, then you can stay there, the location is great! As I said, is the only good thing about this hotel!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Agree with most reviews. Excellent location 5 mins to the square & near lots of restaurants. Try Athenee on the corner next door. We didn’t sleep at all on Saturday night due to the noise from the street. It was ok on subsequent nights but Saturday is clearly part night! Ask for a high floor. Rooms are clean, functional & have good showers. We thought breakfast was excellent. Where I was disappointed was the attitude of reception staff. It may just be 2 we encountered or maybe just New Yorkers but Offhand and didn’t really seem to want to offer help. .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very modern hotel that is in a great location . Hotel is very clean and staff very friendly . The free breakfast is very nice but would be a bit boring if you stayed there any longer than a week . Room are a bit on the small size but beds are really comfy and we all had a great nights sleep . Bathroom is nice but has a frosted glass to the bedroom which if someone showers and are right up against the glass isn't the greatest for privacy . One WARNING be careful of the bell hops. We enquired how much a cab would be to JFK. The bell hop pushed us to get a car organised by him as it would be cheaper. We were quoted $75 and informed this included all tips, tolls etc. We clarified this by asking did this include the tip for driver and we were told yes. I noted that the receipt I was given said "gratuities not included". I went back again to check and he insisted that it did. His actual words were "trust me". I was totally embarrassed when I got to JFK. I handed over the money. The driver counted it and said "I guess you were not happy with the service today". I explained what I was told but could tell that he was not happy. He was very diplomatic but none the less I felt embarrassed. This kind of soured an otherwise really nice vacation in the big Apple .By the way yellow cabs offer a flat rate of around 65 dollars to JFK plus tip so if I was you that's the way I would go do not trust what the hotel bell hops tell you .
user_name:
Dave p K
Twickenham, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location, nice room and quite room. Valet parking available and 3 min away from time square. Its my new place when I’am in NY. Staff are nice and many elevators so you dont have to wait to go up and down.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here with a group of friends for five days. Hotel is ideally sited subway and within walking distance of Grand Central Station, Central Park and the theatre district. Our superior room was very compact with no tea/coffee facilities and only a small bottle of water supplied every other day. They do supply an iron & board plus hairdryer and toiletries. Nice clean and comfy rooms but suggest you bring some earplugs as can be very noisy all night. Breakfast buffet good but we found incredibly busy all the time Staff were lovely and polite and the bar staff are wonderful and helpful with any questions on local shops etc.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Situated in exactly the right place for us for easy access to everywhere we wanted to visit. The service from the moment we arrived to the moment we left couldn't be faulted, all staff were freindly, polite and knowledgable. We were on the 24th floor and had an excellant view. The room was clean and comfortable with everything we needed with the exception of tea and coffee, kettle etc but hey we survived. (Trouble is, being English tea is lacking here) There was plenty of choice for breakfast, self service, so a bit of a scramble when busy, but normal for such a large hotel. Would stay here again if going to New York again. This was a treat for our joint 70th birthdays and didn't disappoint.
user_name:
kathy3terry
Weston super Mare, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We didn’t feel like this hotel was a 4 star. The service was average. Modern decor very plain rooms with a low bed. We were very disappointed with the pillow. There were only two pillows and they were not down pillows!We’ve never experienced that in a hotel before. The bathroom was clean and new. Overall room was smaller than we anticipated. Another issue we had was that at 1:00 in the morning there was disturbing noises and ruckus from the cleaning lady at the room next door. How outregous. This went on until 3:00 am! Location on the other hand is right in Times Square which is great for those who are coming to town for a show. But if your looking for a luxurious and quiet stay this might not be the right place.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were celebrating my 65th and our 43rd wedding anniversary when we stopped here from 13th - 15th March 2019. I had previously asked if we could have a room with a view and they didn't disappoint. Not only did we get a room on the 24th floor they also supplied a gift to help us celebrate. Many thanks.Virginia checked us in and was the perfect host and made us feel welcome immediately.We opted for breakfast which was varied and good. However, this is a very busy hotel I guess because of its value for money, and this particular mealtime is extreme but is also well organise by RIU staff.Overall a good experience and we would return which has to be the benchmark.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Are you Hotel in New York City was Very clean modern hotel. It was located very close to time square and to a lot of other places we could walk to It had easy check in and check out services Be included breakfast was a bonus It was quite delicious

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our first trip to New York had the best time hotel clean and comfortable - breakfast busy but good quality with lots of choice - staff friendly and helpful especially the porter DuVaughan who went above and beyond to assist with advice and recommendations

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The visit to New York was on our to do list for years. To us one of the most important ingredients is the base. Somewhere to rest and recuperate from our long days and tens of thousands of steps. The Hotel Riu Plaza Time Square fits the bill. One block from the main time square and a 15 minute walk from most of the popular tourist sites on Manhattan. Our room was on the 21st floor. It was clean tidy and comfortable. Only thing missing was coffee in the room, a bit snobby but that's how we felt. The breakfast was a buffet which although hectic was well stocked and very well staffed by polite helpful staff only too happy to meet any requirements. I would like to have scored it 4.5 because we felt it was a shade short of 5. But it's perfectly place comfortable affordable and would highly recommend staying here. Enjoy New York people, beautiful city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in Broadway just a short walk to Times Square. We were on the 6th floor and were not aware of any street noise at night. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. The breakfast is well organised even on a very busy weekend there was a min wait. There is a large selection of food and great variety of fresh fruit. The bar was good for a hotel and was always staffed. Would definitely go back, great location, highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely amazing place.hotel was clean and modern.very comfy large bed.breakfast was lovely with loads of choice.would def come her again.new York is amazing and stopping right on times square was brill as all on your doorstep.concrete jungle where dreams are made of..certainly is..brill

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Came here with my fiance, mum and son for a week's stay for our wedding. The hotel is in a fantastic location, a 5 min walk to Times Square and is not noisy at all. The rooms were clean also modern exactly like the pictures. We booked through British Airways the transfer was easy as was check in. The views from the hotel are fabulous and you can proceed up to other floors and gaze through the glass panels at the skyline. Breakfast is fantastic with alot of choice. I had prosecco on the morning of our wedding which was organised by the restaurant and used the dry cleaning facility for my fiance and sons clothes on the day. Will definitely return here!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Ideal location, a minute walk to Times Square, friendly staff, especially in the restaurants, bus tour of New York available to pick up right outside the restaurant door, lots of little family run restaurants outside main entrance well worth a visit

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent a few nights at this hotel & in my opinion it served us well. Rooms are clean & tidy maybe a little small for 3 Adults but we managed very well..Beds comfy & bathroom had plenty of space. Water in the fridge was replaced every day which is a nice touch. Breakfast was good & yes it's the same variety most days but we enjoyed it & it set us up for the day.. Great location for Time square, Bus station etc. Staff friendly & helpful.. I would recommend you give it a go if visiting the Big Apple..

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent, especially service at breakfast restaurant, the staff are very friendly and professional, Tofael is excellent server & great guy, he cares about customer experience as whole, I wish I can Hire people like to work in my company

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel in a great location.The staff in the hotel at the reception and in the bar were extremely friendly.The rooms were rather small compared to other hotels I’ve stayed in in NYC but were fine, they were modern and clean. The breakfast buffet was a bit of a let down. There was usually a bit of a queue to get in. And it tends to be the same food every day. There was always something I could eat but would have liked more variety.I would stay here again. It’s good value and in a great location. We had an excellent stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic location and clean room. Thats where the positives really stopped for us. Customer service was hit and miss, some staff were friendly and helpful, others were the complete opposite! There are no facilities in the room to make coffee/tea and when you go to the bar to request hot water and a splash of milk..you are charged $3.27USD to put hot water and a bit of milk in a mug...ridiculous (especially when I provided the mugs/tea bags). I was informed that the water was free but the tiny bit of milk I needed for a cuppa was going to be at the charge above with the rude staff member stating "theres only one charge for milk". Maybe a small thing to some but simple coffee/tea amenities everywhere else Ive stayed have been complimentary. Greedy comes to mind. We wont be returning.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We chose this hotel because of its location, Located on 46th st on 8th Ave ,but mainly as it was one of the very few that offered breakfastl. Very modern looking rooms with a very nice bathroom. Main room was small but I think they are all similar sizes in New York. Breakfast had a good choice of hot and cold items, all buffet style.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived Mar 14th from JFK via Uber and was greeted at the front door by a wonderful doorman. Please note that the street is under construction across from the entrance and it's a one way. Therefore, if you need an Uber or taxi, it will take them longer to arrive! Plan accordingly. The lobby was bright, clean, had plenty of seating and was well updated. We walked over to the counter and a super nice woman checked us in early. She did tell us about the deposit that they hold and that was ok. Make sure it's enough though as you will need it to cover any incidentals such as the bar, etc. We received our keys and went up to our room, 2105. The elevator requires your room key to insert then choose your floor each time you go up. Very nice security feature. Once we arrived on our floor we stepped off the elevator into a very warm lobby, super warm. It was very cold outside but this warm was a bit much. Upon entering our two bed, sleeper sofa room, we noticed it was warm too. The decor was very nice, clean and ample room for the four of us. I did read on other reviews that the bathroom had an opening in the sliding door that allowed guests to see each other on the loo. They were right! I could sit down on the toilet and actually watch TV! LOL I included pics of the crack. Also, the main shower wall is frosted glass and the other guests can see the shadow outline of whoever is showering and what they are washing. If the showerer pressed their buns against the glass, you could see it as if you were right there.The room faced other buildings but also if you looked to the right, you could see the street and the fire station below. (*If you don't want to hear the sirens all night, bring ear plugs, 21 floors up and we could hear them great) The room was bright, cheerful and clean. We did have an issue with the AC not cooling. Even though outside was cold, the temp in our room was at 78 and rising. Too warm to catch a nap. We lowered it to 65 and still it climbed. We contacted the front desk and a maintenance man arrived quickly. He fixed it and it was great the rest of the trip. (*we do think like others did, that the air temp is controlled by the hotel as the warmer the outside city got, the cooler the room did) We noted that the special gift I requested did arrive after 4 pm which is when the bar opens. The bathroom is equipped with a blow dryer, a good one too, soap, conditioner, body lotion and in the shower is a shampoo/body wash combo bottle mounted to the wall. They give nice linens except during our stay, we had 4 ppl, they only kept giving us 2 washcloths. I called each day to get extras. The pillows on the bed were small and there is 1 extra large one in the closet on the upper shelf. I called and received extras with no problem.There is an iron, ironing board, safe with your own code, hangers, a luggage rack and two hooks on the wall. There are two nightstands with drawers. The beds are high enough to hide your suitcases under. The beds are very,very comfortable. I've had spinal surgery recently and was worried but I slept like a baby. The only odd thing is that the beds were pushed together. Housekeeping is clean and helpful. We did have an issue with our mini fridge. It's mounted on a tri wheel base and we put a bottle of vodka, bottle of champagne, two glasses and some plastic cups on the top. Out of nowhere, it tipped over towards the window and crashed the vodka bottle to the ground, breaking the glasses and the bottle. I called down and housekeeping came right up as did maint. They cleaned it up and while maint was there, he saw how it tipped yet again right in front of him. I was concerned as I had my child there but he fixed it with some blocks. Just make a note that this can happen. They even replaced my vodka with a bottle from the bar! At breakfast, Diana greeted us and since we had the extra person in our room added at the last minute, her list didn't show it. She checked with the front desk and voila! We were let right in. She is very capable in her position and speedy. The food was delicious. They offer much more at a free breakfast than any hotel I've been. The staff is so helpful and smiling. They also have a business center that you can print your boarding passes. Most hotels always have issues with their printers but not the RIU. I called down one morning and on the other end was a gentleman who sounded like he was laughing/smiling over the phone. I told him he sounded like he was having a great day and he agreed while chuckling. I can tell a place is a good employer if the employees are smiling and laughing. They were. Patricia at the concierge desk is also very friendly and will try to find you shows. I have to say, the little inconveniences were nothing compared to the value, the location, the staff and the amenities. I would stay again and I would recommend you do too. (excuse the messy room, we hit the ground running!)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just arrived home from a 5 day visit to New York, staying at the Riu Plaza Times Square. Had a fantastic (but very tiring) holiday in the big apple.We always use Riu hotels whenever we go on holiday, hence our status as Riu Class Gold members and always email the hotel before we travel asking for a free room upgrade. On this occasion we were given a room on the "crown level" 26th floor and had a great room with stunning views. The rooms are smaller than you get in normal Riu resorts as you would expect of a city centre hotel, but the room was lovely. The only thing I was surprised about was there aren't coffee making facilities in the room. However, this didn't matter to us because we had the use of an executive lounge which is reserved for 26th floor guests and has a coffee machine, soft drinks, wine and snacks available 24 hours.As for the Big Apple, it was 20 years since our last visit and we did all the usual touristy things: Brooklyn Bridge, MSG, Greenwich Village, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Statten Island Ferry, Statue of liberty and of course Times Square. The hotel location is perfect, just off the square so not too noisy, but within easy walking distance of subway stations etc.The highlight of our visit was definitely the 9/11 memorial and museum. It is obviously very sad and sombre but fascinating none the less. I would highly recommend the guided tour of the museum which lasts an hour and costs $20. I think our tour guide was called Becky, and she was excellent. If you book any attractions before you go it is cheaper - NY is very expensive, as are all major cities.We spent 4 hours in the museum and could have spent longer, but felt we had been depressed enough by then! Its strange to "enjoy" such a sad tribute, but its presented so well and with such respect it really is a "must do" whilst you're there.My best advice for a trip to the big apple: take comfortable walking shoes! Yes, the subway system is great and really easy to use, but you still walk for miles!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked this hotel as a group for a birthday celebration and although a Lille apprehensive - all was good when we arrived,Check in was quick and easy, with the 4 rooms all together on the 16th floor.While the rooms were compact (it is New York!!) they were all spotlessly clean and well designed with good shower bathrooms and USB charger sockets next to the bed etc.The location is superb for sightseeing, being a 5 minute walk from Times Square and right opposite the No.1 stop for one of the open bus tour routes (just negotiate a price as we managed to get the 5 day pass down from $79 to $55.00 as it was listed on their website!!).A 10 minute walk in the opposite direction gets you dinghy onto the Intrepid aircraft carrier museum - a must if you want to get up close and personal with a space shuttle, F16, and a WW2 cruise missile submarine. Well worth a trip.I did not give a 5 star - but ONLY because there was no coffee making facilities in the room (I really need coffee first thing in the morning!) and the bar prices were somewhat extortionate... but again, it's New York - so what do you expect :-)While on here I'd recommend Carmines for an unreal dining experience - just superb, Westway Diner for it's great menu and friendliest service and Panda Express for a low cost but REALLY tasty Chinese meal.Would I go back to this hotel - definitely. Would I go back to New York, hmmm maybe just a few too many aggressive "give me money for food" beggars and that damn traffic.Great hotel, great location, good service would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Went with our two grown up children we shared a family room, two double beds and a pull out double sofa bed, plenty of room for us all. The shower design was a bit iffy due to it showing your silhouette. The staff were friendly and helpful . We stayed half board . Breakfast was plentiful and a good choice and the evening meal was buffet style to and again enough to satisfy all. Rooms and hotel was spotless . They have plenty of lifts and they move very quickly. The views from the hotel corridors was fabulous. Would definitely go back, the price we paid for our holiday was incredible

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wonderful location. Rooms are nice, modern. Frosted glass partition of bathroom might bother some people. Visited this hotel in febbrary 2019, stayed for 4 nights, no problemtutto ok this hotel is situated near time square

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We checked in and out no fuss or wait. They take $50 per night held on card and refund at check out if you don’t use. Size of room good well presented and clean. Staff nice enough Would recommend also in a convenient area

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wonderful location. Rooms are nice, modern. Frosted glass partition of bathroom might bother some people. Buffet is fantastic. Only downside is the elevators during peak times - they are very crowded and long wait times are necessary. Lines for breakfast in the morning are long during peak times as well.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited this hotel in January 2019, stayed for 5 nights 6 days, had no problems. This was my first visit to New York and would 100% go back to this hotel. Perfect location for sight seeing, located on restaurants row, 2 mins walk away from Times Square, 10 minute walk to Madison Square Garden. Nothing is far from this hotel. The room was the exact same as the picture, nice and clean. Cant complain! Dont let picky people put you off this hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. Just one block from Times Square. However, it is let down by rude and incompetent staff.The hotel has over 600 rooms. But not enough staff.They offer a breakfast buffet that is ridiculously busy when they hotel is busy. We were ushered into another area of the hotel for our second mornings breakfast. It was chaos. We had to queue down some back stairs. Not apologized to for this. Just herded like cattle.The restaurant we had breakfast in the first morning was great. Smaller and not as crowded. When we went back the next morning at 9am we were pushed out by a horrible staff member called Maria. No apology, just told to get out and go to the other reataurant.Our room was not cleaned at all while we were there. Even after asking reception in person to look into it. AND calling down to reception again.Luckily they brought us clean towels one day.If you like service with a smile, then don't stay at this hotel. Very disappointing.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a great location across the road from Times Square. It is modern and clean. The breakfast buffet is well worth it would recommend it. It can be a bit noisy outside with the traffic but nothing too bad. The restaurant looks nice but I find eating in New York expensive anyway.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is in great position for Times Square. Good breakfast. The only thing that let it down was the staff at reception. We asked about water in the room and were told it was only refilled every two days and despite us saying we had only had one bottle for 3 days she looked at us like we were mad! Again we asked the same lady about late check out on our second day she said they only do it on the date of check out. So.. we asked on this day and they are fully booked at 7am? She said we should have asked the day before? For anyone wanting this check every day. Having stayed at two riu palaces over the last year we were a little disappointed and will consider another brand in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel was clean, the breakfast included in the rate was ok. Plenty of options but get there early as they did end up with queues. Room was very small and basic, one chair in front of a narrow shelf with no mirror. Two double beds. The fridge had two bottles of water in it that should have been replenished every other day. It wasn’t. Beds were comfortable - pillows were awful. No kettle/tea making facilities in room.No room service (!)Bar for tea/coffee or drinks was not open Sunday afternoon. Not sure of any other afternoon. You need to be able to get a coffee or drink in a hotel in daylight hours at least. Bathroom was good, no bath. Reception and restaurant staff not the most helpful or friendly. Location was excellent and we didn’t spend much time in the room so it served its purpose. If you want luxury then this isn’t the hotel for you

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza Times Square for 7 days in Feb 2019 and it was amazing, New York is fantastic, so much to do! The hotel overall was brilliant and the staff on reception and in the restaurant couldn't do enough for us, I would say the only thing that let the stay/hotel down would be the house keeping, we stayed on floor 18 and our room was not always cleaned fully, some days only the bed was made and fresh towels issued, nothing else was removed or cleaned despite the house keepers being left tips each day, there was also one day we returned to nothing being done at all, we then had a knock on the door at 18:00 from house keeping which we turned away.Other than this we could not fault the the stay and would love to return in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our second visit to the Riu plaza Times Square. The hotel is perfect in every way. Staff are very friendly and the breakfast is amazing, totally sets you up for the day. The location is perfect to access every part of New York . I had a request and I emailed the hotel before my arrival, Rimarly .G emailed me back and went above what I had asked for. He made our stay so memorable, thank you . Our room was amazing and had wonderful views of New York. I can’t fault this hotel in any way, I highly recommend and I look forward to returning again in December. Thanks for a perfect stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Usually a fantastic place to stay. We come frequently and always enjoy the friendly staff, location, cleanliness, good bedding and excellent breakfast offerings. This trip in early March we had an unpleasant breakfast experience due to extreme overcrowding at 7:30 with several very badly behaved guests making things difficult for staff who were trying to keep things orderly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu is a great hotel. Brilliant location if you are a tourist and it’s your first time in New York. Hotel is spotless. There is a lovely smell in the lobby area, wish I had asked what it was and where I could get some for home! We stayed at the Riu for a week and were in a deluxe king. The room was more than big enough for us. There is a good sized wardrobe with about 8-10 hangers. The rain shower is heaven. As many people have commented on before, the only thing the room is missing is a tea/coffee making facilities. And in a 4* hotel, I think it should be there. Breakfast was included and really set us up for the day. The restaurant staff were my favourite... always cheerful and welcoming. Two places serve breakfast... the main restaurant and also the Fashion bar. The main restaurant is much much bigger than the fashion bar, but I liked the the fashion bar much more for breakfast because it was smaller. It’s only open until 9.30am whereas the main restaurant serves breakfast until 11am. If you are an early riser, go to the Fashion Bar. There is a Duane Reade ‘pharmacy’ (but actually a supermarket as well), about 50m from the hotel. The street next to the hotel is known as ‘restaurant row’. Many places to eat there if you are all walked out. One of the USB plugs in our bedroom did not work when we arrived so when we were heading out for the day, I let reception know and also asked for an extra pillow. When we got back that day, the plug had been fixed and our room had been made up with an extra pillow included.Attentive staff and a great, spotless, centrally located hotel with a great vibe. What more could you want? We booked with British Airways and got such a reasonable deal. Having breakfast at the hotel saves so much on food. Thank you Riu, for a great stay!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As a family of 3 we stayed in the Riu Plaza for 4 nights mid-December 2018, myself my partner & 12 year old son. Hotel is lovely - modern, clean & staff were very friendly. The location is also perfect. Very central so we felt we were right in the heart of the city. We stayed bed and breakfast and found a wide selection, although the selection was repeated exactly the same every day. I'm vegan and did still manage to find a lovely, substantial breakfast each day. Room was cleaned regularly and to a good standard. Comfortable beds and shower facilities were lovely - no bath. Lovely stay in all. Will return
user_name:
Amie S
County Durham, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent one night with my husband- the room was very small. Everything was clean and had a cool floor to ceiling window and it it in the heart of Time Square. Cons: our shower stalled leaked into the hallway; our thermostat did not work so it was cold in the room and although they sent a technician- after standing at the console and pressing all the buttons for what seemed like an eternity - said he needed to come back with tools. It was after midnight so we just endured the chill. The next morning the technician called very early in the morning (so much for sleeping in) my husband told him to forget about it but they still knocked on our door 2 more times to see if we wanted them to fix it - so it became more of a disturbance than just being cold. The breakfast buffet was mediocre but the staff were all very nice

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A few minutes' walk from Broadway theatres. Picked this hotel out of many possible options nearby because it had a good discounted rate at the time. And it's a newer hotel, so everything's in good shape. Service is friendly. No complaints. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I had a wonderful view from my room. I loved the shower and comfortable bed. The hotel is new. It´s important for me because I don´t like those old rooms with old furniture and weird smell very common in NY. My room and all public areas were always very clean. Those housekeepers could be less noisy. Overall that is a great deal: nice breakfast , 2 restaurants with a plenty of options, nice happy hour drinks, great front desk service, a very familiar atmosphere and really really well located.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have been in New York A LOT, but this is definitely the best hotel we've ever had! The location is brilliant, just behind Times Square. This means you don't feel/hear the noise, but you profit from being in the very centre of Manhattan. It is a big and pretty new hotel, everything was nice and clean. We were on the 23rd floor and had a brilliant view from the room, overlooking all neighbor buildings. Metrostation is nearby, restaurants and shops are too. The breakfast in the hotel is amazing. They serve all guests in a big restaurant (ok, this is not very cosy), but the meal is great and the waiting line is limited. We never had to wait longer than 5 minutes to be seated. The room is not too spacious for 4 people (2 queen beds) but very much ok for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Yes, I missed a coffee machine, but that's about it. There are 6 elevators and sometimes you had to wait to get up/down, although the elevator could take different (unnecessary) stops when it was fully occupied already which was a bit annoying... An engineer should take a look at this... So if you think location and great breakfast is important, you should definitely book this hotel when staying in Manhattan. If you are more on the look-out for a boutique hotel, you should look somewhere else. Price/quality, this hotel was a very good deal!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for a week in February and had an amazing time. The hotel is in an ideal location just enough away from Time Square . Ideally placed for access to the subway . The hotel is clean and the staff were really friendly and helpful. We stayed in a room in the 6th floor and it was clean, comfortable and cleaned to a high standard everyday . The breakfast was brilliant all you could ask for hot and cold choices with a great selection of fruit. The dining area was very busy but really well organised for a large hotel . Could not fault our stay here and would return to this hotel on our next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is very nice, lobby area is very big and spacious and the hotel overall is very clean. Rooms are adequate size for NY as you are hardly in them but plenty of room for cases etc plus free safe included. The frosted glass to the bathroom is fine unless you turn the light on during the night as it lights up the entire room, quite a quirky design and the double shower heads were a nice touch. Bed very comfortable and although there is some noise from the road it is not too bad. The breakfast was included but we only had this once over the 5 day stay as we found it rather poor, everything was cold and rather tasteless and we were down there for 7am. Instead we went to local diners which were not too expensive and much better quality.It is in an ideal location and easy walk to lots of attractions , shops etcWould definitely stay again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We’ve just returned from a 4 night / 4 day stay at the Riu Plaza. Lobby staff ( bell boys in particular) were very welcoming & it was nice to see that they had obviously noted and were able to accommodate a request that I had emailed previously for a room on a higher floor. One thing worth noting is that they do place upon checking in a $100 hold on your credit card - upon checking out about $52 is taken from this for ‘resort fees’. It wasn’t explained what ‘resort fees’ cover - but I’m presuming it must be things like WiFi, gym etcThe rooms are small - but I don’t think you can expect any different considering the location. Spotlessly clean. They were cleaned on a daily basis, towels changed when requested & bottled water restocked every other day. There’s also a fridge available & tons of complimentary toiletries.There’s just a few things which for me stop this hotel from being a 5. The lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. I don’t understand this considering that this is not a cheap hotel The two other things which I wasn’t keen on was the frosted glass window that separates the shower from the main bedroom - fine if your travelling as a couple, but not exactly private when travelling with children I also wasn’t keen on the breakfast - I fully appreciate that this is free & that the hotel isn’t able to control other guests - but it was to crammed in & too busy. The staff worked incredibly hard to make sure that nobody was waiting long & to clear tables quickly. I just struggled with the constant queuing ...We had a lovely time & I certainly wouldn’t hesitate to return

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing hotel. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Bedrooms are amazing and the views are breathtaking. Food was outstanding with a large amount of variety. Nothing was too much trouble and the service was excellent. Well done to everyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my mum stayed here while visiting New York City. We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. Only complaint of I had to make one was there wasn't a kettle and tea/coffee in the room and some of the plugs were not quite aligned in the wall right (wonky in the wall, wouldn't expect from a 4 star). The hotel was in a fantastic location, only one block from times square which made it really easy to walk everywhere.
