We booked half board and I'm so glad we did, it made New York seem quite cheap as we didn't really buy any food throughout the day and knowing we had our evening meal already sorted meant we didn't have to look around for places to eat. The evening meal was delicious with a great choice every night. The breakfast was fine, very typical buffet breakfast and very busy (most people seem to be breakfast only so it was quite hectic at times in the restaurant in a morning).If I went back to New York I would definitely stay here again for the fact the rooms and food were nice and the hotel is in a great location for exploring all the sights.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Clean hotel in a very good location. Walking distance to main part of times square, top of the rock and central park. Plenty of lovely deli's and pizza parlours just accross the street. Staff at reception are not very friendly nobody really spoke to us our entire stay. Also the restaurant doesn't seem big enough for the hotel, its a must to get there for 7am or you have to wait in a line. If you want to tour and see all the city has to offer book the hop on/ hop off bus when you get there. Reps are dressed in red jackets and are always outside the hotel. For 250 usd we had a three day pass for all the family for all the city and surrounding burb's. It also included a night tour of Brooklyn and Statue of liberty trip along with museum enterance. Must sees are - Top of the rock, 911 memorial, China town ( for good fake handbags/watches etc) and the natural history museum. If you have kids be aware of the disney/ marvel characters in times square they insist on heavy tips for pictures you take.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Everything about the hotel is brilliant and I couldn’t recommend it enough. 200 yards from Times Square, surrounded by Broadway theatres, restaurants on the doorstep, 45 minutes from JFK. Hotel staff are so friendly and helpful. Concierge is knowledgeable, bellboys were so organised and reassured us when waiting for airport pick ups, reception explained everything, restaurant staff were quick and happy. The food is some of the best I’ve had in a hotel but then that’s Riu, always providing excellent food and great choice. Breakfast was included in our deal and is a buffet of cooked breakfast, pastries, smoked salmon, cereal and fruit, as well as juices and coffee. We paid extra for evening meal which is also buffet. Varied choices and a different cooked meat every night. We had garlic prawns, rack of lamb, steak and poached salmon, just to name a few. This was a good price at $35 each but reception gave us a further 15% off that as we booked 3 nights. Breakfast is busier than dinner but the staff get things moving quickly and the wait is minimal, if at all. Rooms are spacious considering you’re in NYC. Beds are large and comfortable. Res room underneath the beds for your cases. Bathrooms are large with two showers, one waterfall and one free held. Bath towels are huge and soft! Also lots of toiletries provided included shower gel and shampoo. Hairdryer is powerful too. We even had an iron, ironing board, kettle, mini fridge and bottles of water replaced every other day. Large tv also in the room. Floor 16, room 1604 gives a great view of the buildings and Hudson River. Lifts are quick and you don’t wait for them. The rooms and corridors are spotlessly clean. The staff clearly work hard here and it is appreciated by the guests.I wouldn’t hesitate in recommending this hotel. Thank you for making our stay brilliant.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel and comfortable room, the team at the front desk is really friendly and open to do their best. This property is located on a walking distance to most of the attraction in NY. The breakfast is amazing, the variety and quality is great!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We came to New York as part of a special year visit. This hotel was reasonably priced, very large, we were on 21st floor, rooms comfortable and clean. Great A/C versus heating, quiet and dark considering how close to Times Square you are. Really central for getting places. Staff friendly, considering the numbers of people they have to deal with. Breakfast, they cope well considering having to cater for such large numbers, good selection, catering for all tastes. Main pressure was time waiting for elevators at the weekend. Would recommend this to anyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I changed my hotel booking to the Riu Plaza TS NYC as the reviews on the other hotel were mixed and the deal with breakfast and dinner was hard to beat.We stayed in a deluxe double, with breakfast and dinner included. I was travelling with my mother who's 76 and sister in law for my 50th birthday.We arrived at the hotel via subway at around 4.30pm and were warmly greeted by the reception, our room was ready and check in only took a few minutes.The reception staff were very helpful in sorting WiFi, sorting our safe issue and booking us a taxi back to JFK. Nothing was ever a problem. The lifts were fast and you rarely waited for them. We were on the 18th floor and had a lovely view of the city. Our room was a good size and there was plenty of storage for three in the wardrobe and there's extra storage for cases under the beds. The room was immaculate. Very clean and smelt wonderful. The bathroom had a huge shower and plenty of storage space for toiletries etc. I was concerned that the shower screen wouldn't provide much privacy but this wasn't the case. In the middle of the night there was also enough light off the street to go to the bathroom without putting the lights on and waking everyone up. Dinner was better than I was expecting. It's ideal if you're travelling with older guests and in winter. We didn't want to be walking around at night in the cold looking for places to eat. There were ample choices of main meals. E. G. Paella, fish Risotto, Turkey, beef, chicken, burgers, pizza pasta lasagne to name a few etc as well as a huge variety of very freshly made salads & tasty starters and fabulous desserts. The wine and prosecco and soft drink prices were very reasonable and we were offered ample free table water.Breakfast was busy but the staff couldn't have worked any harder to get everyone seated and fed. The food stations were stocked up as quickly as possible and staff were polite and helpful. The variety of food on offer was exceptional for a 4 star hotel. We couldn't fault our stay at Riu plaza, if I ever get the chance to visit NY again I will not hesitate to chose this hotel again. Thank you for making our stay so memorable.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 5 nights in the Riu Plaza, Breakfast was busy from 8am, so try to get down there before then for a more relaxed experience. Strawberries, melon, blueberries, blackberries, pineapple all available which is unusual for a breakfast buffet. Lots of selection of cereals,bagels and hot food. Rooms were comfortable, clean and great views from the 23rd floor. Only downside is there is no kettle in the room for hot drinks. Great powerful hair dryer provided and a selection of toiletries.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This really is a shame to be writing a bad review, because the hotel has so much potential. If you read my other reviews, It is extremely rare to ever see a bad review, so it takes allot for me to do this.The location couldn’t be better, with some amazing views from the high floors. The building is very modern in comparison to some of the other hotels in the area, but that’s pretty much as good as it gets.I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights in February. The room itself was totally fine, except for the bathroom. The door is a frosted glass sliding door, with a HUGE gap between the wall and the actual door. Im not exaggerating when I say that you could literally see the television in the room, whilst sitting on the toilet with the door closed! If staying here, you need to be VERY comfortable with your roommate, or this will be very awkward!The breakfast was included in our stay, which was a welcome addition with lots of gluten free options. Unfortunately, the restaurant where breakfast is served is far too small to deal with a full hotel. Its basically set up like a school canteen, with tables and guests on top of each other. We ate breakfast here once and didn’t again. You couldn’t have a personal chat and guests on both sides of us all commented on how ridiculously over-packed it was too.The hotel holds a deposit on your room of $150 when you check in. On day two, we noticed that the hotel had actually taken this payment twice. We immediately went to reception to address this. The reception is set up with 2 desks, one for checking in and the other for customer service, with the opening hours displayed as 9am – 5pm, I believe. This was approx. 2PM. We went to the customer service desk and waited for several minutes. It was completely unattended. This was despite multiple staff members at the check in desk looking over toward us whilst not actually doing anything, but selectively ignoring our presence. Eventually, we had to queue up at the check in line, just to ask a question! When we finally got this addressed, the receptionist could not have been more rude. We were bluntly told “that’s not possible” when we said we were charged twice. The lady did not actually check anything, she just answered us instantly. We showed her our online banking, clearly showing 2 transactions. Again, she said no way, we don’t take 2 payments its an issue with your bank. Whilst very unhappy about it, we had no choice but to further address it with our bank to confirm what was going on.On our last day we requested a late check out which we received. We were advised to come down to reception on the morning of check out and have our room key re-cut to ensure we don’t get locked out. We did this, as requested and happened to have the same receptionist we dealt with previously assisting us again. I do not recall her name but she was an older member of the team with a tattoo below her ear, down her neck. Upon beginning to say why we were at reception (to cut the key), she turned to another staff member and spoke in Spanish, then laughed. This alone was extremely rude and unprofessional. I again explained that we had called about a late check out and we were told to come down for the key to be cut. Before I finished, she cut me off stating “its too late for a late check out now.” I sternly said excuse, me, had you let me finish you would know that this was already addressed hours ago with a colleague of yours. We have the late check out confirmed and we were told to come down for our key to be cut”. She then replied “well you didn’t say that, there’s no need for a bad attitude.” She looked at our key then said “that’s fine”, so we assumed we were good. Hours later upon trying to enter our room, we were locked out! She had not cut the key to stop this happening.This woman is beyond disgraceful! She has single handedly ensured that 2 people will absolutely never consider staying in this hotel again, along with telling others to avoid it.Upon arriving home we checked with our bank about the payment issue. They confirmed that we were 100% charged twice. 1 Transaction was held on the card (as expected) but the other transaction had actually been completed by the hotel several hours later. The hotel knew this, as we could see that a few days afterwards they had refunded it. We are in a Euro country so our currency is Euro. Due to exchange rates, the refund was €10 less than what they actually took fraudulently. We contacted Riu hotels and Riu Times Square directly to address this. They advised that a refund was processed but ignored our protests about us being €10 out of pocket due to their own error. Eventually, our bank had to step in and got this back for us.It really is such a shame because there are a small number of staff members in the hotel who are way too good to be working there. The bellboy, for example. Complete gentleman! His colleagues completely let them down as a whole though.Having visited New York 7 times between the 2 of us, I can absolutely assure you that there are dozens of hotels at similar prices to this one, providing significantly better service to you in the exact same area. I cannot recommend the hotel for any visit.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel just a block away from Times Square also within walking distance of Hells Kitchen and Macy’s. Rooms are small but functional was good to have a fridge you could use rather than just a mini bar. Breakfast can get very crowded however we used the fashion bar and were seated reasonably quickly. Major gripe was with key cards. We had to have ours replaced twice. Extremely frustrating as also used to enable lift to go to your floor.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I’ve just returned from this hotel with my wife after a 4 night stay.Let’s cut to the chase I’ve been reading the reviews on the hotel for the past month and some of the negative ones concerned me. Fear not it’s the perfect base for any type of stay in NYC.It’s clean and very modern from the minute you walk in. The rooms are perfect, clean, bright, comfy bed. Breakfast was busy but we didn’t wait for ages for a table and it is only busy because everyone wants to get out early and see the sites. Check in was fast, we really had no complaints. The location of the hotel is perfect too.To finish the one thing that makes this hotel successful and a perfect choice is quite simply the staff. The staff at the hotel are a very hard working bunch of people. I hope they are told that often.I will be back to this hotel when I return to NYC without a doubt

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The HotelThe communal areas were spotlessly clean at all times. Wifi is fast and reliable.The breakfast restaurants can get very busy at peak times but the food is always good quality and the coffee is lovely! If you're still on European body clock like we were and you can make it down for breakfast as soon as they open at 6:30am it is a much more relaxed atmosphere.The hotel is well located within a two minute walk to times square and only a few blocks from the nearest subway station. You'll be spoilt for choice finding a place for dinner as the hotel is on 'restaurant row'. There are plenty of eateries and bars to chose from with a wide variety of choice. Staff are friendly and helpful and the bellboys are a godsend. The RoomThe bed was spacious and comfortable and the pillows were lovely and bouncy. Bathroom was clean and equipped with a decent hairdryer and complimentary soaps etc. No tea/coffee facilities in rooms. Great views from the higher floors (we overlooked the Hudson river).Nothing negative to report here, we would definitely stay again!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel Nice rooms very clean but maybe smaller than I’m used to Great breakfast but busy at peak times No tea or coffee making facilities in the room but to their credit they let us use the executive lounge for free which was a nice touch , the bellboy is really good at the job ie cabs directions etc Stay here and you’ll have a great holiday

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We are just about to return to England after a 5 night stay at this lovely hotel. We had a fabulous room on the 23rd floor with city views. The room was good, with very comfortable, clean bed and good quality shower. The cleaning was top notch every day. Yes, I can imagine it would be noisy on lower floors, but we brought ear plugs just in case, but, if you're travelling to a big city, then you can't expect peace and quiet. The breakfast was fantastic, with a choice for every taste. We ate like kings each morning. I loved the fruit (which actually tasted of fruit, as compared with some of the tasteless choices available back in the supermarkets at home). There was something for everyone. Yes, sometimes we had to wait 5 minutes for a table, but that really wasn't a problem at all and it could get busy, but no more so than anywhere else we've stayed. The staff were friendly, efficient and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. Pointers to make a great hotel a fantastic one:-1. Tea making facilities in room (an absolute must).2. Mirror above dressing table.3. Two chairs, not the one we were originally given (we liked to sit and watch the world go by from the window).Very close to Times Square, and centrally situated for all the sightseeing attractions. Closeby to subway too. Had a wonderful stay. Would come back here in a flash. There are a couple of Whole Foods Market stores within a 10/15 minute walk of the hotel. Great shop, stocking absolutely everything. Hot and cold food of all varieties which can be selected (from a buffet type of arrangement), and either eaten in store or taken back to the hotel (which we did a couple of times). Good way to save money, as restaurants are expensive. Don't hesitate to book this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On arrival room key card system was not working. This meant security had to escort us to the room. This took hours to resolve. Queue for breakfast ran in front of the lift bank this made a dangerously congested area for several hours every morning. Our room was described as a family suite. It was not what a I would call a suite. It was two bedrooms, a toilet and a shower room joined by a corridor area with a fridge. Misleading to call it a suite. The room was basic but immaculately clean. It was cleaned to a high standard every day. Housekeeping are amazing. We were told we couldn’t use the fashion bar for breakfast - in fact we could!We were told we couldn’t use the club room - in fact we could. More misleading information from the front desk. Concierge are only interested in making sales. The front desk will not help with anything. If you leave laundry in your room they will take it and have it cleaned but not tell you when it’s back or take it to your room. Unbelievable. Location is good.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I surprised my partner on a 4 nights away to New York. We stayed at Riu Plaxa New York Times Square. Amazing hotel and such a great location. We had breakfast included and never had to wait to be seated, great selection on food and the location of the hotel was perfect. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a four day break to NYC. Can categorically say we could not fault this hotel what so ever. Upon arrival, Reception personnel were extremely friendly, I emailed before hand and asked for a high up room as possible, mentioned this at check in and were given a room on the 25th floor, it even had a balcony! Also, the views were fantastic and the room was spotlessly clean. The breakfast is fab with lots of choice, yes busy but we were seated in no time at all. Will be recommending this hotel to friends/family etc. also the location is brilliant too. Should I return to NYC again I would have no hesitation to stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: From the moment we checked in to the moment we left it was a first class stay. We had breakfast included and it was a huge selection which was all cooked well with 2 buffet stations allowing ease and less queuing. The room was well equipped with free WiFi, huge shower and a really awesome mattress. If I had a niggle it was having to use the room key every time you went up in the lift, but such a small annoyance it’s trivial. We highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is located right off Times Square, but is yet not loud. The breakfast served is delicious with a huge variety of food offered and a quick moving queue system. Fabulous hotel. Will defo be back

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked the Riu as we have stayed in this chain before and loved it, this was no different. We had the top floor (28th) with stunning views and just a block away from Times Square. Great location with the subway just a short walk away. We had a deluxe double room and it was spotless and had everything (apart from tea and coffee facilities) you could need. The bed was very large and comfortable with extra pillows if need.We had breakfast included and was buffet style, all you can eat. There was lots to choose from at the beginning of our stay but towards the end there was a little less selection of the hot food. Plenty of fruit and continental choices. One thing was the tables were quite close together making it difficult to get in and out of your chair. You could also get dinner here at $35 with a discount if you were staying there but there are so many restaurants on your doorstep to choose from we didn't bother. There is a bar and coffee shop on site.Reception staff were all very pleasant and helpful, also the door staff who could tell you just about anything you needed to know.We would recommend staying here and top floor if you can stomach looking down is definitely better, much quieter also.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at the RIU Plaza Times Square Hotel for 8 nights at the start of February 2019. The hotel was ok, nothing particularly special - what you would expect from this style of hotel, from a hotel chain. The thing I want to point out is how disappointed I was in the way they cater for guests with food allergies. It really was not ok.I suffer with celiac disease, which means I have to keep gluten out of my diet. If I eat gluten by mistake, it is not like a nut allergy (which can be deadly), but I can be sick for days, sometimes even weeks. Before my trip I checked with the hotel and was told “all RIU hotels offer a range of glutenfree food”. This really was not the truth. At check-in I was told to talk to the servers at breakfast and the people in the restaurants and they would be able to help. The reality was that during the whole trip, I was only offered a couple of pieces of toast and as far as allergies being shown on menus or on the breakfast buffet, there was absolutely no information. It was let to the guest to decide what they could or could not eat, a complete lottery. You took your chance and then saw how your body reacted; good or bad. This was a chance I was not prepared to take, so I had to bring my own food to breakfast and never ate in the restaurant. For people with nut or seafood allergies, this really could be a life or death decision of what to eat.I really expected more from RIU and their hotel in New York. A minimum should be that allergy information is provided. In fact, in most countries – especially in Europe – I am sure this is needed by law. Also there should be some option for people with allergies or wish to eat say a vegan diet. It should not be left to the guest to decide and then without information, you just take a chance. RIU have a duty to their guest, if not through law, but to provide them with information during their stay. It really is not much to ask to give people these warnings and alternatives.From what I saw at the RIU Plaza Times Square Hotel means that I will not use the RIU hotels again, until I can be sure there is food I can eat, or at minimum information that allows me to safeguard my health. Anyone else who has food allergies I would urge you to check, double check and even ask for exact details of what RIU can offer. Don’t be like me, just accept their word, and then arrive and be disappointed, even go hungry because they cannot provide for their guests

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: looks great on the surface, but my room had bed bugs...the housekeeping staff was great, the amenities were good, the breakfast buffet a zoo...and there were bed bugs...I wouldn't stay there again if you paid me to.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a fantastic hotel. We have stayed at various Riu hotels (mainly in Mexico) and this one was definitely up there with them. Upon arriving (late at night) we were automatically given an upgrade to the executive level. Nice touch. the room was very bright and clean with a lovely and very comfortable bed. We were on floor 26 and had great views. The executive lounge had soft drinks and bottles on wine and a few sandwiches and pastries - which was a nice touch. Right in the heart of the theatre district and one block over from Times Square, couldn't be in a more central location. Breakfast in the mornings was great - was a line sometimes but it soon went down - plenty of tables. Would recommend to anyone visiting NYC. we will be back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved this hotel it was immaculate gorgeous modern and had everything and an amazing big breakfast choice so enjoyed staying here lovely staff and so clean definitely will return. The location was fab in times square bus port authority few mins away

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent location for anyone wanting to be in the theatre district of NY. The location is literally in the middle of all the hustle and bustle for any tourist wanting to sample the bright light. If you are looking for somewhere a little more quaint and less 'touristy' this is probably not the hotel for you, but if you want a fantastic location to sample the bright lights, then look no further. Inside the hotel is clean. There are plenty of staff who are all efficient and as helpful as possible when helping with checking in and baggage etc. In the eating areas, the same again, good service, nothing ever felt like too much. The breakfast menu is brilliant and you have an option of eating outside if you have a warm morning. During the evening there are a range of bar snacks and drinks. Cocktails are expensive, but what do you expect from a hotel in such a location? The rooms were clean and tidy and the hotel generally had a modern feel to it. I would recommend for anyone wanting a central location in the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just come back from 5 nights stay. Excellent location, Great service, Great value. Read about breakfast being a nightmare, had no such problems - no waiting and good selection of food, downside No Brown source!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel right next to Time square.Very vibrant hotel. Lovely breakfast selection..the only reason it's not a full on 5 for me would be the information cam b3 hard to get,you have to ask.The hotel information in the rooms are not very informative for foreign guest and it would be nice to be told the nicest places to go and how Best to get the etc.Comfortable rooms.Our view wasn't nice3.We had a roof view but still a great stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just returned from 5 nights at this hotel and were delighted. The hotel is modern, immaculately clean and the location is so perfect. Ideally situated for Times Square, Broadway, restaurants, subway , the tour bus and local shops it’s all on your doorstep. The breakfast was outstanding so much choice and no ques. The staff were extremely helpful and our room on the 26th floor had the most amazing views. The beds are really comfy and very little noise from the city below we slept great , the shower facilities were fantastic too . This hotel offers All you need after a busy day sightseeing. I would highly recommend

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just stayed here for 4 nights and it was fab! I had emailed the hotel prior to request a high up room and they didnt disappoint. We were in 2410 and the view was amazing!The kids loved it!A lovely modern clean room that was cleaned daily to an excellent standard. We couldnt check in until 3 so left luggage with the bellman. We checked in later that day, authorised a $52 resort fee and $200 deposit We were up early our first day and had been told at check in that breakfast was between 7-11, however we were down around 6.45 and found we could eat in the Fashion bar. The selection and service was top class. There was always a long queue for breakfast in the main restaurant which puzzled us as it was the same offerings in the bar. We assumed maybe some people didnt know they had a choice. The hotel was so central it couldnt have been any betterWe checked out on our last day and left luggage again with bellmen. We didnt think we would benefit from the late checkout $40We asked the hotel to arrange a taxi to JFK for us, they advised they dont use yellow cabs but a company called view. They said the price was $75 and this included toll & tips and give you a slip with price on. The slip does state tips not included but i queried this and was reassured it was all in. We were pickedup in a black Suburban, the driver was friendly and chatty but he mistakenly asked for toll charges on top. We advised him the price the hotel had stated was all inc and he apologised for the mixup. We therefore paid the $75 as statedWe would return to this hotel in a heartbeat, it was that good!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just back from 5 nights at the RIU PLAZA and loved it. Great location, very clean and modern hotel with friendly staff. Rooms have mini fridge, large tv, hairdryer and very comfy beds. Just in case you haven't walked enough you can find a gym downstairs, I found it by mistake lol.The staff who attend the door are super friendly and very helpful.If I was to ever return this would be my hotel of choice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very good hotel, fantastic location, super breakfast.Room spotlessly clean and larger than std for NY.Only downside, my credit card was billed before I checked out, sorted by speaking to manager, but should never have happened !!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I found the hotel to be of the highest standard, the staff were all very attentive and were always willing to assist with any queries we had.The room was excellent and well proportioned and being on a high floor had excellent views.The breakfast was excellent and catered to al tastes, and for such a big hotel the speed of service was second to none.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a 4 night stay, 2 rooms booked through BA. Arrived just after 2.00pm requested rooms close together were able to check in but rooms not ready until after 3.00pm. Hotel put a $200 charge on card per room in case of damages. $52 per room resort fee. Rooms on 18th floor not great views but we were not bothered by this especially as we were give rooms next to each other. The rooms are clean and modern a little sparse on comfort but sufficient for sleeping and showering, no bath to soak your weary feet. Great WiFi good speed and included in resort fee. Breakfast was included in our deal, this was a little hit and miss, the food quality is good and if you get in at the right time. You may manage to get a hot breakfast butif you get stuck in the queue anything you put on your plate first is cold by the time you sit down. That said there is a good selection and even the fussiest of eaters will find something. The waiting staff are really nice special mention to Cecil always cheerful. A couple of the ladies that check you in for breakfast were a little rude. The fashion bar, is a great place to have a relaxing drink after a day of sightseeing, I highly recommend the Fashion punch. The hotels location is fabulous just a few minutes walk into Times Square, plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars close by. A good hotel that I would stay in again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed 4 nights at the hotel to celebrate family birthdays. Check in was great-we were very late due to flight delays so didn’t arrive until 1am. Armando was fantastic on the front desk-joking with the kids to cheer them up and really helpful. The room was very clean and although compact, was all we needed for the stay. Fantastic location as we were able to walk to most places we wanted to visit. Would definitely like to come back and stay again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just got back from 4 night stay. This hotel operates with great effieciency for its huge number of guests. Check in and out were simple. Luggage brought to room. Rooms just like the photos. Clean and comfy, great shower. Breakfasts are amazing - great food- every menu option for breakfast covered and eat as much as you want all included in the price. Amazing systems in place to enable guests to be quickly seated and waiting staff constantly and discreetly roaming to clear plates so after eating first course table is cleared by the time you return with next course. Staff efficient, friendly and helpful. Location is great -5 minute walk max to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a fantastic 4 night stay at the Riu Plaza. We arrived in the evening and were quickly checked in and shown to our room which was situated on the 20th floor. We had a great view and even though the room was small it was clean and comfortable with a lovely big shower.Our package included breakfast which was great so much choice and available from 7am till 11am. We ate around 7am during our visit as we were up and ready for the day ahead plus it can get really busy and we did see a queue for breakfast during the later times. Fantastic location for Times Square, Central Park, shopping, shows, lots of lovely restaurants close by and bars too. Would definitely recommend this hotel friendly and helpful staff and we had a fabulous short break.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Read all the reviews left on this site before and they were great and our overall weeks visit was amazing !Staff were great , room was on 27th and great view.Room is normal small type , but lovely bed and TV.Breakfast is everything you could ask for and the hotel is situated where it all happens times square.Would stay here again , so book now !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Situated a block away from Times Square,a clean modern efficient Hotel.The bedroom was spotless and the daily clean left it as you may have just arrived.The room provides a easy to operate safe and plenty of room to store your cases under the bed.a small gym but again clean and well maintained.The breakfast was a hot/cold buffet which would feed a army but avoid the porridge which was a odd consistency and tasteless. The cafe attached to reception is handy for a coffee on the run amongst smoothies etc.The bar was on the pricey side too. Conclusion yes I would come back as it ticks all boxes and it’s priced right.Btw..turn right out the hotel and follow down to the Hudson.a great day to be had on the aircraft carrier ‘Intrepid’ a museum which also houses a space shuttle, submarine and The Concorde..all with tours.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived at hotel where check-in was smooth and efficient.The room(0819) was spacious,clean and everything you'd expect.The safety deposit box was an added bonus,as it was free.Well placed(corner of 46th and 8th),just 150 yds from times Square,it was perfectly placed for attractions and shows.Breakfast was also a bonus,with a great selection and variety.The staff were courteous at all times,and a credit to the hotel.I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family,and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights. Brilliant location. Easy to walk to all midtown Manhattan sites. Public areas very modern and comfortable. The breakfasts were lovely but packed in like sardines if hotelfull. Staff were very efficient and friendly in the restaurant. However when my husband asked the Bar tender for 2 champagne glasses to take to the room he was told he wasn’t allowed to but we could have plastic ones. It was our anniversary so he persevered and he relented eventually. No cooler though and no ice machines. We also asked for a kettle or hot water so we could have a cup of tea. No luck there. No drink making facilities in the room - we really expect to have that for this class of hotel. Room was small but quiet and very comfortable. Shame the little things that can make the stay even better are not addressed. Would stay again but will bring our own kettle and cups next time!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our third trip to New York and also our third stay at this hotel. We chose to go back again as the hotel is fairly new and we know what to expect when staying there.Our visit was for 7 nights early January and we were provided with a high floor room with a balcony (something I wasn’t aware they had). It was a great feature and you could catch the Hudson on a clear day, unfortunately the weather in early January didn’t really allow for us to enjoy the feature.Rooms still clean and tidy and well maintained. The halls are still very stark so noise is a high issue for me due to echos and slamming doors. Overall I cannot fault the hotel and would recommend to anyone travelling to NY. Especially if you want to be close to Times Square and some great bars and restaurants.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked a package deal through British Airways and after a fairly quick taxi journey from JFK we arrived at this big smart hotel. We were upgraded to Executive room which included use of the Executive lounge.The room was on the 26 floor which suited us well and was modern, a large very comfy bed and very good bathroom with large walk in shower, very nice bathroom accessories. All NYC hotel rooms are small, this was but it was plenty big enough for our stay. It was very warm. Breakfast was included, a rarity in the USA, standard buffet style and chaotic due to large amounts of people all up early to get fed and out to see the sites. Ours was a 5 night stay and we liked the hotel for its convenience in “doing the tourist attractions “ it is one block away from Times Square and subway stations are nearby, we used them a lot, or taxis ( pricey) The only downside was the lovely Executive lounge was occasionally exploited by loud over zealous guests ( group of loud young women) who deemed it their role to completely eat and drink all that was provided and leave it in a mess rather than consider other guests! This is no fault of the hotel who every day cleaned it up and replenished the fridges etc.Just bear in mind NYC is very expensive, most meals for two in local area between $80-90, bottle of beer $10-15.If you’re prepared to go further afield to Chinatown or Little Italy meals are better and a bit cheaper. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for quality room, food and location

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A great location for sight seeing in New York. Hotel is spotless and staff friendly. About an hours taxi ride from JFK at 75dollars each way. Hotel keeps luggage secure if you have a late flight included in the price. Around 14dollars a night local charge payable direct to the hotel at check out. Safe included as standard. Lots to do near by. Breakfast is a must with lots of great choice for even the fussiest of eaters. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is located close to Broadway which makes it convenient for shows. Breakfast has a school cafeteria feel with a variety of options. Decor throughout the floors is depressing and looks like areas best left behind industrial double-doors in the bowels of a hospital. The rooms appear to follow a similar no color palate accented with small double-beds.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It appears to be a new hotel, very modern. The hotel is located next to Times Square, close to theaters and muscials! Breakfast is a buffet with a lot of options, very good. An excelent a very good option for a good price!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is very central to the subway and Times Square/Broadway. The room was a good size with excellent views of the city. The hotel was spotlessly clean could not fault it. The breakfast was fantastic set you up for the day we didn’t eat again until teatime. The reception staff I feel let the hotel down as they are not very friendly or welcoming. As the first point of contact when you arrive you would expect nothing less that fabulous service but this was most definitely not the case. The house keeping staff where excellent couldn’t do enough so so friendly. Breakfast hosts not the friendliest either the security and bell boys were superb

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We really enjoyed our time here! The hotel was spotless and all staff very nice no complaints at all. We had a nice room on the 25th floor and had great views of the city. 2min walk from Times Square and a subway. Breakfast was busy but seated quick as staff were well prepared. Overall can’t wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked the Riu Plaza as it was close to Times Square and looked central on the map! It exceeded all our expectations, the hotel was clean, friendly and only 2 blocks from Times Square! Close to Subway too! The breakfast is a buffet breakfast with plenty of choice! The room is adequate, with a lovely rain shower! There is a bar in the hotel which is fairly priced and very friendly! Nothing was too much trouble at all in the hotel! Even down to the business centre, easily accessible and can print your documents! All in all we had the best stay ever in New York, made so much better by our stay at Hotel Riu Plaza, New York Times Square!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were very happy with the rooms and housekeeping. Disappointed that although 3pm check-in time displayed at reception that does not by any way mean you will be able to check into your room. We had to wait until 6pm despite asking many many times. Very disappointing.We had breakfast and dinner included in our package. Dinning was buffet catering to the masses. Breakfast was ok, dinner not so great.Good central location though - close to Times Square, subway etc.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well located hotel to visit all the main attractions either on foot or via the subway. Very clean hotel and helpful staff. Very good breakfast buffet. It was very busy at about 09:00 each day but never overwhelmed with high standards maintained.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a stop over night to kill in New York so why not get into the thick of Times Square. Lots of things to see and do made this a great location. Moderately priced hotel with good amenities. Breakfast is included.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I have been to New York on a Few occasions ,The hotel is in a great location just off 8th Avenue 2 minutes from Times Square .It is a Modern Chic Hotel with Contemporary modern rooms to a good standard , The Staff were Very Friendly and accommodating.The Bonus was The Breakfast included with the rooms which was exceptional, varied and always hot.The concierge were great the only downside is when i booked the Taxi they said it was $75 including tip when i arrived at the Airport,the Taxi driver disputed this and wanted a tip, for the customers maybe the hotel could clarify this issue , I would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a fantastic stay at this Hotel. Stayed at room 2504 amazing views. Plus it had a balcony which was a massive plus. Stayed half board. It was our 10 yr wedding anniversary think this is why we got Balcony room. Think the room was only 1 of 5. We also received a bottle complementary champagne in our room which was a lovely surprise. I would like to also make a special mention to Victor Herrera who looked after me and my wife whilst at dinner during our stay he is very professional in his job but made a lot of time to engage with us top man Gary Rachel Formby Merseyside

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed in the Rui Plaza for 4 nights. The Hotel is lovely and clean. Rooms are basic but clean and that s all you need when visiting New York as you be out so much during the day you just need to sleep there. The Hotel booking includes breakfast and it was brilliant as it saves quite a lot of money. They have a wide variety from your cereals pastries cold meat fruit yoghurt and fry. They offer to keep your luggage on check out day our pickup wasn't until 4 pm so we were able to check out and leave cases and collect when our pick up came. There's a fee of around 50 dollars on check out for fees and they also do a hold of 200 dollars on credit debit card. I used the revolut and they money was back on my card within 3 hours of checking out. It is literally a 3 minute walk info times square from the hotel. There are lots of food places to eat next to it as well. I would stay here again if I went back to New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza New York Times Square at the end of January 2019. Great hotel in a great location just minutes from Times Square and the Broadway Theatre District. Rooms although a little on the small side are more than adequate for a weeks stay. Bed is comfortable and Just what is needed after a long days sightseeing. Bathroom is more than adequate and shower is really good. Breakfast is great and plentiful with a great choice. It can get a little busy at certain times but we never had to wait for a table. A great hotel in a great location and comes highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel, is a real gem!For us Brits, this hotel offers great service, location and breakfast to boot! This was our first visit to NY, and our room 2524 (on the 25th floor!) a queen premium suite was excellent in every way. Clean warm and had everything the traveller could need. It was cleaned every day with the bed being made up as well. The staff were always courteous, attentive and always willing to help. The views from the lift lobby are stunning over the Hudson River, just near where the miracle of the Hudson took place. The hotel is Located on 46th street which is five minutes from Times Square, 42nd street subway station and cross town busses (which were free) we tried to pay every time only to be told by the drivers to sit down! The breakfast was exceptional, varied and always hot. The selection was vide and catered for all nationalities. When there where queues they moved quickly.The subway takes a little to get used to, but is efficient clean and very entertaining. New York, New York so good they named it twice...we will return here and to the hotel again!! Well done chaps, keep up the excellent service, you deserve all the plaudits!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel the room it’s was smaller than what am used to when staying in the states but can’t fault the cleanliness the maids do an excellent job lovely and polite. The breakfast buffet was good nice selection of hot food you do need to get there early though as it gets super busy they said it opens at 7-11am but actually opens at 6:30. The only thing that we couldn’t do till the morning which was have a late check out they said first come first serve, so we went down at 6:30 and said come back at 7:30 I just found it strange you couldn’t do anything the night before.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I booked this through British Airways we stayed for 5 nights We were greeted by reception who were very helpful are bags were taken to are room for us we were on the 20th Floor with lovely view to the street below Breakfast was included it was also very nice it’s a buffet style It’s was my birthday while we were there and they left chocolate and a card I have stayed in New York before at other hotels but this will definitely be my hotel from now on I can’t wait to go back

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Riu Plaza for 5 nights in Jan 19, nice room, friendly staff, right by Times Square and easy to walk to other attractions. Breakfast was superb, lovely way to start the day, plenty to choose from. Hotel lobby was spacious and welcoming, would definitely choose to stay here again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 4 nights with friends and we found the hotel was in an ideal location. It's 3 years old, very clean, smart and tidy with a brilliant buffet breakfast...really good. The rooms were small but we'll equipped with a super king bed and a modern bathroom with a shower.Having 5 lifts meant you never waited long for one. Reception and bellboys were all very good and they stored your luggage securely.It's an ideal base to explore the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location, Location, Location we walked from grand central station here. We were able to check in early and drop off our things. The view is wonderful. The hotel lobby is large and always bustling with activity and so much comfortable seating to accommodate people waiting for their next adventure. The attached bar was a great way to have a drink snd watch the city passing by. We walked to the Moma, rockefellar center, times square is truly steps away. In the evening we walked to the Gershwin to catch a show. The room was comfortable, modern, clean and new. The included breakfast was a bonus. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: hotel was clean breakfast was fantastic plenty of variety and all ways hot and fresh bar was expensive, will definitely go back again and would recommend this hotel ,great location :) .all the staff were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel, we will definitely be staying here again if we return to New York! It is in a great location, just off Times Square and very close to several subway stations, shops and restaurants. The rooms are spacious, modern and very clean. We had breakfast included and it was great, plenty of choice and the food was lovely. All the staff at the hotel seemed really friendly and happy to help with anything you need. When we left we needed a taxi to the airport, the hotel have their own drivers who will take you there for a flat rate of $75 which I thought was acceptable, same price if not cheaper than a yellow cab and much more comfortable!Thanks Riu for a great stay!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Clean, modern style. Nice BR with rain shower. Comfy bed. Attentive, helpful staff. Location, location,location. 46th street is restaurant heaven, broadway shows within a couple blocks. I will is definitely return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was totally impressed with the decor from the minute I walked in lobby, the cleanliness, the friendly staff and the VERY reasonable price, which included a free breakfast fit for a queen! The rooms are sound-proof, could not here the outside world unless I opened window. Loved this place!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Walking into the toasty reception off a very cold side walk, i was pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Lobby, tastefully decorated with ample seating area.The hotel reception staff were a let down, not very friendly and they found it very hard to meet my simple requests, even though i called weeks in advance to secure what i had asked for. It was exceptionally disappointing that i asked to borrow a common power cable to power up my equipment equipment, instead i was referred to Best Buy, this was 11pm in the evening. This was pretty much the theme for the entire 10 days that i was there,You simply cannot beat the location for the Riu Plaza, its minutes away from everything, you are a block away from Time Square, you are RIGHT ON restaurant avenue!Its a fairly large hotel with no less than 400 rooms, so breakfast gets extremely busy. The hotel does not have room service, so be sure to stock up on snacks. The rooms are tiny, but this is what you can expect from any hotel in NYC, bedding could do with a refresh, it felt old and tired. The electrical outlets are limited to US adapters only, a welcomed feature was the USB outlets right near your night stand.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I can’t recommend this hotel enough . From the time we arrived to time we left staff were very helpful and thoughtful.We came to New York for a suprise visit for our daughters 10th birthday the staff on the morning of her birthday gave her a brownie and cream and wished her a huge birthday. So obliging . I e mailed the hotel before my trip to ask if possible if they could try and let us have s room with something iconic to wake up to I will say we had a fab room and loads to see much appreciate it . Breakfast was self serving but was plenty there and if run out they got it for you . All I can say is if we come back we would definitely stay at this hotel again great location just up from Times Square plenty food and coffee shops around . The hotelStaff were very helpful for any questions not one bad word to say perfect .. A ****** Many thanks
user_name:
louise580
North East England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing hotel!! Friendly staff and litterally seconds away from everything!! I would stay here again in a heartbeat! By far the trip of my dreams, short walk to subways, we walked everywhere, and the hotel was simply the perfect location

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We picked the hotel because it was well located and seemed to have a nice offer for its value. We were happily surprised. It’s just a couple of blocks away from Times Square, but far enough to be quite. The view from the room was awesome, and the room was very comfortable and we found it to be decorated in a modern style. The staff was super friendly and so eager to help, they were even measuring food and countertops to review if they were at the right temperature. What can I say... I really loved this place and would recommend it to anyone traveling to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was a great choice! The staff were lovely and hotel itself is very modern. Walked 15 mins from Penn Station to the hotel which is easy to find. Literally 1 block from Times Square which was great. Also the Big Bus tours leave from across the road. Plenty of restaurants and quick food options nearby as well. Bar at the hotel was lovely. The breakfast is buffet and a bit cafeteria style however is incredible value with an array of options to fill you up before exploring the city! Really enjoyed my stay here and will be back.
user_name:
allycemaries
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After carrying out plenty of research (particularly on TripAdvisor) prior to making our booking, we decided on staying at the Hotel Riu Plaza in New York Times Square. We stayed for 5 nights, starting 20th January 2019 and made our booking through British Airways as part of a package holiday.Approximately 10 days prior to arrival at the hotel I contacted the front of house department by email to see if it was possible to stay in a room on a high floor with a view, as we wanted to make it special for our mother who was celebrating her 60th birthday during our stay. I received a reply the same day saying they would endeavour to meet our requests and would make our stay as memorable as possible.Upon arrival we found check-in to be straightforward and efficient. Our booking was found on the system without any problems and the staff went through the hotel general information and services they had to offer, along with the total fees payable at the end of the stay.We stayed in a Deluxe Twin room which consisted of two double beds on the 22nd floor which had great views out of the window (as we kindly requested). The room was spacious, had a modern decor and was clean throughout. The beds were comfortable and never had any trouble sleeping.Breakfast was included with our package which we enjoyed each morning. Getting seated in one of the breakfast rooms was a swift process and there were plenty of staff on hand making sure everything went smoothly. There was a large selection of breakfast items to choose from and when each item was running low members of staff were quick to replenish them.Maid service was carried out each day to a high standard, with bottled water and toiletries being restocked when they were low. We also found the beds made up upon returning to our room after spending the day out.During breakfast on the morning of our mother's birthday members of staff presented her with a hot chocolate brownie with a message reading 'Happy Birthday'. The hotel maids also left a little box of chocolates and a birthday message inside the room. She was pleased and grateful for this and we thought it was a nice touch.Checking out was as efficient as checking in. After having the room deposit returned and paying the hotel resort fees ($13.07 + tax per room per night), we used the luggage storage facility via the bellboy as we had a late flight and did not want to carry our luggage around with us all day. We returned later in the day with our luggage tickets to retrieve our suitcases, tipped the bellboy and made our way back to the airport to head back home.Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Riu Plaza in New York Times Square. The location is ideal and close to many attractions. For those out of walking distance the nearest Subway station is only a few minutes walk away. Staff were friendly, the room more than suited our needs and we look forward to staying again in the future.Many thanks!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and found it to be a very comfortable stay.The rooms were compact but had everything you could need including toiletries, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, free wi-fi etc. We found the bed/pillows perfectly comfortable.The breakfast was included in our hotel rate through British Airways - and it was a fantastic spread. I love my fruit of a morning and was happy to find fresh Blueberries, strawberries, blackberries, pineapple, bananas etc. My partner had the cooked breakfast which he enjoyed, and on my last morning we had smoked Salmon and scrambled eggs. I like my coffee on the milky side so just added a little hot milk which was available. We were always seated quickly- even on the busiest mornings and the breakfast items were replenished quickly. Staff in the breakfast room were polite and attentive at all times.Be aware that there is a tax to pay when you leave - I think ours was $54 for four nights. We were advised of this upon our arrival by a very quick talking receptionist- she asked for our paperwork and credit card a number of times - we just stared at her until we understood, we were not being ignorant- we just couldn’t understand her accent. The hotel is central to lots of tourist sites. The lobby area is inviting- we didn’t have a drink in the bar so can’t comment- but it never seemed busy. We found a bar called Jimmys Corner a short walk away where the drinks averaged about $3 for a draught larger. It was an unpretentious small bar but the drinks were good with some nice company. I can also recommend the Brazen Tavern, the drinks here a a similar price to most of the Irish bars in the area $7 a pint, but this place was a lot more elegant and cosy than the cold plastic Irish bars, there was a cosy lit fire, lots of candles giving off a warm atmosphere- and the young lady serving made you feel nothing was too much trouble for her. It’s on 44th street, give it a go. In all- we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would return and recommend

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, I like the rooms, (no tea/coffee making) but breakfast is a very poor experience. Have stayed here previously two years ago, but breakfast experience spoils this rating. Everything in the food section is cold, bland or both, overcrowded little room to manoeuvre around tables. Like a school canteen. The other dining section on the other side of the lobby was better, but closed this time as 'off season'. Worst was serving tongs for the bacon and sausage left just sitting on top of the food,including the handles, because there were no stands, no thanks. Sitting cheek by jowl with coughing folks. Waitress on first morning when dining room was only 25% full seated us next to the food trash and clearing area, yeah that would have been our first choice!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The clue is in the title ..... BUT breakfast first morning. The restaurant had maybe 10 people in which might be under 10% capacity but never the less we were shown to a seat right next to the bins. I did complain and was offered another seat...next to the seat i was already given. Very very dissapointed. Weve stayed here before and found it okay..... But noticed after the breakfast incident that the staff in the dining room need to be given some serious customer service training

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is well located a short walk from Times Square and close the subway stations on 42nd and 50th streets. We used the subway a lot so it was easy getting to and from the hotel for sightseeing.We were given a room on the 29th floor so had a reasonable view but facing the wrong direction to see any buildings of interest. The rooms are very small so we had to put our suitcases on the bed each morning as there was no room to open them on the floor. The rooms are clean and comfortable. As others have mentioned the frosted glass between the bathroom and rest of the room means that the bathroom light lights up the entire room if anyone uses the bathroom at night.Breakfast was a bit disappointing. Although it was not that busy before 8am and we did not have to wait for a seat the selection of food was limited and often had been sitting out for some time. The pancakes were dried out and had crusts around the edges and the coffee machines seemed to break down regularly. The staff at breakfast weren't overly friendly or helpful either.Overall, this is a good hotel in a great location. If you can get a cheap rate then I'd recommend the hotel but if the rates are high you can find a better hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel, staff welcoming, light airy clean rooms, and good quality breakfast. Ideal location just off Times Square. Reasonably priced late check out but do ask to keep your room when you arrive as there is limited availability. Would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed our stay in New York, mainly because of New York, not this hotel in particular.. although the hotel was nice. Positives: location - close to time square, close to hop on hop off and close to restaurants etc., clean, comfortable beds and pillows, lots of good tv channels, tasty breakie.Not as positive: front desk staff not overly friendly or helpful when you check in... seem to want to rush through the queue, breakfast super busy and tables super close together making breakfast a military operation, bar overpriced and tips expected on top, too hot in hotel, found ourselves using air con to cool room down in January as too loud to open the windows.Overall a pleasant stay but a few areas could be addressed to make this excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The best trip ever! I had never visited New York (or the states before) until December 2018 and it was the trip of a lifetime! The hotel is so central, 5 minute walk you’re in the centre of Times Square, the staff are so attending and helpful, we arrived at around 11pm and were given a room on the third floor (which was fine for us) and the lovely girl on reception told us if we liked we could have changed rooms free of charge to one of the top floors in the morning which I thought was so kind. Rooms are clean, warm, and the breakfast is a great touch, thanks again for a brilliant stay, you made the holiday that bit more special

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza in January, 100% Recommend this hotel, have no complaints, only positives.It is a very busy hotel and they cope very well. Breakfast is a bonus, and gives you a great start to your busy day. We found the bar was expensive but not too extortionate, and only a couple of drinks after a busy day was a well deserved relaxing break.Juan who served us was a genuine person and very professional.The room was always clean, there are comments regarding the glass screen between the bathroom and bedroom, a good tip is to turn the light off in the bathroom and put the nearest bedroom light on, you can still see in the bathroom, and people in the bedroom can't see you.I would defiantly stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel in the midle of New York, next to several theatres. The rooms are clean,confortable, the restaurant with good breakfast and dinner food selection. Fast checkin and checkout. I would defenitly stay on my next visit to NYC

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights for my daughters 21st, we found the room a good size for NY, and well decorated, beds were comfy and view from 22nd floor was fantastic. We never had a problem getting a lift and the longest we waited to be seated for breakfast was a couple of mins, good choice for breakfast. The hotel is in a fantastic position to explore NY, plenty of places to eat and shows right on your doorstep. Found hotel staff friendly and helpful.would defo stay again we had a great time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from 6 nights in hotel.The hotel is very clean and modernWe had a room on the 28 th floor with a great view of the riverThe staff are very pleasant and efficient.Breakfast is excellent only stood in line for a few minutes .its very well organised. The food is very good great choices , everything you would need for breakfast and more.Our room was large,bathroom big great shower,toiletries replenished everyday,clean towels everyday.Highly recommend hotel and will book again for next year.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We came for a short break in January, after landing in Newark and taking the train to Penn station (easy to do would recommend) a short walk up the road was hotel Riu. Check in was quick and friendly and we took to the 21st floor. The view was fantastic although our room wasn’t looking at Times Square the sunset view over looking skyscrapers and busy streets added to the experience, and if I’m honest I loved he view.Room was cleaned everyday, it’s compact as many are but everything was modern and a nice hot shower, good WiFi and it was cosy. A great place to stay with everything 2 minutes walk away from the subway to Times Square and not to miss Hells Kitchen. The bar is expensive so be careful what you order there are plenty of places doing happy hour close by. We would stay again. Thank you Hotel Riu for helping us have a great break

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Love This Hotel Would Highly Reccomend Very Modern And Up To Date Staff very Courteous and attentive very central Time Square within walking distance .Great Coffee Bar .They have added a new Breakfast bar since my last visit all you can eat Buffett great selection .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel seems new, the room are well decorated and so is the bathroom. Breakfast is really good with big variaty and good quality. As the hotel is quite big, the breakfast can be really full at "rush hour". The reception and concierge staff were really friendly. The location is also very good, walking distance from Times square and central park.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Upon arriving to the location, we were greeted by an attendant that instructed us to stand in line to check in. We waited in line for nearly half an hour before a desk receptionist was able to see us. The kind woman was helpful in collecting our information and getting us checked in. She then directed me to the valet service to park my car. The valet attendant quickly took my keys and “parked my car.” My family and I then went to our rooms and inspected for any prior damage so as to bring Any existing damage to the hotels attention before we settled in. I am glad we did- as one of our rooms was an absolute disgrace to the reputation of the hotel. As you will see in the photos that I have attached to this email, there were stains in the sheets, another guests hair in the sheets, and holes speckled the bed sheet. We tried calling the desk to inform somebody and the person on the line told me that they couldn’t help me and instructed me to find somebody in reception. Well, shockingly, I assumed the number I called WAS reception. Nonetheless, I went downstairs again to inform somebody. Nobody was available at the desk. Instead, we found another sleeping arrangement for our party that was occupying two separate rooms- each containing two beds. We made it work. After we fixed our arrangement, I walked downstairs to head out for an evening in the city. I found my car running on the side of the road. I recognized it right away by the license plate number. A black Audi Q5... I quickly ran BACK into the hotel desk and demanded to speak with somebody. The valet attendant scolded me and told me that they have been “waiting on me for HOURS to pick up my vehicle!” I meekly and embarrassingly stated that I had “dropped the vehicle off for valet and I am not leaving until tomorrow.” I pulled out my valet ticket and as he looked, he rolled his eyes and picked up his phone to contact a driver. He assured me the vehicle would be taken care of properly. I then carried on with my night.Upon check out the next morning, I tried to explain my families experience to the service desk. The woman behind the desk frantically began “searching our information” in the computer. I simply stated to her that I would handle the situation myself and contact the appropriate people (as I am doing in this email). We then moved to the valet area and requested that we have our car returned. We waited well over 45 minutes for the return of the vehicle. During the interim period, we were sitting in an area by the door with our luggage- eagerly, yet patiently. Suddenly a man appearing to be of some authority(manager maybe?) approached us and boldly told us to “stand up and move from the seating area.” Adversely, we stood, collected our belongings, and stood outside while we waited for the car to be returned. The valet driver returned with our car and would not allow us to put our belongings in the vehicle. Instead, I was faced with a communication barrier that made me feel as though my own vehicle was being held hostage from me.I have to say- I have traveled many, many places and stayed in NYC many times. I have never experienced such terrible customer service. There was quite literally ONE person that was delightful to speak with. I wish I could remember her name. The rest of our experience was simply awful. The bed was dirty, the attendants throughout the hotel made me feel as if my family was a burden. We did not feel welcome at all. I truly do no wish to return to this location and I will not encourage anybody to stay there.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time in New York and chose this hotel based on reviews and price.Our room was on the 29th floor which only had about 6 rooms on it so corridors fairly quiet. Quite a lot of road noise which didn't really bother us after a couple of nights but be aware the fire department is over the road one block up so got awoken by sirens a few times. Room was as expected..adequate for what we needed and a very comfy bed!We had half board. Which I wouldn't recommend unless you're on a very tight budget. We only ate at the evening buffet twice as found there not to be much choice and what there was was cold after a couple of minutes ( perhaps it would help if the were heated),Plenty of good restaurants round the corner instead!Breakfast was OK but as in previous reviews a bit like a cattle market most mornings.Not enough space for the amount of people really.All in all thee hotel was good value for money as a bed and breakfast deal but not half board.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stopped at this hotel rooms are bit small thought they would have been larger for the price there charging per night . It’s location is great near time square and reception area is nice . Rooms were cleaned everyday and staff are helpful . New York was great lots to see and do will definitely be going again .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location plus an amazing breakfast! Perfect for theater District, time square area or Rockefeller center. Hell’s Kitchen area so many choices for restaurants and bars. Very friendly staff!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very friendly & helpful staff, good food & lovely, clean rooms. This is a great hotel & I would definitely recommend it/go back again! The elevators are a little strange though. You might find yourself waiting a while, or go up & down a few times when trying to get to a particular floor but other than this you can’t fault the hotel at all. Great stay!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time to NYC picked this hotel due to location and reviews. We had a bit of a mis hap with room upon arrival but management swiftly sorted this by upgrading our room to a higher floor . Floor 26 with executive lounge benefits. I would certainly book one of these rooms again it's a suite so worth it. Hav8ng said that all rooms are clean and comfortable. Fantastic showers, fridge tv all u could want. Breakfast added bonus. Times Square round the corner and subway. We purchased a metro card for our 5 day stay . You can however walk to quiet a lot and we did A lot of "walking" going home for a rest. We have stayed in Riu hotels before they are always FANTASTIC. Could not fault really really good we will recommend to outhers and when returning to New York will book here in a executive room thank You Riu and all your wonderful friendly staff. Going home today xx gracias thankyou ...

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Have stayed at other RIU hotels and found this hotel to be as good if not better!! The hotel and rooms are spotless,the hotel staff was great!, The convenience to the theater's, midtown and Times Square,make this the perfect location for staying...The rooms were a little small, but had all the amenties you could need..If lucky enough to get a room on the higher floors you have great views of the city...Looking forward to a return stay at the Hotel Riu Plaza!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Okay, this is a decent hotel for its price. It is clean and tidy, and has good breakfast. But a piece of advice- you rather want to check in early than later. Arrived in NY at midnight, no one helped with the luggages. Two guys saw me struggling with multiple bags and none of them offered to help; instead they watched me drop my stuff at least three times until I had to ask for help in which the guy answered saying that the conceige reopens at 8am and theres nothing that he could do to help. So, with my luaggage, I managed to reach the check in desk where I struggled again to check into the room and was left helplessly at the hotel lobby for 30 minutes. One amazing staff, I think his name is ‘Amandro’, however, intervened and proceeded with the check in which literally took less than five minutes and helped with the conceige (i thought it reopened at eight am but apparently not and mind you, it was the very same guy who told me conceige was closed) Overall, it is a decent hotel but Staying at this hotel twice at different times I have received mixed service. For its price, I guess I shouldnt expect too much of service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in different Riu in all those islands in different time , so intend to try out this Riu built in 2016 , this is my second time stayed in this hotel , you can have vacation feel even in this crazy big Apple , my deluxe room was much better than the regular room, bathroom bigger & more neat , special love the big balcony, wish I can see the blue sky too, if the room has coffee machine will be prefect , appreciated that I got 2 bottle of water in room, so I won’t be going crazy at night looking for water to drink ! The buffet breakfast not too bad, but flooding a refugee camp at 9 am, lacking management team work , the peoples who were working there like 1/2 dead, compare the $35 dinner buffet, you will rather pay to enjoy it , cause it’s more elegant & classy , more choices & selection! I will come back to this hotel, but not sure should try out breakfast!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel situated right in the heart of everything really. Room was a good size, bathroom was lovely and shower was fantastic. Hairdryer in the bathroom which worked well. Bed was really comfy. Easy walking distance to many attractions and the subway. Times Square is very close. We were on the 18th floor and there was some road noise but nothing that bothered us, we slept well every night. Breakfast was average but it was edible and included in the price so can't complain too much. Staff very friendly. This was our view from our room. Would stay again when returning.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
