review_body: From the moment we arrived to our departure everything was so smooth. The hotel is located a few steps from Times Square with many restaurants and shopping right on your doorstep. Our room was located on the 5th floor and was large, airy and bright with a lovely bathroom. The only criticism would be there was no kettle or coffee facilities. The breakfast was very good with so many different choices, all fresh and nicely presented. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning to New York in the near future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here 1 - 5 January 2019 with wife and 2 children ( 12 and 6) . Very clean and comfortable room . Every member of staff we engaged with was very friendly and couldn’t have been more helpful. The location is perfect for seeing the City and I would have no hesitation in going back here and recommending the hotel to anyone. Do book trips through the concierge very knowledgable .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a room with a view to our liking with a roomy closet and bathroom rooms. Loved the lounging areas in the well designed lobby. In our package was included a fabulously delicious breakfast and dinner. I would have been satisfied not to have left the hotel it was so interesting.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights. Great location, nice hotel. Little touches like fridge, water and toiletries in room all lovely but tea and coffee facilities would have been a welcome addition. Room comfortable and maid service excellent. The buffet breakfast was great. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Where do I start on this wonderful hotel......The location is fantastic right on top of broadway and Times Square as well as all the tourist locations, it is clean and the rooms are great the shower is amazing and the bed is so comfortable the only thing i would suggest is they provide a kettle to make tea and coffee etc as it could be placed on top of the fridge as there is enough room for it.The breakfast is really nice a good variety to choose from cooked breakfast and bagels and toast and pastries and a good selection of hot and cold drinks, if it is your birthday they get notified by reception and they bring out a chocolate brownie which says Happy Birthday which is such a lovely gesture and really thoughtful plus it tastes great :)The reception team do a great job they are friendly and helpful and are always there to attend to your needs they are a credit to the hotel as well as the cleaners they are amazing and do such a good job they deserve a medal for some of the things they have to put up with.New York is amazing but it has got so expensive for food and drink in the hotel a vodka and lemonade is 17 dollars and a beer is 9 dollars so be aware! but even outside the hotel the alcohol is expensive and everything is plus tax, a packet of 20 cigarettes is 16 dollars so best to buy some at the airport. You must take a trip to woodbury common outlet shopping centre it is an hour away from Manhattan and you can buy tickets for 42 dollars return from Port Authority bus station or from the sight seeing ticket operators which are on every street near Times Square you will also receive a voucher book on arrival to use whilst shopping. If you get time have a travel on the subway to the Yankee stadium in the Bronx it is great any single journey on the subway is only $3 but be aware of all the buskers and singers and people asking you for money on the subway there are alot but after a while you get used to them.Macy's is amazing got some great bargains and very cheap in there for clothes and bags etc but only if they are in the sale.All in all an excellent trip and New York and everyone there is amazing it is such a happy place and I made some very special memories there, and I would most def stay at this hotel again they provide a wonderful luxury place to stay in. Well done Riu xx

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu plaza is a great hotel with a great location.The hotel offers a great breakfast and clean rooms. Location is the key of the hotel it’s located right near Times Square and to all major attractions.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic hotel, modern, very clean, and beds are comfy!We had breakfast included, a full buffet available and it was delicious with loads of choice.Easy to get to via bus from Newark, and a perfect location to get around from. We walked mostly, but there were subway stations close by for easy access. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel comes highly recommended if you wish to stay within easy access to everything in NYC.Getting to the hotel from JFK Airport was very straightforward and it took about one hour. I boarded the Airtrain to Jamaica station ($5), then took the E subway to 50th Street ($2.75 single trip) and walked the four blocks (5mins) to the hotel. I purchased a week's unlimited pass at $32 as this was more cost effective for my stay in NYC. Please beware... do not purchase your Metrocard from the vendors at the kiosk, use the machines instead. They are nothing but hustlers and will rip you off in tips. They claim to save you the extra dollar charged for a new metrocard, but charge you more in supposed tips. I was given $3 less (with no explanation) after I'd purchased my cards and when challenged, was told it was taken as tips. Tips? For a one second transaction? Jokers... they prey on your naiveté.On arrival at the hotel, I walked into a very clean and welcoming lobby and I didn't wait too long to be seen by the front desk.The first room I checked into on the 16th floor was unsuitable as it was too bright. I was then moved to a room with a balcony and really nice view on the 25th floor, but this was also tricky; gaps in the balcony door caused on-going eerie whistling as it was quite windy.Back down I went. I explained the situation to the receptionist who quickly found me yet another room on the 21st floor, which was absolutely perfect.  I must commend the receptionist, Moyur Ahmed (real asset to the company) as he dealt with me with genuine care throughout my stay at RIU Plaza. Nothing was ever too much trouble for staff at RIU Plaza, as I later found out.The room was extremely clean, comfortable and warm, with easy to read temperature control. The bathroom was of a good size and the shower was effective and powerful. Complimentary toiletries and mineral water were replenished daily.Six unbelievably fast elevators service all 28 floors, which was great as I was so high up.Breakfast was always very busy, but queue times well managed. The food was always fresh, tasty and constantly replenished. I didn't like the Minute Maid apple and orange juice from the dispenser though... tasted like it was laden with artificial ingredients.I didn't have dinner at the hotel, so I am unable to comment on the food or service. I ate out everynight as there are so many lovely restaurants in the area. Check out OBAO Thai/Vietnamese between 45th and 46th Street... the Catfish claypot is absolutely amazing. I also didn't use the gym, but I did see that it was well equipped.After checking out, I actually sought out the duty manager to thank her in person, as I was really impressed with my stay at the hotel. Well done RIU Hotel... I now look forward to staying at your other hotels and resorts worldwide.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a great find in an awesome location! Loved the clean, sleek design of the efficient bedroom and bathroom. I especially loved the shelf under the sink for storage! Wish more hotels did this! The complementary breakfast was superb...very fresh and it offered everything you could possibly want. One night we went to the bar adjacent to the lobby for a nightcap; very relaxing. The elevators were fast, so we rarely needed to wait for one, even though we were on the 27th floor with a great view of the Hudson River.After reading the other reviews I wish I had mentioned we were celebrating my birthday with this visit! Oh well - maybe next year!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I came into the city to see a couple of shows and ended up at this hotel for the evening. The location was absolutely perfect, just two blocks away from Times Square. There are several great restaurants nearby, and Port Authority was just 4 blocks away. Check in was so easy. The staff was lovely to deal with, from the doorman to the front desk. The room was perfect for what I needed and I had a fantastic view into the theatre district. I especially appreciated the hotel being so accommodating with a change I needed to make with my original booking. I will absolutely book here next time I stay in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was a part of our vacation package from Southwest Airlines. Turns out it was perfect for our four day stay. The location could not be better, right in the heart of Broadway, surrounded by theaters and great restaurants. Our room was very comfortable, the staff went out of their way to be helpful and the complementary breakfast was fresh and tasty, with a nice variety. Next time in NYC I'll try to make reservations there!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here in January for 6 nights for my 40th birthday. It is a lovely, modern hotel that offers a great breakfast. I cannot fault this hotel and the location is excellent. The staff took note that it was my birthday and had a little cake for me after breakfast and also left a little box of chocolates in the room for me in the afternoon. Nice touch. :-) I will definitely stay again when I visit in the future. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked this break sometime ago and it was all we had hoped for. Decided on yellow cab from JFK and although we could have done it cheaper we were soon at the hotel. Met by a concierge who took our cases, welcomed us and took us to check in. Very simple check in process and shown to lift.Given a room on 29th floor which was incredible. Spent the first 10 minutes staring out of the full length windows along 8th Ave and the surrounding area hypnotised by the fantastic views. You’ll soon get your bearings here. Only 200 yds from Times Square with all the theatres on your door step. The buffet breakfast which was part of our package was fantastic. The selection and quality was very good, and though I’ve read other reviews to the contrary we never queued for a moment.Very impressed with staff here who always had a smile or a kind remark, and would have no hesitation in staying here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here as a couple for my birthday in December. Lovely hotel, great location and lovely staff. Breakfast was really good and we even had a bottle of champagne and some chocolates in the room for my birthday. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Staying at the Riu Plaza Times Square was OK. It was early December and the location suited us for visiting all the main attractions. Check in was concerning as we were advised that if you’re not at breakfast for 6am it might be difficult (and then the receptionist cackled and said “you’ll see why!!”). I’m not a morning person but I got up at 6am for the first few days and we just managed to get a seat at breakfast. The latter few days we just gave up and went to a diner, which defeats the object of paying for breakfast. The queues into the dining room actually blocked access to the lifts in the morning so this side of things was a little chaotic and poorly thought out. The room was actually ok for NYC. Cleanish (some hairs in the bed) and water was meant to be restocked every other day but never was during our week despite mentioning it to reception several times. If you’re not travelling with your partner then please don’t shower with the bathroom light on as it’s quite a show you put on through the glass wall into the bedroom. Mildly embarrassing even with my partner. General feeling that staff really weren’t interested at all. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and I asked the concierge for any recommendations for places that stand out nearby. The response was “if the restaurant is near here it will be good”. So no recommendations? I asked? “No, just choose one you like the look of”. Not exactly helpful. We were on the 28th floor, an upgrade if you book direct with a Riu was promised but that didn’t materialise. Even that high up there was plenty of noise from traffic and sirens (it’s to be expected in midtown) and after the first few nights I got used to it and slept. Would I stay here again? Probably not. But it was a most memorable holiday in an amazing city.
user_name:
N0rthumbrian
Northumberland National Park, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here with my 2 daughter's for 3 nights. The hotel is in the best location just round the corner from Times Square. The hop on hop off bus is just opposite the hotel. I expected the rooms to be small after reading some reviews but they are a good size and the frosted glass in the bathroom is not a problem as all that can be seen is a slight shadow. The rooms are very clean and comfortable.We only queued for a couple of minutes at the most each morning for breakfast. There is plenty of choice from cooked breakfast to pastries bagels fruit yogurt and cereal etc.The staff are very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 3 nights at the Riu Plaza at the beginning of January on a fun girls trip. This hotel was the perfect location for getting everywhere we wanted to go! Easy walking to Times Square, 30 Rock, shows, etc. the hotel was very nice! We loved the breakfast buffet and the dinner buffet was also fantastic! Every employee we encountered was wonderful & friendly. The bar in the lobby was great! If I ever make another trip to NYC I will absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Writing this on my first night (out of five):On our booking and at check-in we asked for a quiet room.At check-in we were given two options "room with a view or quiet" (which is an odd way to put it, vut alright...). We said quiet. We went upstairs, got into the room, dropped our stuff and left to explore NYC.When we came back later today we realized the room (2006) has connecting doors with the room next door (2005). People next door are not loud, but even speaking at regular speaking volume it sounds like they're inside our room. Makes it impossible to sleep.Called frondesk and they say they don't have one single room that they can change us to. Not sure why a hotel would expect us to believe this. I do not.They say it's only possible to apply tomorrow for a room change...It baffles me that we were check-in to a room with connecting door with the guarantee that it was a quiet room.Pathetic.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice stay in New York. Hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. Location was perfect ! Close to everything that any one would want to see. The rock, time square, and Broadway. Don’t think twice on booking this hotel you won’t regret it !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza in Times Sqaure the past few nights and our stay was totally flawless!We drove and getting into the city/ to the hotel was easy peasy (we are not from a big city and this was our first time in NYC) As soon as we pulled up there was valet waiting for us (totally un arranged) this was 120$ to park for both nights and worth every penny considering all other parking is very comparable and you have to find it your yourself, etc.We had the dinner buffet the first night and it was great for the value and included labr and salmon, both freshly carved by a chef, a salad bar and over a countless hot and cold dishes! Something to please everyone.Breakfast buffet was the same.. even better I would say and was included with the stay!The hotel itself was 2 blocks from times square.. about a 5 min walk.Staff were all super friendly from start to finish!Hotel was very tastefully decorated, plenty of storage/space in rooms.. Only complaints (if any)would be no coffee maker in room and could hear quite a bit through the rooms.. luckily we had quite neighbours :)Would recommend and come back in a heart beat! :)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location with Times Square and the theatres only a few blocks away. Always clean and tidy. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Breakfast was busy but well stocked and tasted great. There is the fashion bar located next door which was always a good place for a quiet drink after a busy day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The overall experience from walking through the doors, receptionist excellent, breakfast service extremely helpful and happy even a song or too. Only one little thing the female concierge could have been more helpful seem to rush you, would definitely recommend this Hotel Riu Plaza to all our friends and family x my husband and I are both over 60 years very young at heart, 27th floor was fantastic xx

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect Location, Perfect hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and couldn't do enough. Everything was perfect. Would 100% chose to stay here again. Views from the 25th floor were outstanding.Didn't have anything bad to say.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good location close to Times Square. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was a good size for New York. The free breakfast was great and had s good selection, it could get busy but you’d expect that from a large hotel. The only downside was the shower leaked all over the floor.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived on Boxing Day early afternoon and were able to check in although our rooms were on 2 different floors which wasn’t a problem. Ours was on the 27th floor out of 28 so decent views from the floor to curling windows. Location is great. Loads of restaurants and bars. 1 block off Times Square. Rooms a decent size and bed comfy. No tea/ coffee facilities butt coffee shop downstairs although we used Dunkin Donuts over the road as Latte etc $2.00 on an afternoon. We had breakfast in with our rate. Breakfast was good plenty to choose from. Also had dinner buffet 1 night which was decent too. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have stayed at Riu hotels in Portugal and the Carribean and have always been happy so when we decided to go on a 14 day cruise from New York this Hotel was the right decision to make. Great location, pleasant staff, excellent buffet spotless room

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having stayed at the RIU brand of hotels at various locations globally we decided to stay at the Plaza Times Square, what a fantastic locationRoom were spotless and very comfortable and the breakfast meant a great start to the daywe had a clubroom on the 26th floor which meant we had access to the club lounge which was great with coffee, snacks and wine Right opposite there was playwrights bar, great beer and food although all around eating places and bars pretty much everything you could want i have to mention Christian (bell boy)not sure if that the right title but a great help
user_name:
Darren K
Ebbw Vale, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A really good stay in the Riu Plaza over the New Year holiday.Rooms were of a fair size and totally adequate for our needs. This is a busy hotel but very efficient from check in breakfast service to check out and baggage storage.Location is very good with Times square a short walk away and entrance to the subway 2 streets away. Restaurants and bars are all close to the hotel.Staff are always happy to help and many do so with a smile on their faces.A good barometer for a hotel is if i would stay there again and I certainly would.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing hotel with amazing staff, make sure you say hello to Cecil at breakfast ❤️ it's like being at home but not. Can't recommend enough, we are now looking at hotel riu in Arruba/Jamaica due to the staff and ppl we have spoke to in new york. Go, it won't disappoint.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and myself stayed here for a week at the beginning of December from the moment we arrived we loved this hotel. Firstly it is an ideal position for exploring New York, two minutes walk from the centre of Times Square. The hotel is very modern and looked lovely with all the Christmas decorations, the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean with very modern decoration, the bathroom was huge for a city centre hotel with big walk in shower, everything was provided hairdryer, fridge, ironing board and iron and free, yes free safety deposit box and a full size TV on the wall. The lifts are a little temperamental and get very busy at breakfast time, it was so bad one day we actually found it quicker to walk 17 floors down to the ground floor. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis, it is a buffet service and the food was very good and lots of choice, the restaurant was perfectly positioned by the sidewalk so you can watch the world go by whilst enjoying your breakfast. Again the restaurant gets very busy at certain times and the food is not particularly set out very well so it is chaos at times, it was not helped that the pastries are above the hot food which if you are short is actually difficult to reach but also you then have to get in the huge queue for hot food to just grab a croissant, or if you push in face the wrath of the people in the queue. We also went into the bar a couple of times, again this is very nice and comfortable. All in all a wonderful hotel, definitely would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just around the block from Times Square. You can’t go wrong with this hotel. Hotel and rooms very clean. Breakfast was ample. Staff polite. Location was fantastic. Highly recommended. Booked through TUI so transfer was included.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a gem of a hotel, the location is perfect, the staff are amazing, so friendly and nothing is a problem for them even on New Years Eve hen the placed was fully booked, always smiling and on hand to get you what you need, even the guys in the foyer would run to main road to grab you a taxi.Breakfast was great and surprisingly the drinks were cheaper than outside of the hotel.Perfectly situated for all the attractions.A big thank you to all the staff and we will be coming back this year!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I’ve stayed here the first time. Everything was perfect, check in and out fast, room was spotless clean as well as all public areas. Breakfast is served until 11 am. Great choice of hot and cold food. The entire staff is more than friendly and helpfully. Thanks a lot.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Clean, roomy ( New York roomy) convenient, and the breakfast was excellent, real eggs, salmon, bacon, sausage, pancakes, and oatmeal was delicious. Staff was terrific, they more happy and willing to please than anywhere I have ever stayed in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a very nice hotel that is very well situated for Times Square and the Theatre District.The staff are fantastic, Breakfast is excellent, the Bars are great although be careful with prices.Corridors can be a little noisy.Great WiFi and very very clean and tidy.Will definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just got home today from a 2 day, short stay at this hotel. The hotel was beautiful! This location was perfect. A short 1 minuet walk down the street lands you right in Times Square. The hotel was very clean, modern, and just stunning. I did not eat the breakfast, but my husband and kids said it was very crowded and gross. We walked right down the street to Bond 45 for bf and it was so delicious and beautiful inside. Must try Prazteria Perfect Pizza also right down the street walking towards TS. We enjoyed our stay so much.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is centrally located - not too far from Times Square but far enough from most of the tourists. Although, there are a lot of tourists that stay at this place. Check in was like a resort, especially since there is a resort fee to stay here. There are a lot of people and rooms in this hotel, so getting up and down the elevators can take a while. The rooms are very small, but they are functional. The beds were pretty comfortable and the restrooms were basic. In fact the toilet was so large I could fall in. Dinner and breakfast can be included in the room price. The spaces are so large they cater to a lot of people. Be sure to get there early since there are a lot of tables and the lines for the buffet can be long.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the RIU in NYC nice rooms and pleasant staff and a nice free breakfast. It is in a great location near Times SQuare and if you want to catch a Broadwa Play. The rooms were clean and we were on the 26th flood and had a great view the the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great stay...terrific staff...bar a little pricey but New York as a whole a little bit pricey...great location, would certainly return.A word of caution...you must go down for breakfast early as it can get very busy...

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Room small, but to be expected excellent bathroom.Food was terrible only managed to see waffles and pancakes twice.Perhaps more cafe machines always broken and cheap coffee not one real brew.Hotel is in a great Location and the bright lights of Times Square are blocked about by good curtains.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our 2nd night there we were woken up by the fire alarm and a member of staff who had no idea what was going on!Apart from that, the hotel, food and cleanliness where amazing.We were here for Christmas and it was beautiful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We truly enjoyed every minute of our stay at Riu in Times Square. It is located on “restaurant row” with everything from a Saki Bar to a steakhouse to a jazz supper club! The hotel staff was as helpful as they were delightful. Breakfast was plentiful and well organized. We had the opportunity to also interact with the maintenance staff (showed us how to use the sink plug) and shared a good laugh with them. And security was helpful in rescuing our chocolate cake from the Sugar Factory (only 2 blocks from hotel) when we left it in our room after checkout. Our family of 5 was thrilled to find a room to accommodate all of us with two queen size beds and a sleeper sofa. We will definitely consider staying at this property again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Decided to have a week away before Christmas arriving back on 23.12 Hotel was very central and ideal for sightseeing and visiting shops. Weather was cold and one day very wet, rained all day. A little disappointed with service at reception on a number of occasions, not the service level you expect from American Hospitality although service in the restaurant was excellent at all times, bar service was also good.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Please do not be but off the room size most NYC rooms are small. WE a good time excellent breakfast (just right for a Buffet) Sevice in all area was perfect. Location you walk to most mid and uptown things you need to see or all stations

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights . The location is excellent and when we arrived the staff were great , sorry have no names but the bellboy and the receptionist were very friendly and helpful .. the hotel is very clean and I thought the breakfast was very good The only downside was no kettle or tea making facility in the room, and after 9 pm you couldn’t get a hot drink in the hotel, small thing but would have made such a big difference Also there was a fire alarm when we were there , nice to know there are tannoys in the rooms, not sure that the person using it knew what he was doing , you could here him turning it on but not saying anything , we were on the 27th floor and ended up phoning reception to see what was happening .. luckily it was a false alarm but had there been a fire minutes could have been lost , I feel more training could be a good idea .. Overall a great hotel , would stay again and would recommend it to friends and family

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A VERY TRUE REVIEW.The room is clean, the bed confortable and it is a 2 minutes walk to Time square. Awesome location. The breakfast is good, not great, but good. Downside: The parking is not included, so it 40$ USD per day. The personal who works there, really don’t care about you. ( Except Samuel at the front desk...who is utter perfection. Give this man a raise.) When we get there, we had a lot of complications. I booked with a different credit card. DON’T EVER DO THAT. So they told me: « We have to cancel the reservation you did, because you don’t have the old credit card with you. » So, they told me I need to pay our stay...a second time.(They say, they will refund me in 6-7 business days) Really???? Johanna was rude and not helpful.(Manager) WoW!!!!We had a bottle of champagne in our room, I asked the general manager if I can have two glasses in our room. To celebrate my wife and I. Her answer was: « NO! »I said why??? She said: « Because we are here to make money!!! » « You are aloud to buy a bottle at the bar. » Thanks to you Christina, but I don’t mind paying...but can I have some great options, at least. Not your bad and cheap sparkling wine. ( Veuve Clicquot, Dom Pérignon, Crystal, La palme d’or of Nicholas Feuillatte)So, I went outside to buy some glasses and came back to our room. I WILL NEVER GO THERE EVER AGAIN. This hotel staff is by far, the worst I ever seen. They do not represent the excellence of the true core values of the Riu. I hope some one from the head office, will read this. Score 4 out of 10. So sad. Best regards Hans Guenin

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I stayed Christmas week at the riu plaza hotel. It was a great place to stay walking distance to many sites and easy access to transport. The rooms were very comfortable and quiet. If possible stay in a junior suite it’s great views from the high floors and the executive lounge you have access to was excellent. The lounge was well stocked and we enjoyed afternoon tea ,coffee or a glass of wine with a snack each afternoon after our exploring of New York. Breakfast was efficiently organised with quick seating and a large variety of food to chose from. I am looking forward to staying at other riu properties.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Having been to New York several times this hotel is by far the best we have stayed in. Hotel is spotless in every area and really modern. Our room was a good with a lovely view, it was a fair size and the bathroom was great. Location was spot on 2 min walk to time square. Staff were all fantastic always smiling and so helpful with any questions about the hotel or area. We had breakfast included which is quite rare in New York and it was brilliant. Plenty to choose from and yes of course at times it was busy but the longest we had to wait for a table was 3 minutes. Thank you riu plaza for a truly wonderful stay, if I ever get to come back to New York this is where I will be staying :)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: In the heart of the city. Great rooms. Very modern. I had great views of the hud son from the 18th floor. Great breakfast, definitely sets up up for the day with the variety given. The concierge Ronald is a legend. He knows the city like the back of his hand and always willing to help.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great stay. Love the all inclusive meals. BreKfast and dinner buffet. It would be great to include a drinks package.Great to have an in room fridge but no tea & coffee facilities. I had to pay $2.50 upwards for a cup of tea.Beds are very comfy.Great location toTime Square and the theatre district.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights just before Christmas. It was easy to find and is right around the corner from Times Square. You can pretty much walk to anywhere from the hotel which is great. There is also a Pret A Manger and Dunkin’ donut right opposite which is really useful. We stayed on the 23rd floor which had an alright view but mainly of buildings which are taller. The room itself was fine, a little small perhaps but manageable. I wish it felt more homely, it felt a bit corporate and not overly welcoming but the bed was nice and waterfall shower was great. The aircon unit was incredibly loud (we weren’t using it) and would turn on and off all night making lots of noise. My husband didn’t notice but it bothered me slightly.Food wise, breakfast is included which is a massive bonus for the city. We stopped by twice and it was alright, a bit average and very crowded but a good way to start your day in nyc.It’s a nice stay for location but I think when we return we might try to find another hotel as it was an average price for New York standards.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here during our last 4 days of our holiday - bought the package that included breakfast - it was very good and was a quick in and out - very modern and we were able to check in earlier than the specific time as they had a clean room - we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well what to say but awesome. This hotel is such a good choice. It is exactly 5 minuets from time square. The staff are awesome friendly and polite. Breakfast was great such a good choice. You do have to pay a $100 when checking in just Incase you break anything. Your rooms are cleaned every day. Forget any reviews about the waiting time for a table,we waited minutes if that. If you go to the restaurant in the main bar. The other one is busy. A glass of wine is $10 a beer is $8. The bell boys and concierge are awesome. The reception staff are friendly and friendly. I always have to stay in good places and this is the best place to get the service. The only reason for not staying here next time is purely to experience a different part of New York. The financial district.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very good hotel, close to midtown Manhattan, excellent position for doing the sightseeing trips.Lovely rooms, nice clean hotel, staff friendly and very helpful, for me bed was a bit hard, but that’s personal preference.Only criticism would be food and drinks a bit too expensive in my opinion.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just had a superb few days in NYC and that was helped by this hotel being so good. Location wise it is excellent on 8th Avenue, close to Central Park, Times Square. Broadway, Madison Square Garden to name a few. Room we had was 27th floor and view was out of this world down 8th Ave. Spacious, clean and very comfortable. Only thing I would say was, if they put a kettle and brew kit in that would have made it even better. Breakfast was good, all you can eat really, so set your day up with nice food and away you go. Does get busy but you get seated quite quickly, thanks to people like the lovely Diana.All staff are excellent, very helpful and will all they can to make your stay as good as they can.Thank you Riu Plaza , we will see you again in the future I promise.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was a great location as ot was very central rooms are very clean it was a little loud outside but nothing that kept us awake cannot fault it at all the only let down was when we arrived when after being on such a long flight we just wanted to get into our room but we had to wait over 3 hours to get in which was dissapointing however cannot fault anything else in the hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the riu plaza in 2 weeks ago, and I must say I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a modern, clean and excellent location while in new york. From the minute we got there (the man who took our bags for us was amazing, made us feel very welcome and definately knows how to put a smile on people's faces) check in was quick and easy, we were on the 18th floor and had an amazing view and hardly any noise. The room was outstandingly clean and modern, bed was comfortable and a mini fridge in one if the cupboards which had water in, this was meant to be topped up every other day, however I found sometimes it was missed. It was a nice touch but could of been better if stocked up regularly. There also wasn't any coffee making facilities in the room, not too much of a problem for us but might be for some people. These are the only had things I can say about this hotel really. Check out was quick and the hotel will hold your bags for the day if your flight isn't until later which came in handy. This hotel is very close to times square, just round the corner which I preferred as it was nice to get away from the noisy and busy times square. I read the reviews on TripAdvisor before I picked this hotel and was very glad I chose this hotel, with regards to people saying they can see through the frosted glass into the bathroom, I was with my partner so didn't matter too much but we tested this while we were there. The shower was situated on this wall and you couldn't see hardly anything through the glass when looking from the room, unless you stood very close or touched the glass. The toilet was at the other end of the bathroom so couldn't see partner when sat on the toilet through the glass. It didn't bother me much but thought I'd mention in case people were worried about it. All in all brilliant hotel and would recommend to anyone. Great location, very clean, friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location and nice size rooms. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Really modern and clean close to restaurants and sights Recommend especially if this is a first trip to New York. Concierge helpful and happy to hep with bookings

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is THE place to stay in NY. One block over from Time Square, close to everything. I've stayed at the Riu a total of probably 4-5 times now and they have never disappointed me. In fact it's almost like it gets better every time I stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Check in was smooth and the room ideal as a base for exploring NYC only minutes away from times square and close to several good restaurants and bars. Despite being on only the 7th floor you couldn't really hear the noise from 8th avenue and with the black out curtains in place a good nights sleep was found The bathroom was quirky with an obscure glass wall separating it from the main area. There could have been a little more shelf space to put stuff on but the tops of the cases served this purpose. The bar was good as was the coffee shop. The highlight was the breakfast which provided a wide ranging spread of hot and cold food perfect to load up on before hitting the streets of Manhattan and not feeling the need to have a large lunch.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First - the positives. Great location and a friendly check in team that did all they could to allocate rooms for our party as close to each other as possible. Moyer deserves particular praise for his friendliness and professionalism at check in, throughout our stay and at check out. The hotel is v. close to Times Square and well placed for all the restaurants and bars of Hells Kitchen.The standard room is very small, but fairly modern and clean but there’s nowhere to place large cases. There’s a small fridge with some complementary water in it upon arrival and refreshed every couple of days.No room service. If you want ice you have to go to the bar to get it yourself.Now the terrible bit. As lots of other reviewers have noted - the breakfast service is terrible. The lines / queues are so long to get seated. They go out past the elevator / lift area. It’s totally mobbed in the breakfast area. Food runs out quickly and is not replenished. On one day of our stay, the milk had run out in the hotel and there was only black coffee. Everybody was complaining, The Restaurant Manager (JL) was so rude and aggressive. He told guests, “well nobody has died, what’s the problem?” The problem was that whilst these things can happen, there’s no need to be so rude to your guests. We complained at reception about him - he popped up again and said there was nobody more senior on duty to complain to, except a check in supervisor. He then switched to Spanish to his colleague - another mistake as we live half in Spain and half in the UK so understood everything. We left for the UK later that day feeling very let down by this experience. Funnily enough, same as other reviewers - we went to Pret A Manger opposite for breakfast.(If the GM wants to contact me ... I am happy to provide more details and full names of the staff and dates.)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at Hotel RIU in NYC on 46th street, and enjoyed our one night stay on the 30th floor with outstanding views . The staff was pleasant and helpful.The room is small , but very livable with large floor to ceiling windows and a great shower . The hotel is extremely clean . I would have rated the hotel five star , but the breakfast “cafeteria style “and valet part were disappointing. There is plenty of food at the breakfast buffet , but we were not expecting a buffet with hundreds of guests eating. The breakfast was included in the price . The valet parking is not really valet parking. It is a private parking garage around the block , where you can actually self park for half the price ,and walk to the hotel. We had to wait over 90 minutes to get our car , and they wanted to charge me for the extra hour . Park yourself! There are plenty of parking garages in the area , and if you reserve ahead of time , you can find parking deals . We booked the hotel through booking.com , for a total price with all taxes , resort fees , etc. , $192 . Great deal for this quality hotel in NYC , in the Time Square area during the Holiday Season.WiFi is included in the price .This hotel is worth the price, with a great Times Square location. Be sure to request a high floor with all the traffic noise .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a good stay.... staff were very friendly and comfortable rooms. Great location. Only downfall is you could hear all the doors closing as people left their rooms. Not much on the hall walls to dampen the sounds..... other than that I would certainly book here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here as part of my NYC city break from the UK and spent months reading the excellent reviews and it was far better than expected!! the major things were fantastic such as customer service by the reception staff, bell noys, restaurant staff and housekeeping. The accommodation was great, huge TV, great view, extremely comfortable bed. The breakfast at the hotel was very good. Yes it was busy but the (small) queue went down quickly. There was lots of seating and two parallel breakfast serving areas within the same restaurant to speed things up. I was there this week and had no problem at all with this. i read the queue goes around by the lifts, well the lifts are 8 yards away from the front of the queue so that's no big deal at all. i imagined first day of Next sale type queues!!! not at all. We ate at night as well on a half board package and the food was great. my tip is, eat all of the typical fast food for lunch out at places then eat the lovely salads and proper food at the hotel - the variety is great and 4 star if not more. there is a carving station, fish, meats, lovely deserts and so on. they do pizza and fries too so you can have all that aswell. i read the drinks were extortionate by someone and here. we got a tap water (free) and fresh orange or diet coke - cant remember exactly and it was $2.49. plus tip so i would recommend this restaurant. The hotel - obviously a Riu, but you do get a little feel of being in Spain on your 4 star holiday whilst in NYC and i say that from all of the things that you like about that (apart from the weather in NYC haha).The other little things, so - i read about the frosted glass. I was with my daughter so privacy was important. All we did for extra privacy was turn off the bathroom light when in the shower then there is no problem at all. There wasnt really a problem unless i was right against the shower wall but then i wouldnt normally do that anyway on a huge walk in shower. Also - when you run the cold tap, the water was ice cold straight away and hot straightaway. Never had this before. normally you have to run it at least a few seconds. 5 lifts so we never waited long and they were extremely fast. Excellent location - easy walk to times square and rockerfeller center. subways nearby. I tried the sofa bed for comfort too as we had a double family deluxe. it was long enough for me 5'11 but not sure 2 adults could sleep on it. 1 max or 2 small children.So all in all, i loved this hotel so much. didnt want to leave and booked already to come back. In true last day of holiday style too - i got a late check out - had to pay tho, but also used the gym and had a shower before getting a taxi - loved it!!!! Well done Riu and keep an eye out for me coming back please!!! thanks :-)
user_name:
gheth67
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As mentioned in other reviews, it does have a great location yet we were disappointed by the rooms. They were somewhat small although not too bad, the views were amazing but the walls were very thin. We could hear everything. During our stay we were woken up several times a night due to people in the corridor, people in the room beside us etc. Not to mention the lady delivering water bottles knocked twice and before we could even get to the door she had opened it and walked right in!The bathroom was awful, the door to the bathroom is transparent, as well as one of the walls near the shower. You can see exactly what people are doing, there’s no privacy at all. Not only that but our shower would flood every time we used it and it would manage to seep out into the main part of the room.Breakfast is very expensive, $19.95 + tax + tips! It tends to fill up quite quickly also.On the other hand, the guys who store your bags were great and very helpful. They ordered us a private taxi to the airport for $75 all in.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was well presented, very clean, friendly staff who were very helpful. The location was spot on for our first stay, being centrally located and easily accessible from and to the main attractions. The rooms although not overly big were well provided and adequate, great as a base to check in after a long day exploring the city. Breakfast, which was buffet style was very good, plenty of variety and although busy you didn’t feel pressured. A great start to set you up for the day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Myself and my family stayed at this beautiful hotel in December for 5 nights. Lots of people who have stayed in NYC had said not to get carried away booking a fancy hotel due to never being in it and it only being somewhere to sleep. We completely disagree. It’s important for us to have a good base. The Riu did not disappoint. It was extremely clean (top of my list). Also very modern and spacious considering we were a family of 4. We had the most comfiest beds to give us the best sleep whilst we were there. Times Square you can see if you are in the right room. Extremely close to Times Square and Broadway. Maceys, Bryant Park and Fifth Avenue were all within walking distance so fantastic base. Breakfast is fantastic! Everything you can imagine. Only downfall is that you do have to queue. When I say queue, it’s literally 5 mins if that. The later you go in the quieter it is. First morning was a bit stressful with the children and with it being so busy. We all got seated then got up to get our breakfast. Went back to the table and someone was sat on it! Can understand how this can happen with it being busy. And considering the amount of tourists they get it does seem like organised chaos! By the second day we were on the ball. One of us got all the cutlery etc and sat at our table whilst the other 3 got their breakfast and came back.By day 3 it was a breeze. Another negative..at a hotel of this level I would expect a better hair dryer in the hotel (it was terrible) and I really, really missed a kettle and coffee in the room in the morning. This is certainly a must. Especially for the English tourists :-) Overall I would rate this hotel excellent and I would definitely stay again in the future.p

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We waited over two hours for our room. Check in was suppose to be 3:00pm and we actually got into our room after multiple visits to the front desk at 5:00pm. Part of the problem was that a there were two door access to the room which the front desk did not notify us about and the outer door was locked and our key would not work. Two more trips to the front desk before they could fix that. No apology! This is our third stay at a RIU. This property does not live up to the standards of other RIUs. Don’t be fooled. By the brand. This is well below standards of other RIUs.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good value hotel nice staff very helpful nice size rooms Having the breakfast included saved are family of 4 probably £50 a day ver good selection for breakfast Would definitely return Very good position in Times Square

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was a nice hotel with friendly people working there the room was clean not vary big but it is New York the bathroom was nice with plenty of room the lobby was vary modern and had a great smell the bar closed too soon and opened too late but I am a non drinker so it did not bother me the others did not like that but the hotel was a perfect place for me to stay and check out New York it was walking distance to everything I wanted to see

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently returned from a five night stay at the Riu Plaza and would thoroughly recommend it. The hotel is just off Times Square and in a great location to get to many of the tourist attractions, with subway stations within a short walk too. The hotel itself is modern and clean and our twin room was perfect for our stay. We were situated on the 8th floor and although it was quite noisy at night sometimes with the traffic, it wasn't anything that ear plugs didn't sort out! Our room had plenty of space with comfortable beds, great storage for our suitcases under our beds and it was nice to have a fridge and iron too. The bathroom was also very modern, clean and had everything we needed. We thought the breakfast was great and really set us up for the day. Plenty of choice, well stocked throughout the morning and the staff work tirelessly to clean up after people leave to ensure everyone is seated quickly. We never waited more than a couple of minutes to get seated and that was at different times of the morning too.Overall, we would definitely recommend the Riu for anyone travelling to NY in the future. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is due to a lack of communication from the hotel before we arrived regarding organising a (paid for) surprise in our room for my mum 60th birthday. It didn't ruin the trip by any means, but it would have been a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a great experience at hotel....staff was wonderful....having breakfast included was sufficient in everyway....service was pretty fast!!.... Only issue that disappointed me was their "LONGBOARD" meals with breakfast /dinner I had purchased with my stay!!! Dinner does not start till 6:30pm If you got shows to attend at 7pm...you will not be able to use It!!! Why in the world dinner starts at 6:30 pm when all shows starts at 7-7:30pm?!.....made it impossible to get FULL VALUE purchased ...with NO REFUND!!?! I DON'T RECOMMEND PURCHASING THEIR LONGBOARD....IF YOU GOT SHOWS TO ATTEND etc....otherwise I would have given higher score....still a wonderful and sufficient place to stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A well situated hotel just within walking distance of the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Broadway. We stayed in a room with a queen sized bed.The room was not large but adequate for a few day break. Our booking provided us with a hot buffet breakfast which was excellent and really set you uo for the day.I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Thanks.....

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We got here late on a Friday evening the hotel is in a perfect position being within a walking distance of most of the attractions a little bit further for the 9/11 memorial and just one street from Times Square.When we arrived the receptionist wasnt the most friendly but she did her job on arriving and leaving the hotel we didn't get offered any help with our bags but we weren't fussed.The room we had was a deluxe king on the 22nd floor which we had a corner room the bed was plenty big enough and had a nice shower with two shower heads they was a frosted wall and sliding door but you couldnt see in or out on the shower floor there was a tiny chip out of the floor and when having a shower the water leaked out the was a hairdryer but it wasnt that powerful too completely dry your hair if you wanted to shower in the morning,little disappointed there wasnt any dressing gowns.The bed was really comfy the was a fridge a table and chair and a small cupboard with a safe in it.There was a t.v. which was nice to watch after a long day on your feet when you want to rest before going back out.The air conditioning or heating unit not shall which one but this was quite noisy kept me more awake than the outside noise.We went down for the breakfast which we got a seat but you have to get down early but they do have two restaurants the breakfast buffets had a large range of food the bacon and hot chocolate was my favourite.We did eat down there for a evening meal which was a buffet and it was very good value for money.The room was cleaned everyday but if you didn't want it cleaned they is a do not disturb sign which we used.The hotel is very clean and nice looking the room we had was very Similar to the premier inn hotels in this country.If I went back I would stay again there and if your thinking of going really look into this hotel with being able to see the Time square but without all the busy rush that goes with it this hotel is a must stay at thumbs up for this one

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights.We stayed in a deluxe king room on the top floor (28) as we had requested a high room. Room was clean and had everything you needed inc an iron and board. No kettle though. Maids came everyday, clean towels and bedding. Water provided every other day.Breakfast was great lots to choose from. Didn’t eat there for dinner but from why we saw it looked good. Hotel was perfectly placed, not right in Times Square but as good as. Sightseeing bus stopped just round the corner and lots of good places to eat close by. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for four nights, check in was quick and all the staff there were friendly and helped take our luggage to our room. The room was very clean and the maid was in every day to make the beds etc. We also had breakfast during our stay which we were very happy with and there were lots of different choices so you couldn’t get bored of it. The location as well was fantastic, walking distance from almost everything, would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu was super clean and stylish. I enjoyed 5 days here - check in was fast and easy. wifi was good, rooms were bigger than i expected and breakfast had a wide range of choices. Bacon eggs sausages, cereals, salmon etc Every morning we were seated pretty much straight away. I would definitely stay here again - Planning my next trip for 2020

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is situated approx 3 mins and straight up from the hotel crossing one road, it is a modern hotel in decor. The rooms are quite small but adequate for 3/4 nights, it is clean . No tea or coffee facilities in the room water bottles provided every 2 days, there is a safe provided free, plus iron. The breakfast Buffett is good , but it can get busy, the coffee shop is good and not expensive.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our second visit to the Riu was as good as first. Hotel is spotlessly clean, friendly staff and great location. Minutes to Times Square, Subway and Port Authority bus station. Very suitable for people in a wheelchair as accessible rooms are big with wet rooms. Will not be our last visit.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel within easy walking distance of most major attractions. Tour bus also near the hotel giving you a hop on hop off option. Hotel is modern , with very helpful and polite staff. Food is excellent , with breakfast being busy .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Cant say enough how much we loved this hotel. it was bright and has great views, not overshadowed by other buildings. Super location, central to everywhere we wanted to go visit. the staff was very professional, nice, not rude or snooty. the breakfast had very good food, a great value.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was my second but not last visit to RIU in this location. This hotel is a great value, especially in this location. Riu times square is the most conveniently located, clean, well appointed, reasonably priced, friendly, helpfully staffed place to stay in this area. Within walking distance of Broadway theaters, Macy's (gotta see those windows), and a short uber or cab ride to Central park locations, East village or lower Manhattan. One block off times square. Cannot say enough about the helpfulness of staff, and if you are driving in just take advantage of the Valet who will park your car. Solid breakfast buffet (what else do you need but eggs, meats, fruits, breads, cereals, yogurts, fruits, etc) with very attentive staff. RIU does it right!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in deluxe king size room on the 24th floor. Check in was easy and someone from the front desk phoned to see if everything was perfect once we got to the room. The room was very clean and modern. As in previous reviews, the frosted glass in the bathroom was a bit odd, but did not bother us. Breakfast was included and we used the smaller, quieter dining room. There was a good choice of food. We also had the buffet dinner ($35) one evening and we were pleased with the choice. The hotel was in great location being just off Times Square and a 15 minute walk from Central Park. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would be happy to stay there again.
user_name:
Ann L
Milton Keynes, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: DO NOT RENT A JUNIOR SUITE! My husband and I stayed at the Riu Times Square on December 3, 2018 and were totally unsatisfied with our room.  We paid $565 for a "Junior Suite" and I was shocked and stunned to see that the bathtub and sink were IN the bedroom and the toilet and shower areas opened directly into the bedroom. It was the craziest layout I have ever seen. In retrospect, we should have asked for a different room but we were staying for only one night so I didn’t bother. After the fact, I tried to get some compensation from the hotel or from Expedia (through whom I booked the room, to no avail). Live and learn, I guess.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We picked this hotel because we are members of RIU hotels. It was great location and clean. We got to hotel at 2:30 pm and our room was ready. The rooms are small but clean. I only wish they had coffee pot in room but not sure where they would put it. We only spent two nights as we just went to be in New York at Christmas time. Breakfast came with the room it was ok. But nice not to have to walk to get breakfast.
user_name:
Tammy R
Louisville, Ohio, United States

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We chose this hotel based on the positive reviews, the fact that it had recently been opened, and the free breakfast buffet. We were not impressed and would not come back. We found the staff unfriendly, the rooms severely lacking, and the price-quality ratio completely overblown for what you can find in the area.The rooms are exceedingly small. I have stayed at POD style hotels and there is nothing wrong with that approach, but this hotel does not sell the impression that the rooms are so small that you literally have to climb over the bed to get around if a bag is on the floor. They truly spent all the money in the lobby.The rooms are described as having a desk. There is no desk. There is a shelf where your laptop will barely fit. The chair fits under said shelf, and if you want to use it you will the your back with the bed. The bathroom is separated from the room by a translucid wall, so if you have to use it in the middle of the night you will wake up anybody sleeping with you. We had a small child and this was definitely a problem.We did find the staff off-putting and generally condescending. At several times we felt treated like they were doing us a favor. This was the case with the reception, the bar, but particularly, the woman managing the entrance to the breakfast buffet who truly treated us as an annoyance literally lifting her finger to shush us while she finished her conversation with a member of the cleaning stuff. She was just downright rude and for me reason enough to not come back.The breakfast buffet was adequate. It gets very busy and very loud as the hotel is very large with lots of families, but you can avoid this getting in early.At night, we requested two dental kits when we realized we had forgotten our tooth brushes. I went downstairs to avoid the housekeeping wait (being aware how large the hotel was) and I was told to go back to my room and wait for it. It took 45 minutes and they showed up with one kit. I told them I had requested two and I waited another 20 minutes for it. I should have walked across the street and bought it at CVS.The bar is severely overpriced even for NY standards. Again, we were under the impression that a hotel of this size that announced a restaurant and bar would have options for drinks and a snack before going to bed. Not the case. Nothing to eat in the bar but you can drown your sorrows in one pint of beer for $11.Finally, when it came time to pay we realized our numbers were not matching up. Well, that is because you get it with a $13.06 ´resort´ fee per room per night. Resort? I have been to many resorts and this was definitely not one of them. This resort fee included things like "access to the gym" (which I did not use), "in-room water" (which we did not request) and Internet access (which is definitely not a resort feature). We ended up coughing $100 more than we expected and it definitely felt like a bait-and-switch. We politely complained and got our now-familiar condescending Riu treatment. We will not come back. There are many great options in the area.
user_name:
PedroC842
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in the Rui for 5 nights in November (holidays). The hotel is very big (600 rooms if I got it right) but it's modern, nice, confortable and clean. And really, really central, just one block away from Times Square). Rooms are small but well designed and confortable. The only thing we disliked was the hectic breakfasts (too may people). But the breakfast itsef was good. Will gladly consider the RIU again if visiting NY in the future

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, nice modern rooms. Breakfast included was a big plus. Well stocked cafe in hotel.Room was nicely laid out with a very comfy bed and good shower. Tv with plenty of channels and safe in room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time in New York and we were celebrating my partners 40th birthday, we chose the Riu as the location is amazing.Check in went smoothly accommodated the 6 of us perfectly, we wanted a high floor for the views and they helped as best they could ( the view we had was amazing ), lifts are a pain to master you have to use your card put it in take it out and press the floor your on most of the time it didn't work and we saw some people just travelling up and down as they didn't understand what to do.Room was lovely very modern great for a long weekend, bed was comfy, room was clean, maybe just needs tea and coffee making facilities and it would be perfect but that is maybe personal preference.Now to the down side breakfast which is a shambles as with all restaurants there is a large queue in a morning as you wait for a table, but the tables are set out that you are literally touching the person behind you there is no space to move. The food is lovely when they have it nothing is replenished quick enough so you have to wait ages if you want a full breakfast also in one dining room there are hash browns but not in the other so you have to go for a walk if you want anything. We did complain about the breakfast and the restaurant managers are very rude and dont seem to care on one day we just left and went across the road to Pret A Manger which defeats the purpose of paying for the breakfast if theres nothing to eat.I would have given more stars if the breakfast was better and because of the rudeness of the restaurant managers ( all other staff really lovely couldn't do more to help ).Fix this and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is relatively new had only been here for 3 years this is my first trip to the states/nyc the staff are all very accommodating from reception to the bell boys to there chambermaids nothing is to much to ask! The hotel is very central so every this is in walking distance and if your not watching at the hotel there are some good places nearby

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our first trip to NY and We couldnt have been happier with our hotel choice. Nice clean modern rooms and bathrooms. The inclusive breakfast was great ... lots of choice. Great position for Theatres, Times Square etc. We walked to most places from there except when going downtown to Brooklyn Bridge etc. Staff really friendly too! We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Have visited New York before but did not stay in this hotel so decided to try it. It is a very modern hotel and well laid out. The bedrooms are compact they are well laid out and tastefully decorated. The breakfast was a buffet. It was a very clean hotel. Some of the staff were not very friendly and did not smile. The cleaning staff and servers were pleasant. This hotel is in a good location. It is an expensive hotel I am not sure if this is because of the time of year or location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I have just got back from New York. We stayed at the RIU Plaza and everything about it was amazing. We had a deluxe king room that looked out onto 8th avenue. We could see the clock in time square from our window. The room was spotlessly clean with a lovely e suite and very comfortable bed. The decor was of a very high standard. Plenty of wardrobe space, a mini fridge with bottles of water The only negatives where the lack of a mirror near to a plug socket. There was a built in hairdryer in the e suite but difficult to use straighteners. I would also be nice to have tea/coffee making facilities. Breakfast was included and it was a very good buffet breakfast with plenty of choice to suit all tastes. The foyer was very well presented and always lovely and clean. All of the staff were excellent they were all very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. We are hoping to go back to New York again and would definitely stay at the RIU Plaza again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We absolutely loved staying at this hotel, it seemed very central to everything we did and very very close to Times Square, it was a short walk to Central Park also. The hotel was really clean and all the staff worked hard to keep it like this, it looked just like the pictures on the website.The hotel breakfast we felt was good value for money with a range of food and it appeared to cater for all tastes.We will definitely return to this hotel again....

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our first, and hopefully not our last trip to New York. We choose a Riu hotel because we had stayed in Riu's several times before, and we were not disappointed. Great location, only a couple of blocks from Times Square. Room was very nice, but would ask for one higher up next time to appreciate the view. But, hey, when in New York you only come back to your room to rest your aching feet and sleep. Having breakfast included is a big bonus, as you can fill up for the day. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On checking into this hotel, was not over impressed with the reception staff. No warm welcome after a very long journey. First time to New York for myself and my friend and we were left disappointed by their manner. Our room was ok but didn’t really like the way you could be seen having a shower due to the type of glass used. Going to breakfast the next morning, staff again were not friendly. Had to wait to be shown to a table and it was a wave of a hand that meant follow me. Tried to get a drink from the bar one evening and we were totally ignored by the staff. Lady in the coffee shop was very nice - perhaps she could show the rest of the staff. Tried to book the shuttle bus to take us back to JFK and couldn’t get through on the number I had been given. Asked the reception staff if they could help and they tried the number. It yet again didn’t work and they said there was nothing they could do. I told my friend we would try the next morning (the day we were to depart). This time I tried the concierge. Well what a difference. The lady that was on the desk saw the number I was trying and said hold on please. She then dialled a number for me and lo and behold I got through to the right people. She told me that nobody was able to get through on the number given but knew a different one to try. We couldn’t thank her enough and I am just grateful that she was on the desk. I think your reception staff should be given this number so that they can be more helpful to guests. Overall I wasn’t impressed with my first visit at all.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We’ve just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. The hotel is beautifuly decorated and modern. The bell boys were really helpful and couldn’t do enough for you, whether it be directions or sorting cases on departure. The check in was quick and easy. The room was adequate size for 3 adults. We were on the 14th floor. We couldn’t hear the traffic just a few sirens here and there. The room was cleaned really well daily and modern. Felt the beds were a bit hard and uncomfortable. The bathroom/shower was lovely. Slightly annoying that the bathroom light wakes everyone up if put on in the middle of the night. There needs to be a mirror by the dressing table and coffee/tea making facilities. Location was great. 5 min walk from Times Square. Time square is packed and bustling but the hotel was away from that which was nice. Location of hotel is central to Central Park in one direction (30min walk) to Empire State Building the opposite direction (20/25min walk). The bus terminal is about 6/7 min walk from hotel. You can get a bus from here to the jersey mills outlet shopping centre. Cost $14 return. There is coffee shop in hotel that sells snacks and drinks. Reasonably priced. Cocktails in the bar generally around $15 which seemed quite expensive. Overall, a great hotel and if I were to return to New York would definantly use this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a good hotel but make sure you get a great price. It is definitely not a 5 star option. It’s a solid 4. Nice and new and a good location for all the broadway plays and Times Square. A few quirks. We did the half board. Food is ok and plentiful. Restaurant ambience and service is rather limited though. I would just take breakfast next time as you’re in restaurant row anyway. I didn’t love lining up for dinner. Small rooms but decent linen etc.Had a balcony which was a plus. Bar area ok but again ambience is questionable/to a certain taste. Service ok nothing to write home about. Would I stay again ....yes I would - but only at a price. If a chain hotel (Intercon etc) were on offer at a similar price I’d be there. Having said that overall it is a pretty good option for NYC. New and decent digs for a few nights.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and everything was great. Very quick and efficient check-in. We had a room upgrade to the executive floor with access to the executive lounge, where we were offered sandwiches,pastries, fruit, snacks, soft drinks and wine all day every day......a lovely surprise. I was also presented with chocolates on my birthday. There was a very good choice for breakfast and we managed to avoid the queues. The smaller breakfast room was more relaxing than the larger "canteen" style room. The bar served up the best Long Island Iced Tea ever. The hotel was very clean and all of the staff were friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location for those who want to be right in the midst of Times Sq and the theatres. The staff are all very friendly, the hotel is very modern and clean. The buffet breakfast catered for everyone and although it could be busy the longest we had to wait to be seated was a couple of minutes. The room sizes are standard and the beds are very comfortable after a long day of site seeing. There aren't any tea/coffee making facilities in the room but there is a lovely cafe downstairs that also has some lovely pastries. We were on the 14th floor and the noise from the road 24/7 can become quite annoying if you are a light sleeper. The frosted glass in the bathroom - If you're a late night bathroom visitor you are quite possibly going to wake up your room mate when you switch the light on. It's a great hotel to stay at if you're looking to stay around Times Square

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very friendly, very clean and very comfortable. Breakfast could be busy but staff were very helpful showing you to a vacant table. Ideally situated very close to the lights of Times Square. Would use again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a three night stay here as a family of 5 (2 rooms). This is a very busy hotel but check in and out was smooth and efficient. The hotel is very clean and rooms are nice. The bathroom glass did not bother me but could see how might be a small issue for some people. The 2 best things about hotel are location and the breakfast. You really are in heart of Times Square and so many great shops, restaurants and sights are within easy walking distance. The choice of options for breakfast was best I ever seen in a hotel, it has basically everything you could want and sets you up for the day. It can be busy but you will get a table. The staff are very polite and helpful. Overall it was a very comfortable stay and would return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just stayed at the RIU the entrance and reception area gives a false impression because the dining is very average and the rooms are small and basic. The bathroom has a frosted glass surround so if you turn the light on you disturb the people in bed.The breakfast is chaotic in the morning, long queues no room to walk between table and chairs, by the time you have queued for your food it is cold and greasy. The location is good 5 minute walk to Time Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: They didn’t tell us if the parking was included in our stay and they didn’t tell us how much it was so we thought it was included in our stay but it wasn’t so we spent at least $400 so please ask it will save you a lot of money but everything else was perfect and there nice and your right on time square

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time to NYC and couldn't of picked a better hotel.
