The hotel was clean and very modern and excellent location to a subway (helpful when you have to lug your suitcase)We arrived early (1pm) and found that we could check in already. We were give a room on 27th floor directly facing times square. The room was adequate for us both with large bed, great shower room, fridge and tv. Yes even though you were on 27th floor you could still hear sirens and horns faintly but you really don't notice it after a while. Know where you staying NYC you will have a quite room. Breakfast was brilliant, very good choice and never had to wait to be seated. We had evening meals included but the buffet style and choice wasn't for us. There are plenty of places to eat near the hotel. It's a great location and only short walks to central park, times square etc. Would highly recommend and would definately stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very modern with a touch of the RIU palace as know around the world. Service was very good and friendly.The location is perfect to walk to Central Park and other tourists spots.Do not hesitate to book this hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a lovely stay at the Riu Plaza. All the staff are friendly and make your stay enjoyable. Hotel is in a very good spot right near Times Square. Also decor looks quite new compared to other hotels nearby. Breakfast is very good too. If I came to NY again I would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel couldn’t have been in a more perfect hotel. Walking distance to Times Square, Macy’s Parade, Radio City, Today Show and tons of amazing restaurants. Couldn’t have picked a better location!!!The breakfast included was great. Very large selection. We only had to wait for a table 1 time all week.Hotel is beautiful and modern. Fast elevators. Great coffee shop downstairs with friendly staff. Starbucks and Dunkin across the road.Only downside was the bathroom. While beautiful and sleek, the sliding glass door that doesn’t completely close is not something I want when sharing a room. NO PRIVACY at all since the door doesn’t seal. Overall, everything was amazing. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived for a 4 day visit booked through ba which gave us the best this included breakfast.Reception smooth and allocated room on the 17th floor at the side of hotel,view breathtaking,room spacious and very comfy queen bed,bathroom shower only but all toiletries you would want,towels top quality.breakfast was okay choice of hot or cold.All in all superb hotel with excellent and efficient staff in every dept.Would strongly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First off, the hotel is literally on the same street of the Richard Rodgers Theatre which is amazing. The hotel overall is excellent. The staff was very nice and the people at reception was very helpful. The food was very good even though we mainly had breakfast there. The rooms were very clean and beds very comfortable.
user_name:
Nicole M
Riebeek Kasteel, South Africa

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My Husband and I Stayed at the RIU Plaza in September for 7 nights. It was our first visit to New York and chose this Hotel for the location and the modern rooms, which were both great. It is close to all the sights, walked miles and also used the yellow cabs - great way to see the City. On arrival at the Hotel early evening, we were allocated a room on the 4th floor even though I had emailed the Hotel previously to request a room above the 4th floor! So no sleep whatsoever, felt like we were by the side of the M25 motorway with the noise of sirens and disco lights in the room as the curtains were transparent! Eventually, the next day to their credit, Reception did change the Room but our first day of the holiday was not great as travelled from London plus No sleep!!! Breakfast was included in the price but we only tried it once, as was total chaos! There are lovely coffee shops all around the area - which suited us. Good things and bad things for us but this is just my opinion! Lovely Bellboys, so helpful and the Coffee Bar Staff at the entrance to the hotel were so nice. We loved New York, visited all the sights and our friends that live in the City but for us the hotel was just too big, noisy and chaotic.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Central location. Room quite small for the US and a King I think. Breakfast busy but had a decent selection.We stay at Rius a lot over the world and it was our mini-moon and although we informed them in advance there was no acknowledgement. At first I thought this was because they didn't do anything but I can see from other reviews that others have received champagne and chocolates. Loyalty doesn't pay!Late check it the worst I've ever experienced. You have to ask on the morning of departure. We were told it was between 7am-8am, but if we called at 6am they would sort it out. So up we get called and got told it was 7.30am. In the end we got up and went down to breakfast and at 6.30am someone sorted out our late check out. The staff obviously aren't all informed of the right information. Which is not really acceptable. Having late check out makes a difference on your last day and not being able to sort it until the morning is not helpful.On the whole the hotel is ok. I wouldn't return, there will be nicer hotels to choose from that i'm sure treat you as a guest rather than a number, which is how we felt at this Riu.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at this hotel on the 7th & 8th of November. I have really good memories of staying at different Rui Hotels all around the world but unfortunately not really at this one. The hotel itslef is very smart and clean and is perfect for a short stay in this wonderful City. My issues were not related to the hotel itself but more towards a small handfull of people that worked their. I left my bags in the room on Thursday morning before i went for a walk around the city. When checking my bags upon my return i noticed that i had some English money missing that was definitely there before i left the room. I reported this issue to the management staff and to be honest i was very disappointed in their efforts to resolve the issue. I had £40 taken out of my bag but it wasn’t theft of the money that annoyed me it was the fact that someone had been through my personal belongings and no one at the hotel seemed to care about this. All i would say to anyone staying at this hotel is make sure that anything valuable to you is locked away and secure otherwise they may go missing.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Almost all the complaints I have read here were not an issue, other than water wasn't replenished every two days as was noted on the room refrigerator. The breakfast buffet was good. Yes, occasionally they would run out of something, but it was quickly replaced. Staff is friendly, helpful, and professional. It's true that the "bathroom" has frosted privacy glass for the toilet and shower, but it takes a really good imagination to actually "see" anything -- when I was in the shower and my roommate was at the sink, the only way I could tell was the appearance of a different blurry blob of color in the vicinity of the sink. It's really not an issue.One thing to keep in mind -- you can't get the official late checkout (that costs $40 and lets you stay in the room until 4 PM) unless you schedule it ahead of time, and unless the hotel is not completely booked the evening of your departure. The hotel had no problem letting me stay until 1 PM (an hour after official checkout) at no extra charge, though (which was all I really needed).The location is fantastic -- 1 block off Times Square, and walking distance to restaurants, bars, theaters, subway, shopping, etc. I definitely would stay there again (although without the breakfast buffet next time, because I tended to overeat, LOL).

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had booked this hotel for our first trip to New York. From arrival to departure everything about this place exceeded our expectations. Well located for all the theatres and not too far from Central Park, certainly walking distance, it also has plenty of great restaurants close by. We had a Junior suite on 26th floor which was a good size and had impressive views. The room rate included breakfast which was buffet style and catered for all tastes. We ate in the restaurant in the evening a couple of times after really long days walking around this lively city. Again the evening meal was buffet style and totally unlimited which at $39 per head is great value for New York. All the staff we had dealings with were friendly and extremely helpful, especially the Bellboys who have a great sense of humour. Thank you all at Riu Plaza for a great stay. Hope to see you when we come back.
user_name:
sjh1404
Weston super Mare, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited New York in February 18 with the Family for my husbands retirement, New York is a place we love, we have never stayed at this hotel before, the breakfast was great, the rooms were lovely and very comfortable. We also ate in the hotel one night and the food was fab.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was a very positive experience, we arrived at 1.30pm and we were delighted to find our room was ready, Liz was very helpful on check in. As the other reviews, say our room was spotless and ample size. One thing I encountered was that I booked a double room which in Ireland and Uk would be 1 double bed. (It seems that’s not the case in USA, it’s 2 doubles that would be a twin this side of the pond. That’s my issue, not the hotels) The breakfast was a great experience. How the staff cater for such a large crowd, by clearing tables and replenishing food is very impressive. Our only issue was that our water was not replenished. Again as the other reviews say, the location is excellent. I would have to question if the few negative reviews have more to do with guests being unreasonable than the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for one night in November. The customer service was completely unacceptable. We stayed in a nice, clean SMALL room on the 6th floor. When we checked in, nobody informed us that there was an apparent "problem" with the heating and cooling. In fact, we were given instructions on the thermostat in the room. When we walked into our room, we were hit with a wall of heat. No big deal, I thought, we will just turn on the AC. I was certainly wrong about that. The temperature instead kept rising, and it was reading 78 degrees, even though the thermostat was on 65. We called the front desk and they sent up an engineer, whose gun was reading 85 degrees when pointed at the vent. He assured us he could fix it. We went to our show, and when we returned around midnight, it was hotter than before! But yet the unit was still reading 65 degrees?!?! So again, I call the front desk. They sent up another engineer who said yes it was very hot, but he was alone and there was nothing he could do about it because it was the whole building. I requested to speak to the manager (Johan), who came up and told me that the city MANDATES the heat be on. When I questioned him, he said that it was problem with the system in the whole building. SO WAS IT A PROBLEM OR A MANDATE? His solution, open the window as he had already gotten about 8-10 complaints that night. I searched for another hotel but could not find one at almost 1am, so I had no choice put to stay there, Needless to say, I had to leave the window open and listen to the sounds of Times Square ALL NIGHT long. We did not sleep, as closing the window was not an option or we would've been dripping in sweat. When I asked to speak to the manager the next morning upon check out, the receptionist did everything in her power to ignore that I requested one, and the manager never came out to speak to me. At over $300 a night, the least your manager could've down was come out and apologize if nothing else. I disputed this with Expedia as that is who I booked through and they told me RIU has NO log of any complaint I mentioned, but when I checked out and asked to speak to the manager the receptionist saw ALL my calls. The fact that my room was almost 90 degrees was also not acceptable. The lack of customer service and the convenient missing complaints I logged with the front desk is not acceptable.I will never stay at another RIU again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a week in October. The hotel is new, modernly decorated and clean. The location was excellent, Times Square is only a short walk away and there were a lot of restaurants and shops nearby. Our room had a large TV, spacious bathroom with a large mirror, shower and a small fridge. There was also a table and chair, and a very large comfortable bed. The bed was my favourite part of the room! You could hear the noise from the main road outside but it did not affect my sleep at all. They also have usb sockets as well as standard ones, which was handy to charge up your phone. There was no kettle to make drinks, however opposite the hotel there is a dunkin donut shop which is handy for buying drinks. They also have their own hotel cafe with reasonable prices. This was the only hotel we came across that included breakfast. The breakfast was good quality food and has a great range. There was cereal, hot food, fruit, porridge, cold meat, vegetables, bread, pastries, as well as juice, water and hot drinks dispensers. Although it was very busy and crowded, we never waited around too long to be seated. We did go to their own evening buffet, which was convenient, however the waiter with short dark hair and facial hair was very rude and aggressive over a petty matter of signing in the wrong place on the tab. This was disappointing when the other staff were so professional and friendly.It is worth buying a subway card on your visit, to get around the city. We covered pretty much everything there was to see, making use of the card everyday. Overall, it is a lovely hotel and I would thoroughly recommend staying here if you are going to New York!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a new and a very comfortable hotel, from the begging the staff is friendly and multilingual so if you are not fluent in English that coul be a relief. The hotel is just two blocks to Times Square, so you can enjoy New York right from your door. The lounge in the 26 floor, for guests in the suites is very comfortable and sometimes the breakfast could be better here than in the restaurant. The room are spacious, well distributed and lighted. Just one down, at the check out we were charged a “facility fee”, because our travel agency didn’t take care of this, but our overall experience was superb.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights on a trip to NYC and we had a great time staying at the Riu Plaza. The hotel was well presented and very clean and the staff were all very good too. The Hotels location is spot on, TimesSquare itself is a 3 minute walk away so perfect for the heart of Manhattan. It’s a modern Hotel so it’s very upto date and everything works very well. There are 5 lifts servicing all floors and they are very fast and efficient which is useful when the hotel is busy. Breakfast is your usual American Buffet and is plentiful. I didn’t go the full 5* on this occasion as it wasn’t totally perfect but I am being picky. Hard flooring in all areas and big heavy doors that close with a bang mean you are disturbed if you get inconsiderate quests on your floor. Not the hotels fault but people come and go at all hours in Manhattan so should be expected. The room was fairly small (we had a Queen) - it was big enough for us but don’t expect much privacy when using the bathroom. Our shower door leaked onto a tiled floor which wasn’t great but it was easily sorted with a towel and the maid service was excellent so every day we returned to a spotless room. I am being really picky here, it was a great stay and considering the price, I would be happy returning here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Bit of a calamity as 7 of us had booked this hotel and they had allocated only 2 rooms for all of us. Rooms are small so the first night was a terrible squeeze. The hotel said they had no more rooms available. We managed afterwards as 2 of the chaps moved to another hotel. We were on the 11th floor so it was quiet. Personally I thought the desk staff weren’t very helpful and there was a heavy que for the breakfast buffet in the morning again the staff weren’t very helpful. All in all this did gall me somewhat as we have stayed in rui hotels in the Caribbean and found these to be very good. For its location I would probably stay again.
user_name:
phil c
Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice welcome when we arrived, polite and happy staff, beautiful reception and location, room had lovely view and was nicely sized with comfy beds, nice accessible bathroom, really good breakfast and not a huge wait considering the size, easy check out, and staff very happy to hold bags on our last day whilst we wait for pick up.Will be returning.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 4 night stay with Jet 2 holidays seasonal city breaks ,flying from Newcastle.Flight time 8 hours going and six hours coming back. Hotel was immaculate and upon arrival we were booked in within about 5 minutes. Please note there is a 13:25 dollar tax per room / per night upon checking out. This is a city tax. Lifts - there is about 6 lifts in operation and you wait no more than a minute or so at any given time for one. Had read reports on here about long waits which are ridiculous. Room - Nice big room with king size bed and beautiful en suite . There was a huge flat screen on the wall with about 100 channels ( I’m not kidding) . The room has a fridge which contained 2 bottles of water upon arrival. These are replenished every two days. Bathroom- The bathroom has a huge walk in rain forest style shower. Shampoo is supplied along with a few other lotions . There a fresh towels which are changed daily razor points and a hair dryer is supplied.Breakfast- We were bed and breakfast for the duration of our stay. The breakfast was canteen style and not relaxed. As the hotel is so busy there is a quick turnaround with tables . The manager (bald headed guy) was really rude and spoke to both staff and guests in a bad way . The food was ok , but nothing special for the money paid to stay at this hotel. I didn’t have any other meals at the hotel.Bar Area - This was really nice with excellent staff. Please note that drinking in NYC around the Times Square Area is really expensive and the hotel was no exception. However, I expected this before arrival. Roughly 8-10 dollars for a beer wherever you go. Overall - really nice hotel which is about a 2 minute walk if that to Times Square. Excellent location !
user_name:
jasoer123
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived on the 1st November for a 5 night stay to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Hadn't realised when i made the booking earlier in the year that i'd booked the weekend of the NYC Marathon. Because of this I imagined the hotel would be crazy but to my surprise, this was not the case.Our room was on the 23rd floor with a decent view out of the huge window. We'd booked a double room with a queen size bed - really comfortable. The room wasn't huge but was more than large enough for the two of us, the only thing missing was a bath .... you need something to soak your aching feet in at the end of a busy day sightseeing.We ate breakfast in the smaller fashion bar , didn't fancy the larger restaurant (for no reason other than the bar was less busy) You have to wait to be seated but the wait isn't long. Plenty of choices for food and lots of it - the kitchen staff replenished supplies regularly.All of the staff were warm and friendly throughout our stay, didn't have any complaints.I'd definitely recommend this hotel and would book again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is clean, well organized and well located. It offers rooms with great views. The area is ideal if you want to go to the theatre, park and other midtown venues.It does lack distinct charm. It's not personal and the design is also very common. If you're looking for romance or a typical NY charm, do not go here.It does have ample restaurants, which serve rather boring but decent fare. The bar is decent too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here at the end of October it was my partners birthday and we had a lovely box of truffles and a card left in the room, we requested a room with a view and we got it 23rd floor amazing- I have to say the insulation must be fantastic as we heard no noise despite being above a very busy road and NYC is never quiet. Breakfast was ok, we always had enough to eat to set us up for the day, yes a bit of queuing but the girls and guys work so hard to get you seated quickly. All the staff are lovely, from Bell Boys to security men, the only people we found unfriendly and unwelcoming where the reception staff! which is bizarre considering they are at the face of the Hotel, I have stayed in many RIU hotels as I love the friendly atmosphere- which we got apart from the reception staff

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were on a hogh floor and had a great view on downtown, from the hall way we saw the Intrepid carrier, in minutes we were on Times square, breakfast was elaborate and of good quality, although in the midst of the city, we had no issues of noice or traffic, room was very nice, clean and more than enough , we staid 4 nights. It was a great city trip!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice,modern and clean hotel, comfortable room, nice and central location to times square, bus tours, coach station and subway. Staff friendly and helpful. Good buffet breakfast but long queues if you have a late one.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location and the rooms were massive, 2 double beds. Only one chair though. Towels plentiful and changed daily. Inclusive breakfast was very good and despite being very busy, we never queued for more than 5 minutes for a table for 6

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We chose to stay here after staying at RIU hotels on other holidays. Their pricing is very competitive especially booking direct. We were celebrating our 1st Wedding Anniversary and informed the hotel of this when booking. When we arrived they had put us on the 2nd from the top floor with an amazing view and a complimentary bottle of champagne with a lovely welcome note. The room was a good size, the bed was very comfy and was clean and tidy. The staff at reception were very helpful however the lady behind the concierge desk was useless! Her English was very poor so was hard to understand but she was not helpful considering we were only asking about booking a taxi to return to JFK. We later spoke to another staff member who was extremely friendly and helpful and got everything sorted for us.The only slight negative was if you timed it wrong for breakfast, you had to queue but I didn't think the wait was excessive. I was hugely keen on the breakfast but husband said it was great so I think it's just down to what you are used to. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location and reviews from here is what made me decide on this hotel. Thank goodness we did.Time Square just around the corner. We were celebrating our ten year anniversary and they nicely celebrated with us by given us a bottle of wine. Check in fast but it was 11 at night. Our room was lovely, clean and one of the nicest we have stayed in, however, we were right next to the elevator and if your a light sleeper at 3 in the morning you think your under attack.The rooms cleaned daily and could not fault.Breakfast is the usual, toast, cereal, eggs, pancake etc what is in your usual buffet. However after 5 days of the same same I was glad to be leaving the breakfast behind. Its very very busy and you are seated fast. It pushy at the food and everyone(guests) is rude. The staff are lovely and plates moved efficiently.All staff are pleasant and some remember you and have a joke, which is nice with such a large hotel.check out fast and they even held our bags until we got our shuttle.Wonderful experience and will be coming back again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wonderful hotel spotlessly clean and so convenient to the main attractions. Staff very friendly and extremely helpful. Excellent choice for breakfast although can be busy at times. On the whole I would stay here again and would recommend to my friends and family.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was amazing. The room was clean, and roomy. The breakfast was amazing. Very organized, and had a huge selection of food choices. The staff was very attentive to the guests and went out of their way to do little things that just made our stay so enjoyable. The gentleman working the door braved traffic to direct our Uber driver to where we were, and the gentleman that showed me a quicker elevator when I was carrying my New York pizza up to the room was very much appreciated. We didn’t have to ask for help, the employees saw what was needed and volunteered their assistance. All employees were courteous and enthusiastic. Great place to stay!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really good hotel and so close to everything if ever had a problem they sorted it the only thing I would say but this is the case all over New York the drinks were expensive, breakfast was really good plenty of choice we only picked this hotel as you could get a breakfast I would deffo be heading back to this hotel again Rooms nice and big cleaned everyday shower did leak big time every time we used it but that didn’t put us off great views and although really busy outside you could never hear the traffic great hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Riu Plaza. The location is excellent. The rooms are modern and very clean. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Staff were very friendly. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in a queen sized bed room, with breakfast included. The room was great, no problems checking in. A acceptable view, for the floor and money paid. Breakfa st was great, although it gets quite full past 7:50, but even then we had a maximum of a 13 minute wait to be seated. The only downside was the buffet dinner, the food was very dry as it had been sat there for a while, but it did have a good variety of meals. Overall the position and the convenience of the hotel easily, makes it a highly worth while place to stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at the Riu Plaza Times Square, this hotel was perfectly situated within walking distance of Times Square, Theatre district, Hell’s Kitchen, Port Authority, every where really!! If you don’t mind walking and are keen to see New York then this is a great hotel, subways are very close too!Staff were mostly helpful and friendly, breakfast was varied and plentiful! My only gripe would be the room that I shared with friends was to accommodate 4 people it was sold as a “deluxe twin”, the room was tight for space not enough closet space or are cases which were stored under the beds and had to be pulled out every time we needed any clothing! Despite this a great stay was had and I would return to this hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Last minute change of hotel for a three night stay in NYC based on location to the theater I had purchased show tickets. This hotel was great! The room was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was good (both the breakfast and dinner buffets were included in my rate). Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a good hotel. Friendly and efficient staff. The room was well furnished with a good sized shower room. Would definitely recommend the breakfast - all you can eat, with a large selection of hot and cold food. The staff organised seating in a very efficient way, meaning that we did not have long to wait. Very important for a hotel of this size is that there are 5 lifts, meaning that you did not have to wait long. It is also a 5 minute walk to Times Square. The only unusual point was that there were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room. However, drinks could be purchased on the ground floor or from coffee shops opposite on 8th ave. overall a very friendly and clean hotel, centrally based and I will happily stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location and though quiet rooms. Modern and clean. Pc and printer available. good buffet breakfast except for the pastries which were very dry. Could have done with tea/coffee facilities in bedroom.
user_name:
Sabine Michele J
Colmar, Alsace, France

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time traveling to NYC: it was a great choice staying here at the RIU PLAZA HOTEL. The location is great... just a few steps from Times Square, Broadway, Hells Kitchen, Central Park! Rooms are medium sized, very clean and they offer you bottles of fresh water each day.I would come back and I recommend thia Hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed early October 2018 for 4 nights. This is a great convenient hotel - right in the city centre & close to subways. Very modern with comfortable beds & soundproof rooms. Breakfast was full - really busy but they handle it well. Great buffet breakfast. Check in & check out was simple, straightforward & fast. Porter was very helpful with the bags & storing them on my last day - also great for arranging taxis. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Nice bar, not too busy for such a busy hotel. The craziness of times square disappears when you walk in through the front door.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: If you want a hotel with a location close to Times Square this is an amazing place. The check I was quick with friendly staff. The room was very nice and larger that expected for NYC. The bar and lounge is large and very warm & friendly. The restaurant was nice with a large menu choices. It’s not the cheapest hotel but I feel has the best value. The Ambassador Theatre is just across the street and Chicago is playing there.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked 2 rooms for 8 girls, everything went smoothly, we arrived at 12:00 noon and asked for a early check in. Wedidn't get in our room till 4:00, which was disappointing. The 2 bell hops were excellent, very friendly and helpful. Overall it was a good experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here for work and it was a very good location. Walked to the office and used the subway to get around while in the area. as soon as you get out of the hotel you just turn left and times square is only 2 blocks away, there is also many food options around. The room itself was nicely appointed and the bed was comfy, that helps when you're tired from meetings all day. I did not use the breakfast so I cannot comment but from what I saw they had lots of options to meet your needs. Hope to stay again in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I booked this place because of the location and the fact that breakfast was included in the reasonable price. DEFINITELY go for the breakfast option; food is horribly over-priced in NY and a good cooked breakfast in the morning kept us going until our evening mean with just a snack in between. The location is great - two minutes walk from Times Square and two minutes walk from the subway. The rooms very very small but immaculately clean with lovely modern showers and good wardrobe space. We had room 2810 and the nighttime views were incredible. The only thing I would say is that apart from one receptionist the staff were horribly rude and everything was an inconvenience. Fortunately we didn’t have to interact too much with them so our stay wasn’t marred by that. All in all a good hotel - a suggestion would be to put tea and coffee in the room as there is no room service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights in October and couldn’t have asked for a better location. It was close enough to most sites, but also far enough from Times Square and the noise. We were on floor 20, which came with wonderful views of the city and the ball drop in Times Square. Our only issue was breakfast. Although they have tried to make it as organised as possible, the breakfast room isn’t big enough to accommodate the amount of guests staying; it turns into a cattle market with people out for themselves!All in all though, staff were friendly and we had a great stay!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel was fantastic. The hotel itself was good. The room was clean and comfy. We had Bed, breakfast and dinner. The dinner was a lovely experience each evening but the breakfast was not so good because it was so manic. But I suppose if you want to stay somewhere popular then you have to put up with that.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights at the Riu Plaza to celebrate our 25 Wedding Anniversary and my husbands 50th. I had emailed ahead to request a good view and we were not disappointed, with a balcony also. Room itself was quite small but it was functional. The hotel is in a perfect location, only a few blocks from Times Square and in the Hell’s Kitchen area. We found that if you arrived any later than 7am for breakfast it was impossible to negotiate the buffet, (fashion). The coffee machine was also faulty on two mornings. We tried a different restaurant for breakfast (capital) one morning thinking it would be quieter but it was even worse. Having said that the food was good and set us up for the day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Riu Plaza Times Square 10/18 for four nights. Excellent location, close to Times Square, Broadway Theatres and many great places to eat and visit. Had a room on the 20th floor looking out onto 8th Avenue, great for watching the world go by. Room very clean, a descent size for New York and bed extremely comfortable. Breakfast was included with our booking and there was plenty choice for everyone, although I would go down early to avoid the queues. Only negative would be the frosted glass around the bathroom, as when putting light on in middle of night it lit up the whole room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We checked in and received an upgrade to room. We were on 17th floor beds comfy and rooms more spacious than i was expecting. We enjoyed breakfast in the fashion bar and the service was excellent. Staff polite and helpful. Location great too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The only thing good about this hotel is the location and proximity to theaters. Breakfast was a nightmare in a crowded dining room and the coffee machines didn’t work. It felt like being on a cruise ship with thousands waiting in line for food. The room was small but bathroom ok. Cleans towels needed to be requested and the hair dryer was broken. Not worth the premium price we paid. More 3 star hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was right in Times Square & close to everything. I was on the 23rd floor so I had a great view of Times Square. I was surprised they didn't have an ice machine in the hotel & the rooms were tiny. The breakfast was good & it was nice to have a bar & coffee spot right in the hotel. Most mornings it was very congested with people checking in & out so the elevators were slow in the morning. Since there wasn't an area for smokers, they were right outside the hotel entry. Overall I enjoyed my stay there.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our first stay at the Riu Plaza NYC and I'd definitely stay there again.Check-in was very quick. We arrived early (around noon) and, as expected, were told the room wouldn't be ready until 3:30 or 4:00. They checked us in and we stored our luggage with the bellman who couldn't have been nicer. We went back to the hotel at 2:30 and found that our room was available. We were put on the 8th floor and the room was great; glad we weren't near the elevators or ice machine. The room was small (it's NYC, what do you expect?) but very updated. There was no carpeting in the lobby, hallways or the room - all hard floors which is great for rolling luggage. There was a night stand on both sides of the king size bed with outlets easily accessible for charging. The closet was large and the room included a safe. The bath was a good size and we had plenty of counter space on the vanity plus a huge shelf under the sink to store our toiletries. The shower was a large glass enclosure with both handheld shower spray and a rain shower head. One small negative was the frosted glass between bathroom and bedroom so if someone turns on the light in the middle of the night it may disturb others who are trying to sleep. Our rate included the breakfast buffet which was quite extensive with lots of hot and cold choices including meats, cheeses and fish. The restaurant was very busy but we were seated immediately. The location is excellent, close to Times Square, Broadway theaters and many tourist attractions.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I just recently returned from the riu plaza after a four night stay with my 3 children after a long flight from the uk we arrived at the hotel the lobby is beautiful so modern and clean check in staff were very friendly and check in was fast and simple we were helped with our luggage to our room room was clean and modern beds were comfy bottled water provided and all the toiletries you could need shampoo conditioner wash etc were all provided I was very satisfied!!! we took the bed and breakfast option which is well worth it as breakfast in New York can be on the exspensive side the breakfast has lots of choice my kids loved it it’s buffet style so you just help your self great way to set up for your busy days!!! On day of check out we still had a few hours after check out before we had to leave for our flight so the hotel were happy to store all our luggage safely away so we could enjoy our last few hours in Manhattan all in all a great stay will defenetly return and they are so great with the kids so would defenetly recceomend it for family’s

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here recently on our first visit to the Big Apple. The hotel is located centrally with all visitor attractions within walking distance, two minutes to Times Square ! Our room was on the 28th Floor with great views. Room was modern, spacious,cleaned to a high standard on a daily basis. Breakfast was plentiful with ample selection to suit most tastes and to fuel our bodies for the busy days exploring the city. Sampled the restaurant on one evening which was also excellent value for money at $30 per person. Would definitely recommend the hotel to other travelers and would be happy to stay again if we return in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my boyfriend have been here since Saturday and are staying until Sunday.The room is small, but it’s clean. We didn’t get water when we arrived, but we got one bottle each on Monday. Yesterday the cleaning lady took one of the room keys so now we have to go down and get another one.The location is great and the service when we checked in was good.The breakfast is not good at all. You feel that you are eating dry leftovers from two days earlier and they are often empty for some things. I always look forward to hotel breakfasts when I am travelling, but now we are considering eating out, even though we have paid for breakfast all week.One day we were tired and decided to eat dinner downstairs and try the buffèt. This was one of the worst buffet I have ever tasted. Bad selection of food and nothing made sense to eat together. The food was once again dry. It took forever to get something to drink because the waiters were busy and forgot your order.The buffèt costs 35 dollar and with one Cola Zero I got in a glass that tasted soap, one coffea and one beer, we paid over 100 dollars. So not worth it!After dinner we wanted to buy some water in the Grab and go area. They had closed a couple of minutes early and didn’t let us buy anything. The customerservice on this hotel is not the best.Do you want a hotel because of it’s location I would live here. If you want good customerservice, where you feel like the staff wants you to enjoy your stay, choose another hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here recently on our first trip to New York, The hotel is in a superb location, the famous Restaurant Row is on 46th street,just walk outside, turn right and you're there!, its just a 2 minute walk into the manic Times Square and only 10 minutes walk to Central Park,42nd street subway station is less than 5 minutes away. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and the rooms are just as you would expect from the great Riu chain. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and varied. We booked late checkout on our final day and it was no trouble for the staff.The views from the rooms and corridor windows are amazing!We liked the hotel so much we have rebooked again for next year.Thank you to all the staff for making our trip so memorable!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Went with my daughter we were happy we picked the riu!! The location was perfect as it was very close to the action of time square as well as access to the broadways, subways, and short walks from many things to see or do. Our room was on 26th floor with amazing view of the city and the water!!! This was an executive level so we had access to executive lounge where you could help your self to many types of wines as well as soft drinks and snacks! nice place to unwind at the end of the day!we tried the buffet breakfast one morning and decided we would not go there for breakfast for the rest of our stay it was just too chaotic and picked over for us... i rather one of the many new york bagel places in the morning for a more authentic experience :) I will go back to this riu again when i visit new york and happily recommend to others! also on another note i’m from canada not sure if this is a normal thing in new york but the windows in our 26th floor room opened... like right up?? not very safe? would be careful of this with small kids

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very comfortable hotel in a prime location in New York. Excellent breakfast buffet catering for international tastes. Efficient friendly and helpful front desk staff. Walking distance to many sites including Broadway theatres, Central Park and subway stations. Would definitely use this hotel again on future trips to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing absolutely breath taking...loved the decor felt rich...very affordable...food delicious...employees were the kindest n sharp dressing people I've seen...just all out fabulous n very fancy... Might I add right in the heart of New York time square...easy accessible to everything in New York site sees including subway n tour buses... 100% u can't go wrong with this hotel above n beyond what I expected!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just come back from 4 nights at the Riu Plaza in NYC.It's an excellent hotel in all respects, spotlessly clean and well appointed.One good idea is an area with 4 computers and a printer so you can print out your own boarding passes etc.A few good food and drink places near by, Bareburger on same road 100yds down good variety particularly for vegetarians and good value for money. Also on same Street is 5Napkin on the corner a bit more expensive but Veggie burgers are 10/10.If you want a cheap drink and don't mind slumming it Rudy's bar around the corner on 8th Av (5min walk) is great, looks rough but people friendly, drinks about 50% price of everywhere else, Budweiser $3 a pint.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I spent 5 days at the Riu Plaza and found it a perfect place to stay for access to all the sites. The hotel is very comfortable and has everthing you would want. The food was excellent and staff were friendly and helpful. My room was perfect and I loved the view from my window.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were in New York for a quick weekend to see Hamilton and wanted to stay near the theater district and Times Square. We needed a room that was large enough for 3 of us. This hotel has a family suite that worked perfectly. The room is very large for a New York City hotel room. When you enter the room, there is a small desk and the entrance to the bathroom. The family suite has two separate rooms - one king and one with two queen beds. Each room has its own television. The hotel has a very nice breakfast buffet in the morning with several hot options including a few egg and meat options, oatmeal, pancakes along with the usual pastry and fruit. There is a snack bar with "grab & go" items like pastries, sandwiches and drinks. The line always seemed long so we never shopped there. The location of this hotel is great. We walked to the theater, Times Square and shopping along Fifth Avenue. I absolutely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights, family of 5 in a 2 bed suite.Hotel was superb.Location excellent as 1 block from Times Square. We had access to a small lounge for refreshments throughout our stay. Breakfast was really busy although we always got seated without waiting. Food at buffet was delicious and varied. Our rooms were spacious and very clean.Underbed storage was a great way of keeping suitcases out of the way.I would book this hotel again without hesitation

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at the Riu for 1 night last weekend and it was exceptional. I loved the location. It was within walking distance to so many things, shopping, restaurants etc. Its a lil pricey to me, but overall it was very nice. The breakfast buffet was also very good. The room was clean, great shower and the beds were extremely comfortable. We also had a fantastic view of the Hudson.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was in a great location, spotless and comfy bed. Great that breakfast is included. Gets very busy but they run a tight ship. Would def stay again. Concergie was great, really helpful. A nice cocktail bar too.
user_name:
Michelle A
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent location, 5 minute walk from Times Square. Great breakfast, great showers clean and tidy rooms. Comfortable bed and although busy we had no issues with waiting for lifts or breakfast. Staff I would say we're on the whole very helpful but some were abrupt and a bit rude.... maybe that's a New York thing. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Big, modern hotel ideally placed for the theatre district and Hells Kitchen area. Staff friendly and efficient. Room was larger than expected though it was a deluxe one. Nice big fluffy towels and amazing rainfall shower. Breakfast was included in our room rate and though very busy there was plenty of choice hot or cold. Probably most annoying was the coffee machines, they were continually being restocked causing queues.We booked from the UK almost a year in advance so may not have got the best deal today. Will learn from this.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had 5 nights stay for special birthday trip, on arrival a box chocolates and card from hotel had been left in our room, a nice touch and appreciated! Hotel modern, spotlessly clean throughout, bar staff very friendly and pleasant as were the breakfast team. Breakfast can get busy but we were up and out most mornings to cram everything in to our trip so we beat the rush which seemed to start around 8.15 am. Husband used gym each morning and was more than happy with it. Hotel is in a really good location for getting to sights/subway access and lots nice restaurants nearby in Hells Kitchen area, it’s also close to theatre area so you have lots of choice within short distance. Whilst out walking miles each day we spotted a few other hotels that we had considered before booking but I am so pleased chose Riu it was perfect for us. Would recommend and hope to return one day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived into a busy lobby, efficient staff. Room clean, comfortable with a view of skyscrapers reflecting the lights of Times Square a block away. Breakfasts were like being on a railway platform with large numbers of guests self serving from the buffet bars. Recommend rising early and using the cocktail bar for breakfast as it starts & ends earlier than the other larger ground floor dining area.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 5 nights in a family room. Whilst the hotel is clean, comfortable and ideally located, travelers should be aware that the deluxe family rooms are small. Sure they hold 2 doubles and a sofa bed but if you intend to have 3 or even 4 in a room, it is going to be cramped, especially with luggage. The breakfast room is unbelievably busy and packed but staff do a fantastic job of getting people seated, tables cleared and constantly refreshing food. And they do it with a smile. On check in though we found front desk staff to be unaccommodating and surly. Although we booked a room for occupancy of 3 people months in advance, the 3rd (sofa) bed was not made up on arrival and we had to ask three times before it was done ! There was no water in the room so we asked for some at reception, which they said would be dispatched. It never arrived.Bar area pleasant and staff there were helpful and welcoming. Bell-hops also really cheerful and accommodating.So overall some good, some bad, hence my 3star rating. Price was ok compared to surrounding competitor hotels but I was left with impression that I’d rather have spent the extra and got a better overall experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were already in New York and had stayed at a terrible hotel the night previously. It was so bad that we had to make a change for our remaining 2 nights in the city (I had never done this before). Fortunately, through our booking site, we were able to get this hotel for less than what we would have paid for our previous one. If that was the equivalent of a 1-star hotel (I don't care what it claimed to be!), it made this place seem like a 5+ star hotel. Bright, light, modern, clean. Bliss. Our room on the 19th floor gave great views along Broadway and from the corridor you could see out to the Hudson.The hotel is in a good location. Short walking distance to Times Square and within walking distance to Central Park, Fifth Avenue, High Line etc. It's a short walking distance from a few different subway lines. It's straightforward to get a taxi or Uber from outside. The service at the hotel was swift, polite and prompt. Couldn't speak more highly of it, particularly the guys at the bell desk. As I was in New York, I paid little interest to the facilities the hotel had. You only need a nice room for your stay really IMO. Breakfast was included, which was a nice added bonus. The only negative was how busy this turned out to be. The problem with larger buffet breakfasts like this is your always at the mercy of the behaviour of the other guests. Unfortunately, there is always going to be some people (who can't wait for their Weisswurst!!) barging halfway down the queue for the breakfast items. Or people who ignorantly stand and block main/narrow walkways. There was a member of staff assigning tables to people on arrival to the breakfast area. But perhaps they could section off parts of the serving area so that it's less chaotic; force people to walk the line for the breakfast items instead of queue jumping etc.The price to value was good considering the price of our previous hotel. However, Manhattan isn't a cheap place to stay, especially when you're only really after a clean comfortable bed to rest at the end of a long day. If you can get this hotel for a reasonable rate, I would definitely recommend staying here. Our room included; small hair dryer, walk-in shower, double bed, TV.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: When we checked in, we barely recieved a hello and no smile, much less, ‘welcome to our establishment, we hope you have a lovely stay.” For the price we paid, we didn’t feel any warmth. The gentleman who brought up our bags was very kind and always had a smile on his face when we saw him in the lobby. I wish I had caught his name. He brought me a bucket of ice for my injured knee. Room was relatively cleaned, although the shower floor had some dark spots on it Took us a minute to understand that there isn’t any power in the room unless you insert your room key into the wall unit. Had never experienced that before. Beds and pillows were comfy. Location was close to Times Square and Hell’s Kitchen, so that was nice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I just checked into the hotel but have not received a room assignment yet due to my early arrival. I initially booked this hotel for a two night stay to celebrate my birthday post cruise. I prepaid the reservation at a non-refundable rate. Originally, my husband was to travel with me but became ill and could not make the trip. I called the hotel prior to leaving home to have the reservation noted that my mom is traveling with me instead of my husband and we would like the bed type changed from a king to two doubles, if possible.Upon checking in at the desk, I again made the request only to be told by Natalia that they are unable to make changes to reservations and I would have had to call. I informed her that I had called and the reservation was supposed to be noted. After Natalia insisted that the reservation could not be changed, I asked if a manager could possibly make the change, I was then told that the hotel is full. She continued with the check in process and stated that she’d speak with her manager. I told her that I would like to speak with the manager and she said okay. She went in back and returned with a male who never approached the counter but told her to tell me that my reservation can be noted to make the change at an additional charge per night.Of course, I rejected this and I can assure you that I will never book here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a room on the 11th floor and could see Times Square! Fresh and clean. Included breakfast which was varied and plentiful and certainly adequate though not great food. Loved the big shower with both rain and wand showerheads. We knew to expect small but the room was set up perfectly, and the bathroom was large.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Came back from a full day out needing to have a shower to get cleaned up to go back out but hell no Riu plaza have no towels we asked where they were at 5 they told us they may not have a delivery until tomorrow so an awful lot of rooms have no towels it’s a total joke. Staff just can’t be bothered!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This place has a fantastic modern NYC foyer / lobby area with a great bar attached to it that makes you feel like you are in New York.But that’s about it!!The rooms are so small you can’t even swing a cat in them. Suit cases are suggested to go under the bed to make room.. pretty hard for a family of 4!!I had to go down and wait in the lobby every morning and wait for my girls to get ready just to make some space.Very disappointed in the after service too as I left 2 articles of clothing there by my own fault and still after 5 phone calls are yet to be found!!! the clothing to replace are $400 in total as Ralph Lauren and was sweat pants size 4xl and a puffer jacket size 4xl so it’s not like a white T shirt that could get mixed up in the linen run...Now I get it’s my fault and I guess they would have over 2000 guests stay in the place at one time but surly it’s not hard for the cleaners to get 2 items of clothing to there lost and found!!!I think someone has sticky fingers in this joint So this place is a big fat No for me

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our first time in New York and we loved the Riu. The property is new and clean. We were there for a week and had 2 full size beds pushed together and they were very comfortable. Good sized quiet room on the 25th floor with a great view. Nice clean shower and bathroom. The included breakfast was excellent. Located 1 block from Times Square and the Broadway shows. Friendly staff. The clientele is mainly European - they all seemed unfriendly and unhappy to be alive not sure what that's about but we didn't care the facility was awesome! Thanks Riu we'll be back!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: just had a 6 day holiday in new York and stopped at the riu hotel ,excellent hotel,.staff very friendly and helpful, well located very close to times square ( 5 mins walk).we got an upgrade to the 26th floor and the views were fantastic the only downside was the noise from the never ending traffic but after a couple of days we got use to it

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What an excellent hotel in every way! I went with my husband for 5 nights. Super quick check in when we arrived, we were given a room on the 20th floor which was perfect. Spotlessly clean, fab view and added bonus of a mini fridge. Breakfast was busy but the staff are so efficient we were seated within minutes and the breakfast was amazing. Something for everyone. There’s a really cool bar which I think opens at 6pm which serves really reasonably priced cocktails. If I was lucky enough to return to New York I wouldn’t hesitate to book this hotel again. Also it’s in the best location, only a few minutes walk from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: beautiful 4 star hotel so close to time square. 5 minutes to feet.room clean but not to much big.the room are new and cleanGreat Continental breakfast.inside the room you have a chiller and one big flat tv.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our stay at the Riu was absolutely hassle free! The lobby was delightfully scented, the checkin process very smooth. The room impeccable and staff helpful and courteous! In fact, 6 hours after check out I realized I had left my medication in the room frig. They had it refrigerated and ready for me when I came back to retrieve it!!! BYW. The buffet breakfast was hearty and varied. They even had gluten free toast for me. Definately a great find !!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 2 nights here and loved the location, only 1 block from Times Square. Clean room, friendly service from staff, and the best breakfast buffet ! Would highly recommend if you want to be close to the energy of Times Square !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for four nightsGreat location for central NYHotel is functional not fancy, clean and tidy.Rooms are of reasonable size,plain & cleaned daily, ours was a inward facing room so little noise from traffic, we did get the rumble of the Subway but not very much.Breakfast food was fresh,plentiful in quantity and quality. we did have issues with the dining hall being overcrowded as the tables were very close and this made it difficult to get to the buffet as there were many visitors everyone was crossing paths to the food stations.Lifts were very busy at most times as they are serving 28 floors, waiting was common at breakfast time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: In terms of location it's difficult to get better than this Hotel, if you add to that the quality of the installations, the friendly and helpful staff and the good breakfast then you've got a winner. In our case we also had a friend who works at the hotel and we were allocated rooms on the 24th floor with great views. All in all we spent a couple of great nights at this hotel and we can recommend it unreservedly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at Hotel Riu Plaza for a week for sightseeing in New York. We booked through British Airways Holidays and breakfast was included. I emailed the hotel prior to arriving to request a nice high room if possible as we were staying for our wedding anniversary and wanted it to be special. The hotel were very obliging and allocated us a room on the 29th floor which helped with any noise from traffic below although you can’t hear this with the windows closed anyway. We arrived to a bottle of Champagne and a card wishing us Happy Anniversary from the hotel which was a nice touch. We were very happy with our room which was a deluxe king room with a comfy bed and a spacious bathroom with toiletries replenished every day as were the towels. The room was very well looked after by housekeeping and cleaned every day we couldn’t fault it. The food in the restaurant at breakfast was very good, only problem was the plates weren’t always warmed so the food went cold quickly , the restaurant always felt a little crowded as though you were on top of each other but we only had breakfast daily so that was fine. All the staff were pleasant and helpful at all times and they are all a credit to the hotel. We were sorry to be leaving but we hope to return one day, thank you a Riu Plaza for a memorable stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 11 nights. We were on the 21st floor so had good views. The hotel is modern & bright we had breakfast included which was good you can also get a buffet evening meal. Found all the staff friendly & approachable. Hotel itself is nicely situated for Broadway & theres nice restaurants nearby. Handy for subways.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed three nights in this hotel. It was modern, pleasant, and friendly. We enjoyed our stay right in the heart of the city just a few blocks from Times Square. However, we visited the bar all three nights because it was convenient, but it is Poorly managed. The drinks we ordered were not correctly made, they served NO FOOD and the potato chips were served about 5 at a time, and try as we might, they just wouldn’t bring more than a handful. Service was only adequate and not friendly, and here’s a no brainer, they had no Pinot Griegio any of the nights and it’s on the menu!! We requested each night, and there was no excuse given.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fab hotel and would be my go to in NYC. Super convenient location. Very modern and funky - staff all really helpful. Cracking deal in the restaurant for a 2 course lunch. Rooms small but hey its NYC. Beds comfortable. Only wee complaint that checking in was a bit manic but may have been alot of people checking in the same time as us . x

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is situated one block away from Times Square so not too noisy. Very clean hotel and our room was nice and spacious with everything you need including a small fridge with complimentary water provided. The breakfast choice was very good but the only downside for me was the tables were too close together meaning you had to squeeze between the tables to get to your seat, this is the reason I've not given 5 stars. The staff are very friendly. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for a week during our week holiday in NY. The location of the hotel itself is perfect - it is so close to the centre of Times Square. The room was immaculate, very clean and well designed. Housekeeping always did a great job! The staff were all very friendly, we even requested late check out which was granted as our return flight was late at night. We did pay an extra $30 for this. Breakfast was good, with a variety of foods - accommodating for all.There was even an area with computer access and a printer, which was really helpful as we had booked things when we were at the hotel. Overall a great stay and we would definitely use this hotel again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, the staff were excellent. The room lovely and clean. It is only one block away from the centre of Times Square and within walking distance of Central Park, Empire State Building and Juniors with cheesecake to die for. The food was good with plenty of selection for breakfast. The only downside is there is no tea making equipment in the room... not back during the day as you can always grab of cup from Grab and Go cafe which is within the lobby... but first thing in the morning we had to hang on until breakfast. Having said that it is a fabulous hotel and well worth a stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Attention to detail was perfect. We emailed ahead to request non feather bedding for my husband as we do with all our hotel stays with my husband being asthmatic, correspondence was prompt and polite. We advised them we would be staying with them during our anniversary and requested a room with a view if possible. On arrival our room was not ready as it was 2pm, we expected this and went for a drink. Check in was quick, reception was polite. On entering our room we were greeted with a bottle of champagne, 2 glasses, a little note wishing us a happy anniversary, a fantastic view, and the all important non feathered bedding. You would be amazed at how many hotels still put it in our rooms despite a request being made ahead each time. The room was spacious by NYC standards, spotless and no noise from outside. Breakfast had something for everyone, was tasty and wholesome but a little chaotic. We chose to go for the half board option as we have been to NYC many times and experienced many restaurants and wanted something non hassle at the end of our busy day. There was plenty of choice, we only ate here 2 nights butt different choices both nights, all fresh and lovely, only thing that left a lot to be desired was the pizza, otherwise, food great, easy to get a table and service also great. Each time we go to NYC we always make a habit of trying new hotels no matter how good the previous hotel was, but on our next visit I think we might actually consider revisiting this hotel again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited New York back in January this year and stayed at the Riu Plaza Hotel. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to stay in that part of the city. It is 1street away from the main part of Times Square with plenty of different entrances to the subway surrounding the hotel. The breakfast provided from the hotel was fanstasic and they also provide take out cups so you can take a hot drink with you to start your day. (Fab on a winter morning).The hotel staff are so kind and polite and our room was always left in a fantastic manor once the cleaners had been. Will definitely be looking to return to this hotel in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had stayed at the Hotel 2 years ago and loved it then. This time around, they have added variety to their breakfast and have a buffet dinner. Great value for money. Hotel is in the vicinity of timesquare and there is so much to do around the Hotel.Staff us friendly and professional and very accommodating.I was expecting a package which was untraceable and even till the day I left, the team assured me that they will keep looking!!I would recommend anyone travelling to NY to stay here.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 6 of us visited last week from the UK, we all had rooms on the 20th floor, absolutely fabulous views. Great rooms, simple but very clean and a fabulous shower. Breakfast was amazing as much or as little as you wanted, we never waited to be seated & went down at varying times between 6.30 & 8.30. Had the evening buffet 1 evening which was brilliant. The staff were all very very helpful & pleasant, we came back most evenings and had a drink in the bar - fabulous cocktails. Right by Times Square and many shops/bars/eateries etc. Can’t wait to go back

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent hotel situated in a prime location with super service and yummy food. I should mentyion that the staff was very helpful and the rooms was clean and tiday though small. Value for money i guess and no hesitation in recomending this propoerty to anyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me & my husband stayed at the Riu Plaza for 4 nights. It was simply amazing, exceptionaly clean all of the time, our room was on the 7th floor with floor to ceiling windows showing an amazing view, the room itself was very spacious and big bathroom. It was immaculate. Decorated to an exceptional high standard. We had breakfast included and that was delicious, lots of choice at the breakfast buffet. Going into the bar in the evenings was a plus aswell. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, just a few mins walk to Times Square and around 10min walk to the Empire State Building and 20mins to Central Park. I would highly recommend this hotel and would most definitely stay here again and again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really good location to get to times square. Also subway station just a few blocks up from which you can get downtown to world trade center, statue of liberty etc. Good breakfast choice (included within our deal). Would recommend and would stay here again.Agree that there is a frosted glass 'issue' with the shower into the room, (that others have commented on) but not a problem for us.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our second visit to this hotel and we found it just as good as first time. The main big difference is that they now do breakfast. It's very convenient having breakfast before going out in the morning instead of the other way around. I've read some complaints about the breakfast in other reviews. We found nothing wrong with it. The food was hot, plenty of it, and choices for every taste. As in every hotel buffet meals are spoiled by the selfish minority who seem to think that every meal is going to be their last one and charge around causing chaos. Friendly staff, lots of them, and with breakfast being available until 11am no need to panic. I found Kenneth in the restaurant was especially helpful. My only complaint about Riu Plaza is the Fashion Bar. A large beer, (about a pint) and a small Amaretto cost $27. Come on Riu, you have four stars so stop charging five star prices. Wi fi is good as is the air-con.If back in N.Y. we wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was whisked away for my 30th Birthday to New York as it was my first time mt partner wanted me to be Central and near all the attractions within walking distance this hotel was perfect for that . It’s such a modern clean and chilled out hotel . It’s not long built so it’s one of the newer ones around midtown New York !! Not only was this a great place to stay you also got breakfast included which was amazing as saved us looking for somewhere every morning and wasting time as we were only there 4 nights !!! We went early for breakfast around 7am as after that Time gets really busy !! I asked for a high dollar for the views and they placed us on the 25th floor great views and a little less noisy if that’s possible. All round great trip would book again in a minute!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and i stayed in this hotel two weeks ago for 4 nights..Staff all friendly,breakfast excellent lots of choices and open from 6-30 until 11-00.Hotel in excellent location.The bar area was very cosy and 8 dollars for a large beer which was reasonable considering the bar prices outside where 6-8 dollars.Wi-fi excellent and free in hotel.Would definitely recommend this hotel and will return soon.Could not fault anything,even a free computer to use so we could check in online for our return flights.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here with my family for 5 nights. Great location, just a short walk to time square. Some great restaurants within a couple of hundred yards and much quieter than the overcrowded time square area, if that’s your preference.Super fast elavators made staying on the 17 floor easy. Breakfast included is the best option as it’s a massive spread of food for all. Rooms a little small but not really an issue.Highly Recommended.Clean & friendly hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having just stayed here after recommendation from our travel agent, I couldn’t recommend it anymore if I tried. Location was brilliant, breakfast was tasty and the room was lovely and comfortable especially after a long day out on our feet with a lovely view over the city. We would happily return to this hotel so thanks :).

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a great gem, on 7th avenue and so close to Times Square and even to Central Park. My only complaint was the checkin, I arrived early and as expected the room was not ready.. no problem leave your bags at reception and we will e mail you when the room was ready.. I am still waiting for the e mail, after doing my rounds I returned at 2.45PM (checkin is at 3pm) exhausted and needing my room after a long flight.. yes it was ready, just wondered how long it was ready is I waited for 2 hours in the lobby for the room... anyway, mistakes happen and the hotel more then made up for this.Room was small but functional, breakfast was great (extremely busy but efficient), dinner was surprisingly good, fresh and a variety of buffet style food.I would definitely return to Riu Plaza New York!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is in a prefect location - close to everything Midtown - theaters, restaurants, Times Sq, subway etc.It's quiet, clean, and staff were lovely. Rooms were compact but not too small, nice bathroom, and great bed!Buffet breakfast, although busy, was exceptional.Laundry costs were very high, but there is a laundromat around the corner on 9th if needs be.Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for five nights at the end of August..Check in was good, even though I forgot to take the card I payed with.. I was told that i needed it beforehand, but it got left it behind. We had a top floor room which was amazing and could see times Square.Room was lovely and clean with a massive comfortable bed! TV and mini fridge. Iron and board. The shower is huge and bathroom really clean.The lifts are fast and frequent which is good.Breakfast is well worth it, we are every morning which set us up for the busy day ahead. From fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, and hot buffet. Can be busy at times, but everyone is in the same boat, wanting to be in fed and out. We also had evening meal 4/5 nights, this more than anything saved a hell of a lot of time "looking" for somewhere to eat while on a busy schedule. Staff were very friendly, you can book a shuttle to JFK for $26 pp at the concierge desk, they come every two hours..The location is great. Two minute walk to times Square, 10 mins to subway and the same to port authority.The lobby area is also immaculate and pleasing in the eye with pink lighting.Couldn't fault this hotel at all and I would definitely stay again I've already recommended it to friends!! You with t be disappointed.
user_name:
louisea461
Thornaby on Tees, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Recently stayed at the Riu Plaza for three nights. The room was fabulous, clean, spacious with great views from the 14th floor,Breakfast were excellent - buffet so you could try various dishes.The staff were smiley, helpful and very friendly. I was surprised to find this in the centre of a large city. Would stay there again and recommend it highly!.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent base for visiting New York. Hotel is located a short walk from Times Square and lots of subway stations for getting around the city. We were on the 27th floor and had an amazing view of the city -couldn’t hear any noise from traffic. The room was compact, spotless with fast WiFi and comfy bed. Breakfast was included and was good for buffet style. Staff were efficient and polite. Would recommend and stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The room was very nice and comfortable. It was rather tiny, but adequate room. There is no ice machine in this hotel. The breakfast was extremely good. The location is perfect if you are there to go to a play.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
