review_body: Lobby is large and modern, rooms modern and beautiful. They were very forthcoming with free WiFi, food, and an upgrade. Excellent locationOnly one slight negative, when the a/c turns on it can get very loudLarge modern TV. Everything you can want in a room at a great price

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The customer service men are awfull. They are very rude, they cannot be trusted. I have asked them to help me finding the most reasonable way to get to the airport and of course they had recommended the black taxi service whih cooperates with the hotel. Unfortunately it is the most expensive transportation service. On top of them being very rude about my questioning their choices they were very pushy and unpleasant. I hope someone from the management will read my review and do something about it for the sake of other visitors.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in August and the stay was good. The rooms were new and modern and very clean. The breakfast was a bit of a zoo and the food was just ok, but decent for a buffet. The location is the best part as it's two blocks off times square and close to multiple subway stops so getting around NYC was a breeze.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband booked this spot as we were attending Summer: The Donna Summer musical. It was in perfect proximity to the Lunt-Fontanne Theater! And the hotel was such a surprise! It's literally a resort in the middle of NYC! The staff was amazing, check in was easy and seamless and the rooms are a pleasant surprise. Small, of course...it's NYC, but they were nicely appointed and our room had a great view of the NYC skyline. Our package also included breakfast and dinner which made a huge difference! Loved the fact that he found this gem! I'd certainly book there again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at Riu NY Plaza whilst mu visit to New York and the hotel was amazing.... From check in to check out the process was so smooth and the service was outstanding. It gave you a personal touch where you felt welcomed and the hotel is new as well. Situated walking distance to Times Square the location is ideal for any traveller. The food was amazing with a full spread breakfast and Dinner and worth the monies. I have no hesitation in recomending this hotel to any person who intends travelling to NY be it on business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Have just returned home after spending five nights at this fabulous hotel, from check in to check out we found everything to be perfect .The cleanliness of this hotel is outstanding in every way .We had breakfast each day and although it was very busy staff have you seated in no time at all, the food was buffet style with a wide choice of everything you could wish for at breakfast time.The staff at this hotel are amazing especially when you see how busy they are but they always greet you with a smile and are so professional and friendly. The hotel is located just far enough away from  Times square to be able to enjoy a little peace and quiet should you wish to do so.We are frequent travellers to New York and its the first time staying here and it certainly will not be the last, to sum it up a great hotel run by dedicated hard working staff who are a credit to the RIU, we would highly recommend and thank you to all at the RIU Times Square for a fabulous stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was my first time in NYC and we wanted to stay somewhere central as we didn’t really know the area. Couldn’t have done any better with this hotel which is ideally situated for the Times Square and 42nd Street subway. The hotel is on 8th and 46th street which is very handy for dining on 46th Street although you can dine in the hotel. The thing that struck us when we checked in after a long flight and transfer was the welcome and efficiency of the staff that we met. Whilst talking about the staff, we never met anyone who wasn’t polite, welcoming and professional, these staff are a credit to this hotel. The room was very clean and had a safe, fridge, TV, iron and ironing board. Although we only had breakfast in the hotel it had a large selection of fresh food that would cater for all tastes. Great location from which to explore and the hotel did have the benefit of having a large RUI sign on the top of it which was great when you were trying to get back to it. Recommended!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: These guys have got the hotel down to a science, even resembling cruise ship life. Rooms are clean but tiny. Showers are great. Beds are comfortable.staff are courteous, helpful and pleasant. Location is amazing- across the street from Hamilton! Wow. Baggage is checked for free and everyone is so accommodating.Breakfast resembles a cruise too. There are hot and cold offerings, lots of fresh fruit and even cereal tastes fresh. We’ll stay again. With all the guests I hope they are able to maintain cleanliness and very good quality. We stayed for 4 nights - and no complaints.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here from 18 Aug and had an amazing time, really can’t fault the hotel or holiday at all. Room was amazing, clean and very modern. We had a 24th floor room with a view over New York and the Hudson River. Some people had mentioned the bathroom with it’s frosted glass wall and was a tad apprehensive as we had taken our daughter for her 21st but it really wasn’t a problem. If you turned the bathroom light on you could see the outline of your body but if you left the light off you really couldn’t see a thing. We just used light from the room itself when showering so wasn’t an issue at all. They do a buffet breakfast each day which was really good and had a choice that would suit any palate. If you have enough to eat at breakfast it sees you for the day and saves a fortune in eating out through the day. The hotel staff were lovely and really friendly definitely made the right choice with this hotel. It is situated on the corner of 8th and 46th street so a couple mins walk from Times Square and all the other main attractions. Also on the same street as all the restaurants the locals call it Restaurant Alley so never short of choice of places to eat and on your hotel doorstep. Any advice was freely given when asking hotel staff and didn’t try to sell you tours just advised best places to go and options to do them. Will definitely return to New York it was incredible and will definitely stay at Riu Paz’s again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for three days and had absolutely no problems. Our fee came with the breakfast and the dinner. For those traveling on a budget you can't beat the price. The breakfast and dinner was plenty for us. The lines for breakfast and dinner can get long but they move quickly so it's not that serious. The only major complaint I have is the smell of the room was bad when we arrived. It smelled like something was wet. Once I sprayed the room the smell went away and wasn't has noticeable. The shower doors do not close all the way therefore you will have the floor a mess when you finish. The executive lounge was the best thing ever. The executive lounge is only for those with executive suites and above. It was a pleasure to come back from so much walking and being able to grab a drink and sandwich without having to walk to a store. We will definitely come back again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good location, steps away from theaters and all the Time Square action. The hotel has restaurants with very good food and drinks. It’s very clean and comfortable with good staff. Happy Birthday to my baby!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This boutique style hotel is in a fantastic location to explore the city at the heart of Times Square and the Hell’s Kitchen district. Rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. Lots of restaurants and bars on the doorstep and a visit to the piano bar a few doors down is a must for a great evening of entertainment.Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The best thing about this hotel is it’s location. Close enough to easily walk to most of the main attractions - Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, etc - but sufficiently far enough from Times Square (about 5 mins walk) not to be totally overwhelmed with the mayhem! Rooms are clean, new and perfectly fine. They are a little on the small side and storage isn’t great, but this is Central New York. There is only a shower - no bathtub and no lock on the bathroom door if you value your privacy . We were one adult and two teenagers sharing a family room with two doubles and a sofa bed - a real bonus for kids who don’t want to share a bed. The inclusive breakfast is plentiful and good. It is busy but we never had to queue for long. Staff helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend it on location alone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Place was one of the cleanest hotels we have ever visited. Spotless! Complementary breakfast and dinner buffet were both very good. Located in the heart of Times Square. We will definitely be back again !!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The position is good but it is not best in Times Square. The hotel is very new (it is visible) and the staff is very gentle and available. The breakfast is various and always refilled but you have to wait in line some minutes to eat. We had a surprise at checkout, we requested a taxi to the bell boy, he sold out a "service" all inclusive that it seemed convenience to us. In the end, the driver asked us 25 USD more for an inexplicable tax. Be careful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location for first time visitors or returners like ourselves. One block away from Times Square, and about two from broadway Lots of local eateries, diners and bars nearby with less touristy pricing, if you go one block opp way from TS when you step out of hotel Views from rooms exactly what you want from a NY city base, rooms stylish and modern. Taxi (yellow cab) I'm sure was about £50-60 from/to JFK each way, takes about 45mins, just hail yourself from hotel door. Great base for doing all the touristy spots.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a short walk from times square and ideal for theatre district and other attractions and many restaurants within a short distance. Rooms are quite small but modern, clean and comfortable. There is a nice bar area and restaurant although general lounge area is limited. Staff very helpful and keen to give good service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, staff very helpful and friendly, Rooms just right for a city break - clean, tidy, well equipped...breakfast very good choice you won't go hungry.. Wifi for those who can't live without it - very good in all areas including rooms and is free it is easy to find 46th and 8th Ave...4 blocks from subway get a metrolink card = $32 for seven days unlimited...would definatley use this hotel again....perfect.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I had to write a review for the RIU plaza because we had the most wonderful experience! Everything from check in to check out was done with perfection. On the day of check-in our flight arrived in the city quite early around 1030am. We went to the hotel and they were very helpful and stored our luggage until check-in time. We went back to the hotel close to 2pm to see if a room was available early as we had tickets to a show at 3pm. We got Joanne at the front desk. She was so friendly and helpful. Not only was she able to accommodate our early check in but she also upgraded us to the executive floor. We were celebrating my husband’s birthday and this was such an amazing surprise and lovely touch. We had half board, which includes the breakfast and dinner buffets. We hadn’t planned on eating dinner at the hotel but were very impressed with the buffet, so we ended up eating there almost every night. The first night, the staff at the dinner buffet was extraordinary! I wish I had gotten names because they worked great as a team, were very attentive to customers and just made you feel welcomed. All the staff were great at the hotel, but these ones were just exceptional. Breakfast included – eggs (scrambled or over medium), bacon, sausage, pancakes or waffles, a variety of fruit, pastries, breads, etc. Breakfast is very busy, so I suggest going before 8am. The line can get quite long – both to get in and to get food. We were up early every day, so we never had to wait long. Dinner buffet had a wide variety of foods, including a carving station, a seafood station, various meats, pastas, veggies, pizzas, soup, etc. The dinner buffet was never busy. I know you go to New York for the food but we were on a budget and this allowed us to still have a delicious dinner and instead enjoy lunch and late night snacks out which was easier on the bank. Our king room was on the small side but that is expected for New York. Nonetheless, it was perfect for the two of us and had everything we needed. The room was spotless and had a great view of the city. The whole hotel, including the room, is very modern. The shower did leak a bit onto the floor in the bathroom/front area as noted on other reviews. I agree something the hotel should consider fixing to avoid mold issues in the future but definitely not a huge issue.We had access to the executive lounge which includes access to a room with sofas, chairs, tables, TV, snacks (chips, sandwiches, pastries, nuts, etc.), wine (red, white and rose), variety of pop, tea, coffee and bottled water. I would definitely pay the extra for this level of room next time we go. We requested a late check out on the morning of check out. They were able to accommodate our request for an extra fee which was well worth it since our flight didn’t leave until 6pm. Check out was a breeze, just put your room key in a box and done. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Not only is the hotel amazing but location is ideal – within walking distance to just about everything and close to all subway lines. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is bright and spacious, we stayed for a week and found all staff to be polite and very helpful, our room was always cleaned to a high standard and was brightly decorated.breakfast was buffet style and the choice was what you would expect from a hotel of this high standard. my wife was given a box of chocolates for her birthday totally unexpected as we had not mentioned this to anyone . would certainly stay here again and our personal rating is 9/10

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel ,good location, sits on the corner of west 46 street and 8th avenue one block from broadway, about a 3 minute walkaway. we were in a room on the 17th floor . The room was comfortable with a decent sized walk in shower complete with rain head. Never had to wait long for a lift as there was a bank of six decent sized ones.Reception was large ,bright and modern. The concierge desk has lots of information about Newyork and is the best place to book your return to the airport from. We were on a bed and breakfast deal at the hotel and found a good choice of hot and cold breakfast which is buffet style. We found that the breakfast rooms got very busy after 7.30am as people wanted to get out early site seeing. The bar was clean ,bright and modern and as with everywhere in the hotel friendly staff. We stayed for seven nights and found the position of the hotel perfect ,just minutes from times square, a short walk up 8th avenue to central park and a five to ten minute stroll along 46 street to the Hudson river for the statue of liberty cruises and the Intrepid aircraft carrier.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed one night 8/4 to 8/5 in the Senior Suite on floor 26 for my husband's bday with our kids. There was a nice lounge area on that floor. Dining staff for breakfast were rude didn't even seat us.:(

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in July and this hotel did not disappoint. From the minute we arrived we loved the look of the hotel. It was very bright and modern and everything was nice and clean.We had originally planned to go out and about for breakfast but after seeing the breakfast they offered we stayed put as it was so good! The deluxe room was big enough with space for suitcases under the beds. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The Riu is in a perfect location too. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a visit and we would stay there again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Riu Times Square in November 2017. The hotel lobby and the rooms are very modern and clean.We stayed on the 25th floor facing Times Square and the view was spectacular. The hotel is situated on restaurant row and is in a perfect location to explore all NYC has to offer. Broadway is just across the road. Would stay here again if visiting NYC

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Although we live locally my wife and I decided to stay in the City after seeing a show and dinner.I looked at a lot of hotels and I absolutely recommend this modern hotel. Beautifully decorated, very friendly staff who upgraded our room free, giving us access to a fully stocked executive center with food, drinks including wine and a comfortable lounge. Room was comparably priced to other hotels in this category. I highly recommend this hotel if you plan on staying around the theater district.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We got a family suite as per the website. It was extremely small for a family of five . There was no space to walk. The bathroom flooded each time we had a shower. I think it’s time to change the towels .The breakfast area the guests would use there bare hands to pick up the bread and pastries. The juice glasses were filthy and when I informed the staff nothing was done about it . I would not recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just back from a stay & must say what a great hotel. Clean, excellent staff, nice room and a great breakfast. Close as possible to Times Square and within walking distance of other attractions. Would definitely recommend!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here recently and was not disappointed. Check-in was speedy and efficient and staff were helpful and accommodating. The room itself, although small (expected), was bright, modern and clean with an iron, safe and air-conditioning. The hotel is eco-friendly and will only change your sheet/towels etc if you leave a hanger on the door which works perfectly as I wouldn't change my bedsheets daily at home so I welcomed this environmentally friendly approach. The Riu is perfect in location, just a few minutes walk to Times Square and across the road from the hop-on hop-off buses. If you want to use the subways, these are within walking distance (we used the 42nd street station from Brooklyn and walked the 6-8mins back to hotel). Breakfast offers a selection of hot food (I can't comment as I didn't try), fruit, pastries, cereals, yoghurts, different breads for toasting and hot drinks from a self-serve machine. Yes there was a queue even though we went at different times but staff were super organised and got you seated within minutes! Overall, we had a great stay at the Riu and I would definitely recommend. The only thing I would say that if you are like me and enjoy a cuppa before you even leave the room in the morning then bring a travel kettle as there are no in-room facilities. There is however, a cafe attached to the hotel via a side door that sells hot drinks and snacks but as we were on the 21st floor, this didn't seem an option if we were coming down for breakfast anyway. Good WI-FI too!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Would recommend at least 5 days for a first visit. Amazing place, so much to see. Long days. Don’t waste any time! City bus tours are good for a bit but I wouldn’t recommend as main form of transport. Use underground, much faster. One World tower is a must and next to 9/11 memorial. Get there early and avoid crowds.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my parents have just enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Wonderful Riu Hotel in New York. This hotel is only 2 years old which is evident through the modern and funky decor throughout the hotel. It is sleek, clean and has all the amenties you need for a great city stay. Upon check in we were informed that the hotel was fully booked and that our rooms had been upgraded to the next category as a result of booking directly with the hotel. Our rooms were located on the 26th floor where we enjoyed superb views from our floor length windows from our rooms. Our upgrade meant we had the benefits of accessing the complimentary lounge which was stocked with both hot and cold beverages and snacks. It was a superb touch which made our stay even more special. This is perhaps one of the few hotels in central Manhatten that offers a fully cooked breakfast to it's guests, which was included in our price and the food was of good quality and there was ample of choice. Although breakfast tended to get busy resulting in some queues to be seated (around 9am seems to be the most busy period) it was all efficent and food was stocked continously. Breakfast was served until 10am which set us up for the day. The Customer Service in the hotel was excellent. Despite it being a large and busy hotel (over 600 rooms), staff were all friendly and efficient. One I could not work my hairdryer I called the reception and within minutes a maintainence guy arrived in my room to fix it. It turned out the hairdryer was not faulty, I had not seen the switch on the side. Although I had expected the rooms to be compact, our upgrade to a king room and king suite meant that we enjoyed larger rooms which were great. The bathrooms were modern and well equipped with large shower cubicles. The hotel is within walking distance to Times Square and tourist spots but at the same time located away from the immediate hustle and bustle. The hotel is right at the beginning of the infamous 'Restaurant Row' where you can find all sorts of restaurants reflecting the diversity of the City and some which provided live music and dance, which was lovely to see. This hotel is definitely one of the more modern and sleeker hotels located centrally. We throrougly enjoyed our stay and I would defintely stay at this hotel again or when I return to New York. My only criticism is that there are no tea and coffee making facilties in the rooms. Thank You Riu for exceeding our expectations. We would definitely recommend you.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Special trip as we were getting married in nyc so wanted a better standard of hotel. We were not disappointed. So impressed from minute we arrived into the very stylish reception/foyer. Rooms were smallish but very clean, modern and comfortable. Breakfast is a must here - brilliant choice and service. Treats left in our room on our wedding day (champagne) and chocs for my husbands birthday. Thankyou so much. Will def recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Oh dear, oh dear.Having stayed in many Riu hotels over the years in Spain, Portugal, the Canaries, Mexico and Cape Verde, we decided that as we were spending 4 days in NY, the Riu Plaza was our first choice. We have been loyal to the Riu brand for many years and will continue to be so, because of the service, style and generally excellently run hotels, but we will never stay at this hotel again.On our day of arrival we were already in the US so I phoned to see if we could have an early check in, especially as we are Riu Class loyalty members of many years standing. The lady on the phone told me that she couldn’t help (even though I’d been put through to reception), but should ask on arrival. So, on arrival, we went to reception and was told quite abruptly that check in is at 3.00 pm but they could store our bags.We left our luggage and went out. On our return, our luggage was not in a secure room but left in a corridor off reception!Having checked in, we went up to our room, a “king” double. Someone has a weird sense of humour if our shoebox could be described as a king anything.Not much room, not much hanging space and apart from the bedside tables, no drawer space.Next morning we went down for breakfast. Oh dear, oh dear. Scenes of chaos greeted us. There was a queue which blocked the main lift area and snaked down and up stairs.Fortunately, the queue moved quickly and on entering the breakfast room, our first and only impression was that we had walked into a downmarket cafeteria by mistake. This certainly wasn’t Riu!The choice wasn’t, the style certainly wasn’t, and the service, or total lack of it certainly wasn’t.The next morning we went to a different breakfast room, smaller and because we were early, nice and quiet. This morning we went to the same one, but whereas yesterday, the tables were laid with cutlery, napkins and sugar etc., today we were told to go get our own!I wanted scrambled eggs. The container was empty. I had to wait around 5 minutes before someone ambled our the kitchen with fresh supplies. This is NOT Riu!!!!There are various other things that are far from our expectation of Riu, but I think I’ve rambled on enough.I think that one of the major obstacles facing Riu is that those of you who have visited Riu hotels, whether Classic, Palace, or AI Resorts, will know that Riu has a certain style, a similarity and familiarity with the way they do things, which they do very well, but this is New York, where to put it simply, the service ethic that made the US something special, has completely vanished, and I believe that Riu will have an uphill struggle to get this hotel to the level that loyal Riu customers expect.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed a week at the RIU while in NYC. The location is great, just a block from Times Square and easy access to the subway.Standard rooms are fairly small but this is NY! The room is nicely decorated and modern and the bathroom is a good size!The ‘included in room rate’ buffet breakfast is excellent with a wide variety of food. A great way to start a day of site seeing! Can get a little busy but food continually being restocked.I only have one negative with the RIU - most of the staff are friendly and helpful from the restaurant staff, housekeeping, concierge and doorman, however in my experience with reception (checkin) staff, they come across as almost a bit rude and not helpful. Perhaps a bit of customer service training be beneficial!Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice Hotel also busy. It’s in a super location for Times Square. Easily walkable to lots of places in New York. We walked to Central Park about half hour.Empire State Macy’s Grand Central Rockerfeller Centre Intrepid Sea Air and Space Museum. All walkable. Breakfast good but go early as it’s busy after 830 but the staff were very good and made sure everything moved smoothly. Don’t bother with the bar they do a happy hour but draught beer not included and it’s over $10 a pintMuch cheaper bars 5 minutes walk away. All staff were friendly and approachable. Concierge very helpful when we wanted metro directions to the Yankees game.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location is perfect. Just on block away from Time Square. Easy walk to subway and great attractions. The hotel and the room was beautiful and clean. Only thing that was a little below average was the breakfast buffet. Food was pretty generic.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Long story short. 4th July went restaurant for buffet meal. The top carcass of chicken served to me by waiter with my one slice. Showed this to supervisor who apologised. We wanted tenderloin. Waited 3/4 hour for the tray to be filled. At no time during this was the meat available, despite many requests. When it came, this is what we were served. Completely raw and cold. Awful. They gave us 20% discount. We wanted full as it was terrible. The wine we'd bought to accompany our meal, we didn't need it. Total stress. I complained on our return, the response was - tastes vary.We had great meals in different restaurants during our trip. We travel a lot but won't use this chain again. 7am for breakfast to save long queues and no room.Would you eat this

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We live in New York and decided to get a room for a couple of nights and do the tourist things. After much research and price checking I chose the Riu . It was myself ,husband and 16 year old son. I booked the Deluxe family double with sofa bed. We had no need for the sofa bed but it was nice to have it to sit on when we were in the room. We arrived early about 1 pm and initially was told check in was at 3 but after checking in computer we were given a room right away. We were on the 17th floor. Our rate included a buffet breakfast as well. The room was clean and a good size for NY at that price range. Bathroom had rainshower and plenty of toiletries and thick towels. It was clean and well maintained. A major complaint at some hotels is the wait for the elevator. We did not find it here even on Saturday when the hotel was more crowded,never more than a few minutes wait. The breakfast area was busy but workers were hustling to get stuff restocked and people seated. Large choices of hot and cold food. All staff we dealt with were pleasant and smiling. We would stay again,great location and price

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Travelled to NYC with my mum and sister for 4 nights and opted to stay here as we got a reasonable price and it seemed pretty central. It was perfect!! Able to walk everywhere, breakfast was amazing and filled with so much choice that was included in the room price and set us up for the day, the room was modern and clean, and staff all very friendly and helpful. The bar in the hotel also had ‘happy hour’ every day with cheaper cocktails which were lovely and we made sure to fit in! I would definitely recommend this hotel if travelling to New York and if I am to return I would 100% stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was my wife’s and my first visit to New York City. This hotel totally exceeded my expectations. The room was gorgeous and extremely clean. The staff was both courteous and extremely helpful. The room is small but just right for a couple. The breakfast buffet was well prepared and was able to fill you up until lunch. This is great because this meant that we had extra money to spend on a more expensive lunch and dinner. We were fortunate enough to have our room on the 26th floor with access to a private executive lounge. This was truly a treat because you could get a cold beverage or a wonderful glass of wine, pastries, and fruit cup any time of the day! Overall, we loved this hotel and will definitely stay here again when we return to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The staff was great. From checkin, where they had enough people working so you wouldn't have to wait long, to housekeeping, and the restaurant staff. We travel alot and and have seen good, mediocre and bad...this was very good.Planning on staying there again and visiting other Riu properties based on this stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I cannot compliment the staff at RIU Plaza enough: they are professional yet friendly, helpful yet non-invasive. The hotel is clean, the room was spotless, the bed was very comfortable (maybe too much so). We were celebrating my husband's 65th birthday and we were given a fantastic room, high up with a great view. This hotel is a splurge for us but one we think is well worth it. Dinner there is $35, great after a long day of museums when getting "home and into bed" is preferred over more touring.
user_name:
PhillyGirl27
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This place is nothing special. Small rooms. The Hall way was bland. Reminded me of a dorm. Dorms usually have painted cinder block. This was only slightly nicer. The room was very small and the bathroom smelled like mildew. Couldn’t figure out why till the shower leaked all over the place. My deal came with dinner and breakfast. I wasn’t there for dinner and the line was so long for breakfast, I went to Starbucks. Maybe that means it was good. I couldn’t tell you. They hit you with a 13 dollar resort charge. Not sure why. I think it’s because they can. The front desk staff were kind of cold. I got there early so I wasn’t surprised I couldn’t get a room. They said they would email me when my room was available. I nvr got an email. The bellman made a fortune in tips. Everyone had to check bags. If you want Times Square or Broadway, than this hotel has a great location. It’s the best part of it. I will attach a few pics for your viewing pleasure. Sorry I could add the Mildew smell. This was my experience. Since I was there for 18 hours I didn’t complain. Don’t know if that would of helped.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited New York for 5 days in December and this hotel made our trip very enjoyable. The staff were very accommodating and the hotel was exceptionally clean and modern. The breakfast was beautiful, and lots of choice.Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very well located. One block from Broadway, 2 from Lionel King, etc.Almost no details to tell, kind people. 9 days dame breakfast and almost no boring.They have a good buffet dinner for 35.Details: I was st the shower and there was no soap.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We got into NYC early and had to have the valet hold our luggage until we got into our room. They had a problem finding the correct bags, but my husband was able to help out. We got a room on the 20th floor. Samuel at the front desk was so friendly. Our room had breakfast and dinner included in the rate. Both meals were fantastic! The hotel isn’t very old so the rooms were in great shape. We will stay here again when we are in New York City.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights July 1-6. Excellent Location - close to Times Square, Broadway, Restaurant Row, the Pier, and most major attractions. The hotel is beautiful and very well maintained. Our room had 2 beds and a sofa bed and although on the smaller side (which is typical for New York) was comfortable and extremely clean. The entire hotel was very clean. Staff efficient and friendly. A great plus was the comp. buffet breakfast. There was something for everyone and the trays were kept full - its not often you are offered smoked salmon and Prosciutto on a breakfast buffet - daily! I would recommend this hotel for anyone - single travellers, families, couples - and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again - thank you RIU !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location, great facilities, and really helpful staff. The breakfast area gets really busy so get down there early to miss the rush. Very close to Radio City, Time Square and all the theatres of Broadway, especially Hamilton.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is perfectly situated for Times Square, just 5 mins walk away from the hussle & bustle. Lovely modern building and rooms big enough for a short stay. 2 restaurants to have breakfast at both with plenty of choice - my children loved the buffet style. In room facilities include shower gel, shampoo & conditioner so if you are short of luggage space this comes in handy. I had a family room with 2 double beds and a sofa bed which we didn’t use as it wasn’t very comfortable. This hotel was one of the few that can accommodate 5 people in 1 room which is handy if you are on a budget and don’t want to pay for 2 rooms.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed a few nights at the Riu Plaza hotel and we had the nicest experience. Smiling and helpful staff, beautifully designed and efficient rooms, extremely convenient location, buffet style breakfast included in room fee with excellent coffee. On our last day we couldn’t benefit from late checkout but we were offered and we used the rest room at the gym to refresh. Amazing service really. We will definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great room on the 29th floor. The breakfast that was included was good. The rooms were clean and modern and the bed was comfortable. The location was perfect for going to the theaters. Most particularly, Natalia at the front desk was super helpful and helped to make our stay very enjoyable. She was friendly and helped us with any questions that we had. Riu Plaza you have a star employee with Natalia!! We will be back!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: They where rude! They charged me for a room i already paid for and tried not to give me my money back! They have 6 elevators and it took an hour to come down it! The stair doors was locked! I will never stay there again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hi, me and my wife passed a week in this fantastic hotel.We get the room on the last floor (28th), with a nice view of Manatthan.The hotel is really in the center, 3 minutes walk to Times Square and all subway connection, the hotel is in restaurant street, exit to the hotel, tourn right and you get all the restaurant that you want. Breakfast with all international dishes, so very completed.Room nice, big enough for us, comfortable. For sure new time that we back in NY, we will re-use this hotel.Regards

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu is in a perfect location. The hotel is new and very clean. The staff is very friendly and the included breakfast buffet is a nice bonus with a nice variety . This will be our first choice next time we come back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a great experience. Hotel was great in a fab location to get around. Was very clean staff were very helpful and friendly especially Divonne. We used the smaller restaurant for breakfast staff very good. Had room on the 16th floor great for 3 adults left chocolates for daughters birthday. Had great view. Will definitely be returning to New York and will certainly be using Riu Plaza Thanks for a great stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I picked this hotel because I wanted a central location with breakfast. We arrived late after a delayed flight and were checked in quickly by a friendly chap. Our room was a king on the 30th floor, not huge but with the floor to ceiling window was fine for the 2 of us. The bathroom had a good sized shower and a glazed wall bedroom side. Of course it didn’t bother us at all but friends may feel differently. There was plenty of cupboard space, a safe and a fridge. Complimentary water was waiting along with a bottle of champagne as we were celebrating our 21st wedding anniversary. They listened to my request for a high floor and acknowledged we were celebrating. We were impressed. The breakfast is varied and plentiful. Eating out in New York is expensive for us brits so starting the day with a good breakfast is a bonus. The hotel is close to Times Square , restaurants and substations. We loved the modern decor and all the staff we came across were either friendly or super friendly. We got a package of flights plus hotel with British Airways and we felt it was good value. WiFi is free too. I wouldn’t hesitate to go back or recommend this hotel for families, friends or couples.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Free upgrade with gold membership of Riu Class. King deluxe Room.Bottle of champers as return customers.Staff are fab and most helpful.Food not bad. Breakfast better than buffet dinner but that’s my personal choice.Clean and fresh.New plaza being built on Time Square too.So close to all broadway shows and Madison square garden.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Rooms are rather compact but offer sufficiënt space, although large suitcases may pose problems for storing them. Vers good noise isolation, both from outside and between rooms. The breakfast buffet is quite extensive and of good quality, the eventing buffet also OK but a bit more variable in terms of quality. Overall, half board offers excellent value for money. The Executive lounge on 26th Floor is small but a nice haven of tranquility with a limited but good selection of softs and wine, plus snacks.Good WiFi . Very friendly staf throughout and a super conciërge. We really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Went after a show to this delightful lounge within the Riu Hotel. Happy hour was a bargain,,,Drinks for 4 was $33.00. Nice pours and excellent service...This is a great find in central Manhattan...We will return regularly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently stayed in the rui plaza & it was amazing the room was perfect,staff friendly and helpful and everything in pristine condition. Please remember to tip the room staff as they did a fanstastic job in making our room welcoming daily.The hotel is in the theatre district and a stone throw from times square. All I can say come here and see for yourselves its an amazing experience & remember to look up just as much as looking forward. Enjoy I know we did.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a fairly new hotel in New York City and the location is great, you are essentially right on the square. Lot's of things are well within walking distance for most people. The rooms are a little small as you might expect and no tub, just a shower, but very modern faucets etc. We were on the 27th floor but the view for our room was mainly a bunch of rooftops. The rooms must have been very well soundproofed because I never heard a peep from any other rooms. Some deals include breakfast which is excellent. Because this is an international hotel and only the second location in the U.S. many guests and workers are speaking a different language, but the staff all spoke English as well. One thing unlike many hotel chains in the suburbs is there is no coffee available during the day, no treats and no daily paper, and no managers reception in the evening with snacks and drinks.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in this place twice myself and booked it for a friend once. Best location and absolute value for money. I usually wait for deals before booking. sign up for their newsletter. Received city facing rooms both times and the liveliness is totally NYC

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a pretty superb well located hotel but with a few wrinkles. The resturantm needs a staff make over. Some contact was good and some not so good. The not so good stands out. I asked one guy where was the butter at breakfast, the answer. "Well if it aint in there (pointing to a tray) we aint got any"! Not what one would expect from a 4 * hotel. Buffet food was generally left to hang about for too long. The toast machines need maintenance or "retuning". We ate in the little restaurant and the larger one. Things appeared to be better organised in the smaller one ie, placement of food etc.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was very clean, however the room with 2 double beds was very cramp!!!! The a/c was not working exactly as it should. Often the room would get very damp!! Lots of humidity in the room. Workers were friendly and hotel was quiet at night.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: great hotel and so easy to get anywhere in new york city from here, close to the theaters of Broadway and restaurants . had a great stay and staff could not do enough for you .ps the cocktails are good value

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our third visit to the Riu in New York. As usual the check in was quick and painless. We got upgraded to a room on the 26th floor, This gave us access to the floors executive lounge which had various complimentary items in it. We found this to be an excellent upgrade. As usual the room was tight for space but up to the job. The staff were always helpful and polite. The bar was usually busy but we were able to get a seat. Since we were here last, the main restaurant has opened for use at breakfast time. It was very busy and for some reason the entrance to restaurant is at at the end of area where the elevators are. This caused severe queues. There is breakfast available at the bar but it closes earlier. The food in both places was very good and staff gain very helpful. Hopefully will return again soon.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for one Night as part of a spur of the moment trip to New York with a friend. Staff were friendly, room was clean, and I liked the location of the hotel as it wasn’t right in Times Square so it wasn’t as crowded but still nice and busy. Bathroom was a nice size as well. Had the free breakfast in the morning - that’s the only thing that could have been a bit better but it was nice to have. We were too late arriving for the free dinner we had in our stay but maybe next time. Would stay here again :)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here in March 2018. Our room was clean and modern but quite small. We were on 27th floor with an amazing view. There was a safe in the room and a hairdryer.The location is perfect - just a few minutes walk from Times Square and easy to get to most of New York’s attractions by foot or subway (we didn’t need a taxi!).The breakfast that was included was plentiful and always hot. Dishes were being refilled all the time. It was a bit busy and chaotic at breakfast so try to get a table out of the way. We are in the restaurant one evening as it was too cold and snowy to venture out! The food was lovely - would recommend.When we visit NYC again, we will definitely use this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked this hotel as a package with British Airways. The hotel was in a great location just a couple of minutes walk from Times Square so it was slightly less busy. If you turned right out of the hotel it took you to some nice restaurants in a quieter area. We emailed in advance and asked for 2 rooms next to each other and that is what we got. We were on the 25th floor and the view was amazing. The rooms are quite small but have all the facilities you need with a free safe and water in the fridge replenished every two days. There is no tea or coffee making facility which we would have liked but we went to Dunkin Donuts for a morning coffee as we preferred it to the hotel cafe. The hotel bar was really nice and great for a cool drink in the air conditioning after a hot day sight seeing! The hotel staff were all really helpful. The free wifi worked well.  The breakfast was a big bonus. It was vey good with plenty of choice and not too crowded except on the day when we went at 9am so maybe good to go early. It saved us from wasting time looking for somewhere and we could get on with the day. The only thing we didn't really like was the bathroom which was behind some frosted glass and was really not very private. Not sure why they didn't make it a proper room. Would recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really nice hotel that offers great service. Our room was clean and comfortable and quite well appointed. Would have been nice to have tea and coffee facilities in the room. Location wise it’s perfect for pretty much all you would want to see in New York. As the hotel name suggests it’s a very short walk to Times Square and other attractions are easily walkable. Really enjoyed our stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I recently spent a week at this hotel. Although the staff was friendly, we had problems with our room which required numerous visits from the hotel engineer. In addition, our room key failed to work 3 times, once causing us to be delayed and lose dinner reservations with family. I have written customer service for the hotel, both individually and thru Booking.com. a total of 4 times with no response. My last correspondence to the hotel was 3 days ago and I am still waiting for a response. Ironically, we had gone to this hotel on a recommendation.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This a very nice hotel which serves breakfast daily. It is up to date and it is located near everything in New York. It doesn't have a microwave but it does have a small refrigerator. The doormen are very helpful. If you are looking for a nice affordable hotel in New York this is it. They have a nice bar area which has happy hour daily.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the hotel last year, enjoyed it then so decided to re-book as we were back in NYC as part of our 10th wedding anniversary celebrations. This time we stayed for 6 nights and got the deal with breakfast included and I'm pleased we did because that in itself saved us quite a bit of money eating breakfast out each day. The hotel was exactly as we remembered it last year, we even were allocated the exact same room on the 28th floor which is the top floor. Check in was a breeze as it was around 1am when we arrived at the hotel after our flight from Boston where we spent a few nights beforehand was delayed so it was literally check in and bed. Breakfast in the restaurant which wasn't actually open last year was really nice, there was an excellent choice of food to choose from, all self service. The restaurant was always generally quite busy on a morning but we never experienced a shortage of food. Tables are positioned quite close together so be aware of that. The hotel is situated near Times Square and Broadway but far enough away from the madness of Times Square but its an excellent base for exploring the city. Rooms are clean and well appointed with everything in that you would need. The shower is huge but if privacy is a concern be aware that the shower itself is 'in the room' and the silhouette pf whoever is showering can be seen but that was not a problem for us. Wi-fi is fast and reliable. The hotel also has a bar and a café where cakes, pastries and hot drinks can be bought and eaten in. All in all this was another enjoyable stay at the hotel, I don't have any complaints about our stay and would certainly stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very impressive hotel and brilliant location. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and bigger then expected. Highly recommended for a stay in new york. Times square 2 mins away and a walk to central park is 15mins. Thanks to all the staff who made this stay wonderful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel Riu Plaza new York is very beautiful and it has an excellent location. The rooms are very nice and spacious considering the hotel is located in the Times Square area. The property is fairly new, so it is modern and very clean. The breakfast buffet was very good and the staff was nice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: In town on business, stayed here for the first time. Rooms small, but clean, well appointed and comfortable. Buffet breakfast and dinner inexpensive but poor quality (you get what you pay for). Customer service: front desk staff/reception were pretty disinterested, and verging on rude. Restaurant and bar staff were much more polite and willing to help. Will not be staying here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel very central,on arrival had me down for bnb only but had paid for hb,which was ammended the next day.Never recieved water so had to buy then i got 6btls from them.Never had clean towels one day,called reception twice then had to go down twice before they told me they were waiting on clean towels being delivered,which shocked me,a hotel that size.Breakfast and evening meals are buffets but never have enough staff on for cleaning tables.All in all customer service is very important in a hotel this size,more training on that and understanding English is a must.Rooms very nice.Enjoyable stay apart from the mishaps which should never of happened in this day and age.Found few staff behind reception bit rude and not very helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in this hotel fro 4 days. The rooms, the lobby, the restaurant all of it looked like the pictures on the internet (pleasant surprise). The hotel was very clean, very convenient. Staff were absolutely very friendly. I would have give a 5 star rating except for 2 incidents. 1. Breakfast check in process was very cumbersome the first 3 days. You have to wait to be seated - they check your room number, then they seat you. It took time and the line was long. One of the days, we were seated at a table, we left to get our food and some other Maitre D' seated another party in our table. Lots of confusion. On our last day though, they checked our room number then let us seat ourselves (I think this is a better idea - keep it up). 2. I had coffee the first day in the restaurant and the coffee cup handle just came off dropping hot coffee all over our table. It would help if the staff checked the cups and glasses once out of wash. Aside from these 2 small glitches we had a wonderful time at this hotel. The price is pretty reasonable too. I already recommended this to another friend of mine planning to visit NYC in august.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved the hotel and location was on Times Square so all within walking distance. Staff were all amazing and always ready to help and special thanks to the Bellboys. Breakfast was also very good with plenty of choice and room was spacious with good air conditioning. The Fashion Bar also great place to hang out and gym was more than sufficient! Would highly recommend this lovely modern hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice center hotel. Close to subway and Port Authority. Has small gym. I liked breakfast. The staff were very helpful, thanks. The Sunday rate is good, for the other days a little overrated. It has 4 stars

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was perfect for a night in the city! We were able to check in early, which is always A+ in my book. Cute bar for a quick drink, lovely staff. Close to everything we needed. Rooms were small, but cozy. Staff was nice and attentive.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Pros... excellent location in Time Square, fantastic service, great wifi.Cons... small room, but I understand that space is a premium in NYC. Its easier to get to Riu by JFK than Newark.I would 100% stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent location close to Time Square, Broadway, Hell's Kitchen. Booked a Family Room for 2 adults, 2 tweens. It has 2 doubles and not very comfy sofa bed -can feel the spring. Room was small. 1 suitcase fits on a stand, the other one goes under the bed. Bathroom was fine with standard toiletries but did not get replenished. Somehow, the water in the shower leaks out from the door to the room - an annoyance. Did not find the glass shower wall a problem as mentioned by other reviewers. Breakfast buffet was ok but the dishes were served everyday. Coffee from the machine was not fresh brew but syrup - definitely a huge disappointment considering this is a Spanish chain!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: You will be hard to find a better location for this quality and price. This Mid Range Hotel has smaller rooms than you may expect. And yet we were able to easily move around it. The Decor was minimal and clean with the wooden floor. Beds were clean and comfortable enough. we got plenty of sleep. This is not budget and not luxury it fits nicely in the middle.Our room included breakfast which was a great buffet style and a great start to the day.What makes this hotel stand out in this price range is it's location. Easy walk to most things and lots of different subway stations a short walk away. We found it easy in the very cold January weather to get all around Manhattan island. With time square a block away you have plenty of choices for food and entertainment. You can easily walk to empire state, Macy's and Central Park. We will stay here again and highly recommend all our friends consider it.The Quality for the Location and Price is hard to go past.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wow! Riu in NYC. because of the age and soaceprices we know that most hotel there are "old(isch)" so this hotel being new is exact what we're looking for.Great room with spacious shower, great spot only 1 block walk to times square, nice personal, breakfast included, good bar with all day cocktailhappyhour.With nice weather you can sit at the "courtyard". As coffeelovers we think the coffeespot which is in the hotel serves a pretty good cappucino ( for a good price).No other hotel for us when visiting the big apple again. It's worth its price. We give this Riu Plaza Hotel a 9.9 out of 10!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was in a great location - stones throw away from Broadway, Times Square, a subway station, the restaurants on 9th. Within walking distance were more tourest areas such as NBC/Top of the Rock, Empire State Building and 5th Avenue. Other areas of the city are easily accessible by public transport. The hotel is a nice place to stay, the room was clean and tidy and the bed was comfortable. It wasn't a big room but big enough to hang out in and use as a base. However the safe in our room was broken. We put our things in it but then it wouldn't unlock. Maintenance did come and try to fix it but couldn't so we had to call them when we needed our things. Breakfast was fine. Limited choices but had the stsples like toast/peanut butter!My only slight issue with this hotel was that on my last day in the city when I became really unwell to the point where I just needed to go to bed. Unfortunately an hour before, I think it was actually less than an hour before, we had checked out. I wasn't feeling unwell when we checked out. When we returned to the hotel and I was visually distressed we asked if we could pay the extra (and offered to pay more) for our room back so I could rest. At this point the staff became very awkward and unkind towards us and said that if we wanted to use their hotel it would be just shy of $200. I was desperate to lay down so we paid - we stayed for around 2 hours. We knew our original room had not been cleaned yet so the hotel staff could have been helpful and just let us use it again for a fee but chose not to be sympathic or helpful. For this reason alone I would not use this hotel or any hotel in the Riu chain again. Even if they couldn't give us our original room back and we had to pay full price for another room there was no need to make a distressing situation worse by being unkind and awkward. A little sympathy would have meant repeat business from us on our next trip to NY. we're brand loyal people.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I travel a lot for pleasure. This hotel is a welcome taste of Europe in NYC. I am not exaggerating that this is one of the best hotels for the money that I have stayed in. First, hotel rooms in NYC are closet sized. I have been in hotels where there was not enough room to walk around the bed. RIU's rooms are spacious for NY standards. There is a lot done with mirror and paint to make the rooms feel larger than they are. Second, the decor is not your run of the mill chain beige and faux marble. It's white and lavender, which may feel odd but to me that was a refreshing change. Third, the bathroom is also spacious for NY. In my previous go-to hotel, the nook where the toilet sits is so narrow that I have only 2-3 inches of clearance on either sides of my shoulders ,and I am not huge. Plus the shower and its controls are better than standard. I see a lot of complaints about noise here, but again in comparison to other hotels in NY, this was quiet in the lobby and maybe I am just too tired after a day out and about in NY to notice the noise but I found the room a respite from the auditory attack of the city. I also had a view of 8th avenue and I have never gotten a view of anything more than a brick wall in other hotels. The location is at the corner of 8th and 46th, which is in close to Times Square but at the start of Restaurant Row so the street is filled with small, charming restaurants in a street that isn't made up of skyscrapers. It's very pleasant. What made me book this hotel in the first place over my go-to hotel which is just across the street is that a full hot breakfast is included for the same price I would pay at the go-to. I expected a typical American hotel hot breakfast: carbs in every form with some plastic eggs. This was where the European feel of the hotel is most pronounced. There was every kind of cooked breakfast meat imaginable as well as smoked salmon and prosciutto, a selection of cheeses and breads, waffles, pastries, scrambled eggs that were neither runny nor overcooked as well as hard boiled eggs. The highlight was the fresh fruit: all fresh and sweet and included pineapple and even blackberries. Yes the coffee, even though espresso and cappuciano was offered from the press-a-button-to- brew machine, wasn't great, but I don't expect coffee in most US eateries to be good. Finally, the staff was friendlier and more efficient than I have experienced in other hotels. To check in there was only one person in front of me. The bag check also was not backed up and the bell boy was friendly. Some reviewers have complained about the added fees once even thought they prepaid. Be aware that all hotels in NY do this. The added on "facility fee" for internet and gym is actually half the price of other hotels I have been in. Annoying as hell yes, but that's the way it is in NY. Still two of us stayed here in June for just under $200. I have paid more than that for truly crappy hotels in NY ten years ago.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Yes the rooms are small, but the location and the facilities make up for it. Breakfast was much better at this European themed hotel than you get for an "American" breakfast at one of the chain hotels. The buffet dinner was also not bad.On to the important things. Despite the small room, the mattress was great. The bathroom, also small, did have a good shower with a rainforest and handheld spray. Very friendly and bi-lingual staff. On the down side, even though we were on the 27th floor, we could still hear street noise. After all it is right in Times Square and right in the middle of everything.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of the hotel in the middle of theatre land and one block from Times Sq make this hotel. Staff are welcoming, breakfast was nice but very chaotic, ensure you eat early. We had a queen size room on the 28th floor, view was fabulous, bed and shower great with bottled water in the fridge. Stay here and you’ll not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family had a fantastic stay at the Riu. Thi is a great location for going to Broadways shows and easy walking distance to many great sites. Our room was spacious by NY standards with two double beds and a love seat that pulled out into a bed. The staff in the lobby, concierge and restaurant all provided great customer service. Having the add on of the breakfast worked perfect for us especially having a child. We were able to fuel up before heading out for our adventures of the day. The guests were from all around the globe giving this hotel a very international feel. Highly recommended and would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, great shower but that’s it. Tiny rooms with limited storage. 2 days no towels in roomConcierge barely spoke English, couldn’t book our Theatre or Baseball tickets hopeless.Lifts out to higher floors, had to walk up and down stairs to lower floors. Dinner meals were average. Check out guy was extremely rude, we tried to give feedback but was ignored and brushed off. Never staying there again. Spanish or German seemed to be the preferred language...

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My complaints are, paying the $52 dollars service charge when I have already paid for the hotel. The service charge is for bottles of water each..every other day ! The gym...to exhausted walking. And WiFi!!! I didn’t think about saying I didn’t need it...unsure what they would have said. Anyway had to ask for bottles on day 2. Left on day 4. The shower ran for7 minutes before it was hot enough to shower. But breakfast was buffet style and good. But is very busy in the restaurant, okay for us, but if you have mobility issues you may struggle. My positives are, The staff are so knowledgable, helpful and polite. The position to New York is perfect. The rooms are lovely modern and clean. The rooms are small so if you take a large suitcase you may struggle for space, but for us it was okay. The chambermaid does a fantastic job of tidying and cleaning the room. Even though there is noise, it is New York, the City never sleeps, it’s an acceptable drone in the room. We slept really well.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I’m so disappointed with the poor customer service and attention to detail at the location In New York, this was our 3rd time staying at your facilities and this one in particular was the worst experience. As an example we asked for Soap never came, the staff overall rude and just not helpful,We were considering using you for our next trip but we will have to reconsider that, we are travelers and we have always highly recommend RIU and have brought Family with. I was so frustrated that i had to feel and deal with this through my Birthday. When I called to file a complaint I got an Email address!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I chose Riu Plaza NTC Times Square with a reasonable price offer considering the position. However I was given a low floor room (5th) directed towards the backyard (i.e. avoiding the stress). As I was expecting though, huge ventilation noises were very clear in the room, despite closed windows. Apart from that, hotel is clear and well kept. Good breakfast included in the price and, of course, fantastic location within NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Despite booking through my Riu class membership and paying for my rooms 5 months in advance, the hassle and rudeness upon check in unfortunately ruined what should have been a great experience. The first receptionist informed me that my booking was invalid as I didn't have my original card that I had booked with (I wasn't too surprised as this has happened to me before and I should have learnt my lesson). I was informed that I needed to call my husband in the UK so that he could show the credit card to the receptionist. I did this and then another VERY RUDE receptionist came along and said that actually wasn't good enough and she would need a scan of his passport and the credit card emailed to her immediately. I asked if she couldn't just cancel the reservation and re-debit another card that I had in my possession? I was then informed that she didn't like the tone of my voice and that she didn't appreciate my sarcasm. I was gobsmacked. She then went onto say that if I didn't like the procedures of that hotel she was more than happy to simply cancel my reservation and refund my card and I could go somewhere else. (despite saying that she couldn't cancel and re-book earlier!) Eventually the information was scanned by my husband and sent and she finally wound her neck in. NEVER have I experienced such rudeness from a member of staff at any of the hotels I have visited. (see my profile- there are MANY) and I would never visit this hotel again for that reason. A lesson in customer service is in order. Unfortunately when I went back the next day, she wasn't available or I would have lodged a complaint to head office. (Gailyn?)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: the location here is amazing. our room was very clean and classy - the windows were the highlight with the best view :-)breakfast was fine, but we preferred the diner nearby. the staff was also very helpful and ready to assist.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Are you looking for something new, modern, clean, in a great location and full of amenities? Then this is the place!! RIU Plaza New York, opened in 2016, the first of the famous RIU chain to open in America. For those of you who know RIU from all-inclusives in Mexico and the Caribbean, you know the quality here. This is a true 4+ star only two blocks from Times square. From here we walked to Empire State, Macy's to all the tour bus routes, even to the Intrepid Air and Sea Museum on the Hudson River. We stayed in rm 2818. This is a suite on the 28th of 30 floors overlooking 8th ave. Fantastic spacious room, king bed,spa tub, dual sinks, separate shower and water closet, living room area with sofa, coffee table as well as small dining table with two chairs & with flat screen tv that swivels to face either the bed to the north or sofa to the south. Also full hot buffet breakfast is included! Eggs, bacon, sausages, baked goods, fruit, cheeses, yogurt, cereal, pancakes, potatoes, cappuccino, lattes, hot chocolate....and so much more. Filling up on a great breakfast like this is the perfect way to start a busy day in NYC. I was there over Memorial day weekend, and even though the hotel was very busy, we never waited more than 2 minutes to be seated at the buffet. Great efficiency and service!Also since our room was a suite, we had 24hr access to the executive lounge on the 26th floor. This lounge has complimentary red, white and zinfandel wines, coffee, tea, soda, bottled water, finger sandwiches, potato chips, croissants, muffins, yogurt and giant cups of delicious fruit salad, all included, 24hrs a day. What a wonderful added bonus. No need to run out for a snack when you feel hungry and a great place to take in the view with a glass of wine in the evening!!! Cannot find fault in this hotel, and the price is fantastic. It's less than most good hotels in NYC and you get so much more. This is the best value in NYC if you are looking for a true 4+ star and want something new in a perfect spot!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location just off Times Square, 75 dollars from JFK in yelllow taxi.fantastic food, breakfast had plenty of choice and could eat as much as you wanted, the snack bar in the hotel was reasonably priced too.Very comfortable clean room, not massive, but we didn’t spend much time there.highly recommend this hotel forComfort and location will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is beautiful, rooms were exceptionally clean, lobby was always busy, breakfast buffet had more options than I've ever seen at a hotel. Large safe and mini-fridge in each room. Housekeeping collected dirty towels and bath mat, but did not replace them. Had to ask for more.The one really weird thing was the frosted glass walls that separated the bathroom from the sleeping area. It would've been fine if I was traveling with my husband, but I was traveling with friends and it was super awkward. Okay if you showered with the lights out, or asked your friends to step outside for privacy. Pretty, but just kind of weird. The final receipt did not make sense. I have no idea if it was correct. That all being said, I would stay there again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Picked this hotel because of the great reviews and for the fact that breakfast was included in the price, we didn’t want to waste time looking for places to eat our first meal of the day. The rooms were lovely and clean, could of been a bit bigger but great on the whole. Breakfast was buffet style, plenty of variety, didn’t like the bacon, it was very fatty and over cooked. We like the smaller of the two restaurants as it was more spacious.Hotel staff were lovely, very helpful.Would I stay there again..........yes I think so.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was my sixt or seventh time at NYC. This time I come for my birthday with my 2 daughters and decided to stay at Riu Plaza, because they offered breakfast included (in NYC it is rare...) and my travel agent convinced me that the prices were much better than hotels nearby, bla, bla, bla.The hotel is not bad, it has a big lobby, rooms are reasonably confortable, the location is not really bad (there is a thai restaurant at the end of the 46th that is really nice!), but the whole experience is not positive and I explain why:1) the Riu seems like any modern hotel you visit in Europe. I have been recentely in Vienna for work and the hotel I stayed in had a similar bad taste decoration, the bathroom was as small as the Riu, you have everything you need but only that. It follows the well known IKEA style.2) But when coming to NYC you want to find a traditional american hotel, with lots of wood on the ambiance, good carpets and confortable sofas, huge bathrooms and lots of confort.3) The Riu is located in 8th avenue and 46th. Try to stay between 5th and 7th and up 50th street and there is such a big difference!4) Breakfast is not bad but is so full of people that you won´t have the possibility to eat slowly and in peace. Too busy for my taste and food as no flavour at all!In sum, if you want to have a really good NYC experience don´t stay in Riu, find another hotel, there are excellent options it is just to choose!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel is big, but that are all hotels in the city center of Manhattan. The Hotel is situated on 46th street just one block away from Times Square. Very good situated to visit all of the most famous atractions in Manhattan. It serves an international breakfast with normal European portions which was for us as Europeans very good. Diner we don’t know because you can eat everywhere in the city. Nice personnel and cleaning of the room was good. It was even quite during the night in the city that never sleeps, so that means very good isolated.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in a great location very close to Times Square, Theaters and the bus tours. The room was clean and the only gripe is the stupid opaque glass between the shower and the room, instead of a wall. Surely in a two-bedded room you should change this as it often means families/friends sharing who may wish for a bit more privacy?Breakfast included was ok, and it was nice to start the day without having to venture out for breakfast elsewhere.However, it's not the usual RIU standard, limited choices of food and drink available... but it did the job. AVOID the restaurant dinner buffet.... it is very poor, I have never seen such a tiny buffet. Very limited choices, eg they had meatballs in sauce but no pasta to accompany it? You could have potatoes or a mixed rice (that was dry/crusty) and a choice of 2 vegetables.As well as the meatballs there was one chicken dish, one prawn dish and ribs. Disappointing.But overall, this is a clean modern hotel in a wonderful location so it just about makes a 4*

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spectacular hotel, fantastic views of the city. Really handy for the open top bus routes, Broadway and the Hudson river boat trips. Staff very helpful and breakfast was superb, from 630 till 11 am !! Definitely staying there next time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Awful welcome, reception manager was terrible, smirking and unhelpful, and tried as hard as possible to be as difficult as he could. Ruined the rest of the experience. Hotel itself was good and very well located.
user_name:
Fitzwaltermatt
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The RIU Plaza Hotel is located just a two minute walk from Times Square. Please keep this in mind while booking (you will be in the busiest area of NYC)!However, the sound of the city you will not hear from the hotel room, at least not from 906, facing to New Jersey side. So I do not agree you will need earplugs for the sound. You will need them for your neighbours. We had a very loud, I guess, Italian family next to us with a baby. Since the rooms have ‘in between’ doors you can literally hear anything your neighbour is doing or saying. It’s terrible, especially when the baby cries two or three times at night-time. The room itself is everything you need for a trip to New York and for New York rooms quite spacious. Staff is friendly, cleaning could be better. The breakfast is OK. On their website they are advertising with ‘a real American breakfast’ but don’t expect that. It is intercontinental and nothing American to it. Subway just four blocks away (5 minute walk). Due to the very noisy rooms I will not go to the RIU Plaza in New York again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Helpful staff, clean modern-looking room with large TV, close to Times Square.
