Only real issues were the disappointing quality of the all-you-can-eat breakfast and the fact that we were unable to check in until 3pm – despite having paid in full in advance and taking a horribly early flight from London!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Rooms are small but clean . We had a room on the 25 th floor which gave us a great view. Daily breakfast was also included with our reservation. Location of the hotel is great, Only a few Steps away from great dinning and entertainment. If I return to New York it’s definitely where I would stay as it’s a great bang for your buck.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed 5 nights in February and loved every minute. Location is perfect .The rooms are very clean and modern. We had a high floor room overlooking Times Square and loved it, view was good .The rooms were very hot, but you can open the window slightly Yes you hear the noise but it’s Times Square what do you expect and you get used it to it. I would have to say the breakfast was fantastic so much choice and freshly cooked it filled us up for the day. We loved every thing about this hotel, we loved it so much that we have booked to go back again next February and we can’t wait. Thanks for a brilliant stay, we highly recommend this hotel .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely great location one block from Times Square. Our room was very modern, great decor! Lobby was clean and staff were very helpful. We were able to walk to all the local attractions and restaurants.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really enjoyed staying in this new Hotel. We had 3 staying at the hotel and the room was well equipped to handle us all with 2 double beds and a pull out sofa. Excellent location with just a short stroll to the hustle and bustle of Times Square and some great Theatres within a stones throw from the front door. Capital Grab & Go was a great option for a bagel for breakfast on our way out to explore the city. The restaurant serves quality dinners at a great price with very helpful and professional staff. Would definitely stay here again on my return to NYC

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice location in the center of new york Very cheap for what it offersReally good breakfast with delicious pancakesThe people working at the reception were very efficient. I visited new york on March and i cant wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and daughter have just returned after staying at this Hotel which I booked for their break in NYC. They said had a great room on the 25th Floor and the breakfast was fantastic. They would recommend the Hotel which is in a great location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: the location is great and the hotel itself is very pretty!the room is a bit small but that's what you expect in NY! but both the lobby and the rooms are very modern! the buffet breakfast at the hotel was very nice! staff was very helpful!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our stay here started out great. Nice price, excellent location, clean and comfy room, and friendly staff. The shower is a bit weird ... it’s semi-transparent through to the bedroom. You can’t see skin but you can see what’s going on, so be forewarned if you go with a colleague or someone else where that might feel odd!However... As we were checking our bags to leave, the gentleman who took the bags asked us how we would be getting to the airport. We told him we planned to call an Uber or grab a taxi. He told us that would be very expensive and said the hotel could arrange a cab for us for a flat rate of $55, which would include tax, tolls, and tip. Since that seemed like a no-hassle option, we took it. He gave me a receipt on which he had written $75 would be due to the driver. I took it back to him and he aplogized and corrected it to $55 as he had quoted. We took the cab, which was a black SUV not a yellow cab, and when we got to the airport the driver asked for $74.95. I explained we were told the rate was a flat $55 and that I had a paper to prove it. The driver said that did not include tax, tolls, or tip, just the ride itself. He was extremely rude and demanding. We paid what he asked and got away from him. I do not know if this is a scam between the hotel employees and the drivers, or just the drivers, or if the hotel is involved in cheating customers like this. It was a very sour end to what had been a wonderful visit. What a shame for our final impression of this hotel to be that we were duped and cheated out of money. I emailed the hotel the following day and received no response, not even an apology.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our family had a great time in the hotel.The breakfast buffet was nice.Very clean and the aroma when you enter the hotel is incredible.My dauther love the hotel.The staff was very attentive and they took good care of us.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The lobby was bright and welcoming, hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The room was gorgeous, not a fan of the frosted glass for the shower and toilet area but it wasn't horrible. We were in a king room with our teenage daughter and were very comfortable and content. I would have liked a curtain or door to close off the tub area. The view from the 26th floor was amazing. Overall we loved the hotel and all of the amenities. Looking forward to returning in the summer for another visit.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just come back from short break at riu plaza New York ,can't understand any negative reviews we found it wonderful,room on 25th floor, not noisy, spotlessly cleaned every day,staff pleasant and breakfasts everything you could want, also very convenient for times Square and surrounding area,had buffet dinner one night also very good ,if you want plush hotel this isn't for you as very modern and light and airy .I e mailed before we went to say it was a celebration and there was a bottle of champagne in fridge when we arrived ,we wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel,yes it's busy but it's a large hotel can't expect anything else .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Honestly I would have appreciated some touch as it was the beginning of our honeymoon. Even a card or a nice room view. We instead had a room with a not very nice view. The room itself was nice,l and clean, but also a bit noisy. The breakfast was very good and with a huge variety of products.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is located in the hub of everything, without it being too overwhelming based in Hells Kitchen and a short walk from Times Square.The rooms were really clean, and had the basic amenities inclusive of a safe, and toiletries. The breakfast options were perfect for adhering to anyone with dietary restrictions. The internet does come with a resort fee, but the connectivity was great - had no issues.Will definitely be rebooking for my next visit!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As with the whole of NY it is very busy. Arrived on a Saturday and check in was very busy but efficient given how busy. Hotel was immaculately clean, again for the number of guests. All staff very friendly and willing to help. Very high standard of food at breakfast which staff do well to keep clean and a wide range of food always available. The only ‘downside’ is that as it is so busy, it is very noisy. Again similar to the rest of NY, so avoid if you want a relaxing start to your day. Had a room on 25th floor, with a room beside the loft. Room immaculate and cleaned to a high standard daily with all the necessary toiletries. Room was beside the lift with a whirring noise, so avoid if a light sleeper. Would definitely book again if back on NY.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On arrival our luggage was taken to our rooms for us, the rooms were very modern and we had a view of 8th Avenue from our windows which was nice. There was three sets of curtains including blackout ones which was good blocking out the lights from outside and most of the noise so it was nice to sleep. The bed was comfortable from my opinion and my partners, air conditioning was easy to use and didn’t create too much noise, there was a safe in the wardrobe which was useful and also a mini fridge which was handy for any drinks and snacks we bought. Breakfast was continental e.g bacon rashers, sausages, egg, hash browns, cereal, fruit and some other things. Very nice breakfast we only used the fashion restaurant as it was less busy around half 8 in the morning, we didn’t eat in the hotel as there was plenty of places to eat around us, the hotel is in a fantastic location and was close to many things like Carlos’s bakery which was only 4 blocks down 8th Avenue. Overall a really nice hotel living up to the fantastic riu name.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very well located hotel for Broadway, Time Square and Hell's Kitchen. Choice of several Metro stations nearby. Modern hotel, professional helpful staff nice buffet breakfast choice. Clean good size rooms, plenty of hot water for showers. Complimentary champagne in room as it was our anniversary! Would definitely book again if we returm. Recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First visit to the big apple and booked 4 nights at the Riu Plaza. Perfect choice as right by all the action. Modern basic room with fridge and a good shower, which is all you need as never there. Comfy bed too. I emailed them and asked for a high floor room with a view of Tines Square as it was my wedding anniversary trip. They gave us exactly that which was brilliant. At the end of our first full day we returned to freshen up and they had put a bottle of Champagne on ice in our room with a happy anniversary message. Unexpected and amazing!The staff were all lovely, the hotel was modern and smelt amazing in the lobby? It’s good they do breakfast and worth doing as lots of choice and very convenient to eat before hitting the streets. If there is a queue, ignore as you get seated very quickly. Hot buffet and almost all you could think of for brekkie. Help yourself and have what you want. I can’t find fault with our hotel experience. Can’t wait to go back and would definitely stay here ! Well done Riu.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for three nights in November 2017 and it was such a lovely hotel. We were on the 23rd floor and the view from our room was amazing! The room was spacious and comfortable with all the facilities we needed. The bathroom and shower were big and very clean. The breakfast was amazing. They had a brilliant selection every day and lovely chatty staff. I wouldn’t definitely recommend staying here if you come to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Appreciated not being far from times square yet slightly out of the hustle and bustle of NYC.I can't walk much and still found the location ideal. We enjoyed the mornings buffet breakfasts.We did find the room a little small but liked the good size shower.We also found the staff to be unfriendly of all the hotels we stayed in travelling across the States.If we ever return to NYC we'd be happy to stay here again.
user_name:
Daphadills
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The check in was very busy and a little slow, but the woman who helped me out was great. The hotel is in a fantastic location in Times Square. The room was very clean and comfy. Morning breakfast buffet is vegetarian friendly with lots of selection. Very pleased with the stay here!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here from 22nd April to 30th April. Our room was on the 25th floor -fabulous views !!I The hotel was just round the corner from Broadway which was just round the corner from Times Square. It was very central. The hotel is beautiful and clean. Could not fault the staff,howrver depending on what time you go for breakfast you may have to que.Saying that the ques go down very quickly . Breakfast is very good with a mixture of eggs,bacon etc + all the continental stuff.Suited both me and the husband. He liked the Full.English and I like the Continental. The rooms are quite small but adequate with hair dryers/ironing boards/irons./safety deposit boxes.You do not spend a lot of time in them. All in all fabulous hotel will go again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: If I would visit again it's a good recommendation 2 friends in an 18th floor twin room. Plenty of room, great comfortable twin beds. Bedside tables, sofa, fridge, wardrobe, bathroom. Safe hair dryer, toiletries.All in all excellent facilties in room excepting tea/coffee making however you can pop down to breakfast restaurant and pick up an early morning coffee pre breakie no probs, staff are very helpful and arranged cabs when required. Breakfasts were excellent, plenty of choice buffet style, shame plates are cold so,food gets cold quickly. Would give the $35 buffet a miss not worth the money Cocktails good value at $7 or $8 a pop.Can highly recommend this hotel for rooms, service, location and value for money

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in an area that is very chaotic and full of tourists. The level of tourism in this area is quite low and so accordingly the restaurants in the area are the same. We wanted to have dinner locally as the children were very tired in the evening, so we tried 3 different restaurants that were all bad!!!The rooms were clean but our Deluxe Double was very small.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We took our son here for Spring Break and we really liked this hotel. It was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was right in the middle of Times Square. Even though the rooms were small, I felt that the space it did have was maximized, and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast, which is included with your stay, was quite tasty and had a variety of options. We were very pleased with this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I’m not someone who writes reviews every time I stay or eat somewhere...unless it’s amazing or really terrible. This place was GREAT! The check-in process was easy and we went up to our room on the 25th floor. The views are awesome. The room itself was a little small (but most NYC hotel rooms are), but it did the job. The room was clean and the shower was really nice. The bed was also really comfortable and the room had a safe, iron, ironing board, and mini fridge.An added bonus was one of the employees bringing my fiance a small gift of chocolates since we were there celebrating her birthday.The breakfast buffet was also really good and was included in the stay.They’ll hold your luggage for you at no charge if you check out and still want to go do some sightseeing.The hotel is one block west of the heart of Times Square, 10 blocks south of Central Park (an easy 10-15 min way) and is 4 blocks east of the Intrepid. For as great of a location as it is, the price was not bad at all.Definitely would recommend and would stay here again
user_name:
Richard G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I traveled to New York for a few days and stayed in this wonderful hotel. Love the Riu brand and this hotel certainly doesn’t let the name down. Great staff and perfect location for all site seeing in New York. Situated on the edge of Times Square (3min walk to main square) 15 min walk to Empire State and Rockefeller building and Macy’s, 5-10min walk to all broadway theatres, we used hop on hop off bus (recommend the big bus tour company) for transportation to Statue of Liberty and Ellis island. 30min walk to Central Park West. We booked B&B and breakfast starts at 6.30am so you can get out early for the attractions. Food was not the best but adequate to be honest. Recommend this hotel for a sightseeing trip to the big Apple. Enjoy

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On a recent trip to the city we searched for a long time before choosing the RIU. The main reason was because we are familiar with the brand here in Spain and it was also on the price which offered us 5 nights including all taxes & breakfast for two people at a little under $1,500. It may seem a lot to some people, but find me a 4 or 5-star hotel in the heart of one of the most expensive hotel city’s in the world for that price at high season would be a challenge.We asked for a twin double-double room simply for space but due to the high demand for these rooms we got allocated a king double room on check in and asked to check back in the morning for a alternative room. We were given room 2919 on the very top floor with views to the east and south and loved it so much we stayed. So the room was not big, but it’s NY and you are there to enjoy the city, not the room, right! The bed was so comfortable and huge! I loved that we could let air in rather than use the air con which we never needed to use. The shower gave out great pressure and the bathroom offered nice toiletries. Housekeeping was very good.Breakfast was served from 07:00 every morning in the ‘fashion restaurant’ on the 1st floor (ground floor) and was a typical affair of juices, breads, pastries, eggs, bacon, cold cuts, cheeses etc. Staying 5 nights I’d have liked to seen a little more variety even if just on a few items maybe replacing pancakes for waffles and another morning for churros. The coffee was really poor though, then again, I think coffee in the USA as a whole is poor. I struggle to find coffee I liked anywhere in the city.I also liked that the staff were not over friendly and false. We came into contact with a lot of staff in the elevator going from level LL to other floors and all were really lovely...maybe that I speak Spanish helps too. Great WiFi strength everywhere. Good job team RIU!¡MUCHAS GRAIAS A TODOS DESDE MADTID!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and the hotel had everything that you needed. The room is compact but when in New York it is only for sleeping in. It was very clean and the bathroom had a lovely large shower. There were lots of toiletries provided as well. The hotel is situated very close to Times Square and is in an ideal location for most attractions in New York. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It was a great experience for our two-night stay! The room was very clean and had a huge window for looking outside! It was quiet, the staff was very friendly and the variety in the breakfast buffet was satisfying! I highly recommend it, especially if you are a couple!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited New york with my teenage twins. Stayed in the plaza times square for 6 nights and we stayed on the 5th floor. It was nice and quiet on this level and had a nice view. Rooms very clean and adequate, we were not spending much time in the room, a little cramped if you planned to spend time in the room, you would be better sitting in lobby or the cafe. We had breakfast included which was a good choice and tasty although very busy in the main room. The fashion restaurant was much quieter start to the day. The hotel is perfectly located, we could walk to most things including the intreped sea air and space museum and took the subway to battery park for the statue of liberty ferry and Ellis Island tour. We then walked the short walk to the 911 site and freedom tower. If you are quite active then most attractions are within walking distance and a great way to see the city. We purchased a New York explorers pass which I feel definitely saved us money. I would highly recommend the harbour lights tour. You pick up the ferry for this right near the intrepid museum at around 6.30pm, it departs at 7pm and takes you all around the sights and it's beautiful just as sun is setting and then when the city lights up. Wrap up! It gets chilly outside. Fabulous time, we all loved it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel, great staff and the breakfast is brilliant. The rooms aren't the biggest, but then again I don't think rooms in NYC in general are big. The bathroom and shower is great and the views from our room on the 24th floor were very nice. Excellent location, literally right next to Times Square and Hells Kitchen.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just spent 5days at the Riu Plaza hotel in Times Square, New York. The hotel is in a brilliant location, 5 minutes to Times Square, subways are also very close. The staff in the hotel were so friendly and helpful and willing to spend a few minutes chatting. The breakfast was very good with everything you could wish for. Had a fab time in a fab hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay. Comfortable room, very clwan. Centrally located easy to get to where we wanted to go. Liked breakfast, though busy at tomes but always managed to get a table. Polite staff. Would recommend.
user_name:
Peter W
Canvey Island, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here five nights Apr 18 till 23 Apr on travel agents recommendation the room on the sixth floor so small there was no where to store luggage put up the ironing board and you cannot move around.The room faced the noisy street up to times square.The A/C did not work and had to ask for extra blanket for the chill room.its just the little things like no clock radio no shower cap and the best of all the combo squeeze bottle on the shower wall for your hair and body and open the shower door to wash your hands after the toilet no hand soap on sink and some sort of air fresher would be nice on hand after using the toilet not well ventilated at allThere are a few good points its close to anything,breakfast ok,non smoking hotel ,check in check out ok in all hindsight its a 3 star not 4 would not stay here again.I think they should pay you us65 a day resort fee to stay here.What modem hotel these days does not have USB charge ports as I said its just the little things.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The staff was so nice, once I checked in the room the receptionist called to make sure everything was at par. The view we had was amazing, and it's in a very good location. You can walk to Times Square and walk the opposite if your getting picked up by uber to avoid timesquare traffic. The included breakfast was good, and had a descent selection, weekend hours 6am-11am Their restaurant was really busy and it was hard to get service, they need more staff in the weekend Overall great experience

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza from April 22 till April 26 2018. Location of the hotel is excellent. It is located only 2 minutes from Times Square.Staff of the hotel friendly and multilingual but most of them are Spanish native speakers. No complaints about that but the concierge Patricia was not very friendly. I had a question about getting tickets for the Yankee Stadium and she was not very pleased to look up something. Besides she mixed English and Spanish when she was talking to me. I speak Spanish so I asked her wheter it was easier for her to speak Spanish. She answered me: 'don't you understand me in English or what?' but with a not so nice tone. So I asked if we could get tickets over there and she said 'maybe, I don't know'. And I saw some Spanish native speakers over there and she changed her tone immediately and making phone calls for them to check... so that was not a very nice experience. The other person at the desk was friendly.Breakfast was very good. A big room devided in two parts. A lot of choice but sometimes empty. It took a while when they refilled it.Rooms are nice and clean but was a bit tiny for 3 persons. Okay, we don't need much space but could be a bit bigger. The room misses some small important equipment like a clockradio and a filled minibar. The clockradio is very important to see the time or a wake up call during the night. Housekeeping doesn't speak English. Only Spanish. I asked for an extra pillow and she didn't understand me in English. I had to ask 3 times at the reception and housekeeping to get an extra pillow. Even in Spanish.I would recommend this hotel even with the small points I've made here but it needs some improvement. But they can work on it. Just to be clear it was not a disaster.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Main reason why this isn't really a 4-star is the corner cutting everywhere. For example the floors are very inexpensive laminate, the hair dryer in the room is one of those cheap motel style mini dryers that's bolted to the wall, the granite is the cheapest grade of granite, the hallways are so spartan it will initially make you think you took the service elevator up by accident, the mattress is only medium thick and not great. Very few outlets in the room too - major oversight. For two people it would not be sufficient. Also there are tacky advertisements everywhere. Lobby is completely full all the time, appears to get a lot of tour group traffic.Pluses - the wifi is very fast 95Mbps down, plenty of hot water, the window glass is thick - does a good job at street noise control, 5 elevators so not much delay at prime time and super fast outside of peak, and the rooms have windows that tilt open. Breakfast was ok. Gym is ok too but nothing special.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel is located right at times square which makes it easy to visit all Manhattan The staff very freindly and helpfull and allways smilingVery modern and tastefull design ,the rooms are exellent we had a stunning wiev from 25 th floor.The bed was very comfortable and bathroom fully equipped only slippers were not there We found free water in the fridge and on my birthday a pack of chocolate and greetings from the staff All the hotel very clean Breakfast amazing just everything where there and in spite of many people allways got seated very quick from very kind staffAlbergo in posizione fantastico su Tiles square.personale tutti molto gentile sorridente e disponibile .Camera con vista incredibile sul Manhattan (ero al 25 piano)letto comodissimo ,bagno grande e funzionale tutto molto pulito In frigo acqua "gratis" e al giorno del mio compleanno ho trovato cartellino di auguri e ciocolatto in camera Tutto albergo molto pulito e funzionale con ottimo designCollazione fantastica cè tutto dolce ,salato,frutta.......nonostante tante gente tutto molto veloce

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very easy to find, the hotel towers over 46 and 8th. My room looked straight down 8th Avenue with great views from the 29th floor. Amenities were very good and "free" breakfast is thrown in. However the company's tv channel reminds you all their other hotels are all-inclusive.Came down to breakfast and all the hot food is cold. Cold bacon, cold eggs, not good.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We got a great deal at this hotel.Bought at discount with breakfastArrived at 11.30 am and they let us check in anyway.Room was lovely and clean.If you have 1 kid and you book a family room it is only 1 bed.The restaurant was shut down when we arrived because of water issues but they compensated us breakfast financially with no issues.Just round the corner from times sq and great location for the hop on hop off busses. I would recommend this hotel and use again anytime.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel very central position staff friendly especially restaurant staff & doormen- Edwins a great guyViews from higher floors amazing - can see Hudson River Very clean & modern rooms Would love to return

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights. This very modern hotel was exceptionally clean, staff all very friendly and happy to help. Room lovely with great views. The breakfast buffet offered a great variety from fresh fruit to bacon, eggs and waffles. Very close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed there 2 nights. Their service is good. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Food which they provides to their customers is also good. If you are planning to go to this city you can stay here..

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in February and had a lovely time. The location is great, just a few minutes walk from Times Square. We had breakfast included, which was ok, but would not have wanted to pay over $20 for it. We asked for a room on a high floor and we got it. The staff are all friendly. Overall a nice place to stay for a few days exploring New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I would not recommend this hotel. The “shadow showers” were uncomfortable. There was not a coffee maker in the room. The ice had to be obtained at the bar. The rooms were small. The beds are literally pushed together with no space between them. The climate control was not functioning. Local was convenient.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here for 13 nights recently and i can say, wow, great location. The good:- location - good breakfast- small but good rooms. Could have been better.- fire alarm drill - very inconvenient and loud. - Need better personable approach, it is RIU approach, its not what you expect in American way of check in, checkout process.- No Kettle or Coffee maker in room! - on checking answer is they don't provide it.- They need localization with better English speaking staff. - no bathtubs- low water pressure in showers. Please dont go as your usual 4star hotel expectation in mind. Go and read what RIU has to offer overall and they are not changing, they are serving with what they are used to and known in their host countires. They have lot of tour package customers in group travelling from Europe and Soth America. So sometime you feel you are in a Spanish speaking country not in US :) but thats not a problem with me. Given choice to stay again, should i be staying again, - yes offcourse. Thank you RIU.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nothing really special about Riu Hotel but that's a good thing. The hotel is located next to Times Square. Restaurant (Shake Shack, pizza, etc.), shops (open until 2am), transportation (subway, Lyft, taxi, rental car, walk) are all near by. This is a huge hotel with lots of people and lots of floors. Breakfast is big operation (with 3 different dining halls). Check in has a wait. Check out has a wait. You just need to be mindful of that.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Plaza is a large 600-odd roomed hotel with a great location on 46th Street just off 8th Avenue. This is very close to both the theatre district and Times Square and a great central location. It is also on "restaurant row" with nearly 40 restaurants on 46th Street between 8th and 9th Avenue. The hotel is very modern. The rooms are reasonably sized for New York with a functional bathroom. There are two breakfast areas with a great selection of buffet styled choices, which are constantly being refilled. The gym on the lower ground floor has several treadmill and other machines and they supply towels and cold water. The service we experienced could not be faulted at all. Sadly there are no coffee machines in the rooms, but there is a Grab and Go cafe at the hotel entrance.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Huge variety in the breakfast, everything is fresh and tasty. The staff is nice and the room looks modern and cool.The beds are comfy and the location, oh the location, you just can't ask for more. It's close to a lot of Broadway Theaters and it's right at the Times Square.I will definitely be back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is ideally situated for shopping, sightseeing and theatre.Friendly staff, Lovely bright spacious bedrooms, modern decor, fantastic breakfast .Abundance of places to eat very close to the hotel or the hotel restaurant is also very reasonable and varied menu.We could not fault our stay at all, in fact we would consider staying here next time we come.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location 2 Mins walk from Times Square .clean comfortable rooms .The hotel is big and bustling .Reception and door staff were happy to help with any questions.If like us, you intend on shopping or you are travelling with a fair bit of luggage , you may find the rooms a real squeeze.The breakfast which was included for us was a great start to the day , good choice and even though on the second day we had to wait for a table we were sat down within 10 minutes .Recommend for a central and clean hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here last month ,on arrival was welcomed into the hotel by a very friendly bell hop who took care of the luggage from the taxi to our room.on reception was a lady called Cinthia who was charming an assisted me in changing our booking as i had booked a room on black Friday which had a pay now no refunds or change for the price, but then decided to take the 2 teenagers with us as a surprise, well cinthia could not of been more helpful in changing the room for a few dollars a day more which includes breakfast this is top draw all the normal items as well smoked salmon etc thank you so much for your help.the room had 2 double beds and a sofa bed lovely spacious shower with all toiletries soap shower gels body creams and enough towels for 6 people and fantastic views over the Hudson river the rooms are spacious enough too and very quiet slept like a baby. The hotel is in a great location only 2 blocks from times square,you can see it from the front door of the hotel, only the same distance to restaurant row with all the eating places just 5 minute away a panda express at the end of the block for excellent chinese style sit in or take away,theres also a couple of mini markets very closeby for snacks and nibs soft drinks and beers for the room, the hotel has a nice modern feel a big spacious foyer with lots of seating a fab bar just of the foyer with a great vibe and barman all in all great place to stay would defo recommend. On leaving the bell hop got a very smart limo back JFK airport for $75 including tip And thanks again once more to all staff at Riu Plaza Times square HAD A GREAT TIME

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a great find! I was not familiar with Hotel Riu or the brand when I booked my stay. I decided to take a gamble based on the price and location of the property. I was not disappointed. The staff was friendly and accommodating (especially Gailyn at the front desk). The room exceeded my expectations. Clean, inviting, and not cramped. The bed was comfortable. No issues waiting for the elevator. The breakfast was exceptional and very organized (not a free for all atmosphere like most chain hotel breakfasts). The hotel is located within a few blocks of most Broadway theaters and Restaurant Row is right outside the hotel doors. The only complaint (and it is a minor one) is that the hotel bar was understaffed which resulted in slow service. But the drinks were great and prices (for NYC) were reasonable. Overall, a delightful stay. Hotel Riu will be my new go-to hotel in NYC!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had an awesome weekend -perfect location for broadway shows, and walking tours of the city= breakfast was very convenient- nothing special but allowed for more chatting time- and unrushed. Room was clean, spacious ( for NYC standards) great bathroom layout- super shower. Would recommend it highly for all the reasons we enjoyed it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in February, it was my partners birthday and we'd just got married, we let the hotel know this and they gave us a little card and some chocolates on the bed (nice touch). We also ended up in a room on 29th floor which could only be accessed by certain lifts (perhaps we got an upgrade, no one said anything so not sure!). View from the room wasn't anything to write home about and it would be terrible if you were scared of heights! The room was small but fine for New York.... the shower and bathroom was lovely. Double walk in shower, really hot and good water pressure. It felt luxurious (for a small bathroom). Bed was comfortable and spacious and very clean. Housekeeping were great. The breakfast was great as long as you could get a seat otherwise it was quite a long, I imagine in the high season it would be chaos! There are 2 restaurants for breakfast... we preferred "Fashion" as the other one was bigger and chaotic but both did the same food. Lots of choice, the american style pancakes and waffles were a let down though! Location is great, really central but lots of cabs didn't know where the hotel was, I guess as its new, so I would recommend to make a note of the street address! Staff were friendly and we booked an airport transfer on departure through the concierge which was really reasonably priced and a great service. Overall lovely, clean, modern hotel. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were really happy with our stay at Riu. The staff was attentive and helpful, and it was a fairly quick cab ride from La Guardia. Breakfast was included in our booking, and it was a fabulous breakfast buffet—a really nice way to save a little money. We decided to stay in this area since it was our first trip to NYC, and the location was really perfect. It was just a couple blocks off Times Square, but we didn’t find it noisy at all since we were on the 26th floor. I also felt our room was pretty spacious for NYC standards! The hotel is close to major subway lines, so we were able to hop on the subway and make it to our different activities within 10-25 minutes. Tons of great restaurants and shows are within walking distance. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent five nights here. Rooms are very clean, beds comfortable and staff lovely- helpful and friendly- approachable and informative. View from the room- amazing- we were on floor 22. You are close to everything. It was very busy at times and I would have liked coffee making facilities in the room. However, we would go back and stay again - it was good value for money

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great stay at this hotel perfect for sightseeing New York definitely going back. It's a very useful vase for Times Square, Hell's Kitchen subways and many other tourist spots. Particularly good breakfasts and friendly bar after going to a show all of which were in walking distance.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent five nights here, room excellent, beds very comfortable. fabulous location to explore, near to everything. Just two tiny things, there was three people in our room, although enough hanging space as ever with the Riu hotels vey little drawer space, and disappointing no coffee making facilities in the room. Rooms very clean, plenty of towels, and quite at night; great breakfast and used restaurant and food very good. Staff very helpful and very efficient In fact the people of New York was some of the most helpful people I have met. All round a great city break made even better by a fabulous hotel base

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights in March . First time in New York and highly recommend this hotel , location is so central , you can walk to everywhere from here. Breakfast really good . We had evening meals a few times and was good , bar expensive even with happy hour . Staff very good . Room nice we stayed on 21st floor and good view. Would stay again .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A great central location with attentive, friendly, efficient staff. Rooms are clean with a fantastic shower and comfortable beds. Just what you need after a hectic day touring the City. Breakfast is chaos but it is organised chaos. A lot of people trying to eat at the same time can cause queues but these are swiftly dealt with by the excellent staff. Some ignorant quests who think they don’t have to queue for hot food and push in are annoying but this is not the fault of staff. These kind of morons are everywhere you go and a hefty shove normally sends them on their way with their tails between their legs. Failing this, if you ‘accidentally’ spill your drink on them and apologise profusely whilst trying to keep a straight face it adds a certain entertainment value to the morning experience! Food in the restaurant was also of a good standard. The waiters are truly efficient and helpful. Couldn’t understand the role of the front of house girl. She stood there and did nothing to contribute to the nights proceedings. Maybe she was new?The bar is also very nice for a cocktail to start the night off and the prices are very reasonable. I would definitely recommend and return to this lovely hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here the first week of March 2018 the Hotel staff was nice and this place has a great breakfast and great location. We were able to walk the downtown area and see the City. Parking is extra and the only downfall with this place.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights from 28th March. Really lovely hotel, breakfast was good - if you go down about 7 it’s a lot quieter and you won’t have to queue. Saying that, the one time we did go down later and had to queue, we only queued for a couple of minutes anyway which wasn’t a problem! Location is perfect if you want to do all the touristy things. Within walking distance of Central Park, Empire State, Rockerfella, Maddison Square Gardens, Macy’s..etc! We also walked down to the 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty which is downtown! The walk took us just over an hour with a stop at a lovely little coffee shop on the way (can’t remember what it was called). Staff were friendly. We had a problem with our shower and the maintenance guy was with us within 5 minutes, followed by a call from reception around 30 minutes later to check all was ok. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice clean and friendly hotel right in the heart of Time Square and the Theatre district. Perfect breakfast for a long day of sight seeing and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The hotel looks fairly new and you have a choice of two breakfast bars in the morning. We came back to NYC for a trip to the 9/11 memorial and decided to walk from RIU Plaza, it’s a good hour but you do get to see lots on the way. The hotel is right in the middle of all the places to visit so is a good place to base oneself and is not too expensive.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for a week. I had requested a high level room but unfortunately there were non available as the hotel was nearly full - however we were upgraded to a Superior Room on the 9th floor which was lovely. The included breakfast was as good as I have had anywhere with both cooked and cold options, eat as much as you like and lots of fresh fruit.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I enjoyed the diversity of the staff and the location was perfect for the Broadway area. The modernization of the private and public spaces is lovely and very comfortable. Sound-proofing to the traffic outside was excellent. My only complaints are the heat and the breakfast crowds. Fortunately, I could open my window a few inches to try to cool off my 80F+ room. Breakfast was so crowded as to be uncomfortable, perhaps even unsafe.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel Riu Plaza New York Time Square is a great place to stay. It is very convenient to many attractions. It is located at the edge of Restaurant Row; it is a very short walk (3 minutes) to Times Square; a ten minute walk to the Port Authority and a few steps more you are at Penn Station. The service is as one would expect from a very nice NYC hotel. The offer a full buffet breakfast which included all the breakfast favorites.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The best location! 300 mt from Times Square and theatres. Close to tons of restaurants, souvenirs, all kinds of shops and also near the hop on hop off buses. I will definitely go back again next year.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Rui Plaza for 7 days the last week of March could not be in a better place in the centre of New York City some brilliant places to go and in walking distance a stones throw from Times Sq and all the theatres we checked in within minutes and in our rooms which were on the 16th floor in super fast lifts I was upgraded because of my Rui Card and even got late checkout free of charge to the buffet breakfast was very good and the choice was enough for anybody’s taste though I must say we chose to eat in the bar come restaurant as the main restaurant equally as much choice but got a little cramped sometimes so for clean and modern rooms good service in a good location going to New York try the Rui Plaza 46 street NYC

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good location, clean but slightly small rooms. Helpful staff and comprehensive breakfast. Ideally situated for broadway and bus tours conveniently located nearby. Good selection of bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood to choose from.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked a 4 night 5 days stay at this hotel as part of a British Airways deal. Coming with breakfast which is a bonus in New York the hotel suited our needs, bright and airy room with fantastic views. Staff were friendly and very helpful, the bar was great for a relaxing drink after a hard days walking sightseeing!New York is expensive if you don't keep your wits about you but we chose to eat in smaller eateries rather than big chains and found that for $60 you could eat more than enough. Remember that tipping is the norm at around 15% of the bill so factor that in when budgeting. As for the hotel 4/5 is what I would score it its a comfortable 3-4 star hotel not too pretentious as some can be. 5 minutes from Time Square, the bus tours set out across the main road and are worth doing, All the main attractions are within walking distance but be warned were comfy shoes we averaged 8 miles a day! Brilliant time will not hesitate to go back and stay in the same place

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We just spent one night at the Riu Plaza and I found it to be a very nice hotel. Our check in went smoothly and we in our room in just a few minutes. We were on the 17th floor and the view was nice. The room was small which is normal for New York but we didn't spend much time in it anyway. The bathroom was a good size with a nice shower and plenty of counter space. We had a refrigerator and 2 complimentary bottles of water. The room and bathroom were very clean. We had the complimentary breakfast in the morning and it was very good. Eggs, bacon, sausage, lots of fruit and pastries. The bar and lobby were both very comfortable to sit and relax and have a drink. The hotel staff were all very nice and treated us well. The location is great! We were so close to the theaters, Times Square, Rockefeller Center. I will stay here again next year when we come for a weekend.-

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel, the breakfast was good, but sometimes it was so busy a lot of bumping into other guests and had to wait for tables to be ready, we were a party of 4 and sometimes we would get down before our other guests joined us so id ask for a table for 4 people so they didn't have to wait for a table, but the young lady [with long black hair] wouldn't let us do that as they there and then but [the black girl was fine with it every time we asked for a table for 4 people, but a lot to choose from[fruit, hot food, cereals etc, rooms was good but I would preferred a street view than back of buildings, but overall great, staff were friendly and great sense of humour, especially the girl in the Fashion bar [the blonde girl, sorry I have forgotten her name] she had amazing sense of humour..!! Its only 2 minutes walk to Times Square, easy to get to airport, because the doorman sorted that out with a great flat rate. Loads of shows within walking distance too. One thing the lifts need to be more quicker, took ages to get to our floor 7.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in the Riu Plaza Times Square for a week in March 2018. Arrived around 9.30pm and found Check-in very prompt and efficientRooms weren't massive but you still had plenty of room to put all your clothes away and room to store 2 suitcases. Bathroom was more than big enough for 2, with plenty of hot water and a very powerful shower. Breakfast was a bit manic but very well managed and we never waited more than a couple of minutes for a table. Food was constantly being changed and was generally always fresh and hot. We ate at the on-site restaurant on one occasion, with the food very reasonably priced for NYC, very tasty and served piping hot. The staff in both the restaurant and bar were very attentive. Had to cut our stay short due to adverse weather, but the reception/concierge staff really supported us in the final hours, helping with taxis and contacting various people on our behalf. Would stay again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just spent 5 nights in The Riu Plaza and found it up to the usual Riu standard.We had bed and breakfast and although breakfast time could be a bit of a bun fight the food was excellent and plentiful. Would suggest an early breakfast to avoid the rush.The rooms are of a good standard for a short stay hotel, and are cleaned to perfection each day, the staff are more than helpful and are there immediately if you need them.We dined in the Fashion restaurant every night and found the food excellent especially the spaghetti!!!!! And good value for money.The only down side was on Friday and Saturday night the nightclub opposite played REALLY loud music from 11pm til 4am but that would not put me off of staying there again in the future...WELL DONE RIU!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location as only 1 block away from Times Square. Rooms very clean & nicely presented. However, the morning after we arrived the kitchen was closed and we had to go out to have breakfast. Although the hotel compensated us $25 for this it was not enough as breakfast outdoors costs more! When we complained to the hotel staff, they weren't overly bothered and were trying to divert our complaint to British Airways as they are affiliated with this hotel. The restaurant was closed for the duration we were there and we later found out that this was due to a burst sewer pipe in their restaurant!! Also from the $25 We were compensated we were taxed on it! Spend your money on another hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is located literally 2 minutes walk from Times Square and on the streets of Broadway. Rooms are comfortable. They are small but still plenty of space for everything you need and you don't go to NY to spend the time in the hotel room. Bathroom is small also but comes with a selection of toiletries. My only criticism on the room is the wardrobe had only 3 hangers to hang the clothes. A few more would be nice :) Bottles of water are provided in the mini fridge free of chargeBreakfast is really tasty and a very large selection to choose from. The dining hall is busy but they get through the queues quickly as it is very well managed. Unfortunately they had to close the dining room for 3 days while we were there due to a maintenance problem but the hotel gave us $25 per person for each day which was more than enough to take breakfast outside the hotel. Hotel has a nice reception area and a bar. There is also a restaurant which we did not use but it looked nice friendly and helpful staff Would stay here again for sure if I go back to NY.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location for city visit. Hotel far enough from Times Square to miss hustle and bustle, close enough to be at centre of things. Great service at hotel even fixed a broken case handle on arrival. Room kept perfectly clean. Breakfast had plenty of choice and always fresh. Great View from 17th floor of city. Used the big bus tours as got a great deal for the five of us which included main attractions. Guides were informative and entertaining. Great night at theatre, school of rock was fantastic. Dragged wife & daughter along to the basketball which they surprisingly enjoyed. Good meals out @ Stardust, Hard Rock amongst others. 911 memorial & museum a must visit. Views from one world observatory fantastic. Great Christmas market in Bryant Park. Macy’s huge, take you days to get round whole place! Great views from top of Empire State Building on a clear sunny day but cold. Chilled out in Central Park before attempting 5th ave! So much to do, will need to return. Used Carmel for transport to and from airport, quick and efficient service keeping you informed by text. Will be returning to New York and the Riu Times Square

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for week clean tidy breakfast was ample but cooked stuff could sometimes be cold depending what time you ate. Location was great sometimes a bit noisy sirens horns etc rooms were small but we didn't spend much time in room so wasn't a problem power shower excellent but we didn't like the frosted glass as you could see the silhouette of person using it .We ate twice in hotel both times food was great also used the cafe attached to hotel for cake and coffee if we stayed here again we wouldn't have breakfast as there is plenty of places to try all in all nice clean hotel we stayed on the 15th floor lifts were fine matter of minutes to wait for 1 if you not planning to spend a lot of time in room I would reccomend this hotel for great location I give it 4 stars would have been 5 if breakfast had of been warmer all in all an enjoyable stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Came for a weekend getaway. Checking was super quick and easy. Room was ready and had a stunning view of the theater district. Hotel staff are quite nice and the vibe of the hotel is wonderful. You can’t go wrong with the location because it is near everything, shops, theater, and food.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just back from our first trip to New York, booked a package holiday with British airways for a week, hotel was fantastic very modern looking and in a great location, staff were very friendly, breakfast was included which had a great selection rooms were comfortable, could not fault this and would definitely use again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel nuovo, moderno.Camere spaziose e pulite. Dal 20 piano in su la vista è TOP. Noi eravamo in una Deluxe al 26 piano...alba, tramonto, neve, skyview...uno spettacolo unico.Colazione inclusa: abbondante e variegata. Certo, la sala colazioni è molto affollata e forse caotica....ma in un hotel che ha più di 600 camere...plausibile e comprensibile no?!Ci sono più di 300 persone che lavorano...sorridenti e disponibili.In pieno centro di New York...è all'angolo con Times Square! What else?In: camere, posizione, colazione inclusa (cosa non scontata per un hotel a NYC)Out: 200€ di deposito cauzionale non specificato in fase di prenotazione.New, modern hotel.Spacious and clean rooms. From the 20th floor up the view is TOP. We were in a Deluxe on the 26th floor ... sunrise, sunset, snow, skyview ... a unique show.Breakfast included: abundant and varied. Of course, the breakfast room is very crowded and perhaps chaotic .... but in a hotel that has more than 600 rooms ... plausible and understandable no ?!There are more than 300 people working ... smiling and available.In the center of New York ... it's on the corner with Times Square! What else?In: rooms, location, breakfast included (which is not obvious for a hotel in NYC)Out: € 200 security deposit not specified during booking.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here with my boyfriend and son for 3 nights in a family double double which was the perfect size for us. Rooms were lovely, breakfast was included and just one block from Times Square. Perfect for a weekend break!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having been to New York before and stayed in Midtown, I wanted to stay somewhere with a bit more going on. I chose the Riu Plaza Times Square based on the reviews it had and the fairly recent renovations it has gone through. Room: We stayed in 2207. We had a large bed which was very comfortable. Our room looked out over a cracking skyline. Despite only being one avenue away from Times Square it was not noisy at all. In fact you wouldn’t even know where you were located led in bed! We had a large tv on the wall at the end of the bed with plenty of channels to watch. Oh and there are USB ports by the side of the bed so you can charge your phone, iPads etc really easily without needing American converter plugs! Our bathroom was great. Huge power shower, with plenty of hot water. Complimentary shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, soap, body lotion and shower caps were available. The towels were also white and fluffy, and more importantly clean! Hairdryer was very powerful for one so small. I’ve got thick medium length hair and it didn’t take any longer than it does at home to dry it. Staff: Check in and check out were both very quick and efficient. Staff were friendly without being intrusive. Hotel Bar: We used this most evenings. They do a happy hour offer on certain cocktails, wines and beers between 4pm-midnight every day. Very reasonably priced. Breakfast: We never had an issue being seared for breakfast straight away. Plenty of food which was replenished very quickly due to the amount of people using it. I had sausage patties, fried eggs, crispy streaky bacon, smoked salmon.. plenty of choice along with cereals, toast and pastries. Minute Maid Orange Juice.. a favourite of mine from school along with plenty of hot drinks. I’d say the only downside was that there wasn’t a plug near the mirror in our room so when I straightened my hair I couldn’t see what I was doing. But then again I’ve been straightening it for long enough now that I don’t really need a mirror! I did take curling tongs but didn’t end up using them for this reason. But then again, the hour that I would have spent curling my hair, was instead spent touring the city! Much more beneficial! Wi-fi was free and had a strong connection throughout the hotel. You could even pick it up from outside the hotel. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and wouldn’t think twice about rebooking.. in-fact I’ve already been on British Airways website looking at deals for 2019! Great job Riu Plaza!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just back from a week in NYC. This hotel is a great base to explore the city, the rooms are small, clean and compact! The breakfast was very poor, the plates were dirty and the bread wasn't fresh, there is a good selection of food but as breakfast is served over a few hours in the morning it may be a hit or miss depending on what time you go down. I would come back to this hotel but it is quite expensive in comparison to other hotels in the area and considering NYC is a very active holiday not a lot of time is spent in your room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time in New York and booked Riu Plaza as part of a package holiday with British Airways to be here for St Patrick’s Day. Trust me, you will not be disappointed! The hotel is busy, modern and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is satisfactory with good selection of hot or cold food. The restaurant can be busy but waiting time short. Our room is is on 27th floor with amazing views of Hudson River. The room is a deluxe king size and has all we require for comfort. So far we have walked everywhere and have seen most of the recommended sights (and we are both over 60). We still have 3 days left of our 7 day trip and loads more to explore!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wow! We were so happy with our choice. We stayed in a room for 4 adults and it was a great size! We were pleasantly surprised! We had 2 large doubles and a sofa bed. Our room was on the 25th floor which meant we also had fantastic views of the city. Reviews saying rooms were small gave us concerns before travelling but we shouldn’t have worried there was more than enough room for us all and 4 large suitcases. Another concern was the frosted glass for the shower - again total unecessary to be worried - yes it is glass but at most you can see a slight shadow/ silhouette nothing more so not a problem. The location is superb - less than a 2 minute walk to the heart of Times Square. We found it perfect especially as the hop on hop off tour bus tickets that we purchased had a bus stop right outside too. The company we bought from was Top View. Concierge were great at the hotel - they even loaned us umberellas free of charge when it was pouring down and sorted us a fixed rate taxi to the airport when we checked out.  The hotel itself is ultra modern and rooms were clean and modern too - the front desk staff were so friendly when we checked in - really can’t praise them enough.  Another bonus was the free breakfast we got with our booking - it was great - fresh and so much choice - perfect to set you up for a busy day of sightseeing. I don’t think we could have found a better Hotel for the money. I would definitely book this hotel next time I visit it was great. USB ports at the side of the bed for charging phones without a travel plug, water in the mini bar, hair dryer - it had everything that we needed and more.  Don’t hesitate to book this hotel, you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I read other reviews before staying here and was a bit concerned. So it was with much relief when we arrived to find a clean, bright, modern hotel that offered so much. Check in and check out were both smooth and quick and front desk staff were professional and courteous. We did have an issue with luggage storage. We arrived too early to check in and had to check out several hours before our flight so we left our bags with the bellman. On both occasions it took a long time to retrieve the bags. The room was more like a bedroom than a hotel room. It was small but had floor to ceiling windows, a very comfortable Queen bed, two night stands, a fridge with complimentary bottled water, a closet with a safe, iron and ironing board and a great flat screen TV with many channels. The WiFi worked well throughout the hotel. We were on the 17th floor and heard only the very occasional siren. Otherwise it was blissfully quiet. We were very fortunate to be near other quiet guests. We could definitely hear conversations from other rooms and the doors closed with a very loud bang if you weren't careful. But thankfully we experienced very little noise at all.The room was cool but we didn't want to play around with the thermostat because of the reviews we read about the potential heating concerns at the hotel. We simply called for a blanket and were quickly delivered a comfy fleece one that even matched the mauve colours of the room.The toilet would not stop flushing at one point and nobody came when we first called the front desk. The bathroom door is only sliding glass so it doesn't help with sound proofing. So we left the room and spoke to the front desk again. We returned several hours later to find the problem fixed and there were no other problems. Regarding the bathroom, it was just smoked glass so you could see the shadow of your co-guest as they were bathing. Not a big deal. There were shower caps, skin lotion, hair conditioner and bars of soap at the large sink and a squeeze bottle of body soap/shampoo on the wall of the shower. This squeeze bottle ran empty during our visit and was not automatically replaced. We had to call the front desk to have one delivered.The food at breakfast was ample and perfect for us. We have food allergies yet we had a lot of choice. There were bagels and breads, cereals, orange juice, coffee and several kinds of tea. The hot chocolate was a highlight for one in our party. Scrambled and sunny-side-up eggs, two kinds of sausage, bacon, waffles /pancakes and breakfast potatoes with peppers made up the hot portion of the buffet while there was smoked salmon, ham, salami and several cheeses in the cold section. There was also fresh fruit including various melons and pineapple.Last but not least was the excellent location of this hotel. Attending shows was our main reason for our trip. By staying here we never had more than a 10-minute walk from any theatre. At the same time we were just short walks to the subway, Times Square, the New York Times and the Hop-on Hop-off tour buses. The Riu concierge staff, near the front entrance, is extremely helpful and informative. Beware the tour bus ticket sellers outside the hotel (and all over Times Square). They work on commission and are very persistent. The Riu concierge staff was very helpful in ensuring we picked the right tour without the hard sell. The concierge staff was also helpful in booking a reasonably priced non-stop shuttle for our return to the airport (although if you don't have much luggage, the subway is a close, fast and inexpensive option). We were very happy at the Riu. It was a pleasant home away from home and would definitely return. We enjoyed our stay and

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived with 3 other couples for a few days in NYC, hotel was booked through British Airways in their sale, good price with breakfast. Check-in was quick and easy all our rooms were ready, although we arrived an hour or so before official check-in opens. Unfortunately, one room was on the 23rd floor while all the others were on the 18th.Our room was 1820, (others had 1822,1824). On first inspection room was clean, great shower, comfy bed, big tv etc, (its a hotel room, your not spending every hour in it).Outside room 1820, there is a plumbers cupboard,on the first night all we could hear was the buzzing coming from within. The following morning we reported it to reception, they said they would send someone up to investigate, on returning from a day out we returned to our room and the buzzing was still there, told reception again, was told again they would investigate, To cut a long story short, the buzzing was there all week but we were so tired that we completely forgot about it until we woke up. As for breakfast, great selection to keep any appetite happy, there is a 24hr Dunkin' Donuts directly opposite the hotel, for all you early risers who need a coffee fix before breakfast, (breakfast doesn't open until 0730).All in all, very happy with hotel, one block from Times Square, if we go back to New York, wouldn't hesitate to look at this hotel again. Just not room 1820.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 5 days during snow storm and sun. Lovely hotel one of the better value hotels in New York. Clean lovely breakfast. Maybe a little like a cafeteria but as free accept the multitudes. Staff are very helpfull and friendly. The attached restaurant and coffee shop good food sand value for money

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: So this hotel is all about the location. The lobby is splashy contemporary and the rooms are a pretty good size for Manhattan. (All hotel rooms in Manhattan are smaller than average, which can surprise you if you’re not prepared for it.) You probably won’t spend a lot of time in the room so it’s fine. Elevators were fast and the staff was friendly. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. One caution if you’re traveling with kids - we stayed on the 27th floor and the bottom third of the window opens! My kids are a bit older, but it could be dangerous with smaller kids. The breakfast buffet was fine, but hectic. They had some healthy options and a cappuccino machine. Also, breakfast was included with our room so that was a money saver. Overall a good choice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my daughter stayed at Riu for 7 nights in March. We had an issue with the air conditioning at first night. The room was very hot. They sent an engineer but couldn’t fix it,so they immediately changed our room . From this point everting was perfect. The room is new , the bed very comfy, hot water and clean. The breakfast is very good. Fresh Fruits, vegetables . The location is great. 5 minutes to Times Square but quite enjoyable get 2 little bottles water every 2 days. They gave us late check out till 15 for 30$. Good internet.I will be back for sure.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I booked this hotel as part of a package with British Airways for the bargain price of £1800 for three adults (my husband, my 18 year old son and myself) which included return flights from the UK and bed and breakfast at the Rui Plaza for seven nights from 8 February 2018.Location - Situated one block from Times Square and no more than a five minute walk to various Subway stations, the location cannot be beat. The choice of restaurants is overwhelming, Everything from fine dining, to takeaway Pizza slices is on offer with prices to suit every budget. There are the usual souvenir shops as well as small corner shop grocery stores and several branches of Duane Reade/Walgreens which stocks just about everything you will need during your stay, snacks, toiletries, medication, drinks including wine and beer (if purchasing alcohol make sure you have ID as we were asked for it at one branch - my husband and I are in our 50s!)Arrival and check-in - We arrived at the Riu at about 5.30 pm and we were immediately impressed with the lobby. There was no queue at check-in and we were dealt with quickly. I had contacted the hotel prior to arrival via email requesting a room on a higher floor and we were allocated a room on the 22 floor. We left our bags with the hotel porter and they were delivered to our room immediately.Room - We were allocated room 2201 which turned out to be a disabled accessible room. The room had two double beds, was a decent size for New York, and was spotlessly clean. We had a great view facing uptown and with a side view of the Hudson River. As stated in the hotel description the room contained a small desk and mini fridge which contained two complementary bottles of water which were replaced daily. The fridge was big enough for a few cold drinks and a bottle of wine. I knew prior to arrival that there were no inroom tea/coffee making facilities so took a travel kettle and mugs/glasses with us. The flat screen TV had a large selection of channels, not that we were in the room much to watch it. We found the beds to be very comfortable and they were raised off the ground so that luggage could be stored under them. The built in wardrobe contained an electronic safe, iron and ironing board. The room lacked storage space for clothing. We were three adults and there were eight clothes hangers between us. The only drawer space was in the small bedside table, so there was no where to put underwear, personal items etc.I knew when booking the hotel that the bathroom had a frosted glass wall between the shower and the bedroom. Because this was a disabled accessible room there was a solid wall instead as well as a shower curtain. There were ample clean towels and these were replaced daily. Complimentary toiletries consisted of a all in one shower gel/shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soap. The shower was great with a rain fall and hand held shower head, good water pressure and plenty of hot water.Being in New York we knew we would hear street noise whilst in our room. This was not excessively loud even with the window open and added to the experience of being in NYC. Contrary to some other reviewers we experienced no noise distrubance from other guests whilst in their rooms or the corridor even though the hotel had 100% occupancy during part of our stay.I had read other reviews which complained about problems with the air con. We also had this problem. The room on arrival was very warm and adjusting the aircon had no effect. We ended up sleeping on top of the bed covers the first few nights. We found the only solution was to turn off the air con and open the window. As this is a common complaint the hotel really needs to look into it so the problem can be fixed.Wi-fi and computers - We were able to log on to the wifi without any problems and the speed was good. We did discover that there is a maximum of four devices per room that could log on. This caused a small problem for us as being from the UK we couldn't use the mobile data on our phones due to the high cost so had no choice but to use the hotel wifi. We also had a Macbook, and two tablets so weren't able to connect all our devices.There are several computers and a printer located behind the lifts for guests to use and they were handy for printing out tickets, boarding passes. The only problem we encountered was parents allowing their young children to 'play' on them unsupervised.Lifts - There are five main lifts. We never waited more than a couple of minutes for one and they were very fast to the point where your ears would pop.Breakfast - Buffet breakfast was included in our stay and on our first morning we went down at about 7.30 am. We were greeted at the entrance of the breakfast room next to the lifts and were informed that they were very busy but that breakfast was also served in the main restaurant, Fashion, and beside the Grab and Go cafe. We were seated immediately in the Fashion restaurant and were happy with the selection on offer. Apple and orange juice, tea, coffee, to drink. Four types of cereal, various breads, rolls, bagels, muffins, croissant and sweet pastries. Hot items consisted of bacon, sausage links, turkey sausage patties, scrambled eggs, hash browns or breakfast potatoes, waffles, pancakes. Cold items to choose from were cold meats and cheeses, smoked salmon, tomatoes, cucumber, fresh fruits such as melon, strawberries, pineapple. Food was replenished promptly.Dining - We ate at the hotel one night and found the food to be good and very reasonably priced.Check-out - On our last night the hotel was at 100% capacity so we were expecting a queue at check-out. Surprisingly this was not the case and we were dealt with quickly. We were able to leave our luggage with the porters so that we could make the most of our last day.Overall we thought the Riu Plaza Times Squre was a great hotel with a few niggly problems. All the staff we had contact with were friendly and helpful and took pride in their job. It was great value for money and I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a Queen room on the 27th floor. It was perfect. Very clean & tidy. The buffet breakfast in the morning was adequate with healthy options available as well as hot food. It was open until 1100 which was great after a late night. It’s minutes from 50th or 42nd st Metro on C or E so easy to get to from JFK and easy for Penn station too as it’s only 2 stops. The theatre district & Times Square on the doorstep. Would use this hotel again as it’s also near the Cruise terminal & the eating area of Hell’s Kitchen.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We would stay here again. The room was nice. The location was excellent. The wifi was excellent. We were on the 9th floor, not a great view, but we weren't in the room much so it didn't matter. The elevators were impressively fast and smooth. We got a deal that included breakfast and the breakfast was good. Service started at 7am, so we were out of luck the morning we checked out. There was no 'to go bag' option, no to go coffee, no refund, just a mechanical apology. One morning, my husband had a conference call at 8am and I went to the breakfast room in search of coffee. That was not an option. I was directed to the Dunkin' Donuts around the corner, which was odd because the hotel operates a cafe called Capital Grab-n-Go which can be accessed from the lobby, at the end of the front desk, hidden behind the bellhop stand. I wasn't aware of this, so went back upstairs to put on my coat and hat, walked outside, then immediately to the left saw this cafe and got our two, to go coffees, returned directly to the lobby without going back outside. The only other negative was the hairdryer which was small yet powerful, but the cord barely reached to the mirror which was extremely frustrating. Otherwise, staying here was a very good experience. We flew into LaGuardia and took the M60 bus to the Astoria metro station then took the metro to 42nd Street. We bought the metro/bus card at the airport then it was necessary to use that card outside at a machine to purchase a bus ticket. It was easy and inexpensive because we knew the procedure thanks to info on TA and a helpful, random person at the machine, but lots of folks were confused and the bus driver didn't help them, saying to one woman who asked about the price, "I don't know. I don't ride the bus."

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed 26/02/18 to 03/03/18 4 nightsFantastic hotel very close to Times Square 1 block away , from arriving the staff were friendly and helpful nothing was too much touble for them . Easy to check in plus baggage was waiting in our room . Breakfast was very good so much choice . Nice bar and restaurant .
