Our room was on the 22 floor , very light room nice bed ,small fridge , lovely bathroom large tv on wall , great wifi all over hotel. Great position for all shows in theatre area Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting manhatten

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: If you are a Riu fan like me say yes to this hotel!!!it is amazing and deffinetly worth the price.The hotel is near Times Square so it is a great location and the hotel is really fancy and stylish. people are very nice too!We didn't have any breakfast or dinner there so I can't tell you anything about it but everything I absolutely loved at this hotel!
user_name:
Stefanie V
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is extremely well located, very close to Times Square, which facilitated the visit to New York. The hotel room was very clean, not too big but enough. Breakfast was very good and completed and included in price , which is rare in New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at Riu Plaza Times Square for 5 nights.Don't read the negative comments, this hotel is superb. The rooms are brilliant, spotless, good air con, good WiFi, the comfiest beds ever.A power shower, fridge and wall mounted wide screen TV.Free breakfast included, a massive selection, hot and cold, all you can eat and replenished frequently. Staff very friendly, really helpful.The onsite restaurant has a great atmosphere and the food is of a high standard , the prices are very competitive.I would recommend this hotel and can't wait to visit again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The thing to remember when booking a hotel in New York is don’t be deceived by the flashy, stylish lobby. They always look great, but the rest of the hotel rarely matches the expectations set by it. Having said that, the rooms at the Riu Plaza Times Square aren’t as bad as some other hotels in NYC with impressive lobbies. They’re not brilliant though. For UK readers, if a Premier Inn and a Travel Lodge had a love child, it’d look like a room at this hotel (except you’d get more space in a Premier Inn). We stayed in a twin room and after the beds and the bathroom and a sofa that’s big enough for 2 if you like to be cosy, there isn’t really any room to put your suitcases unless you want to be sliding them under and out from the bed. The room had a small mini fridge in it and the 2 bottles of water in it were replaced when used. Fancy a morning cuppa when you wake up – no chance as there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. You could always buy one from downstairs though. Make sure you are very comfortable with whoever you’re sharing a room with as the bathrooms aren’t exactly private. The door to the bathroom is a sliding door that doesn’t slide shut. It slides in front of the door frame leaving a nice gap for you to see whoever is sat on the toilet should you look in that direction at the wrong time. If you don’t see them, you’ll certainly hear them. The back wall of the shower is glass, looking into the bedroom. Whilst the glass is sort of frosted, the bathroom lights mean you can definitely see very revealing shadows. Some people have mentioned noise in their reviews; we stayed on the 18th floor and traffic noise wasn’t a problem, the only time we heard it was when it was a siren which you could hear anywhere that had a road in the vicinity. The noise we had problems with was other residents. The doors to the rooms are heavy and swing shut with a very loud bang which can be heard all along the corridor. Now one of the good things about the hotel is its location. It’s 2 minutes from Times Square, is close to a lot of transport links and many key attractions are a short walk. However, it’s this proximity that means it seems to attract a certain crowd. This isn’t a quiet hotel by any means. You will hear people in the next rooms very clearly and we experienced large families who had got 2 or 3 rooms on a corridor shouting to each other across the way, opening and slamming their doors every 20 seconds. We also very clearly heard people who had come to party come crashing back into their rooms very early in the mornings too. If you want a quiet hotel pay the extra for a very nice hotel and book somewhere that is nowhere near Times Square. Breakfast at the hotel is a very big buffet with a wide selection of choices – not necessarily healthy but hey, it is the U.S. The breakfast room itself is very plastic and feels a bit like a truck stop or a school canteen with everyone crammed very closely together. The hotel restaurant for evening meals is tiny and the menu is your basic fast food. Nothing special. The bar does do decent happy hour cocktails though and has some nice wine so maybe just stick to drinks. Given America is supposed to pride itself on customer service, some of the hotel staff could maybe do with a refresher course. Reception staff tended to be quite surly bordering on rude, but the staff in the breakfast room were a lot more pleasant. All in all, if you’re looking for somewhere to rest your head for a few hours and be close to Times Square this is the hotel for you, but if you’re wanting more, I’d definitely say book elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived late on a Friday night and on the weekend of the New York Marathon so the hotel was fully booked and very busy. Check in took no time at all and we were in our room within 15 minuts of arriving. Had a twin room on the 17th floor. Good sized west facing room with 2 double beds, good bathroom, room safe and plenty of room under the beds for storing luggage. First morning (Saturday) there was a 30 minute wait for a table for breakfast but as we were a table of 2 got a table within a couple of minutes. Standard but plentiful breakfast included in the room rate, breads, bakery, fruits, eggs, bacon, sausages, juices, tea, coffee etc There are two areas for breakfast so they turn over tables pretty quickly. With the marathon the next day there was much activity so getting the lift up to and down from the 17th floor sometimes took a while but not a big inconvenience really. Good gym, good business centre for printing tickets etc. The hotel is modern, clean and efficient and yes there is some noise from the corridors and hallways but was never an issue that detracted from our time in the room. Will definitely stay here again next time as it is very close to Times Square (3 minute walk), Madison Square Garden, Theatre District, Central Park, Empire State Building and public transport. Don't have a bad word to say about this hotel. Thank you very much, we enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Located 2 minutes from Times Square and subway.Modern rooms with all comfort.WiFi is included and works.Breakfast is very good.Little red point: not an all day long "concierge" - nobody was here when we needed some advices at 11:30 am.A very good choice to visit NYC!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel opened recently (in 2016) and is in the best possible location in New York for a tourist. Next to Times Square (2 min walking distance), it allows you to reach all the key places to visit with a max 30 min walk (Empire State Building, Broadway, Fifth Avenue, Central Park, etc).Highly recommended for a convenient and nice stay in the city centre.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It’s NYC - noise is everywhere, but in this hotel you hear everything in the hallways and the Latin club across the street, and voices from the street. Clean rooms, nice staff but be prepared to stay out all night or simply not sleep....the hotel can’t control the club across the street but fair warning about what you will hear - this is well beyond NYC street noise! It’s like sharing a wall with a Latin dance club...Beware.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: There are pluses and minuses about this hotel. But no superlatives on either end except location. Minutes from Times Square and in the heart of the theater disctrict, it is a more than reasonably priced hotel within a short walk of many of the wonders of New York City. And that is its biggest plus. The lobby is attractive, airy and modern looking. The desk staff are friendly (although someone screwed up my request for a late departure). The breakfast is overpriced and bland. Skip it and find a better place just down the street. The rooms are spotless, the beds are comfortable , the decor is Target. But it's NYC, why are you in your room??? The hallways made me think I woke up in a mental ward; white and sterile and devoid of decoration. Maybe to someone's taste, I don't know. But for the location and the price, I can't recommend it highly eough.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely wowed by this hotel from check in to check out !! We had a room on 29th floor In the corner with awesome views of New York skyline and could even see the Hudson ! The room was fresh clean and spacious .. maids do a superb job ! Fresh toiletries every day and water .. breakfast was super quality and food hot and fresh. We preferred the style lounge for breakfast as this was more relaxed and less busy than main restaurant.. plenty choice and staff worked so hard to clean tables keep food looking good and get customers seated quickly .. We couldn’t fault anything about this hotel the place was so clean, and staff so friendly and happy ... it’s central to Times Square and really comfortable to sit in the foyer or drink in bar !! WiFi is fast no issues at all .. we Would Defo return ..thank you

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Riu Plaza Times Square for 9 nights in room 1518This was my first visit to NY and i couldent have been more successful with my selection of accommodation.The hotel is located in the heart of everything, theaters, shopping, sightseeing, all within walking distances.. amazing location.Upon arrival at hotel you have a very welcoming feeling, the doorman;s greetings, to the front desk warmth, all mattered and helped make us feel welcomed.check in was super quick and before you know it we were up to the 15th floor,the room very good in size, a huge bed, comfortable mattress , pillows, big sized bathroom. the view from the room was amazing.House keepers made a great job.WiFi worked perfect.Breakfast was WOW, such a huge buffet, with so much to chose from from loads of fresh fruit, to eggs, bacon, sausages, breads, yogurt , juices, coffees.. Simply amazing. the only thing with the breakfast room, was the load of people there,it was loaded and getting through the buffet took up to 10 min.Special thanks to Samuel from the front desk who was always friendly and professional and helpful. My stay at the hotel was made through 2 different agents, and the booking for the second period was at a lesser category room.. Samuel tried his best and managed to keep us in the same room and thus save us from packing and moving..this was a perfect stay in all aspects highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: From the moment you step foot in this hotel you will not be disappointed. Everybody even the cleaners are so friendly and helpful. The only thing I was disappointed in was there was no hot tub. But all in all it is a great location with amazing staff and wonderful shopping and restaurants close by. Strategically located in a perfect spot.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Second trip to NYC for business and pleasure. This hotel is in the heart of time square (which means you can't avoid sirens and car horns). The hotel was clean and snug. The free breakfast buffet was more than you would expect from a complimentary breakfast. And the service was pleasant.  My only complaint was their issue with temperature control in your room. We couldn't get room temperature below 78*F, when we called for help the maintenance guys were extremely nice. However, after looking at the ventilation for 10 minutes they told me the best way to cool the room down was to open the window. This seems like a viable solution, however, it was freezing temperatures outside. If I were to return to NYC, Time Square I would consider staying here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I like so much to be here in this hotel. Is clean and comfortable , but I think it would be better if they had a coffee machine in the room. Because their restaurant opens until 6:30 am and sometimes we need to drink some coffee before to go out on a tour. But!! We really enjoy to stay here.! Definitely we comeback!! By the way: they speak in Spanish!! So good!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I have just returned from a 5 night trip to the Riu Times Square. Staying as a family with 2 young children, 2 teens, a couple and my parents, we stayed in 4 rooms, all of which were exceptionally clean and had amazing views of the city. Check in was fast and easy and the reception staff very friendly. Breakfast is good and the prices in the hotel bar, restaurant and coffee area ate in-line with anywhere else in the city. Breakfast was good, well cooked and always warm. It could be quite busy but they always managed to accommodate tables near each other for our party of 10.Perfectly placed, the hotel is a short stroll from Times Square, directly across the road from a number of hop on/ hop off tours and various subway stations. There are some very good quality restaurants, bars and shops within minutes of the hotel. Grand central, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Empire State and Madison square gardens are all an easy walk from the hotel.Myself and my family loved this hotel and would highly recommend it! The only negative I have is that the sewer lines directly outside the main door were emptied 3 days out of the 5 we were there and the smell is horrendous both outside and in the reception area. We heard someone say it should only be done at night, I’m not sure this is something RIU has any control over though!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having experienced another horrible hotel in New Jersey, this time our choice was very right and not disappoint, upon arrival we were greeted very warmly at the reception, we had good friendly chat with the receptionist while she was typing in our information! The hotel is situated in mid town and our room view is fantastic. Therefore I do recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: we were a group of six with three rooms, small but comfortable, great views, amazing location, amazing breakfast (expect long queues though) and to top it all great happy hour cocktails. Only point was could not control room temperature, really stuffy rooms had to sleep with windows open and it was cold in February. great on site café too

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I can not fault this hotel. It’s location is fantastic, just one block away from Times Square. We were on the 10th floor and the noise from below was minimal. The room was clean and airy and visited every day by housekeeping. The staff were really helpful throughout the hotel. Breakfast was exceptional. Ours was included in the price of our booking but I would gladly pay the 19 dollars they were charging. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and if I ever go back I wouldn’t dream about staying anywhere else.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a great experience at Riu Hotel NY Times Square. The room is quite small, as most of the rooms in NYC, but it was clean and in a good condition. The hotel offers a great breakfast for all guests, as well as a good lounge for some guests where you can get some refreshments anytime day. The location is simply perfect, two blocks from Times Squares. If you have any problem or special need, do not hesitate to chat with Samuel, who works in the front desk there and was very kind and helped us a lot during our entire stay. Not a cheap option (bear in mind you will be in NY, and hotels in the heart of Times Squares use to be expensive), but a good choice considering everything this hotel offers.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I visited New York with my wife and my son (22 months old), we decided to stay at the RIU as we have previously had very good experiences at this hotel group.Once again they made it, the staff was amazing from reception to housekeeping, breakfast and bar team, the made us feel so welcome and they were so accommodating in every requirement, special thanks to Hansel and Cindi at reception.The hotel is located just 5 minutes away from Times Square with nearby connections to anywhere in Manhattan.Nice rooms, good breakfast and great cocktail bar.
user_name:
Ribera74
Bray on Thames, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My partner and I stopped at the RIU Plaza for 5 nights at the end of February. The hotel is perfectly located close to Time Square and that it has to offer. The bus tour buses pickup nearby and access to the subway is close by too. The hotel is immaculate inside from reception through to the rooms. Breakfast was included which offered both hot and cold options that really set us up for the day ahead exploring. The only thing that I would say is that the rooms are very hot and can not be cooled by the ac system as it’s switched off in the winter months. The room windows do open a small amount but nowhere near enough to keep the room comfortable. Other than that amazing hotel, book with confidence you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here last year and was a fabulous base in New York. Hotel was beautiful, the best was huge and very comfy, the breakfast was fabulous and they even provided take out cups so you could take a cup for the road.The location was spot on and a stones throw from times quare and all the shops. A little walk to the nearest subway. If I returned to New York I would definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Maybe my expectations were high as is situated in central New York City.Had booked a deluxe room but wasn't deluxe at all...2 of the mornings breakfast was unavailable but we were offered a $25 to be credited to our credit card..This still hasn't happened...Wouldn't be in much more of a hurry to re book

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel was within walking distance to Restaurants, shopping and of course Broadway. One of things I really liked was breakfast buffet, so much select from. Subway only a few blocks down street.. Our room was spotless and a view of city at night... i would stay there again
user_name:
Judith B
Palm Coast, United States

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has ALL of the attributes that you may want! I stopped into the Fashion Bar, which is the hotel bar, and, I had a terrific time!! Drinks, food, service, and, management, ( Amanda, in the bar), were attentive, lobby and rooms, beautiful and well appointed, and, just a sublime environment! I will be back, and, am planning to entertain here!!!
user_name:
eventsbythirteen
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited Riu Plaza hotel for a long girly weekend for my daughters 18th birthday. The hotel was amazing,on entering the lobby we felt like we were in a really luxurious hotel. All staff were friendly and polite. The rooms were lovely & clean we were on the 21st floor and had great views, especially at night. We had a double bed each and the bathroom was modern and clean. Perfect for what we needed. The rooms were really warm but we like really warm so was perfect for us especially as it was so cold outside. The only reason I haven’t given 5 stars is because the weekend we were there, there was no breakfast on offer. The restaurant and bar was shut. We were refunded $25 each for breakfast but it was still inconvenient to have to go and find somewhere to get breakfast or a drink etc. Also the first night we stayed we were woken at 5am by a fire alarm, we couldn’t get back to sleep after this which made us tired for our first day in New York as we’d travelled for 15 hours the day before. Both issues were unavoidable and no fault of the hotel, just unfortunate for our stay. Which at nearly £500 for 3 nights was pretty expensive giving the lack of facilities on offer.
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
Courtneyj17
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My partner & I have just returned from 4 nights in NYC. The hotel was a fantastic location and on arrival we checked in with no issues. We stayed in room 2225 which had great views. The room wasn't massive but perfectly comfortable and enough storage for our clothes.Breakfast was included and had lots of selection.It was a lovely touch that the hotel had put a bottle of bubbly with chocolates in the room on arrival and then on my actual birthday some more chocolates...thank you. We weren't leaving until later in the day on our last day but we were able to store our bags until we were ready.Thank you for helping out first visit go smoothly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stay at hotel riu plaza for 4 nights from Monday 12th to Friday 16th February,everybody was very helpful from check in to breakfast and bar ,breakfast can be very busy in the morning ,on our second morning we went to the bar area for breakfast it was not as busy as the main breakfast area ,hotel is very central to Times Square ,hotel is very clean. rooms are serviced regularly with fresh bed linen and towels ,I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel as a short stop over for your city break to the big apple

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights... great hotel, central, easy walking distance to all we needed. Room small but comfortable, cases fitted under bed. We didn’t have a bathroom with a shower screen into the room so can’t comment on that. Breakfast lovely so many choices, can have coffee to go! Staff lovely, cocktails of the day great value before we headed off out. Everywhere clean and a great view from the 27th floor room we had. Overall very happy with hotelChoice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: If this is your first time in New York then this is a good place to stay as it's close to major tourist attractions. It's within walking distance of Rockafeller, Empire State, Times Square etc.Check in was quick and easy. We arrived at around 9pm so there were no queues. Walking past reception in the morning and afternoon looked busy most of the time but I think there are enough staff to help so you don't wait too long.We're were told on arrival (and there were notes everywhere) explaining there was an issue with breakfast but we would be compensated. For every day breakfast was unavailable we would get $25 per person. For our 2 days of no breakfast we were given $100 there and then in cash which was great because we hadn't budgeted for an extra meal. When breakfast was available it was OK, everything you'd expect from a buffet - toast, cereal, cold meats and cheese, pastries, fruit, sausage, bacon, hot & cold drinks.The room itself was great. When you visit New York for pleasure you don't spend any unnecessary time in the room. The bed was comfortable and the shower was great and you got shampoos etc. The only "problem" with the shower was it took a while to get hot but I wouldn't complain about something like that. The WiFi was great, could use it on upto 4 devices.There's is a safe in the room with a number pad so all your stuff is safe. This is refreshing as in European hotels not only do you have to pay to use the room safe but it's usually managed with a key, which I don't trust is safe.There's was enough drawer and cupboard space to put our clothes in. There's an iron and ironing board, which we didn't use so can't comment on the quality. There is a hairdryer fixed to the wall.The curtains were good and blacked out all the lights from Times Square (we were on the 24th floor with a view of Times Square). There was a lot of street noise but that didn't bother us - we're in New York, it's expected. We couldn't hear any noise from other rooms. There is a small fridge with nothing but complimentary bottled water (ie no minibar).The only issue with the room is that there is a plug socket right near the window by a table and chair, but there's no mirror there (I have hair straighteners and would have liked to have done my hair there) but there is a socket in the bathroom. There are also USB ports by the bed so you can charge your devices.We're loved our stay here and if we wanted to stay near Times Square we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good bits...beds are super comfortable and amazing views from our room on the 27th floor...spotlessly clean and sheets/towels changed everyday if you want by the lovely maids...BUT the bad bits...rooms are so hot it is difficult to sleep even with the window open and the AC does not work even though I asked reception to try and sort the heat out they never did....confusion over the breakfast refunds when the dining room flooded left us out of pocket and some of the reception staff and managers are just very patronising and unhelpful! When the breakfast returned it was just about acceptable - nothing special and I was quite underwhelmed by the lack of choice and unappetising overall look of the cooked breakfast on offer. Great location but there are better hotels in this amazing city.
user_name:
TraceyG328
Sutton Coldfield, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived around noon on Feb. 19th. Nyima, was very welcoming at the front desk. We could not check in but were told the bellman would keep our luggage. Jamil, was very friendly and assured us our luggage would be ready for us when we returned. We left and went to Becco for a wonderful lunch. Davaugn Campbell, brouht up our luggage to room 2213. He told us he had been at the Riu in Jamaica. I cannot sayenough about the staff. They were all super friendly and willing to help.The room was not huge, but was nicely appointed. I had requested a handicap roomand the bathroom was huge. The toilet was very low and even though there were handrails it was not handicap accessible. The shower was lovely, it had a large overhead shower and another hand held feature.The towels were very good quality and they had nice products, but they also had a dispenser for products that we did not use.I would suggest that they get pillows that aren't so thick. I was happy that they were not feather, but a smaller pillow would be preferable. The sheets were good quality too.We went downstairs and Jeremiah, in security said it would not be a problem to get a riser for the toilet. We walked to the Metropolitan Opera, which is a good walk, but theweather was nice. When we returned we were surprised that the riser was not in the room. We went down and Eladio at the front desk was very apologetic and he said he would try and get this resolved.When we returned there was a sign in elevator saying breakfast would not be available and the front desk would give you each a $25. voucher. on Tuesday morning. Joann, was at the front desk and greeted us and when we asked about the voucher she called over Javier Cucarella from Spain. He was wonderful and stated they were having I believe water issues in the kitchen and we would be asked to sign a waiver stating we were compensated for not getting the breakfast package we purchased. They certainly handled this in a very professional manner. We checked out Wed and Eladio asked how our stay was and asked if we did get the riser. It was nice that the staff remembered you and wanted you to return. Pedro, wasalso at the front desk and was another friendly person.Riu gets 5 stars with their staff

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked hotel via BA after comparing against several others and thinking this sounded ideal.On arrival we were greeted by helpful staff who took our cases and directed us to reception to check in, smooth check in and by time we reached our room are cases arrived also. Room size was good for NY and had 2 long beds, downside of this was we were traveling with a toddler and would have liked a cot but we improvised. We stayed in 1601 and had a view out the back of the hotel and was a double deluxe.Sadly the room was the big let down of the hotel, heater/air con was pointless room was regularly between 24-28 degrees, opening window helped cool it but wasn’t practical. Bathroom was very big although only had a shower, a bath would have easily fit but I guess they were going for modern feel.Breakfast was part of the package however at check in was informed it wasn’t available at present due to a ‘technical error’ - as part of this we were offered $25pp/per day when it wasn’t available which eased the blow. This was only the case for 3 days and when it was back on breakfast was really good and recommended.Overall the hotel is ok but seems to still be finding its feet still, given time It can only get better... my recommendations are:Fix AC - make sure rooms are comfyFamily’s - if family’s are staying make sure they’re aware of what’s available. At no point was it clear if we could have a cot or not?Overall, in its current state I would probably not stay again unless i see reviews from people showing they’ve acted on the room comfort issues.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my partner have just spent 7 nights here 18/02 - 25/02 and as much as we loved New York and will defiantly be coming back it won’t be to this hotel. The hotel itself was in a great location we walked to all the main attractions Empire State, Central Park, flat iron building ect and it never took any longer than 25 mins and the subway was a 10 minute walk away to help you along to Brooklyn bridge and the Statue of Liberty. There where bars and restaurants every corner you turned so we never went hungry for long. The hotel was clean and tidy and all the staff where welcoming, our issue was with the temperate of the room it was like a sauna. We spent the whole 7 nights sleeping with the window open which may I add did nothing to cool the room down. We weren’t the only people to experience this it seems like it’s an issue across the whole of the hotel. New York is of course the city that never sleeps and we can vouch for that as all hours of the night there are cars beeping, alarms going off and people shouting. After walking around all day the last thing we needed was to be unable to sleep as it was too hot and uncomfortable and then extremely noisy outside. There was also an issue with the restaurant facility’s when we arrived which they did compensate for however when we did finally get to use the breakfast it wasn’t anything special and the hot foods where luke warm so we wish we had just chosen to eat out every morning. The hotel was a reasonable price however we would choose to spend our money elsewhere next time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here in Feb 2018 and we left quite disappointed. We were a group of four (two couples in two rooms). This us not the cheapest hotel we've stayed in so my expectations were quite high.The location is truly fantastic, one block from Times Square. We had breakfast included and we all enjoyed the offerings - cereal, cooked, pastries, cold meats and cheese, juice and hot drinks. Very good breakfast but there is a queue for the dining room. It moves quickly at least but you are quite jammed in when you get in there. The rooms are small but I can't say this bothered us too much. The frosted glass wall between the shower and bedroom was a strange design choice. Absolutely fine when staying as a couple but causes problems when one of you wants to use the bathroom at night because you can't help but wake the other. We also hated the sliding glass door as the gap means you can see the other person on the toilet. You can't control the temperature in the room so the first night we were unbearably hot (it hit something like 35degreesC). If you open the window, you can't sleep because it is so noisy outside (not the hotels fault). The thermostat is completely pointless and I've never known a hotel where you can't turn on the AC in your room. We got round this by leaving the window open all day when we went out and closing at night. I wouldn't say the room decor is my favourite - it is quite cold and almost clinical. I personally didn't find the bed all that comfortable but my Husband had no complaints. The fire alarm went off one morning with overhead announcements telling us it was a false alarm and one half of the breakfast dining area flooded another day. Overall, an ok experience but we would not stay here again. The location is great but it isn't the only hotel around Times Square. We loved New York but not the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: At least 8 restaurants within one block. Everything from Dunkin Donuts across the street to several medium priced $$ Italian, Brazilian and French restaurants. Sight seeing double decker buses pick up passengers across street. Many Broadway shows within easy walking distance. Taxi to Grand Central station $9; to 9-11 museum $20; to The Met Museum $14.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed as a family of five in two deluxe rooms one two king bed, one two king bed plus sofa bed. Four nights in February our first family trip to New York.We found staff fairly friendly but the facilities lacking.Breakfast was an important part of why we booked this hotel - one easy meal that the children would fill up on.We didn't expect to spend a lot of time on our first morning in New York having to find somewhere for breakfast because the facility was inexplicably closed. It was much easier once we'd found our feet but on our first day with no direction except queue after midday and we'll compensate you on a daily basis.The waver the hotel asked us to sign was bizarre and I did ask to amend it to specify the £25 compensation was specifically for the lack of breakfast and not every eventuality as was worded.The deluxe king twin room, on 19th floor, I stayed in with our 7 year old daughter was 27+ degrees at night. Several trips to reception, over two days, and a phone call resulted in an engineer visiting and saying that the heating was fine and they don't have air conditioning working in winter. Opening the window did bring the temperature down to about 24 at best, but it was incredibly noisy with sirens 24/ 7 so a complex game of be too hot to sleep or it be too loud. The other room we had as a family on the 19th floor was a far more even temperature around 22 degrees. I found it frustrating to have to find somewhere to eat and have to wait around for an engineer. These are not things you expect to do on holiday.The rooms ensuite had a glass wall which formed the back wall of the shower. This ment during the night if anyone went to the loo and turned the light on the whole room bedroom lit up. Could really do with a curtain.The staff were generally friendly but this didn't compensate for lack of facilities. On the penultimate morning we wanted to find the concierge to arrange transport back to the airport but they weren't to be found. We asked at reception but they directed us back to the not to be found concierge. Later in the day I went back to a receptionist and they did help me call a firm i'd found online - so it was a bit hit and miss with help depending on who was on the desk.On check out we left bags with staff in the bag room. We were a little shocked on our return to find the reception a couple of hours later to find the area littered with suitcases in a completely unsecure manner., just posts and tape around them. It took quite a while to find someone to find our bags and quite a while for our bags to be found.A bit too hit and miss for a large chain 4* hotel.We booked a package through British Airways and will be feeding back that we really feel this isn't brand standard. Not dire, just not 4* service, facilities or price.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is very clean with friendly staff. Only drawback is that as the hotel is so big the lobby and breakfast rooms can seem a bit hectic and on the go all the time. The location is great for time square, but we felt that if we went again we would stay towards lower Manhattan where things are a bit more chilled out. I usually like to get breakfast included but this was unavailable for some of our stay so we sampled eating both in and out of the hotel. I would advise on saving some money and finding breakfast in one of the many local excellent bakeries and cafes who also do really good coffee (Amy’s bread, & along edge of Bryant Park) and will save you $25 dollars between two of you (rather than 50 for 2 at hotel) I guess this would apply to many of the hotels

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Full buffet breakfast included with our stay. Excellent selection of cereals, pastries, eggs, bacon, pancakes, fruit, cheese and cold meats as well as juice, tea and coffee. staff were very friendly and helpful at this RIU property in the heart of NYC. We stayed 3 in our room in 2 queen beds and a pullout with lots of space. Far enough from Times Square to be quiet but a quick walk to the theatre and all the action.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed in this hotel in January. The hotel is just few minutes (about 200-300 meters) away from Time Square. View from room is alright. I would not pay extra for it. Breakfast was included in my booking and it was worth it. Rooms were very very very tiny. I believe that is very common in new york. My main issue is no space to keep luggage. I am sure people who visit new york carries luggage. If you are travelling with family, there will be no room for third bag. Bathroom door was funny !! Bathroom size was reasonably large, perhaps could have been smaller to create more room space. People in reception were good but don't expect much service. Room temperature was difficult to control without opening window.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Riu Plaza 12-15 February 2018. Taxi from JFK cost around $70 including tip. Arrived to be greeted by the lovely doorman who showed us inside and directed us to reception. Booking in was very easy, paid $100 on my credit card which was held until I checked out, the cost charged was facility fee of around $70. Room was spacious, clean and we had a great view from room 1411. Shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, soap, hair dryer, iron, ironing board and safe were all included in the room. There is also a large tv with many channels to choose from should you have tone to turn it on! Staff were helpful throughout the stay and housekeeping left me a little message each day thanking me for their tip. Breakfast was included with the cost of the hotel, a great variety, from cereal to cooked breakfast, pastries to fresh fruit. The grab and go option was great also for those with a busy itinerary that couldn’t wait around to eat. The queue for breakfast was long each morning unless you timed it well (0700-0730 hrs no line to wait in but after that until around 0900 hrs was very busy)however the staff were very efficient and got you seated as quickly as they could. I think the longest we waited in line was around 15 minutes. The location of the hotel was perfect, turn left out of the hotel and keep walking for around 5 minutes and you find yourself in the heart of Times Square. You are in the middle of theatre district with some great shows only a few minutes walk away from Hamilton (if you are lucky enough to be able to get tickets!) to Kinky Boots to Frozen! There’s something for everyone. You have a variety of restaurants and bars in your doorstep as well as shops, there’s even a Carlo’s Cake Shop down the road from the famous Cake Boss show! A must to visit if you love cake! All in all a great hotel to stay at when visiting New York. We only encountered one issue during the stay and that was on our last day when a burst water pipe meant that breakfast was cancelled, however we were reimbursed for this and because there are so many restaurants in the area you could easily pick up breakfast elsewhere. To get around the city I’d recommend Top View bus hopper, there are reps outside the hotel who can sell you tickets, we got 3 days for the price of 2 so do haggle with the reps! $29 for 1 day and $59 for 2, we got 3 days for this price. The downtown bus leaves from across the hotel each day from 0800 hrs and the uptown tour bus stop is just up the street! With the 2 day ticket you get free ticket to NY City Museum, a night time tour (this isn’t a hop on hop off but a must do even just to see the beautiful Manhattan skyline at night), a bronx tour and a Brooklyn tour as well as a boat ride around the Statue of Liberty! Well worth the money!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a prime location for sightseeing. We were on the 22nd floor overlooking the Main Street. A little noisy in the night but you are. In New York. The room itself was clean and adequate pity no kettle to make a drink though. The room was cleaned daily. We had booked breakfast for the4 days we were there, unfortunately there was a problem in the dining room and bar so we had to go out for breakfast and hot drinks..people were going out to get McDonalds and brining them back. Luckly there was a lovely Italian restaurant across the road the brakfast was wonderful. We would have liked to eat in the dining room in the evening and to try their advertised cocktails but never got a chance. We were reimbursed for the breakfast but it has put us off.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Firstly, I have to say that this hotel is perfectly situated in NYC, a few steps away from Times Square/Broadway/restaurants and a few steps more finds several subway's which links you up to everything. We emailed ahead as it was a special occasion for the in-laws and the hotel provided a few nice touches in the room which was hugely appreciated and kicked off their first stay in NYC perfectly.The check in was great, really helpful and very professional.The room we were allocated on 23rd floor was compact, far smaller than we had previously experienced in NYC, but we are only there to sleep so how much room do you really need. The issue with the room was not the size it was the unbearable heat! No matter what we did we could not get the heat down so we had to resort to having the window open which, of course, just meant that we were subjected to the non-stop sirens and noises that accompany life in NYC. We asked the reception about air con and they just said it wasn't available! So essentially we did not sleep for the 5 nights of our stay. This was further impacted by the incident remarked on in an earlier post - alarm goes off at stupid o'clock followed by several tannoy instructions advising us that this is possibly a false alarm followed by no follow up message to say that it was safe!Like most of the people staying here at this time, we were on a B&B basis and for three of our five nights this was absolutely fine - in fact the breakfast was excellent. Always a queue but the standard of the produce was worth waiting for.Until the 4th day when we were greeted by signs in the lifts to say that due to a technical incident they would be unable to provide breakfast but that if we went to reception after 1200 that day we would be given $25 per person per day. There were lots of people queuing at reception to complain, but these things happen.We were told by one member of staff it was electrical and another it was water and then by a duty manager that the hotel had taken the steps to stop offering breakfasts due to health and safety, but then we went outside to find that they had a bright yellow notice attached to the restaurant door saying that the facility had been closed by order of the Commissioner of Health and Mental Hygiene!When we went back later to collect our compensation, we were met with a rather surly and aggressive operative from behind the counter who said that we wouldn't be getting any compensation until check out. This was despite the notices from earlier that were actually still all over the hotel. I complained and asked to speak to the manager and it was agreed that we would get our compensation LESS the resort fee for the whole of our stay!Furthermore we were told that we would only get the compensation if we signed an indemnity to say that we would not be able to make further claim on the hotel. This is fine but indemnity against what issue - water/electrical or the hygiene notice posted at the front of the hotel?? So we signed, but caveated it to reflect what we had been told by the hotel.All in all found this hotel and its management to be disingenuous and untrustworthy, all fur coat and no undergarments. Problems happen, but it is how you deal, communicate and resolve the issues that marks the class of an establishment and they showed no class at all.There are far too many good hotels out there to waste your money here.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for four days to visit the city. We have no major complaints! The room was clean, the breakfast buffet was..well.. what one would expect at a hotel breakfast buffet. Our stay was overall enjoyable. Our room was on the 25th floor with a view. The view is quite nice considering the hotel’s location is so close to Times Square. One slight criticism we have is that it was difficult to control the temperature of our room as it was quite warm even for the dead of winter. It still wasn’t a big enough issue to bring to the staff’s attention but it was certainly noticeable. Ultimately, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an enjoyable, and convenient stay near Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in February 2018 and had a great stay, we had a lovely room on the 27th floor with a fantastic view of the city, the room was small but perfect for a base and very modern and clean, we loved the view at night.The hotel is perfect for exploring, the top view tour buses which I also recommend as a way of getting around Manhattan stop just up the road, it's also about 5 blocks from Central Park, a 5 minute walk to Times Square and easy access to all of mid Manhattan.We were up early every morning and down for breakfast at 7 when it was already getting busy, breakfast was buffet style and very good with something for everybody, full cooked, continental, cereal, fruit etc and all very good quality.We were most impressed with the bar and restaurant at night, it's very nice with floor to ceiling windows looking out onto a church. New York is very expensive for drinks around $15 for a cocktail so it was a nice surprise to find the bar has happy hour all night every night with classic cocktails and wine at $7 - $8.We also had a meal in the restaurant which was very very nice and busy with a good atmosphere.At the end of our stay as we were leaving for the airport we asked the concierge if he could get us a cab, he asked us to wait for a moment and got us one of the hotel's new black Escalades a flat fee of $75 to JFK only slightly more that a grubby yellow cab!Thoroughly recommend Riu Plaza.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights in Feb. Rooms small but standard for NYC. 5 mins walk to the middle of Times Square with major subway stations and Big Bus departure point.Breakfast good with great coffee machines but decor felt like a canteen with cheap plastic chairs and tables. Breakfast extremely busy 8am onwards. Good mix of people, mainly European. Lots of teenagers, probably on school trips but not any trouble at all. As with any city centre hotel, rooms can be quite noisy so take ear plugs. Also curtains very thin so if it was summer, would be awake very early. All in all, good value for money with nice staff and nice bar/lounge with reasonably priced drinks.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I,m sad to write this experiece what me and my huspend has in Riu time square new york.Why sad becouse we have had use riu hotels before and those experiece was great.This hotel was not good.Everything works yes, but hotels walls was paper and every voices come in.Our room was 10 floor so I cant say if higer was better ,but we cant sleep at all.When people comes back in their room in the evening you wake up that.there is lot of cars in New York so car noice come in the room like the car would be in your living room.So sorry, I can recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of the hotel is perfect - right on restaurant row and a 2 minute walk from times square.We arrived at 14:50 but the strict hotel policy which was firmly bought to our attention as we had to wait until 15:00pm to check - which I understand but I thought they would be a little more welcoming especially at the price that we paid to stay at the hotel.Check in was quick, once it got to 15:00pm and the room had great views, however... the first night our thermostat did not work properly when we tried to reduce the temperature it was still blowing out 28-29 Celsius which is far too warm and uncomfortable.We called a number of times to reception who said they would be sending an engineer to our room but nobody arrived. The second night was exactly the same and when an engineer did eventually turn up, all he could suggest was that we open the window. Third night it was all fixed, as if it was by magic.The third night had some other issues, a fire alarm went off at 05:30am and continued for at least 20 minutes. Over the tannoy we were advised to stay in our room which we did for the next 30 minutes. At no point did the hotel let us know that it was ok to resume normal action or give us an update of the situation which I thought was abit naughty.Finally, on day 2 (after specifically choosing this hotel as it included breakfast and paying extra for breakfast) we were informed that there was an issue in the kitchen with the pipes and they would not be serving breakfast for the rest of our stay. They compensated by giving us a refund of $25pp per day however, as future holidaymakers heading to times square will quickly realize - breakfast at times square comes to more then $25 pp as it is a very expensive city.Overall, if RIU PLAZA can sort out the thermostat issue and compensate better for the breakfast issues this would be a great hotel but in my honest opinion, with the issues above this can only be rated as 'average'.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We are at this hotel right now and shocked that it’s even rated 4 stars. From the moment we checked in and they let us know that breakfast was cancelled for emergency reasons to getting up to our room and seeing that the girl at the front desk who told us we had a great city view meant looking into the windows of a building directly across the street to finding out the thermostat didn’t work so we stayed freezing in a room that was 60 degrees. They made it right by moving us into another junior suite this morning with an actual city view that also has a broken thermostat and it is 85 degrees and we are sweating so much, but they can’t even bring us cold waters and an ice bucket that they promised an hour ago. The engineer as well as several front desk staff told us they know about this issue. So in words, this hotel is okay lying to their guests and hoping they either don’t notice or complain. I’m waiting to talk to the manager tomorrow and the general manager is not here to rectify this situation immediately. But we want our money back in full that they charged my credit card long before we came to stay here, so we can stay the rest of our trip at another hotel that actually takes care of their guests and doesn’t trick them into staying here knowing all the issues it has. They should let guests know and let them decide whether they want to stay here or not given these problems. I, for one, would’ve stayed at another hotel from the beginning. There are many more issues here as well, but I’m tired of filling out forms and dealing with customer service. I’m just giving a heads up to future travelers, don’t stay here!! Especially not in Junior Suites 2616 if you don’t want to freeze in cold weather, or in 2811 if you don’t want to sweat like you’re in a sauna. This trip has turned me off to ever staying in any Riu resorts anywhere in the world and we travel all over.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Exactly what you are after in a hotel. Good location for accessibility to explore, cleanliness... the hotel was immaculate, good breakfast & decent service, good WiFi. No complaints whatsoever. When you are in NYC you should be out exploring, the hotel is just somewhere to rest your head! Only compliant is the heating controls in the room didn’t work so it was extremely hot!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here mid February as a group of 4 girls. The room was big enough for us, with 2 double beds, a sofa and a tv! The bathroom was a very good size, slightly awkward frosted glass panel separating the shower from the main area, but we coped! Check in was quick, we queued a while for checkout but as we had extended check out until 3pm, we queued with all those arriving! The only issue was breakfast, for 2 of our 5 day stay there were technical difficulties resulting in no breakfast facility! The hotel was more the generous, offering $25 per person per day it was broken! So overall not a big issue and when we did have breakfast there was an excellent selection of cooked breakfast and continental, with lots of fresh fruit! The location was perfect, only 2 blocks away from Times Square and all the main tourist attractions, very close to the Broadway shows and hundreds of restaurants! The staff were all very friendly and more than happy to help in any way!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is perfect if you want to stay in the Times Square broadway location. Hotel is very modern and rooms were a good size for New York. Unfortunately the 3 nights we were there there was an issue and couldn’t provide the complimentary breakfast. However I’m always a believer in ‘things happen’ it’s not what happens but how a company deals with it. This hotel did a great job addressing the situation by providing $25 per person per night to compensate for no breakfast. I was very impressed with how they handled the situation. Beautiful hotel in a great location!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having stayed in RIU in Mexico this hotel was very diffrent as this is a city hotel. Rooms are small but adequate for a couple. Bathroom which only has a shower was nice as the shower was hot and powerful. Bar area very nice and reasonable prices for its location.Breakfast which was part of our deal can be very busy as at 7am there was already a line of people waiting to go in. This does go down very quick so not a problem for us. The breakfast itself bearing in mind we were at front end of the line it always seemed cold by the time you got your table.Last couple of days they had a problem which out of their control as they was not serving breakfast for which they gave us a refund. Also the bar was closed last 2 nights with i guess the same problem also. This was not a problem as the times square diner around the corner was resonable and very large portions.The staff had some friendly and some quite miserably but we did not have to speak to them during our 5 night visit.The rooms were alwas warm to hot which can affect your sleep. Other than the breakfast being cold mist times i would stay there again as its very modern and very very clean.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here at the beginning of February. Check in was quick and efficient, we were on the 6th floor, so although it didn’t have the views that you would get from higher floor rooms, it was clean, comfortable and quiet. Room was cleaned daily, with fresh towels and bed linen changed when you requested.We couldn’t fault the breakfast, although at times very busy, there was always plenty of choice and a 4 hour window to have breakfast too.The hotel is in a great location, just one block from busy Times Square, near to all the theatres and on the tour bus route too. NYC is also so easy to walk around so the hotel is nearby for other attractions too, with Central Park about 30 minutes walk away.We really enjoyed our stay in NY and loved the comforts of the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Chose this hotel due to its reviews on trip advisor , we stayed from the 11th-15th Feb Can’t fault this hotel , check in was quick and simple Rooms were ideal. Couldn’t hear the traffic much, but it is New York so just go with it , the breakfast was nice and loads of choice , a few queues but didn’t have to wait long, very close to Times Square and the subway , we walked most of the time as most of the tourists spots are close together , saw a show on Broadway which was enjoyable and lots of choice of restaurants , loved NYC, defo worth another visit

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here with friends for 5 nights. Rooms were very comfortable, relatively spacious (by Manhattan standards!) and quiet and it was great to be able to open the window. Lobby bar had a good atmosphere and reasonably priced. My main gripe was with breakfast - huge lines, highly congested at times around the lifts which made them difficult to access, fruit selection seemed to run out and not be replenished often enough (on Sunday we had great choice; on Monday it was melon only) and the hot food wasn’t very hot at all (this was just as much the case at 7am as at 9am. Staff at reception and in bar and restaurant were generally very pleasant and helpful. However, we did ask one night about taxis and were convinced by the concierge that it would be so much cheaper for him to book a car than it would be to hail two yellow cabs (there were 6 of us). The car over to our restaurant that he arranged for us cost $55; the two cabs back that we sorted ourselves cost $20 in total - hmmmm! If they could manage their breakfast arrangements just a bit better, I’d have given 5 stars! But I’d be happy to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in a pivotal spot of New York in the vicinity to many touristic attraction and restaurants. The room are spacious and relatively clean with the city view. They have a fantastic gym at teh 15th floor. There are times of day that elevators are quite congested with guests and the wait is long.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here as a family for 5 nights in a 2 double bedded room. Each day the room was cleaned promptly with fresh towels and water topped up some days too; bathroom was very clean and bed comfy. It was nice to open the window as the room was hot. Breakfast was a great addition, even if the queues were long - perhaps as so popular to have included in NYC. We loved the location as one block from the noise of Times Square yet near to the residential area and Hells Kitchen restaurants. I used the gym which had modern equipment, unfortunately closed for the last 2 days, but we understood why. Would visit again and recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Easy check-in and the front desk facilitated our request for upper floor and quiet room, so yay! Small, but stylish room, comfy bed and thank goodness, a window that opened, since we were quite warm and unable to make temp control work for us. Thought it would settle to requested temp while we were at our evening function, but it didn't. Other than that, we were happy with the room and breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a fantastic place to stay. Ultra modern hotel with great facilities. Breakfast was included with our package booked through British Airways. Very central location great centre to explore Manhattan from. Our room was very well appointed, clean & one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. The hotel staff were great very friendly & helpful. Would most certainly recommend this hotel & will definitely use it myself again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A great hotel in a perfect location ,rooms compact but efficient and kept really clean and tidy.Breakfast was plentiful but better taken in the lobby restaurant.The door bar within the hotel serves a perfect coffee on a cold winters afternoon ,all in all a great stay thank you

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect location, perfect staff, evrything was great, recomend for stay in the center of new york.Breackfast was good, with lots of options, diner was also great, would return there for sure.recomend

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: ideally placed for visiting New York rooms are small but perfectly adequate.Enough space for 2 people only lacked a kettle.Breakfast is fantastic but very, very busy so get there by 9am or face very long queues out of the door!Oddly very little hotel information in the rooms or tourist info at the reception.Late room check out is expensive.Our room was on the third floor and very quiet. Good black out curtains.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was my first trip to NYC and this hotel was great! Very clean and modern and the location was close to everything. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was a perfect way to start the day. The only thing I would change is the frosted glass in the shower. While it's not "see-through" you can definitely see the silouette of the person showering, and allows for the bathroom light to be seen in the sleeping area. Not ideal, but we made it work. Overall this hotel was a great value for the money and I would definitely stay here again the next time I'm in NYC!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I had an awesome days at Riu NY. The staff was just amazing, prefect breakfast and a very nice room. I will definitely recommend to my friends to stay there and I will be back for sure! Just amazing !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visit NYC several times a year, and we have stayed in many hotels in the Times Square theatre district. I think from now on, we will always select the Riu. Here are the reasons. The location is right on the corner of Restaurant Row. If you come to the city to enjoy dining, this is an ideal location. You are also in easy walking distance to all of the Broadway theatres. The rooms are small but very comfortable and immaculately clean. The shower was large and great. We had plenty of fluffy towels. There is a mini-fridge which is also very nice. The lobby bar was wonderful, and the free buffet breakfast is served in both the restaurant and the Fashions bar/restaurant. In addition there's a gym fitness center. I also liked having the option to crack a window in the room, which is seldom the case in a brand new hotel. It was a warmer than average February weekend, so it was great to be able to have a bit of fresh air. We were able to get an amazing price for this perfect hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 days, and from the minute we entered the hotel until the minute we left our whole party enjoyed every minute.Staff on checking in were very helpful. Foyer and reception area very clean and décor very nice. Rooms were spotlessly clean. Fashion bar was very relaxing, and drinks not badly priced, considering the location.Breakfast in the morning was excellent, with plenty of choice for the fussiest of eaters.All the staff we encountered in the hotel were very polite and helpful.Ideally located in the heart of Manhattan, within walking distance of most of the sights and with easy access to public transport if needed.We had three adjacent rooms on the third floor, and there was very slight noise from the traffic outside with the windows and curtains closed. All six of us slept extremely well every night in very comfortable baeds.If I ever go back to NYC, this would be top of my list of hotels to stay at as it was very affordable compared with a lot of the other hotels I looked at, and as breakfast was included it was even better value.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I took my husband here for his birthday. We loved it. The decor of the hotel was beautiful. We were on the 30th floor. The room was small but fantastic, loved the layout and the bathroom was totally clean and nicely set up. The view was awesome of course. Breakfast was ok wasn't to keen the way they did the eggs. We also had a few drinks at the Fashion bar. Would definitely go back again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: we loved this hotel, friendly, helpful staff, excellent food, more breakfast than we could eatrooms small but comfy, easy walking distance to times square and all the attractions, Very noisy at times but thats new york !!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel , great location for Rockefeller centre, Macy's , theatre, restaurants ,Central Park . Great buffet breakfast something for everyone . Rooms clean comfy beds sightseeing bus right outside door .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel, we were so pleased with.We booked this and had no idea how close we were to times square.We were so glad we booked this hotel.It was perfect for what we needed we stayed here 8 nights and added on breakfast, even though we didn't eat it every day, we had it as an option.,This hotel was clean, friendly and really easy to get to and from.Recommend anyone that wants a central base hotel.We had such an amazing view we were on 46th street corner.We will probably use Riu hotels in the future when we go aboard.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Thought this might be a little to business like to enjoy a family holiday but was wrong to assume this. Stayed for a week on the 15th floor and right from the first day all the staff were great. Always willing to help and guid you round the big apple. Rooms wer clean and a good size with clean bathroom. Breakfast was clean with great selection. The location is central in time square and a 2 minute walk from everything

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel, great view and perfect location, 5 min walk from timesquare, 10min to Rockefeller and Madison square gardens, 15 to 20 min to central park and most importantly 5 min to Carlos Bakery!! we stayed here 4 days and walked practically everywhere. You have got a 24hr dunkin dounuts on the street opposite the hotel and various other food carts and pizza places open untill fairly late.Breakfast was good with the usual variety (pastries, eggs, bacon, cakes, cereal etc) but you are in New York so no point getting breakfast at hotel! Venture out you have got 3 amazing diners close by and various other places to eat. Hotel rooms are average size for 2 people but if you are travelling with millions of cases then no hotel room in New York will ever be big enough! Room temperature was hot at times but we fixed it by opening our 25th floor window :) Oh and if you are worried about the reviews regarding the glass wall between the bathroom and the room being see through... it's Not! Unless you press your butt against it.. I tested this lol

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is fabulous! My daughter and I had a great stay over the MLK weekend.The customer service was awesome for our entire stay from check in through check out. My daughter forgot her tooth brush and a dental kit was sent immediately. I requested an additional blanket and that was prompt as well with an apology for the disturbance (I had forgotten that I had the do not disturb sign out for the next morning already). The room size was spacious by NYC standards and the room was cleaned very well everyday. I usually leave a hair ball in the sink or shower as my check that cleaning is occurring and the cleaning crew passed the test. There was a small frig in our room and there were bottles of water.Our stay included breakfast (normally $19.99) and it was a very large and varied spread including American and Eurpoean style selections for food and drink. I would suggest going early even though the dining area is very large it did fill up at peak times.There were signs for drinks in the hotel bar (I didn't go), but the pricing was very reasonable by either NYC or Indianapolis standards.We never had a problem with the wifi. We did not use the fitness facilities, but they were on site.The location was great for our needs. It was a few blocks walk to Times Square and there are a lot of restaurants and theaters that are easily walkable. We flew in from EWR and the Newark Airport Express ($16 OW/ $28 RT;30 minute ride) will drop you off at the Port Authority Bus Station which is a few blocks away and very walkable with luggage on wheels.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were happy with this hotel. The room we stayed in felt brand new, modern and nicely equipped. The staff were all very pleasant. It's a great location to see a play, have a nice place to eat and if you want - stroll Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here when we went to see Springsteen on Broadway, what a great location!! The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are not huge but they are stylish and clean. Loved the free breakfast the next morning!! Great coffee!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter & I stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate her 18th birthday, I have got no complaints what so ever the hotel is great and in a great location easy access for everything wether on foot or using the subway. We had a room on the 20th floor which had some fabulous views, the room was very clean a bit on the small side but not really a problem as we only used it to sleep in. The breakfast was a great way to start the day always very busy but plenty of choice. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is relatively new (2 years) and offers good room rates during winter months. Rooms are pretty basic with few amenities. A “resort fee” is added which is basically a fee for internet service. The advertised bottled water never materialized. Breakfast was included however most of the breakfast offering was sub-standard. The hotel’s interior spaces are cheaply designed and already showing age and wear and tear. With such a cheap price one can’t complain too much. Near all the Broadway theatres and Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: All I can say is thank God for Al!!! (the maintenance guy)My husband wasn't feeling well so all we wanted to do was go back to our room and relaxe until the next morning..Well, that was not an option because the heat wasn't working.. we called downstairs to the front desk and let them know there was an issue with the temperature control so we wanted to know if we could change our room..Now, our original room was on the 28th floor with a beautiful view.. Just amazing so, no complaints at all. As a matter of fact, we were so impressed that we started looking into staying at the Aruba location because we saw it and other locations throughout our travels. Long story short, whem I called downstairs, I was told they could only switch us to a room on the 8th floor but could not guarantee a good view.So now my husband is coughing and sneezing more then he was earlier today because we're in a cold room that we paid to be comfortable in.30-45mins later and after Al changed the filter and fixed the heat and hot water, my husband is sicker and does not have the strength to move to another room.Pissed cannot describe how I feel.
user_name:
Tears26
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: There are no words to tell about this beautiful hotel!!!!!!!! First time in New York, we wanted something special for our honeymoon!!!!!! So due to this event, our room was on the 27th floor (thank you so much for this) !!!!!!! The view was so stunning, we didn't want to leave the room!!!!! When we first got into the room, a champagne, chocolates and a congrats card were waiting for us!!! So so so nice!!!!!!!!!! Rooms Super cleaned every day!!! Breakfast delicious and fresh, with plenty of choices which were so tasty, food and drinks also !!!!!! Room very modern and beautiful, with big TV, big and relaxing bed, and a nice, wide bathroom also!!! The position of this hotel is superb.. In the heart of Times Square, so close to everything, subway, shops... Last but not least, this hotel has a unique staff.... So kind, so friendly, they were smiling aaaaall the time, and ready to help you whenever need it!!!! Keep going guys, you're the best ever!!! I believe that the photos will help you understand why we fell in love with this hotel, and looking forward to coming again!!!!!! We are so thankful to each one of you!!!! Really really thanks for everything... G&I

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Took a cab from JFK, which took around 1 hour. Arrived at hotel around 2pm and was told room wouldn't be ready til 3pm, so we left bags and went for a wander. Lovely bright reception area which gets v crowded, lifts can take some time. Room was Deluxe double - there want a great deal of space but for a 3 nighter, we were fine. Great views from the 28th floor room. They leave water in the fridge every other day....and you'll need it because this hotels ehat is off the scale. Even putting a/c on,it makes no difference. We had to leave window open at night as it was so uncomfortable, but then all you hear all night are the sirens. The bed is really comfortable but we didn't sleep well. Breakfast is mass produced but fine, we just preferred to go out. Loved the juice bar though. Fantastic location just off Times Square and staff are really friendly, but due to heat in hotel generally, we wouldn't return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just returned from a 5 day stay for my partner's 50th birthdayWe enjoy exploring and shopping so the Riu is perfectly placed around the corner from Times Square and BroadwayWe booked the flight/hotel package with BA from Heathrow for only £615 ea Breakfast is plentiful and varied so always go for the b+b option as it'll save a good deal They also provide takeaway coffee cups to fill and take out or back to your roomAlso go 1 avenue over to 9th rather than 5th 6th or 7th for much cheaper and more varied restaurants(A tip from a friend)Don't be afraid to use the subway to get around The riu is on 47th st so we walked to the port authority terminal on 42nd street and got a metro card which you load up using cash or card We used the same card for both of us Its 2.75 dollars ea for any one way trip We went right down to the 9/11 memorial and the free Statten island ferry to see the Statue of liberty then all the way back up to Central park and the Metropolitan museumAlso at the port authority terminal on the right as you walk in you can purchase your tickets and travel to Woodbury Common Definately worth the 40 dollars each Loads of designer outlets I had 5 Ralph Lauren shirts for under £100 and my partner had some lovely handbags less than half the price North face jackets and Superdry stuff too plus it's a nice hour and 20 mins drive outside the cityTry and purchase Broadway tickets or other attractions from Groupon Wowcher etc before you go for extra savingsOverall fabulous hotel great city Take comfortable shoes as your legs and feet will kill at the end of the dayEmail the hotel to ask for a high floor There are 28 floors and we were on the 27th so we had amazing views toward Times Square

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Rui Plaza for 5 nights from the 21st to 26th January,as soon as we arrived it was the wow factor,it is a beautiful hotel.We arrived early,but we were able to leave our luggage in the storage room and go for a wonder and some lunch,we got back to the hotel at 13.30 and our room was ready,check in was quick and easy,they put a $100 security fee against your credit card,but if there is no damage then you get that refunded back to your card.The room was lovely,we asked for a lower floor and that's what we got,in the room there was a mini fridge with a complimentary bottle of water every other day,an iron and board,safe,plenty of storage for clothes,complimentary toiletries and tv,there is no coffee/tea making facilities,but there is a grab and go coffee shop that opens at 7am,or just take a travel kettle like we did,breakfast was yummy and plentiful and was from 7 am to 11am.opposite the hotel there is a dunkin donuts and a pizza place that has coffee also and they are open 24hrs.the king size bed was very comfortable,and a good sized shower,the bathroom also had a hair dryer.Nothing was to much trouble and the staff were very friendly,I would highly recommend this hotel which was just a 2 minuets stroll away,and Central Park was about a 20 minuets walk,we will definitely stay here when we go back to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel & very attentive staff.Rooms were clean & comfortable & cleaned daily.Breakfast at 7am is a bit late for some & the bar opening at 16.00 can be a bind but the hotel is in an excellent location so no real problem to pop out.Would definitely recommend & stay again, as with all the Riu chain of hotels that I’ve stayed all over the world they are clean & well run!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
