review_body: This hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan, Times Square is a 2 minute walk away. New and modern hotel, rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. Beds were perfect. Staff is very helpfull and friendly. Check-in went smooth, room was ready (at 1 pm). Breakfast is very good, large choice of eggs, bread, cereal, fresh fruits etc. We really enjoyed our stay and would definately go there again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for four nights. Room was small but clean. No kettle in room so took a travel kettle. Powerful hairdryer in bathroom.Lack of plug sockets was a bit of an issue.Fridge in room was handy. Two bottles of water appeared in their one day.Breakfast was okay. A small queue each morning. Was quite greasy by fresh fruit was available.Not much info in hotel on places to visit and reception was not very helpful.Drinks very expensive in hotel.Location was good.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I really couldn’t fault this hotel it was perfect for our needs. The staff were really friendly and accommodating. This was our first holiday abroad without our children and we loved it. The hotel is in such a great location close to theatres and great restaurants!! Thank you Riu Plaza for your warm welcome and excellent hospitality

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here January 18, it was our first trip to New York, we found this hotel just perfect! Hotel was in a great location within walking distance of Times Square! There was an excellent choice for breakfast, even covering gluten free options for myself! If you want gluten free bread just ask a waiter and it was brought out hot! Hotel was very clean and staff all helpful! We booked a shuttle through the hotel to jfk, and ended up with a limo, great little treat to end our holiday!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very close to the hell's kitchen area, so good food all within walking distances. The Times Square is just around the corner as well, so it's very strategic.The hotel itself is new and spotless. I got the room on the 4th floor, but surprisingly I don't hear much noise once I close the window. The room and the bathroom are super clean, the overall hotel is also clean and modern.Keep in mind that the room size is small, which is typical for a hotel in Manhattan, so if you travel with a lot of luggage, just keep that in mind and be prepared to keep things packed.There is a restaurant in the hotel and I got breakfast as part of the bookings, and I can say the breakfast was OK.Overall, I think this would be a good hotel to choose if you thinking about somewhere close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel lovely, from check in to departure could not have been any nicer ,breakfast has everything you'd need ,rooms lovely and modern and cozy!!!,close to everything ,we even got a limo to the airport run by hotel for same price as taxi as there was 4 of us a great end to a fab stay in new york(it's very cold in January so bring the woolies)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good hotel just a 3 minute walk from Times Square.We were on the 21st floor overlooking 8th Avenue. There was some traffic noise but not so bad that it disturbed our sleep. I’m sure if you had a room at the back ithere would be no noise.Breakfast was busy but a great spread.All reception staff that we came into contact with were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent a week in New York City and found this hotel through a website.What a pleasant surprise! It was clean, modern, had a great vibe, a wonderfulbreakfast buffet was included in our plan and the location was super. We were neara subway and we used the subways extensively to get to all the places we hadmapped out to visit. Check-in and check-out were super easy and we were justhappy we chose this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stay in a family suite, very comfortable we have a little fridge and the most remarkable thing was the location very good breakfast and you have the option for dinner , simple but if is very busy outside you have the restaurant just in the lobby

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel,breakfast is good at this hotel everything from English breakfast to continental the choice is yours,really handy for time square and all theatres,would highly recommended this hotel to anyone,we will definitely visit this hotel again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited this Hotel and stayed for 4 nights. Was a great hotel and central to everything. Breakfast was fantastic with both hot and cold food with take out drinks if wanted. Would highly recommend this hotel as clean and room cleaned daily. Will be coming here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Rui Plaza Times Square for 4 days, to party for my friends' 50th birthday the hotel is perfectly located to explore the wonderful sights of New York. The hotel is bijoux and comfortable, ideal for resting a weary head after long and hectic days. The breakfast is plentiful and decent, there is an onsite bar and gym. The rooms are fine...limited storage space but an iron, hairdryer and toiletries. The staff weren't overly friendly but our stay was wonderful nonetheless.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I visited NY with my mom. RIU was so good that we already booked another 2 nights in RIU Miami beach. The hotel is very new, modern and clean! The service is great, we got all we asked for very fast and the staff always smile.We will come back for sure in the 3rd time:)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is right in the heart of the theater district, and a short walking distance to Tiimes Square and Rockefeller Center. The fact that I loved where we were helped to make up for the fact that the room was the size of a large closet. There was barely enough room to have my bag on the floor while opened, offered no room service, and the breakfast included most often provided a line so long it was not worth it. For the price and locations it is great, but not my top choice in New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I feel very bad about writing this review. I originally thought this was a nice hotel at a good location until the following happened. My sister and her husband came to NYC from Munich, Germany for the first time to celebrate my sister's birthday 2 weeks ago. I decided to fly up from Austin, TX, where I live and meet with them. We booked 2 separate rooms at the hotel. When we arrived at about 1 PM on January 9th, only their room was ready, which was a little disappointing for me, but I decided to leave my luggage at my sister's room while we went sightseeing. Before we left, I asked to use the bathroom. THAT WAS A BIG MISTAKE!!!!! When I shut the door using the sliding glass door, the door slammed against my middle finger, severely hurting it. Note that I just gently slid the door shut. I pulled my finger out and said "Ouch" and suddenly the glass inside the door, made some weird crackling sounds, which scared us a lot. Note that I'm not a big person by any means and did not exert any force on the door. I simply wanted to close it to have some privacy. It was weird because they had put some kind of stopper on the door, which didn't really lined up, so needless to say it was some bad engineering on their part. We were pretty shocked and I called the reception and told them about our accident, asking for a new room. Soon, a couple of people came up to the 7th floor, looked at the damage and agreed that we would need a new room. I told them that I felt that the sliding door wasn't working properly and everybody made us believe that this was in no way our fault and that we would get a new room ASAP. It still took quite a while until we both had a new room, but we resumed with our sightseeing thinking that everything would be OK. We had a wonderful time in NYC and I left 2 days later feeling really great about the trip, the city, and the hotel. My sister and her husband checked out a day later. When they checked out, they were presented with a random bill for $1800. Somebody brought a German-speaking person who explaining that the damage to the door was their fault and that engineering had examined the cause. My sister and her husband (both are MDs and very smart people, but English isn't their first language) were very stunned. They only had 5 hours until their plane left and they were told they couldn't leave until they were paid up. They were never even presented with a real bill that broke down the cost, but just some random makeshift notice that they had to pay. They finally negotiated the cost down to $1000, but needless to say, this spoiled their entire trip and NYC experience. If I had been there, this wouldn't have happened, because I would not have let that happen. I've been to many hotel chains in the US, like the Westin or the W. Last time I was in NYC, I stayed at the W, and I assured my sister and her husband that those hotels would never ever charge their customers for any hazardous conditions that are their fault and not ours!!!! I pinched my finger by closing a malfunctioning door, and now my sister gets charged for this. This is so outrageous. I cannot believe that this so-called family hotel chain takes advantage of their overseas customers like this and spoils their entire experience instead of offering an apology for creating a hazardous condition to begin with. I will make sure to post this in all my social networks and tell my business associates as well that they shall never visit this hotel again. SHAME ON YOU GUYS!!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here recently for 1 week while we visited New York. The location of the hotel is perfect, just off times square, easy to get to everywhere. The lobby staff and check in staff were amazing! From the very begging of our stay until the very end! Rooms were very clean and tidy. Couldn’t fault this hotel at all. Breakfast was great, couldn’t really have asked for more. I would definitely stay here again! Thank you for an amazing trip!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It was a great place to stay and discover New York from. The hotel and staff were excellent, a great location close to Time Square and all amenities. Chose the package through BA holidays and all went very smoothly. Would definitely do it again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for a week with my wife and children. Staff were very helpful and place is spotless clean. Rooms are probably a bit small but we didn't spend much time there. They were however very clean. It's in the perfect location if you have children as everything in new York is easily accessible and if you need to go back to the hotel for anything you can without the hassle of getting a cab. We had food in the restaurant one night which was excellent and as for the breakfast... That's just top quality great selection of all types of food. I would say if your travelling to get breakfast included as it sets you up for a long day of sightseeing. Overall we had a ball in new York and loved this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked Riu after reading reviews online, and wanted to find something in the theatre district for my birthday weekend with friends. Perfect location, close to most theatres, restaurant row options for dinner, shopping and Times Square. Subway at 49th St was couple blocks away and easy to get downtown. Loved the interior of the hotel, very modern, clean, warm and friendly staff. Added bonus of breakfast - decent buffet, crowded but not common to find in an NYC hotel. Fashion bar/restaurant was a great pre and post night out stop for a drink, specials daily were reasonable, standard drinks nothing that great but good. Our rooms were on 18 and 22 floors, nice views of the area, good ammenities, plenty of space for a NYC hotel. Only odd thing is the frosted glass shower - anyone in the room gets a shadow person show while you're in the shower lol. Little too personal but hey we made it work.Staff were helpful when we didn't get our luggage on time, and had to find transportation round trip to the airport to pick it up ourselves (don't fly Delta, but that's another review). Appreciated them calling a car, locking in the price and making sure they would wait while we got our bags.Overall very nice property, would definitely stay again or at other Riu locations.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for a weekend in NYC, and it was perfect for our purposes. We went to see Hamilton, which was about 100 yards away, and Restaurant Row is even closer. Times Square is a couple blocks away, and subways to most of the city are close too.Hotel is brand new, with a clean, modern design. Staff is friendly, helpful, and multi-lingual. Rooms are on the small side (even for NY), but they are quiet, stylish and well laid-out. Gym is well-equipped. Breakfast buffet was busy but excellent. We'd go back again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this great hotel. The location is fantastic. Perfect for getting around all the major tourist sites and also located on restaurant row. Room was compact but clean and modern. No tea and coffee facilities which is a disappointment. The breakfast is by far the highlight of this hotel. So much choice, hot and plentiful. Negatives - staff are miserable! I don't think one smiled during our visit. Hotel charge is a rip off! Includes very slow Wi-Fi and 2 bottles if water! Not great value for money. This may be the norm for NYC??I also emailed the hotel to inform them my son was turning 18 during our visit and if I could arrange some balloons or a cake etc but no response. I then told them at check in and they didn't even wish him a happy birthday. Overall a great hotel if you want to be centrally located.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked the RIU for a short visit to NYC. Upon checking in was told there was a $39.00 resort fee and a $50.00 deposit. I complied. My husband happened to be sick, decided to stay in. No room service AT ALL. No ice machines or ice buckets. You can’t “charge any food from restaurant to your room”. No coffee service in the am. Got double charged in the restaurant twice in one night. Housekeeping did not come at all one day so we requested towels and soap. Got two towels and conditioner. Too many places in NYC to stay to put up with this .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: You can not go wrong with this hotel. Close to everything just off Times Square. Hotel is spotlessly clean. Bell boys were very helpful. It was my husbands birthday while we were there, we came back to find a card and a small box of chocolates which was a lovely thought. Breakfast was included and was hot and has something for everyone. Not sure I would pay 19 dollars each if I had to pay. I would highly recommend this hotel, and can’t wait to return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed overnight at this hotel and attended a Broadway show. The hotel is nice, functional and is a no-frills establishment. Rooms are small but what do you expect in New York! Times Square and theaters are all within walking distance. The price is very reasonable.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I booked a room as a special graduation gift for my 19 year old son. I specifically booked a Deluxe Double room so that we could have two double beds seeing that I was traveling with my son. Upon arrival, the staff behind the desk was rude, and dismissive. After being assigned the room for our three night stay, I inquired if it was for sure a room with two double beds as stated on my confirmation. I was rudely told that it was a room with a king bed because we reserved a room for two adults. I politely replied that we were two adults, but not every pair of adults staying at the hotel would not use a king bed and this was my son, and I specifically reserved two double beds. I was told that if I wanted two double beds, I would have to pay extra money. I showed the confirmation of my reservation again, and was told rudely that I booked a king bed. I disagreed and asked to speak to a manager. The employee retreated to a back room and after waiting for about five minutes in which she obviously briefed the manager, the manager approached me and argued that the booking company I used booked a king bed even though my confirmation clearly showed a Double Deluxe room. My choices were to either sleep in the same bed with my 19 year old son in a king bed, or pay extra and sleep one night in a room with two double beds, but I would need to move the next day to a room with a king bed. I then showed a picture of the Double Deluxe room from the Riu website showing two double beds, and the manager continued to argue that it was my booking agent and if I wanted to I could call them. He then brusquely walked away. Left with no choice, I took the room with two double beds and the notion that I would have to pay extra. The next morning, I was called by the front desk and told that, "If I really wanted to move to a room with king bed, I would need to do it now!" I politely explained that I did not want to move to room with a king bed, and was very happy with the room with the two double beds which is what I booked. She then argued with me that I was the one who asked to move. I explained once again the situation I was in and that I was traveling with my 19 year old son and clearly wanted a room with two double beds. She told me she would have to get back to me. ???? Fifteen minutes later I was told I could stay in my current room for the remainder of our stay. When I checked out , I was handed a bill for over $100.00 which I was "up-charged" for the room I had originally reserved. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS! The staff is rude, unreasonable, and the antithesis of the term "customer service." The room we were given was modern, had a gorgeous view, and was bright. However, there was black curly hair on the bathroom floor, and in the shower. We could not figure out the thermostat and the room was rather warm. We slept with the window cracked open and we stayed in January. The breakfast was a nice touch, but was very cramped, and again the service was rude, and indifferent. This hotel is in a prime spot in Manhattan, and has potential, but the rude people behind the desk and in the restaurant ruin the experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We just checked out of The RIU in Times Square NYC. We enjoyed the immaculate simple elegance of our room. Accommodations included complementary breakfast , which was a huge buffet with a wide selection. My only disappointment was the coffee at the buffet, not good at all.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We found the location to be excellent; its a relatively new hotel and the rooms were spotless, comfortable and well presented with great facilities. Reception was very efficient and the staff were friendly and attentive. Restaurants/Bars were very comfortable with a relaxed atmosphere and the food was superb. The adjacent café was ideal for a coffee on your return to the hotel after a busy day exploring the City. We would definitely recommend Hotel Riu Plaza and would love to visit again. One very happy family holiday!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is the second Riu resort my husband and I stayed at. It was awesome all around! We booked through the hotel website and to make my experience better I am a Riu class member and got 10% off for my birthday! Check in was easy and our room was nice. Breakfast was really good and the restaurant was inexpensive for NYC..all around we have a wonderful time and would recommend Riu resorts for any of your future trips.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I’ll start off by saying this is the 2nd Riu hotel we have stayed in and once again it hasn’t failed to have 2 very happy guests! Checking in was very fast and easy, friendly greetings from all staff on the desks all willing to help and answer any questions we had. We had a room on the 21st floor, with amazing views! The room was clean, tidy and well kept together. Cleaned every single day with new towels also. This hotel is literally right on the door step of everything.. we ended up walking everywhere instead of getting taxi’s as its all so close. Central park about 30 mins walk along one straight road, times square is under 5 minutes walk, bryant park and grand central station and all the shops about 10 minutes walk away. 5 days is definately enough, being in new york can get very tiering and very expensive (but so worth it!) We had breakfast included in with our room, wide selection every morning and the breakfast was absolutely delicious and filling, great start to the day. The bar inside the hotel is also lovely and have a happy hour 4pm-midnight $8 a cocktail. You can pay anything up to $18 in the city!!! Will 100% be returning to Riu again in the future. They are just brilliant

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First the positives. 1. The location is great. Very close to Times Square, Broadway and only 2 blocks to the subway.2. A full, hot breakfast is included in the room charge.3. It’s not very old so the fixtures and fittings are modern and in good shape.4. The rooms are good but, like a lot of New York, they aren’t large. They are, however, well equipped.5. The staff are largely, with some exceptions, friendly and do their best to help.Now the negatives, which largely concern service.1. They charge a daily service fee, which for us staying 4 days was about $52. I don’t actually have a problem with this. It is made very clear on their web site. BUT, if they are going to charge it, they should deliver the service. The service charge is meant to cover 2 bottles of water in the room every other day. When we arrived, there was no water and the safe was also locked. I went down to reception. They gave me water and promised that they would send someone up to open the safe. No one arrived. When we went out that evening we had to take all our valuables. As I left I reminded them about the safe. Again, they said they would send someone up immediately but when we’re returned it was still locked. Only at the 3rd time of asking did the safe get opened.2. On our last full day the room wasn’t made up at all, even though we were out all day apart from 45 minutes at lunch time. When we got back at 5pm the room hadn’t been made up. As we were going out again that evening I decided to tell them as we left. Reception promised they would send someone up straight away. We were going out to see the Christmas decorations so got back about 9:30pm. The room still hadn’t been cleaned. At that stage we were tired and leaving the next day so we really couldn’t be bothered to complain again.3. They have a bar but it is so small that there not enough seats. Twice we went for a drink but couldn’t get a seat so we left. Of course, there are loads of bars nearby but after walking miles around New York we just wanted a drink and a sit down in the most convenient location. You can get a drink in the room mainly used for breakfast on the other side of the lobby but it doesn’t have the same atmosphere as a bar.4. I’ve stayed in loads of hotels around the world. I’m usually asked if I enjoyed the stay. The person who checked us out seemed completely indifferent to our experience, which was a shame.In summary, it’s great location so I wouldn’t want to put you off staying here and maybe we were just unlucky but, from our experience, they could do with improving the service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for a week including New Year’s Eve during the visit, I emailed the hotel prior to arrival and requested a high floor which they arranged with no problems however the room was near an elevator which turned out to be quite clunky and noisy so the next morning we asked for a move and again they were very accommodating, moving us to another room still on a high floor. The rooms are extremely small but I imagine this is similar to most so close to Times Square. The breakfast is great although very busy and you have to queue- this may just be because of the time of year we went. Overall staff are very friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean and tidy with good free WiFi.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A wonderful break with the family in an icy New York but the welcome could not have been warmer at our hotel. Friendly, helpful and all round lovely staff made our stay the best. Fantastic food really set us up for braving the sights in the midst of the -14 Bombogenesis! Can't wait to go again.
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
Oolzy
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time visiting NYC amazing hotel and facilities , breakfast was something for everyone , Rooms very clean , always seeing a cleaner doing main entrance floors . Staff very friendly and helpful, quick check in and out , lovely to see the Christmas lights on the main front windows and decorations . Couldn’t ask for a better hotel will definitely be visiting this one again :)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Staff especially the staff who look after your luggage and take to the room, they were excellent and very friendly, all of them. The breakfast is the best I have ever had, top quality and very speedy to clean tables and get you seated. Nothing too much trouble as it is such a busy hotel. Not sure about charging for the wifi and the safe though, but the staff and breakfast made up for it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my sister stayed here overnight before a cruise. It was in a great location and the staff was wonderful. You are able to drop off your luggage if you arrive too early, which is assigned a number and taken from the lobby. Yes, the lights from Times Square are bright when you are trying to sleep, but it is Times Square. We stayed 1 floor from the top and the view was amazing. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a great hotel for New York, I’ve stayed at the Sheraton before on time square. But I found this hotel to be better.This hotel is a short walk to time square, it has breakfast include and close to the subway (metro $33 for a week) best way to get round nyc. We were upgraded to the 26th floor which included a lounge area where we could get hot / cold drinks and snacks. Great as the rooms do not have a Kettle to make drinks. Our room was a good size, but that could be because of the upgrade, also went down early for breakfast so didn’t have any hassle with waiting for a table. The staff were great, we required the hair dryer to be fixed and new battery for the tv remote, this was all taken care of within minutes. I would stay at this hotel again. Good hotel in great location, with breakfast included. We also had some food from carve sandwich’s across the road, which was good.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Big sigh of relief when our taxi pulled up at the Riu Plaza New York to see a smart hotel sparkling with Christmas lights filling the ceiling to floor glass walls. First impressions - Good! We had two rooms next to each other on the 12th floor. Clean and bright with a queen bed and great shower room. Friendly and helpful reception staff. Altogether a really good choice of hotel, we could not have asked for better. The location is brilliant, right in the heart of Times Square, we walked everywhere. We bought a New York Explorer pass in England for £59 which covered 3 excursions (£48 for kids). We decided to do a Riverboat Cruise on the Hudson River, the Rockafella Centre to view New York from the observatory at the top and the American Natural History Museum. From the Museum we walked across the road to Central Park and enjoyed walking through the park in crunchy snow. The younger members went ice skating and then we walked back to 46th street to the hotel. Breakfast was Included in our booking and it was superb, just about everything you could want and loads of it. We happened to visit New York during the 2nd coldest New Year since 1917 but it was sunny and bright and we wrapped up well (including our faces). In spite of the cold we did everything on our list including luckily a horse and carriage ride through Central Park on our last day (the horses had not been allowed out because of the severe cold weather). I would love to visit New York again in late Spring early Summer and would definitely stay at the Riu Plaza.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Plaza was very welcoming. The reception area is spacious, clean and always smells clean. The staff are helpful & friendly.We needed two rooms and requested they were near each other. This was no problem.The rooms are modern, again clean and the fridge has water. I did miss being able to make a coffee in the morning before breakfast.The breakfast is good and there’s a wide variety of food. The breakfast rooms are crowded and sometimes difficult to get to your seat. However we never waited long for a table. We visited the bar one evening and enjoyed some cocktails. The hotel is in an excellent location. Close to theatres, restaurants, Times Square, shops.I’d definitely stay here again. I love NY!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for New Years Eve. We had two rooms, one on floor 21 and 30. Both clean and good facilities. Location is superb, 2 min walk from time square and we could see it from the 30th floor. Can't see the ball drop from the room (despite what some reviews say), but fantastic view of the fireworks. Breakfast also very very good. Cannot fault at all.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Recently stayed at the Rui Plaza, fantastic hotel, well appointed with excellent facilities and in a great location to all amenities. We stayed bed and breakfast, plethora of food to choose from to suit everyone’s needs. Staff were very friendly and approachable nothing to much trouble. The decor in the rooms was lovely, however rooms are small but adequate for sleeping and bathing. Only disappointment there were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room.All in all thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate in returning and would definitely recommend to family and friends. 10/10

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel and friendly staff, we only had breakfast there which was included in our package but very good, it had two restaurants and a coffee/sandwich bar as you enter on the right which was also convenient, overall a lovely stay. Would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The room was incredibly comfortable, despite being quite small. Although noise was never too much of an issue, this is not the place to stay if you value quiet rooms -- I could hear nearly every conversation coming from near the elevators, and the guests in the room next to me were coughing for much of the first night. I opted for the breakfast buffet each morning, which was delicious -- but again, it felt very cramped and crowded in the restaurant areas. In addition, the restaurant flooded one morning, meaning guests had to squeeze into an adjacent room to finish their meals. This part of the stay was very unpleasant. My favorite amenity was the gym, which was equipped with a variety of functional equipment and was never crowded. Overall, my stay was fine, but I would consider this hotel to be closer to a 3-star than a 4-star. I would consider staying here again, but would be tempted to pay more for the Sheraton, Hilton, or Marriott.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I came to New York to visit several museums, and honestly chose this one quite by chance. It was clearly a serendipitous choice and we are very pleased with it. The room is quite comfortable and very roomy by New York standards.The bar and restaurant are wonderful with very reasonable prices ($7 and $8 drink specials at all times) and a decent restaurant menu with also reasonable prices. I highly recommend the ahi tuna steak!. Very generous portion and absolutely delicious!!Don't miss this jewel when you visit the Big Apple!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my husband stayed here from 7-10 December, I don’t have a bad word to say about this hotel. Staff were friendly, hotel was really clean, breakfast was of a good standard and was included in the price we paid for the stay. The location was excellent, we could walk to most places in Manhattan from here and we did. The rooms aren’t so big but had everything we needed for the few days we were there, the bathrooms are really modern with a big walk in shower. Bed was comfortable and a big tv, what more could you want. Also the bar was really nice and not too pricey at all. Great stay. Photo of view from our room on level 20.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On their official website, a lot of rooms come with "5% off for Riu Class members with code RCPLAZA". If you think you can get this discount by just registering on their website, logging in, and then booking, you will end up with a non-refundable rate with no discount at all. My booking confirmation clearly shows the Riu Class number I filled in when I booked the hotel for my family. Yet no discount at all applied to the final rate.The ill-designed website (constantly switching between English and Spanish) and bad customer service from their call center make me wonder how this hotel receives such a high rating. If you have to stay on the property, NEVER BOOK ON THEIR WEBSITE or WASTE YOUR TIME CALLING THEIR CALL CENTER.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having been delayed at jfk by passport control (volume of passengers)and missing our transfer.had to make our own arrangements to get to hotel.we was happy to settle into what was the best hotel we have ever encounted in a city.from checking in to checking out I couldn't fault it in any way.staff were as friendly always had a smile for us,can't understand some reviews stating otherwise.we went for our 40th wedding anniversary got to room and was presented with a bottle of champagne and chocolates which was very touching.we were on the 29th floor room 2919 which had a fantastic night time view onto some high rise appartments and a little view of times square.room itself was always kept cleaned by maids. (We stayed 7 nights).great walk in shower beds really comfy.we had breakfast included which have to say was top notch had everything that a breakfast could throw at you.walking distance to all that new york has.would strongly recommend this hotel.would go back in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was cheap, clean, and the location was amazing. Our room had a cool view to the city streets of new york, not like the Times square, more like small alleys and streets, very cool and pretty sweet to look at. The location of the Hotel was placed like 2 streets of Times Square. The bathroom and bedroom was very clean. That's something I didn't had in every hotel I stayed in. Thank you RIU team for the stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful property with stunning modern decor. Location can not be beat!! You're literally in the middle of everything! Extremely clean and appointed rooms. We were there with our teenaged children so the frosted glass walls of the bathroom were a little unsettling at first. Rooms are a bit on the small size but you're only really in your room to sleep. Amazing buffet breakfast included with our room .. the perfect way to start a very busy day exploring NYC. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here recently for four nights. Walked to the hotel from Penn station which took about fifteen minutes and very easy to find. Straight forward check in and straight to our room. Not the biggest we’ve stayed in, but not the smallest for New York standards. But the room was spotlessly clean and lovely and warm after walking in minus 10 temperatures! The breakfast was excellent and worth the money, with just about everything you could want from a buffet. Never had any problems getting a table. And no problems using the lifts.Excellent location for all of the tourist attractions.Would definitely recommend this hotel and use again when we return to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Position excellent, very closed to Times Square but quite enough, only 12 blocks from Central Park. Room clean, very good choice and quality at breakfast, brakfast room a bit crowded but overall ok. An hotel that I will consider again in the future

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: loved the hotel. checking in was quick & staff was friendly.. Lots of fun things to do. The breakfast was to die for.....yummy The room was up to date ,smelled good and beds were comfortable. beautiful view.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Easy check in and the breakfast is a nice touch. Our room was clean . We did not visit the bar although it looked very cozy. We would stay here again for the location, clean rooms, and breakfast included.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We are used to the Riu Resorts in other countries. This is not a resort by any means. I guess we expected a resort. Even as a NYC hotel, this property did not live up to other hotels we have stayed at in Manhattan. When we got off the elevator I felt like I was on a cruise ship as the halls were so narrow. Once opening our room door I was certain I was on a cruise ship. It was like a small cabin. The breakfast buffet had a rather large assortment of pastries, meats, etc. however, it was so-so. I would not stay here again. Perhaps we are spoiled to larger rooms etc. The staff was ok, but not the go out of their way for you.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived Christmas Eve and stayed for 4 nights. The location was excellent and some good restaurants and bars a short walk away. The quality and quantity of breakfast was good. The room was small but well appointed and the ensuite nice.On day 2 I tried to blow dry my hair and the hairdryer stopped working. We asked at reception on our way out and the staff said they would sort it. Getting back that afternoon it hadn’t been. So at 5pm we asked again. When we got back later that night the hairdryer still wasn’t working but someone had been and left extra towels on bed !?!?!We tipped housekeeping as instructed each morning but in 4 days they didn’t empty the rubbish bin or take away dirty mugs/ glasses (that we had brought up from restaurant). Again this was noted to reception but didn’t make a difference.Signs in the lifts advertised an option to pay for a late checkout. As our flight wasn’t until 10.10pm we asked if we could checkout at 4pm. We were told to call reception at 7am on the morning we were leaving to see if this was possible. We called at 7am to be told to call back at 8am. At 8am we were told that no late check outs were available on that date. I argued the point and we were finally allowed an extension until 3pm.The housekeeping staff and the quality of towels, hairdryer etc meant this was not the 4* hotel that I had paid for for my partners 40th birthday present sadly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Check in process was quick and easy. Staff where friendly but we was surprised too learn we where expected too put a deposit down in case of any damage to the room which would of been nice to of been informed about when bookingRoom was lovely and clean. We was on the 27th floor and the view from there was amazing. I'd advise requesting a high floor for the views alone. Shower was lovely and warm. The bed was one of the biggest and comfiest I had slept in.Breakfast was plentiful. Enough choice too pick from. And never busy we usually ate around 7.30amWe asked for late check out on the morning of our last day which was they allowed us. But then the only blemish to the hotel happened. We asked when we went down we would like to pay the late check out fee by cash as we had a lot spare and was told that was fine and too pay on check out. When we came to checking out the lady that checked us out said we was all paid up. When we mentioned paying for late check out she told us they had charged it too the card on file which we didn't want. She said we'd have to wait for a manager to issue the refund so we decided just to let it go. But then when given the receipt we had been over charged. $60 instead of the $30. So we had to go back and ask about this. The lady sorted it for us eventually but with no explanation of why this had happened.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in a great location and once the staff stopped taking to each other in Spanish and checked guests in, it was simple.Our room was a good size for New York and the decor was lovely. The windows need sound proofing from the constant honking of horns and sirens. These can be heard until the early hours of the morning and they are enough to drive anyone potty. The bed sheets were not changed once in the 4 nights we stayed in the hotel. We did later find out from another couple that there were cards in the room to request the change. We however were unable to find these in our room.You get 2 x small bottles of water in your room when you arrive and these should be replaced every 2 days, but ours wasn’t. The water pressure in the room was terrible the water in sink barely trickled out at times.Breakfast was really good with lots of choice. Overall the hotel was good but the staff let it down. Would we stay here again? No, the staff are too rude and we did not like the fact they constantly spoke in Spanish.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 4 days. Great location, if you want to be close to the theatres and times square. Rooms are fine and the couch is nice if you are with a family. The only downside is the personell and service. This is not what you would expect, even from a 3-4 star hotel. Rooms not cleaned, if you call they promise to clean but never show up and need to call again for dry towels. Cleaners don’t even check that toiletpaper is almost finished when cleaning. Not friendly at check in/check out, bagageroom etc. A general attitude of not caring. perhaps they don’t expect tourist guests to ever come back. I have had better service in NY hotels.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a lovely stay at this hotel with the family hubby and 3 children .What can I say from arrival everything was no problem given our room quick helped with bags etc , breakfast was good in a morning , from cooked eggs bacon etc , cereals , fruit ,.Staff all attentive and pleasant rooms clean and did the job , we stayed further down down last time we visited but found this hotel more suitable with the children it was more central to most attractions we wanted to see clean and will def return .Many thanks to all the staff at Riu we all had a amazing stay .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 5 nights in a "King Deluxe Room" over Christmas... perfectly located close to Times Square.Unfortunately only the bed was Kingsize... the room itself pretty small (which probably is Standard in NY) - but the big panorama window and the quite spaceous bathroom made it up a little. And besides the constraining roomsize the pretty thin walls forced us to listen to each single word of guests on the corridor and neigbor rooms (especially annoying: screaming children) - fortunately the jetlag was strong enough to help falling asleep. But at least positive to mentioned: the windows are perfectly sound-dampening! We hardly heard any streetnoise The incl breakfast was served with a very good variety of food and really attentively staff! Finally said we would come back and can recommend this hotel = perfect location and very friendly staff!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely stylish reception area. Nice hotel room was really clean. Really comfortable bed. Could not fault this hotel. Great location too. Walking distance to everything. Including the Greyhound bus terminal. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel chain based in Spain has only has 2 locations in the United States but many properties around the world. The New York location caters to international travelers - I don't think I heard English spoken once in the elevator. Here's what I really liked about this hotel:- Great location in the theatre district- Wonderful, helpful staff- Very modern rooms with features found in European hotels- Very comfortable bed- Extensive breakfast buffetA few very minor complaints:- Room was a bit small- No clock in the roomI highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in this hotel from the 22nd till the 26th of December.Hotel is modern and in a great location. Yes it can be a little noisy bit as others have said you are practically in times square. If you balance a great location with a little noise or a quieter hotel but not in the best location the better location should usually win. This is a city break after all.Breakfasts are fantasic it saw us through for most of the day... just what you need for New York.Would I stay here again... YES DEFINITELY!Great Hotel with fantastic service.... look out for the all day happy hour cocktails.. $7 for a Mojito great price for NYC

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza for four nights on a recent trip to New York. A great choice of hotel - a nice clean room, reasonable price, very good service and breakfast included (a real bonus). The hotel is close to Times Square and many good bars and restaurants. Perfect for a Christmas visit to New York.Would choose this hotel again for our next visit.Tip: ask for a room on one of the higher floors - should get a good view

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Modern hotel very clean, friendly staff, buffet breakfast is great, located just on block away from Times Square, good sized rooms for newyork as most rooms in hotels are small. Subway is located near by.
user_name:
Robertroocroft
North West England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel lobby, bar, and restaurants are very nice. Very reasonable prices for lunch. Our rate included a buffet breakfast which was very good - lots of options. We also had a great lunch for a good rate, too. The room is what I would call minimalist, but it was fine because we weren't there for long every day - mostly to sleep! The location is great - close to Times Square, Restaurant Row, Broadway, tours, everything! I plan on staying here the next time I come back to New York. Also, all of the employees we spoke with were extremely nice and helpful! Great value for the location!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is modern and so convenient for the tourist attractions. 5 minutes from Times Square, Hells Kitchen, the Rockefeller Centre, Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden are all walkable.Our rooms weren’t all ready when we arrived but apart from that it was a perfect spot and we would return.Breakfast is included which is hard to find in NYC.Rooms are small but have everything you need.The traffic is loud but this is NYC! You don’t stay in Times Square for peace and quiet.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked to stay here with my girlfriend.Hotel is superb, food excellent and ideally situated for all the attractions of NYC. Loved it and hotel room was spacious and comfortable.Bar was good although drinks a little overpriced but good place to start or finish the night.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Not long come back from a 4 night 5 day stay at the Riu Plaza hotel Times Square and what a lovely hotel. Spotlessly clean, the lobby smells wonderful every time you walk in, bright and very contemporary.We stayed in a family deluxe suite on the 17th floor with a great view. The room was clean and tidy and an ok size, however would of been better if it was wider. We found it strange there wasn’t a mirror over the dressing table so struggled with 2 women doing their hair and make up when getting ready.The Bathroom was lovely but not very large. I had previously read comments about the glass wall in the shower and did worry about this, however I needn’t of as it’s not as bad as I imagined.We had breakfast included which was great. All the food was fresh and again the restaurant was spotlessly clean. The only fault I could pick was that the food at breakfast in the 8th Avenue restaurant was always cold by the time we got back to our table which was not appetising, but we never experienced this in the smaller restaurant in the lobby, food was always hot there. The Staff, hmm I’ll be honest I was not impressed. On check in there was a problem with the name our booking for some reason, fromWhat I could make out. I produced my accommodation pre paid voucher from BA to 2 members of staff and I asked if there is a problem and I was ignored. They carried on talking to each other in what seemed to be Brazilian or a similar language, so I asked again and was ignored again by them both. After a couple of mins they seemed to of sorted the mix up out and amended the name, I was handed 4 door entry cards and told we were on the 17th floor. He took our details from our passports and handed them back to me and walked off. We were left there thinking is that it? Can we go? So I waited to ask a lady that was also behind the counter who was sorting paperwork out. We waited and waited she definitely saw us but completely ignored us and walked off. So we left and went up to our room. The next morning my husband went down to the desk to ask a question and was waiting in line and was completely ignored and so was another guest waiting. A lady with a baby asked a female member of staff for a baby changing area and she was ignored, In fact the lady actually called out to her again and walked after her and asked the question again to be Snapped at with “No!”. The only member of staff that was friendly and always spoke was the porter. He’s a lovely man.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: its a great hotel near to times square new york very clean good breakfast the view was amazing in the 28’s floor very nice staff don’t send laundry if you need it at the same day they didn’t allow me late check out even for few hours

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very convenient to theaters and Time Square without dealing with the crowds a few blocks away. Room with double beds and sleeper sofa was on the small side but not cramped. Great shower and large shelf under sink for toiletries. Efficient checkin. Buffet breakfast had a large selection - line moved quickly - no frills seating. Very clean and quiet.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel, easy check in and out. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was included and had everything you could want to eat.Great location for subway, Central Park and shop.Would definitely stay here if I came to NY again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On arrival we found we were in a room with one bed. As we were staying for a week we decided to upgrade to a room with 2 beds. We paid for the upgrade. First night we found that the window was broken and kept opening allowing gusts of winds to blow in. This proved to be a difficult night as it was -12 degrees outside.We requested a room change at 6am the following morning which they agreed to at 3pm. The rooms are on the basic side but are clean.The breakfast was a big bonus. If you are up at 6:30am we could eat in the main restaurant other than that it was a canteen style room. Hot and cold breakfast was available with a good choice of drinks.The reception staff were rude and unhelpful. They did not know what they were doing and needed help from other members of staff. There was no structure to the staffing with the bell boys doing as they pleased be it pacing the front of the hotel or sat slouched their side of reception. Again they were very unhelpful regarding transport from the hotel saying yellow cabs would not be available due to traffic and the holidays however it seemed $20 speeded the process up. We booked with Tui and this included free transfers to and from the airport. It's free for a reason. It took over three hours to get from bag claim to the hotel. We had to wait for the driver to arrive to take us to the hotel. there were 8 people in the mini bus with us . The driver kept insisting there were in 6 in the mini bus and was waiting for 2 more people even though 8 people were sat for over an hour trying to convince him we were all there. It felt like a Peter Kay comedy sketch. Finally setting off the driver got lost 3 times and struggled with google maps.The return journey was equally mad due to the fact that the driver arrived at the hotel and left without any passengers. After speaking to the volatour Rep at the hotel she telephoned the driver and he came back.Nothing is free, we have been to New York before and have never experienced such a tragic package deal.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: You wouldn't think you'd find a quiet hotel close to Times Square but this is it. Very convenient (though not as close to Subway stops as some might like). The Lobby is beautiful with soaring ceilings and the room is modern and sparse. The Room: small, but it is NYC. There is no carpet in the room. The bathroom fixtures are quite contemporary and there was a nice closet area with an in-room safe. The bed was very comfortable, and I'm pretty picky. The biggest complaint about the room was that the water pressure was very gentle. We were only there one night so I didn't need to shampoo my hair, but I think I might still be there rinsing if I did. The Hotel: the breakfast had a large buffet but noting was particularly special on it. Everything looked very warmed over. We did not eat there. The worst and most unexpected part was check in. We had a prepaid room. But both room guests had to show ID and then the hotel photocopied the ID. Then we had to leave a security deposit on the room...not just run the credit card in case, but an actual amount that is then lifted when you check out. There is no bill under your door at the end, so you really want to check out in person to verify charges which adds to the process. Oh, and beware the 'resort fee' that you are required to pay. It's in the fine print.Because of the weird check in, the poor breakfast, and the low shower flow, we give a 4, though perhaps it should be a 3....

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Ideal location for all the attractions. Staff friendly and helpful. Good selection of food at breakfast. Couldn't fault the cleanliness. Would defiantly stay here again as so convenient for everything you wish to see.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here to be close to the action in Times Square. Location was perfect, two blocks away from the square. Easy to walk back and avoid the crowds if we wanted to.The checkin was fast, the bellboy service was great. The wifi was very fast, and the breakfast buffet was varied and tasty.The rooms were a bit small and Very spartan. 2 beds, and a desk that could fit one laptop only. The bathrooms was also strange, with no space for toiletries. But everything was new, clean, spotless.OVerall, I would definitely stay here again if I'm back in the area.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here twice over the last few months while on business trips to NYC. The hotel is located close to Times Square which is great for tourism but not ideal if you're travelling for business. The lobby is well appointed with one cafe with fast food and another casual restaurant that serves drinks. The drinks are priced very well and food is decent.The rooms here are small but not to the point where you can't move. My issue with this hotel is that the construction quality is terrible. It feels like an IKEA with everything being made out of particle board or compressed wood chips. Looks cheap, and very used. Now, this isn't a great concern if you're paying the right amount for this room and know what you're getting into. If you can get over the cheap, IKEA feel of the whole place, it's actually a decent option to stay in NYC - for the right price.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our family of three visited in July for 11 nights. This hotel is perfect as a central point for all of New Yorks’ attractions and literally 5 minutes walk from Times Square.The air conditioning worked a treat in our room and although the room is smallish for 3 people,we felt the location made up for it.The hotel is clean and tidy as still quite new but does lack a little convenience shop which would be useful for late night arrivals or when returning to the hotel when the cafe is shut and you want to grab a quick snack before bed or need to buy some toiletries.Another issue was lack of bottled water which we thought was replaceable after your initial one on arrival. For the price of staying here this could have been included or at least sold cheaply on the premises.However the breakfast was lovely, a great choice of cereals,cheese,cold meat,,smoked salmon,Danish pastries and so on. The only downside being that a breakfast was supposed to be available until 11am but we found they were shutting up at 10am. If you have a late flight home, it’s not always possible to arrange a late checkout but there is a shower with the gym available if you wish. our room was on the 9th floor street side and the first night was a little noisy but we soon got used to it.Central Park was about a 15 minute walk away And there’s a lovely little diner around the corner from the Riu called The Times Square Diner and Grill which we found very tasty,typically American food,generous portions,reasonably priced and efficient staff. The Riu is also around the corner from the bus/ coach terminal for some excursions.Overall a very pleasant stay and we can’t wait to go back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It is a great place to stay for the right price. Its so close to times square and central park, you can walk towards it in just a few minutes. I Will recommend this to everyone. The only thing is, is kinda noisy during the night. But overal great. Oh not to forget, the breakfast is good.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Room Service Clean and neat.Restaurant with very reasonable dishes and price.Very nice entrance and general environment.Congratulations RIU :)Poor medical assistance and uncomprehensive credit card budget problems :( .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in the heart of the city and have to say the calm interior belies the chaos of Christmas awaiting outside. We returned most days on our knees and were relieved to crawl through such a welcoming, beautiful smelling, clean bright lobby! Our room 1409 overlooked 46th st and the main entrance, which although had a constant stream of traffic could thankfully not be heard with the window closed. The room was spotless and a descent size the beds very, very comfy. Mini fridge but no mini bar, comp 2 bottles of water left every 2 days, no kettle, cups or glasses.....I had however come prepared although not for the hotel hairdryer which blew up on us day 2!! Thankfully the maintenance guy was very efficient and a brand new one was fitted before my hair had chance to dry eau naturelle?!Prefer to be up and off first thing so didnt opt for breakfast which looked pretty busy but did have a couple of meals later in the day which were very good and the restaurant had a nice relaxing atmosphere.Ticked all the boxes for me.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Junior Suite 26th Floor ( AMAZING ROOM, GREAT VIEW ). The Riu always does a great job of taking care of there guests. This Hotel lives uo the reputation of the chain. For an inner city Hotel the room was ready upon arrival. It was extremely spacious and well worth the upgrade cost associated to it from regular suites. The breakfasts at this RIU had everything you could desire.There was an on suite for gusts of the higher floors. Complimentary wine and beverages, in this area. The fridge in the on suite open to guests from floor 26th floor and up was a great touch. Wine, Muffins, and Candies a great little area to relax and get to meet other guests.Needles to say this Hotel is a block or two a way from the main Times Square area. First time visitors to New York will need to get to know there way around. This Hotel really is in a triple a location. Don't rent a car, take the subway of just start walking.Times Square is one of the most cosmopolitan areas there are. Shows, restraunts, night life and not far from Central Park. This is a must see. The RIU is well prices for the area and gives great comfort to its guests.The perks of staying in a Central area for the first time visitor is well work a few extra dollars. You can begin to discover New York City from the inside out. Even your trip is short less than a week I highly recommend the location.Wall Street, Ground Zero, Central Park, Stanton Island and all three airports are within close proximity. Lower rooms are really nice two that are less costly but I found the value for the dollar spent well worth the experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 12/15-17, 2017. Hotel is very modern. The staff are incredibly nice and friendly. Room was very clean. I am very picky about where I stay and it was my first time staying here so here are the Pros: breakfast buffet is included which was great, hotel is located on Restaurant Row so there are plenty of good places to eat going away from Times Square, there was a food truck right outside the door which had great hot dogs, plenty of places to shop for souvenirs, walking distance from theater district, we walked to Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center without being tired at all, location is excellent. The Cons would actually make me not book this hotel again. I would have to see the situation I would be in to consider it or not. 1) the glass shower stall is not private at all. You could clearly see the person taking a shower in his/her full glory. The stall has a white tint to it which DID NOT hide much. Traveling with a teenager who was not pleased at all, we had to turn off the lights while showering or give our backs to the person in the stall so we wouldnt see anything. The same goes for the toilet. Once the door was slid closed, there was a huge crack and if you sat at the desk, or by the foot of the beds, you could see the person sitting on the toilet doing their business. I complained to the front desk and they did say they were aware of the privacy issue. I am sure they could add a blind to the outside glass. 2) I had two double beds and they were pushed together. I was obviously the person who somehow would end up in the middle and had to crawl my way into and out of the bed. The first night I was so tired so I didn't mind, the second night I just said 'this is ridiculous'. Luckily it was just 2 nights. Great for an adult weekend stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights. Very nice modern hotel. We asked for a high room and got a corner room on 22nd floor with dual aspect views down 8th Avenue and 46th street. The room was very clean. The breakfast included was a plentiful buffet. The location is ideal for Hell’s Kitchen in the evenings for large selection of bars and restaurants near by and Times Square in the other direction. Being in a busy area of NYC it was noisy at night from the traffic/horns/sirens but that is inevitable. I imagine being in a higher floor helped reduce the noise. Great facilities, gym (we didn’t see it though), WiFi, guess use computers, nice bar and restaurant with nice food (we eat there once for lunch and once in an evening). The grab and go coffee shop also very convenient.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel is perfect, minutes away from times square. The decor is modern, our room was a double deluxe and was ample room for the 2 of us. Beds and pillows were so comfy, had a fab 3 nights sleep in them. Staff were polite and helpful. Breakfast was nice, plenty of choice, definitely something for everyone. If i return to New York i will be staying in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here 10-14 December 2017. This hotel is fresh, bright, modern, spotlessly clean and the location is excellent. We were on the 25th floor (room 2511) and the views at night are stunning! Room was spotlessly clean, great shower, good stock of shower gels, shampoo, conditioner, body creams, soaps etc which were all replenished daily. The location is quiet and you are only within a 5 minute walk from Times Square, Rockefeller Centre is a 10 minute walk, across from that is Saks, Central Park 15 minute walk, Macy's 15 walk - everything was closer to walk to than we thought. The Port Authority station is a 4 minute walk - we used the subway to go to 9/11 memorial. We cannot fault this hotel, staff were friendly and welcoming and happy to help with any queries, food and drinks were good. The Fashion Bar located in the lobby was stylish with great background music and had a fantastic warm chilled vibe! The hotel offer airport shuttle back the airport which we took, this was cheaper than the two of us getting a taxi - very efficient service.We loved this hotel and the location and would have no hesitation in staying here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in a good location and the lobby is so impressive. The staff is very kind and accommodated us with an early check in. The shower was hot and the bed was comfortable but the pillows were horrible. They were balls of cotton that separated so this was not up to par. We called the lobby because our room was so hot and they sent a maintenance guy. He was very kind but told us the room couldn’t get cooler because it would freeze their pipes however the room was like 76 degrees. Luckily we had a window in the room we could sleep with open even though it was well below freezing each night. All in all it wasn’t bad. It was about average.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very modern and clean hotel. Minutes from Time Square. Breakfast included. Will definitely go back again when in New York. Staff were very helpful which made our stay more enjoyable as we were not familiar with the area and attractions

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It’s my family with my brother and my sis in law. Overall, I love this hotel because its location is so good that you can walk to major tourist spot in a few seconds. The hotel doesn’t cost us too much and the hotel is breakfast included! OMG, I love the breakfast so much! It’s a must item to eat in the New York City! The fruits, the juice and the food are so good for a big breakfast! It’s also very convenient to everywhere. It’s located in the area of time square so you are able to reach everywhere in seconds. The room is also comfortable, clean and tidy. Hotel staff are nice and helpful! So overall I will give it a very good rating!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights. Lovely spacious room. Bathroom had glass wall and door which meant you couldn’t put light on in the night to go loo (or you would light the room up!) which was slightly annoying. Room comfortable. Great location seconds from Times Square. Breakfast great and had lots of choice. Bar area in evening was nice. Didn’t eat in hotel other than breakfast but looked good menu. Staff very friendly. Its noisy but you are on Times Square so what do you expect? Ha. Only reason not 5 star is we encountered a lot of pressure from the concierge man to use ‘the hotels car’ to get to the airport going home. They lied about the yellow cabs saying they charge on the meter which is not true as there is a set fare for airport. They lied about how much we would be charged. They also kept saying there is no way we will be able to hail a cab but we did within minutes after they left us alone. Made us very uncomfortable. Once in the taxi the driver said “the hotels use their friends and get kick backs, it’s normal for them to pressure you” Other than the concierge man and his friend’s lies which let the hotel down, it was amazing an stay and I would recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely stay at the Riu Plaza, location is perfect for sight seeing. Although when you come out of the hotel turn left not right it's more residential to the left & I noticed a brothel further down the road!! The staff were very accommodating & breakfast was to die for! The room was spacious, only down side was that there was no tea/coffee making facilities & the ensuite was opaque glass, but we got round that by keeping the light off in the ensuite & putting the light in in the room! Beautiful hotel though & would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well...my title says it all...great location near time square, but tiny rooms..service at check in was good...hotel and rooms look nice...well maintained...bathroom not too small...for one person on a business trip I guess it is ok...for a couple the rooms would be too small

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I had confirmation of full amount paid including resort fee and was charged this again during my stay even though I had a piece of paper confirming it had already been debited. That being said I enjoyed the hotel it was very pretty and luxurious feeling and much better than the citizen m which is a more expensive option. I didn’t get the chance to have breakfast as I had to leave early for a show taping although I did enjoy the bed , and the shower! It was very comfortable ! Overall the stay was good it is a shame about the overcharging though otherwise it would have been 4 stars !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just a block down from Times Square, this hotel is amazing. There are a few restaurants on site, a bar, The foyer is amazing. The staff are wonderful. The room size is a little small when comparing it to other American or Canadian hotel rooms but for NYC it can be expected. We had a high floor so had great views of the city. Room had a fridge, Bathroom was a decent size and the shower was amazing - though if travelling with a friend or family member, the bathroom wall does allow for a silhouette but this can easily be avoided by keeping the room lights on and bathroom light off.PayTV, free Wifi, A/C. Room under your bed to store the suitcases so you're not tripping over them in the room and the Beds are high up because of this. The lifts are fast. We had breakfast included, breakfast was good with a variety of hot and cold options. Plenty of cafe, restaurants, bars near by. Room was clean. Will stay here again when I am next in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here November 28-30th. We are Riu class members and expect certain things from a Riu experience. We were able to use our Riu points to pay for part of the room which was nice. This was nothing less than what we expect. It was a great trip! The rooms are on the small side but that's expected in NYC. They were clean and it was fine. We ended up in a handicap accessible room for some reason so we kept tripping on the accessible area from the bathroom to the main area, but no big deal just my clumsy feet. The breakfast is typical Riu breakfast. Saying that means it is fabulous!! The staff is friendly and helpful. We visited the Fashion bar and purchased a few cocktails the one night and the bartender was fabulous and the drinks were great. When we return to NYC we will definitely stay here. The proximity to Times Square is great. We also rarely changed the tv channel...we just watched the Riu ad with all the tropical hotel locations all night! Lol! So relaxing, not a joke, we loved that! My only complaint is that the lobby/bar area smelled like cigarettes 24/7 which was severely irritating as I'm allergic. Other than that I found no flaws in the trip.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My sister and I returned from our trip only a few days ago, we have stayed in a couple of hotels in New York but the Riu was by far the best. It's location firstly is fantastic, minutes to Times Square, 5/10 mins to port authority, 15 mins over onto fifth avenue and about 30 minutes to Central Park. Bus stops right opposite for city sightseeing. Our room was a twin on the 24th floor, view out was south and very impressive, we heard little noise. It was compact but more than adequate, modern and clean. We would have liked a coffee maker as travelling from the uk we are always awake about 4am with jet lag, however we did use the lounge on the 26th floor for coffee. We had breakfast each morning and this was great, plenty of choice and even though hotel was very busy we got seated no problem, this saved us quite a bit in spending money! We ate dinner a couple of times in the hotel and food was good and reasonably priced, we also had drinks in the Fashion bar and again were a good price for Manhattan. We found all staff polite, we had a couple of issues with our keys but most probably because they were beside our phones in our bag but this was fixed promptly each time. We took advantage of the late check out which was very helpful as out flight was in the evening. All in all a great base to explore New York and we would definitely stay again if visiting again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Rooms were on the small side but your only there to sleep really. Room was clean. Nice little bathroom. A block away from Times Square. Free wifi and free breakfast was fabulous. Service was great. We would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really good central location just off 46th W St and 8th Ave 5 min walk to centre of Times Square, 10mins to 49th St subway and there’s a hop on/hop off bus stop just opposite for Grayline and NYC sightseeing tours. 10 mins along 8th and you’re at Port Authority Terminal too.Mum, cousin and me - girls shopping trip (and sightseeing for my mum on her first visit to NYC!) stayed in one room with 2 double beds, ample room as all you really do is wash and sleep! We were on 25th floor and also had access to the exec lounge on 26th floor, providing big fridge with cold drinks, sandwiches, fruit, crisps and yoghurt- very handy to grab something when calling back to the hotel.We had bed and breakfast and even though hotel was full and breakfast looked really busy it only ever took 5 mins maximum to be seated. Lots to choose from at breakfast: cooked breakfast, continental, fruit, breads and pastries so you can fill up for the day. If you haven’t booked breakfast it’s $19 per person. You can ask for late check out if your flight is later, but tip is to ask when you checkin as if it’s full they won’t extend, it’s first come first served. They charge $30 to extend to 3pm and then an hourly rate after that IF they can accommodate, but there’s a big storage area to leave bags.Hotel is new and modern, rooms have fridge but no coffee/tea facilities. Hairdryer in the bathroom, electronic safe and iron and ironing board. Bathroom just has a glass sliding door - seems to be a bit of a gap and doesn’t block out noise! So if it’s just friends sharing...you need to know each other well! Also watch your fingers when closing as 2 of us jammed fingers between wall and door!Would stay there again as location was great and I think the B&B option very reasonable.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really enjoyed my stay here. Come as a couple and enjoyed every minute of this amazing holiday. Only thing I can fault about the hotel is they didn't have baked beans alongside the really good breakfast buffet (scrambled egg could be better). 5 lifts can be a bit busy at breakfast time but queue went down quickly. Rooms small but what I expected. Clean and good bathroom and shower area. Staff friendly and bar prices reasonable. Go out the hotel and turn left. Go across one avenue and you are in Times Square When coming out of the airport at JFK make sure you go to the yellow cab taxi rank if you want a taxi people everywhere will be trying to get you a lift. It was flat fee $52 plus tolls and tip so $70 we paid. View was good towards Times Square. You can hear horns and sirens all night but you get used to it and our sleeping pattern was messed up anyway. Did late checkout until 3pm for $30 and normal check out is 12.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just had a 2 night stay at this hotel. I agree with others that the location is superb just 3/4 minute walk from time square. The hotel is excellent, very modern and well presented. Reception area is great to relax. The bar area does great cocktails and the food is of a good quality. The breakfast included was only ok. It was varied but very cold. The rooms were great with an amazing shower but on the small side with a very small bed. All in all a great find for any trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
