review_body: This place literally sucks. It’s super ugly and gross entrance. The staff are terrible. I paid for my room in advance with a credit card in MY name matching MY ID. They forced me to cancel my reservation because I didn’t have the same card with me even though everything else matches. I hate this place. Had to argue with the manager in Spanish on the phone and they wouldn’t let me talk to anyone. AVOID

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had four days at the Rui. It's a bed and breakfast. Room was quite large. Two double beds.couch. desk.mini fridge.safe.ironing board.iron hairdryer. Room Was clean and room service/maid good. I would class the hotel as contemporary. Check in was quick and easy. Staff friendly and helpful at reception.breakfast is self service with plenty of Choice. We did go for an evening meal there. Food was nice unfortunately on that evening the service was slow even after we asked twice for our dessert. Hotel right on times square. Downside no tea/coffee / kettle in room so had to go across the road late at night or early morning to Dunkin doughnuts.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Positives,Excellent hotel, well presented and clean rooms. Restaurant for breakfast busy but fresh and plenty of choice. There is a lovely smell in the reception area! Staff all friendly and helpful apart from a particular female on reception, see below.Negative,Please don’t forget the card you paid your bill with! I did, and after a 3500 mile flight, transfer from Newark, the last thing I wanted to hear was a member of staff telling me that although I’ve paid my bill she was cancelling my reservation! Suggesting I go home to get it didn’t help! I asked 3 Times if she would accept my internet banking as I knew a copy of the card was there, she said no every time. Eventually my wife managed to persuade her, and we got our room.I wonder if management could come up with a better contingency plan for silly customers who end up in this situation? Surely a passport is sufficient proof of who is in front of them checking in.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Has to be the worst hotel to deal with. Booked through booking.com. The Hotel overcharged prior to arrival. I queried this and they wouldn't give a breakdown of charges. I said this was unacceptable and said I wanted a refund. They wouldn't engage. They cancelled my reservation and all thought the cancellation said free of charge they kept the money. Now they just ignore all communication. Left to book a hotel last minute and then had no money for the trip as they had taken my spending money. Absolute thieves! Avoid!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Would highly recommend the hotel. Clean, accommodating and they have A location where you can drop off your luggage and check in later, if you arrive too early. Very centrally located close to the theater district. Enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the RIU Plaza Times Square for 3 nights and it was a pleasure. We found the hotel to be clean with a modern decor. We had a smooth check-in and no issues with our room. We stayed in a Deluxe King room and though small in size. The room used space efficiently and had a comfortbale bed. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast with a decent selection. The food was satisfactory. The dinner restaurant also had a decent menu and the prices were reasonable.The hotel is located about 1 block west of times square in Hell's Kitchen. I found it pretty convenient as its not smack in the middle of the busy Times Square but you still have easy access to shopping, restaurants and theaters. I would recommend this hotel for those persons looking to be close to action but not in the middle of it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very good, modern, clean hotel. Ideally situated, excellent king sized rooms. Close to everything you need to see. Be adventurous and turn right and visit Hell’s Kitchen for best bars and eateries. Definitely worth a future visit

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location worth every dollar! 5 minutes walk to Times Square. Hotel is clean, services were good. Actually is the quality you expect from a chain of hotels. Cleanliness is great and breakfast is quite poor as varieties but will get you started in the morning. As I stated above I recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Came here for thanksgiving with my sister in law and for some retail therapy. Well what a fabulous hotel in an excellent location. Rooms were cleaned daily and were not noisy like reviews said. Ok there was a little noise we were on the 9th floor so I’m guessing it might have been the lower levels maybe? 2 mins from Times Square so fabulous location meaning plenty of restaurants and plenty to do. The hotel is close to all of the tourist sightseeing spots. We walked to them all even though we’d purchased a 7 day pass for bus and the subway. We had bed and breakfast at the hotel and there was plenty of options. I would recommend the fashion restaurant as it was quieter because it’s much smaller. We got the LIIR shuttle from JFK and then the subway to 42nd st port authority was a 5 min walk to hotel from here so perfect and cheap as chips. It was daytime so was fine but I wouldn’t recommend doing at 5.30am like we did as it was quite scary lots of not so nice people hanging around and didn’t feel safe. We had some great shopping days in century 21 grabbing some amazing bargains and also Macy’s had a great sale too but make sure you plan a day to go to there as Macy’s has 11 floors!!! The hotel staff were brilliant especially Jeremiah who was very lovely. There is also concierge who help you with any queries and all staff were attentive. The cocktails are gorgeous in the hotel and very reasonably priced at $7 as was the wine. Prosecco was $22 a bottle. Loved the hotel and would definitely return here. Thanks for such a memorable stay with you! K & S from South Wales

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful, recently remodeled (2015) or so I’ve been told. Great location in the heart of Times Square and restaurants everywhere. Many sights within walking distance. Very clean facility, very friendly. Would come back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I spent the night there on 11/25 with my sister to help celebrate her 44th bday. It was a nice and clean hotel. It gives me the feeling like I was on a cruise ship. I love the purple accent. (Even the blanket and ironing board cover was purple) cute! Lol The breakfast room was extremely large with great food selection. The staff was really nice. Shout to the haitian guy who worked Sunday morning replenishing food. He noticed my haitian 1804 t-shirt and began chatting with me. I appreciated the staff quick table clean up once they noticed guests were done. Your coffee machine is super awesome. It does everything at the push of a button. I thought cafe au lait was really a latte. Lol I guess not because there was a different button for each of them. Thank you for the great experience
user_name:
UnpredictableMarj
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great central location, hotel was clean, buffet style breakfast was good, Wi-Fi was excellent. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others. We were on the 25th floor the lift was very quick except for our last day when they seemed to have broke down.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is an amazing hotel. In the best spot of Times Square - which means you are close to all the attractions and its walkable to most places. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous, very modern with lovely decor. It gives you the proper New York feeling. It also smelled so good as you walked into the lobby! The rooms had big ceiling to floor windows offering spectacular views of New York, especially at night Staff were very helpful, always on hand to help and going beyond with their service. I will definitely be returning there when I go back to New York!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Leave it here for Thanksgiving. We had a very late check in. The staff is very courteous and very helpful. We didn’t have the room we like but they promised usWe could change the room in the morning and help and they helped us change the room as promised The very next day. The staff were very helpful courteous and friendly. The rooms are cleaned every day. There are some very good views of the water and you can see the cruise ships coming in. The breakfast is the best. It’s like an all inclusive resort breakfast. From fresh fruits to gourmet coffee everything is free. And can’t beat the location. One block from main time square. Highly recommend and will definitely recommend to friends and family.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here recently for 5 nights as a family of four.Had a double twin room.Frosted glass bathroom was not a problem.The room was on the small side, but who goes to New York to stay in a hotel room.We were on the 24th floor and could see a bit of times square from our room.Breakfast was buffet style and offered a huge choice.Staff were friendly and helpful and location was excellent.Would recommend this Hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel located very close to the Time square ,Broadway and where everything's happens, we didn't need to use the subway. the landscape from the room is amazing. The staff are very kind especially Nyima from the front desk that was helpfull and very profession and kind thank youMargalit & Sabrina

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We've just returned from a fantastic stay at this hotel. We spent a lot of time choosing a hotel for this trip and were really pleased that we made the right decision.The hotel is very close Times Square and other favorite spots. It is also a bright and well decorated hotel with a nice ambiance. We decided to pay for an upgrade and stayed in a two double bed room on the 22nd floor with a spectacular view of the Hudson River. The rooms were well cleaned, the beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was just perfect. The staff were so helpful and we will definitely stay here when we return next time !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is an immaculately clean, nearly new and modern hotel close to Times Square. The staff were excellent and the rooms clean, well equipped and comfortable. The hotel was very quiet and we managed to get un-interrupted sleep despite its busy location. I would definately stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent two nights in NY and enjoyed the location of the RIU very much. Just a short walk to Times Square but you leave the chaos and madness behind in that short walk to the hotel. We took two rooms on the 19th floor for our business trip, one facing onto 8th Avenue and towards Times Square, the other facing South onto W 45th St and overlooking a row of theatres. Floor to ceiling windows mean that you can enjoy nearby high rise buildings or just draw the curtains. The noise from the street below didn't travel up to the 19th so it was generally quiet except for the occasional siren. It is NY after all. The rooms are very clean, with a smart frosted glass bathroom, and we had an iron and safe in the room. Breakfast was a good buffet selection and the staff ensured that the food was well stocked. I would go back on a future visit. As ever selection is subject to the rate on offer. We were very happy with the rate we paid for our stay in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in November, the hotel was lovely, very modern, lovely room that has a safe, iron, fridge & hairdryer, the only other thing I would of liked would of been a kettle. Amazing shower, nice and big and very powerful, loved the frosted glass wall separating the bedroom.The breakfast was nice and a good selection of cereal, hot food, bread, cakes, fruit, cold meat, cheese etc.The staff were all very friendly and helpful.The concierge lady was a great help booking our last minute helicopter trip and our airport transfer.The hotel was very clean, we would definitely stay here again.The location is brilliant so near to everything, Times Square, Rockefeller, Bus station, subway. We walked to Empire State, Macy’s, Bloomingdales, we did loads of walking and loved being so central at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was nice. The staff seem nice. Paying $4000.00 for 8 days I expected a whole lot more....like a room, not a closet. When me and my wife arrived, things were ok until we found out only one of us could eat breakfast. Really? While checking in, the clerk informed us that breakfast was for one only. I complained and asked for the manager. He went to a back room and returned a few minutes later. He said the manager would give me 10% off the breakfast. Really? It got worse. We got to our room #2213. It was the size of a toilet.....I take that back. The actual toilet was bigger than the room. The dumb clerk gave us a handicapped room. It had a push button knob by the door. The bell clerk showed us how it works and guess what? It didn't work. The view from the room was spectacular but don't turn around. You're in a small closet again. We knew we couldn't stay there 8 days so we called the front desk. They said we had to pay for 8 days regardless if we stayed there or not. They told to call Expedia who we made the reservation and speak with them. We called Expedia the next morning who said that we would have to handle this through RIU. This went back and forth for three hours until I told my wife to write down everyone's first and last name and position. People started getting nervous. I won't waste your time with names of the riu manager, clerks, reservation person at Expedia and the their manager. But we begin to get through to somebody because RIU said we no longer have to pay for the remaining stay. Dah!We left the next morning heading to the Hotel Edison. It was a much better price and spacious room. The next 6 days were wonderful. If you don't mind getting screwed out of 4 grand...stay here. If you're a foreign tourist and don't know any better, stay here. I'm an american and I like my room to be large enough for two pair of shoes. I'd rather spend my money on a Broadway play. Oh yeah, the wifi really sucks.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Situated on the edge of Times Square the Riu Plaza is in the best place to visit everything in Midtown. A short walk to all the theatres and many attractions. The breakfast was the best we had ever had in this type of hotel. The bar was welcoming. Staff attentive and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at the Riu Times Square for 2 nights. The hotel is newly built and very modern. Great breakfast included for our price, great selection of food and wonderful coffee machine with all sorts of coffees. Amazing location around Times Square and near all the Broadway Theaters. I've been to NYC many times and this is the first time that I slept through the night without horns and sirens going off all night. I didn't hear anything all night long. Wonderful shower with great water pressure. 5 star all the way.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Love this hotel for the location and we had a family room for the 4 of us so the space was ample. What a fantastically placed hotel for tourists. It was a stones throw from Times Square, Broadway and the Theatre District. Ten to fifteen minute stroll east of the hotel puts you near to The Rockefeller Centre, St.Patricks Cathedral, Radio City and more. Madame Tussauds also close to the hotel. Comfortable but cosy rooms. Opaque glass wall and door to bathrooms are a modern twist to interior design. however there is a tiny void in the glass door and wall allowing your other guests in the room being able to see you use the toilet Nice large bed with comfy mattress ensured a great nights sleep every night for a week. Good breakfast selection available. Found all staff to be very helpful , polite and always had a smile. The hotel was nice and clean throughout.Definitely recommend.Overall good stay and I would use the hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Returned to the RIU for a second stay after having a good experience last year.The hotel seems a lot more established now as it seemed a lot busier than last year. The New York Marathon was on though so this may have had something to do with it.Love this hotel for the location and we had a family room for the 2 of us so the space was ample. It was an adjoining room and they definitely need thicker doors as you could hear people using the toilet and breaking wind, they were that thin The last time we stayed our room was in a small corridor of just 2 other rooms but this time we were on a long corridor totalling around 8 rooms and people are very disrespectful with slamming room doors and this was amplified by the echo of the stark halls so you were easily awoken at 5am as people started coming and going.We opted for the buffet breakfast this time too which was okay and was handy but we only used it a couple of times as we like to venture out early and try different places.Overall another good stay and I would use the hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: New modern hotel very close to Times Sq. which means the area, whilst central, is not the best. Great views. Rooms are clean appear spacious, however there is nowhere to store suitcases except under the bed! The room requires a mirror above the desk/table in the bedroom itself so you can dry hair or do makeup when partner is in the shower. Good choice for breakfast but food tended to be a bit cold. Friendly bell boys who were happy to arrange taxi to airport etc.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Took my son here for his 21st birthday we stayed 4th nov to 9th nov and it certainly wasn't cheap! Hotel is nice & modern but small and the location you cannot fault.However for 3 out of our 5 nights the room and corridor smelled strongly of weed which isn't great for a no smoking hotel! We reported this to reception each night and it wasn't until after the third night when Jose simply put his hand up to me and said yes were aware of the issue and we are dealing with it that it got resolved, they must have done lots of cleaning to get rid of it as it was so strong yet funnily enough they're now denying ever having a problem and are basically causing me of making it up!Floor 19 room 1916.I reported it at my check out to the manager who claimed there was nothing she could do and scribbled an email address down on a scrap of paper, I said but all they will do is come back to you and you could deny it and her reply was no madam as there are notes on your account.So I have done exactly as asked and no shock my reply from Riu is-'we have contacted the hotel manager and he informed us that they don't have any issue in the hotel with bad smell and that they did not receive any other customer feedback regarding bad smell in the hotel'Hmmm their english isn't even right and I never said it was a bad smell it was the drug weed.I work for the emergency services and know this for a fact.I am disgusted that Riu are not only accusing me of lying, the hotel staff at this hotel are obviously telling lies and covering this up which is appalling.I have been to a Riu hotel at least every year for the past ten years mostly in the Caribbean and I have spent a fortune with them, I am appalled that they think they can treat loyal customers this way.There were people near me when I checked out who witnessed this and there were surely other people who were affected. Hopefully someone will speak up on here to confirm although shouldn't really have to as Riu should be honest.I will take this matter further, one very unhappy customer.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On arrival we were asked if we were ok with heights as we were on the 25th floor! Took me a while to get used to the drop below!! But the view was great.The room was on the small side but clean, comfortable and adequate for us.The buffet breakfast had plenty of choice, what ever time we went down we could always find a table cleared and cleaned. We ate dinner in the restaurant which was nice and quite reasonable, the service was good.The checking in and out was very easy and quick. All the members of staff seemed very friendly and helpful.The hotel is situated in an ideal location for visiting different tourist attractions, if I visited New York again I would definitely use this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked 2 rooms for last saturday and couldnt have picked a better hotel in a prime location. First the hotel is Clean, Modern, had everything we needed. I work in the industry so I can be a bit critical but I must say I was very impressed. I requested a high floor and got it. The rooms are not large but so well lit and lovely that it felt larger than it is. Staff nice and the breakfast was delicious and the staff cleans the tables so fast you better hold on to your coffee cup. We will definetly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: There were 3 of us in our family party so our room had 2 double beds.Lots of room not cramped at all.Shower was hot and powerful, the usual shampoos etc and towels.We were on the 5th floor the only problem could be the access to lifts at peak times.breakfast was included and you could queue sometimes but get quickly seated.Food was good, hot breakfast and cereals too. Gallons of juices and coffee.We got a yellow cab from the Airport to the hotel but, for a few dollars more, we had the shuttle take us back when we were leaving.Foyer is large and spacious, reception desks are on one side, seating areas on the other.Hotel restaurant was comfortable serving up a good meal in a pleasant atmosphere.We would go again :-)
user_name:
michaeltL9524XG
South East England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After much research we booked 3 nights at the Doubletree Suites in Times Square because we wanted to be "close to the action" and hopefully get a great view of the lights below. We got both, but after walking past the Riu Plaza and taking a look inside, we quickly changed our plans and checked out of the Doubletree after one night, and stayed the second two nights here.First off, the location of this hotel can't be beat. You are literally a block from Times Square but a million miles away from the riff raff. Forget about the tourists, you are heckled every step of your way through Times Square by bus tour peddlers, would-be rappers trying to "give" you their CDs, and characters dressed in costumes attempting to con you into taking a picture with them. It's too much for anybody, any age.So, a block away (7th is a primary arterial street through Times Square) on 8th Street, literally across the street from at least 10 theaters, you can pay the same price to stay at this brand new, hip, clean hotel with plenty of modern amenities.The breakfast buffet is excellent - plenty of options to choose from and plenty of seating capacity. We showed up both mornings around 9:30 and had no problem getting a seat either day.The lobby is a great place to hang. It has a really distinct, fresh smell, similar to some of the nicer hotels in Las Vegas but without the cigarette smoke. We spent at least a few hours at various points just sitting and chilling out in the lobby, watching people.Riu is an international company and this and their property in Miami are their only US hotels, and it shows. There was a distinctly international feel and I say that in a good way.About the rooms - they are small, but very modern, very sleek, and really all you need. The views from any side of the hotel are outstanding - facing west, you look over Hell's Kitchen and the Hudson River. Facing East, you look towards Times Square and can see plenty of theaters and lights. The busy 8th street below is also fun to watch.Beds are comfortable. About 100 tv stations to choose from. Shower worked great and the water was quite warm.I'm not sure how long prices will stay as they are here, so take advantage while you can! We will definitely choose this hotel again as the location provided for a great alternative to Mid-town, if you want to be up closer to the Theater District.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very central to Times Square and all surrounding tourist areas. Room was very clean and adequate for our needs. Breakfast had everything you could have wished for. Bar in the evening was perfect after a day sightseeing. Would definitely return to this hotel if returning to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great stay as part of our honeymoon. Very clean room. Small but what do you expect in NYC! Lots of choice at breakfast. On check out asked concierge to book us a taxi. They advised us to ask the bell boy which we did. He went to the main street to flag a taxi (or so we thought). When he can back he said taxi is €75 plus tip. When we challenged him on it, he kept saying that was the price to the airport. When asked directly if it was a yellow cab, he eventually admitted it wasnt. As we know new york we know the cost to the airport is €55 plus tip!! Be careful you don't get scammed. Very disappointing that this hotel let's this happen. Otherwise recommend- 5min walk to broadway but quiet enough to sleep!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I think my review is driven by personal taste more than anything. No denying that this hotel is is a great location and just one block away from Times Square and a short distance from bars, eateries and broadway shows. I think my issue is the decor which may sound somewhat petty. I like my hotels to be warm and comforting and a home away home for my stay. I think the issue here is the decor is very modern and aiming at a funky vibe. The rooms though functional are stark and clinical looking. They are functional and clean but there is no feeling or warmth to them instead they are like a boutique style hotel aiming at a particular crowd. Staff are friendly and we ate breakfast here each morning. Food is good, fresh and well laid out for the breakfast buffet. It's a good hotel just not to my taste.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I attended a wedding this weekend at the Hotel. While there were problems with the check in because the room s were not ready, the experience was made up for by the house keeping staff, specifically the maid Jacqui. We strayed on the 18th floor and even though there were numerous people attending this and other affairs, Jacqui went out of her way to ensure that our stay was stress free and as relaxing as possible. The stress associated with the wedding and everything was a bit much for my Grandmother and was taking its toll on her. Jacqui immediately recognized this. Through her genuine caring, concern, knowledge and expertise, Jacqui was able to alleviate what would have been a very stressful situation and in stead turned the affair into one of the best times my family has had. She is a true asset to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: An excellent trip to New York. The Rui plaza is in a brilliant location. 5 minutes from the centre of Times Square and the theatres.The hotel was stunning, staff friendly and helpful. Only thing we were staying 5 nights and no shelves to put clothes. A few hangers in the wardrobe and two drawers either side of the bed. Bar area was stunning. Bar prices quite high but they do have some cocktails all day on happy hour half price and house wine.Breakfast was really good very busy but well restocked and plenty of choice.We felt very safe in New York bearing in mind we were out the day after people had been run over which is very sad.It is by no means cheap as people had led us to believe. Luckily we had taken plenty of dollars.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from NYC and stayed in this hotel for three nights.The room was minimalistic but had everything you needed. HD tv iron safe etc, could have done with a kettle. Lovely big bathroom.Very clean with confortable bed. We had breakfast included and the breakfast was absolutley superb. I’d go so far as to say one of the tastiest I’ve had in a hotel.The location of the hotel is excellent within the Times Square location.We took their taxi back to the airport and this was worth the extra cost. Staff very pleasant and our stay there was faultless. wIfi is free and super fast. How it should be. The outside was extremely noisy, but that isn’t the fault of the hotel. You are in a big city.We were so tired we could have slept through anything. This hotel is highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location convenient but . . . 1. Interior space antiseptic and cold; vinyl glue flooring throughout; one strip popping up in our room. Bed would slide since no carpeting anywhere. No space for bags except under the bed. Room small. 2. Our room faced 8th Ave: music from nearby club playing till 4 AM. Ugh!3. Bar in main lobby cool but took last drink orders Friday night at 11:30 - huh?4. No clock/alarm in room5. Off site parking: $50 per night

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really clean and modern hotel centrally located in Times Square. First time in NYC and staff were great, happy hours were really good, clean rooms and great views. Lifts super quick and breakfast had abundant choice of food and drinks. Very good hotel compared to one we went or see which was double the price double the drinks prices and dated Stay here I would highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here Monday to Friday for my boyfriends 30th. The hotel looked lovely from the lobby but the rooms weren’t as nice as I thought they would be, the corridor looked like student accommodation which was very simple. The room itself was ok, a bit on the small side but as we only really needed it to sleep in it did us. The one thing that did stand out in the room was the glass that was a partition between the room and the shower, when someone got up to go to the toilet in the night it lit up the whole room and also you could see the other person in the shower which was ok for us but if you are with a friend it wouldn’t be so nice! The hotel staff weren’t overly friendly when approached. As I said it was my boyfriends 30th birthday and I asked if we could order a cake for him as a surprise I was told “we don’t do cakes but if he has handed in his passport at check in then we will know and a card and chocolates will be delivered to your room”. Well it came to Wednesday which was his birthday and nothing!! I feel like they can’t really be bothered to do anything out of their way to make it a memorable stay for guests. Overall it was a good base and bed for the night but apart from that I wasn’t overly impressed!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Hotel riu plaza for 5 nights.This was the first time visiting New York.The hotel was modern,clean had great views from the room and served great breakfast with a lot of choice.The hotel is in excellent location,in Times Square.Most sites are within walking distance.There is also hop on/ off bus tour just opposite the hotel that has many routes around manhattan.I would recommend getting the city pass if you are wanting to visit all the main attractions.We also booked Statue of Liberty on the official website before we went and managed to book to go up the pedestal which is the same price as just visiting liberty Island.We had a birthday card and truffles in our room as it was my partners 30th Birthday which was nice.I definitely would recommend this hotel you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a fantastically placed hotel for tourists. It was a stones throw from Times Square, Broadway and the Theatre District. Hell's Kitchen was equally as close as was the restaurant district. Ten minute stroll north along 8th Ave puts you in Central Park. Ten to fifteen minute stroll east of the hotel puts you near to The Rockefeller Centre, St.Patricks Cathedral, Radio City and more. Madame Tussauds also close to the hotel as was the offices of The Big Bus Tour and collection point for New York Passes. Comfortable but cosy rooms. Opaque glass wall and door to bathrooms are a modern twist to interior design. Nice large bed with comfy mattress ensured a great nights sleep every night for a week. Good breakfast selection available. Found all staff to be very helpful , polite and always had a smile. The hotel was nice and clean throughout.The hotel bar was very good with competitive prices compared with nearby bars and restaurants. The restaurant was excellent and we dined there on two occasions. We had the 8oz and 12oz steaks which were first class. Definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel Riu Plaza is in a good location just off Broadway by Times Square, the rooms are beautiful, light and modern, very comfortable. During our tour of the States and Canada this was one of my favorite hotels to stay. We requested, before arrival, a room high up as before when I've stayed in NYC the noise level can be extreme in a not so insulated hotels. The location of the Riu was perfect to get around to all the sites of Manhattan. The bar was friendly and modern in design. The breakfast hours did get very busy.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has so many good points: It is almost in Times Square but despite this it is quiet. The staff are fantastic and that includes everyone from the receptionists ,the bell boys to the room cleaners.The rooms are spacious with beds that I want for my own home. I had the best sleep in ages! The hotel has a fantatic entrance hall.The buffet breakfast is belly bursting and the special lunch menu consisting of 3 courses for 14 $ is excellent value.I will be visiting this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel nipping clean and very modern. Room was an average bedroom size with a shower room . It had everything that was needed for a weeks stay. Hairdryer, which was very powerful, towels, soaps, iron board, safe, clothes hangers plus a fridge which was replenished with water every day. The queen size bed was exceptionally comfortable. We booked bed and breakfast, breakfast is not to be missed! The staff in hotel and extremely polite and can’t help you enough. The hotel is ideally situated it’s right on Time square and you can walk to all attractions from here or buy a two day hop on hop off, bus ticket and get to the attractions this way. This was our first visit to New York and we visited , Time square by day and night , 9/11 with tour guide, this was very emotional. Empire State Building , this is very high but amazing after I had stopped shaking! We had a boat tour around the Staue of Liberty and drove around Central Park on the bus tour . We went on an outlet store shopping trip, looking for bargain designer clothing, no bargains to be had what so ever! The clothes here, were so much more expensive than in England even with the exchange rate! All in all we have been there seen it, done it and loved it x

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was close to Times Square and the staff were friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean and tidy and the beds really comfortable. A must for serious sightseers. We were staying on a bed and breakfast basis, and we couldn't fault the breakfasts. Even though the hotel was busy, we didn't have to wait for a table and the food was constantly replenished. All in all, a very pleasant stay.
user_name:
Tess P
County Down, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Clean, modern, great location for Times Square and close to cruise pier. Breakfast was included in the rate so made the overall package reasonably priced. Top floor had good view across the river. Room was comfortable if slightly minimalistically furnished, quite small typical of NYC rooms. Big flat screen TV should you wish to watch the endless adverts.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stopped on in New York to break our flights up. The hotel was lovely massive lobby area. Check in was quick. Rooms were small but adequate nice sized bed and bathroom with shower. Great view of the city. Location was superb very close to Times Square lots of bars and restaurants and subway close by. Breakfast was somewhat hectic but hey it is New York it's a massive hotel. We didn't wait long for a table and there was a great selection. We paid a lot for this hotel and would suggest booking direct with the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice and clean hotel, very close to Times square, Broadway... the rooms are very confortable, the customer service was excellent, very friendly staff, Zoraida at the reception took the time to explain to us how not to get lost in Manhattan ;)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is really good hotel and I enjoyed to stay there for two nights. Staff was very friendly, smiling and eager to help. My room on the 22nd floor was clean and fresh looking. A small fridge, a safety box and ironing items made my life much easier there. In the price was included very reach by the North America’s hotels standards buffet breakfast.The hotel has great location - at the corner of 8 Ave and 46 St. and this is just one block from Times Square and in a very close proximity to the variety of theaters. The 42 St. Port Authority Bus Terminal and the A, C, E subway lines are just walking distance away. There are also affordable and good Italian, Brazilian, Spanish, French and Thai restaurants along the 46 Street.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a great hotel, with a friendly atmosphere, in a great location close to Times Square. Very clean and modern. We stayed on the 26th and the views were amazing! We had dinner in the bar/restaurant a couple of times and thought the food pretty good!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights end of October 2017.The hotel is lovely, very much a boutique feel to it. All the staff are great, especially those in the Fashion Bar.The drinks and food is also a good price compared to others in the vicinity. The location of the hotel is great with everything on your doorstep.The rooms are gorgeous and the beds extremely comfortable. I can only pick two faults and that is the hairdryer provided and the lack of a mirror in the bedroom- the hairdryer is more of a travel hairdryer attached to the wall in the bathroom and all it did was burn my hair. I would expect a hotel of this calibre to supply decent hairdryer that can be used with a mirror in the bedroom , away from the moisture in the bathroom.Otherwise, highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Recently my husband and I spent a week in New York and our accommodation at the Riu Plaza was exceptional. The rooms were very spacious and the staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. The buffet breakfast provided each morning was totally adequate and the choices of food were excellent. As for the location, well where else would you rather be when visiting New York but close by Times Square? Overall I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great clean,large room with great views across to the west port, good buffet breakfast, and a good bar which also serves food, this is a very central hotel on 46th street close to Times Square and the theatre district, and there are various restaurants close to the hotel the rooms were quiet too

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very modern hotel for NYC, cannot find fault with anything, all staff very friendly, breakfast busy but plentiful and varied choice..... Set us up for whole day, fashion restaurant lovely food and good value, cocktails moreish... Room little on small side but only used to sleep in. Bathroom had large walk in shower, all spotlessly clean! Frosted glass wall not an issue. Location ideal central to most things. Only returned yesterday after 5 day visit now planning return trip for next year!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a week here and first impressions weren’t that favourable but it grew on us as the week went on. When we checked in we were charged a “facility fee” for the use of their gym and lounges to which we objected. However it turned out this was the compulsory tourism tax which everybody has to pay so why did they refer to it as a facility fee for the hotel? Next morning we battled down for breakfast along with the hordes and were shown to a table, given a place mat and left to queue for coffee, bread, cheese, ham and fruit. The queuing took ages and the noise was incredible, but the quality of the food was good and everything was spotless. On our way back to the bedroom on the 26 th floor we spotted a little lounge which we could open with our key card so from then on we breakfasted in that lounge where there were tubs of fresh fruit salad, croissants, ham and cheese plus jugs of hot coffee, tea and water. Apparently we had been given an upgrade to the 26 th floor and this lounge was part of the deal. I would say the upgrade was essential to our stay in the hotel and made all the difference. If you can afford it go for it! The position of the hotel is near enough Times Square to be readily accessible a couple of minutes away and all the city bus tours start a block away, but far enough away to be quieter and miss most of the traffic noise. The advantage for hotel Riu is location and the fact that breakfast is included which for NY is unusual, rooms are small but clean and there is an outdoor patio with seating area plus I believe a gym which I managed to avoid.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has a fantastic location, delicious breakfast, well equipped clean rooms and really helpful staff! My partner and I really enjoyed our stay and will definitely return. I can very easily recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was recommended by our travel agent and it was ideal for our first visit to New York. Good location near all attractions but farcaway from the bustle and noise. We had quite a good sized room with two double beds and a sofa bed. Breakfast was included and had everything you needed which made a good start to the day.Staff were all friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel for first time visitors. There is good wifi you get the passcode when you check in and are able to hook up four devices. All main bus tours have a stop near by. We found Top View to be the most affordable and you can barter with the ticket sellers for a better price. A great way to get round New York. The hotel has many places around for something to eat. We were able to leave our luggage on the day we were leaving with the concierge. You can also pay an additional $40 and have a late check out of 4pm. Check out was 12 pm which worked well for us

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Rooms and facilities all spotlessly clean. Excellent breakfast with lots of choice, only negative is how busy it is, although not a huge issue.Great location.Would recommend and would happily stay here again on any future trips!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights.Great hotel in a very central location. Modern, stylish.Every member of staff we encountered was helpful, friendly and professional.The reception staff were welcoming and efficient - sometimes processing large numbers of guests with ease.The guys that helped with the luggage were great. If you arrive early they will take care of your cases until your room is ready. Then they will deliver them up to you room when ready.Happy hour in the bar was 3pm-8pm - discounted cocktails and wine. Breakfast is as described in other reviews - plentiful buffet self service. Food constantly being replenished. Very busy but did not feel rushed to move. This set us up for the day!We stayed on 23rd floor - corner room with great views. Free WiFiVery comfortable bed.Mini fridgeSafe.Flat screen TVAir ConDouble wardrobe, bedside drawersIron and ironing board.Great shower - complimentary shower gel, shampoo and conditionerBathroom also had a magnified shaver mirror.Great location for many restaurants, theatres, Times Square, Central Park, Hudson River.The HOHO bus guys do descend on you as soon as you walk out of the hotel but don't pursue you. If you want to use them don't take the first price offered - barter for a discount.Will definitely use this hotel again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: New clean comfortable 4 Star hotel 4 minutes walk from time square good breakfast good service recommended for comfortable stay and acceptable price, view from the room very nice just to know room not big but it’s ok will return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights this is my 6th visit to New York stayed in a few different hotels but this one tops the list. Lovely modern hotel rooms aren't huge but do the job. First time I've ever had breakfast included and it was definitely a bonus a plentiful buffet with lots of choices and it was tasty. Brilliant location only a 5 min walk to times sq and in a street full of restaurants pity we couldn't try them all. If I ever do return would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited here for 3 day’s before going on a cruise to Nassau and the Bahamas. The location was so convenient, the hotel only opened this year. The beds were superb and the rooms bright and clean. Some people may not like the modern glass bathroom cubicle, but we both liked it. The breakfast buffet was excellent and highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in a great location only 2 blocks from Times Square but a little away from the really busy area. We found the staff to be very helpful. We had emailed to ask for a high room as it was our anniversary. We got a room on the 27th floor and we also received a bottle of sparking wine from the hotel. You can walk to anywhere in the Midtown area within 30 minutes and Times Square and Broadway are 5 minutes away. The rooms are comfortable and of typical City center size but the bed is comfortable and the hot water instant.The buffet breakfast is good and plentiful. We went to the smaller dining room where the bar is during the day as the other one is huge and a little like a school dining room, it also opens before 7:00.The only hiccup was on our final full day the cleaner did not arrive until 5:00 when we were just getting ready to go out for a meal and then a show. The cleaner was very apologetic and gave us fresh towels etc.You are on Restaurant Row with lots of choice. I can recommend Swing 46 in the same street. Food is Ok but has a great swing band and atmosphere.I would certainly use again and recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel is just perfect. Situated a mere stone's throw from Times Square, the hotel is luxurious, welcoming and we really enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was included in our hotel and it did not disappoint, with a range of continental and American foods, both savoury and sweet. The reception staff and concierge were only too happy to help. We stayed on the 27th floor and we will definitely be back again, owing to its convenient location slap bang in the middle of the Theatre District.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here last week and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is modern and "up market" with efficient friendly staff and good facilities. You get a better rate if you book B&B as they charge $21.00 plus 8.875% tax for breakfast. Breakfast is buffet style with lots of choices from fruit, cereals, porridge through all sorts of breads, pancakes, waffles to bacon, sausages and eggs. The room was clean and comfortable and you can have your bedding changed every day if you want to. All rooms have air con. The hotel has a bar and restaurant as well as a "grab & go" take away section. We eat in the restaurant on one of our nights there and found the food to be reasonable priced although at $8.00 for a pint of beer (currently around £6.25) it was a little pricey . Walk left out of the hotel, cross 8th Ave and you are at the theatre district & Times Square within 3 mins. We would stay here again if in New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived in a prebooked über , we paid for the tolls but he didn't actually use the toll so we got riddled there but hey ho, we only noticed on the way back, lolThe hotel itself was fantastic it had every thing we needed, to took our own kettle and cups as reviews had said that they didn't supply any so that was fine, although downstairs is a coffee shop which is lovely, the room is adaquate for what we needed , to sleep and get clean and dressed In, perfect location for everything, we ate in the restaurant at breakfast time which , yes it was busy but you could always find somewhere , it was definitely worth the extra for breakfast as it set us up for the day until dinner time in the evening where we either ate out or back in the restaurant, not bad prices and food was great.The staff here are so helpful and friendly and will go out of their way to help you in anyway they can, we bought the top view bus tickets which is a on/ off hopper , absolutely brilliant and well worth the money, ( bargaining ) obviously got an extra day thrown in.All in all a very present stay and we will definitely be coming back to this hotel when we visit New York again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location is superb, near Hell's kitchen and Times Square, plus the Grayline hop on hop off service is around the corner. Its worth 5 stars for the location, however after reading how friendly the staff are, I would disagree (not all staff its fair to say) - having had a very long day travelling we were met with a very CBA attitude by a receptionist when booking in, she even tried to get the young good looking man behind us to push in instead of booking us in - she was ridiculous and immediately tarnished our opinion of the hotel. Other staff were OK but nothing more, apart from the bar staff and bell boys who could not do enough to please. Concierge seemed disinterested and not useful at all! Breakfast was very good, lots of choice but go early (pre 8.00 am) as it gets very busy in the enormous dining room, and the bathroom glass box not a problem for us, I would use this hotel again though due to the location!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: average hotel experience.. we stayed on the 28th floor.The check in takes too long for too many people - it needs to be slicker for those waiting to be served and those being served. i didn't come to New York to stand in line checking in. The Room was quite small the stark white walls are - well- stark. the one thing about white painted wall though is it must be easy to keep it looking fresh - so why were there big black marks on it. if it was wall paper that was damaged , thats not so easy and somewhat forgivable but they are WHITE WALLS - these should be kept looking like its a well respected hotel chain which is not the impression given. ON OUR SECOND DAY.... remember those check in queues i told you about. we had bought a couple of coffees to drink in our room after a long day out seeing the sights. but when we got to our room we were LOCKED OUT. bad enough that the reception staff cant do a simple thing like keep you checked in and stop you entering the room you've paid for but it took 20 mins to get any attention because of waiting in line at the reception desk. the queue wasn't even long. i was the next one to be served. and because there was no formal queue infrastructure there were people who were looking to push in - i had to be a bit attentive to make sure i didn't loose my place. again poor management. Breakfast - all i can tell you is GET THERE EARLY... otherwise its the all too familiar queue.Overall - nothing to write home (or a good review) about

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited NYC for the 1st time as a couple and thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night visit and the RIU Plaza. The hotel was very convenient with Times Square just a block away, right on Restaurant Row and the Theater district. We are very familiar with the RIU brand and this location was much the same. Check-in was fast and efficient. We arrived at 10 AM, stored our bags and were told a room should be ready by 12:30, much before the advertised check-in time of 3 PM. We walked around the area and returned about 12:30 to be told our room was ready and our bags would be delivered. That was especially nice since had been touring the Northeast states for 8 days, lugging around 4 bags to different hotels each day. We had a beautiful room on the 19th floor with a corner location so we had views to the East toward Times Square and the South toward Midtown and the Lower Manhattan. The room was very quiet, bed firm and comfortable and everything functioned as specified. We did not sample the breakfast buffet since we took advantage of a special RIU Class offer that didn't include that, but there are plenty of places close by to get a quick breakfast. And we were able to walk less than a block all 3 nights to great restaurants right on 46th between 7th and 8th. Plus the theater where we had booked a play was a short 2 block walk.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel is great, especially if you want to go to the theatre and get around mid town Manhattan as only 4 blocks either way to a subway. The bed was very good as was the blackout curtains etc making for a good night's sleep. The bathroom was a good size with a good walk in shower but it does have a frosted glass wall and so you can see a shadow of whoever is in the shower which could be embarrassing for some but we were OK. The bathroom also has a sliding door which is good for going to the loo in the night, but it does not lock/click, so useful to know in advance.The room itself was a good size for New York, and relativity quiet for sleeping given its location but I used ear plugs as you can still hear sirens/car horns etc even on the 26th floor - think a river facing room would be quieter than one on 46th ST or 8th AVE. The views were also good of Times Square (of overlooking 8th street) and of the Hudson River is located on the opposite side of the hotel. It's good to get a room on a higher floor to get the better views and to get in the lift, if you're on a much lower floor the lift is often full by the time it gets there, so you have to wait longer. On arrival after a very long day/flight, the receptionist was not at all welcoming, not even 'hello' which we found rude as was her manner when we were signing in - luckily most of the other staff were far friendlier.We had been upgraded and so got a slightly larger room, which was good as most of the space is taken up by the very large beds, and so there's little drawer space. Luckily I'd read a previous review, and so took extra clothes hangers - which were welcome as we got about 6 each otherwise. Also the room did not have coffee/tea facilities, so we took a travel kettle, which could run on 240 and it did, but a lot slower than when used in the UK. There is a fridge, which is empty apart from water, as it's for cooling your drinks etc, (it's not a mini bar) but it's not got a freezer section and there's no ice machines on the floors, which is very strange for an American hotel. The space was fine for our holiday but the 'desk' would have been small if there for work.The queues for breakfast were long and so we went out to local diners for breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A well located busy hotel near Times Square. Friendly approachable staff, clean rooms and great breakfast choice. Happy to return on next trip. Hotel bar was welcoming and lively and there was also a ood selection of nearby restaurants on 46th Street, especially Brasil Brasil.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a nice modern hotel on West 46th Street (restaurant row) between 8th & 9th.Great location. 11 short block walk to Madison Square Gardens. 1 1/2 block walk to Times Square.Nice modern rooms ... quietLots & Lots of restaurants and bars nearby.Valet parking and self parking nearby.Breakfast included in the room rate was good ...lots of choice.RIU is known for its Caribbean resort hotels ... front desk people were multilingual English & Spanish (probably other languages too)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Although the rooms are small, they are very modern and comfortable. Staff has been helpful and friendly. I love the location, everything in NYC is in close proximity. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is just awesome. Located very close to Times Square less than a 5min walk along 46west street. We had 4 nights here and didn't have one complaint against the hotel, check in was straightforward, staff were polite and courteous and even granted us with a top floor room looking onto 8th avenue and across 46w street. I'd read previously about comments on noise, ok regardless of where you are in New York there is noise but this is part of the experience. We had our window open on the first night and yes we did here the tooting of horns and vehicles etc but after that we had the window shut and the turned on to keep the room cool enough problem solved.Room was perfect for the both of us it was the double and we still had enough room with shopping we had bought, we didn't find the frosted glass between the shower and our room a problem you could tell someone was using it but that's about it.Breakfast was great, we ate he twice and ate out twice which was part of our experience. The hotel price on drinks is no different to what other restaurants were charging so again it wasn't an issue.Again if your wanting a hotel in a great location for bars and restaurants and close to Times Square and Broadway look no further. If we come back to New York then I would definitely consider coming back to the hotel as it ticked all the boxes we wanted.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a four day break, modern bright central. Walking distance of Central Park ,Macys,Empire state, and the Rock, right in the middle of all the Shows, or if on budget just walk around Time Square in evening great street entertainment. Our room was on the sixth floor,but did not get any street noise, great bedrooms and shower, and breakfast that fills you up for all day outings, would stay again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently stayed at the Riu Plaza one night before and one night after a cruise, the hotel was recommend by the cruise company (Scotlands Cruise Club)We were travelling with friends so it was important that we all enjoyed our stay, we need not have worried, from the minute we walked in we were made welcome and the staff were all friendly.Our room was modern and very clean, not the biggest but adequate, the bathroom was clean and had a large walk-in shower but no bath.The bar was also a modern place with an extended 'Happy Hour' and with the exception of the Gin& tonic which was outrageously priced the Cocktails were reasonable. The location was perfect, close enough to Times square yet slightly detached from the hustle and bustle, just right.We were on a bed and breakfast deal and this was the only criticism we had, although the food was good the place was just too busy and not a relaxing experience as it should be.That said we and our friends had a great time in a lovely Hotel with loads of restaurants on the doorstep, I would recommend the Riu Plaza Times Square to my friends and family.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel, lovely restaurant, and very well situated for just about everywhere (all within walking distance) Staff were helpful and we were able to book a late check out which gave us time to revisit Central Park before our flight

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent clean and Modern Hotel in Superb location for Times Square and other tourist landmarks. Subway station 5 mins walk from Hotel. Small but very clean rooms cleaned on a daily basis, staff very friendly. Buffet style help yourself breakfast very good kept us going to mid-afternoon.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights and was a great location for sight seeing in New York. Short stroll to Times Square with great bars and restaurants nearby. Decor was very modern but comfortable and there was plenty of space in the family room for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Breakfast was included in the price which was a big bonus considering the prices in New York! Would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to go back one day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in the perfect location for anything and everything. Just a few minutes walk to the hustle and bustle of Time square, but also far enough away from the noise. We stayed in room 2722 on the 27th Floor and the street noise was minimal. You will always hear sirens and fire engines etc, that's just the way New York is. I would recommend the meals in the Fashion restaurant, they are very reasonably priced for a Hotel and better quality than Hard Rock Diner & TGIs etc. I would also recommend to go for breakfast before 7-30am, otherwise you will be queuing. The breakfast is spot on and all fresh and something for everyone, even the fussiest of eaters. It was my husbands birthday and our 30th wedding anniversary whilst we were there and the staff wished him happy birthday at breakfast, and for our anniversary, there were chocolates and champagne and a card waiting in our room on arrival, which was a lovely touch. All in all a perfect hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel. Great central location just off Times Square. Very clean, good sized rooms and public areas. Helpful staff. Cafe on site for breakfast, very nice. Would highly recommend. Would book again when in New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I stayed at the Riu Plaza for a recent family engagement in the city and reached the consensus that the hotel caters to European travelers and is not preferable for American travelers. This is not necessarily a bad thing, but it is not what we expected. The breakfast has a European flair (aside from being only average tasting) and the rooms are very small. Said rooms also include a semi-transparent shower, so don't get a room with people you aren't very comfortable with.In regards to the service, they appear greatly understaffed and were not consistently prompt with satisfying our needs. For one, we had a plumbing issue in our bathroom one morning as we were trying to get ready to go out for the day. We used the room phone to call the front desk, and after explaining the issue twice, were told a maintenance person was coming. Nearly 15 minutes later, having seen no such individual, we called a second time to reiterate the urgency that we could not use the bathroom precisely when we need to. A maintenance man arrived shortly after and fixed the problem.The subsequent day, when we wanted to check out, we again experienced service difficulties. We were told to dial 0 for the valet to ask for our car. This did not work, so we called the front desk and also asked for a porter to bring a cart to our room and help with our bags. Almost 20 minutes later, no porter, so we arduously gathered all of our belongings by ourselves and went downstairs. Once downstairs, we learned that our car wasn't exactly "on it's way," so we spoke with the valet and asked them to get the car, which arrived nearly 45 minutes later. We originally called downstairs at 10:30 in an attempt to be on the road at 11. Thanks to the service, we left the hotel closer to noon.Having said all of this, I would like to highlight some examples of exceptional service. Two members of the valet team, Carlos and Edwin, exhibited what I expect in a luxury hotel. Upon checking in, Carlos came out to our car with a cart, helped us unload all of our bags, had someone take the car for us, took our bags upstairs, and helped us unload them all within 10 minutes. On top of that, he was exceptionally friendly and professional. The next day, when the hotel experienced an emergency maintenance issue, we went downstairs to the lobby to inquire about the messages played on the hotel intercom. Once there, no one seemed sure what was going on and the elevators were shut down. Upon finding Carlos, he explained everything he knew and showed stairs to return to our room.During our checkout valet fiasco, we met Edwin about 40 minutes into our wait. Hearing of our circumstances, he took our valet ticket, spoke with a couple staff members and assured us the car was on its way. While we waited, he was very sociable and explained what may have been taking so long. The car arrived shortly afterward and he helped load our car. Without Edwin, we may have been waiting another hour.So, in summary of the hotel:For European tourists, not American ones.They need more staff members and more immediate service when requested.Carlos and Edwin are champions of that hotel and I hope the managers recognize that. If you stay there, find them and ask for their help.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was quite disappointed in my stay. The room and service definitely was not worth $500/night. Well, maybe if you are European. That seems to be who they cater to. If not for Carlos ad Edwin, I would have given this hotel one star. The rooms are extremely small, all other employees are not helpful and in fact some were downright rude. I wanted a receipt for my stay but the woman insisted I did not need it and would not give me one. I needed a bellhop to help with luggage on departure, but I guess Carlos was no working at the time and Edwin was busy out front. It took an hour to get our car and that was only after Edwin was persistent. We called for it as directed o the slip we were given at arrival. The number did not work. We called the front desk and was told "yes, that number doesn't work." hmmmm. We had breakfast included but one day had to argue that fact before we got it. The fire alarms went off and after 5 min were told they were investigating, but never said we should evacuate, stay in our room, etc. Oh, and this is a no smoking hotel which is great, but all the European's stand right outside the hotel doors and smoke that you have to go through a fog to get in and out.I would not recommend this hotel especially for the price.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights... great hotel, central, easy walking distance to all we needed. Room small but comfortable, cases fitted under bed. We didn’t have a bathroom with a shower screen into the room so can’t comment on that. Breakfast lovely so many choices, can have coffee to go! Staff lovely, cocktails of the day great value before we headed off out. Everywhere clean and a great view from the 27th floor room we had. Overall very happy with hotelChoice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed as a couple for 5 nights early Oct, celebrating hubby’s 60th. We were on a top (28th)floor (room 2806) which has fantastic views. Nice size bed, lovely bathroom, fridge and iron. Plenty of space for clothes. Hotel is very clean and modern. Breakfast buffet busy but a good selection and staff obliging. Had one evening meal there - lovely food but a bit pricey. Loads of places to eat out - Connolly’s Irish pub in nearby 45th St. very good. Right near Times Sq and theatres. Close to Central Park but plenty of Metro stations if you don’t want to walk miles. Lovely cafe within hotel foyer for snacks and drinks. No tea or coffee tray in room though. Would visit again and highly recommend.
user_name:
Andrea B
Preston, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We just stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and we had an awesome stay. It is situated at a good location, right at the Times Square, close to the city sight seeing bus stops. Some of the attractions are at close proximity, can walk to places but we took the sight seeing busses and realised that we could have even walked. The staff at the door were very helpful, organised taxis and helped us get tickets for the sight seeing buses at a cheap price just outside the hotel. Hell's Kitchen is just next door offering so many eating places. We read a lot of bad reviews about breakfast but we were not disappointed any day. Breakfast was very good. Staff attending were really nice. Our room was very well made every day. The only downside was that the room was quite small but looking at every other thing, this is minute and can be compromised. I will definitely return to stay here. Very clean and new hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The room looked better than the pictures & I had a room for under $200 but now I see their prices are sky high. Its worth it though if you want a convenient area & some great service plus the higher floor I was on had a beautiful view.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just home from a 5 night stay at hotel with my 12yr old daughter & it was fabulous! Great location for sightseeing & shopping, nicely decorated & spotless. Staff very friendly & go out of their way to help. Would defo recommend staying here!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just spent 4 nights at Riu Plaza on Times Square - lovely stay - comfortable hotel, friendly and helpful staff, food lovely and reasonable prices, close to all the action. Would definitely stay there again if I got chance to go to New York again and would strongly recommend this hotel to others. Thank you for contributing to a fantastic holiday.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is very modern but the rooms are very small. It has not been open that long so don't assume the cab driver will know where it is as we did. As is the whole of NYC roads are worse than manic, fortunately we picked up our car on departure. On that note, National / Alamo is only a block away. Which brings me to location. The RIU is ideally situated for both Broadway, Empire State Building and Times square. We very easily took the underground to Liberty Island and the tour bus stop is nearby. Breakfast was reasonable save for US choice, but busy. Concierge was useless, we obtained better help & advice from the bel staff. Despite room size this hotel stacked up to the international RIU standard we are used too. I would recommend

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I found the hotel to be clean, front desk to be very polite and the location was just perfect! Bathrooms were a great size as were the rooms. Free breakfast was actually quite tasty and a bonus. Will definitely come back!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our first time in New York. But this hotel had everything we could ask for. The location was the best. Located between Times Square and Hells Kitchen. We walked one block and was in the middle of the crazy (good) Times Square or we walked in the opposite direction and we were in Hells Kitchen where we could pick from dozens of great restaurants. Central Park was also in walking distance. But if you then wanted to walk around most of Central Park it turns out to be along walking day. We walked approx 25 km one day doing just that and doing the American Museum of Natural History on the same day.We had a Deluxe Room with 2 Double Beds. It was great with a good view. It was clean, spacious with a great bathroom.Front Desk Staff were very good. Helping us every time we asked. We got room service one night and it was wonderful.If you have breakfast included you are in for a treat. It is HUGE. There is Sooo much on offer and it is all yummy. There is no way you will go hungry. We sometimes ate so much that we did not have to worry about lunch while out and about. That's a bonus.By the way there are no negative points to report. We may have been lucky but I think it is because the Hotel is very professional.One thing you should know is New York is noisy. So when we did hear sirens at night it did not annoy us as it was just NY.I can recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location!! Rooms are small but clean and updated. Shower in bathroom but no tub. Lobby is very busy- people waiting for rooms, cabs, etc. Great breakfast but busy and crowded.What I liked best was the location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is situated in the perfect location in Times Square, New York City. No noise from outside could be heard once in the hotel. Brilliant wifi and breakfast in the hotel. Rooms are in great condition, very clean and modern. Very helpful staff and good value for it's excellent standard.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were in NYC for the secondTime. First time in the Riu Plaza. This is a great hotel, perfect rooms, all modern, you feel thatAll is built new. We ate twice in the restaurant, absolutely OK. Service is very friendly andHelpful, we will come again for sure if we come to NYC again. For us one of the very good hotels

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We travelled as 2 couples and stayed for 3 nights, each couple in a double room. The hotel was located within Times Square and was a good base for travelling around New York to see the sights. The room was clean and comfortable and the facilities were fit for purpose. The breakfast buffet included an excellent choice of both hot and cold food. The staff were polite and efficient. We enjoyed our stay at the Riu Plaza and would recommend it to other short break travelers.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the RIU Plaza on 28th September 2017 – 5th October 2017 (for 7 nights).On arrival (approximately 9:30pm), we were greeted by front desk staff with smiles. All staff were extremely helpful and we were checked in very quickly.Our room was 2704 with amazing views of NYC and the modern look of the room made it even more special.The purpose of this trip was to celebrate my Birthday and the hotel could not have given us a room with a better view!On my Birthday, chocolates and a postcard were left on our bed – this was a really kind gesture.Our room was cleaned to a very high standard each day and we absolutely loved the size of the TV. Storage space was okay and the safe seemed to be pretty secure.The shower is very powerful and always nice and hot. Beware of when showering as the person in the bedroom can see your shadow whilst in the shower.Breakfast was included in our stay and we could not fault the variety of food available. From continental to full cooked breakfast, there were enough options to not get bored eating breakfast here for a week.The breakfast areas can get very busy and it can be hard to get a table. You may also have to queue a couple minutes in the food queue.A word of advice – when allocated a table, leave something there to show that the table is occupied. We had an issue where we left our table to get our food and somebody had sat there whilst we were getting our food from the buffet. The coffee is amazing and the fact that they have take out coffee cups is great too! The bar in the hotel is also great – they offer a happy hour every day between 3-7pm ($8 per cocktail) and the drinks were great! The staff in the bar could be slightly friendlier but on the whole, good service!The location of this hotel is key! It is close enough to Times Square – 2/3minute walk but in a location where you feel you have got away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.There is a street food cart directly outside the hotel, if you are ever hungry and the whole street is full with bars, restaurants and souvenir shops.I will definitely be returning!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Centrally located for times sq and theatres . We were just 5 min walk from theatres . Room was stunning - like new .spacious ,clean . Staff very helpful -receptionists and bell hops all friendly as went out of way to help . We never made breakfast ...jet lag but handy cafe next door served breakfast which was included in the price . Good hotel for location and for helpfulness

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We travelled as a family of 6, four children aged 17-21 it was everyone's first time in New York. We had a family suite I think it was called. There was a king size bed in one room and two doubles in the other. Breakfast was included with the deal we booked and as it was a suite we had access to a lounge on one of the higher floors.The room was great there was enough space for what was essentially 6 adults and all of our suitcases etc. I was worried about the shower as the glass door had been mentioned in other reviews but it was fine it was very shaded you could not make anything out.
