The toilet was in a separate room and there was a double sink in the shower room. The breakfast was really good also we all over indulged everyday. In the lounger there was chairs, a tv, a fridge full of bottled water, soft drinks, fruit, ham, cheese. There were pastries and bread rolls but these were only replenished once a day. The location was amazing a couple of minutes away from times square and the bus tour we did literally had a stop across the road from the hotel. Penn station was a few minutes walk away also. The only annoying thing was they gave us wifi passwords for our entire stay for 4 devices and we had to get 2 passwords renewed on a daily basis but that only took 2 seconds walking through reception everyday. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, could not recommend the hotel enough, the staff were all lovely too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a perfectly located hotel in times Square, it's right on the corner of Restaurant Row (West 46th Street). As soon as you enter the hotel there is a beautiful scent to welcome you. Staff are very friendly and helpful.Room are spacious and well appointed, clean and quiet, you can hardly hear any noise from the street below.The breakfast is extensive and self serve, with staff clearing tables, the food is restocked often whilst breakfast is on.The Fashion bar on the ground floor have a fantastic happy hour and serve refreshing cocktails, it's a great place to people watch and unwind after a busy day.There is a busy vibe at this hotel given it's location and size, yet it has a boutique feel about it.The doormen were terrific at hailing cabs and handling luggage and always smiling.You are so close to some great bars and restaurants on West 46th Street and 9th Ave.I would not hesitate in recommending the Riu to family and friends and I look forward to staying here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked this hotel as it was new last year and looked good, but for what we paid was, I feel, it was over priced. I did ask check-in if they would give us a better rate as rates had dropped shortly before we arrived, they made their excuses and woul£not budge. Whilst it is very new and modern, the/our room was small. There are no facilities in room (coffee/tea maker), but there is a small fridge. The bathroom was adequate, however, when we arrived there were no toilet rolls, the shower door wouldn’t open. The maintenance man arrived quickly and between us we figured the reason why it didn’t open. Toilet rolls arrived too. Next day, no face cloths were left and hot water took a while to come through. The breakfast was good and have no complaints there. Overall, I would not stay there again as there at many other hotels in the vicinity that look better value. We will stick to the big chain hotels that we know. Oh! Finally the lifts were not working for an hour or two, fortunately we wanted to go down so had to use the fire escape stairs, glad we were not going up to the Room!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for three days on the 18th floor. When you walk into the hotel it is so peaceful and relaxing you wouldn't imagine that you have just walked off the busy streets of New York!! It's so modern and rooms are a decent size with all the amenities you'd need. From the room we had a view of Times Square through the buildings it was great and to top of the view my then boyfriend now fiancé went down on one knee at that very window!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: So good they named it twice!!!!!This was our first trip to the big apple and asked our travel agent for a centrally located hotel.Well she couldn't have found a better hotel. I booked a transfer from Newark airport on line and it was $20 each . Good value, perfect. Don't be afraid to use these transfer companies.As soon as we arrived at the hotel we were impressed. It has just been refurbished and is very impressive . Check in was easy and the view from the 25th floor was spectacular. The rooms are modern and contemporary. Spotless with large comfortable bed and lovely shower room.It is 2 blocks from Time Square and Broadway. Perfect. You can walk across Manhattan from the hotel . 6 blocks to the Concorde and aircraft carrier exhibit. Also 6 blocks the other way to the U.N. building. It is easily "do able", just take good walking shoes. Also Central Park is walkable but if you want to go all way round, hire a bike!!!!Use the concierge in the hotel foyer to book your transfer back to the airport. They were spot on. They have a secure luggage room to store all your bags, if like us, you have an evening flight. Do your own thing but you won't do better than stay at the Rui Plaza!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My partner and I arrived here on 22nd September for a 5 night stay. We arrived early and waited for a short period for our room to become available. The room was great. The bed was a king sized bed and very comfortable. The only drawback of the room was the shower was a glass frosted screen which you could see a silhouette of the person showering. This wasn't a problem for us as a couple but friends may find this uncomfortable. The room had an ironing board and iron available and a safe free for use. The hotel was quite loud in the corridors at times including regular fire alarm tests that continued for quite some time. It's reassuring they check the alarms but it also becomes annoying. The location of this hotel is amazing. Everything is within walking distance except the statue of liberty which was easy to get to. The concierge team were great at helping us out to locate sites. This holiday was the most amazing 5 days. The hotel was a great base to explore everything NYC has to offer. I wouldn't hesitate to book again.A final mention to Gindy. She checked us in and was very friendly. We appreciate her assistance in our room card issues which she sorted out without any concerns.Thank you to all the staff at Riu Plaza. You do a fantastic job.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was a nicely presented, clean hotel in a central location to Times Square. The check in staff were helpful and friendly and we feel the roomies were well priced. The only criticisms were that the corridors were noisy, as in you could hear people walking around, closing doors etc. Because of the floor surface. We also had access to a shared lounge on the 26th floor. This would have been great, except it was poorly stocked and frustrating to use. For example we would go to make some hot tea in the afternoon (we are British) and the hot milk that had been left out in the morning would have curdled into something resembling cottage cheese. So I would take the lift down to reception and ask for some cold milk. Reception world send me to the bar and the bar would send me to the cafe and the cafe would send me back to reception. After going through this farce several times I gave up and bought my own milk. But seriously, why not just leave some cold milk in the fridge?! Maybe hot milk is some American standard I just don't get, but after 2hours it's completely wasted. Why?!Apart from this it was a good experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here during our 5 night stay in NYC. A great location if you want to be able to walk to main attractions such as Times Square, Empire State Building, The Rockafeller and 5th Avenue. Breakfast everyday comes in the form of a Buffett. A very good selection which sets you up for the day. You can have this with the room or can pay each day if you are keen to sample stuff outside of the hotel. We had a good sized room with king sizeBed and a good size bathroom with an excellent shower. Air conditioning was great for the warm days and nights. The only slight problem was the fire alarm seemed to be tested quite regularly which was getting a bit annoying as it was a loud screech! Staff were very helpful and spoke a wide range of languages to help people from a wide range of countries. The concierge was very helpful in providing us with details of getting back to JFK on departure day. We would definitely use them again when we go again. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for a city break which covered both our 25th anniversary and my wife's 50th.The hotel is well placed for Times Square and the surrounding areas with easy access to the metro and port authority bus terminus on 42nd st (50th st metro is within easy walking distance also).Room was what you expect from Riu, clean modern with usual facilities. What was missing though was tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Staff we courteous, friendly and very professional. We had a room on the 23rd floor which had good views across the city and high enough up to avoid the street noise!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent rooms....excellent cleanliness, excellent bathroom excellent service. I would definitely return to this hotel...great location for bus tours, Times Square, Empire State any many more...Long Island ice teas are strong!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fabulous hotel Central to Times Square very clean staff excellent extremely helpful good for couples or families Had breakfast included and the food was great,hot food was hot and fruit was lovely and fresh . Thoroughly recommend for a lovely stay in the hustle & bustle of New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: just got back from a fantastic 4 day stay in new york. stayed at the riu plaza it was a lovely hotel,it was spotless,modern,rooms were beautiful.i e-mailed the hotel to ask for a high room for the amazing views and they gave us the 25th floor,it was incredible. the breakfast had something for everyone from cereals,ham,cheeses,coissants,eggs,sausage,bacon it was gorgeous. the staff were always there to help and all were very nice. the hotel is in an excellent location a block away from times square,i would stay here again in a heartbeat. new york is awesome.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I had to travel to NY for business meetings with clients so was booked at the RIU as it was within walking distance to most of the clients I needed to visit. Just off 8th Avenue so very central location. Easy to get around the city from here by cab or subway. RIU was a bit on the small side but fully functional and free WiFi was included. The breakfast buffet was included and was well stocked and the food was good, never had any issues finding an empty table in the dining room. Was on a high floor so had good views of the city and Hudson river. Was a bit surprised to find an aircraft carrier parked at the end of the street, which turned out to be the Intrepid Museum, would have loved to visit but didn't have enough time this trip. The other advantage of the high floors 28 and above was they have a private elevator so the wait is normally not onerous.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the RIU Plaza for a few days after a 2 week trans-Atlantic cruise. The hotel is in a great location near Times Square and Theatre district. To be honest things went downhill after this. Our room was tiny and the King bed virtually filled it. The only place to sit comfortably was on the bed. There is limited wardrobe space to hang clothes and only the drawers in the nightstand for any other clothes. The room was utilitarian with modern furniture which had sharp edges that I managed to scratch myself on. My biggest complaint is the fire alarm system. They are clearly having issues with it as it was constantly being tested, once in the middle of the night (unbelievable, but true). I would not stay at this hotel again unless I could be re-assured that the problem with the fire alarm has been resolved. There is no room service and we had to go down to the bar to get a cup of ice. We did not use the dining room, so can't comment on that. In conclusion I could not recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location handy for all Manhattan sites. Rooms great for focussed business trip and appreciated upgrade to balcony- great sites over NY at night. Staff attentive and helpful. All round acceptable but left with a feeling like any one of a dozen hotels within 5 minutes walk so stiff competition.Breakfast was rammed / this is a big hotel so preferred to take coffee across the street.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very close, but not too close from Times Square, close to all the amenities. You can walk to many restaurants, many attractions (rockerfeller, high line, central park, macys, grand central). The staff were all courteous, the breakfast was vast and varied. Lovely and bright reception. Food in the bar was really good and value for money. The rooms were larger than average for NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked 4 nights at the Riu as a 30th birthday surprise for my husband, we stayed on the 15th September. From start to finish our trip was amazing, every single member of staff from the managers to the cleaners are polite and curteous. Nothing is too much trouble for anyone. We arrived early at 11am and were given a room straight away. The rooms are clean and spacious with an iron, ironing board, toileteries and a safe. We were on floor 22 which had amazing views of the city, the lift was quick and never had to wait for one. We had breakfast at the hotel which was buffet style with a variety of different choices. Very delicious and always hot! Lunch and dinner is available in the fashion restuarant which is excellent value for money, the lunch offer is fantastic.. all you can eat salad, main and dessert for less than $15 each! On departure our flight was at 23.00.. we were offered late checkout or somewhere to leave our bags.. we left our bags with the bell boy who had them ready for us on our departure..We absolutely love this hotel and will definitely be recommending and returning. Thanks to all the amazing staff for making our trip that little bit more special!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Ok so let's start with it's a fantastic location. It can be a little noisy on a weekend but on the 25th floor it wasn't too bad. The check in was smooth & rooms 99% clean. The staff in the Fusion bar attached were not the best, one or two were ok but overall the service was slow & at times blatantly unprofessional. Very disappointing but the hotel is very nicely decorated & reception staff very pleasant. Bell boys not around or attentive enough. But great location & would stay there again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Plaza New York Times Square is a fairly new hotel (2016) and very modern. The staff is really friendly and the rooms are very tidy and clean with comfortable beds and a nice bathroom with a great shower. We did not hear any noise from the rooms next to us (so great isolation). Please note though that this hotel is situated around the corner of Times Square so bring your ear plugs to sleep at night because the sirens of firetrucks, police cars, ambulances etc. will be heard the entire night, since this city never sleeps ;-). We were on the top floor (the28th) and had an amazing view. From our hotel, you can easily walk to Times Square (of course), 5th avenue, the Empire State Building, Rockefeller center, Central Park etc. We only took the subway for Battery Park because that is quite the walk ;-). Breakfast was included during our stay and they have a nice variety of choices (yoghurts, fresh fruits, cereal, eggs, bacon&sausages etc., pancakes and more). We will definitely book this hotel for our next trip! Ellen & Eva from Eindhoven, the Netherlands.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 4 of us spent 3 nights at this modern clean hotel. Staff very friendly. Great buffet breakfast to set you up for the day. How anyone can moan about the rooms I don't know. Mind and take advantage of happy hour with great choice in cocktails at half the price. Great location. Two local bars we liked were the playwright across the seat , has a patio on roof which was nice and the Rum n Gin bar down street was cool.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What a lovely modern hotel. Check in was easy, staff were very helpful. Rooms were very small but in New York you don't spent long in them. Breakfast was organised and hit the spot before a busy walking day. We had a couple of meals in the evening which was also well presented and very tasty. We asked for a later check out which we paid 30 dollars for.Will miss this hotel and New York in general............the only thing I will not miss is being asked hundreds of times a day...... if I want a bus tour!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic modern hotel. Very clean hotel. Rooms lovely and reception area great. All the staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is excellent. It is one block off Times Square so fantastic location without all the noise of Times Square. When I next visit New York I will be booking this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely loved new york what a great city. Riu plaza was the best hotel by far, the staff are amazing very friendly and helpful at all times. Thank you for a great stay and would return for sure.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu is located in Times Square in restaurant row. Fabulous new hotel With lively decor.Front desk staff were a little unfriendly, but bell boys, concierge were amazing. Breakfast included, but would have liked option out of it- very greasy and very over crowded.Comfortable beds and rooms.You stay here for the location- close to everything.Improvements could be made on the front desk service people. At 4 pm our rooms were not ready and they made no attempt to put our 2 rooms together- they just didn't seem to care- said we make no guarantees, but they just didn't try- it was obvious.A bit over priced for a night stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice lobby and staff. However, while in your room you will hear every noise from the hallway, elevators, people talking, slamming doors and the street below. We were on the 20th floor, and was impossible to sleep for any length of time. As busy in NYC the night we booked at the RIU, we paid over $400 for one night of no sleep. We left after one night.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The RIU hotel group opened their first hotel in NY in 2016 & only by a fortunate suggestion by our travel agent did we decide to stay here. What an excellent choice by luck. Since check in we have been so impressed, greatly exceeding our expectations. Staff are warm & welcoming & even the friendly security always greet us at the lobby. It's only a block away from where we stayed last year, so it's close to Times Square too. So why is it better than the last hotel? It's new, it's quirky, it's interior design is vibrant & the rooms are not your typical NY size rooms. You have room to move! The beds & the bathroom are bigger- even the TV is bigger. The room is bright & refreshing & new. For a similar price to what we paid per night last year this hotel is now our choice. We're so glad we didn't go back to the last hotel. As expected, it's very clean & the service at reception & dining is polite & efficient. The other point of difference is the breakfast included. Full buffet breakfast included for the same price! The only recommendation we have is to put a kettle in the room for coffee. But if not having coffee facilities in the room ensures the room rates remain competitive, then we can do without. However, as more tourists find out about RIU & demand increases the price will go up. Let's hope not too much, because we want to return.RIU, glad we found you.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hear at present for a couple of more days. Arrived yesterday. Rooms are way to small. They have certainly been misrepresented on their website. No space to put your belongings anywhere.Reception staff are very rude. We have complained but really doesn't make any odds . They don't want to know we booked deluxe rooms. But definitly not deluxe.Just arrived back to the room and room has been cleaned but they have put dirty towels in the room. Would not recommend thank goodness we are planning to be out.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited 8th Sept for 4 nights. Hotel is in a great location for all forms of transport subway and feet seem to be the best so bring comfy foot wear. We booked with Tui which included all you can eat breakfast from 6.30am which was brilliant for us as one of our trips commenced 7.30 at Empire State so had time for a quick bite then a brisk walked start our tour. The breakfast is plentiful and a good choice. We also had an evening meal as it compared favourably in price to other eateries nearby and was very nice and excellent service...must say it was excellent service throughout on all counts. The one thing that did bewilder us is that we have stayed at numerous Riu Hotels and have had tea/coffee facilities in our rooms BUT not here, and after midnight you could not get a coffee for love nor money in this chain of hotels in NYC. But on the whole we had a lovely stay and a great experience. Would l visit again...definitely yes but with a travel kettle....

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our grandma's dream was to go to NYC so my mom, sister and grandma all went. We stayed for one week at RIU! It's location is very easy to find no matter where you end up in the city if you can make back to Times Square you can find RIU! Breakfast buffet is worth the money it was always hot and plenty of options no matter what time you decided to eat. Upon check in our room had a fan blowing in the shower like there was a leak but before we could even bring up to staff they called our room stating they changed us to another room. We were pleased by this quick and hassle free room change and the fact they brought it up and we didn't have to start our trip with griping! The hotel restaurant offered little selection however had a good variety and was tasty the night we decided to stay in! Watch the happy hour menu and only order what comes "happy hour" or you will have yourself a $20 margarita! Hotel lobby, elevators, hallways were always clean and smelt wonderful! Hotel was quiet you would never know the city that never sleeps was outside your window if you didn't look! Our only real complaint is the room was kept neat but not What i would say clean. For example, Glasses we used the night before left, trash left, wash rags left in shower etc just small probably nit picky things. Just aheads up rooms offer little privacy so make sure that is not going to be a problem with your party before booking! I highly recommend the RIU for your NYC adventures!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel appears to be brand new, it's in a great location. It is very close to Times Square which means it's close to Broadway shows and restaurants. The staff are friendly and professional, we didn't use their breakfast facility as it was always crowded and seemed a little pricey compared to what you can get nearby. Overall a good choice to stay there.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I found the hotel to be very clean, AMAZING location, and the staff to be very friendly (especially the doormen and bellmen/concierge), the front desk staff sometimes provided us conflicting information. As any typical NYC hotel, the room was very small (we had the 'family sized room' note- the two double beds are actually squished together so its like one massive long bed) but there was enough space to walk, and their beds are conveniently high enough to fit lugagge underneath (that was so handy!). The bathroom was a fair size and the shower was heavenly. However, they tried a little too hard to make the hotel modern, the toilets are awkwardly large/a strange shape, and the shower has an opaque glass wall so you can see the persons body shape while they shower... which I found odd since it was considered a room for a family... sorry but I wouldn't want to see my brother or parents showering (haha). I would visit this hotel again, if I could afford it again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Rui Plaza for four nights. The staff were friendly, polite and efficient, the food was very good and the facilities were also good. The rooms were clean and functional although not very big. They could have done with the addition of a tea/coffee machine.The hotel is well placed for the sights of New York and is adjacent to some great restaurants. Altogether we had a very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel has smell and front counter staff very racist (especially the funny looking over weight blonde man). My deposit of $US100 still not refunded as hotel still does not acknowledge taking this money even though I have provided my visa transactions. Only thing good was the breakfast. We stayed as a family and hotel room too small with 2 double beds put togther with no space in between and space to move around room. Bathroom has no privacy if staying with family with older kids. Over priced, bad service and misleading on photos shown on website. Stay away from this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I will start off by stating that the area is awesome and the staff is great. They are friendly, helpful and accommodating. When we arrived, they immediately said they were upgrading our room to a king, for no reason at alll! I can only assume it was because we booked the hotel a year in advance? Anyway, I got a small box of candy and a small note on my bed that week becasue it was my birtheday. That was nice. The room was small but that was to be expected in NYC. What i didnt appreciate was that everyday the cleaner left our window open! We left a note not to do that again and was followed! Also there is no clock nor radio in the room. To add, there was nowhere in the hotel to get ice (not a big deal for us). Lastly, the walls are thin. We were woken up by inconsiderate guests. The kids would wake up about 5:30 a.m., yell and scream, bang the doors and the adults talked loudly, right after that. We finally complained to the management and said they would get security to check it out. This worked but the next day it started up again. I would recommend this hotel due to the staff and the location, but it is most definitely overpriced. We were lucky to pay $187 a night due to booking a year in advance but even that is too much. It is just a fancy looking hotel with not much to give in return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for eight nights at this lovely hotel which is perfectly located for exploring Manhattan being close to Times Squares, bars, restaurants, transportation etc. We stayed on the 29th floor in room 2914 which had amazing views over the city, room was a good size being bright and tastefully decorated. Bathroom a good size with large overhead shower. Although on high floor lifts are super high speed so no issue with getting up and down. Porters are genuinely friendly and helpful as are all the hotel staff we came across. Breakfast is varied with both hot and cold selection setting day up for a good early start for sightseeing. Hotel is quite new and staff work hard to maintain the 'as new effect'. Definitely would recommend this hotel. In regards to New York use subway to get around along with bus system as this is best method of getting up, down, across island quickly and is easy to use. However it is also a great city to clock up the miles walking as so much to see and do whilst not noticing how far you do actually walk. Highlight in New York was the harbour lights cruise (amazing), 9/11 museum/memorial, Madison square garden tour, empire state and top of the rock - amongst many more. Hop on Hop off bus is a must for first day so can get bearings on where all the attractions are and the guides are extremely knowledgeable giving good info.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It had been my mum's dream to go to new york for years so we wanted to make it special! Riu Plaza was in the perfect location Litrally around the corner from the madness of NYC but still plenty of restaurants and shops next door. We preferred in a slightly quieter area and central to where we wanted to be. We went to see Kink Boots which was litrally maybe 3-4 blocks from us. The facilities are great here fresh towels, large bed and very clean room/bathroom. I also took advantage of the gym on site which was perfect for my needs and again quite luxurious beating the standard gyms in hotels. I would recommend to many who are wanting to sitesee in New York. I would stay here again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I spent one night and was impressed by the excellent, professional and helpful staff. The hotel is only 1 year old. It is very clean and comfortable. The location is amazing. The included breakfast buffet was huge and very good. Will return.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We requested a high room and whilst they emailed back to say they could guarantee it, we were given a high room with a balcony! The room was clean and came with ironing board/hairdryer etc. Yes the shower glass wall could be uncomfortable for those not travelling with a partner and the door for the bathroom is a sliding glass door. Not the best design but I'd stay again. Close to various tube stops for getting around and a few bars around the corner/broadway/Times Square. Oh and buy one get one free cocktails in happy hour :)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and me, really enjoyed our 5 day stay at this almost brand new hotel, the staff was very kind and helpful, everything is super clean, the room price includes a delicious breakfast buffet and is perfectly located just 3 blocks from Times Square and in the center of Hell's Kitchen( superb restaurants) and the best theaters and in one of them we attend The Phantom of the Opera great performance.
user_name:
renemartinelli
San Pedro Garza Garcia, Mexico

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Incomparable location, that's for sure. The much-commented bathroom was probably the best thing about the room, which is, as has been remarked, rather small, and already beginning to suffer wear and tear. An almost white room in a very busy hotel is perhaps not a good choice. There are two things I'd remark. First, we were there in mid-August which might explain the interminable wait for elevators. All of them serve all of the floors, so if you're high up it takes ages to get down, and if you're on the lower floor wanting to go down, you might have to wait a good while for a free lift with space for yourselves and luggage.The breakfast is fine, but with only two lines, it's insufficient for the number of guests. With the high ceilings, we felt transported back to a school dining-room: very noisy!That said, staff are all attentive, friendly, and commendable.Perhaps when it's less busy, these warts aren't so apparent.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had an excellent check in and my son asked if we could be on a high floor! Check in lady said yes!Room was lovely, 2 adults, 2 children, we managed as for NY heard hotel rooms are tiny, but we managed!The breakfasts were very tasty! We ate like kings! Staff in restaurants were helpful and friendly. Thank you.The hotel is in good walking distance of lots of tourist sights.An amazing hotel, would love to go back!5*

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A great location for Broadway and the whole city. The advice I would give is to ask for a high floor 22 or above as its the main area and there is a lot of town noise to be heard. The breakfast included deal is worth considering as there was a good choice and very competitive with other eateries around.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A great location for all the Broadway shows. The hotel was clean and staff were very helpful.would recommend this location for any disabled person who walks but not too far.We booked with the breakfast included and found it easier than going out also very competitively priced. Ask for a high floor as the noise is minimal 22 or above.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As Times Square is grid locked most of the time it's important to choose a hotel with a great location and Riu Plaza is just that hotel. Small modern rooms with splendid views and all the mod cons. An extensive buffet style breakfast that will cater for the fussiest of eaters; choice of seating areas including al fresco and front window if you love people watching. I thought $300 per night was a bit on the heavy side but breakfast was included in this price; it may pay to look out for deals.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location if you're going to New York to visit Times Square. The rooms are nice and well kept. My only issue was with the staff. I reached out to the hotel weeks before visiting and asked if they could do something special for my wife since we were visiting for our anniversary. I told them I would pay for it no matter how much it cost. They acted like my request was something they have never heard before and when we arrived they did nothing special for us. Otherwise, great location and nice hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed as a family of 5 for one week. Hotel is ideally placed for the tourist attractions, a short walk from the bustle of Times Square and within walking distance of other places such as Broadway, Empire State etc. Tube minutes away, giving easy access to further areas. Couldn't ask for a better location! Hotel was lovely and clean, modern and luxurious lobby, gym open 24 hours. Breakfast was fantastic, help yourself buffet including fresh fruit, meat, cheese, pancakes, pastries, cereals etc. Sets you up for the day, meaning you don't need to splash out on lunch. Cafe downstairs to buy snacks during the day, restaurant serves lunch and evening meals. Visited restaurant on last day and pleasantly surprised by quality of food and price. It is very expensive to eat out in NY, the hotel compared favourably with other local eateries.The room was on the small side with 2 double beds pushed together and 1 sofa bed, but we managed fine with teenagers. You don't go to NY to sit in your room! TV and fridge, complimentary water on first day only, (go down to the gym to refill with chilled water!), free wifi.Friendly staff, polite and always with a smile - couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Definitely recommend, would go back in a heart beat!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited the riu plaza for two weeks from the 29th July to the 12th August. Have visited a few Hotels in NY which I have been mainly happy with. Upon arriving I was very impressed with the modern Decor of the reception and the bar/ restaurant area very clean and well maintained. We were greeted by a very helpful and courteous receptionist apologies for not remembering her name. We were given a room on the 30th floor 3017 which was a little smaller than I expected but still a nice room with a floor to ceiling window allowing plenty of light with a view onto 8th Ave and 46th Usual amenities safe fridge iron etc step in shower. Big screen TV and super quick Wifi for up to 4 devices. The location was very good one Ave over from Hell's Kitchen at 9th Ave and step out your on 46th RESTAURANT ROW. Turn left your one Ave from the bright lights of Times Square and right in the middle of the theatre district you're also just 4 blocks from the port authority bus terminal head north up 8th Ave to Columbus circle and you're just across from Central Park. We loved the Riu Plaza and will most probably visit again. That said there were a few things we weren't totally happy about. One of them being house keeping main problem being that on one occasion our room door was left open whilst we had been out most of the day. I appreciate this would not have been done purposely but security of your room and possessions should be absolute priority. When this was reported to reception it took sometime to get a favourable response due to the first person we spoke to not really having a full grasp of English. After this we were then passed onto someone senior who handled the situation. I have to say Riu have since done everything to Compensate us for the oversight and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel great location excellent restaurant and bar. Couldn't be more helpful and excellent food. The doormen I found to be generally very friendly and helpful. I thought no maybe one or two on reception could do with maybe a little more training but that was just our experience. I think Riu Plaza should reconsider their plan to only offer packages with breakfast included pushing up the price. As I think this might alienate some and lose customers. So hoping they rethink this but if you're happy to be restricted to only having breakfast at the hotel then this is the one for you.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in a family room (2 adults and 3 kids under 12) which accommodated us with 3 queen beds and a double sofa bed. Just about room to move still but as expected! Bathroom is a frosted glass partitioned room and was a bit daunting at first! If you showered with light off it wasn't too undignified but the sliding glass door was a terrible design and not private in the slightest...We could have done with more wardrobe space but we managed.Staff were lovely and the room made up spotlessly each day.The location was amazing, just round the corner from Times Square and central to exploring NYC. Would definitely stay there again, as finding a decent family room in Manhattan is not an easy task - recommend for families.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well placed hotel just a block away from time square. Staff extremely good and you can see have been well trained. European feel with showers that you can see peoples outline in. Make sure you know your room mate well. Only problem is the jail type doors. I am sure they have to be like that for fire regulations but as this is a town centre hotel with activity 24 hours then the constant very loud banging of doors could be an irritant. Felt pad would help muffle a little.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is located in prime site on corner of 8th Ave and 46th Street, one block away from TKTS booth and across road from the most popular show Hamilton. Everything is within walking distance in Times Square - Hard Rock, Madame Tussaud's, Bus tours, major theatres. Arrival at hotel was smooth, bell boys take your luggage and will store if room not ready (we were early) while you go out exploring. The main atrium has a wonderful perfumed smell that is lovely and fresh at all times. Rooms were spotlessly clean, bright and modern and beds were the most comfy we have had in the US. Views from our room on 19th floor were spectacular and far reaching. There is a resort fee of $13 per night which includes use of gym, bottle of water on arrival, luggage storage and free wifi for up to 4 devices. Reception staff could be a bit more friendly but otherwise no gripes. We would stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is great if your focus is on location, as it is one block off timesquare. The hotel is very nice, the staff is very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are small, but it is NYC.I enjoyed the free breakfast. At $200 + a night a pool would have been great, but the big value is it's proximity to timesquare and Broadway.
user_name:
Marc F
Maple Shade, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It was my daughter's 21th birthday celebration, OMG the service was 5 stars (and I used to work for a 5 star hotel). The bellman was above and beyond. He made our stay better and better, I don't know how to spell his name but was liwe Debrine. He was so nice and helpfull. The rooms was beautiful and clean. Two blocks away from Times Square. Breakfast included is a plus.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here earlier this month 08/06 until 08/11, hotel is central located for all the major sites and is clean and bright with friendly helpful staff. We were given a room on the 26th floor with access to the meeting room ( free drinks/snacks).

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked this hotel from the travel agents advise and we weren't dissappointed this hotel is exceptionally clean from outside to in , staff fantastic and very helpful situated just off Times Square literally 5 min walk from Times Square beds made daily rooms immaculate and a good range of breakfast from full English to all meats, croissants and cereals we loved our stay here plus it's very modern
user_name:
Derek M
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel could not be better located, right on restaurant row and incredibly close to Times square. The theatre district is very close too, as is the Rockerfeller centre. The hotel is modern looking with very good facilities. When we were there the restaurant had excellent value meals for breakfast,lunch and dinner. We were on the 30th floor and the views out of the windows were breathtaking. The bar also had a happy hour which was good,if you fancy a drink before dinner. The bar staff were excellent,as were most of the staff. My only criticism of staff were the staff behind the desk, who didn't seem to communicate to each other or understand the rules of being a Riu loyalty card owner. We had been granted a late check out by one of the desk staff, but we were then asked to leave before our agreed time and told there would be a charge. It was all sorted out in the end but very disappointing. Can I also warn everyone that the price you have been promised on your booking website will not include the hotel tax and the New York residency tax which, for us, came to about 150 dollars. Another tip I would give is if you are getting a taxi to the airport ask one of the doorman to get you one as it will cost a lot less.The hotel is a great starting place for your adventure in New York and is wonderfully located. I would recommend it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent location near to the buzz of Times Square and great local eateries. The hotel is bright and ultra modern with clean, well equipped rooms with views. The breakfast is excellent and staff really friendly and helpfull. I did, however, receive quite a frosty response from one of the receptionists upon booking in. I was given my room details and was quite concerned to see that my name and nationality were completely different from those on my passport. I took the room details back to the receptionist and told her that there must have been some kind of computer error when she scanned my passport. She scanned my passport again, and still it printed out someone else's details. She told me it was okay and my details were correct on the computer, but I insisted she correct it. She was quite rude and aggressive towards me. Eventually, following a silent 'stare-off' she called the manager to help her. He scanned my passport again and, this time, my details were correct. In these days of international security scares, I should not have had to insist upon this. It made me wonder why it had happened in the first place.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights during our lovely holiday in New York and couldn't fault the service given by everyone who works there. The air conditioning was so inviting and the view from our room on the 22nd floor was amazing! Thanks a lot RIU!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Literally a 2 minute walk to Times Square...A few blocks north of the Port Authority Bus terminal. We left our car in Sycaucus NJ (not sure if the spelling) and bused into NY. Roughly 20-30 minutes by bus, unless it's rush hour, then closer to an hour.Uber from the Hotel to the bus terminal cost around $8.00Very good breakfast, lots of seating.Very busy hotel, nothing that bothers your trip, just lots of guests.As with the RIU resorts people may be familiar with, this is a very nicely appointed hotel. Rooms are a good size for a NY hotel.Several Broadway theaters are within a 2-10 minute walk from the hotel.You couldn't ask for a better location. Subway stops roughly 2 blocks away from the hotel. There are a number of Hop-On-Hop-Off buses stop across the road.The only issue was the number of people trying to sell bus passes as you left the hotel in the morning, usually around a dozen.And speaking of Pest, the bicycle tour guys, and Horse Carrige ride people in Central Park..... they just don't take NO! for an answer. They try to get you into a conversation... sorry but just be rude and keep walking.....Again, we loved the hotel, and its great location...Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: near to times square and all the main locations. clean and bright. good air con. fabulous service. friendly and accommodating . breakfast menu good. lovely stay. check in and out service good. it had a good atmosphere and answered all queries. had a really good overall experience

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here 7th Aug for 3 nights No complaints at all. Fantastic location, walking distance to everything within midtown. Loads of subways close by. We did not use any facilities in the hotel as we were out all day. Spotless hotel  Rooms compact & simple but comfy beds and good shower. The frosted glass wall did not cause any problems. Wifi worked well & the fridge was a big advantage. We were in room 1422 facing 8th ave, could hear a bit of traffic noise but nothing major. There was a lot of loud music from a bar 1 night till around 2am but seemed a one off as had no more noise issues . I would stay here again if the rate was competitive. The only thing that could be improved from our stay would be the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. This is standard in even basic european hotels so was disappointed with that. Everything else spot on.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel, very modern with a superb location. Literally 2 mins walk to Times Square. Clean rooms, nice bathroom and nice staff. Had a little problem with the window that was promptly solved. Don't miss the breakfast if you get a chance.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very clean and modern the room are very nice bathrooms are spacious. We paid extra for breakfast and that's when it goes down they are so so busy crammed to capacity around 9am the Fashion which is the better is closed at 9.30am so you have to wait in long queue then more queuing to get food etc it's more like a soup kitchen really disappointing.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This place would have got a better rating if they did not charge extra resort fees. As someone who has used Rui in Europe several times we felt they were a name to trust. But charging resort fees separately to the price of the hotel is just plain dishonest in my book and shows they dont really care about the customer at all .... just how much money they can squeeze out of them. When I asked what they were for I was told one of the reasons was so we could leave our cases at reception after checkout if our flight was later on! Free in most hotels! Unbelievable!Other than that the place was pretty good. The location is excellent if you are a tourist wanting to sample New York. The rooms are clean and modern and you have usb charging sockets at your bedside for your phone. Breakfast is a little chaotic and a bit of a 2-3 star experience. No table service for tea/coffee/toast etc. A bit like a canteen buffet setup but it's fine if you're in a rush to get out and see the big city.If you're going to a show on Broadway most of the theatres are right next to it so it's ideal for this purpose.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is near Times Square and the staff are polite and friendly our room is on the 4th floor close to the lifts.Small but spotless with a lovely decent sized shower.Their main restaurant although it says a la carte is more basic no frills i.e. Pizza lasagna burger etc .I had the lasagna hubby had the burger I got lasagna that was it no garlic bread or chips he at least got chips with his.Also their drink prices were high but on the plus side they have happy hour from 3 till 7 and cocktails are $7

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here as a family of 5 in July, lots of people moaning about room size but they are typical New York size, small but everything you could need in them. Great decor, powerful shower, comfortable beds and we really only slept in the room. The buffet breakfast had a great selection. The location is fantastic, we will definitely be back again.
user_name:
Jolene W
Lisburn, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was pretty easy to get to from JFK, we got the AirTrain to Howard Beach and then the A train to Penn Station. After that we only had to walk a couple of blocks to get to the hotel.Check in was quite fast, although I was a little bit confused about the deposit. They seemed to charge more money to my card and I was then worried that I wouldn't get it back! We were given a room on the 21st floor which had a view of 8th Ave. The room wasn't huge, but I didn't expect it to be. It was mostly decorated really nicely apart from a few bits of woodwork next to the shower that needed fixing up. The bathroom was nice and clean with a great shower and toiletries to use. The only thing that we didn't quite like was our toilet which made squeaking sounds each time you sat on it, making us think that it might break off of the wall! It was also just a little bit noisy in the room, you could hear taxis and cars beeping all through the night and the hallways were also noisy. You could really hear people talking and slamming doors.The location was great and Times Square was less than a 5 minute walk away. There were also plenty of good places to eat within a short walk. It was close to Nathan's hot dogs, Shake Shack, Dunkin' Donuts and we also had a brilliant big pancake breakfast at the Brooklyn Diner. All of these places were very close to the Riu Plaza.We paid for breakfast at the hotel on our last day and we were quite pleased with the variety, although we did agree that we would've gotten a bit bored if we were eating it every day.We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to people. The hotel was quite expensive but it did give us somewhere clean and comfortable to stay in a great location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A very comfortable hotel. Staff were helpful and very professional. While roms are a little small, they are set up with comfort in mind. Bathroom had a shelf under washbasin for toiletries etc.A full buffet breakfast is setbed from 6.30am.Located in the heart of the theatre district right near Times Square. Easy access to subway. 42 St subway station connects to most parts of the City.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked 2 rooms ( my wife and 2 boys) and requested executive king sized rooms. The description refers only to the bed size and nothing else. The rooms are tiny and the bathrooms don't even have a bath. The hotel is clean and the service friendly. It is a little over priced I feel but could be because of the location. The breakfast was included and was nice ( buffet style) One issue is that there seemed only to be 2 out of 5 lifts working and this caused long delays in the mornings . Otherwise ok.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I am a dermatologist. I was in NYC for a conference and had my family with me. I expected to get work done remotely while I was there. We had four people in our room (and I had paid for two other rooms for family). During my five-day stay, there were four separate times, I could not get on the internet to do work. When I tried, a pop-up came up that said that we already had four devices on internet. We did not (or not that I know of - maybe some devices remained connected without our knowledge). I have never had a hotel limit our internet. I complained three times and was told a manager would talk to me, but never did. I emailed my complaint, but was told my email went to the parent company and that I should contact the individual hotel (which I had tried). Pick another hotel with good internet. There are plenty of others in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely loved staying here, so stylish!! The smell of the lobby is so nice! Everywhere, including the rooms were very clean! Rooms had a stunning view. The guy on the door ( cant remember his name, really short hair, dark skin, in a tux handling luggage and greeting) was so so friendly and helpful, put a smile on our faces! drinks in the bar were very expensive but thats new york for you! Definately will stay here again, top place, staff so friendly. Not far from times square either, its in a good destination.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent hotel good location just off times square city view near theatre district. Excellent standards throughout good staff apart from one guy on the concierge desk who needs lessons in customer service( I don't deal with that is not the answer a customer is looking for tell me who does is the answer ) only one bad apple in a perfect bunch really good hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: In New York for one night and two plays, this hotel was the perfect find. It's new, clean (!), modern, great buzz. Nice bathroom and mini fridge. The views from the hotel floors and rooms are spectacular from higher up. Room quality very good overall. If you're coming to town to see Broadway shows, you cannot beat this location, and the newness and stylishness of the hotel makes it very appealing.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed on the 28th floor with a lovely city view in the perfect location. The hotel was beautifully decorated in modern style and very clean. A delicious breakfast buffet was included in our plan. The only disadvantage was the glass walled bathroom which made light shine on anyone still sleeping while an early riser prepared for the day. The hotel provided transportation to the airport for a flat rate, and the driver was excellent. Every service provider--check in, baggage check, maintenance, food service, was professional, courteous, and efficient. Loved it!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nothing about this hotel justifies its price.Yes, a qurkily stylish lobby. That's it.At check-in, the security guard behind the desk was flirting relentlessly with the check-in agent, interrupting and slowing the process. Not her fault, BTW.The deluxe double room had two double beds pushed together - not an inch of space. Looked like one giant bed.The "desk" was the size of a cafeteria tray. Unworkable.No ice bucket and NO ICE in the entire place. You have to go to the first floor bar for ice.No room service (did I say this is a $500 room, not a Hampton Inn?)Concierge didn't even know the immediate neighborhood. Used the bartender as my "concierge".Zero decor. The room was a white box.This was a bare bones experience at a mid-range price. Not worth it. You can do better for $200 less.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice Modern hotel with a great location. Less than a 10 minutes walk to Time Square with plenty to do nearby. Room is slightly small but it's NY so it's expected. Overall, clean and sleek and good value.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Easy to get to on the train from the airport. Central location. Walking distance to a lot of locations. Near to a lot of bars and diners. Staff friendly. Hotel clean and tidy. Overall a good experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was very good. An excellent location it was near by many places of interest and we could walk easily till those places. On the other hand, subway and bus stations were very near, too.The continental breakfast was varied and with fresh products.The room was comfortable and with a great view of the city center.Nevertheless, during our returning to Lisbon we asked for a cab service at the "Concierge" desk. We asked the taxi for 4.30 p.m. and the taxi never came. We took the risk and we waited till 5.05 p.m. and still no sign of it and the staff told us it was due to the rush hour. Actually we had a flight to Lisbon (which is in another continent) and we arrived to the Newark airport 1 hour later than what was supposed. We could have missed our flight back home. This situation was rude and stressful.Best regards

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A modern hotel in Hells Kitchen/Times Square. Quiet but close to main attractions and metro. Rooms are relatively small. We (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed in a family room which was acceptable. Friendly staff. The bathroom, however, was more stylish then functional, maybe ok if you are alone but the frosted glasses did not serve any purpose and the sliding bathroom door was not closing completely. Bags must be put under the beds since only a small closet existed. It was ok but different. Very nice view over Hells Kitchen from our room.Breakfast was excellent, especially since we have had American breakfast for two weeks, using china plates and real forks/knifes/glasses (using plastics is not ok!). We did not have electric kettle or coffee machine in the room. In the resort fee (why not include that in the overall price, you have to pay the fee regardless?) water was included but we had to ask for it twice before we got it. If you are in a need of a roof top bar you have to go somewhere else. Hotel bar located in ground level. The hotel concierge was helpful with all sorts of questions (metro, airport transfer, shops, maps, taxi, theater etc etc).

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights. Check in was great, staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. Ate in bar, food was bar food, nothing more or less. Decor is very modern. Don't stay in a room you don't feel totally comfortable with as the washroom is not very private. We just turned the TV up a little. Rooms were very clean. We were on the 16th floor so noise from street was minimal. It's New York, so we were in our rooms very little. I would definitely stay there again. Location was perfect. Close to restaurants, Theatre District, etc.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent our wedding night here since we were going on a cruise the next morning. It probably took us 15 minutes to walk to the pier, but we took our time and you are going downhill it wasn't bad(we each had one suitcase). We walked to Junior's Cheesecake in about 5 minutes from the hotel.The room was nice, but not sure everyone would be comfortable with the frosted glass walls of the bathroom. the hallways by the rooms reminded me of a plain hallway in an apartment complex. the lobby was nice and the wifi worked ok.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel itself is very clean. As noted in other reviews the rooms are quite small; we had larger ones in Paris! Service was very good. I would have preferred people to be a little friendlier, but things got done. We were very happy when we arrived early and were able to check in and get to our room. The only glitches we encountered were minor: our key cards stopped working one day, and we had to go back down to the desk, but that happens at other places too. One evening we heard someone trying to get into our room I mentioned it to security and he wasn't concerned, although the previous day we had been required to show our key cards to access the elevator. On the day we were checking out, our wifi was cut off but again, the situation was remedied immediately. If you are a light sleeper, you might want to be in a different part of town. I purchased earplugs and was able to sleep, but that would not have been possible without them due to the street noises. The location made it very easy for us to walk to major attractions - if you don't mind walking you can get to Penn Station, Macy's, the river for sightseeing cruises, Central Park...

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: If you're looking for something near Times Square, this is a great place to stay. The hotel and rooms are beautiful. However, the glass showers are visible from the room. Do NOT book here if you're sharing a room with someone you wouldn't want to see you naked. The glass is frosted, but really it leaves absolutely no room for imagination.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is an uber cool hotel, with very helpful and friendly members of staff. Lovely bar area (mojitos are to die for!), trendy reception atrium and the guest rooms are both spotless and funky! We had a room on the 21st floor, and it was perfect...Location is perfect for the central sights of New York (especially Times Square), and there are plenty of trendy and quality restaurants on the doorstep too. Loved it!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked the Riu Plaza because we thought that RIU had a good reputation. Had it been located in most other places it would only rank as a three star. The room was the smallest that we have ever had in the USA. It was kept very clean, but wardrobe space was not good enough for our week's stay. When we first arrived, gasping from the journey, we were amazed to find that two Bacardi & Cokes cost $34. For a single dollar morewe bought a full litre from the liquor store. Needless to say, we did not stay in for dinner, as wine was also expensive.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked via travel agent for 3 night stop over in NYC before heading to Orlando. 2 adults and 1 child (10 yr old) in room with only king size bed. Would not move us as apparently this was what was booked for us unless we paid more. Hotel staff not pleasant never heard one of the say hello or good bye. Would never recommend this hotel or stay in it again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On a recent visit to New York City we needed a room for two adults and three children; we wanted to be as close to Times Square as possible. And, we wanted to keep costs down. The Riu met our needs.The room was not large but it accommodated two double beds and a sofa bed. There was a small desk, side chair and mini-refrigerator. We only planned to be in the room when ready to sleep so the tight fit did not bother us. The bathroom and shower were clean and roomy.The hotel looks to be fairly new. It is owned by a Spanish company, I understand. There is a "quick" breakfast restaurant that we visited one morning for coffee and pastries. We did not visit the other food options but they looked good.The staff was helpful and friendly. We did not notice any noise. The only problem was a brief annoyance one morning trying to use a down elevator. We had to wait as several packed cars came by (we were on a lower floor). This room was just over $320 per night including all taxes and fees. We would visit here again.
user_name:
Compass802708
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Close to time square and 1/2 city block from "Hamilton". Opened in March 2016 and still has a new feel. Think Ikea furniture with some lilac. Beds were comfortable. Rooms are tight but to be expected in NYC. Staff is friendly and mostly bi/multi lingual. Didnt hear street trafic on 5th floor with out citi view. However, can hear noise from the hall. Could hear housekeeping carts early in the mornining....no carpet in hall or rooms to cushion sound. Would stay again if traveling to the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lobby is beautiful, nicely decorated, location is awesome. Just walk right out and within minutes you are in Times Square and theater district. We used valet parking, it was ok waited a little to get car and then watched the guy parallel park my car and hit the curb . So I was a little unhappy with that. Service was great room was ready before check in . Room was a bit hot so I had to call down how to get it cooler. It never really cooled down enough though. Temp was reading 74 but felt warmer. It was a 90 degree day so not sure if that's why. The hallway was cooler because we even joked we should have slept out there. Now the worst part, the noise. We were 11th floor, maybe not high enough to not hear everything outside but it was VERY distracting to sleep. A few times we were woken in the middle of the night to the sirens from the fire station outside and the traffic. Funny part was I asked when I booked the room online for a quiet room, I got the complete opposite. We have stayed in times square in the middle of all that noise and it was not nearly as loud as this hotel. Not sure if they didn't soundproof enough but I would not go back because of this. It's a shame because it is a beautiful hotel and super clean, bathroom was a great size. Room was a bit tiny for a king, but it did the job.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We got into NYC early morning and checked to see if we could get into our room early, but we weren't able. We came back awhile later and were happy to know that our room was on the 20th floor. The front desk staff were very friendly throughout our stay. The elevators were very fast and efficient. The breakfast is served from 7-11 am. It is a very good breakfast, everything you could ask for! The hotel is located on a street very close to Times Square, very easy walk. The subway station at 42nd street is within walking distance as well. The rooms were clean and very modern. I would very much recommend staying at this Riu.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I haven't even stayed here yet and I have already encountered the WORST customer service over the phone. I am staying here starting tomorrow and will be away from my 8 month old baby. I need to pump and store my breastmilk frozen (since I will be away for 5 days). This has never been an issue at any of the other hotels I've stayed at. Either they have let me store the milk labelled in a bag in their kitchen freezer or they have made sure my room comes with a mini fridge with a freezer compartment. This is not a light matter as it concerns the well-being of my baby, and being away from him is hard enough already. I spoke with several agents, and all of them basically said "No, we cannot accomodate this" with no further explanation. I even tried emailing the manager as she was continually not available to speak to me all day. Her response: "I am very sorry to let you know that our policy prohibits the storage of guest items (what ever it is) in our Kitchen." This shows that they do not put customer service at their forefront. Any hotel that is not friendly to new and breastfeeding moms is a No go in my books. I also tried to call their 1-800 customer relations number for the RIU company itself - also no help. If this is the type of customer service Im encountering even BEFORE I leave, I can't even imagine what it'll be like when I arrive.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing location just two blocks from Times Square. Hotel was clean and staff attentive and friendly. Breakfast was serve yourself with plenty of choices for everyone. Only one downside no tea or coffee facilities in the room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We travelled to NYC during June 30th - July 3rd and had a 3 night stay at the RiuTimes Square. We were a little hesitate to stay here based on a few bad reviews but went for it anyway and I am so happy we did. The Riu is somewhat new, the rooms are clean and the service is friendly. We requested a high floor and got the 29th floor (the hotel has 30 floors in total) so our request was met. We had a great view overlooking the city. The beds and pillows were comfortable and the room was a decent size (King deluxe room).It is in a great location close to times square, hell's kitchen etc. We walked just about everywhere. Breakfast was included with our stay and we assumed it was just muffins, croissants etc. but it was amazing, They had a full buffet breakfast with eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, smoked salmon, a variety of cold cuts and cheeses, cereal, muffins, fruit, etc. You name it, they had it. We had an amazing stay and would definitely return. I think some people like to nit pick at everything :)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was absolutely amazing!The hotel was beautifully decorated, with an incredibly modern and new feel throughout the hotel and the room.The hotel could not have been cleaner, the rooms and the rest of the hotel were impeccably clean and spotless throughout.The staff were a credit to the hotel and the brand itself, as they were very courteous every and anytime we had to deal with them.The hotel was only one block from Times Square, therefore we could not have felt any more a part of the action in New York City.The hotel was on Restaurant Row which meant that my partner and I were never short of somewhere to eat.We had a 25th floor room, and the view from our room was just spectacular. Our view even included a view of the Hudson River.We had an exceptional time at this hotel, and we now know where we will be staying the next time we travel to New York City.We have told family and friends about this hotel as we feel everyone should get a chance to experience just how good it was!See you soon!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel which offers great comfort in a design setting, where everything is very functional and new. Rooms aren't big but for New York it's OK. However they are well conceived with good closet space and a modern bathroom with an excellent shower. Beds are comfortable and we could have a relaxing stay besides hotel's position, in a very central, but Chaotic area. Breakfast has good choice and quality in a very spacious and sunny space. It definitely is an added value. The hotel offers all the services of a four star with an excellent service. It is elegant, impeccably clean. There are very nice views from certain rooms. Would definitely recommend it and return again in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a very modern hotel in an almost perfect location.We had a three night stopover in New York prior to a cruise and wanted to tick some of the New York boxes. You can comfortably walk to broadway for a show and to times square. we did both in about 10min or so. The nearest subway station is also about the same which gets you to the museums and central park at about $3 a trip.The room we had on the 14th floor had some nice views across the river from the elevator lobby but only older inner New York buildings from the room window.The room itself was compact but comfortable and very clean. The bed was great for us but could be a little soft for some.The bathroom was shower only but that tends to be the norm these days. The only downside was the shower curtain which was very thick and tended to blot out the light, not a major issue but it was slightly off putting.The staff were all friendly and helpful and the rate acceptable for NY.The buffet breakfast was quite good but the breakfast area is large, very noisey and I'm sorry to say the guests tended to be self absorbed to the extent of being quite rude and pushy.In summary great location, good rooms but not quite perfect.Would I stay again, yes no question

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is fairly new and the it felt fresh and modern. The foyer is spacious and contemporary, the rooms are nice, not huge but adequate with a nice bathroom and comfy beds. The location between Hell's Kitchen and Times Square is ideal for an entertainment filled weekend or dining out experience as there are loads of great restaurants within a very easy walking distance. We had breakfast included which was fine but certainly. Or a fine dining experience - think more scrum...... Had it not been included we would have eaten elsewhere.However, the staff on reception are extremely surly, unfriendly and generally quite unwelcoming. Not an ideal start to a hotel experience .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect. Food was fantastic (every kind of breakfast food you could possibly want) customer service exceptional and rooms exquisite with beautiful views overlooking central Manhattan. You're guaranteed to get your money's worth here. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A group of six of us stayed here in June. We had no complaints at all.Staff were pleasant and helpful,room always well cleaned each day.We were on the 9th floor and there was minimal noise at night.We received chocolates as it was our Golden Wedding at the weekend, which was a lovely gesture. Altogether a very pleasant stay and would certainly return.
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
Ruth H
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of April. Went for the upgrade to Executive double, which was on the 26th floor and well worth the extra. Hotel is immaculate. Rooms good. Beds very comfortable. Bathrooms and shower spotless. Lifts were quick and no need to queue. Breakfast had a great choice and was good. Some queuing, but not for long. Bar was great for a drink after a hard day out sightseeing. We also booked a shuttle return to the airport to though the concierge. Bought 3 day tickets for the Topview hop on hop off bus, which stopped just across the road. Probably the best thing we did. Would recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu is a great place to stay close to Time Square. Easy walking distance to the Square and a nice little breakfast place right across the street, which makes it easy to eat then return to the room to get ready for the day. Front desk isn't super friendly, but maybe that's just a New York thing.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here from 3-7 June and found the hotel very good, very clean and comfortable. We asked for a room with a good view as it was a combination of our 75th and 70th birthdays and our 50th wedding anniversary later in the year. They didn't disappoint- we were on 23rd floor in a corner room and overlooked 8th Avenue.It has a bright and airy lobby with plenty of space even at busy times.  The only disappointment was the weather, beautiful when we got there and the next day, but after that rain and it turned cold, pleased I took my fleece. We have been to New York a few times before so knew where to go and walked for hours on end and finding new things.So, no complaints from us about the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 10 days for a visit to NY - rooms are comfortable (not spacious) but sufficient if you're planning to be out and about the city. Hotel is clean and very well situated only one block from Times Square. Hotel is in the Restaurant Row area which offers many choices for lunch/dinner. We loved the breakfast as well, although the buffet did not change during the time we were there. Full buffet breakfast. Service is good and friendly - although we were not allowed to check into the hotel until 16h00 after our flight of 24 hours it was a bit disappointing. Overall, it was a lovely stay and we will highly recommend this hotel. Hotel also offers a restaurant for lunch and dinner as well as a "Grab and Go" restaurant area where you can buy a quick bite. Room had a lovely view of the city and noise were not too bad. Great place for a holiday in NY!
user_name:
travelchick030
Cape Town Central, South Africa

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location, very clean and tidy. Happy hour in the bar is great. Definitely recommend here only for couples though as the bathroom wall is just Frosted glass. Checkin was super easy and the staff are super helpful and friendly. Bed linen was clean and comfortable but at the end of the day you don't go to New York to stay in your hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very well located turns out to be to my point view the biggest advantage of this hotel unit. Little varied of breakfast and adequate rooms in size for the standart of NYC. I would give a higher rating if a sweater had not disappeared from the room on our last day at the hotel, and after the complaint was made 4 days ago we still did not get any response.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here in a room on the 22nd floor after requesting by email a higher floor. Fantastic lobby and what a great room, my husband and I shared a queen size bed while my 12 yr old son got a queen size to himself. Fabulous bathroom, yes the glass is frosted but you can't see anything, who's watching anyway? Chocolates and a card greeted my husband on his birthday which was a nice touch and the staff were always polite and attentive. We didn't have breakfast here, too pricey, but there are plenty of options not too far away. Great location for everything especially Times Square, cannot recommend this hotel enough.
user_name:
