Penny T
South Shields, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The room was a pretty average room despite us being told that we had a free upgrade because we are Riu diamond club members. Our room was the same as my sister's room and she is not a diamond club member.The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the shower was good. As "VIP's" we were entitled to the complementary snack lounge but as the lock was broken, all and sundry were piling in and taking stuff but it was nice to have a little lounge area for a coffee and chat with friends.On the plus side, we saw "hairy naked guy" in the building across the street from the lounge so it felt like an episode of friends!There are free log on computers hidden away in the lobby which are great for a quick log on but as you have to stand up to use them, you are clearly not encouraged to linger, which is fair enough so that everyone has a chance to use them.Rude people talking loudly late at night whilst walking along the corridor is not muffled by sufficient sound proofing or carpet - that could be improved.There are lots of seating areas in the lobby and I would say the cleanliness was good, we didn't try the breakfast as it sounded quite expensive.If I were coming back to NY I would stay here.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family (4 kids - 6 people total) stayed in the Riu for 5 nights. We loved it. The description lists it as Times Square. It is about 1 1/2 blocks from Times Square. Great location! Close enough to the action but far enough away to get away from it all. The room was clean and decorated nicely. We shoved our suitcases under the beds for storage. The glass shower door was interesting (very European) but not an issue for our teens if we turned off bathroom light. We used the room darkening shades and found them adequate. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and accommodating. We were always greeted when we walked in. Dauvaughn was great and even recognized us outside of the hotel. We never ate at the restaurant as there are so many options nearby. Over all a great, reasonable option for NYC. Would definitely recommend to friends and will stay there again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrival 8.30pm amazing lobby area cooling after a hot journey from Washington DC. Our package was booked through an agent with our wedding anniversary and my birthday to be celebrated in NYC Reception very terse not very welcoming we had an accommodation voucher from agent outlining the room and our occasion ,they were not in the least interested. Not that we expected anything but it would have been nice for them to recognise the occasions. Being a scardy we were given a room on 23 floor which to their credit was changed to 8th floor Very disappointed with the rooms which I commented on to re epitome staff we had been booked in a deluxe room which as in my experience is such however this hotel offer basic travel lodge standard. Very very disappointed to be told well this is New York . This being my 11th visit to the city this is not a delux room at all IHG group offer this also independents radio city apartments to name 2 Will return to the city but not to this hotel
user_name:
Y50alh
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu Plaza was perfect for our recent family vacation. It's cute, modern, and the staff was amazing! Just super friendly and accommodating. The location was also amazing... close to TS without being IN it, and with tons of restaurants nearby. I'd stay again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was absolutely perfect for my husband and I. It's right near the heart of Times Square with walking distance to so much. All of the staff were friendly, and could help with directions or whatever you may need. I unfortunately had a death in my family while on the trip, but they worked with me on switching my reservation for what worked for my husband and I.You should consider staying at this location for sure, I know I'll be back!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Second time to New York had the best hotel experience ever . Staff was so genuinely helpful and courteous , made out trip hassle free. From check In to check out top notch service ! Thank you I will be back . I will continue to stay at Riu resorts.Originally booked at the Novotel Times Square and we were left stranded because they over booked an absolute nightmare for 3 single women from another country so thank god for that ax things happen for a reason we ended up in a better hotel and I thank you again Riu Plaza New York Times Square

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel, very European style of room. Very quiet, very comfortable. Bathroom spacious and nice. Fantastic view of the river. Close to Times Square without any noise. 17 minute walk from Grand Central, faster to walk than drive a vehicle to the hotel! Lovely staff, quick check in.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just come back from a 3 night stay at this hotel and it was great. Lovely modern hotel and very clean. In a great position too. The staff were really nice and the restaurant served good food. The rooms might be a bit small but plenty big enough for 2 people. Really couldn't fault it. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu is just two blocks from Times Square in Meat Packing district. Not as hectic as on TS in a quieter area. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Everything from dive bars to top end steakhouses. Just leave the hotel and you have a drink in no time. The bar at the hotel is nice quite upscale but with upscale prices. Breakfast was ok. Buffet with the usual. Not very fancy but ok, Check in and out was efficient with no delays. Professional service. The room was nice. Two large beds and a small sitting area with a huge window and a magnificent view. There is a small fridge but we missed a coffeemaker. That and the lack of shoehorn took down the impression a little. I would not call it a luxury hotel but a very decent tourist and business hotel. We will definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived in the late afternoon and check in was smooth and friendly. We requested a high room and they duly obliged by putting us on the 29th floor (30th is top floor). The room was clean and very modern with a large screen Tv. The view was amazing, exactly what I'd had envisaged a NY view to be. The lifts were very quick and never had to wait long. The staff are all extremely friendly and greet you in a very friendly manner which is nice. The bar area is very nice and relaxed. Happy hour is 15:00 - 19:00 but this does not include beer. The only small negative is the glass box bathroom which does not offer much privacy when using the toilet but if your in a close relationship this shouldn't matter ha ha. All in all this is an excellent hotel in an amazing location and I would recommend it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I have been here many times and fully enjoy the property. Very modern and clean. Service is great. Rooms European size but thats cool with me. On downside: tons on of tourists that can slow things down. A small price to pay. Will be back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in this hotel upon our return from an overseas vacation and after staying at an unpleasant hotel in NYC before our vacation overseas. It was a relief to be in this hotel. The location is fantastic if you want to experience the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The rooms are small but clean and modern. We were there with two teens and, as others have mentioned, the frosted glass separating the bathroom shower from the main room was a bit awkward, but it was fine. The beds were comfortable. There was a small mini-fridge in our room, and a small pull-out bed in a loveseat. There is also a modern gym with treadmills, an elliptical, bikes, free weights, and incline bench in the lower level of the hotel. It felt clean and safe. The lobby is well-decorated and there's a restaurant/bar just off the lobby. Stepping out of the hotel, you find yourself in the very heart of Times Square just one block away. Theaters are all around. This area of New York is very busy and touristy and central to the rest of Manhattan. This is a great, trendy, and comfortable choice if looking for a hotel in this area.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Plaza NY was an excellent location and value for money. We stayed 7 nights and were sooo central we could touch everything we needed and wanted. The Hotel is modern and well situated. The room we had was a bit small but more than adequate and very clean. the staff everywhere were polite. One associates noise in NY City so although on the 19th floor we accepted the noise as part of the NY vibe.Breakfast was a self-service canteen style set-up with a generous variety, so no complaints there.would we stay again? Yes, definitely. The only one big recommendation: TAKE AWAY THE IRONING BOARD AND IRON. NO ONE WANT TO IRON ON HOLIDAY. LET'S HAVE TEA AND COFFEE FACILITIES IN THE ROOM !!!!!!!!!!This would have made us rate the hotel 5*.Also a few more shelves in the cupboard would have been nice.Judy Hofer

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent 4 nights in this hotel with our two tween/teen kids. Had a great stay. The hotel is very modern and the rooms were nicely decorated although it was quite small.As most people say, not that keen on the idea of the frosted glass as the bathroom wall when sharing with teen kids but it didn't bother me too much. We didn't spend that much time in the room anyway.The breakfast was really good, a huge selection. It was very busy every morning but we didn't really have to line up. It was a fantastic location near to Times Square and noise didn't bother us in the room. Staff were also helpful. Our kids loved this hotel and it was their favourite in our 3 weeks of travel in the US.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived at the hotel at around 6.30pm after our 10 hour flight from Manchester, UK to JFK, New York. We were collected from the airport by Viewmycarandlimo.com which was arranged through the hotels concierge service. As this was our honeymoon we travelled from the airport to the hotel in a stretched white limousine which cost $175, which included drinks and snacks. Some other limousine companies were going to charge in excess of $400. For our return journey from the hotel to the airport we had the hotel arrange this again for us which cost $75 which was reasonable given that it was rush hour on a Saturday night.When we arrived at check-in we were seen immediately and as we'd booked the hotel direct through the Riu website, we would ask for certain things, such as quiet room, high floor, nice view. As a result were weren't let down. We also asked if anything special could be done as this was our honeymoon and as a result when we arrived in the room a bottle of champagne was waiting for us with a message from the hotel.We stayed on the 23rd floor with a view over West 46th Street. We also found that if we opened the window the noise from the street was quiet noticeable and even when we pulled the window closed this didn't reduce...only when we locked the window did the noise level reduce dramatically.The hotel room itself was fairly large with enough wardrobe space, a large flat screen TV on the wall and an ironing board & iron. It also had a self coded safety deposit box, which was included in the fair.We only ate in the hotel twice, once for an evening meal which was very nice and fairly priced. We also stayed for lunch one day during the happy hour which again was superb.Happy hour is from 3pm-7pm daily and includes some of the cocktails at a special rate and 10% off all bar snacks.When we checked out we left our bags in the capable hands of the hotel luggage staff. They gave us tickets for our bags and could go and get them for whatever reason whenever we needed them. I'm not sure of the staff members name but Davaugh from Jamaica was very pleasant and helped us get back to the airport with the car company.All the staff at the hotel were pleasant and we had no issues at all. We would definitely be staying in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic place, the people are amazing, so happy to help you find were you need to go, absaloutly roasting, it was a heatwave 93f, hop on hop off busses were a great help too getting around this massive city so you get to see it all, fantastic location, 2 min walk from times square

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful new hotel where all the staff are really friendly and everywhere is clean and shiny.One downside to this hotel is that the rooms are quite small. The ensuite shower room is lovely but it isn't entirely enclosed properly so there is a gap between the wall and the sliding door (not a proper door). You can also see whoever is in the shower from the bedroom as there is only a green opaque wall between the 2 so you need to be fairly friendly with the person you are sharing the room with!We were on the 25th floor directly overlooking the main street outside. The noise from the traffic was quite something considering we were so far up. Eventually you get used to it but we were woken up frequently throughout the night.Don't think I would stay in this location again as it was so busy with traffic but if this hotel was elsewhere in NY then it would be spot on.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed in this hotel 3 nights June 8-10, 2017. The hotel was new, clean and had a pleasant modern aesthetic. We chose the Riu due to the proximity to the shows we were seeing. Being a block off Time Square was an added bonus as 8th Avenue was quieter than being in Time Square. Only a 3/4 of a mile walk up 8th Avenue to get to Central ParkCheck-in went seamlessly and we requested a high room (23rd floor) and received one looking east overlooking 8th Ave. If you have a choice I think the view to the west and the river would be a better view. Rooms were nicely compact with a king size bed, 2 night stands and a small desk. Each room also have min fridges and in room safes. The bathroom was elegant, porcelain tile room with a large glass shower with hand held and rain shower. The side of the shower has a frosted glass wall to allow light from the bedroom window to filter into the bathroom.Breakfast was included when we booked and the buffet was good with hot food, pastries, cereals, lunch meats, cheeses and fruit. They continuously refilled bins and baskets throughout the morning.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our fifth trip to NYC and our first stay at Riu Plaza. We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of May into June. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the door to hitting Times Square so the location is excellent is Times Square is what you want. The hotel is new having opened I believe in March last year and you can tell that it is new. It has a modern look about it both inside and out. We were on the 28th floor which is the top floor and had a room looking down onto the street below aswell as being able to see some of the lights of Times Square. All in all it was an awesome view through the large windows. Check in was very quick, I had read reviews of long lines and slow check in but no such thing for us and this was around 4pm aswell. The room was well appointed, small but standard for many NYC hotel rooms. The furniture is basically white which makes the room look bright if as some reviewers have said a little clinical but I liked the look of the room. There were some marks on the walls which looked like they may have been from suitcases or similar but overall the room was clean. I guess that it is downside of having a light and white room. The bathroom has a shower however be aware that it does have a glass partition which from the room itself means that when someone showers their outline is visible. This isn't anything really new in NYC hotels as I have stayed in them before with the same thing but if you aren't expecting it, this may bother you. The toilet does have a sliding door and when this is being used you cannot see through the glass shower partition. Free wi-fi is in the hotel and this was fairly stable during our stay. The bed was large and really comfortable, absolutely no complaints with the quality of sleep whilst at the hotel. The hotel also has a restaurant (we didn't eat there so can't comment on the food) and bar which is very modern and there is also a coffee area which sells pastries and cakes attached to the hotel. Overall we had a great stay at the hotel with nothing really to complain about and this was a very solid start to our vacation.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked the hotel fairly last minute and got an excellent rate.Hotel is a stones throw from Times Square.Requested high floor rooms close by. 14th floor and next door to each other. Perfect.Room was fairly spacious for NYC and felt modern.Ambiance of whole hotel was new and fairly trendy with a sense of happiness from the staff.....Check in was smooth.Check out was smooth.Concierge looked after our bags in a secure area (no charge...just a tip)Breakfast was great. Plenty of staff keeping things moving.Hot food was hot. Cold food cold. Plenty of choice....I couldn't say anything negative about this hotel. Shame we had already booked the W on Lexington for our 2nd night as I would loved to have stayed put.Arrived by Uber so can't comment on parking....Fab

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights from 3-10 June 2017. The hotel was really nice, clean and modern. Staff were very friendly and when we requested help with various things their response was swift. We dined in on our final night and the food was good. We stayed on the 16th floor and we had a very good view of the busy streets, windows were well glazed as when they were closed, you could hear no outside noise. The in room temperature control worked well and the ensuite shower was really good. The bed was comfortable, there was enough closet space for two. My only gripe was that the room was too small, no space to store our cases. I think just coming in from Vegas where our room was huge, we were a little spoilt. Having said that, you don't spend a lot of time in your room as NYC has so much to see and do. Would I stay again, yes. This hotel is based right near the hustle, bustle and great scenes of Times Square and right on the restaurant row.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stated here for 5 nights. Check in no problem. Rooms clean and well sized. Had room on 28th floor, still lot's of traffic noise at night, but it's New York.Staff helpfull and friendly. Being just off 8th Ave, your close enough to Broadway, Times Sqr, central park is 15 mins walk away as is empire state building, Rockefella, central terminal ect. Free WiFi and safe are great free add-ons.All in all great value.Just wish the Americans would put tea and coffee in the rooms!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was a lovely hotel, the rooms were clean, modern amenities and stylish. We had a great view of the surrounding areas and being so close to Times Square we could easily sleep through the night. We decided to book our Chicago tickets through the concierge at the hotel and they were great - Manuel Figueroa was particularly helpful. This was at a decent price and save us time in wondering around trying to find tickets. Additionally we also booked the shuttle bus to JFK which I would recommend as it was half the price of the taxi fair we paid to get there. This hotel is in a great location and I will definitely be going back next year.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I am just back from a 3 night stay at this hotel with a friend, we stayed in a twin room with 2 double beds and ensure bathroom. It is a beautiful hotel with restaurant, bar and coffee shop attached to it, it is immaculate, brand new and in central New York and a five minutes walk from Times Square and in the heart of the theatre district.The staff were very friendly, helpful andVery professional.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel 5th - 10th June. We had a nice clean room and the staff were really helpful and attentive. The location was perfect and we would recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at RIU for 2 nights. Arrived earlier then check in on a rainy day but they worked hard to accommodate us.There was a red carpet laid down because of the rain and our silly girls thought it was just for them. The front desk /concierge staff joined in on the fun working the red carpet and each day after treated them like divas.The hotel vibe was safe, trendy, clean. Perfect location to shows, restaurants, public transit. Price rate was on point too. Shout out to Ronald,Dean,Davaughn! Scored us cab to airport, made the guest experience memorable each day with their fun dispositions and NY insider info!! We give RIU 4 thumbs up and will be back again hopefully soon!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We are a family of 4, we stayed at this hotel based mostly on its location, we were not wrong, the location is perfect, a block or so from Times Square, from there you can go anywhere in NY. Very good restaurants on the same block as the hotel. The Hotel itself is nice, the Room are small, I did not expect a large room given the location. But they were comfortable for us. Like I said, we did not expect a large comfy room. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast, good food, it gets really crowded, but its worth it.All the staff was very very kind and respectful, specially the Concierge that helped us planning our activities.As expected, parking is very expensive, make sure that you consider that, they charge you for Full Days, so if you go over by 30 mins, you need to pay for a full day of parking, so plan your leave considering this.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice clean modern hotel , friendly staff , great location right on times Square theatre District . We had a Queen deluxe room which had two queen sized beds and was easily large enough for three adults . Good shower and good WiFi in room .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel cannot be beaten I'm sure - near enough to Times Square, subway, various restaurants (opposite direction to Times Square) but no noise heard in our room. Rooms are on the small side, but that is to be expected. The frosted glass in the bathroom didn't bother us too much as a family, but I can see how it would be an issue for some.We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but did notice it was busy - there are so many choices close by that we didn't feel we had missed out.Check in/out was fine, all staff were helpful. Good price considering the location, would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived at the hotel and 1 of three rooms was ready. We put all the luggage from 6 people in the one room and off we went into town for a day in NYC. I had called and was told all three rooms would be together. One on the 27th floor and two on 15. None of them next door to each other. No apology. $3600 for 3 rooms for 3 nights. No dresser. No bathtub. A shower that leaks, and we had to put the window open because we could not get the room cool. This room is a basic white shell with a very basic 3/4 bath (it has a shower). It appears the the hotel was ready to be finished and they ran out of money. They stuck two okay beds in the room and then charged $300+ per night. I will never book an RIU property again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Center NY and not very expensive considering the location and quality.Internet is very very fast and available in all the hotel.Breakfast is not very expensive considering the prices in the area and you should consider if you go in a 3 to 5 days period.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were very pleased with the value for money this hotel provided;rooms were a good size, bathroom was very clean and the location was perfect for visiting Times Square and Theatre district. Staff were so friendly and were keen to help in anyway possible. We will use this hotel again, next time we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Price was good, very, very clean hotel, great staff, minimalistic decorations and corridors are very bare. Very comfortable room, bed, nice bath. Would stay again. The location is unbelievable, you are right in the middle of all of the action.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Modern hotel in a great location. Times Square is literally on you doorstep along with so many other NYC landmarks. Huge selection at breakfast, although the breakfast queue was fairly long depending on what time you got there. We stayed in a twin room that was spacious with a very clean and modern bathroom. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was very clean, great location, close to everything! Staff were a bit sketchy, there was a bit of a language barrier due to the fact that this hotel accommodates towards Spanish/Latino based clients. In the room, it was very small, not much room to put your suitcases on the floor especially when me and my partner had two suitcases each and a carry on bag. Shower was nice but it did leak a lot of water. They provided shower caps, which is great - I rarely seem them at the hotels I go to lately. Beds were comfy but only provided one extra pillow (3 in total), and the bed sheets/blankets were too thin. They provide you with complimentary water bottle - which we continued to fill up at the gym downstairs (until they took it away the bottle during cleaning service). Probably wouldn't stay there again, due to small rooms and that they don't do room service! Only got one photo of the gym - oops!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It's close to so many things to do - Times Square, Central Park, theatres and shopping. The rooms are small, but immaculately clean and comfortably furnished. I was on a floor with access to a "snack room" which was stocked with pastries, fruit, cheese, soft drinks and cold cuts 24 hours a day, with wine miraculously appearing late afternoon. There was a more than adequate supply for a light breakfast. Staff were courteous and helpful. I spent 5 happy nights there and recommend it to anyonewho wants to be right in the middle of so much to do.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved this hotel, we got our high floor 25th room perfect but sadly no tea making facility, I had one concern though the window opening, not that you would fall out but there are some persons out there that just might throw something out and from that height!!!!! Other than that enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Usual good standards as expected by Riu. Friendly welcome and special request for high floor and room with a view was no problem. Rooms on the small side but that seems the norm for NYC. Great location just metres from Times Square and Broadway. We would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location very short walk to times square,restaurants and bars .Check in was smooth and quick very efficient. We were room only and great size for a couple in the queen size room.toiletries in bathroom,fridge and a safe ,t.v etc .One issue is that I left some items of clothing in the drawers next to the bed ,I have e-mailed the hotel 4 times stating that I will give my address and pay for postage to get my items returned and have had NO reply !! Naturally I am a very disappointed first time Riu guest . We stayed from May 22nd to Friday 26 th 2017 . Hopefully I will get a response this way .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I would recommend staying here for its proximity to Times Square and Hell's Kitchen bars and restaurants, cleanliness, and modern vibe. Just a block or two from Times Square! Great thai restaurants heading in the other direction. We stayed in a King room on the 12th floor. Room was a decent size for NYC, and the bathroom was excellent. Shower was among the best at any hotel and very modern. Bed was ok. Large tv. Terrific view. Part of the room was starting to look a little worn after just one year, but a fresh coat of paint would help. Breakfast buffet was good, mostly just eggs, bacon, breads, fruits, etc. No omelette station. Coffee was strong and tasted great. Lobby and bar area were very attractive and smelled fresh. We would certainly stay here again. Staff was friendly and always helpful.
user_name:
dnpinva
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a very modern hotel just a short walk to Times Square past several theaters. The reception is amazing and the room was bright , modern , clean and included a fabulous walk in shower . As this was my husbands first visit we wanted to do all of the major attractions , we were able to walk to all of them except for 9/11 memorial for which we took a taxi. The other best thing for me personally was the Concierge Manuel Figueroa who helped us on several occasions and recommended several additional trips /restaurants etc and booked us great seats for a Broadway show all of which combined to make our holiday truly memorable. The only issues we had was queuing for breakfast but after the first day we learned to avoid specific times around 8.30 am so we did not have to do this again and the fact that tea/coffee making facilities were not available in the room which we are used to in the UK. We would definitely return to this hotel in the future

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Checking in was fairly easy. My room was on the 6th floor facing 8th Ave. It's one of those rooms where you have to have the key in a slot in the wall to activate the power. It was a nice comfy bed, not a lot of drawer space, but ample closet space. Sure the shower is glass and everyone says it's see-thru, but it's frosted enough that you're only seeing shadows.  With the super dark blackout curtains, I decided to sleep in each morning instead of taking advantage of the breakfast buffet since I heard there was always a long line. But I really like that there's a safe and mini-fridge. They say that the higher floors are quieter, but I slept just great on the 6th floor. The location is great, and an amazing gay bar right next door!  I was sad to check out of my quaint, comfy room. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It's an average hotel at a very expensive price tag for the smallest room I have ever stayed in. I booked this hotel knowing the Riu standards but I was very disappointed when I opened the door to our room.You do not get the friendly personal service which you get at other Riu hotels which we have become accustomed to. I think there are better hotels for the price tag in New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing hotel in the heart of everything. Great staff. New hotel, lovely. Can not fault a thing. Hotel offers flat rate to and from airport.Morning café is good and good prices. tons of stuff around. Pubs, Time Square, Subway, Bus tours are 3 mins by foot. Carlo bakery(NYC) is just around the corner. Most shows are in the area. Subway on 42 st takes you to Chinatown, Brooklyn etc. Easy to get around cheap. Trump towers is not far by foot either,happy hour prices are cheap(Surprisingly). You can get a new York explore pass and pick 3 or 5 things to do. Hope this helps

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our first visit to New York and we decided to stay in the Riu as we are familiar with the company from other holidays. We went for a special occasion so I emailed ahead and requested a room on a high floor - they gave us a room on floor 24 out of 27 - ideal! The hotel is in the perfect location just one block away from the centre of Times Square. If you are a first time visitor to NYC, you'll be reassured to know that you can get to all the main attractions very easily from here. We walked down 5/6/7th Avenues, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Macy's - and there's a subway right in Times Square so we had easy access to the 9/11 memorial and Statue of Liberty. The hotel itself is really new, very clean, super modern and nicely decorated. The rooms are a really good size. I've seen people complain about room sizes in NYC but honestly what do you expect? We had a comfortable double bed, dressing table, fridge, wardrobe, safe and iron and ironing board. Cable TV also includes plenty of channels. I imagine it could be a little noisy if you were on a low floor, due to emergency services, taxis, but hey - it's New York. The noise didn't bother us where we were. Breakfast was included in our package. Like everything in NYC, breakfast was somewhat chaotic. It gets extremely busy whatever time you go down and expect to queue for a table, but the queues go down pretty fast. There isn't a great selection and it's a buffet so you can't request anything different. Food is very average but sufficient to start your day. I probably wouldn't have paid for it had it not been included. There is a Pret a Manger right outside so if you were stuck you could always go there for a snack. Lastly, the hotel staff were very polite and friendly. I had a mini crisis after check out where I realised I'd left a ring in our safe! But the gentleman on reception raced straight upstairs with me to help me find it. He could not have been nicer or more helpful. Check out itself is a very quick and easy process and we didn't have to queue. You can also pay for late check out if you want, nice option to have!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed with friends for 4 nights. Brilliant location a few steps from Times Square and with a significant number of quality restaurants nearby. New hotel so well appointed and very clean. Rooms are spacious for Manhattan. Staff very nice. It works very well

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 6 nights here, whilst the hotel was clean it may be more suited to young people. More like an upmarket back packers hostel. It is not in Times Square - 2 blocks away( this wasn't a problem but should it be in the name) the bathroom was minute room only for 1 person to be in there and the rooms barely managed to be able to put 2 suitcases down( with 1 in the cupboard). Whilst staff were polite they were not at all interested in their customers. Breakfast was included in the price but after 2 mornings we stopped going - food was all cold and dried out. Queues to go to breakfast were huge. The fire alarm went off on 2 consecutive nights and it seemed there was difficulty turning it off there were no updates onto what was happening until the PA advised that they ' didn't know why it was happening".

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 1 night. Modern, clean hotel. We were able to checkin at noon (but was a lower floor which doesn't matter to us since we sent very little time in room). Walking distance to theaters and reasonable price. Breakfast was included, basic buffet, nothing to write home about but good enough. This hotel bigger and more sterile so you don't the boutique hotel experience but the price was right! We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Riu for 3 nights in May 2017. We had a very comfortable stay and loved the handy location. Just a block from the hustle and bustle of Times Square yet far enough away to feel a bit separated from the action.The hotel had a very modern vibe and the decor was interesting. It was an expensive place to stay and for the price did not provide many extras.Due to booking late I secured a family room with two double beds. The room was quite spacious. Although the beds are technically separate they are pushed together. I'm not sure that i would want more than two or 3 people in the room let alone a family. There was very little storage.I have read some reviews from people commenting about the frosted glass of the shower and toilet and lack of privacy. I can understand that this may be off putting however in my opinion i can assure people that privacy was not compromised. When my husband was in the shower all one could see from the room was a very distorted silhouette. There was a small bar fridge but no tea or coffee making facilities.  I could often hear the people next door so sound proofing was not fantastic.Wifi was reliable and complimentary.We ate in the hotel restaurant one evening and enjoyed a nice and reasonably priced meal. The staff were friendly and attentive even after I spilt my water all over the table.Overall I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location, front desk personnel, room, restaurants., we liked everything! Previous comments about opaque bathroom walls are not a problem. Generous toiletries were provided. Shampoo is in the shower, people. Amy's Bread and Kiehl's are around the corner on 9th Avenue. Location is within a couple of blocks of TKTS and Broadway shows. Wonderful restaurants are nearby. Lunch in the hotel restaurant is reasonable and very good.. The Grab & Go is handy for coffee or smoothies and a sandwich or wrap. We will stay again on our next trip to NYC!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel right in the middle of Times Square. We were within walking distance to The majestic and the other theaters. Steps away from shopping, dining and nice pubs. Took advantage of the nice December weather to do as much walking, but Uber came in handy!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: New hotel in the middle of the action of Times Square. Very efficient staff at check-in. Small but very clean standard rooms, isolation from street noise is poor. No bath tubs, only showers. Breakfast is ok but crowded, do no expect personal service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Modern Clinical looking hotel with cold and not very welcoming public spaces. Canteen style breakfast in a large noisy space. The breakfast was very good . Small but spotlessly clean rooms.Beds comfortable. No Tea and Coffee making facilities. I would say on a par with Premier Inn. Beware of the taxes added on the bill we ended up paying around £125 more than anticipated. Resort fee's for use of Gym.! I think we could have done better.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just got back from 4 days at this hotel and was impressed. Very good location, clean rooms and comfy beds. There are no tea and coffee facilities in the room and no water in the fridge but we spent very little time in the room and just used it for the bed. Would recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel located not too far but too close from time square ... great location. Very new with nice modern decoration. Rooms are comfortable with beautiful view if you enjoy room in an upper floor. Nice bar for happy hour or late drink. Staff is very friendly . Breakfast room is huge and very much full, nonetheless buffet continuously renewed ... friendly staff in general. Certainly a great place to stay in NYC at a reasonable price with good clean comfort

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really nice hotel!! Perfect location.The room was really clean and with modern furniture. The only small negative point was the size of the roomService and good were really good .We recommend this hotel for a short trip in NY

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This four star hotel is well situated to Times Square. It is clean and comfortable. Despite no room service you can get what you want downstairs in the restaurant & bar. The 'resort tax' says 'includes bottled water' but this is only once then you have to buy your own. I thought this was misleading and said so.Felt quite safe as a solo traveller staying here and wandering out and about from the location. You are right in the theatre district with a huge range of food outlets and entertainment. All within walking distance. Cos it's midtown you can walk to Central Park as well as Bryant Park area with ease doing your shopping along the way.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great modern hotel. We put in a request for a quiet room, and despite being told it's hard to escape the noise in NYC, we didn't hear a thing from our room up on the 27th floor. Everything in the hotel was super clean and new. Bathroom was modern and spacious. The location was superb, right near times square and a 15 minute stroll to Central Park. The hotel restaurant was well priced and convenient. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 5 of us girls shared a family room, which was small but as I'm lead to believe every room in NYC is small! Well it is if you want good location, which this certainly is! We found staff friendly, roasting showers and comfy beds! We were hardly in the room as we came to see New York and fit in as much as we could! Views were exceptional!!!! You can't see through the frosted glass, but I can see why people might be put off! We didn't eat in the hotel because loads of wee eating places round about! Would go back to stay here if I return to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were booking on behalf of a client and had what can be mildly described as an abysmal experience. We are based in Ireland and the reservation was for an Irish competition prize, so it was a big deal to our client and ended up being a very big deal to the winner's cohort for all the wrong reasons. First of all, pre-payment methods seemed to be non-existent. We fully understand card security etc, but no flexibility/accommodation was given by the hotel. Surely pre-payment on behalf of a client is something that an international hotel would be accustomed to. After weeks of to-ing and fro-ing however, the hotel managed to muster up a pre-authorisation form as an "exception". If this "exception" was conducted earlier on, it would have saved us and indeed the hotel a lot of time and bother.This delay and tardiness leads to the second issue. Due to the delay in pre-authorisation, we were put in an embarrassing situation, whereby the competition winner party had to use their own card to pay for the rooms... Essentially paying for their own prize! Luckily our winner understood the predicament that the hotel had put us in... If it wasn't for check out, when the hotel tried to take payment again, not once but twice and maxed out the guest's credit card! This caused a highly stressful and embarrassing situation to be in, impacting on mortgage payments and direct debits coming out of the card that the hotel had incorrectly maxed out. Really disappointing and unsatisfactory, would never recommend this hotel to a client, friend or traveller ever again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We were advised the Deluxe Family Room would be adequate for our family of 5 - ha! Where to start.....upon arrival the doorman took our bags (very nice) we checked in and we were told they were taking $200 on our credit card and this would be taken off the final bill - ok. We went to our 'Family Deluxe Room' - oh no, there's been a mix up. When we entered the room we were confronted with two double beds pushed together and little to no room to walk around the beds, let alone place our suitcases for 5 people anywhere. Also, There were no solid walls for the bathroom, just frosted glass, the thought of watching my kids and husband on the toilet is not nice and having my 13 yo son in the room while I shower is weird. I went back to reception and advised we thought we had been given the wrong room. The receptionist was quite frank and told me that was well big enough for 5 people and a standard family room. I asked him if he would shower in front of his mother like that - he said no! Our hand was forced (as we couldn't spend 11 days in a dog kennel) and we had to pay for the next sized room (not in the budget) but they couldn't move us for 3 nights. It's lucky they didn't move us right away because it took over an hour to get our bags delivered and this only happened because my husband went to chase them up.Obviously the person who designed the family rooms with one large bed and access to watch each other shower and go to the toilet had a very SPECIAL relationship with their family.While staying there we talked to other quests who had the exact same experience as us! They were also waiting to be moved to a larger room.Upon departure we didn't get back our $200 they were holding (we forgot to ask) The rooms were cramped, dusty and not finished (painting half done, tiles held on with tape) Lino floors is not what you expect for that price. Staff not interested in taking care of quests once you handed over your credit card. Great location. The cafe attached to the hotel was lovely, staff friendly and would help with directions, fresh food and fast service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely beautiful hotel, modern, clean and in my opinion classy. The rooms are small but accommodating however I would of liked a kettle and cups in the room for when you fancy a coffee (or your own British brew). The location is perfect across the block is time square. We stayed B&B and glad we did as the prices of food around the area are jaw dropping (I can't comment on the menu prices in the hotel but put it this way two drinks at the riu bar cost me $27 = £21.50 but hey that's the big apple! We didn't use all the facilities the hotel has to offer As NYC has too much to offer. As a New York virgin I didnt think I'd be needing the hoodie and trainers but did I!! Rethink your suitcase people trainers all the way. I would highly recommend the gray line city tour bus saved us a fortune in taxis we bought the VIP tickets from our local Thomas cook and you get free excursions inc. Pre book your super shuttle if you have no transfers as this saved us a fortune the riu offer their own taxi service to the airport but I was quoted $75 shuttle is only $43 you can initially book this at the airport on your arrival but then to book your return book online. The hotel has wifi which is very fast and efficient. The staff are as friendly as you want them to be.... the say hi and are there if you need them for anything which is enough for me. Check in was fast no messing and check out also as fast. Perfect hotel for our first and perfect experience of New York couldn't of asked for better!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at Rui plaza Times Square for 5 nights and unfortunately the only positive thing I can say about this hotel is that it is in a great location. We found the staff rude and unhelpful. The rooms were small. We had to ask for room to be cleaned Shower was cold more than hot and water pressure was non existent. Over our 5 day stay we were lucky to get hot water for half the time. We complained twice but it made little difference. On my next visit to NYC I would stay in this location but not this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived at this hotel around 9pm and booked in swiftly by pleasant smiling staff. Went to our room, which was clean and comfortable. Hotel is located about a 5 minute walk to Times Square? No bottles of water in the fridge and as others have stated, no tea and coffee. Didn't spoil our visit though. We went out and bought some. Room was more than adequate for us. 2 queen sized beds which were very comfortable. Not the biggest room we've stayed in, but who needs a large room when visiting New York. Only used for sleeping in. As for the glass panelled bathroom, which people moan about, where's the problem? Glass is heavily frosted and we couldn't see each other,but then, we weren't looking. We're not prudes or shy, so maybe not a problem to look for. Took breakfast in the hotel. Bit chaotic, but everything was fine. Everyone wanted to be fed and ready for sight seeing and arrived around the same time. Go early, or a bit later. Plenty of choice, unless you're really fussy. Always shown to a clean table and all the staff were smiling and appeared happy. Shower gel ran out 1st day, but not replaced. We took it off the wall to make the point, but it was just moved. By day 3 I put it in the middle of the shower and it was replenished. No big drama as we had taken our own. On the last day we got 2 bottles of water put in the fridge. Too late! We had brought our own anyway. Opted for a late checkout, as we were getting picked up at 5.30PM. Not a problem. Paid the fee on checkout and not too expensive compared to other hotels. Would I return and recommend this hotel, YES.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very Impressed with Hotel, Looks new, Room was bright and airey, View from room only concrete, staff very helpful, Good position for exploring major attractions. Did not eat at hotel but there was alot of choice nearby.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I checked in late after a show I'd seen and even though it was almost midnight, both desk agents were busy. It took some time but finally one was available. Armando was very nice, the process took a few minutes (mostly notable due to how tired I was) and I was given a free upgrade due to my room type being unavailable. I had a nice view and two double beds pushed together. It's a pretty good sized room for New York. The room was clean, a few things a little worn and the remote for the tv was nowhere to be found. I was only there overnight but it got the job done. A pretty reasonable price for being very close to the heart of Times Square. Easy walking distance to tons of stuff. Also the lobby is really neat and the decor really stands out. It is fun!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here 18th to 23 March 2016.brilliant location for everything.times square is 3/4 min walk away. Central park 15/20 mins roughly.subway stations 5 mins away.cafes 'restaurant's 'deli's' souvenir shops etc all within a couple of mins away.so couldn't be closer to things if u wanted.hotel was superb .lovely foyer as you walk in.helpful staff .rooms are smallish but have got everything that you could ask for.nice shower' comfy bed 'iron & board little fridge 'blackout curtains'which you may need because of the lights from times sq which we didn't relies where there till are last day when my wife pointed them out haha.we didn't really need them but some people may do. we stayed In a deluxe double room on the 220nd floor looking out over towards times Sq. So fantastic views of that.also if u go in the corridors when you come out of lifts there are at least 2/3 windows looking out towards the Hudson river one way and uptown towards central park .when we booked with Thomson's they asked if it was a special occasion. It woz are 25th anniversary so the women said she would make a note to the hotel .We asked for a nice view as well.so we got the nice room with a view and on are anniversary day we came back after being out All day to a bottle of champagne/chocolates and a nice little card wishing us a happy anniversary. We thought that was a fantastic touch from the hotel.they didn't have to do that .Would we stay here again.YOU BET we would and will in the future. and we would recommend it to anyone.10 out of 10 for us.also lovely little coffee shop on ground floor for a nice drink first thing or late on and very nice staff also.☺

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Could not fault this hotel, big clean rooms, staff, breakfast, location. Staff were great, very helpful especially the doorman. Am in wheelchair and staff were always asking if I needed any help and tried to refuse tips when I did . Girls in breakfast room went out of their way to find us a suitable table. Stayed at Edison last year, nice hotel but Riu Plaza surpassed it. Going again next year to NYC and will not be looking at any other hotels.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Grand lobby area with soaring ceilings. Lots of places to sit with restaurants throughout the lobby area. Grey "wood" flooring and white walls with black and white photos of NY. Clean modern sterile feel. Spacious rooms and bathroom. Bed is comfortable -pillows are mediocre. Great location - just a block off Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Horrible customer service, vagrants in the lobby, I felt very unsafe in the neighborhood. Customer service was rude especially the blonde man at desk. Overall terrible experience.Do not bookWorst stay ever

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First of all, it's a very good location. Secondly, clean rooms. with a beautiful view of city from 26-th floor. We stayed with my husband in the Executive room. It gives you all day snacks, coffee, water and even vine. Friendly staff. Amazing holiday!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu Plaza NY is a modern hotel, with rooms very comfortable and well decorated. The front desk crew is friendly and solve all my requests. The hotel is near the Times Square, at 46th W Street, where you can find many good restaurants, mainly using the Timetable app.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A convenient location for all of the main tourist attractions.most are easily walkable but also easy to jump in a taxi or get to nearest subway. Comfortable clean modern hotel . Check in was disappointing as we arrived at 2 pm and allowed to check but told rooms would be ready at 3 pm so we hung around the hotel but actually the rooms were not ready until 4 30 so we wasted a few hours waiting when we Could have gone for a walk had we known up front . The hotel did then give us a late check out as compensation so that worked. There was plenty to choose for breakfast. The cooked stuff was ok not great but plenty of cereal toast fruit and pastries etc so easy to fill up on that. All in all a really good stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Brilliant location. That's the first thing! Literally just off Times Square and close to subway and taxis. Next, The rooms were a great size even by New York standard! Three girls and a mountain of bags and suitcase and we all fit just fine! The beds are super comfy too! The staff are faultless and couldn't be more helpful if they tried! Can't wait to return!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel, was nervous being a bit newer...but very clean and we had a beautiful view of the river! Having 2 double beds and a fold out couch was fabulous...very hard to find and with 3 kids they often don't want to sleep in the same bed. The energy saver of having to put a key in the light switch can be a bit annoying when someone wants to stay in the room but someone else wants to take a key just in case....ask for an extra key!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in the Rui plaza 3-7th may. It was a lovely hotel, central to everywhere. Hotel staff were very nice and friendly. Breakfast was gorgeous, loads of choice. The views were amazing, we stayed on the 25th floor. The only one thing I would criticise is the bathroom, it wasn't very private, it was frosted glass with a sliding door, I've been with my partner for 7 years but didn't feel comfortable using the bathroom, didn't feel private enough.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Mother and daughter travelling together. In terms of location this is very good but felt it let itself down in other areas. Having to queue down a flight of stairs for breakfast was difficult for my mother who struggled with going down stairs, although the queue moved quickly. The breakfast was similar to AI breakfast I have experienced in the past, The room was deluxe but generally, I have had better. I expected there to be shampoo as in other city hotels but every time we asked the cleaner didn't speak English. We had plenty of conditioner. Before going we were aware of the problem with the glass shower but the main problem was waking each other up in the night with the light and not having a door that shut when using the toilet. The room has two queen bed and if there were four people rather than just the two of us I could not see where luggage would have gone, The bell boys were really helpful. Reception staff were not that helpful. We were also woke at 6 am by alarm going off in the room and then again at 7 am. Sometimes workmen stood outside our room chatting on radio phones. The hotel appeared clean and was almost clinical. Would I recommend, yes for location but not for quality of room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location is excellent. Everything is within walking distance- Times Square, Rockefeller center, Central Park, Broadway, Grand Central Station, Macy's on 34th, MOMA, Port Authority bus terminal........The staff is attentive & very hospitable.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My first time in New. York and I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.My room was kept very clean and the public areas were also.Did not have breakfast here but snack lunch was good,no complaints

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I visited this hotel for a weeks vacation in New York. It was appealing based on its location and it being a new hotel . Overall I would recommend staying here - rooms lovely if a bit small, good gym and above all fantastic location. The only advice I would give is to avoid some of the disabled access rooms which have wet rooms in the bathrooms. They haven't been finished well and water can leak into the bedroom.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The "Great" LOCATION--theater district, Times Square, Restaurant choices The good--main desk, entry decor, bar, breakfast buffetthe average---very small room, European, one straight office chair, no in room coffee, three outletsthe not so good--Concierge--Had to look everything up on computer, no "inside" information about anything.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is a block from Times Square which was great but that's it. The room was small, the walls were dirty (only 14 months old), the phone was dusty, they didn't clean the bathroom and the TV Chanel's were not working and when I asked about it I was told they only get the basic channels. Why did I pay a resort fee for just to use the internet? Will not be going back there that's for sure...

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel ideally positioned near Times Square. The rooms were clean and in good condition. The staff and service were excellent. The restaurant served a great breakfast and, considering the position, fantastic evening meals, albeit with a limited menu. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay again any time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stopped at the Rui as an anniversary treat from our daughter and were looking forward to staying in a hotel in the heart of Times Square.First impressions were great, a modern hotel with bar and restaurant, coffee lounge and large breakfast room. Plush reception with polite and friendly staff. Check in was relatively quick and bell boy handled all the luggage up to the room. Could have done it myself but I'm on holiday so why not.Then we get to the room. For something that cost over $300 a night I can only rate the room as very basic and based on UK hotels, budget standard. Toiletries in the shower room, telly on the wall, two bottles of water in the fridge and that's your lot. No coffee making facilities, mini bar or posh slippers.We did ask reception if we had the right room and were told that none of the rooms have tea or coffee facilities and to get more room amenities we would have to upgrade to a suite. Having what is classed as a deluxe double leads you to think that the room would be reasonably equipped. Wrong!I did pay a visit to the bar on one occasion to get a coffee and a beer. Couldn't have a glass pint glass as I was taking it to the room so had to have two glass bottles. Health and safety apparently. $25 and the beer was out of date! Got a refund on the beer but restaurant manager didn't seem to see my point that he was selling out of date stock. Dated Sep 2016 with 180 day consume by advice. It's now April 2017.Although we enjoyed our time in NY, the hotel let the holiday down. I'm sure there are plenty of other hotels that offer the same standard of accommodation and facilities for a lot less money or other hotels that offer more for the same money. Either way won't be recommending the Rui as a value for money place to stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Date stayed 23-4-2017 to 27-4-2017 Room 2520.This is a very modern hotel in a prime location in NYC. On our arrival our check in was quick and smooth. All of the staff we encountered were polite and courteous.When booking this hotel I would strongly advise you book the room rate which includes breakfast.We saved a small fortune eating breakfast at this hotel. Pretty much anything you would want to see served at breakfast is available. This certainly kept us going all day.Our room was a decent size for two people. Clean and tidy. The room includes a safe (which the previous occupant decided would be a great idea to leave locked. This cost us about an hour of our time while the hotel staff came to unlock it).There was in iron and ironing board as well. Unfortunately there was no tea or coffee making machine in the room and the selection of TV channels is extremely basic.There was one big problem with our room. The design of the bathroom wall and sliding door.The bathroom wall which is adjacent to the bed is opaque glass. So when you needed to see a man about a dog at 2 O'clock in the morning the whole room lights up when you turn the bathroom light on. The sliding door (also opaque) is a great space saver, however not very private even when closed. You would indeed need to be very comfortable with the person you are sharing the room with. I would recommend this hotel we enjoyed our stay, particularly breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed two nights and I must say, I can't find anything bad to say. The hotel is very close to Times Square (one block away), it is clean, sleek and very modern. Check I was very smooth and, since I was there before the 3:00pm check in, they stored my bags for me while I hit the sights and sounds of Times Square. The room was small (space is always a premium in Manhattan) but the design was clean and modern. Perhaps just a tad "too minimalist" for my liking as I constantly seemed to be looking around for a clock to tell the time. Breakfast buffet was excellent and available from 7:00 to 11:00 am. I did not partake of any of the hotel's restaurants as you are so close to both Times Square and Hell's Kitchen and the literally hundreds of restaurants and deli's nearby. Price was a little on the high end, but it is a higher end hotel. And real estate in the Theatre District can be pricey. Overall, a very comfortable stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited in April 2017 for 7 nights! Great location being a few minutes walk from Times Square and Subway stations. You can also pick up the Woodbury common bus opposite the hotel, which was great especially after coming back with lots of shopping! The hotel was lovely, the staff very friendly. The rooms were of nice size and had good views, as can be expected from New York!! The cafe was also good in the hotel for a quick and cheap breakfast. Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location ! Restaurants , bars and street vendors aplenty and right on the doorstep . 2 min walk to Times Square yet wonderfully peaceful nights sleep. Concierge staff lovely with great sense of humour, front desk a little stuck up! Wifi acceptable and available in lobby , your room and bars . Breakfast great lots of choice fresh and tasty. BUT ... the bathroom in the rooms have frosted glass doors , no wood !! So prepare to hear and smell everything and a 2 inch gap so you can watch too if that's your thing ! Now shower time , do you remember Tales of the unexpected ? The dancing shadow , well guess what you have the main part ! Google it if you need an image . So would I return , No, but only cause I don't have that closer relationship with my friends or my partner where toilet activities are concerned . Enjoy NYC it is Amazing !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Riu. Lovely room, great view, good location. Bus stop for sightseeing just across the road. Glad we took a travel kettle - no tea facilities in room. Fridge came in handy. Very busy at breakfast, had to queue most days but not for long. Lovely helpful staff. Would recommend it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed four nights in RIU Times Square. The location is perfect! Within Restaurant Row, close to Times Square, shops and including breakfast buffet. Offering breakfast is a Unique Selling Point compares with other hotels in Manhattan. Severel Hop-on-Hop-of-busses stop in front of the hotel at 8th Avenue.* Check in* The receptionist behind the frontoffice desk wasn't so friendly. We were commanded: "ID and passport". That was a pity! The deposit was 100 US Dollars for the room. The bell boy and conciërge were friendly and showed hospitality towards the guests. *Room*We had a so called Deluxe Family Room on the 15th floor. Unfortunately there were no coffee and tea facilities. But the room was okay and good. There was a mini fridge, an iron board in the closet and many towels, bodylotion and soap in the bathroom. *Breakfast*Breakfast was from 07.00 - 11.00 AM. Sometimes it was very crowded. There was a lot of choice: Pancakes, strolls, muffins, bread, bananas, apples, fruit etc.. A good day starter. We had a good stay in RIU!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Ok, nothing interesting happened, for those of you who don't know Hamilton. The title would have worked better if something weird had happened, but my room was fine. I booked two rooms, both were clean. Everything went smoothly other than the delay in getting our rooms. When we got there, I requested adjoining rooms, or rooms really close by, and also high rooms, so I assume the delay was a result of trying to fulfill the request.A great value and location for seeing a show. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Can't fault the location and reception area, rooms are small only one chair in deluxe king or queen room, there are no coffee making facilities in the rooom or complimentary coffee available - there is a coffee shop on site open until 9pm. Daily service fee of $12 per room includes use of gym and "free wifi" - does seem excessive since generally these are included in room rates! Breakfast buffet very busy and comparable to school canteen all self service. Restaurant was pleasant with minimal basic menu. Reception staff pleasant but with poor English understanding making check in an ordeal - check in time is 15:00 but had to wait as rooms were not ready.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hubby and I had gone out-of-town to visit our Family in the big apple and stayed in RIU Plaza, Times Square. The modern hotel has a very nice ambiance and a little busy. It is in a good location, only 2 blocks to the Time Square. The rooms are a little small – but it was perfect for a couple. If you’re traveling with family, ensure to book a wider room with double beds. We got there earlier than the check-in time and didn’t have any issues. The restaurant – Fashion is open late, so if you’re too tired to step out to grab a midnight snack, you can always check it out! Good food and very polite servers. We will definitely book this hotel again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for a week in this hotel in April 2017. It is perfectly situated (e.g. 2 blocks from nearest Metro Station, a few hundred meters from Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue etc). Our room (double deluxe king size bed) was modern and relatively spacious. Bathroom was excellent. Room a/c was not providing warm air (but we did not report it to management). The staff was very polite and willing to assist on every occasion. The bell boys are swift in their response and there is 24/7 security staff checking who is going to the elevators - good feeling of safety and security. Business center is very good and free-of-charge (e.g. to print boarding passes). The restaurant is good and not very pricey and the breakfast was good too. One inconvenience was the noise insulation in our room (plaster wall separation) which we feel was not up to the hotel's overall very good level. It goes without saying that we strongly recommend it both to individual and family travelers.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: hotel itself is lovely, rooms spacious - only concern regarding room is the showers frosted glass - not ideal when travelling with friends!Customer service of hotel managers and head office is beyond appalling. The hotel FROZE my friend's life saving medication and refused to do anything about it, they would have left her to die for all they cared. Several complaints later and the hotel are still doing nothing about it. Over £3200 occured in extra charges sorting out their mess and the most they can say is its nothing to do with them. Would not recommend and will NEVER stay with this hotel chain again. EVER.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The "hard product" at the RIU is OK, and would have perhaps warranted a 3-star review. It's got a good location, the rooms are small but clean and spare, and the furnishings relatively new. The rooms lack some basic amenities, like coffee-making facilities or a clock-radio, and the bathrooms are very small (no tub).However, the "soft product" (the part under the control of the day-to-day management) at this hotel is absolutely awful. On arrival, it took the desk clerk almost 30 minutes to check us in (for a fully pre-booked reservation), with much hemming and hawing and shuffling back and forth. On the first morning, we arrived at the breakfast room to find a line of 75+ guests snaking down the hall, down a set of stairs to the basement, and down the hall there -- all waiting for breakfast. Once seated, we saw a single woman seated at a table by one manager, and when she got up to get the buffet, another couple was seated at her table, displacing her!On the second morning we went to the elevators, and they didn't work -- the call button simply went out after being pushed. We tried again and again, but gave up after 10+ minutes and walked down the fire stairs to the lobby, where a manager told us that they were running them on manual, and would have gotten to us "eventually" if we had called on the phone! There is no phone in the elevator lobby on each floor.And at 2am on the second night/third morning we were awoken by a fire alarm -- a piercing shriek. As we quickly dressed and prepared to leave a voice came on saying to stay in our rooms, but then the alarm proceeded to go off again four more times, each time followed by a garbled announcement -- in four languages -- to stay in our rooms, it was a false alarm. This went on for 20+ minutes.If you read the other reviews, our experience is clearly not a new one, these things happen often. The management of this hotel clearly has no idea what they are doing, and in my experience it would be a mistake to stay here. There are plenty of less expensive hotels around Times Square that will deliver a better experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: this is a lovely modern boutique hotel that is in a great location close to times square. Amenities are clean and modern. it was good to take advantage of the buffet breakfast daily before heading out to explore NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Room was on 28 floor brilliant views and quite,very clean,maids always cleaning,especially around reception and restaurant ,coffee shop attached to hotel ,no coffee or tea making facilities in room ,restaurant good food,not really expensive ,close to times square and tour buses stop just outside hotel. I would recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was a trip for my daughters 21st and we had asked for a room with a view and a higher floor. We arrived to check in and the lady checking us in seems hassled. We ended up on the 8th floor with no view. When we went to bed that night I noticed that the springs on my side of the bed had in some way collapsed and the mattress was lop sided! We didn't complain as every time we walked by reception it was always so busy. On 4 occasions we had to return to reception as the key card wouldn't work for us and again, the staff seemed hassled and frazzled.We ate in the restaurant on one night and the food was ok but I ordered a bottle of chardonnay from the menu. The server came back confirming that they were out of chardonnay. I then ordered pinot and he returned again to say that all they have was sauvingon! I brought my glass of wine to the room on the 2nd night to finish it and the glass was still in my room when we left 4 days later! Positives - Room is small but functional for 2 people. Everything was very clean when we arrived. Lifts are busy but not too much delay at all. Hotel is 3 min walk from times square and there are plenty of coffee shops etc around it. Breakfast was in a large area but was constantly busy. Food was good with a large range of hot and cold items. Wifi is "free" however on leaving expect approx £130 extra on your bill for taxes and hotel charges!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited riu plaza 17-22 April.. lovely modern hotel right in the heart of new york... ( times square) Check in pretty straight forward and quick...some reception staff were lovely, others forgot they were the first face of the hotel and were pretty lacking in manners and personality..Gorgeous bar and coffee shop with Apple crumble donuts to die for..Brekky...Very busy buffet stylePlenty of choice for drinks and foodHot food - not hot ( didn't really bother me but some will find it a major downfall)Bagels, cheeses, cereals, pancakes, toast, nutella, maple syrup, pastries and muffins... there's plenty to go at if luke warm scrambled egg ain't your thing..Was my birthday when there and they brought me cake and sang to me which was a nice touch..Room....Spacious, clean, comfortable, modern...Loads of towelsNo tea or coffee making...took our own kettle which took an age to boil but kept us going.. .you can actually take drinks from brekky to your room.Hairdryer was fast but my hair styling tool just didn't work on their voltage.. .my friends straighteners seemed ok though..Little fridge in room and lots of wardrobe space ( only one tiny drawer though) and free safe..So so so noisy from the street outside...incessant beeping of horns but I defy you to find a central hotel where this isn't the case.Room cleaned daily...Would I go back to this hotel? Yes

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The decor of the hotel was cool and very European, however, the other things about the hotel will cause me to never stay there again. (#3 below is the main reason).1)The room was hot, and I'm pretty sure the thermostat was just for looks - didn't seem broken, just seemed fake. I called downstairs to ask for someone to come up but no one ever did. 2)They didn't have bottled water available on the property after their store closed. I'm not even kidding. I was relatively ok with no ice machines and not a vending machine on site (too American for this cool Euro-prop), but when I went to the bar to buy bottled water, he only had 2 bottles. Again, ok with that, but the next night I went back and he had none. None on the property. I went to the front desk and actually had to complain that it seemed crazy to spend $815 for 2 nights and I can't buy bottled water??? After a few minutes of complaining, the front desk clerk went to a manager who was listening in the background at a desk, but never atttemped to come intervene, and he ok'ed the release of 3 bottles of water from some secret place in the back. It was just weird.3)The final and biggest issue making this property a poor choice for any traveler....When we were ready to leave, I gave the hotel attendant my parking reciept. He said the car would be around in 20 minutes because of traffic. This was at 4:07 pm. I didn't not get my car until 5:10 pm. It was ridiculous. He forgot to put the request in the system to retrieve the car from the parking company that they contract with. I found this out after waiting for 30 minutes and going up to ask what the deal was. It took another 30 minutes to get the car after they realized their mistake. At this point, I insisted they bring our bags to the front, because I didn't want to lose more time once the car finally arrived. Our large duffle was missing, and a back pack belonging to someone else was on our cart.
