So after all this waiting time, I asked the bellman to ask the manager if she would consider paying the $120 for my parking, since I lost an hour because of their mistake and I also would have lost a duffle bag filled with valuable shoes. The bellman came back telling me the manager said she can't and won't pay it, and the only way I would get it paid was if the hotel employee himself would pay for his mistake." Totally unprofessional. Total disregard for hotel guest. The kicker is that the gentleman who worked for the parking company, and brought me my car (not an RIU employee), told me "they will probably pay for it, they've done it before". So I know that the woman who was the manager on duty, on Friday, April 21st around 5 - 5:30, simply didn't care. Please reconsider staying here. If you like the decor, go to the bar for a drink. We've stayed at the Crown Plaza when my girls want to go to Times Square and it was very nice and the rooms were twice the size. They were booked so we tried RIU.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wow, wow, wow... Riu said they had been looking for 10 years for the right place in New York, well let me tell you, they have.What a stunning location, fantastic hotel and great staff.This hotel is literally 2 minute walk(when you can cross the road that is) from Times Square. It's central to everything you want to do, where you want to go. Can't fault this place at all. When we checked in, there was confusion with my booking, but this could have been due to us rescheduling our break, all resolved quickly and our room upgraded to boot.The rooms were lovely, functional but lovely, I mean you don't go to New York to live in your hotel room, bit like going to Paris.Comfy, cosy, warm, room with a view.Well done Riu, we loved it, we will be back to the same place with our girls.Oh and when in New York... use Uber, best way to travel by far.Don't know why I'm begging this hotel up.... it will be booked up now when I want to go back cos you all gonna book it lol... go ahead, it's great.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu Plaza is ideally situated 400 metres from Times Square and is very modern hotel with nice decor and very nice staff. We stayed in room 2301 on the 23rd floor and the views were great. The room was made every day with clean towels supplied, a great walk in bathroom , huge beds a large TV. The buffet breakfast was great with a very well run team seating a lot of people very quickly. The choice for breakfast was very good with everything you could think of to start the long New York day. Bar staff were good and we ate one evening in the restaurant which was lovely.25 mins walk to Central Park . All in all a good Hotel choice for New York City.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It's all about the location, in the middle of the city, walking distance to all the attractions and times square. We stayed in a double and it was quite comfortable! there was a leak in the shower which made it a mess when showering. I had contact with 3 people in the front desk, and none of them welcomes you with a smile or a proper greeting. For the level of this hotel, one would expect a better service, the guy that works in the storage room with your luggage was the only one pleasent enough to have a service minded attitude. Ps: The bar at the hotel is way overpriced.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was for 3 days staying at Riu Plaza and enjoyed the stay. The location is very good (central) and the hotel is new and clean. The room size is OK and the staff is kind and friendly.I will come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was one block away from times square and very near to the broadway theatres. There's also duane reade behind the hotel. Room is modern and clean. They do not have queen beds, only full beds, so we had to use the sofa bed. However it was very thin and you can feel the spring, but the staff were very kind and they offered us extra blankets to layer it. Lots of charging sockets.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, on the 8th a few steps far from Time Square, several broadway theatres and good restaurants. Good service, kind staff and rich breakfast (not cheap though) Went there with family in January 2017.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After reading mixed reviews I was sceptical but honestly did not see what there was to complain about! The room is bright & airy. We had two double beds (3 people sharing) The bathroom/wet room is fab & packed with toiletries. The frosted glass door was not an issue, it didn't face the room & as your traveling with family, it's not a problem. Yes, the white Walls do have scuffs on them but it's a busy hotel. Great addition of having a fridge but a kettle would have been good. Hairdryer isn't very powerful but it does the job.Our view on level 5 wasn't great but we didn't go to look out the window. Considering we were only 5 floors up and next to the lift, we didn't experience any noise from the busy city outside or the lift. The hotel is a 5min walk to Times Square, subway stations & Carlos Bakery.The staff are friendly & helpful. We even had to get maintenance to break into our suitcases with no issue! He came up to our room with an angle grinder! Didn't use the breakfast or bar but did use the cafe which was lovely & fresh & good value. Having stayed in many Riu's before though, I do think this should be a bed & breakfast hotel.Would highly recommend & would stay here on my next trip!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I have recently returned from a 5 night stay here. The hotel is perfect for you if you are on a city break and will be spending most of your time sight-seeing. The deluxe double room had a comfy bed, fridge, shower, hairdryer, iron, tv and you are given a wi-fi access code on check in. In our room there was no mirror apart from in the bathroom which was slightly inconvenient.As the hotel is so close to Times Square there is a bit of noise, we were on the 20th floor and could still hear it. The Saturday night was the worst with a lot of traffic, which kept us up but the rest of the week was fine.The location of the hotel is perfect for Times Square and the subway although we walked to most places - Battery Park for the Statue of Liberty took about an hour and a half and Central Park was about 25 minutes.All in all, you wouldn't want to stay here for a nice relaxing holiday but if you are sight-seeing it is perfect.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I don't usually leave reviews, but I just feel that I should warn my fellow travelers out there so that their vacation is not ruined. First of all, this hotel seems luxurious (and you do pay the price for a luxury hotel) so it's natural to expect that you will have a good stay and that management would be be professional. We visited New York back in October 2016 and stayed here. From the moment we arrived, it took us forever to check in - it seems like the front desk was under-staffed for the number of people that were checking in at the time - which I found to be quite unprofessional. Guests are required to make reservations ahead of time - why can't management staff accordingly knowing that a lot of guests will be checking in? Also, we arrived a couple hours after check-in time, but our room was not even ready yet. Once we entered our room we sat on the bed only to find out that it was literally broken! The springs on one side of the bed had given in. So naturally, we requested another room, which required more waiting time on our end, which took away from our allocated time for sightseeing (we only were staying for a long weekend, so time was valuable to us). During our stay, a staff member literally just walked into our room without even knocking! And this person was not house keeping nor had we even request assistance with anything. Just a person with a key card just walked right in. We reported this at the front desk and were told that they would look into it. But throughout our stay we notice at least once on our floor a staff member entering a room with a key card and that staffer was not housekeeping. I've never seen that before at any other hotel and I find it to be rather sketchy. If you do stay at this hotel, be sure to take your valuables with you!On our last night, the fire alarm went on! What really bothered us was someone just walking into our room without even knocking - that's an invasion of privacy! We brought up our concerns with management once again at check out and to be honest they did not even care - all they did was give us a small piece of chocolate and I mean thinking back on it know I can't help but to chuckle! There are plenty of other hotels in NYC - and honestly this hotel is too close to Times Square. You're better off staying somewhere else.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My partner and I spent three nights here in April to celebrate my 30th birthday. We flew from Heathrow to Newark with United Airlines. The flight was pleasant and on arrival at Newark we passed through Immigration and Customs which took approximately 25 minutes. We arrived in to Terminal B but we had to use the free airport transfer train to the airport train station, so we could jump on the New Jersey Transit to Manhattan. This train cos 13 USD each and took about 30 minutes to Penn Station. We then walked to the hotel which took about 15 minutes.On arrival we were greeted by a fairly friendly receptionist but who was lacking in information on the hotel. We paid the bill on arrival and were told of a 100 USD deposit to be paid which would be refunded on checkout. There is also a Facility Fee which includes use of the Wi-Fi, luggage storage facility and water in the room on arrival. Our room was at the very top of the hotel, the 28th floor, and the lifts were quick and efficient. As we had to get the lift to the very top of the building, we would constantly be stopped on the way down and up with other guests using the lifts and getting in and out. If this would annoy, then a top floor room may not be for you.We booked a junior suite. The room was very modern and featured a whirlpool bath, iron with board and free safe. There was a king size bed, flat screen TV and sofa. The views of Manhattan were stunning. The air conditioning unit had a digital control and the instructions were provided but I am unsure whether it worked correctly as we tried to change the temperature but the display would simply default back to the previous settings. Luckily the temperature in the room was suitable and this didn’t cause any issues. The Wi-Fi was available on up to 4 devices and the signal was very good. There was no minibar or kettle.We had pre-booked breakfast which was served between 7-11am. We went down on our first morning at 8am and the restaurant was manic. There is a queue to get in to the restaurant which forms into the lift area in the lobby which in turn causes a big scrum when people are trying to get in and out of the lifts. The design of the food and coffee area is also poor as everything is along one wall, so this caused constant queuing plus pushing in was rife to get the food that people wanted.The food was of a good standard with sausages, bacon, scrambled egg, and potato wedges. There was also bread, cereal, fruit and pastries. I was surprised to see no pancakes available. The coffee is from a vending machine and is drinkable. I initially asked a waiter for soya milk but was told they did not do this. I did not believe him so I went looking for the restaurant manager who got my soya milk for me no problem. He also remembered to get me this on the following 2 mornings. The restaurant was on the lobby level and had windows that looked out on to the street and you could people watch while you ate.As we had booked a junior suite we had access to the Crown Level Executive Lounge on floor 26, which offered free coffee from a pod machine, Coke/Diet Coke/Sprite/still water bottles, and a small assortment of bread, jam and pastries. There were also a few bottles of wine available. The room is quite small and only seated no more than 20 people at once but this was never a problem for us as only once out of our 3 visits was anyone else in there. There is a large TV mounted on the wall available for use. When we first tried to enter the lounge my key card would not work and we had to have this sorted by reception, this obviously had not been activated correctly at check-in.There were a few niggles that we were not happy with, which mainly arose due to the staff and service level. I arrived on my birthday and I was not wished a Happy Birthday by the reception and nothing was left in the room on the day or during the rest of our stay. I find this extremely rude and I have taken a mark off the score due to this. I assume the staff training is a work in progress as not all staff seems to have the same knowledge. In the service industry this is disappointing. Hopefully this is rectified and this aspect of the hotel improves. We did not use the hotel bar, restaurant or gym so cannot comment on these amenities. As other reviews have stated the hotel is very well located for Times Square and the subway, as these are only a few blocks away. The hotel offered a luggage room service on check-out but we did not require this. I would recommend the hotel for all types of travellers who wish to enjoy a city break in Manhattan, but be prepared that it is not the epitome of excellent customer service and luxury.Overall, the hotel is not perfect and is slightly pricey but we did enjoy our stay and would definitely stay again due to the brilliant location.Any questions just drop me an email.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights. It was a block away from Times Square so very central for sightseeing. We had one room on 23rd floor which had a really good view and a room on 4th floor with less of a view. Arrived really late and had requested a twin room but they then wanted to charge $350 upgrade charge which we were unhappy about as this was why we booked. Eventually they relented and waived the charge. Breakfast was buffet style, very busy but plenty of choice including bacon, sausages etc.The air conditioning only goes to 19 degrees so the room was a bit hot even though the weather was not warm. There was a fridge in the room which was handy but tea making facilities would have made the room perfect. We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in AprilCheck in was swift although BA didn't book us the correct room but the hotel check in staff soon corrected it I did ask for prosecco and coke to be in the room on arrival, coke never came so a bit disappointed in thatBreakfast was really busy and adequate but I wouldn't pay extra for itRooms are very clean although the hair collector in the shower wasn't cleaned so the water overflowed in to the bedroom, ooops! It's a great base. Great staff. Good experience. I would stay again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: THIS IS THE HOTEL ! Let me advise you if your seeking a centralized Hotel with OUTSTANDING service ,RIU is worth every dollar spent.I was at Hotel for 6 days and from check-in to check-out ,I was impressed.*Clean*Friendly*Centralized
user_name:
Steve R. C
San Antonio, Texas

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect Location near Times Square for exploring the City and Different Subway Stations nearbye - Great breakfast with a big Choice - would Chose the Same Hotel again for my next stay in New York !!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The RIU Plaza is a street down from Times Square. The hotel is newly opened and has an impressive front lobby. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate with lovely lilac decor. The hotel doesn't offer tea and coffee facilities but does have an onsite cafe where you can get tea, a variety of coffees, hot chocolate and a variety of pastries. The ladies who work there are lovely and friendly. The hotel charges a $65 facility fee which includes a bottle of water upon arrival and wifi which is very reliable. I also had a $150 charge held on my credit card, which was released upon check out. Rooms are kept very tidy. The fashion bar offers cocktails and drinks (happy hour too) we didn't eat in restaurant but menu looked lovely. Great location in NYC. I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in April 2017. The hotel was clean and modern, tidied and cleaned everyday. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were good. Only 2 gripes - we had a room with an internal door to the next room. This meant we could hear everything our neighbours said! It didn't annoy us too much - we were so knackered each day, our heads hit the pillows and we were gone, but they woke us up most mornings.The second thing was that there wasn't much in the way of clothes storage - my husband ended up keeping it all in his case. Wasn't too much of a problem seeing as we were only there for a short time.Overall, good location for sightseeing - just a short walk from times sq and quieter away from the main drag! Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a bloc away from Time Square with a 5 minute walk and in the Broadway quarter.The rooms are of good size we had a 2 queen size bed rooms were clean. The bathroom is separated from a smoked glass and sliding door which is not ideal when you need to go do your business. The breakfast has a great choix of pastries and cooked breakfast to help yourself. Because of its location it is a vey busy hotel with mainly a clientele from Europe. There is a nice restaurant attached to the hotel and offers a choice of healthy food. The price is sensible when you compare to the restaurants on the street.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good hotel 1 block from Times Square so a perfect location.Room is small and spartan but beds are really comfortable with good storage, shower and safe.Nice and helpful staff with the option for late checkout at 5pm for $50.Ok but busy buffet Breakfast for $20 per adult and $10 per child but checkout the awesome Time square diner around the corner.Would recommend!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in the hotel as a family of four - 2 adults, 2 children (9 and 11) in April 2017.All in all this a good hotel in a great location. Rooms are clean and modern and the beds are comfortable although rather on the small side (standard double). My main critisism is that the bathroom door offers little privacy - it's a sliding, thin, frosted glass door. Would also be better if there were rooms with larger beds.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It is a new one hotel 100 mts away from Times Square. The crew are very efficient and likable.The hotel is clean and silent and the views are very impressive.The breakfast is good and you can get a table very soon.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: You can catch all the fun you want out of New York City and do your shopping since the hotel is a few walk from Time Square. The Hotel have very nice staff at the reception. Very neat as the hotel is still new. They have a shop on the ground floor where you could get beverage and pastry.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great choice for a 5 day, first time trip to this amazing city!! The hotel is still quite new, everything is still fairly new, the lobby area is very trendy in a modern, colourful style and (on our arrival) not too busy which made it more relaxing. We were checked in straight away and had requested prior to travel a high floor which was honoured (24th out of 28) The rooms again were very modern & minimalist in style, definitely not large which we knew but had 2 full double beds with plenty of walk around space, room safe taking a full laptop, HUGE flatscreen TV with a good choice of channels and simply stunning views of the city by day & night through floor to ceiling windows. The only drawback was that the room lacked any drawer space to store clothes at all which was unusual - other than a tiny draw in bedside cabinets the wardrobe only offered hanging space - not a huge issue but something to be aware of. Numerous reviews seem to focus on the bathroom and its opaque glass walls, not a problem to us (they are not the only hotel doing this now, Secrets in Cancun do the same for example) it is not possible to see anything other than a shadowy outline and the view from the window draws your attention anyway. We were advised on check in that our reservation included the buffet breakfast each day - a real bonus as we were not aware of this - we had a problem that the reception system had not advised the breakfast room system that breakfast was included so we had to get a member of reception go & physically tell them (a bit embarrassing when standing in a queue) and this happened all 4 mornings, but I have to say the restaurant manager was fantastic as he personally waited for us each morning & told us to go straight in to avoid any more embarrassment - top class customer care!!The hotel bar is very smart, and a real relaxing haven after a long day sightseeing, they have a happy hour(s) from 3-7 with cheaper cocktails & wine and a bar food discount which was very nice.The only negative we have about our stay has been mentioned by another reviewer and that is the bellboys trying to book you a taxi back to JFK - they offer a service that includes tolls & tips at $75 and try to tell you that the yellow cabs will put you on a metered fare, will make the journey longer & it will cost you more...simply not true!! we had them hail a yellow cab outside, the flat rate fare to JFK was $52.00 plus 80c in taxes, he took a route that avoided ANY tolls and with a tip it cost us $60 - this is a really nice hotel, please stop spoiling your reputation with this behaviour, stop scaremongering guests into a more expensive deal.Overall we had a fantastic stay and for anyone looking for a really modern base with midtown right on the doorstep we would highly recommend the RIU

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has a magnificent location with times square right behind the corner. The rooms are clean, tidy and large enough. Although we stayed on the third floor, we almost did not hear any sound coming from outside. I would recommend this hotel for a city trip!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked 3 rooms for 10 nights. Firstly our rooms were not ready by 3pm. We had to wait another 45 minutes. We stayed 1 night and left!!! The quality of the rooms was terrible. As mentioned by others you can be seen when doing your business on the toilet and your silhouette is visible when using the shower. The breakfast area was like being in a college canteen !! The place is cold, clinical and unfriendly. Rooms are tiny. No where to store suitcases when you've unpacked. For the cost of $10000, we would expect more. We moved to a far nicer hotel where we have a private lounge - for half the price. Really recommend you do your research and look around. Do not be dazzled by the bright lights!!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The lobby at Riu is quite modern, sleek, and impressive. The rooms are also modern, but that's about where the comparisons end. Our room was tiny. There was a kind of non-opaque wall between the shower and the bedroom area such that you can see the outline of whoever is in the shower. That would have been a little uncomfortable if I was with anyone but my fiance. The bathroom door was also just a slider, which didn't give the most privacy. The worst part was that in the morning, a family across the hall decided to get ready with the door open. At 7 am, you could hear everything, from kids to a hair dryer. Not ideal for your vacation. We called management, but can't tell that it was addressed and nothing was taken off our bill. I'm SO glad we were only here one night.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had the Junior suite on top floor..awesome size for NY with king bed,with a 42 inch tv on a dresser with mini fridge that rotates to the living area with a couch.Nice big bathroom with 2 sinks a jucuzzi tub..a big stand up shower and a toilet closed off with door.Room came with access to the executive lounge that had all day free coffee,pop,bottled water,meats,cheese,buns,chips,pastries etc.Was a huge bonus especially in morning!The service from front desk,to maintenance,to housekeeping were all on point.Hotel is in a really great location..so close to everything!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I can't say I'm sure of the rating I gave. Was close to a four point performance. But the beds weren't as comfortable as I hoped they'd be. Plus the hotel had an issue with their technical division. We were kicked out of the system long before leaving. And also the breakfast was really not good. It was American, but always old and hard to swallow. I wouldn't recommend it as the first option for a New York stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel, very sleek and modern. No carpet which I adore. The room was a good size for a hotel in a large city. The beds were comfortable and it was completely adequate for our needs- we don't travel to hang out in our hotel room. The bathroom has frosted glass doors, you can't see through them but if you are staying with someone you don't know too well, it may feel a little odd.We arrived in Manhattan well before check in and they allowed us to drop our bags off before a day of sight seeing.Our room came with 2 free adult breakfast buffets. We had two children with us and paid about $10 each for their breakfast. The buffet was plentiful. My only complaint about the hotel is that at around 10, it sounded as though a nightclub was next door. Some of our neighbors were playing music and talking loudly. Not the hotel's fault though. Just annoying.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stay away from the restaurant in the hotel unless you like dry bland expensive food, honestly it is so so bad. That's that done.Everything else is a positive, great views if your on a higher floor (if not just take a ride to the top and have a look).Rooms are nice and bright and the whole frosted glass thing separating the bathroom is not so bad, you still have privacy and only awkward if your staying in the same room as your mother in law, lucky for me i was with my wife and kids.Friendly staff who helped out when we needed directions, travel info and print out our boarding passes when we were leaving and other things..if we go NYC again we would have no issues returning to this hotel.1 final thing, if your use to having a tea/coffee in the morning you have to go to the little cafe down stairs next to the lobby as there is no kettle in the rooms.. minor!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is modern and clean, and we were on a high floor, so we heard no noise from the street at night, which is nice in New York. There are also blackout curtains, which you need because of all the light coming in to our room from the Times Square signs, even late at night, from our side of the hotel. This is one of those hotels trying to be " hip" and stylish, including speakers on the outside of the hotel playing club music. as you stand outside the hotel on the sidewalk. New York City is really not in need of additional noise pollution in this very noisy part of the city, so this struck me as a strange idea. The lobby is overbright, with harsh, intense lighting bouncing off of the white shiny floors. I prefer lobbies with subdued lighting and a quieter welcome. Also strangely, the halls outside the rooms are wood veneer flooring instead of carpeting, so be prepared to hear people walking down the halls at night and dragging their suitcases along those hard floors. Very echoey. The room is tiny, as many new york hotels are, though I would have expected slightly larger for the rates they charge. The really strange thing is the bathroom..there is a sliding glass door instead of a wood door that closes properly. The glass door leaves a tiny gap when closed, so depending where you are in the room you can see your fellow guest sitting on the toilet through the gap in the door. Just something to know if the idea of your roommate hearing and seeing your business on the toilet makes you uncomfortable. My only guess is that this saved space rather than using a wood door that closes properly. There is also a glass partition, (frosted) allowing people in the room to see the shadow/ silhouette (distorted, but there nevertheless) of whoever is taking a shower on the other side of the glass. I could see why one review mentioned that their teenage daughter was uncomfortable about this! Something to be aware of depending who is with you in the room. Room was over-warm and difficult to adjust the thermostat. Also annoyed by the hidden charge in the form of a "resort fee", just another way to make the rate higher without showing in the total..Why not just be honest and add this to the regular rate, given that this is not a resort, and not sure how they justify this fee. Would stay here again if we got a very good rate, but there are hotels I have enjoyed much more.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice looking lobby,clean room- no carpet which I liked. Amenities were great. Staff was friendly and helpful. But the noise level from 8th ave was awful! We were on the 9th floor. And the worst thing for us was the curtains are not room darkening. It was so bright you could read without the light on at 2 am!The frosted glass privacy might be an issue for some as stated in other reviews. Didn't bother us at all. We chose the hotel for the location and price. So if you stay here bring earplugs and a sleep mask.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is just a couple of blocks walk from Times Square. Very good location and very clean hotel, very modern. We arrived early so our rooms were not ready however we left our cases with the bell boy ( receipts given) and went for a walk. On our return we were still to early for our 3pm check in however one room was ready. They advise you upon check in of the resort fee, i asked was this for the wifi/ water in the room and they said no. It's not a resort, so unsure why they charge this. It was just under $40 for 3 nights, hidden cost if you ask me! Bedroom had a bit of space and so did bathroom compared to our New York hotels I have stated in, TVs with English channels. No bath only shower. Toiletries replenished daily but only had water on our first night. We did have a drink in the hotel bar, prices are visible. Don't forget to tip.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights while in NY. There was a mix up with our booking and they thought we were there 11 nights, we advised upon check in that it was incorrect its only 5 nights, we then went back down later to confirm this. The hotel itself is in a great location, walking distance from Times Square, close to hells kitchen, Not too far from central park - really we walked almost everywhere, we even walked back from downtown near the 9/11 memorial (that was a big walk though). The room is small BUT all rooms are small in NY, we settled in nicely. It was also clean and Tidy. Downstairs has a reasturant we only went for happy hour which was great, i think it was between 3-7?. When we checked out we were going to get charged the 11 nights again, the staff handled this well but it was just annoying to have to go through it all again.I would gladly stay here again and would recommend Riu to others.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a modern clean hotel. Usually not my style but loved it. Every single staff member that we came in contact with were friendly, helpful and really outstanding at their jobs. Hospitality is a difficult job but some people make it look easy and they certainly did. Will definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A modern well located hotel in theatre area. However when you do modern with white walls they show every mark and our room had every mark on every wall! Be warned the hotel only has a two pipe air conditioning system so the whole hotel is heated or cooled but not both at same time. So if like us you have a hot room and the hotel is on heat mode ( likely all spring and autumn) you can not cook your room!!! So ours never got below 75 degrees so we moved to a better hotel with 4 pipe aircon.The other issue you can not check in until 3pm no matter what. Staff at front desk are indifferent and unhelpful. You will see a bunch of managers huddled to the left of reception but don't expect them to help at all. They clearly set the tone for the surly staff.The engineer who came to our room was the only customer centric person in the hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel is located right near Time Square and set just off the main streets leading to the main broadway shows. The hotel was excellent, the room we had was newly decorated and perfect with regard to space for what we took with us and clean each day. The staff were very helpful and courteous made the stay really relaxing for us both. The restaurant and breakfast was really good and reasonably priced considering the location and measuring up to other places we eat at.
user_name:
Ian F
Swindon, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved this hotel. The location is terrific, the people are super nice, and the rooms are modern, clean and appealing. We got "a deal" on our room so we decided to try the Riu and were happy we did. We would stay here again and probably will.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is very conveniently located just three minutes from 42nd Street, 5 from Broadway and within easy walking distance of all of central Manhattan's places of interest. The rooms are typical city centre with ample space and storage - no hot drink facilities. Beware though they charge your room tax on arrival and no matter how you wish to pay they put it on your credit card and will credit you back after you leave. Breakfast is $24+tax (9%) +service (min 18.5%),but a set 3 course lunch can be obtained for only $12.50 + +. There are many good eating places within 200 yards - Typical US, Italian, Brazilian, Irish, etc. Service depended on the waiter fro brilliant to isn't it about time the food was here? Despite these negatives the location as I said is excellent.
user_name:
Graeme S
Alderley Edge, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Rui plaza New York. Beautiful friendly Hotel. Lovely coffee and snack bar. Didn't try restaurant as bit pricey. Only downfall is the frosted glass door to bathroom so privacy is a no go even with your partner some things still should remain private and that includes using the toilet. Staff friendly, bell boys the friendliest. Good location 5 mins from Times square and walking distance to Central Park.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at this hotel last week with my husband and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is perfectly located from Times Square, a few subway stops and is generally a 15 minute walk from a lot of sites such as the intrepid, macys, rockerfella etc. The room was very comfortable my only 2 issues were that the bedroom door has quite a large gap around it so a night a lot of light came into the bedroom from the hallway. Also, our shower leaked every time we used it. Otherwise, we were really happy with our stay. We also enjoyed the happy hour in the bar which is between 3-7pm. All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a conveniently placed hotel for site seeing and broadway shows!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel Riu Plaza is located in the theater district...awesome location! Hotel was very clean and modern. I loved that they didn't have carpet in the rooms. Front desk was not overly friendly at check in seemed a little distracted, but the other 2 times I talked with the front desk they were very friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be the room was a little warm. I'm already staying at the Riu Plaza on an upcoming trip!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was pleasantly surprise on the turn-around of this hotel (see my initial review). Service was a 100% better. The room was decent in size and I would say up to par by NYC standard. My last visit was less than a year but I could see i bit of wear and tear in the room. Nonetheless, the room was clean and comfortable. It is really a big improvement and I'm glad changes were seen. I would come back to this property on my next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Myself and my boyfriend have just returned from a 4 night trip. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Within walking distance to many tourist attractions, underground and Times Square. Room was clean and perfect for a couple (not much privacy with frosted glass shower into the room). Beds were very comfortable. Lovely view from 23rd floor. Hotel staff were helpful. Iron and hair dryer in room. Had an amazing trip. Be prepared to pay around £10 per drink and also to have a late check out from the room is an extra 10 dollars per hour.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The rooms were very basic and smallish. No dresser, alarm clock or hardly any furniture but the basics. Decent location, 2 blocks from Times Square. Very international while I was there, no one but us spoke English, but that added to the ambiance. For the money, I've stayed in better places in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really enjoyed this hotel. My daughters and I shared a room with a friend. Our room was clean, spacious (for a hotel in Times Square) and had a great view. The rate was reasonable and the staff friendly. We were in walking distance of most everything we wanted to do. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently visited this hotel for a 4 night break and were really impressed with everything . It's got a great location very close to Times Square . We found all the facilities in the hotel to be very good especially the grab and go cafe and also the bar .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A local travel agent booked the hotel for a group coming to NYC for SB 2017 and my daughter wanted to stay where the group was staying, so my wife looked it up and decided it looked good on line, so we booked a 5 day stay. We have stayed in Times Square previously, so are familiar with hotels in area.The RIU rooms are tiny! I realize space is limited in NYC, but these rooms you must go outside to change your mind. Our A/C or (Heat) wouldn't work when we checked in....even though they provide everyone instructions on how to work the controls. After an hour wait for engineering, turns out our unit was turned completely off in the ceiling....it is 38 outside and we have yet to feel any heat being given by the unit. The directions need a little bit of spell check too.Beyond the heating/air and the size...the pictures were misleading to the size of room. The hotel has no carpet, so anything going on in hotel is exaggerated in noise level.Out sink stopper would not retract and had to dig with my own tools to make sink work!!!When I checked in they said they were charging my credit card for extras, yet when I went to bar for drinks during happy hour, I was not allowed to charge to my room...hmmmm?Still have 2 days left during this visit and wish I could get money back and move, even if it will cost extra to stay somewhere else.Again, not our first time to NYC and Times Square....I stay in hotels about 14 nights a month as part of my job, so this is not just sour grapes.Good luck if you choose this place, we will not be back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was here last week for a night and it was a good hotel. Whenever I was in the lobby it was constantly being cleaned, the staff was helpful and friendly. The bellhops did take a while to get to the car for valet but they brought the luggage to our room. The room was a bit smaller than I would prefer but the view was amazing so it was definitely worth it even with the size of the room. The hotel is inexpensive especially for the location, only a block away from times square and only a few blocks away from several other attractions. I would overall recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Girls trip to the city, 5 of us total. Booked 2 rooms.. didn't want to fight over the shower! However one room was definitely big enough to fit us all comfortably sleep wise . Rooms look just like pictures on site. Clean. In love with the shower. No ice machine on flr. Have to go to the bar.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We usually stay in a quieter area on the Upper West Side, but my two teenagers wanted to be near Times Square so we decided to give it a try. We stayed for 7 nights in a Family room, which has two double beds plus a sofa bed.Overall we were happy with our stay, the rooms were well appointed and clean and the hotel was fairly quiet. The only downside was even for a Family room upgrade, the room was very tight. The room basically fit the two double beds and couch (all nearly touching each other) with just enough room at the foot of the beds to get by. The bathroom was thankfully average size with a good size shower.Even with smaller rooms (that's just NYC) we would stay here again for a few reasons:Locaiton - you were a few minutes walk to Times Square and all the craziness but far enough away that the hotel and street was fairly quiet at night.Subway options - 5 subway lines are within walking distance from the hotel. My family bought week long Metrocards and could get all over the city very easily using the subwayLots of food options - being so close to Times Square and the Theatre District there were tons of food options to pick from, many open 24 hours

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We decided on a last minute one night trip to New York at Christmas. We found a room at Hotel Riu for 3 of us. We got a great deal and were expecting a tiny room, but what we got was 2 double beds and plenty of space for all of our shopping. The view from the room was lovely and the bed was super comfy. We were high up so there was minimal street noise so we all had a lovely sleep. It is very close to Times Square and the Theatre district and perfect for anyone going for shows and shopping. I would def go back next time I am in NY.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here last week for 6 nights. We expected a hotel with some Spanish influence having been at several Riu hotels in the past. The location was excellent but there was little else to distinguish it from any other generic hotel anywhere in the world. The room itself had a great view - it was a corner room. We were on the 18th floor so noise was minimal. The room was small. I had to be careful when walking around the foot of the bed to not hit my head on the tv. We expected small but usually there is sufficient space to put clothes. Coats had to be put on the floor since the closet was tiny. There are two small drawers in the night stands. As mentioned in others, there still isn't a coffee maker in the room and as others have mentioned, no bottled water. One day we had towels dropped off but the bed was unmade and no glasses were provided. Another day we had dropped back to the room around 6 and I had to request that the room be serviced. One morning we were awoken by an alarm of some sort. I went off again later in the morning before we left for the day. I was told not to worry about it. We were awoken early on our last day by repeated alarms and then by someone knocking repeatedly that they needed to come in to check the smoke alarm. We had had a late evening and having to let someone into our room at 9 a.m. was not appreciated. Not a place I would advise and definitely not a place we will return to. No character and no one seemed the least concerned about inconveniencing anyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently stayed here for 2 nights with my family. We were very impressed with this modern hotel. Rooms were light and bright and quite large for New York standards.. location amazing! The bar offers a great atmosphere in the evenings as well. We would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just come home from a week away in New York the hotel is situated one block away from Time Square. Lets start with hotel big space lobby. Disabled toilets located here. Very clean. Our room was on the tenth floor 1001 a good size room to get a wheelchair around. the bathroom had a wet room with a chair in the shower area hand rails low sink. The bed was the same height as the wheelchair so easy to transfer . All good. The staff was very friendly and chatty and more importantly helpful. Especially the doorman who help out with a situation. Lovely steaks and club sandwich in the restaurant. Getting around New York was easy I walked where my husband propelled we managed to get to ground zero to Central Park, grand central, Empire State by using a map. Loads of drop kerbs. The only downside is some of the restaurant aren't accessible due to stairs or step. A little found Amy's bread use to get tea and cake there for afternoon. A chemist is near by called Duane Reade which is also a supermarket.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The service was good, the staff was very friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and cleaned very well every day and the beds were just like the ones at home. I would advise to not make use of the hotel taxi service though. We were told that it would be cheaper than a regular taxi, but it turned out to be more expensive when we arrived at the airport. Overall, I think this is a great hotel and I would definitely book another stay at my next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I just did a 10 day east coast trip. We started here at the RIU Plaza for 4 nights. This hotel is amazing. The room was small but all rooms in New York are small. The place is very clean and the service was great. Beautiful décor and very modern. We were a block from Time square and were within walking distance of every thing. Lots of places to eat and shop real close. Cant wait to go back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited this place last week for 5 nights celebrating my 50th birthday.This is a great hotel ideally placed next to Times Square about a minutes walk along 46th St. The hotel is modern, funky & the rooms are great. Yes the bathroom has a glass wall but it's not an issue get over it.The Restaurant is stylish & the food was great, ate there twice & the food was excellent, you will get a shock with the drink prices (about £10 a pint & more for a glass of wine) but that's the same all over New York. Met the Restaurant Manager Allen he was a real gentleman & Somera behind the bar was lovely & full of fun.All of the amenities in the hotel were of very high standard & easy to use.There is a great coffee shop in the hotel where we would grab a hot drink each day & one of the waitresses Mayra was a real sweetie, all of the staff we came into contact with were great but there was one stand out, Carlos one of the doormen was amazing, a true ambassador for the hotel, not only great at his job but a really great guy. these staff will be the reason that when i go back to NY i will definitely stay here. Thanks guys you made our trip special.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our room 1820 was really ok. The room is quite big enough for two adults, very clean and a good view. The only thing it is very noisy. I would come back to this hotel, but choosing a room to the other site because of the noise. The reception is very helpful and they offerd to change the room, but we won`t do that for the last 4 days....Also the restaurant as the coffeeshop in the hotel are very nice and they have friendly staff. Check in and out without any problems and very quickly. The staff in custumer service always very helpfully and if you have to change euros in dollars be careful and ask in customer service they tell you where to get the best rates and they have good ideas for daytrips. Alltogether a nice hotel, very clean, nice people and a perfect situation.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Absolutely amazing place! Just 5 min walk from time square and everything was so close to us. Staff was very nice and welcoming. Breakfast was great so much to choose from. Room was always up to standards and with a great view! Except I didn't get why they sent me information about my stay in Spanish haha.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel on our winter vacation!!!! The level of service was nonetheless amazing! Our room was very spacious, especially to be a hotel in New York!!! The decor was nice, an she bathroom was huge, with a walk in shower, with really HOT water! We had a good view Hudson River!!! An the location was the best of it all! We were a block away from the center of Time Square! There were enough food joints to chose from, an a Duane Reade shop a few blocks away! Which made this location every more the merry! Also many shows, an things to do close in the area!!!! Love this hotel!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We ate at the Fashion restaurant in the lobby of the hotel. The staff were very nice. I ordered a plain Caesar salad. My cousin ordered a burger. I found a live fruit fly walking through the lettuce when I was a third of the way into the salad which totally grossed me out and my cousin found a hair on her plate. We paid and left.
user_name:
Loraine A
Long Island, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wonderful hotel. Excellent staff. Fabulous location for everything. Easy access to Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue and Central Park. The subway so close. Easy to get to the world trade centre, Brooklyn and Staten Island.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was literally spotless. The location is perfect for all attractions in New York. Just a 2 min walk away from Times Square. The rooms are typically small in New York, but these are lovely decorated. The bathroom is behind frosted glass, and has a large sliding door, we shared a room with friends, and privacy wasn't an issue with the frosted glass. Also the hotel restaurant was the most reasonable prices restaurant we ate at. 100% recommend this hotel to anybody.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel is great, a five minute walk to the centre of Times Square and the heart of broadway. The famous Carlos bakery is a 5-10min walk and there are lots of amenities such as coffee shops, pharmacies, groceries and places to eat all within 2-3 min walks. Staff are very friendly, they helped us when we needed directions to the subway and other places and they also booked us an executive minibus to take us back to the airport. My only criticism is that the rooms are quite compact. We had a room for 4 people and we were struggling for space to put suitcases away etc. New York is obviously an action packed trip, lots of sights to see, things to do, so the time spent in the room is minimal and if you use that perspective when booking the hotel then you won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at this hotel 3/7/17 and had a very nice experience. The room was clean and everything functioned well. The highlight of my stay was the excellent service I received from Dean! He helped me out tremendously by hailing a cab on a very busy and rainy morning. It took a long time for a cab to stop but Dean was very diligent with making sure he got one for me. Dean also made an awesome recommendation for lunch and helped me set up car service to LaGuardia airport. My only disappointment with this hotel was breakfast. It was $26 and not very good at all. I do not recommend eating breakfast here. There are plenty of other options within walking distance of the hotel. You should stay here if you need to be in the Times Square area. Be sure to look for Dean and he will help to make your stay very pleasant!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a fantastic location! The rooms were average size for NYC (we had a double). The breakfast was RIU style as are the furnishings and rooms, modern and clean! The staff was helpful and use Uber's!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Holiday with my 3 teenage daughters. Great location, we walked to most of the places we wanted to see.Rooms clean and fresh, the glass showeroom wall was no big deal. Only comment was one day the cleaner moved things around a little too much for my comfort, my travel bag had been moved and pockets I left unzipped had been zipped up. Disposable cups I intended to use had been thrown away etc. A little annoying and satisfied nothing removed from bag, but shouldn't have been messed with.Only had breakfast one morning, was average really and expensive for what it was.On the other hand lunch and dinner very good and very reasonably priced.Would recommend and would use again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I don't usually write hotel reviews but the staff were so patient with us throughout the entire stay. On the first night we arrived I remember having 4 of our credit cards getting rejected but they were very patient with us while we sorted out the issue. Special mention to Ms.Alisa at the counter for helping us through check in. Location is fantastic as it's pretty much right next to times square at the heart of manhattan, would come back again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was clean, 1 block from times square with amazing views. On the same block there is a fantastic dim sum eatery. One of NYC well known piano bar called Don't tell Mama, a Spanish tapas restaurant and so much more. This is a great place to stay and well visit again
user_name:
Amy T B
Syracuse, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fabulous place to stay in New York-immaculately clean and comfortable and great value for money. Such a short walk from Penn Station and so convenient for Broadway. Great views also. I will certainly be returning!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved this Hotel in New York. We had a beaming, happy staff welcome us straight away as well pulled up. Our room was wonderful, clean, beds were comfortable as were the pillows. The staff was very helpful by booking my daughter and I into the tours we wanted to do. We only had 3 nights here but wished we had more.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu for 2 nights. Worked out very well. Funky, Clean and Comfortable rooms. Beds and showers were very good.Angel was great with Check In. Kept us informed.Stayed on the top floor - 28th and we could still hear the horns honking and the people talking in the halls at 7:00 am - don't people think!!!Very close to times Square but not directly in it so it wasn't crazy. Close to all Broadway shows. The bar was OK but not comfortable. Chairs are funky but not comfortable.Did not use the restaurant as lots of choices on the streets.You pay for wifi whether you use it or not. It's in the hidden costs.I would return!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for two nights. This hotel is part of a large Spanish chain with a huge presence in Latin America. This hotels brings a distinct concept for NY. Riu is usually a vacation hotel, and they bring the same idea to NY. I'm not saying it doesn't work for business travelers, it should, but it is well geared for people that want to be out and about the city. The hotel has a nice modern reception, two restaurants one nicer and with a bar, the other fast coffee shop/bakery/sandwich concept. I didn't use the restaurants nor their gym or other facilities but they have the basics.The rooms have all around tile flooring. I like this. Great for people with asthma/allergies, and also, they are always cleaner than a rug will ever be. Now with tile flooring you'll have less sound proofing, but I didn't feel that the room was noisy.The bath room is encased by privacy glass and a sliding door. You can't see through, but you can see some profiles. So take this into consideration if you're sharing the room with others. This is a new trend in hotels and it is not going to go away. It makes the rooms require less wall space sacrificing privacy. Not a huge issue for me.It has a very basic desk, a good size HD TV with basic programming- no HBO, Cinemax, etc.- as I said before, this hotel is geared for people that want to be outside of the room. The mattress was VERY comfortable. What I found not so good was the bedding. It was perfectly clean, but at only a few months old the fabric is starting to look tired. It may be that the washing cycle is too strong, or that the fabric simply isn't durable. There were only two pillows for a queen bed, and two soft euro cushions. I rather have four pillows.The room has a fridge, a large programmable safe, great views of the Hudson river and other parts.I think the price was great. Certainly a lot of value for staying here and I am sure they will be very busy come summer.One added bonus is that the hotel allows for extending checkout up to 4:PM and 6:PM at a surplus charge $40 and then $10 per hour.It is on restaurant row and just across the street from Broadway theaters. You can walk a block to Time Square. I recommend this hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a convenient hotel to stay in if you plan to watch any Broadway show and be near Times Square because it is literally within in.The hotel is clean and looks new (we stayed at the higher level floor and had a view of NY). The staff are helpful from the bell boys to the receptionist. We didn't avail of their breakfast but it looks filling, delicious and worth the price. I certainly recommend Riu Plaza NY.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for ten nights early February. Checkin/out was quick. Staff were lovely.The room was perfect, located on the 18th floor, noise was not an issue at all. The room size is just average, it wasn't small at all, It was ideal for the two of us plus our four suit cases! It was spotless and cleaned everyday with fresh towels. The shower leaked one or two times throughout our entire stay, it was a teeny puddle, plenty of towels are provided, it was not an issue. The shower glass wall is not see through, you can just see a faint silhouette. Room temp is perfect but there is air con which is easy enough to use. Location! Right beside Times Sq, approx. 2/3 min walk. Right beside the Port Authority and Subways. Few mins walk to Central Park. As we were shopping most days we used to walk from 46th street right down to Lower Manhattan and shop along the way, it is very manageable if you like walking. We did not eat in the restaurant but the cafe to the front of the hotel is very nice for a quick bite. Times Sq is very expensive for eating out so try venturing further. You can't go wrong with an NY pizza though!We will definitely return and would 100% recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights. Room was clean and compact, comfortable bed which was required after busy days! The only thing that was missing in my opinion was tea/coffee making facilities - although that was easily overcome as plenty of places to grab a tea/coffee from. Bar/concierge all good. WIFI.Great location a couple of minutes walk to a Times Square. They offer late check out or can hold luggage after check out so that you can enjoy your last day. I would stay again and recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Headlines:Liked & Does well: Service, Location, Reception, Bar.Disliked & Could do better: Small Rooms, Room Service, Entrance (appeal).Summary: Good location, modern and reasonable value (for NYC), central to Broadway, shopping. Slightly hidden away from, but adjacent by 2 blocks, to Times Square. Would consider using this hotel again but given a choice we would have paid a little extra for a bigger room and better views, and/or to stay in a different hotel with more street appeal. Overall happy with stay and service.Location: Situated a short 5 min stroll west 2 blocks from the red steps on Times Square. Easy walk to all theatres which we did one of the evenings, and within walking distance of Rockefeller, Maces and Empire State Building. We chose the hotel to be more in the hustle of Times Square, good choice in that respect, and although it is slightly hidden away, that became a benefit when we just wanted to chill out. Plenty of coffee bars, pizza, ice cream eateries down the adjoining street if that appeals, but not too touristy walking back to the hotel late evening.Hotel: The hotel felt modern, the reception area, bar and restaurant were welcoming (not intimidating), bright and looked recently decorated. The check-in was easy although the room was not ready (we arrived early and did not expect it to be) which allowed us to ask for a room on a higher floor with views, which the hotel kindly arranged (27th floor). Worth ensuring you are registered as a RIU Member as I am sure this helped. We were able to leave our bags and spend a few hours sight-seeing. Equally, when we checked out we were allowed to leave our bags in a secure room until early evening free of charge. Concierge, valet and all staff were courteous and helpful. We used the bar once for a snack and drink (Nachos and G&T), reasonably priced and served nicely to the table, although not a large area the décor was pleasant, fresh and modern.Room: This would have been the only criticism; it was on the small side with a king bed and small desk in the corner. Barely enough room to walk around the bed - could not open the suitcases without putting them on the bed. Impressive views over Manhattan skyline but the room was the wrong side to see any named sights; looked towards Times Square but you can not see anything. A bit more attention to detail on the house keeping would have helped although the shower was lovely, clean and reasonably sized. There have been some comments about seeing the person in the shower through the glass wall partition but we thought that was a nice modern touch and it was only a shadow outline. We did not expect a large room being central to Times Square, and given the price, we were not overly concerned - it was modern and looked clean, and we were out most of our stay. Comfortable stay, free Wi-Fi, and large flat screen TV, although no coffee making facilities. Fridge in bedside useful to store your own drinks.Food: We did not use the restaurant although we did get a coffee on a few occasions from the snack cafeteria which links to the hotel. This is a great facility although limited in opening times - more an early morning, afternoon snack and early evening stop-off than anything substantial.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We take a trip once a year, I thought about this trip for months and it was such a let down. Upon arrival, we pulled up front and we were lost on what to do. Dean was the only one who greeted us of the 5 or so workers in the lobby. After a good minute of looking around lost, on what to do for parking he saw us and helped up right away. The front desk was not busy at all, I walked right up to a blonde women in the center, I am a front desk agent myself and I could not believe how I was treated. She said "credit card and I.D as soon as I walked up, no greeting whatsoever. When she placed two sheets in front of me she said sign here, and here and continued on conversating with the other blonde haired women beside her (neither of them had name tags on). I felt like we were bothering them, but being my fiance's birthday I asked for a high floor so we could see the city anyway. She said "not sure but I'll see what I can do." I understand limited availability, because like I said before I work at a hotel but she definitely could have phrased it differently. Once were got up to the 17th floor, the room was very small, which was expected of NYC just wanted to add that for people who mind. There were two small decorative pillows on the bed, we were not going to use them, they were flat and did not have covers on them, so many others have probably used them so I called down for two more regular pillows. If the lack of a greeting wasn't enough, this definitely topped it off, when the women answered she said hello. I asked for two pillows, I heard many people in the background so I figured they were busy, but I'm sorry if you work at a 600 room hotel you should be able to handle it. She said "sure," I said "thank you" with a response of "bye" and hung up. On top of that they never came. I came down maybe an hour and a half later and went to the customer service desk and told her, I think she wrote something on my reservation stating what happened. The next day got even better. (sarcasm) I woke up to use the shower, it leaked all over the floor. We cleaned it up and were leaving so I put the "request of service" sign on the door around noon. We came back after three, not only was the room not serviced but there was a women and a man standing in our room with the door open while all of our stuff was in there. The women was apologetic and explained in was an engineer but never told us what they were in there for. She saw the sign on the door but still asked if we wanted service? Weird, but okay. I just took the sign off and said it's fine. I was getting really irritated. My fiance and I left again to go out for a few hours. When we got back to the room later that night he realized some of his cash out of his drawer was missing (I did not think we had to use the safe, because the DND sign was up) Sadly enough it was about $450 dollars missing after he went through all of his cash, we could not go out or do anything Saturday night because of it. I was literally in tears. I walked down to the front desk and I don't even know why I bothered, we were just bothering them again! Needless to say checkout was the same, not knowing that I signed an express check out form because she did not explain it to me the guy that took my keys looked at me like an idiot when in reality it's his departments fault. We are out money, a birthday memory and a one time a year experience. I just called the operator to speak to a manager before I was going to post this, but they were in a meeting, and the only way of contact is email. She laughed when I said can I leave my phone number. I feel really violated and unappreciated. So here is my essay, that could have been prevented by talking to someone with some TLC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed three days there on business and while the lobby looks good the room is tired and needs a refresh. The door would not close and took more than an hour to be fixed. Curtains were grubby and keeper sticking and the walls were scuffed and need a repaint. Great location and friendly staff but it lacks freshness.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a lovely hotel. The rooms are very spacious and big. They were very clean and always maintained. The staff are all very friendly and very helpful. It's also in a very good location with a short walk to all the big attractions. I would definitely recommend staying here

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for the first time and I am not sure why it is received any negative reviews. We only stayed for 2 nights and found no fault whatsoever. Staff where very friendly and helpful, we booked transport back to the airport rather than a taxi, this private SUV, which only cost a few dollars more than the taxi we took from the airport was great, and the lady (sorry did not get her name) was very helpful in arranging this.Yes there is a glass wall in the bathroom, so what you can't see through it and it was in keeping with the rest of the decor. The rooms where spacious and the beds very comfortable.We also had breakfast here, and ok if you go out looking you could find it cheaper, however getting up in the morning going for breakfast in a nice setting with good food then being able to go back to your room to get ready to go out is well worth paying a few extra dollars for.Location was great, only a few 100 yards from times square and all the theatres at your doorstep.Would 100% recommend this hotel and RIU

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I had such high hopes for our stay but ended up being very disappointed. When we arrived at 8pm, we got our room keys and went up to the room. An employee came in to check if everything was clean which it was not. We had dirty sheets and towels that looked like they had been thrown on a shelf. While she did correct the problem, we had been traveling all day and if check out is at 11 or 12, there is no excuse for the room to not have been clean. The shower leaked out into the hallway causing my mother to almost fall. We had to barricade the bathroom door with towels to prevent the water from coming into the hall and bedroom. Location of the hotel was great but that's about it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Rooms are small but you don't go to NY to stay in the room. Very modern design and colors make the room seem bigger. Balcony overlooked some of the city. Great for a few nights or a quick getaway. Everyone very attentive and helpful. We will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent two nights at the RIU after having spent a week in Curacao. The bed at the RIU was heaven compared to the last one. The location is perfect, close to the subway and Times Square. The place looked brand new, super clean. Your room key activated all the lights which was cool. The shower was way nice and roomy. They held our bags for the whole day after checkout because our flight was in the evening. The price compared to other places I've stayed in New York was very reasonable especially for how nice it was. I will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We absolutely loved our stay here. So close to the buzz of Times Square and the Broadway shows. Very friendly service and rooms clean and a decent size for NYC. Walking distance to the subway. Great views as well.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I have just had a 3 night break at Riu Plaza Times Square.We originally booked The Sheraton Times Square but on reading reviews decided to change.I am so pleased we did.From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out it was all perfect.We could not fault anything.We had breakfast which was great every morning.Our room was 2305. The lift was so quick you were up to floor 23 in seconds. Plenty space with a nice sitting area.The location is perfect.We are already looking at going back to Riu Plaza early next year.We would not consider staying anywhere else.Thank you all for a lovely stay.
user_name:
mooseymat
Berwick upon Tweed, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Don*t be fooled by this Hotel being called a Riu Hotel it is nothing like any Riu we have ever stayed in.The room was small with a glass wall & glass door on the bathroom & very basic.There was 2 ladies on the concierge desk who were very good but rest of staff left a lot to desired & having had the dubious pleasure of talking to the manager it is not hard to guess were the attitude comes from & then there is the 91 dollars you will be charged for the wi-fi & gym even if you dont use them

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a four night stay. Great hotel, everything you need for this type of holiday. Great views from floor 26. We did not have breakfast but great Grab and Go cafe that was great for coffee and snacks. Well worth a visit.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here last summer and really enjoyed it, so we thought we would come again this February. We were not let again this visit. We were allocated a room on floor 27 which was quiet and clean and tidy and well maintained as all the Rius we have been in. As other people say the shower door doesn't seal properly and leaks every time you use it, a towel on floor catches it so isn't too much of a concern. This visit we had breakfast included and we found this too be off good choice and quality well worth having. It saved us having to buy lunch any day. We used the bar every day and found all the staff very helpful and obliging especially Allen , Jason and definitely Sorana (hope this is correct spelling) who was brilliant. The front desk staff were always courteous and polite. Concierge helped us book a transfer to Newark Airport and she was very helpful and approachable . As every one else says the hotel is in an excellent location for getting to hop on hop off bus companies, Central Park. A lot of the Downtown attractions available and not far on foot as well. We never used gym when here but it is clean and up to date looking and down a floor just past the elevators. We would recommend this hotel and will be back again hopefully in the near future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic location, close to all amenities and a 2 minute Walk to time square. The hotel has everything you need, from USB ports in the rooms, hair dryer, etc etc etc. No complaints at all. We had the buffet breakfast and had no complaints at all.I cannot express how close this is to the shows and restaurants on 46 street. Walk to 9th avenue in Hell's Kitchen and find some amazing restraints to eat at, from American, Mexican, Thia, the list is endless.I would recommend this Hotel to all my family and friends.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location is excellent...short walk to Times Square and many theatres. Rooms were clean, check in was seamless comfortable and a great shower. I did not use the restaurant or amenities. Concierge and bell captain were very helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, doesn't get any better then the location of this hotel. On the block, which i believe is 46th street, is many many restaurants. Hotel is walking distance to all broadway shows as well. Hotel itself, very clean, rooms are a good size compared to other hotels in nyc. Gym is nice with a good selection. There is a bar in the lobby, which looks really nice. Employees of the hotel are very professional.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Excellent location, and the cost was perfect for our purpose. We booked during the early February 2017 snowstorm to be close to work. Our late check in was the only delay, possibly due to everyone having the same idea "Book Manhattan prior to the storm". The room was very comfortable, with views of Manhattan, and modern. The staff was pleasant. The bar was lively, service is prompt, and cordial. I would choose this hotel again, and look forward to returning in the near future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in excellent position and the views are amazing. Service within the hotel was also fine, nothing special but definitely not bad. If this hotel was offering a great rate, I would stay there again. The bad sides are that we were never provided with the 'complimentary' water and when I asked reception I was simply told that they double check all water in the rooms before arrival so I must be wrong. I know it is only small, but I was parched when I arrived after my flight and it would have been great if it was there. Secondly, on one of the days, we had been given a badly stained towel. Don't get me wrong, it was clean, just stained. In a hotel of this size it is easy to see that the housekeeping team are under a lot of pressure, but it is a small thing that shouldn't have been overlooked. As I have said, otherwise the hotel was fine. There was nothing noteworthy about it, but nothing about it that you could say was bad. The views are excellent, so ask for a high level room if you can! The other bonus is that it has a huge sign on the roof, so if it is your first time to NYC, it is easy to find it! From the hotel it takes around 3 minutes to walk to Times Square and there are lots of restaurants and bars close by. This being said, it was not overly noisy (some noise should be expected as it is the busiest part of Manhattan after all) and we had no issue sleeping! I would recommend this hotel to others, just bear in mind that there are better hotels out there. For what we needed it was fine!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stay in NYC a lot. I like to try different locations depending on whom I am traveling with and the occasion. I was disappointed with this hotel. From the lobby it looks promising but sadly not once you got off the elevator at your floor. I had a room with a pull out bed for my teenager. Once this was pulled out you couldn't move around. There were three suitcases (three people in the room) and we had no space to put them anywhere except under the pullout sofa. The other things is this.....the shower wall is frosted glass and it faces onto the room.
