Whilst you cannot see the person clearly having the shower you can see the silhouette of them and all their actions. This was the same for the bathroom sliding door. It wasn't ideal for those self conscious people like a teenage girl. The other things was the pillows. They were lumpy...all 5 in our room. I called down for some other ones but I was told they were all the same. Then there was the very small print resort fee of $13 pp at the check out. I don't mind a resort fee if I was at a resort but this was no resort. When I asked about it, I was told it was for wifi. Really annoying because almost all hotels have free wifi in NYC. I went through a travel site for this reservation and it rated it as 4 stars. In my opinion, 4 star hotels don't have a combination shampoo/bodywash dispenser attached to the shower walls, chip wood laminate floors and lumpy foam pillows. The only plus side I could find to this hotel is the location for the theatre district. For the price I paid I wish I had stayed at the Marriott up the road.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I stayed here and really enjoyed it. It was very clean and we loved how modern and up to date it was. We really like that there were no carpets in the rooms! It is just removed from times square that you are close but not too close.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights with me sister to celebrate my 30th birthday. The rooms are beautiful with floor to ceiling windows! We had a room over looking time square (1 block away) only thing wrong with the room is there is no mirror over the desk to sit and do hair and makeup. Staff were very friendly and helpful (in particular one of the porters whom escorted me to the local shop in the early hours of the morning so as I wasn't vulnerable on my own)Being with my sister we wasn't bothered about the see though shower wall we actually found it funny.Great location

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our first time in NYC and we picked this hotel because it was newer and close to everything. We are happy we did our rate even included a big breakfast buffet! The rooms are very small but modern and beds comfortable. The lobby very nice. Just good things here you wont be dissapointed just book it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I'll try to sum up briefly the pros and cons of this hotel. We stayed here for 7 nights and had a really enjoyable time in New York.Pros:• Good location for metro and Times Square• Clean• New• Safe• Friendly staff• Free safe Cons:• The shower leaked so the floor was wet after a shower • We were locked out of our room on day 4 because they forgot to take a copy of our passport/credit card on check in on the first day so blocked our key cards. This was a bit of an inconvenience to sort out as the passport and credit card were in the safe in the room so it involved several trips up to the room and back down to reception to resolve • Toiletries weren't restocked every day• There wasn't a kettle, which I would have expected Anyway, in summary, we had a very jam packed and wonderful trip. The hotel was somewhere safe and warm to go back to after a long day of exploring.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely new hotel and in an excellent location. I had been traveling alot before I got to new york so I can not comment on noise levels as I was out for the count. Staff on reception were wonderfully friendly and smiley. Unfortunately despite the above I would probably think twice about revisting and here is why. I have never ever ever in my life stayed in a hotel (four star at that) that does not as a minimum provide hot drink ie coffee facilities or a stickeed mini fridge with snacks and more than one bottle of water for the duration of your stay. (there is a small fridge). I'm british, its a necessity to wake up with a coffee and go to sleep with a nice cup of tea and this uoset me greatly. The hotel provide no hot drink facilities in the room at all nor do they offer the option of room service. So if you need a water or a hot drink you have yyo get dressed and leave your room to go out into the city to buy one as the restaraunt and coffee shop are not open over night. Oh and no microwave. Peculiar experience but adequate none the less.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel isn't the easiest too find but once you do you won't be disappointed with it, the staff are really helpful & friendly check in was quick and easy too, I had requested a high level Times Square room which we had, it wasn't a huge room for 4 people but big enough & the bathroom wasn't a problem that people say is ! We didn't eat or drink here but both the bar & restaurant looked very nice. The location was good too minutes to the underground -Times Square -restaurants, I would definitely recommend this hotel & would definitely return too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: New hotel in a great location for mid-town, theater district, Lincoln Center, Times Square, etc. I stay in the city frequently (>2x/month) and this newcomer is timely and welcome! Clean, very comfortable, easy access to parking & taxis. Check in was quick & easy - when they forgot to give me a package that had been dropped off prior to my arrival they offered me a 4 pm late checkout to compensate. King size room - average for NYC (small) but well designed with more than enough space to get comfortable and unpack a suitcase or 2. Loved the lavendar & white color scheme. Great rates, friendly staff. Didn't use restaurant or lounge while there - but the decor is edgy and new. Glad RIU is in NYC - I was getting really tired of the same old places.
user_name:
Jill S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: my daughter and myself stayed here last week for four nights for my birthday.I have stayed in many riu hotels and this one was excellent.We were on the 23rd floor with fantastic views of the city.The hotel is really clean and we had a twin room which was big enough for us the only thing I would say there wasn't enough drawers but it was really clean and lovely and warm as it snowed when we were there and it was extremely cold.In the bathroom they supplied shampoo and conditioner and soap shower caps and in the shower they supplied shower gel and there was a hair dryer cleaned lovely every day everywhere in the hotel was clean.everyone at the hotel was professional and friendly.We ate at the hotel had breakfast a few mornings as it was really handy to get up go downstairs have breakfast which was buffett style it cost 19 dollars and you could eat as much as you want we found it too be excellent.the hotel has a great location and when we visit it again we will definitely use this hotel another excellent Riu hotel.We didn't find anything at all wrong with this hotel and all staff were very friendly.
user_name:
karenlane61
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very clean and modern. The staff is nice and very helpful. Check-in queues were a bit long, but still went fast. Had a room on the 27th floor, amazing view! The breakfast is not included and kinda pricey. I'd suggest to go to the Times square dinner and grill just around the corner (3 minute walk). They have an amazing (and affordable) breakfast.The fitness center is ok, it's clean and big, but not a lot of dumbbells and stuff.
user_location: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
user_name:
DJMCA
Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have stayed at many Riu hotels and loved staying at the Riu Plaza Times Square! My husband, brother in law and I stayed here for 4 nights, both having king rooms next to each other. The hotel is spotlessly clean and all the staff are so friendly and helpful. Nothing seemed like too much effort for them. Yes, the rooms are compact but I expected this for New York after reading many other reviews. The hotel is very modern with the most comfiest bed and pillows we've ever had at a hotel (or even at home!!). Huge wall mounted tv with loads of channels, not that you wanted to look at it given the views. We stayed in room 2820 (28th out of 30 floors) and we had a great view and could see some of the lights from Times Square. It was a little noisy with traffic but we didn't mind and it kind of added to the New York experience. The sockets next to the bed have USB sockets as well as two pin however these turned off when the overhead bed lights were turned out so not really practical for overnight charging. We just used them in the daytime and the other sockets at night. If you're staying as a couple the frosted glass partition between the shower and bedroom shouldn't be an issue but perhaps a little more privacy required if you're not, although having said that you could only see the outline of the person in the shower..perhaps take advantage of the great view whilst you wait!!!Looking west we could see the river and Intrepid museum from the hallway where the elevators were on our floor. Sampled drinks in the hotel bar, a pint of draft Bud will set you back $8 but this is quite normal for New York. Lots of other drinks selections and we ate in the hotel restaurant twice and had the best steak!! Bar staff and waiters were very friendly and polite. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it was $24 dollars which I thought was a bit steep. Instead we walked 5 minutes from the hotel to the 'Times Square Diner and Grill' on 8th avenue (out of the hotel, left and left again) which I had read about on trip advisor. I would highly recommend this place, by no means dirt cheap but the portions are huge and soooooo tasty. We had waffles, pancakes and French toast and it was amazing...I sigh thinking about how nice it was now sat here writing this review We also ate here once at night and the food was equally as good. The hotel is in such a good location, literally 5 minutes walk from 42nd and 50th St subway stations so you can get virtually anywhere and 10 minutes from the centre of Times Square. Buy a $30 metro card as soon as you get to New York as you can use it unlimited for 7 days and it means you can hop on or off the subway whenever you like and is so easy. We even caught the $5 air train from JFK to the subway then onto the hotel with big cases very easily. Even as first timers we found the subway is really easy. Tip: We bought data for £4 a day (EE) to use before leaving the uk so we could use google maps whilst we were there and this was definitely worth it too for navigation and to find out what subway trains to catch and from which station. Saved a lot of time and a welcome break from our sore feet. The hotel is close enough to be in amongst it all but without the disadvantages of added noise and lights. I would imagine being any closer to Times Square may have these hotels wifi was great, really fast and available in the room. We weren't told of a specific separate charge for this but assumed it was in the extra $52 we had to pay at the end of the trip per room. On booking I was informed that there would be an extra $80 charge to pay at the hotel so I wasn't unduly surprised. As a general caution: Expect to tip at least 15% everywhere, this is worked out on your receipt, we made the mistake on our first night in Johns Pizza of leaving only 10% only to have the bill returned and 'reminded' that it is customary to leave at least 15%!!! To avoid this embarrassment again we made sure we tipped at least the minimum wherever we dined/drank. Another bar worth a mention is Jack Demseys which is right near the Empire State Building and had happy hour daily from 4-8pm and a pint of Bud was only $4. Really nice clean place with a friendly atmosphere. We would without a doubt return to this hotel which was very reasonably priced for the location without compromise on the quality and style. It was the most amazing trip and can't wait to go again!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my girlfriend recently stayed at the RIU Plaza for 5 nights at the end of January 2017. We decided to book this hotel because of its great location and value for money. Both turned out to be true to form!We paid, $563 for 5 nights (direct on the RIU website), working out to under £100 a night, which is a bargin for the location and quality of the hotel. I have seen many reviews where people have paid loads more, and so I can understand there frustrations against how much they paid. However for us, whilst there were some issues, you couldn't complain to much for how little we paid. Check-in was easy and we found all staff to be polite and friendly. They had fulfilled my earlier request of a room up on a high floor, and we were given the 25th, 3 from the top! Yes the room is small, but for a city break, you spend so little time and lets be honest, most rooms in NY tend to be on the small side anyway. The room was modern thanks to being newly built and done the job. In terms of quality, yes the shower did leak as many other reviews have mentioned (No issue really, just put a towel down), some of the finishing could be better, (slightly wonky odd tile etc) and unfortunately we did have to request the room the be cleaned again. Some hairs etc were visible. I think because its a fairly 'white' room design, you might see abit more than you would in darker hotel rooms, it was nothing to the point of thinking "urgh this is disgusting" just more "could do with another quick once over". The front desk staff were very apologetic and sent a cleaner up along with providing us the water that was missing. In terms of location, the hotel is PERFECT! You are one block west of Times Square and can see the advertising from between the buildings, and being positioned on 46th street you can walk to many of the great attractions. You have subway stations close by, a couple of mins walk, although getting the subway back to JFK was a bit of a pain as most old stations in NY dont have lift access, so carrying all the cases down the stairs was a pain, but saved the money compared to a taxi etc. Our room faced 8th Avenue itself, with noise never being to much of an issue, apart from the sirens of the fire station across the road....but hey, you're in New York so should be loving it! Can't comment on the restaurant or cafe within the hotel as never used. But why would you? People, you are in New York City, one of the greatest cities in the world, yet you want breakfast or food that they will sell in every RIU hotel across the world? Walk out the door, and explore the local options, so many options just a stones throw away! On check-out you could either pay the $12 a night service charge (for wifi access, welcome bottle of water and bag storage) by card or cash and we left our luggage for the last day with the concierge no problem. Overall a good stay representing great value for money. Yes some improvements could be made in terms of finishing touches, but would happily recommend a stay at the RIU Plaza Times Square. P.S - Anyone complaining about the shadow on the shower screen, is being over the top. You can barley see anything apart from a faint outline of your body shape.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was in NYC on business and stayed at the Riu Plaza Hotel. I was on the executive floor with lounge access. The rooms were good size with a refrigerator and nice beds. I understand the hotel is only about a year old and it looks to be in good condition. I will now book the RIu now when I am in NYC. This hotel is a good choice!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 6 days over Christmas and new year. The hotel is not fantastic the rooms are so small you can hardy move especially when a family. The bathroom is glass throughout so can see silhouette when in room of person showering.Breakfast not included and silly price, overall staff are quite rude and not to the RIU standard.Close to Times Square but not close enough to be called a Times Square hotel. Overall not very good value for money at all. No Christmas special or new year very boring.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: With a family of 5 (3 kids) we spend three nights here in a "family room". Allthough small I found the rooms to be big enough for us. Afterall this is not where we spend many hours during a New York visit. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The keep the luggage for you both when you arrive and when you leave. The rooms vere clean and nicely decorated. The kids loved the "glass wall" to the shower. So did I, but that's another story :-) It's very close to Times Square and thus in the centre of it all. If you know NYC the hotel is located right between Times Square and the pier where the Entrepid is. You will love it here.I have one tip for the staff. It didn't bother me, but I'm sure some would be bothered that the smoking area is just outside the main entrance, so can't avoid walking thru when you enter and leave.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed there for 5 days, the hotel décor is great, service excellent and staff very professional and friendly. The rooms were adequate but maybe a little small, but very clean. The bar staff were wonderful, helpful, knowledgeable and fun special thanks to barman Jason, he was very nice and made you feel very welcome. Good 3 course lunch deal. The only criticism being no tea or coffee making facilities in the room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is 5mins walk (whilst dragging a suitcase) from Port Authority Bus Terminal - no need for the expense of a taxi when we got the bus for $17 each from Newark Airport. It was in a great location - from our bed we could see the centre of Times Square (the place/building where the Ball drops on NYE).I spent 4nights at the Riu with my mum. We stayed in a Queen room. I wasn't looking forward to sharing a bed with her but the bed was big enough that I didn't even feel like she was there. The room isn't massive but given that we were there for New York and not the hotel room I really didn't care - we only slept there. We used the coffee place downstairs (accessible from both hotel lobby and street) every morning for breakfast. I think the hotel had an option to add breakfast for around $20 per person (don't quote me on that price though) whereas in the coffee place we got 2 teas and 2 pastries for less than $12. The staff were very pleasant too. I can't comment on the hotel restaurant as we never used it.In the room there is a mini fridge with a "Welcome Bottle of Water" for each guest. Reviews have mentioned that their water didn't get replaced every day - if you read the hotel information in the room you would know this is just a "Welcome Bottle of Water". Reviews also mention the frosted glass walls for the bathroom. This is nothing to be concerned about. It is opaque glass and unless you're pressed against it you will see nothing - maybe the hint of a silhouette. The only issue I had with the room is the lack of tea and coffee facilities but other than that, I really can't think of any faults.Also, the hotel was lovely enough to leave me a note and a little box of chocolates in the room on my birthday. This was my first time in New York and I would definitely return to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in a great location and was very comfortable. Compared to some hotels I have stayed in fr the same price the room was better appointed and larger. I'm not too sure what the $14 facility fee was for, there is supposed to be water in the room but there wasn't, I asked and they said they would look for some but I guess they didn't find any. Also I had a letter on the desk with a pen (a room drop) but it was in German and for a different guest so I guess the housekeeping could have better attention to detail. I would definitely stay here again though, it would be interesting to see if their prices skyrocket during summer as currently, they are very reasonable for the quality of room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful modern lobby full of couches and plugs for the smartphones. Coffeshop and restaurant in lobby. Cafe has decent prices. 24 hour delis nearby and lots of restaurants. One block away from Times Square makes it an ideal location.The rooms were comfortable but a bit small. We were 4 and had two double beds, which was a bit tight. Very good free wifi. Fast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Recently we booked a room at the Riu Plaza. We had no idea what to expect and we were BLOWN AWAY. In the past we have stayed at hotels that charged $350 to $400 a night. The rooms were dated and the service poor. The Rooms at RIU were under $200 a night. Although small they are beautifully decorated and very functional. The beds and pillows were amazing.The staff is cordial and always willing to help. We ate at the restaurant and the coffee bar and both were very good.The hotel is centrally located and we were able to walk everywhere.The doorman Jahmel White was a standout. His knowledge of the city and ability to suggest the perfect place to eat or the most inexpensive way to get to the airport was impressive. In this day and age is is rare to find someone who is so committed to their job and the company they work for. RIU is very luck to have him and I hope they appreciate him as much as we did.Anytime we go to NY we plan to stay at the RIU

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I were in NYC this weekend to check out Hamilton which is playing across the street from the hotel. We booked 3 nights at the RIU NYC and on the last night (1/28), my husband walks into the hotel and proceeds to go to our room. As he progresses toward the elevators, the security guard (Raphael Reynoso) aggressively charges him and states “we don’t have public restrooms for people like you”. WTF?!?!????? Never once did Raphael ask my husband if he was staying at the hotel or to show his room key. Instead, he saw a black man and automatically assumed he should not be in the hotel.What’s even more OUTRAGING is that I spoke to Joanne a front desk manager and Katherine the General Manager and they both made excuses for Raphael’s racist behavior and never once did they apologize for this egregious behavior. Joanne offered to upgrade my room…knowing I was checking out within minutes of speaking with her. And Katherine just stated there was nothing she could do to right the situation and directed me to contact customer service via email or Expedia where I booked the rooms. There is no way that she is not empowered to fix this type of situation. It is clear that she chose not to because we are BLACK. What she should have done was apologize for the egregious act and then offer to comp my room for the night. What I know for sure is that THIS IS NOT HOSPITALITY and the RIU hotel just bought themselves a TON OF NEGATIVE PRESS. My family spends at least $40K a year traveling the world and NEVER have we experienced ANYTHING like this!!!!To add to this awful experience, the overall service was horrible. On 2 occasions I had to have new pillows cases sent to the room because there were stains on the ones on the bed and then when we were leaving I called down for help with the bags (my husband went to get the car) and 20 minutes later they NEVER showed up so my daughter and I had to struggle with the bags ourselves.Now I have tweeted the corporate office and they have responded that they are sharing this incident with the appropriate department. Let’s see what they come back with.OUTRAGED and DISGUSTED!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked two full beds and a sleeper sofa. We enjoyed the spacious rooms. The restaurant and bar were a real treat. Loved the location as it was a few blocks from Times Square. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Took a long time considering hotels in NY, so very glad we chose this one, Within walking distance of most sites, for everything else there is a subway stop not far. We stayed on the 29th floor in a king room with a great view, could see bits of Times Square and Broadway. You could still hear the road noise from up that high (New Yorkers love their honking), but it wasn't a problem for us. Bed was very comfortable with luggage space underneath, great tv, cute desk, easy to use safe, & good bathroom (like many of the other reviews have mentioned the frosted glass is strange, but if you don't turn on the bathroom light you can't see through. Hallway light is more than adequate). We found all the staff to be warm & welcoming. Checking in & out was a breeze, we actually arrived earlier than expected (around 1.30pm) and our room was ready for us. We found the concierge to be very helpful with information, stamps, & post. We didn't eat in the hotel, there is a lovely diner not far which was brilliant for breakfast (The Westway Diner). However my Mum used the cafe downstairs to buy coffee & thought both members of staff were very charming. Wi-Fi was strong even up on such a high floor.We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would definitely chose to stay here again.
user_name:
SuzieH3
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I really liked this hotel. I stood there for 3 days I was in town to watch the hockey games. It's really close to Times Square, broadway theatre around and bars or breweries if your into that as well. The room was small but it was just me, it was good for me and would be good for two people don't think you need that much space. The first day I got there they took up a complimentary water. The check in was real easy and the place looked clean. It was a good place to stay at, at least for me I would return here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I went to New York for her birthday. We checked into the hotel on January 28th for one night. This hotel is exceptional! The room was kind of small but it was beautiful and modern. The bed was comfortable, shower was amazing, and the views from our room were excellent. The service was top notch as well. I really don't have any complaints. All this at a 5 star caliber hotel in Times Square for less than $200 for the night. Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As a professional travel consultant I would like to provide my review as a guest staying at the RIU Plaza Hotel in New York City. First I would like to say that the front staff was very pleasant and the lobby was very nice, chic and clean; this was the first thing I noticed when I first stepped into the hotel. The hotel has a nice restaurant and grab and go coffee shop onsite. I was told during my site inspection that all rooms have a nice view. The rooms are on the small side, but that is normal for NY hotels. I stayed on the 23 floor with a nice view. The bathroom was a nice size. All rooms are available in 1 king or 2 queen/double beds. (Please note: I would only recommend you have 1 to 2 people in these rooms due to the size.) Amenities:The hotel does state free Wi-Fi but you will be charged a daily resort fee of $13 upon check-in that includes (Wi-Fi, gym and luggage storage upon check-out if you need that service). The restaurant has a very nice chic feeling serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. You have the option to add buffet breakfast onto your booking. The lunch/dinner prices are very reasonable in price. (note: they do not have a coffee maker in the rooms but do provide one bottle of water complimentary upon check-in). This property provides a refrigerator in the room if you would like to store something from any of the nearby shops. The RIU Plaza is located in a great area; within walking distance to theaters, shopping, restaurants and Times Square. I would give this hotel a 4 star rating.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having stayed in many hotels in NYC previously and not being overjoyed with what would be considered 4 or 5 star we did not have too high expectations for this one, although it looked great on the website. On arrival the hotel was modern, staff were welcoming and speedy. We did have to pay a facilities fee which let's face it is just paying for wifi whether you like it or not but this seems to be happening all over in New York now and at $51 for the 4 nights was not too extortionate. On getting to the room at twilight we were met with the most amazing view of the city from our large floor to ceiling window, just fantastic. Our room was a king, the bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable and the room was spacious enough for our needs, shower was really good too. The hotel is situated in the perfect location close enough to Times Square to be really central but far enough away to keep it classy!! Nice little café downstairs to get tea, coffee, cakes etc perfect for when your body clock is not quite getting passed being up, dressed and out at 7am yet. Didn't try the restaurant so can't comment on that but the queue was long enough each morning to suggest it was pretty good and it seemed good value for breakfast. We stayed on the 27th floor which gave amazing views and was incredibly quiet.Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, would choose it every time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The lobby is a big draw. The location was perfect (we were in town to see Hamilton) so we were a short walk from the theater. Rooms were NYC small but with nice views, modern, clean and nice bathrooms. Beds could have a couple more pillows (but that might be my preference!). Overall, the hotel was perfectly suited for our needs.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This place was a magnificent find by New York standards. Exceptionally spacious, clean and modern, with an huge lobby with expertly designed seating areas and even an outdoor patio. It's also convenient to Restaurant Row, Times Square and the Theatre District and tons of shopping, and still offers free Wi-Fi while many hotels are now charging for this. The rooms have wonderful views, some of them of the river. I visit New York a few times a year for work and shows and have stayed in many crowded and disappointing 4 and 5 star hotels. This was one of the best hotels I've found. The beds are very comfortable, the staff was 5 star, the coffee shop was out of this world, convenient and inviting, with fresh baked good and coffee and floor to ceiling windows to watch the world go by. It was like being transported to Montreal or Europe in the midst of busting New York. Well done Riu!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Recently visited (Jan 17) for a long weekend with a check in on Friday and out on Monday.This hotel was bang on the money for us. It is (as most comments suggest) right in the middle of Times Square and broadway .... ok, so it's a 30 second walk !! Check in was quick and easy and I saw no signs of the previously mentioned rude or unfriendly staff as everything and everyone was fine.I had emailed ahead and asked as it was my partners birthday if we could have a room on a high floor for a view and to cut down the noise everyone had reviewed about. I didn't say anything when checking in to see if the answered email was actually passed on. We were given a room on the 28th floor, which I believe is the top ? THANK YOU. I was also pleasantly surprised to find they delivered a small box of chocolates and a card wishing my partner happy birthday. It's little things like this that make a good hotel even better. THANK YOU.The room was a room ! It was clean, had a bed, a free safe a huge TV, a sink, toilet, shower and lights !!! I really can't understand all the 'doomers and gloomers' who aren't happy with the rooms. We went to the room to sleep, to shower and to get ready to go out again..... isn't that what you go to New York for ????? IF I had been there to spend the weekend in my room it MAY have appeared small, but we didn't we went to see New York ! The glass in the bathroom isn't a see through glass it's an opaqe glass. Not the first hotel I've stayed in with this arrangement at all. Yes I could see the outline of my partner when she was in the shower ..... bonus ! But there was no way she could of been seen on the toilet ! If I had been with a family member it MAY possibly have been an issue if the lights were on in the bathroom and not in the bedroom but this really is no issue al all !The noise...... yes it's noisy....... it's New York City and you are in Times Square !!!! What do you expect !?!?! There are sirens, constant sirens, horns, hustle and bustle at all hours and more sirens !!! But it's New York City and it's Times Square...... if you don't like the noise........take ear plugs or go to Kansas ! There is a coffee shop in the lobby area and a restaurant also. We used neither as we were in New York and decided to sample the local food. The breakfast, as other reviews have stated was expensive, but there are lots of places to eat and cheaper within 2 minutes walk, but would be fine for convenience.There was a bottle of water each in the fridge on day 1 but not replaced and yes, there is no coffee machine in the room. However, trip advisor tip for you here..... the tap water IS drinkable ! AND the bottle we were given fits under the tap... go figure !!!! If we were in the room and needed tea or coffee we had been in the room too long and went out !!! Check out was no problem and was swift and polite. There is this additional charge of $13 per room per night which has been talked about in here and you are told about on check in...... not sure what it's for entirely but we knew about it so budgeted accordingly so don't be surprised and whine about it after you have stayed....... or go to Kansas ! All in all, a hotel within budget in the heart of New York that was clean, friendly, had a bed and ticked all of our boxes..... THANK YOU Riu Plaza New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was my first stay at a Riu property. The NYC location was great, just one block from Times Square and convenient to countless restaurants in the Hell's Kitchen area. The check-in process was a bit disappointing, as I could not check-in even a few minutes before 3pm (they didn't even look in their computer system to see if a room was available), and the front desk staff were generally cold in their demeanor. The room was a standard size for NYC, very basic in layout and amenities, but overall clean and satisfactory for the price.
user_name:
wdcwrldtrvlr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hi, I am writing this as I wait to be picked up to return to the airport. Not normally one for writing reviews but probably one of the first to jump on here and read other people's reviews before booking my holiday. I booked this hotel for 6 days / 5 nights for a surprise for my wife's impending 40th birthday. I contacted the hotel before we travelled to let them know and asked about getting a high up room with a view. When we arrived at check-in we were given an upgraded room (25th floor) with a balcony.The hotels and rooms were spotless and we'll looked after. The room was plenty big enough with loads of hanging space for clothes, safe, large tv on the wall and a really comfortable bed. The bathroom had a large walkin shower, yes frosted glass at the wall and bedroom. The room was cleaned and sprayed fresh every day with fresh towels being left.Had no problems with any enquiries at the concierge and also free use of computers and printer for printing off tickets.The hotel is centrally located and ideal for walking distance to all tourist attractions and subways. Just bring comfortable walking shoes / boots as you will walk a lot we averaged 10 miles a day walking.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would not think twice about staying here again, we have stayed at Hotel thirty thirty, The Sherston and the Roosevelt before while being in New York and The Riu Plaza is by far the best and nicest that we have stayed in.
user_name:
Craig M
South Lanarkshire, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is VERY clean, and the staff is very helpful, friendly and everyone smiled except the woman working outside the restaurant on January 21st she was kind of crabby, other than that employees were very pleasant. Our room was a "family suite" but it was small by Midwestern standards but probably a suite by NY standards. Really nice exercise room and seriously 2 blocks from Times Square. The restaurant is too expensive but the "grab and go" was quite reasonable. There were so many other places to eat very close that it didn't matter that the crabby lady was outside of the hotel restaurant we just went somewhere else to eat. We went to a Broadway show and were able to walk to it. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First time visiting New York and this hotel came up on Expedia with a great deal and price. I was worried at first as it said that it was newly built and lot of people online had things to complain about it. Honestly, I don't know why they did. The hotel is clean, bright and the staff are so friendly! Check in was smooth and completed professionally, we were even given a free upgrade to our room. The rooms aren't overly big but have everything that you need - a massive bed, a safe, a wardrobe, tv, free wifi, fridge and a beautiful bathroom. I've never had such a lovely bathroom while staying on holiday. I noticed a lot of people complaining about the frosted glass being see through while you're in the shower. I didn't personally find it a problem as we just turned off the bathroom light, the frosted glass allowed for light from the main room to come in while the people outside not able to see in. Simple fix. The only downfall of the room was that there was no tea making facilities but I can't imagine that being common in American hotels as they put their kettles on the job rather than plugging them in. Was a shame to not have a cup of tea in the morning but I soon got over it. The customer service is outstanding. We had a problem with our safe and within 5 minutes it was fixed thanks to the front desk staff and the engineers. Also, the staff in he restaurant were the loveliest severs we had the whole time. Food was well priced and delicious! The location is one of the best bits. Only a five minute walk from Times Square and luckily for us we could see the New Year's Eve ball drop from our bedroom window! There's so many places to eat around the hotel and a wide range of subways within 5-10 minute walks to allow access around Manhattan. I rate this hotel very highly and I've recommended it to so many people already. If and when I go back, this hotel will be my first choice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is clean, new and modern, and in a great location being a 5 minute walk from Times Square. The room was clean and modern, and small but it's New York so lots of hotel rooms are small. The bathroom was big and spacious, though the sink hadn't been installed properly and was beginning to come of the wall. We stayed high up in the hotel, so our view was overlooking buildings which was fine by us. We were lucky enough to be able to see all the snow over the city from our room.The staff were ok. They were polite but did not appear to be like they really did not want to be at work, and were not very helpful when the hotel's wifi was not working for one of our devices.The little cafe connected to hotel downstairs was delightful, with a range of foods and drinks. We spent most mornings having a cake or salad, with a hot drink for breakfast in there.The hotel is in a great location, having Times Square a few minutes walk away and a range of dining options all around. The hotel is also in the Theatre District, meaning that the biggest Broadway shows were only a few minutes walk away. Overall, I would definitely stay here if I were to return to New York City.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel. The room was clean and the location is great. The hotel is located a few blocks from Times Square. Several theaters are near by. The staff were are friendly and helpful. I'd stay at this property again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just stayed here for a week, Hotel is in ideal location just up the street from Times Square which I found perfect as at night it was nice and quiet around outside the hotel. (Couldn't hear background noise from Times-square). We requested a high room as it was a birthday occasion which they provided us with one of the top floors without any hesitation and even left me a little card note and chocolates on my birthday! All staff were very friendly and helpful at all times during our stay. Hotel is really modern and kept immaculate. Rooms were also very clean and spacious. Only fault with this hotel was the walls seemed to be really thin so we could hear the neighbours talking and watching tv, But overall I will be recommending this hotel to people as we had a lovely week staying here!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is in the theater district and a great location. Hotel is very modern and clean. You walk in and it smells amazing. Rooms are big for NYC and great views. Beds are comfortable and there is a mini fridge in each room and the window cracks open. All staff are very friendly. Bathroom is also nice and shower has amazing water pressure. I think the walls are thin as you can hear hallway noise but it's NYC so not like you spend much time in your room. We stayed over on a Saturday and saw a matinee Broadway show on Sunday and the bellman watches your bags after you check out. I would definitely recommend this place and will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It has been a magnificent hotel! Great room, great view of Manhattan and a very good deal on the part of the staff. Very central location you can next to times square!When we go back to new york we will surely Same hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First it's brand new so it's clean and beautiful. But....so noisy. We were on 20th floor and street noise was just awful all night. I was cold as the only blanket is a thin fleece. No comforter or extra in the closet so had to turn up heat higher than I prefer for sleeping. I try never to stay in this neighborhood but took advantage of a great rate promotion. When we arrived I had prepaid for the room but did not have that particular credit card with me. This was an issue despite me having ID, a reservation receipt and other credit cards. It that led to us standing at the front desk for what felt like forever until they said ok. Then I was advised of a $26 a day resort fee. Oops missed that charge somewhere when booking. Have never paid a resort fee in NYC hotel before. They offered 10%off their $24 breakfast but any idiot knows better than to eat breakfast in your NYC hotel. There are diners like Galaxy within a block or plenty of other reasonable options within two blocks and a Starbucks across the street. It's a good location if you are going to a show or have interest in Times Square. It's small room yes but you know that when booking. I've had huge rooms and small rooms in NYC. We found this adequate for the two of us. In the morning people were in the hallway at 8am sitting and talking on their cellphone on speaker like they were at home. WTH people do you not realize there are people sleeping behind all those doors? This behavior baffles me and I finally had to go ask the woman to have her conversation elsewhere.
user_name:
valerinanj
Hudson River Valley, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was very central to Times Square and easy to locate. We were on the 25th floor with a fantastic view. The hotel was clean and the room had two double beds spacious and comfortable. Some staff helpful some were not really bother, the porters were friendly and helpful. The wifi was excellent worked perfectly. Breakfast price was outrageous at the hotel over priced so we took advice from another review and went to Westway dinner round the corner on 9th Ave "excellent".No complaints really a nice Riu hotel and webwould return

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Clean, modern and excellent location. We stayed the night before our NCL cruise. Walked to Times Square in seconds. Friendly doorman and staff. We did not eat on premises. Frosted glass shower wall may be awkward for families travelling.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel, nice room and very friendly staff. Stayed here over the new year before going on a cruise. The hotel is in a great location to use as a base for sightseeing and it is also close to the cruise terminal. We had a room overlooking 8th ave on floor 21 fantastic view and we could just see the corner of the ball drop in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location,Fabulous Hotel,Rooms lovely and great views ,Staff so friendly and helpful also very nice coffee shop attachted to hotel.Nice bar menu,Lobby very impressive lovely colours, Spotless Hotel.Would Highly recommend!would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It is my habit to wait a few weeks after staying somewhere before writing a review here. This is so any raw emotion (good or bad) has time to dissipate before I put down my feelings.My family and I (5 people in total) stayed here in October 2016, during school half term. The RIU was one of only a few hotels that offered a family room that could accommodate us all in one room.Firstly, the good:The hotel is in a great location, just two blocks from the centre of Times Square and all the bustle and atmosphere that it offers. Times Square itself is something you have to experience but not for too long. If like me, you don't like crowds then you'll be happy just to pass through. But if you're in New York to soak up the buzz, then the RIU is a good place to stay.The hotel is modern and clean with a bar serving great beers and OK food (more on that later). Plus there's a small coffee shop for pastries and cakes if you don't feel like a full breakfast. It is small though and you might not get a seat.I can't really think of any other good points so I'll move on to the bad.Room size. Really? For a family of five? We expected something that had at least a bit of room to move in, but once our cases were on the floor (no stand was provided) there was literally nowhere to stand.This was not going to work for us, so I spoke to reception who upgraded us to a larger room for our remaining four nights, but not without relieving me of a further $700 for the benefit. This room was much better - two separate rooms and a bathroom with a proper door instead of a frosted glass window. No child wants to see a silhouette of their dad on the toilet.So in the end we got a more suitable room, but they made me pay a lot for it.The restaurant. Breakfast is the usual buffet affair, with all of the expected components in metal dishes for you to help yourself to. Not a great experience when they ran out of eggs, bread, sausages and bacon at regular intervals. They were eventually topped up but it mean that we ate our breakfast in separate sprints instead of together.At dinner (we only ate dinner there once) the menu looked OK but the service was disastrous. We were seated and then ignored for 15 minutes. Eventually our waitress took a drinks order but refused to take our food order until she had brought our drinks, even though we had already chosen. Our drinks then sat at the bar for a further 10 minutes before I eventually stood up to retrieve them myself. Once we placed our food order, it took 45 minutes to arrive - plus they got half the order wrong and it had to be sent back. All of this was punctuated with a mixture of vacant stares and borderline hostility from our waitress who looked like she would rather be anywhere else but serving us. And no, the restaurant was not busy - it was no more than 30% of capacity.When we left, I booked a taxi with the concierge to take us to JFK. "Five thirty" I told him. At five thirty we were in the lobby and I spoke to the concierge. Long story short, the taxi didn't arrive until quarter past six. You could blame this on the taxi firm, but from the way he reacted, I got a feeling that no one had actually ordered our cab.Ironically, this extra time ended up quite useful, because they lost our luggage and it took them over half an hour to find it.On a final note - I paid a $100 deposit upon checking in which was supposed to be deducted from my final incedentals bill. It came to over $900, so I should have paid $800. In all the commotion at check out I didn't check my bill, expecting it to be correct, and it was only when I returned to England that I discovered that the $100 I had already paid was not deducted. I've tried to speak to the hotel to get my $100 back but got nowhere and have given up.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: NYC is so expensive so we found this hotel a great deal, reasonable price, great location and very nice. Rooms are small but you dont need bigger bc u will be exploring the city all day. Close to the T station, few blocks from Times Square, u def can walk to the most tourist places in the city.I think that is better stay in the high level, NYC is crazy so could be lil noise.Our room was very clean and nite, bath big and nice , great customer service is just perfect for any time that u plan go to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have an annual girls weekend in NYC every January. This year we picked the RIU Times Square. Beautiful lobby, very friendly staff and decent size rooms. We had two Queen size beds plus a pull out sofa. The rooms were clean, had a mini frig with complementary bottles of water. Plenty of bath towels, hand and face towels. We did not have enough pillows and called the front desk asking for a couple more. We thought we would need to wait awhile. 10 minutes later the front desk called to make sure we received the towels. (Which we had not.) 2 minutes later the pillows arrived and then another follow up call to make sure the pillows were delivered. Loved the follow thru on the service!The location is great and there is parking nearby. Just a couple of drawbacks. One....no room service and two....really could have used a coffee maker in the room.I would definitely recommend the RIU Times Square.
user_name:
rrodeo
Sea Isle City, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel, very convenient for Times Square area of the city and great for using as a base. Room quite small for 3 adults , NO tea/coffee making facilities and only two bottles of water in the fridge. Rooms very hot, even though we were there week before Christmas and it was freezing outside. Strangest thing of all was the bathroom, the walls were made of frosted glass so you had to turn the light off in the bathroom to ensure complete privacy!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location. This is a new hotel so everything is bright and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My king room was very comfortable. I only spent 2 nights but wished I could have stayed longer. My only worry is that the prices will go way up in late spring.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife wanted to see the Christmas tree at Rockefeller Center. We decided to stay at the Riu in Times Square. We could easily see the television screens from our window. The rooms were small but extremely nice and the lobby was very pretty. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I've been to New York many times. The location was the best feature along with nice room, great aminities and great views.Little secret, don't go towards times square for dinners, continue down 46th Street to find some of hell's kitchens best fare.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed over New Year for a week and even though the hotel was really busy the staff were very attentive and the service was great. The bar and restaurant are always lively but still the service is great and the choice of menu is comprehensive too although there are no coffee making facilities in the room there is a great grab and go coffee shop in reception. The location is excellent

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights over new year great hotel very clean great location paid £42 for resort fee - rip off for 2 500ml bottles of water free WiFi only in the lobby which wasn't great . Warning don't use hotel for cabs ! Doorman offered us hotel car for transfer to cruise port after he discussed it with the driver the price offered $44 !! Litterly walked 12 steps stopped a yellow cab $12 .50 !! And to be fair it would have been cheeper if the que at the cruise terminal hadn't been as long But still would use the hotel again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Initially we were skeptical about booking this hotel as the price was far too reasonable as compared to the other hotels in the area. We were not disappointed with the hotel, the room, or the location. It is very close to times square, and the theater district. The room was clean and comfortable. The room was a little warm, however we had a window and were able to open it up. We talked to the staff about this in the morning and they said that we should have phoned the desk and they would have resolved this for us. It is also very close and convenient to the Manhattan Cruise terminal. It was a 40$ cab ride from LGA and a 10$ Uber fare to the cruise terminal. We have stayed here 2 times and this will be our go to hotel for as long as they keep the pricing in its current range.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel. We enjoyed it very much. It is clean, and yes the staff are friendly and professional. We loved this hotel because it is so well situated. Out the front door, turn left and in just a couple of minutes you are in Times Square. If you turn right, walk for 10 minutes you reach the river where you can explore the Intrepid, Sea, Air and Space museum, or catch the Circle Line sightseeing cruises. We took the 21/2 hour cruise and the guide tells you everything about New York and points out the landmarks, and yes you cruise by the beautiful Statue of Liberty. If you just want to go to the statue that ship leaves at 10am and you get to go to the pedestal.The hotel has in their lobby a cute little coffee shop. This hotel is situated also in the heart of the theater district, so if you get tickets for a show, chances are you will not be far from this hotel. Highly recommended, and we are thinking of going back to NYC to see what we did not have time to see, and we are staying at the Riu again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter (16), and I stayed here for a week, 24th December to 31st, and it was immaculate. And so it should be as we were told it had only been open or refurbished 6th months prior. Check in was professional and were advised a deposit of $200 would be taken for incidentals. Hotel will charge City tax, and some can charge service charge daily, which can be $28 per day. Watch out for that. The maids cleaned the room every day, even though we gave them a couple of days off!!!!. The location is fabulous, out of the hotel to the left, you are two blocks from Times Square, and turn right at the hotel and you will find plenty of restaurants. We eat in the hotel restaurant a few times, food was ok. They also have a little coffee shop attached to the hotel for pastries and snacks. As you do not get tea or coffee facilities in the room. Maybe it's a USA thing. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel Riu Plaza just gets down to the main essentials necessary for a city hotel room in which you are probably not going to spend a lot of time in anyway. Being “just” a city hotel room is not a bad thing. I sort of knew what I would be getting when I made the reservation. At first though, when noticing no carpet in the hallways or in the room, I thought, O boy! This is not the Marriott Marquis for sure. But, I certainly was saving some money in comparison with other nearby hotels. And, what I found was that I was not at all dissatisfied with anything. The hotel is brand new construction, it was clean, bed comfy, shower was great, room was quiet except for some noisy door slammers every once in a while, a great view with the huge floor to ceiling windows and location, location, location. I only got the breakfast buffet there one morning which was fine and typical for NYC. Only down side for me was no expedited checkout procedure or if there was, unfortunately I was not aware of it. Upon needing to checkout in the morning I found a lot of people waiting in line for a desk clerk so they could get a final bill. I could not wait for a long time and eventually had to just ask someone behind the desk to please check me out but I could not get a final bill in hand. This hotel serves its purpose well. I’ll be back to stay here, but every once in a while, I will hit the Marriott Marquis too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is clean, modern and very Rui like with purple and pink every where! Reception staff were great, check in/out was easy. Room was clean, comfortable, small and expensive, but hey, it's New York City!!Big negative would be how we were treated when they had a "fashion show" take over the bar. No warning or signage and I was made to feel very uncomfortable when asked to leave. Manager was very abrupt and unsympathetic. We paid a lot of money to stay at this hotel and we weren't able to have a drink at the bar and no alternative was offered!This hotel is not on Times Square but a short, 2 block walk away.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hard to fault this place, would definitely stay here again if we come back to NY. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Rooms are a good size, clean and tidy. Beds are comfortable although not that large in the family quad room.We only ate in hotel once, the food and service were good but menu is a little limited. Given the hotels brilliant location, just off Time Square, you are not short of food options. Treehaus on 42nd st became our favourite for casual eating.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Me and my friend stayed in room 2004 6th to 10th January. We were both amazed how lovely all the staff were .very polite and could not do enough to help us .the room was lovely .breakfast well .was unbeatable, never seen so much choice for breakfast ..we would both highly recommend the rui plaza for anyone .it's so central to everything we wanted Thank u so very much for making our holiday of a lifetime so absolutely brilliant

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is everything it says it is. Nothing exagerated! Arrived late at night and still got a very smooth check in. Room had amazing views of surrounding skyscrapers. Absolute bargain room rate for location. Literally go outside and turn left and times square is 100mtrs up. Turn right instead for a great run of restaurants. I dont think theyre are any other hotels of this height in the area that offer these kind of views with floor to ceiling windows! Room was cleaned everyday, staff were very polite and helpful. Cant fault this place at all. The Riu chain know how to accomodate. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was in the most fantastic location. Literally 5 minutes to time square!The reception staff were lovely. We got a deluxe king which I've learnt in most other locations means a big expansive room however in New York it means a smaller standard size room I wouldn't want to be in a normal sized room whilst staying in New York. I have found this in all of the hotels that we stayed in here. I would definitely stay here again. Clean and very modern. It's about a $52 US cab ride from either airport and if you want the hotel can arrange a car for you as well to go either direction. Very very helpful :-)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Last December 7th my one year old daughter got sick. I decided to call front desk for assistance.Hotel front desk called one doctor. The bill was 3750 USD for total two visits. Hotel management must care about its guests and not taking advantage of situations like this. Jose Maria MendezSpain
user_name:
Mac5868
Province of A Coruna, Spain

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights in a family room - there was 5 of us.- the room was a bit cramped - two double beds and a sofa bed for the 5 of us - mum,dad , nana and two grandchildren 9 and 12. The room was kept very clean and plenty of towels in the bathroom. We struggled to get a taxi to get us back to the airport as they wanted $120 + a tip. we paid $52 from JFK when we arrived. Ishmael the bell person managed to get us a private car to take us for $60+ toll charge - he was very nice, helpful and deserves a pay increase!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here only one night for a concert and Madison Square Garden. While checking in there was another customer who was OUTRAGED about being over charged$3,000. I can understand his displeasure but he was really creating a scene. I thought the staff was handling it well. Anyway, the young lady Who checked us in was very pleasant and professional. Because we were running late for our show she had the Bellman take our bags. The room was a fair size I've been in much smaller in New York City , it was very clean as well as the bathroom. One little drawback I didn't realize you had a put the key card in a slot by the door to control the electricity, I walked around the room for about three minutes or so trying to figure out why the lights wouldn't go on. This property is in a great spot, after our show we checked out some of the clubs on 46th street and had a good time at all of them especially a place called "don't tell mama"it was very lively and fun worth checking out right down the street from the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: What I miss is the little extra touch of service. A free bottle of water, a coffee machine in your room, perhaps a welcome card on your pillow. Add to this an very expensive breakfast for $26 per person, or $13 for children, I mean seriously that's just a crazy price. We just ate close by for a more affordable and worthwhile option. The room we stayed in with 2 adults and 2 teens was small. With a semi open bathroom in the room. I mean what's up with that.. Yes you got WiFi, ok the location is great with a subway next door, but that's about it. I just was not very impressed. Several things which unfortunately annoyed me.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel has a good position 3 min from Times Square, but the staff is not friendly really. The room is really small and if you are at the 7th floor on the road side, it is really noisy. I liked the bathroom but the wall hairdryer and the soap attached to the wall are really cheap.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very closed to Time Square, rooms are clean but not so big. The bathroom is fine. Concierge and front desk are not always kind and available. The position is perfect and let you walk in midtown by foot

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband, our teenage daughter and myself stayed at the RIU for a long weekend trip to NYC. We try to visit the city as often as we can. We booked the RIU because we are RIU class members and had received a coupon code for the booking. We have been to two other RIU hotels/resorts but in Mexico. Because we had loved the RIU hospitality during our trips to Mexico, we gave it a shot.The RIU Times Square is fairly new and, therefore, clean and up to date. The staff was polite and efficient. We arrived much earlier than check in time. We had traveled by train and did not want to carry our overnight bags so we figured we'd drop them off at BS, go get some lunch, walk around a bit and get back to RIU at check in time for our room. Well, we were pleasantly surprised when they said that, if we didn't mind not getting a high floor room with a possible view, we could have a room immediately. We don't spend a lot of time in our hotel room when we go away so having a room early was more important then the high floor with a possible view and we took it. As I said before, we visit NYC often and, therefore, know the view well. We were also given free bottled water at check-in.Our room had two double beds pushed together into a king plus a love-seat that opened into a bed. We had a mini fridge and a wall mounted tv. The bathroom was a bit different but so RIU (and if you have visited any other RIU hotels you'll know what I mean!). The shower walls were opaque but, because of the light in the bathroom, the silhouette of the showering person would be very visible from the outside. We've experienced several odd bathrooms designs during our history with RIU so we're no longer surprised. LOLOther than that, decent size room compared to the smaller size rooms typical to NYC. Of course, the RIU is not a bargain priced hotel and, even with a coupon, our rate was not cheap!The lobby of the hotel is very pretty and a bit exotic. There is a bar/lounge on one side of the lobby and a coffee shop on the other. I believe their restaurant is next to the bar but we didn't eat there so I don't have any info on it.Location of RIU Times Square is perfect if you want to visit Times Square, see a Broadway play, etc. We like to walk the city and, the weekend in October when we went, was just gorgeous! We ended up walking up to Central Park and down to Madison Square Garden. We also saw a Broadway show and did a lot of other fun things.All in all, it was a great time and RIU TS was perfect for our visit!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked a room with two queen beds. Even though there were 4 of us in the room, it felt like a big room. The bathroom was also big and the frosted glass door did not bother us as it gave you the needed privacy. The hotel is very modern and clean. It was very easy to check-in and check-out and a quick ride from LaGuardia Airport. The only problem I can find is that there was no coffee-maker in the room. There was a fridge though! Overall, I recommend this hotel. Good value for money.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent 8 days over New Years in New York and used the Riu Plaza Times Square as our base. The hotel was clean and well maintained. The staff were attentive and helpful to all our requests. The hotel is conveniently based close to several of New York's subway lines and one block away from Times Square. This can be a pro or con depending on whether you like crowds - Times Square can be overwhelming at times. Overall a good place to stay in New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: this was my first time staying at this hotel as well as any other riu locations. I was pleasantly surprised by how nice it was. I visited with my family and we had the two bedroom family suite and it was perfect. the kids had their own room and we had out own adult room. It was great.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I've been with my family and the hotel is very well located, just 3 minuts walking to time square. Rooms confortable and kind size beds!! Breakfast was included and its better to include it when you booked it in the travel agency! Its cheaper!! Otherwise you must pay 47$ per day/paxBreakfast is like in Spain, bufet with everything! The personel are friendly and all of then speak spanish!If I'd repeat mybrravel to NY, fir sure I will choose again the Hotel
user_name:
ATPL35
Conil de la Frontera, Spain

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel in the heart of New York: Times Square! The room was beautiful. My favorite thing was the shower, perfect! Is very close to shops, restaurants, discos, pubs and more. I love it! I didn't try breakfast

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for 7 nights. Location was absolutely perfect, easy access to everything you would want and we felt very safe walking around this area at anytime of the day and night. Room was spacious for New York and clean. Would have loved a kettle and coffee but the cafe attached to the hotel is easy to access. Bathroom is enclosed with frosted glass but this wasn't a problem for us. Concierge was not very helpful however it didn't stop us finding out information from other staff in the hotel. We only ate in the restaurant once (breakfast) and it was nothing special. There are so many other options close by that are more affordable so i wouldn't bother with a meal option when booking. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We choose this hotel primarily for location, as its only a block from Times SquareCheck in on the 30th Dec was swift and welcoming. Although I had forgotten about the extra taxes so we had an extra $200 to pay. We were given a room on 26th floor. So had greats views of surrounding areaRoom was huge with a full length window. So awesome viewsWe didn't eat or drink in the hotel so unable to comment Staff all very welcoming and ready to answer any questions Times Square is no more than 3 minute walk awayGrand central possibly a 10 minute walkRockerfeller also a 10 minute walkTwo subway stops just a few minutes walk from hotelGreat little bar on 45th called "Iron bar and grill " loads of beer choice. We had burger there one lunchtime. Good value for what we hadWould definitely consider this hotel for next time we visit NY

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We want here for my wife's birthday at the beginning of December, on checking in the staff where very attentive and made sure we understood everything , the bar area was very nice and all staff very attentive , the room as a very nice size and well maintained during our stay , location of hotel was perfect . The only down side was every morning cueing for breakfast no matter what time we got up there was a huge cue . That said there was loads of nice places within a 5 min walk to eat , if going to NYC I would definitely recommend staying here .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 8 nights and overall it was very good. A few small issues here and there but not major thing/s so it hasn't affected my thoughts that it's above average. Smallish "deluxe" family room for three kids and two adults but hey you get what you can afford. Clean and tidy.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The rooms are nice and modern and clean. Bathrooms nice and shower nice, with maybe a slight leak to the bathroom floor (is this an epidemic or something -- I've been to several hotels in a row, none of which keeps a completely dry bathroom floor when you shower). Anyway, still the room was quite nice, location only like a block and a half from Times Square, near subways. No complaints. Another guest told me that the restaurant here was not so good and to avoid taking breakfast here, which I did avoid -- but that was second hand, as I didn't try it myself. The desk did recommend the La Revista restaurant nearby for lunch. I would not recommend that. Around the block we did go to Nizza for dinner -- very good pastas. I would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We recently stayed overnight at Riu, Times Square.Pluses:location, clean and modern, beautiful lobby with lots of seating, friendly and quick check in, convenient bar and restaurant in hotel, room size was adequate, we stayed in an even number room on the 8th floor and there was no street noise. Quick elevators. Complimentary bottle of water.Negatives: the bathroom has frosted glass walls so there is very little privacy for using the toilet or showering. If you turn the bathroom light on in the middle of the night, the whole room lights up. There was a lot of noise from the hallway. No ice machines or vending machines.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Modern hotel but not a 4 star category. No room service. And 275$ a night is pricey but even worse if at the reception you are told that extra bed won't fit in the room despite I booked for 3 (2 adults + 1 child). Upgraded at 34$ extra a night but the attendant said at checkout will see if the manager will waive this. Today at the checkout nothing was waived. Lesson learned.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is centre to a lot of the attractions. Nice clean rooms, good views if above floor 20. Thought the breakfast was overpriced. Staff always friendly and happy to help. Coffee shop attached was nice and clean.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Best tourist location in New York - Times Square. Hotel was relatively new. The rooms was spaceous and well set out. Disappointed that the was not coffee or kettle in the room. Free wifi made it great to stay in touch with friends and family back home. Hotel room and entire hotel clean and well maintained. Restaurant was reasonable and service was good. Staff were friendly and helpful. Lots of great restaurants nearby and walking distance to lots of attractions including theatres.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is one block from Times Square. We were on 8th floor of 28 floors and could hear no noise from outside except sirens. The room was a reasonable size and very comfortable. The amenities were a restaurant, which we didn't use, gym (ditto) and a 'Grab & Go' cafe which served drinks and the usual sugary snacks, but there is a Pret a Manger across the road which is 8th Avenue. Hundreds of restaurants nearby.The only criticism is that there were no tea/coffee facilities in the room, which means you have to go out for everything

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location! Rooms are extremely small as expected. We didn't have any issues with noise from inside or from outside the hotel while in our room. We did have an issue with the restaurant...on two occasions the servers seemed oblivious when serving bottles of wine. On day one the waitress brought us an open bottle. We told her to get a new one and open it in front of us. The second night we ordered one type of red and she brought us a Rioja. When we questioned it she said it was a Spanish red so what's the difference? We don't like bait and switches when it comes to alcohol....esp at that price.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have stayed in different hotels in NYC but this has been the best rate vs value. The hotel is beautiful and spacious. We stayed at the 28th floor with a great view. Room was a little small for a couple with a kid but otherwise perfect. Btw rate was great for its location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Positives; New, therefore clean, friendly staff, (except for some of the staff at check in), great location (if you want to be in the Times Square area), comfortable beds, bathrooms smart, blackout blinds in bedrooms very effective. Negatives, has a dormitory feel owing to laminate floors, but that did not bother me. If you want and private shower, find a hotel with a different style bathroom, because tha frosted glass wall looks great and let's light in, but it allows others to see you showering (of course it depends on your relationship with others if this really bothers you or not, just wanted to let you know). Good views, and quiet. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have enjoyed a 5 nights holiday at Riu Plaza Times SquareTotally new hotel, a big plus compared with other very old hotels in the areaPerfect location, very comfortable rooms, very complete buffet breakfast.It could not be better !!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent ten days here in December 2016 - myself and two teenagers. Great location... v noisy and right at the heart of Hell's Kitchen - just a stones throw from Times Square. Breakfast was good. Room had two double beds and sofa bed. Big window. Didn't feel squashed. Nice bar area which offered snacks. Friendly staff and really clean.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Recently spent 5 nights here as a family of 5, 3 kids 10, 9 and 8. Location was very good, very much in the heart of Times Square, easy and close to all public transport, restaurants and activities. The hotel had a nice atmosphere when walking into the foyer and check in was smooth and easy. The room was very difficult to spend 5 nights in with that many people. People have said that NYC hotels are small but seriously we had two double beds that were about an inch apart and then had the pull out which was separated by a bedside. The floor space was so minimal and our three suitcases (3 week trip) took up any space we did have. THE BATHROOM!! What a major stuff up that is. The wall is frosted glass and although you cannot see all the details, at night with the light on not too much is left to the imagination. As if it wasn't hard enough sharing one small room with children for 5 nights you couldn't even escape to the bathroom for a bit of privacy. We got around this by showering with the lights off which wasn't ideal. As for the shower itself, that was really nice, roomy and good water pressure with a nice big shower head, although water did leak and wet the floor in the room. On the first night we had a problem with our electricity buzzing very loudly.
