Was annoying enough for us to call down to reception to which they said they would send someone up, nobody ever came but luckily after the first night it didn't do it again. We ate at the restaurant for dinner on one night and found it to be a cheap feed but certainly nothing to call home about, still though, it only cost us about $70 to feed the five of us so we were not complaining. If I was ever return to NYC (which I intend on NEVER doing) I would not come back to this hotel. We choose this place purely based on the fact that anything else in the same price range had sold out so if you have a family and have the options I would recommend not shortlisting this one. However I'm sure it would be ok for a couple or single, actually a couple might really enjoy that bathroom wall ;)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a great location in New York. With it being our first visit we were unsure of where to stay and we booked this hotel only a week before leaving but I was not disappointed. We got the shuttle bus from the airport to Port Authority bus terminal and it was only 4 blocks from here and even with big suitcases it was very easy. Check in went smoothly and the hotel leaves a good first impression. Our room was at a corner of the hotel so our view was really good as we had floor to ceiling windows along two full walls of the room(however if scared of heights you may not enjoy this quite as much). The room is compact but it was what I expected from a hotel in new York so I found this to be alright and it did have a lovely walk in shower, the bathroom did have all round frosted walls so you could see the shadows when in the shower, I never found this a negative however some may find it a bit strange. When leaving the hotel you are only a few blocks from the centre of times square and in the other direction you can walk straight along to the pier where you can pick up the water taxi and various boat rides. We walked everywhere from this hotel and even late at night it was busy and easy enough to walk back to. We never ate in the hotel so I couldn't comment on the restaurant however the coffee in the adjoining coffee shop was very nice each morning. We had some issues with the computers and printers but the staff behind reception did help us to print our boarding passes off for our next flight.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well, what can we say to a new hotel that has been built with a hot needle and where the staff at the reception has no idea of hospitality?! Yes, its new, bathroom give no privacy, breakfast is good/average but the location is the way to go! Just really only steps from Times Square the hotel has a good location. Busses and the subway are in easy reach. Restaurants and shops are just around the corner.Pricewise it is no real good deal for the money. If they only were friendly...;)Ask for high floors and a nice view!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Came here for 2 nights during the week for business.Check-in was dreadful and had problems with the room and was a painful to move.Room are comfy and well equipped and staff are friendly but seemed really incompetent. Gym is waste of time. Not a hotel for a business traveler for so many reasons. Check-out equally as painful, and felt more like a Doubletree experience.Good location but not best experience.Book with caution.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I am very familiar with Riu and use them regularly. This location at Time Square is a fantastic deal and perfect location. The rooms are basic but nice and clean. They just opened so I expect quality to increase.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Right from check in our stay was great. Front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. We were on the 24th floor and the room was very clean, bed was comfy, and a good size. Not huge but for the amount of time we were in it, it was perfect. The location is amazing. Not sure what are the complaints about but we were very happy with everything. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good location, clean room, no bathroom privacy what so ever, no alarm clock or microwave. Also, the staff was very welcoming and professional. The only bad: I payed quite a lot for a suite since our family had a party of 5 (compared to a party of 4...I checked) only to find out it was a pull out couch!!! In the first night at 2am, our fire alarm went off but that was not the end of it, the manager came over the very loud speakers (placed in your individual hotel room and hallway) to explain what was going on not once but for 10 consecutive minutes in 2 languages. I am fine with 1 or 2 times (it was obviously a false alarm) but to repeat oneself for that long was very extreme. I have small kids so once they are up, we are all up!!!!!! The other thing was that I tried using the concierge 3 times, and the line was ridiculously long. I would have thought for at least this time of the year, being so busy, there would have been at least 2 people helping. Each time a I tried asking the bell boy or even the front desk when they were not busy for simple questions as where to eat, they of course referred me to the very long line of the concierge. I am not sure what my hotel resort fee was used for since I could never use the concierge or no coffee in the room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a suite which gave us access to the lounge. Having a child this was very great! We also loved the location, very central and walking distance to Times Square. The only bad experience we had was that our room was couple of time in a row not done after a whole day being out. Other than that very friendly staff, and again good location for the value!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Visited New York for 2 days and wanted a hotel in a central location so that we didn't need to travel much to the main attractions. This hotel was just what we were looking for being in Times Square and a short walk from Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Empire State Building etc. The rooms were spotless and had fantastic views and came equipped with a huge TV and small fridge. The staff were very helpful and arranged a taxi back to the airport for us. In the lobby area there was a 'grab and go' café selling coffee, cakes, sandwiches etc and there was also a beautiful restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner although the prices were a little steep for breakfast! The food was good and handy if you didn't want to bother going out. We found some excellent restaurants with plenty of choice turning right out of the hotel down 46th St. If we were to return to NY would definitely return to the Riu.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for one night. The hotel lobby is very modern and they are constantly cleaning it. The hotel staff is wonderful. We were able to check in at 11:30 because the room was ready which is a great. The room is adorable, nothing fancy, very clean. People complained about the size, this is New York, a hotel not an apartment, just a place to lay your head. They also complained about the bathroom, you can't see thru the frosty panes, not sure what they are talking about, must have x-ray vision. There is a fridge is the room, TV placed nice. No radio, who cares I am sure you all have cell phones with the time on them or a watch. We had the lunch special for $12.50, salad, chicken, rice and beans and ice cream, it was very good. The Grab and Go had good coffee and very nice choices for a light snack. My only complaint and no fault of the hotel was that we faced 8th avenue and were right across from The Copa Cabana, did not get to sleep until 4AM because even being on the 20th floor, we could hear the music and DJ and Ricky Ricardo he was not (lol) Only you baby boomers would know what I am talking about. I would definately come back because I really loved the hotel

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked this for one Sat night in Dec so knew it would be crowded, etc. Let's start with the good. The bellmen were great, taking our bags because our rooms weren't ready and getting them and a taxi when we were ready to leave. Could not have asked for better! Lobby bathrooms were nice and rain shower was nice. The price was right, paying $299 for a king room of normal NYC size in high Dec time. And location is great. So you wonder what's wrong. It was so hot in our room, 76 degrees it said, and we could not do a thing to lower it. People also mention the see through bathroom so glad I was with my husband, but we also didn't like the sliding door to close it off as you can hear everything in the bathroom. No privacy is so true. Reminds me of the W Hotel in Scottsdale.Other basics were missing. There wasn't a lighted clock so when you wake up in the middle of the night because it so hot with no covers on, you can't see a time. I know, look at your phone but I don't keep it next to me. Also, there was a flashing white light at the ceiling, part of an alarm I am sure, but once you see it's there, it was annoying. Lastly, there is no coffeemaker. And worst of all, the grab and go doesn't open till 7am. So when you are wide awake because it is so hot, you are stuck leaving the hotel in search of something like coffee or tea. Crazy!! Lastly, there wasn't nearly enough room for people to sit in the lobby area and bags were overflowing the check area. My last complaint was the covers on the throw pillows and the bed throws are polyester and though the hotel is pretty new, they are feel awful from piling. Yucky!Bottom line, there are better places to stay in NYC for similar money if booked early so I don't expect to go back again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Thank you to the staff for their attention and help. At check-in, none of our rooms were ready but they were flexible and able to move us right away so we could be ready for our event that night. The rooms are all seemingly brand new, but very small and tight (I'm sure to be expected in NYC). The room was very clean, nice bathroom where everything inside looked brand new.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Planned trip for eight of us. Got a deal online plus if you are a RIU member, you get another 10℅. Breakfast absolutely the best with fantastic service. We did have a small problem with room not ready since they had no system to let you know but the manager personally handled it so all is good. I did see a concern about the room with privacy since bathroom is enclosed with frosted glass but seriously..if you are sleeping with someone or alone.. I'm confused. Bottom line. Location, location. Location.Great value, excellent service especially in New York City. Look for the online deals and register as RIU member before booking to get additional 10%!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well known hotels were tooo expensive when I searched online. I had not heard of this hotel and just took a chance that we would not be stuck with a crummy hotel like on our last visit. WOW!!! Was I pleasantly surprised! YES by all means!! My personal New York hotel forever!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 1 night with my 10 year old daughter as our trip was shorter than booked originally. While the hotel staff couldn't change the dates to move the night we lost, (as was booked through Hotwire) they went out of their way to do other things. We got a room on the top floor 3016, the view was great and there was no street noise or any disturbance. Room was compact but really modern and tasteful. Great floor to ceiling Windows and lovely bathroom. What made this hotel was the staff! They are great and Angel on check -in particularly helpful thank you. They also let us check out late and u was so appreciative. There's a lovely coffee shop on ground floor and you can get a beautiful cup of coffee or mocha etc and delicious pastries. Cleanliness was perfect and location was literally a straight walk across to Times Square, a straight walk north to Central Park or south to penn station. Will definately stay again. Thank you so much to all at the Riu plaza Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Never heard of this hotel before, needed a last minute NYC booking, and glad I went for it. Location was outstanding. Everything was shining clean, as if the place launched yesterday. Downsides were a long wait at check-in and that the room was on the small side. Was fine for me as a single traveller, would be ok with my spouse too but maybe less for those in need of space.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Place was fantastic but room was slightly small (I'd imagine there isn't much room in New York generally however) and had everything we needed except for washing facilities. Everything was within walking distance (such as laundromats and train station) and very close to time square. Downstairs cafe is great for a quick breakfast but gets very busy very quickly. Staff were friendly and accommodating and made sure that we had everything we needed. Apparently, it is pricey, we were lucky enough to get a discounted price due to it being so new. A/C is very loud however if kept on during the night.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu has a great European vibe, and was beautiful decorated for the holidays.Nice size room for New York hotel; bathroom had a huge walk-in shower with frosted back wall. Having stayed in numerous Times Square hotels, it was nice to have a sit down restaurant as well as carry-out café.
user_name:
Steve B
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, easy walk to many attractions. Hotel itself was a disappointment. Foyer cold as double door does not work as airlock as it should. Room extremely small. No mini-bar or coffee or tea making facilities. No place to put cases except for on the couch. Very poor thought put into comfort of guests. Frosted glass wall in bathroom that gives you no privacy at all, so you need to have lights turned off to use bathroom. Don't understand why anyone would do that and install frosted glass.. No towel rails. Absolutely no view - except for fire stairs on buildings close by and brick walls and tiled courtyard- very disappointing especially after traveling from Australia. Horrible polyester blanked that to the touch make your skin crawl. Hole in sheet. Though bed was comfy. Nice coffee shop at entrance. Would I stay there again, maybe as it is such a convenient location. Need $1000 deposit on check in.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu Plaza is a wonderful hotel. Just two blocks from Time Square. Walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Bryant Park, and Central Park. $20 taxi ride to 9/11 Ground Zero area. Food in bar was great. Rooms are extremely clean and modern. Only complaint: no drawer space! We had one drawer between the beds. Closet was nice size and we just lived out of our suitcases since we were only there two nights. I will be booking this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is in a great location. Bedrooms are small and you cannot turn up the heat and as such in cold weather the rooms are cold and there is not enough bedding on the beds to keep warm. Don't expect to dry your hair with the hair dryer as soon as it gets warm it cuts out.Eat one in the restaurant at lunch time, the food was Luke warm and had to be sent back. Restaurant staff too laid back back, took 20 mins for drink order to arrive and that is after reminding the staff for it.Would not stay here again which is a shame as have stayed in other RIU hotels in Gran Canaria and these were great.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I spent the whole month of October and another 30 days between November and December 2016 at this hotel. In general, the whole staff is very eficiente, polite and warm welcoming. However, there is a very unfortunate point about the place.Every day, in end of the afternoon, a supervisor knocks at every room to check whether the room has been clean and everything is OK. However, this is how they do it. The person knocks on your door once. One second later, he or she knocks a second time. Even if you say loudly that you will open the door in just a moment, the supervisor simply enters your room. It takes few seconds. Most times it happened, I was at the desk working on my laptop and, at the first knock, got up from the chair and sprang to the door saying I was going to open. I didn't work. They opened the door before me every single time.The only way for them not to do it is this. Around 4 PM, hang the "Do not disturb" sign on your knob. However, it is plain ridiculous that you, the guest, must remember at all costs to put a sign on your door at 4:00 PM every single day not to have your room invaded. Otherwise, you may be caught naked or in whatever intimate circumstances. Knocking at someone's door requires minimum respect and common sense. It's not a matter of sophistication, the problem has to do with minimun politeness As for other aspects, I have no complaint. Actually, the staff deserve compliments for their very good work. But the flaw I described above is so outrageous and so systematic that it deeply compromised my enjoying my stay.P.S: I complained about the problem, but it simply went on. Hugo Otávio Tavares VilelaFederal JudgeBrazil.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is new so it is beautiful but it didn't have some basic things. First off they don't tell you at check in that you have to put your room key in this thing on the wall to make the electricity work in the room (kind of an important detail at check in). Second, they were missing basic amenities in the room. We didn't have a coffee maker or a microwave but it did have a fridge, kinda strange to me. Guess we should have made sure when we made the reservation. All in all the staff was friendly and the hotel was beautiful. Within walking distance to a lot so that was great!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu during the first week of December. The location is fantastic-- easy access to the subway and Times Square. Rooms are typical of NYC but was clean and had a great view. We had an issue with a leak in our room that was resolved by the staff so that we could get back to our schedule. We would definitely stay again in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We celebrated our first Thanksgiving in the restaurant at this hotel. We feared that it would be difficult to find anywhere to eat that day since we had not pre-booked. However, we saw the sign in the window which offered a Thanksgiving three course meal with a complimentary bottle of wine per table at $30 each. The meal was superb and just what we wanted, I don't normally take pictures of our food but could not resist this since it was the first Thanksgiving meal we had ever had. Our experience was so good we returned the next night for our evening meal...excellent! We did not stay at this hotel but would certainly consider it next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has a great location near Times Square. Our room was on the 6th floor and wow, how noisy is New York. Over looked the main road and had constant horn blowing and sirens all night. This is just New York so if you do stay then ask for a higher floor room.The room was ok, clean and modern. Bathroom was a bit odd with a glass door and screen ( no privacy there)Was expensive, over $400 a night for a room with no coffee facilities.Would recommend just for the location and if your happy to be able to see your room mate on the toilet through the gap in the glass door then this hotel is for you.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during our honeymoon in USA.The hotel is brand new, at the time when our agency booked it it was still closed for renewing...Of course, customer experience takes terrific advantage from hotel "freshness": the hall is magnificient and rooms are comfortable, clean, modern. Bathroom is very kind, with a stained glass wall as separator from bedroom: very nice solution.Receptionists have been very kind and helpful: they also provided us their whishes for our marriage, with a chocolate box!Hotel position is definitely good: 2 minutes walk from Times Square, several subway stations options in few minutes of walk. From price point of view, I cannot judge since it was "all included" in our honeymoon package: I guess it is not cheap, but by giving a look to prices available on the net I would say it is worth the money you spend to stay in it.Breakfast is expensive, like in every other hotel in NY and in USA in general. If you move around, you can easily find diners where you can have breakfast with half the price (around 10-15$ instead of hotel request of 24 bucks).In front of the hotel, there's also a Pret à manger where you can have a more European breakfast (coffee, croissant, something else) for less than 8$.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu is a lovely new hotel only 5 minutes walk to Times Square and the nearest subway station. The Fashion restaurant is a lovely relaxing area away from the hustle of New York, the prices are great and the food well worth it. There are computers available for use in the lobby area and lots of seating to enjoy people watching.our room was small however for New York this is normal. The double glazing kept out the majority of the street noise and floor to ceiling windows make for a great view. The bathroom shower was fab, very spacious. Check in and check out was very quick and easy and the resort fee of $13 per night is reasonable. Lots of taxis available outside and they have a fixed rate to JFK airport of $52 plus toll and of course a tip for your driver (very brave to drive i n N YC). All in all a very good stay although a bedroom clock would have made it excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: There are so many good and great hotels in the Times Square area, there is no excuse to stay here. This is a brand new hotel, but the attraction ends there. The average hotel sleeping area is 12' by 18'. This hotel sleeping area is 10' x 10'!!! It's too small to function - yet I paid more than $400 per night - more than other very good area hotels I've stayed at like the Millennium, Night, Hampton, and Edison. This is primarily a vacation hotel, where you stay several nights. The problems are there is only one (very) small chair, like a doctors office chair, and room for only ONE suitcase. If you are a couple or family with even two bags - fuhgeddabouddit, you'll have to walk over them or you won't fit! It doesn't have to be that way. The room is about the size of a ocean liner cabin, and they have plenty of storage room. Other problems we had were the AC/heat didn't work. No matter we're set it, it never moved off 75 degrees F., and the TV reception looked like the 1950's. Also, one of the floor tiles is pulling up, creating a tripping hazard. The staff was nice, but it's back to the drawing board on this one, Guys.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Not easy to match a cutting-edge design, at some kind of urban boutique hotel, comfort and reasonable price at just one minute from Times Square. Nice environment for breakfast and quick service at the front desk.One of the best hotel companies in Spain, with hotels at different markets all over America. Enhorabuena, espero volver.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Plaza is a new hotel that is literally a block away from the area of Times Square. It offers a great lobby, a restaurant, nice rooms, and valet parking. The rooms were clean and modern (new). During my stay the hotel was quite busy and was sold out the next night. Its very popular and many families were staying there. Walking out from the hotel one can numerous restaurants, bars, and shops. The subway was not too far away as well. Plus it was in a fairly nice area without hustlers or other characters found at certain other hotels in Times Square. The hotel was quite a pleasant surprise and is well worth checking out.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: 46th Street/ 8th Avenue.... this location could not have been any better..... block off Times Square, close your window and its sound proof, but also close enough to BE THERE!Modern/ Chic/ Ultra cool rooms.... cracked up laughing though as I was travelling with my brother the bathroom is separated by a frosted window - shadow see through.... all good!Laundry just around the corner, also 9th avenue gives you a fell of leaving the city to a different side of New York.....Used the Gym after too many pizzas and pretzels.... fantastic team there, Recommending this place to everyone.... scored a great rate too....FANTASTIC nights sleep!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed 9th November for 2 nightsThe location of this hotel is ideal, just one block away from the madness of times square. Shops, restuarants and bars surround the streets nearby. The decor of the hotel was modern and comforting, a difficult combo to master. The rooms were well kept, the unique and modern bathroom gave us a good laugh. The mini fridge for our own products was a blessing in disguise. Friendly staff across the board. The beds gave us the best night sleep in New York City.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Plaza Times Square for 8 nights. The hotel is in a GREAT location and it was very clean and modern. Actually had no complaints at all, the hotel staff were very helpful when I needed them. I am a travel agent and will recommend everyone to stay here when they are in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is ok. Enough has been said about the location, but it really is a great one: just far enough removed from Times Square yet close enough to have the benefit of a TON of restaurants around you. Really, anything you could want to eat from fast food to high end stuff is nearby, which is awesome. Plus plenty of bars and watering holes, not to mention coffee shops and everything in between. And all the theaters! Positives of the room include that it is new and has floor to ceiling windows. I'm not sure if there is truly a bad view in the place. I was on the 9th floor, a relatively low floor, and it was still a nice view. I love that there is no carpet in the rooms: carpet is gross in hotels. Also the in room chair and sleeper sofa were of a vinyl type material: much easier to clean than cloth. Usually I will not sit on chairs or couches in a hotel room. The room was also well sized. I hate it when people say "big for NYC standards" but it really was; I had a "family room" with two doubles pushed together and a sofa sleeper and it would have been a decent sized room anywhere. I definitely did not feel cramped in the least. I have been in much smaller rooms. Not sure what the size is of their other room types though. Also had a generously sized mini fridge. Wifi was probably the best I've had in a hotel, very strong and fast signal. That being said, unfortunately there were a few cleanliness issues with the room. There were quite a few stray hairs that were not mine. I get that it's hard for housekeeping to get every last piece of hair cleaned up, but there was hair on the decorative pillows and little bedspread thing (gross). Hairs in the bathroom and a big wad of hair near the bathroom sliding door. The bedding is all white, which is only nice if it is kept up scrupulously. It was not in my room, the bed skirt had a stain on it, and it was hard to ignore. Gross again. And the aforesaid awesome windows had finger and hand prints.....all over them. I am forgiving of a thing or two as cleaning rooms is hard, but these were obvious, glaring things that were not addressed. I am not usually someone who whines about the lack of a coffee maker in the room but I did find myself wishing there were either a coffee maker, or at least room service to get coffee. Instead, you have no choice but to venture out of the room to get coffee. Also, comments about the lack of privacy in the bathrooms are absolutely true. I was alone so it didn't matter, but beware: the bathrooms leave nothing to the imagination. Whoever else is in the room will be able to hear and probably see whatever is going on in there. I stayed at a Riu property in the Dominican Republic and it was the same type of thing. Overall, you could do a lot worse but I'd probably only stay here again if I could find a deal on the room, like I did this time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Went to NYC on a girls trip. We needed a 2 room suite to accommodate our needs. Three ladies on a world wind adventure. We wanted to be close to Time Square and the subway. This hotel has the best location of all the places I've stayed in NYC. There are so many good restaurants close. Shopping, subway and of course Time Square. We even walked to see two plays, no need to take subway or taxi. The check-in wasn't the greatest.. I specifically asked to lady at the front desk if there was anything I should know about the hotel, any amenities that would make our stay better. Since we booked a suite I thought the hotel might offer something for suite guest. I was told about the gym and there restaurant & grab & go Deli. Nothing extra for suite guest. I found out later if you book a suite there is a concierge room on the 26th floor . We were told it opened at 7:00 AM, it didn't open until 8:00. I asked what to expect, we were told coffee and maybe a Danish, that's it. We were surprise to find a lot more, pastries, meat & chesses, fresh fruit & yogurt. In the evening there was wine & red wine, plus more food.  Our room wasn't ready when we arrived so we left our luggage with the hotel, which worked beautifully. We came back before dinner, picked up our luggage & room key. That's when I found out from a different girl that we could go to the 26th floor and use our room key to get into the concierge room for suite guest. If you arrive and there is a long line at check in, leave your luggage and go explore. Don't waste your time standing in line. Overall our stay at the hotel was nice, they have somethings to work out, but, the location alone would make me stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Came for some work in NYC. This hotel is just a block from Times Square so it's central for work and some leisure as wellRooms are not that big but the amenities are good Please make sure you get confirmation for room type. I was booked for a queen bed but changed it to a twin. Their system couldn't find my request and was duly charged "an upgrade" for the twin but it was just the same room type and size as the queen.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Riu is located 2 blocks off of Times Square. It has modern, simple design interior and rooms. Upon check-in the staff was very friendly. We arrived early so we dropped our bags off at the bellman's desk--again friendly. Our room was very clean. Keeping with the modern feel it was sparse but that was ok because it didn't feel cluttered. Problem was not a lot of counter space so an extra luggage rack would have been helpful. Beds were very comfortable. We were on 14th floor and our room was very warm even though we had temp. control in room. We opened window a crack and it cooled room down, but a night the noise level was higher. second night we closed all the curtains and this seemed to help with the noise. The bathroom was clean and spacious for New York. They provided plenty of customary toiletries --we always seem to run out with a family. In addition the bath towels were soft and big. One thing I didn't like was the shared frosted glass "wall" between the shower and bedroom. Though frosted I felt a little lack of privacy while in shower. Beware the hotel charges a facility fee. It covers wi-fi, luggage storage, etc. Was not aware of this when we booked. Just be aware when comparing hotel and prices. Maybe all NY hotels charge this.We would definitely stay again. Clean, clean rooms, friendly staff, great location. Did not eat at any of their eateries on site.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is fairly new, very modern...not our style but it was an overnight stay.Clean room, small but NY rooms are. Very good price. Right in the heart of the theater district, many good restaurants nearby. Check in staff not too friendly but helpful. Very helpful holding our luggage before the room was ready and after we checked out. Overall a good experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location is one block away from Times Square, Cannot ask for more.Beds were comfortable. Room was spotless but small, and showers are not all that private. Not appropriate for families.Staff was accommodating and went out of their way to assist us.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well designed with the usual small NY rooms. The facility charge is a rip off - effectively paying for room wi fi access, room safe and luggage storage post signing out. Front desk inefficient - had to phone down on two occasions and both times it took 3 calls to get action taken.Due to illness we had to book an extra night. Had to pay for a more expensive room despite remaining in the room we had. The excuse? Couldn't manipulate the computer system yet later they in fact did so for other purposes. Still had to pay approximately $150 more for the night than the average room cost per night for the previous part of our stay.Leaves a bad taste despite the friendliness of the general staff - mind you bar and restaurant service was pretty slow and sloppy as well - they'd have been sacked in standard NY restaurant

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Brand new hotel with all the important facilities - gym, wifi (stable and fast), free computers & printer for general use, awesome location, helpful staff. Pay attention - ask for high floor for a quite room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and you can't beat the location for being on the doorstep of Times Square.Yes the rooms are small but you're staying in a premium location and they have all the mod cons you need, it's comfortable and it's clean.Reception staff were really helpful (tho lady on concierge was lacking a smile).I met some family also staying in NY for a couple of nights at the Row Hotel around the corner and there was absolutely no comparison - I was very happy at the Rui ... enough said!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is well located for access to Times Square and most anything in NYC and it definitely has a new and clean feel to it. The hallways feel a bit clinical like being in a hospital, but the rooms themselves are nice and modern. While the $12 "facility fee" isn't a significant amount of money, it is tacky to charge something that includes a bottle of water, yet we had no such bottle of water in our room. Upon asking the front desk about this they were rather frigid and seemed suspicious that maybe we were trying to scheme them for this very valuable bottle of water. Upon checkout we decided to use the luggage service (also included in the facility fee), but were advised by the man running the service that they were very overloaded with luggage and if we decided to use it we should allow at least 30 minutes when we return for him to find our bags. Given we were only leaving our bags for 30-45 minutes while we grabbed some lunch that was clearly not a reasonable service. Probably the best solution for this hotel is to not charge a sneaky fee if you aren't going to provide the services promised as part of it. While I won't ever stay here again it is a fine hotel room if you can get it at a discounted price.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location and looks great but very hard to get a good nights sleep. We could hear other guests quite clearly as they made their way up and down the corridor in the early hours of the morning. I could hear the shower and toilet in the room next door. Some of the staff were very nice but several didn't even go through the motions of feigning interest in my pesky tourist requests.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza Times Square for 3 nights in November 2016. This was not our first time in New York but we decided to stay at this hotel due to the fact that we have previously stayed at a Riu Hotel and had a good experience.Check in was very quick and the staff at reception were helpful and respectful. Our room was lovely - very modern and definitely a fair size for a 'city' hotel room - we were very pleased with this. Had a room on the 18th floor which kept the inevitable noise from Times Square to a minimum... we were both able to get good nights sleep.Bathroom was very clean and tidy - no bath facilities in our room but this did not bother us.In terms of the amenities in the room - there was a (empty) mini fridge that was perfect for us as we were able to chill food (mostly chocolate!!) and drinks that we had bought throughout our days in the city. However, we were both very disappointed that there was no hot drink making facility in the room - no coffee machine which we both thought would have finished off the room. We know that there are NUMEROUS places to purchase coffee in NYC but sometimes, all you need is a cuppa in bed before you start your day off! Nevertheless, this hotel was a great hotel and in perfect location for all the main sites in New York City. Of note - it was my birthday the weekend before we arrived and as a treat, the hotel left a small complimentary box of chocolates as a gift. A very thoughtful gift that was very much appreciated - thank you!Would definitely return to this hotel - its reasonably priced and great location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel is good. Everything new and clean. The elevators are fast and the highest floors have a great view of the city. But If you don't like noisy hotels, I recommed choosing another hotel, because the hallways are very noisy and you can hear everything what is going on in there when you are inside your room. During my stay I also have some very noisy neighbors that stay talking loud with high music until late hours, and it was possible to hear everything from inside my room and also smell the tobacco they are consuming inside their supposed no smoking room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu plaza for 3 nights in October 2016 in a family deluxe room. The room was fine as a base for 2 adults and 4 children (11,9,7 and 6) and we had no issues with the shower (as in some other reviews). Overall the hotel was clean and comfortable. The location was great- just minutes away from the subway and from Times Square. The Rockefeller centre and Central Park are within walking distance (15-20 mins).

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4nights.We were given a room on the top floor (28th floor) it had great views of the city.The location was perfect! Only a couple of minutes walk to Times Square, could also walk to the Rockefeller Centre and 5th Ave from where we were based.The room was a decent size and had a good sized wardrobe. The bathroom was clean but the shower did leak if the water was pointed towards the door as there were gaps.Overall had a lovely stay here and the staff were friendly and helpfulWould definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is walking distance to Times Square, which is about its only virtue. The décor is meant to be modern, but we found it a little strange. It has noisy, uncarpeted hallways that made sleeping a bit difficult, and the staff was not very helpful. There seemed to be a lot of confusion about who to pay for our overnight parking.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location - PRIME! We walked everywhere. Fabulous if you're in town to see some shows.Room - 27th floor. The most amazing unobstructed views of Manhattan I've experienced. Modern, chic, bed was very comfortable. Service - No frills. You will find yourself waiting in line for something while multiple employees have nothing to do yet won't help where it is needed. While waiting in line to get our bags we heard many other stories of bad service from others in the line. Overall: If you're in Manhattan to see some shows and have a comfy, chic place to rest your head...I would recommend it! I don't think I would stay again as I'd try and find another similar in fashion with the kind of service that makes you feel happy you gave them your money.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a family deluxe room which was anything but. Whilst this hotel is now shiny and new give it 12 months and it will be a pretty ugly sight. Unsurprisingly given the customer service we experienced during our stay I haven't received a reply from the hotel in regards to our lost property enquiry in the days following our stay. Many better accommodation options in the same area of town. brendan@mindhealthcare.com.au

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is at a great location . very clean .friendly staff and was a great place to stay for our 5 nights in New York would stay there again . The people at the desk were so helpful with where to eat and the bell boy took such good care of our luggage and my camera I was impressed.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a new hotel wing great views. We had a room on the 20 th floor of 28. Looking towards times square. Clean, tidy, great staff throughout, the bell boys were fantastic and bent over backwards to ensure you got what you needed. We will re book here for our next trip to the big apple. Can't fault anything........

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Awful experience, stay away. Hotel does not provide service it is supposed to. There is no privacy, you will have people walking into your room, first with water, minibar service, then room service, even though when you don't open the door and have no disturb sign. You won't able to sleep, the glass wall for city view is not sound proof, so you will basically feel like you are outside sleeping somewhere on 8th avenue. Bathroom has glass walls, so if you have private needs and have someone staying with you, they can see you, or they will wake you up, when you turn on the light. For 300 I paid, I got back a terrible sleepless night.
user_name:
Kkole3
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed at Riu Plaza for 4 nites in junior suite on 26th floor. Fantastic accommodation, which was even better when realising you had access to a suite with complimentary breakfast, further treats throughout the day and great choice of drinks! Loved this!!!!The only down side to my stay( this also happened on my last riu trip to Montego Bay) is I'm a gold card member, and will become a diamond member after this stay ends today is I have never received a gift as stated for being a gold member! I will follow this up via email once I'm home despite raising it with reception staff.All in all 5 out of 5 for all staff and accommodation! I will not deduct for lack of a gift but a third time I will!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Boyfriend and I spent one night in a King Deluxe Room. As is the case in 99% of the NYC hotel rooms, the room was not spacious. But we had a very comfortable bed with excellent bed linens and pillows. The room had floor to ceiling windows which gave us great views of the NYC skyline. Bathroom had a good layout with nice fluffy towels. We arrived early so we checked our bags with the doorman. Definitely plan to stay here again. Convenient to Time Square, the subway, and some very nice restaurants. Staff was very friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Convenient and nice hotel. Check-in was super fast. Our room was tiny (as is everything else in NYC). It was 6 of us so we had 2 double beds and a sofa sleeper. The 2 beds were pushed together upon arrival. Seemed odd but all the furniture wouldn't have fit otherwise. The beds were comfortable, however the sofa sleeper was horrible. We couldn't use the mini fridge if the sofa bed was out. The shower wall was a bit strange. The glass wall was frosted and if you turned on the bathroom light, you could see the persons reflection. Not something I needed my son to see while sharing the room with friends. The housekeeper was very nice, but aside from that, other staff members did not speak to us. Hotel was close and convenient to everything. Overall it was a great stay and aside from the sofa bed and glass shower wall, everything was great.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved the location and price. Very nice décor from the moment you step in the lobby. As with most New York city hotels, the rooms are on the small side but very comfortable, clean, and friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a wonder. The hotel is just 3 blocks from Time Square. Typical downtown hotel. Room with 2 queen beds is small with European feel. Beds are high and fluffy. Wonderful after trudging thru the city all day. I stayed in a suite on the 28th floor. Splendid views of the night lights in the city. This was a 1 bedroom suite. Very spacious with very large bathroom including soaking tub. Daily complimentary breakfast. Very tasty with wide choice of eats, from rolls to eggs to fruit to breads.Staff very attentive and friendly. Always prompt serve to any request you might have. Only downer was no ice machines anywhere. Had to go to the bar on the main floor to request ice. Also no coffee makers in the room. The RIU is a refurbished property. Very bright and lovely.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: While there's no doubting the location of this hotel is great, a few events in the 5 days we stayed here left a bit of a sour taste. The check in clerk was a bit 'frosty' rather than welcoming after a transatlantic flight. We were a little early for check in but were promised an email (?) to let us know when our room was ready. Nothing heard & on our return at 3:45pm found the room was ready but simply hadn't kept the promise.Aside from others already mentioning the odd shower privacy arrangement (not a problem in our case) the room on the 16th floor was good & we had a nice city view - noise was OK from the street at night. Other guests have noted the leaky showers which we 'plugged' with a towel. An unexplained pool of water appeared by the front door after we had showered & can only assume it originated from the air con (which ceased to work after our first night, leaving the room quite warm but tolerable - it is November!).The lack of the promised bottle of water in the room was again minor but having left a note for the maid for 2 days asking for it, only for it to be ignored, was annoying -front desk provided it on asking.On a couple of occasions, we did not get a full set of towels - again minor inconvenience but accumulative in my overall opinion of the hotel, considering it worked out at £300 per night to stay there.On checking out, there was a disparity in the total bill from what we were expecting, due in part to this 'use of gym' & 'free' wi-fi package that seems to be compulsory but what annoyed me more was that the card we had used at check in seemingly had $1900 earmarked and we were then told it wasn't acceptable Further, it would take up to a week to have the 'earmark' removed! I paid without problem using a different card - very odd - & was left wondering whether I'd get charged the room bill on both cards.Collecting our cases from storage early afternoon, the friendly bellhop (?) offered to get us a car for $73, all in (ie including tip & tolls), which was only a very little difference to what we paid on the way in. I checked with him a couple of times that it was all inclusive. On driving to the airport in a very nice sedan, the driver asked how much we were told it would be & on telling her she said that didn't include a tip. I suggested she took it up with the named bellhop. We also took a longer than usual route through areas that avoided the tolls so something ain't quite right there.Next time we're in NYC we'll be looking elsewhere to stay

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: So glad I chose this hotel . It is new , clean,modern and the staff is very friendly. Perfect location if you came to New York to see plays: half a block to Hamilton, the Great Comet, Kinky boots, Get on your feet and more. Lots of great restaurants nearby. Room was small but great views and can see the water. We were on the 27th floor and we heard no noise from either the street or other rooms-a first for NYC. I understand how frosted glass separating the bathroom from bedroom may make sense on a tropical vacation but is a design flaw here. You can see the shadow when someone is showering and the bathroom light reflects into the bedroom . Be sure you are comfortable with your travel companion! I would definitely stay here again and felt it was a good value.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I visted NYC for just one night to see a show on Broadway. This very which sparkling hotel is situated at the corner of 46th and 8th Avenue -- a perfect spot away from Times Square but only one black away. The hotel has very modern interiors, a fashionable lobby and courtyard, as well as a nice restaurant. I highly recommend this new hotel in Times Sq. if traveling to NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Highly recommend the hotel. We had a lovely stay in a great room with superb washing facilities. The towels were changed on a daily basis and all the room always looked great on every occasion. We used the hotel restaurant on a few occasions and found the food nice with a slightly limited selection. My only real negative point was on checking out to find we were being charged $12 per day for the use of the gym and internet. We were charged an extra $78 for something we thought had all been paid for prior to our stay. On arrival, a deposit charge of $200 was taken from a card provided, again, we were not aware that this had been deducted. Maybe, the staff could have made this clear on checking-in. Overall, we had a lovely stay and would most defiantly look to stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: RIU Plaza New York Times Square is in perfect walking distance to many of the Broadway Theaters and minutes to Times Square! The hotel is very clean and rooms have a very modern appeal. If you prefer lots of space during your stay, then maybe try a suite. We had the King bed and the room was small.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: You can't find a newer hotel in a better location for the price (we paid $356 a night for two double beds and a sofa sleeper-room 1203 with no good view). The room was very clean & larger than most NYC rooms, but the beds were pushed together with maybe a 4 inch space in between to get the space for the sofa sleeper (was like sleeping on springs). There was a nice selection of toiletries and plenty of towels/wash cloths in the room. Whoever came up with the bathroom design should be fired! You can see the silhouette of whoever is showering or sitting on the Lou while laying on the beds or standing by the closet. AND if someone has a tummy ache you can smell it as there is no vent and the door slides vs closing!!The rooms are advertised to have complimentary bottled water, but ours didn't and after our third request for it to be brought up in a two day span we gave up! There is a small fridge, but no coffee maker in the room. If you want ice you have to go get it from the bar downstairs and there's no room service; fortunately most restaurants deliver with a min $15 purchase. There's also a McDonalds, Duane Reade (like Walgreens), and Starbucks nearby. There's a little shop downstairs with snacks, pastries, coffee (it was much too strong for our taste), and drinks. The Fashion Restaurant is connected to the hotel with sub par food and really slow service (there were only two other tables and it took 30 min to get our food). We ordered the nachos (expect what you would get at a sporting event) and a Mediterranean salad (salad content good dressing not so much). A side note, its less expensive to take an Uber vs a cab to/from the airport. The staff was friendly at check in and check out. I would rate this hotel a 3.5 but will give it a 4 since that's not an option.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is top notch. New, clean, and they are so helpful to first time New Yorkers. T he location was fantastic and could walk to many venues. We asked for a room with a view and got just that. The porters we helpful with getting us transportation and giving us information. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed here for my birthday weekend and chose it for the location - right in Times Square and in walking distance to the Hammerstein Ballroom where we were seeing a concert. The room was a little small but was clean and the decor pretty and modern. The staff left me some chocolates and a card for my birthday which was a nice little surprise! The only thing we did not like was that the shower had a frosted window to the main room, so you could see the person's shadow as they were showering. A little awkward when you're staying in a room with your friends. Otherwise, really nice hotel and we had a great time!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Cramped, austere rooms without even basic amenities at $600 per night? I don't think so. No bottle opener? Go down to the restaurant with the bottle and they will open it for you, you say? No coffee maker, the bottles of water weren't replaced daily. The bathroom had no walls! Just a frosted glass partition so at night when someone uses the bathroom it's like a solar eclipse!On the plus side it was quiet and the staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Overall this hotel is a good spot to stay in as it was within walking distance from most place we wanted to see on our trip to New York. Staff was very helpful though as much as it was nice to be check on to see if the room was ok or after the cleaner had been, it did wear on us after the forth time. Room wasn't overall that big but the bathroom was lovely.Only problem we found was that there was a stain looked like coffee had been spilled outside our room and this stay there from the Monday till we checked out on the Saturday. Check in and check out was easy and painless. Our baggage was stored fine while we waited for the transfer back to the airport. Curtains in the room really helped when trying to sleep in New York, unfortunately you can still hear outside noise easily but that's just one of the downsides with being in the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The rooms at this hotel are extremely small and bare. The only warmth in the room was the actual temperature. They don't supply air conditioning in non summer months. Temp in room was 77 Fahrenheit . We opened the window to hear the noise from the Coppacabana club until 4am and non stop sirens from the firehouse a block away. To top it off the bed covering was dirty and was just wiped off not changed. All of this aggravation for over $360.00 per night. No monetary compensation was offered by management! Do not stay here!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had an amazing stay at Riu Plaza! Hotel is modern , stylish and very clean. Entrance and reception area is stunning, staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. Rooms are also modern and clean, great view of Hudson river from our room on 18th floor! Only feedback was that we could have done with more wardrobe space in view of 2 adults and 2 teenagers sharing the same room, otherwise great location, would stay again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very well located hotel, just steps from Times Square, and near the subway. The rooms are very small: if you're staying a long time in NYC, you'll have problems with space to accommodate your luggage. Nevertheless, the rooms are fine, cleanliness is correct, as well as room service. The bathroom has an opaque glass sliding door, which gives a nice look, yet not much privacy.The complimentary wi –fi service works well. Both check in and out was quick and efficient, considering that the hotel was at full capacity. It has a nice bar and a place where you can buy coffee, food and drinks to grab and go at a reasonable price. If you do not mind the noise of the area, a small room or a little functional bathroom, this is your hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel in a great location. Times Square is a few minutes walk away. The Port Authority Bus Station is about 5 minutes walk from hotel. We got the bus from Newark Airport to bus terminal, pretty straight forward. Beds very comfy, fab shower. Would definitively recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed recently as a couple and found the hotel to be in a great location and surprisingly quiet. Our room was perfectly adequate in size with an extra large bed and plenty of storage space. It was kept beautifully clean throughout and we had great views. Because of the nature of a holiday in New York we spent very little time actually in the hotel but on our one sojourn into the hotel bar found it to be very expensive compared to local bars and restaurants. The staff on reception appeared quite disinterested, chatting to each other during our check in.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here on our recent visit to New York. The location is fantastic but that is about all. The room was far too small. We had no where to put our suitcases and were constantly tripping over things.There is only a glass wall for the shower so it is okay for couples but not families. We had our 21 year old daughter with us and she did not appreciate seeing her parents shower. Also going to the bathroom in the middle of the night and turning the light on wakes everyone up.While checking out the front desk staff were having a personal conversion behind their hands instead of serving us which I thought was very rude. It was modern, clean and in a good location but for a 5 star hotel it didn't have much more to recommend it. I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I chose the RIU because of the reviews of the sofa bed and location. It's just between Times Square and 9th so you sit between all the food and bright lights NYC has to offer. The street is quieter than Times Sq but you're just steps away. Hamilton is just across 8th of you're that lucky. Trains are easily accessible here. You can walk to the theaters, to the park and Rockefeller quite easily. The hotel staff are friendly. Check in was quick and they held our bags until 3:00. Great view of the Hudson. The Grab and Go off the lobby is perfect for coffee and pastry in the morning. They also have protein snack packs and my sister said the hard boiled egg was fresh. The room is modern....stick your key in for lights to work and art work. There is a glass wall for the bathroom with no privacy. The room literally is a rectangle with a glass sq as you enter the room. You can see a persons shadow while they're in the shower and the glass door simply slides. None of us cared for this idea and when my sister took a shower at 6:45 the whole room lit up. Also the shower tends to get water on the floor. Put towels down or you'll slip. The shower head is waterfall or handheld. It's a bit tricky for some. Turn it back to get waterfall....forward for handheld. This is the only reason I would not stay here again. The lack of privacy was too much for us.....my sisters hated the shower. If you choose to stay check out Orso across the street for dinner and Island Burger for lunch. I'll put Orso on my NYC go to restaurants for pre/post theater dinner. Island Burger wasn't as good as the reviews but a fun little burger joint. You're just in Hells Kitchen so eating won't be your problem. There are many many joints so make sure you read the bad reviews also. Some of my favs in NYC VictorsJacobs PicklesLevain BakeryKingside the restaurant and roof bar

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here over Halloween for 5 nights and can't fault the hotel or the staff. Rapid check in and out, friendly staff at every turn and the room was just right for us, with a flat screen tv, fridge, hairdryer, ironing board and iron. The toiletries were lovely and king sized bed was very comfy. We had an upgrade to a king room from a queen room as our original one was next to a construction area with deafening drilling noise. We didn't use the restaurant as there are so many lovely, reasonably priced deli's and diners only a stroll from the hotel. We got half price tickets to a Broadway show from the ticket master office on Times Square, both of which were only a block or two from the hotel. The location of this place really can't be beaten.Highly recommended! Thank you Riu Times Square staff xx

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel has a Spanish influence and is a block from Times Square. The rooms are small but modern and comfortable. Unfortunately there was no water or coffee maker in the rooms. It was a very busy place with a nice bar and adjacent coffee bar.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is new 2015 hotel, yes rooms not large but this is NYC and for price, great value and best location to go R Rogers theatre.Staff more than helpful; the baths are showers and stylish; yes bath walls glass type but still private.Only comment I heard with family checking in is they thought all King rooms had sofa, so be sure you check total description of room when booking.Mine absolutely perfect King bed with dorm fridge and microwave-and saved $$ and hassle of taxi trips!Will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I just got back from a wonderful stay at the Riu Plaza NY! (from oct. 22 until oct.26) The main plus of this hotel is the location...close to Times Square, Broadway Theaters, Subway stations... it´s also located in 46th street better known as Restaurant Road.... I recommend getting in the breakfast because it´s super convenient to have breakfast right there... I don´t want to go to another hotel in NY.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location near to Times Square.Rooms good size /adequate for staying for a few nights.Toilet shower decent size . Bed comfy . Concierge staff helpful. Did not eat in hotel but menu/restauatant looked good . Free wi fi

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I have stayed at Riu resorts, but never the regular hotel until now. I knew not to expect the same amenities, but was hopeful to still get good service. The hotel is walking distance to Times Square and near various restaurants and bars. We wanted to explore various areas of NYC and found the staff to be helpful in making suggestions. We asked for help from not just the traditional people you would think of like the concierge, but we asked the security attendant that was from the area. He made great suggestions based on the things we wanted to experience. The rooms were a bit cozy (small) and pricey, but that's what we expected for the area. I would say the rooms are average. You're definitely paying more so for the name and location. The customer service is what helped me to rate the property higher.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 4 nights in the hotel and found the hotel and staff great. The staff were very helpful from the time at checking in to the time at organising a taxi back to JFK and the room was large enough for two adults and two teenagers, with one of them sleeping on the sofa bed. The location is great, you come out of the hotel and walk one block and you are in Times Square. We did a lot of walking, but the subway is close by if you need it. I would have given it a 5, but we weren't able to reduce the temperature in the room and we did find it too hot at times.Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel but waken up early hours of morning with sound of pneumatic drilling in our room. Went down to reception to complain about it but was told by a mail receptionist they wasn't anything they could do about it as the loud drilling noise was coming from the building next door.On arrival to check in a blond haired woman on reception was quiet abrupt and not very helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel in a very convenient location. Restaurant food and service excellent. Reception not up to the same standard!! Our room was lovely although too hot in the middle of the night.,What let the hotel down was the extremely rude lady on concierge!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wonderful hotel in Times Square. Modern, beautiful, clean. No problems with the staff. Always willing to answer questions. Stephanie in customer service is a gem. She helped us two days in a row (calling to book our transfer and to check us in online) with patience, professionalism, very friendly. Thanks Stephanie. We ate at the restaurant for lunch the first day and it was great. The staff was so friendly and provided us with alot of information that we needed. The room was awesome. Very clean and the shower was amazing. The only "complaint" is that the room was too hot. We could not get the AC to work or turn off the heat. We survived just fine though. Would highly recommend this hotel. It was so close to Times Square and we so enjoyed our stay there.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was very modern, room was ample spacious, staff helpful. The hotel is very close to Times Square which is a bonus. The restaurant available for breakfast was a little pricey but worth it, staff in restaurant also very helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We just stayed in the Riu for 7 nights as a family our first time in NYC. The Riu is an amazing location to have a base so easy to get around and see everything. I requested a room on a high floor and they gave me the 25th floor amazing views thank you so much Riu. The room was nice, modern and clean and having the fridge was great. My only comment and this is not a complaint just constructive feedback is that they dont have tea/ coffee making facilities in the room, but they have a lovely coffee shop attatched to the hotel but i like a coffee before I shower so I took a travel kettle and stored milk in the fridge. The staff are very friendly and helped me with anything I needed, no problems checking in or out, will definately come back again. Thank you Riu.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: **BEWARE OF SHADY BUSINESS PRACTICESI completed my reservation for a 5-night stay online, and was given a guaranteed rate of $1500 for the entire trip. Two weeks later, when double-checking my reservation, it said "CANCELLED." So I called RIU Customer Service. He said my reservation was indeed showing up as cancelled, but he told me not to worry as he could quickly create a new reservation for me. After being on hold for a couple of minutes, he came back on the line and said my reservation was successfully re-created, but the cost was now over $2,000!!! I explained that I wanted the rate I was initially promised when I booked the hotel 2 weeks prior ($1,500). But he said there was nothing else he could do. So I told him to cancel my reservation, as I was extremely unhappy by this disappointing level of customer service. Long story, short... I won't be staying at this hotel. But I think I made the right choice. BEWARE.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu was as nice a place as we've ever stayed in NY. Large rooms (for there), nice bathrooms, attentive staff. The location is one block from Times Square on 46th, so you're around everything tourist-y (for better or worse). We'd stay there again in a second.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights at a deluxe double room a couple of weeks after they had officially opened in April 2016. Got a room upgrade (unrequested) when checking in, which was really nice. View was great, city view with a glimpse of Hudson river. Clean, beautiful, modern room with a minifridge to store yogurt etc. Did not eat breakfast on site since the restaurant part had not opened yet back then. Quiet room, excellent wifi (included in the obligatory resort fee). Bathroom does offer very little privacy - only a milky glass wall between the shower and the actual room, which could have been a bit uncomfortable if I hadn't been staying with a good friend with whom we just laughed it off. Bathroom also only had a sliding door and the door doesn't close entirely, leaving a gap and an unfortunate opportunity to accidentally peak in.Check-in was quite fast and pleasant. Luggage storage service after checking out was perfect. Asked two different employees in the lobby for an estimation to get to LaGuardia; one said 2+ hrs, the other 1 hr, so maybe ask for a second opinion if asking for any instructions if it's crucial for your plans. The very nice doorman quickly arranged a car to take me to the airport safely and well under an hour on a Sat afternoon.Would return, great location especially for theatergoers. Felt safe, was easy to walk to and find coming from Port Authority.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a brand new modern hotel a stones throw from Times Square with amazing views from room across the city!Rooms are not huge but perfectly formed, bathrooms are very modern with everything you could want.Highlight is floor to ceiling windows looking out to Times Square!!Only reason I knocked down from 5 to 4 stars was attitude of staff. When we checked in we felt like an inconvenience (just checked in, didn't have any questions or requests) she clearly didn't want to be there. Not the feeling you want starting your honeymoon. Breakfast was good but was puzzled to why the "cosmetic surgery" channel was on one morning! Not what you want to see when eating your breakfast. Most guests noticed and were commenting so surprised not one of the waiters noticed for the full 30mins we were there.Small niggles, but would return and would recommend to anyone looking for modern hotel in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This was our first trip to NYC and we decided to stay at the RUI due to the proximity to all the action. Great location! The reason I only rated the hotel as AVERAGE, was due to the terrible experience with the concierge. We attempted to get tickets for Wicked through him and was told I was stupid for not booking ahead of time because the show was "definitely" sold out. I said that I checked ticketmaster and there were still tickets left...He said you can't trust those sites! He them preceded to tell me that School Of Rock is much better and he "Might" be able to get me seats. I decided to try my luck at the box office. He was very rude and condescending! I went to the "Wicked" box office at the Gershwin....and YES I got tickets and good seats!!! The next day we asked if we could get a double decker bus for an evening tour of the city...He said..."No, you should have planned ahead of time. There are no tours this late in the day" Seriously!! The next day we booked our own tour!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was really excited about coming to this hotel as we have stayed at the Riu in Mexico and it was wonderful. However, it turned out horrible. We arrived late with our two kids. When we walked in the room the first thing we noticed was how muggy it was in the room. We were on the 26th floor. We figured we'd lower the temperature and go out for a late bite and it will be cooler when we got back. We also noticed the frosted glass shower where you can pretty much see the person showering and the two beds that were pushed together. So I figured, ok no showers and we're sleeping with our kids. We returned around 11:30pm and it was still hot. We called for maintenance. And they said it was because we had the air on and not on auto. That it should be cold in about 30 minutes. I seriously doubted it was because it was on "on". But we waited and waited. By then kids were asleep and at 1am I woke up because it was just too hot and my son was sweating. My husband went down to complain again. They gave him a key to another room. I was trying to gather all our stuff and was woke up the kids to head toward the elevator. The maintenance man stopped us and said our air was turned off downstairs and he fixed it. To just wait 30 minutes in our room and open window to let cold air in. Ummm opening a window in NYC by Times Square won't exactly get you a good nights sleep. We tried but it was useless. We waited and again woke up at 3am when it was simply unbearable and everyone was sweating. I called and said i need that room they offered to switch us to. The front desk told me "but you declined it". I told them I did not decline. They told me to go back because it was fixed and I was not going to stay in room Any longer. Again I woke up my kids (6 and 9) and dragged them half awake to other room. The other room had two separate beds a non see through shower and was not hot. Too bad it took so long to get us in the room. I was so tired and put the do not disturb sign on our door hoping to sleep in. All was well until 8:30am when someone came knocking on our door. And wouldn't stop knocking until we answered. He wanted to come in to see if shower was working because there were complaints yesterday it wasn't working. And that water flowed everywhere. I told him we just got in at 3am. I put do not disturb. My kids are exhausted. I'mNot letting him in to work on the shower! He left and I thought, guess we won't be taking shower either! I was so aggregated at that point I went downstairs to see if I could talk to manager. I did, but honestly she looked very disinterested in what I was telling her. She said well I'm sorry that happened. But since this is your only night here there's nothing I can do. Here's the email address to customer service. You can let them know what happened. The hotel has a nice lobby. And is near Times Square. The white walls in both rooms were pretty dirty.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon, We arrived mid morning but our room wasn't ready until 3pm, so we visited the sights.When we arrive back we checked in, our reservation ticker said we were there on our honeymoon, when we got to our room it was there standard deluxe room for what we had paid for. No complimentary bottle of wine or chocolates, it was very disapointing, since it was my first visit to NY and was our honeymoon! Now i see from other reviews that there is an executive lounge area on one of the floors with freebies. We were too tired to complain after an early and long flight in the morning and a long walk round NY.Rooms are modern, bright and airy, with floor to ceiling window, our view was of some tall buildings, but was still amazing.Large shower area, but did leak a bit into the main room on the floor, but I just mopped it up with a towel as didn't want to slip on the tiled floor.reception staff were very good, bell boy good as looked after our suitcases while we were out.The coffee/snack bar adjoined to the hotel was excellant, great choice of food, yoghurts, danish pasties, just something light for breakfast.Good location next near Broadway and Times Square. Felt very safe in this area.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is outstanding in every way - location - access - rooms - service.We were able to walk to all Times Square attractions and most theatres were also easily reached on foot. Room was smallish but immaculately clean and very new. Lobby is spacious and colourful - staff were mostly helpful although concierge was obviously chosen to deal with Spanish-speaking clientele - English was ok but not as helpful as expected with advising tours.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We are three days into a weeks stay at the Riu and are loving it. Fabulous location and very friendly staff. Room is great, shower is even better. Will post a longer review when we get back to the UK.The Ward/ Sly family

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Brilliant brilliant brilliant we had a fantastic stay a cracking view a beautiful room and really eager to help staff and the added bonus of the excutive lounge on our floor with free named brand drinks and various snacks will most definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We arrived at about noon the day we had to check in. Unfortunately, check-in is not until 3 pm so plan ahead if you are going to arrive early. Luckily, the Hotel is only a few minutes walk from Times Square and Grand Central Park. Finally, at 3 o clock, we were allowed into our room which I found to be underwhelming. This is New York City so it is probably to be expected to have a tight room. There were two queen sized beds and a couch that turns into another queen. You have to pay for the wifi which luckily is quick and worth the cost.
