I would recommend it seeing as how the rooms are comfortable, if a little on the small size, and the location could not be any more perfect.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Right in the heart of Times Square. It's walking distance to EVERYTHING. You don't need a car which is great since they do not have on site parking. The rooms are modern but small. There was construction going on early every morning we stayed. It was so loud, I had a thumping headache. You would think they wouldn't start until late morning. The lobby and other common areas are nicely decorated and the staff is friendly. It was odd that a staff member, not the maid, knocked on our door each morning to ask us how things were.... we weren't even out the bed yet. All in all, good stay. Just plan your visit when they aren't jack hammering above your head and request a Do Not Disturb sign, there wasn't one in the room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great new Hotel to stay at. 4th of July family getaway. The hotel decor was so upbeat and the clots was fabulous. New fresh lavender and chic decor. Classy but yet has a great environment atmosphere. The staff was great with my family and I. Walking distance to time square. Great food.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for three nights while in town for a show on Broadway.The hotel itself was great and met our expectations. Check-in was a breeze. All staff encountered were extremely pleasant and helpful. The room was small though nicely decorated, very clean and overlooked 8th Ave. As mentioned by others, the shower door leaks though not enough that it posed any real problems. Wifi was included. The hotel's proximity to the subway stations and various subway lines, Broadway, Times Square, Hell's Kitchen, Central Park and other notable locations was unbelievable, making it incredibly easy to get around not only Midtown but the rest of Manhattan and the other boroughs. It is located on Restaurant's Row in the Hell's Kitchen neighbourhood where you can find so many amazing places to eat if you head in the opposite direction of Times Square. Additionally, the hotel is surrounded in various theatres making it an ideal location if you're going to a show. The location of this hotel really is incredible!I would definitely return to the Riu Plaza and recommend it to others visiting Manhattan!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I recently spent 3 nights at this hotel. The location is fantastic, as Times Square is only 1 block away - and the hotel itself is great. The hotel only opened earlier this year, so everything is nice a new. The beds are really comfy, and the rooms are very clean and fresh. We were lucky enough to get a room on the 28th floor, with a fantastic view of the city that never sleeps. We shared a room with our two daughters, as the room consisted on 2 queen beds and a sleeper couch, so it was perfect. My eldest daughter, who is almost 15, commented on how comfortable the sleeper couch was. Also try the steak in the restaurant downstairs, really nice tasting. All in all, a great experience at a nice new hotel that is brilliantly located. Thanks to the staff at the Riu Plaza NYC Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I first chose the Riu Hotel Plaza New York Times Square for its location and price. I read the nearly all the reviews (good and bad). Upon entry, my friend and I were greeted as we entered a very busy reception and a chaotic luggage check in service. Our check in with Angel was prompt and courteous. We checked our luggage into the locker with a very hard-working young man. Sadly, he was in great need of assistance as the set-up for the luggage locker is poorly conceptualized for the amount of people checking in and out.We returned later in the day and went up to our room #1802. We had reserved a deluxe family room with two full beds and a sofa. It was perfect for our needs. Clean, minimalistic and with a somewhat decent view. We decided to take a nap when we heard a loud noise coming from above our room. I called reception and was told maintenance was being done and it shouldn't be much longer. 2 hours later the noise sounded like a jack hammer and I could barely hear the receptionist on the phone when I called again. She did inform me they would be working the next day as well and I said while the room was lovely, the situation was unacceptable. The workers stopped for the day and we slept in the room changing to another in the morning. Reception profusely apologized for the inconvenience and moved us to the 27th floor with a view of the Hudson. Overall, our room was comfortable, clean and perfect for what we needed. Location was great for staging our daily NYC events. The staff was helpful from reception, to bellman and the greeter who arranged our taxi's. The interior was modern and sleek. Enjoyed the aesthetics of it. Never made it to Fashion or the little grab n go. But for price, location, and overall satisfaction even with a room change... it was a nice place to stay in the heart of the City.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel only opened 5 months ago and rooms are already showing signs of age and poor maintenance. Service is non existent and you have to pay a daily amenities fee whether you use the pool or gym or not. Plus WIFI is NOT free and we have stayed at so called less-salubrious hotels where this is complimentary.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After reading many reviews we were unsure what to expect upon checkin at this hotel.We always stay in Riu hotels for our summer holidays but have never been to a city one!We should never have worried,we had a speedy check in ,arrived early and got straight in our room,which was modern and very clean.If you stay on the26 floor you can use the guest business lounge ,which has a relaxed feel and curtesy snacks and drinks .The location could not be better,about a ten minute walk from Time Square tube station(just a quick note on the tube-for €35 you can get a 7 day pass which is great value)Would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone.(Just a nice touch -we had gone to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary -and received a personal note and chocolates in our room)Thankyou

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On entering the hotel, my wife and I joined the check in que. We were greeted by a receptionist who was not at all friendly and welcoming as we expected, but was quite grumpy and complained of a bad back!On entering our room which was a queen deluxe, we found it clean and tidy. We checked the bathroom out which had the appearance of a bathroom 10 years old and gave an appearance of not being clean, but jaded.We had booked a 5 night stay and the location was excellent, very near to Time Square and the bright lights but just far enough out not to be bothered by any noise apart from the fire engines, ambulances and horn honking of the traffic that appeared to be the norm. We had a problem with the shower door not opening and didn't want to push it to hard as it was glass. We told one of the receptionist who said he would get an engineer to look at it. Next morning we tried the door again and again it was stuck. I freed it myself using soap to lubricate one of the seals.On checking out, the Bell Boy gave us a price of $75 for a private 'luxury cab' to take us to the airport. This included, trip, taxes gratuity and tolls. On reaching the airport 1 hour and 40 minutes later, the driver requested $83 and gratuity. When I told him the Bell Boy gave us a price of $75 all in, he said the extra $8 was for using a card and the gratuity was not included. I paid the $83 and said he would have to talk to the Bell Boy for the gratuity.All in all, the hotel was disappointing as it was only opened this year and the staff was un friendly. I felt our room was on the same level as a Travelodge, but definitely not cheap or cheerful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have been to this hotel three times in the past three months. The staff is great the rooms are clean and Danny The bellhop especially is tremendous he is always friendly always happy and makes our stay in New York City fabulous thanks again Danny we hope to see you real soon Jennifer and Gaspare Campisi
user_name:
Gasp2112
Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Rui Plaza, Times Square. The hotel is very well located and the rooms and facilities are good. Service was sadly lacking with a painful check-in procedure and staff that would rather continue a personal conversation whilst we stood like lemons waiting to be attended to. We had a drink in the hotel bar and the tonic out of the gun was flat. Rather than replacing it immediately, the barman squirted some more into another glass to demonstrate that it wasn't flat but it was!! At £10+ a drink I do not expect to have my word doubted in this way. On check out we were told that the hotel was very busy so we could not have a late check out (we were not due to fly until 8pm). However, if we were prepared to pay an additional $40 plus tax the hotel wouldn't be so busy and our request could be accommodated! Didn't like the feeling of being clipped at every opportunity and certainly didn't feel particularly well looked after. Even when we collected our bags from the hotel storage area, we were shown into the room and told to find our bags despite having been given tickets for them. Finally at 14.45 we were told the restaurant was closed for lunch and yet it states clearly on the hotel information that lunch is served until 15.00 every day. Nice hotel but needs to sort out the service. We will not be returning.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We've just checked out after a 5 night stay at the RIU Plaza Times Square and have to say that the hotel was perfect for what we needed.The hotel looks new which was an added bonus as I do like clean lines and often stay at RIU hotels when in the Caribbean. The room, (although quite compact was what you would expect for a city hotel) was a double deluxe on the 21st floor which looked over to Times Square. It had a 40 inch wall mounted TV, large shower cubicle with dual shower, iron and adequate storage.The location was perfect for anything we wanted to do whilst in New York so I would recommend staying here and will again when I return to NY.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel opened in March 2016 and we booked a 3 nights stay in April. Check in was long a drawn out. Staff at from desk were uptight and rude. Rooms were very small and minimal. No tea or coffee in rooms. No slippers or gowns. Shower leaked into the room and onto our luggage. Being a fairly new hotel, the breakfast area was closed as they were awaiting some kind of license from the city council which was somewhat understandable. Plenty breakfast options outside hotel.Concierge desk was friendly and extremely helpful. Didn't get much sleep in the morning as there was an annoying fire alarm which went off every morning in the hotel, we were petrified thinking it was a real fire and called front desk only to be told it was being tested. We were out quiet late every night and upon return we were stopped by a very rude and unpleasant security guard who demanded our room key card. Whilst security in a city like New York is important, the hotel security should not behave like bouncers at a night club handling drunk and disorderly patrons. We are after all paying guests. I'm sure the staff will get proper training and know how too and how not too handle guests in future. Once the many teething issues are sorted, in sure this will be a great hotel to stay in future. Decor was great. Location tops. Price tops.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the location and amenities. Close to Times Square making it easy to hop on the subway to get anyway you wish. The hotel is modern and sleek. Rooms aren't particularly large but have everything you need - large shower with regular or rain shower head (no bath). King room with closet, safe and great views. I booked via Hotwire and we were placed on 26th floor just a few doors away from the Executive Lounge where were could enjoy treats and beverages as and when we wished. Croissants, cheese, ham, turkey, along with unlimited water/pop. You could even pour yourself a glass of red or white wine occasionally. Great value for money and would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is located 2 mins from Times Square. Despite great location, hotel is almost brand new. The price was OK for us, because we booked on special offer with more than 50% off normal price, but in general this is not a cheap nor mid-range place.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good location, Times Square is only 2minutes away. Bad service, a lot of noise inside and outside the hotel. Housekeepers are talking loud and slamming doors from early morning. No value for money, and we will never stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We found the Hotel to be in an excellent location, very clean and modern, Excellent sleep beds very comfortable, Staff very friendly, some issues with bathroom, after a shower as the water tended to escape onto the main bathroom floor this was clearly a design fault, we never ate in the hotel other than the snack bar which is a great idea...fresh fruit etc we could store in the room fridge, plan to stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel is in a great location, very clean and the room was perfect for us and beds were comfortable. Just what we needed after a long day sight seeing. The hotel is on Restaurant Row, so loads of places to eat and cheaper than times sq. I woukd recommend staying here and would book it again if I were lucky enough to go back.
user_name:
Susan D
Port Glasgow, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Uhhh, this hotel wasn't what me and my husband was expecting. Don't get me wrong it's in a great location, mins from Times Square and the price is decent for that. The lobby is beautiful and modern, we landed at 11am and check in wasn't until 3 and they're pretty strict about check in times ( absolutely no way for you to check in before 3, us and a dozen of other people literally just sat and waited awhile) they do let you check in your luggage though so we did that and walked around Times Square for a bit. Once we finally were checked in (which the ladies at the front desk arnt the nicest by the way) we were having trouble finding our room on the 29th floor, we made our way to the main elevator banks and were confused when there was no option for the 29th floor, so went back to the front desk and she told us the other elevators which we were ok..where? She seemed annoyed and pointed behind her. There was ONE elevator that took you to all floors including the top ones, which by the way takes forever. It was basically meant for staff members which was odd. The room was nice but quite small, which was okay we were barely in the room anyways. Floors were dusty upon check in, so we definitely didn't walk bare foot. We stood 3 days and the floors never seemed to be cleaned. Now this leads me to check out day. My husband had an alarm on his phone for 8am, he went to grab his phone once the alarm went off and it fell between the wall and nightstand when he reached between the gap to retrieve his phone he felt something squishy, now I'm gonna let your mind wonder and figure out what it was. Immediately he figured it out without retrieving it just his phone, all I heard him say was "oh my god are you kidding me" before he ran into the bathroom to wash his hands. He went down to the front desk explaining what he had found and they sent up a staff member to see, which I'm more then sure they found it too. We were so disgusted at this point we didn't know what to do, the manager said she couldn't do any rate adjustments to call Expedia since we booked with them but PAID IN PERSON at the hotel ( makes no sense) so we called Expedia and they said we'd have to take it up with the hotel since they are the ones who I paid. We tried calling corporate and even back to the hotel but they have no knowledge of our findings or complaints! It's truly ridiculous you pay close to $700 for 3 days for a nice clean hotel room but in return you get to find used condoms next to where your sleeping!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First visit to a RIU Plaza Hotel after many other RIU visits - The Plaza Hotels are a very different product than the normal beach side hotels of RIU, and this must be appreciated.The hotel is splendid and very cosmopolitan in all aspects of design and finish. The rooms are of a size that you would expect in a big city location where land is expensive but they are designed to maximise the space available.The hotel seems to have recovered from the early launch problems and now seems to be running very smoothly under the auspices of the General Manager and her staff.The location is superb, we walked to nearly all of the major attractions in NY and the excellent restaurants of Restaurant row were on our doorstep.The staff are all very good but some of the Spanish friendliness of a resort hotel is replaced by a more serious efficient attitude, which is different but not out of place!We had breakfast every day and two evening meals which were of good quality, efficiently served and the price was consistent with the surroundings.Cleanliness was excellent (a recurring RIU feature).Check in and out were both effortless and precise.This hotel is a must for sightseers to NY who want to maximise their time by being close to everything, if I were to visit NY again I would be staying here!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Where do I began. My friends and I stayed back here in April and hated the experience between the shower leaking and the hard beds it was the worst! We decided to give it another try and stayed here the past weekend. First off they put us in another room where the shower leaked! Secondly when we came back from the club later on Saturday night we were profiled by the hotel staff. Security followed us upstairs and proceeded to stand outside our hotel room. We weren't in the room 5 minutes and security knocked saying we were too loud. We proceeded to close the door but as we looked out the peep hole the security guard had his ear pressed against the door. That is truly disgusting and a violation of privacy especially in a room full of young women. At check out we were in for another surprise the price chosen online for the room is not what we were charged. Overall I will never stay at this hotel again no matter how convenient it is. Horrible staff and barely any amenities.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I requested a room on an upper level, well advance upon booking, with a phone call, as well as upon check in. Unfortunately that never happened, even though the hotel was not even close to fully booked. The room was very clean and modern, though very small. It looked newly renovated though I hope they rethink the bathroom shower wall. The bathroom and bed area are separated by a glass frosted wall, so that in the middle of the night when someone uses the bathroom, the light brightens the whole sleeping area. Another problem with that design is that anyone taking a shower has his/her silhouette in full view of anyone in the room, not a pleasant experience for those who may be sharing a room on a business trip.I'm also disappointed that the hotel has no water fill up station for eco-friendly bottle water users. I has to go to the bar to fill up our water bottles, or buy disposable water bottles from the convenience store. No complimentary coffee or tea in the morning either. Very basic amenities that are noticeably lacking for such an expensive hotel. Also we booked a room for 4 ( we have 2 kids), and the room had only 2 glasses. I know I'm nit picking here, but they knew of our party of 4 reservation for 5 weeks. We were impressed with the clean rooms, cleaner than any hotel we've been in. The air vent fan in he ceiling that turns on when key card is in wall was wonderful, it helped tremendously with trying to sleep around city noise.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the RUI Plaza on 28 September, we arrived about 9.30 am in the morning and expected to have my luggage stored however the lady on reception said there was a room ready if I wanted to go up, I think this is a great policy as the majority of hotels have a policy of check-in after 3pm etc, which is extremely petty if rooms are ready. The room was clean, beds very comfortable, location very convenient to Time Square etc. The only little down side was no tea making facilities. I would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for one night after seeing a Broadway show. The hotel was in a great location in times Square. The room was small but so are all rooms in nyc. It had a very comfortable king bed. The room was sleek and clean. We were on the 28th floor with a semi view of times square. Shower was awesome, great water pressure. Check in and check out was fast and easy. We got there at 12 and they held our bag until we returned at night. We parked our car two blocks away with a Groupon ticket. $38 instead of $50+ for 24 hours. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The hotel was very modern and clean. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza for our first ever visit to New York or American for that matter. We stayed for 4 nights (Friday-Tuesday) .Our second stay in a "Riu" chained hotel. We were a family of 4 myself, my wife and our 2 daughters (16,11). Like their first hotel one word, Impressed!Admittedly I was a little sceptical with the hotel being brand new and reading one of two mixed reviews but in fact the hotel was spot on. Very modern, clean and sleak. On arrival we were greeted by a very smart looking reception. Check in was fairly prompt. We were required to pay a $50 deposit which we got back on check out. ROOMS: Better than I expected. Nice spacious clean room with air conditioning. Beds were comfy. Large led tv. Fridge. Lovely view. Nice decor. Loved the drench shower. Yes there was a small leak but nothing the towel mat couldn't handle. Hotel was well soundproofed as we didn't hear any noise from outside when window was shut. Plenty of lifts available to we never had to wait for one. Free wifi also internet access with computers that were located in reception with access to a printer which was handy as I needed to print out our boarding passes for our return flight home. We didn't eat here so I can't comment on that but we had a drink in the bar and found that quiet expensive. Location was excellent. Soon as you stepped out of the hotel Times Square was a few minutes walk. Plenty of places to eat in the area. On check out I got my $50 back and we could store our luggage which the bell boy sorts for you as we had a late flight. He also sorted us a taxi back to JFK right from the hotel doorstep which was handy. Overall an excellent stay and would defiantly recommend this hotel. I would certainly stay here again if I return to the Big Apple one day. Service was excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Firstly I want to say I have been to New York twice before and I haven't had a bad experience, until I stopped my car outside the hotel, I had emailed the hotel before hand about the parking arrangements, but had no response, having never driven there before, I did not know what to expect. everywhere else I was greeted with politeness and courtesy, but not here, it was like they were not bothered if you stopped there, as someone else would take your place, the man who tried to sort us out was rude and quite frankly could not have cared less about us, they threw the cases on a cart and pushed them inside, we waited at the check in desk, the man who checked us in, stated that the car was not his problem and waved us back to the bell hop, I can see why the hotel was downgraded before we got there, not a pleasant experience at all.I got a ticket for my trouble and the car went off for a ride to god knows where. once we got to the room, I was a little disappointed with the size, again its like - hey its only somewhere to sleep, it doesn't matter, the shower leaks ( no bath ) all over the floor and into the bedrooms which are tiled, luck would have it, it is a door fault and would need to be stripped out to be fixed, when you are in the bathroom, you need to tell people, as it is a frosted glass door, but you can see them sitting on the toilet, also when you put the light on two large panels light the bedroom up, so the room knows what your up to,  The hotel has a bar and a café on site, be careful when ordering a pint in the bar, the old I have no pint glasses, so getting two halves cost you $4 more than the $6 for a pint, crafty or what, we did not eat there after that, my trust was disappearing fast. we spent as much time as possible away from the hotel as we could, I cannot stress how horrid it was, the most unwelcoming place I have ever had the misfortune of visiting. no amount of money could make me go back there, Monday I requested the car back to escape, I would give at least an hours notice, a word to the wise, do your homework before hand and book a garage up from home, you may find it saves you money in the long run on to Philadelphia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed a night for business purposes. The staff was very friendly and helping. The hotel is new and located in good vicinity to Manhattan's important places. The room, a bit small, but modern, clean, and has all what's needed for the case. Recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have stayed at many Riu's over the world. The rooms are small and there are lack of facilities. The hairdryer fell from the wall first time we used it. The beds are comfortable.b the bar opposite - Playwright is good for bar food and beer

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good view across the city from 21st Floor. Well appointed rooms and whilst not big, were adequate for a 4 night stay. Small fridge in room which could be used for personal items.Could easily walk to Times Sq,5th Ave, Empire State, Rockerfeller Centre and Central ParkHotel is very modern, with Lobby spacious and airy. Did not eat in Hotel so cannot. comment on food.The corridors on each floor were pretty basic and unwelcoming, however this was not an issue as lets face it you don't spend much time in the corridors!!Any longer that a 4 night stay, would find the room a bit restrictive, however have no complaints as they were well appointed.One issue which disappointed me, was when my wife left her cardigan in the bar and realised a couple of days later that she had done so, was surprised that no one from the hotel could locate it. Will use again when revisiting New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really Very good hotel. Fantastic position, services And Cleaning. And the view from the room was great.I had no breakfast in my reservation so I cannot tell on this.but It s so near To everything that You Can go everywhere To have breakfast.Anyway to visit Nyc is a great choice, mainly for its good position.thanks.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Riu Plaza is a beautiful hotel ideally situated to explore New York. It is within site of Time Square. Easy access to the subway which is so easy to use and feels very safe.The rooms are beautiful and the staff are extremely friendly from start to finish. Lovely Irish Bar just around the corner called the 'The Playwrite'. I would highly recommend this hitel and hope to visit again soon.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is gorgeous, and located in a brilliant part of NYC. Only 10 minutes walk to Times Square, 20 minute walk to Central Park, close to Broadway theatres and the hop on hop off buses stop righ at the corner.The hotel was spotlessly clean and very well presented, house keeping were excellent, staff in the lobby were very friendly and helpful.Didn't eat at the restaurant as we were so close to so many choices and variety outside of the hotel.Everything was at your fingertips.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel reception area is vast and Welcoming and had a sense of luxury. However, this ends here! We were on the 22nd floor and had a brilliant view. On exiting the lift the floor had laminate flooring that looked really, really cheap and the rooms were the same - with some bits even being loose! We reported it to reception as we didn't want to get charged for any damages but they just dismissed it and didn't seem to care. The walls were covered in brown marks that didn't look pleasant.The feeling of the corridors and rooms resembled a hospital or more a hostel as they felt cramped. For the price, we did expect better. One more thing is don't expect a lie in. We were there for 3 nights and each morning at 9am they tested the fire alarm - that came with a very loud tannoy warning in 3 languages! This was horrendous! Also the curtains on the large glass windows were non existent, it was just a thin piece of material. Its as if they really do not want you to sleep! Concierge desk were very helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: New hotel great location very modern fair sized rooms 2 minutes from Times Square,Theatre District plenty of eateries on your doorstep.Subway close by staff very helpful walked NGOs distance to most shopping.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: In the Heart of the City. Next to Times Square with a lot shopping and restaurant/bar options. The View from our Room (28th Floor) was absolutely stunning. Staff was very nice an helpful, especially Alia. Thank you so much for your help! We will be back . . .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just spent over 11 days at the RIU while in our honeymoon in the USA.EVERYTHING you read about the RIU on here is trueTHE GOOD:The room was very clean, bed was very comfortable and it is in a very good location for Times Square. The room is small but as this was our 1st time in NYC I cannot compare room sizes other places. THE BAD:Yes your shower will leak and flood into the room if extra towels are not ordered.There are 2 bottles of water supplied and this is all you will get for your entire stay. With the price paid for the room 2x complimentary bottles of water each day is not a big ask. I have never stayed at a motel where laundry has to be delivered to reception where you are greeted with a sneer and then you have to chase them up to get it back and collect from Reception. We learnt our $100 lesson the hard way and then got the same amount done for $9 at a laundry around the corner.It seems the place has been built on the cheap as our room already had paint pealing on the roof, the leaking shower, no clock, fittings not fitted properly, no drawers in the cupboard.THE UGLY:I'm not sure if this was an NYC thing or they have fitted a cheap fire alarm as they tested it every morning at around 9am for the 1st week . No chance of a sleep in.There is no care factor. They took a $200 room deposit (no dramas) but then 2 days later took another $300 without even bothering to contact us. I had to go chase them to find out what it was. Then the rude girl at reception didn't believe me & I had to actually show her my statement to prove it! Some of the staff seem to need a real attitude adjustmentOverall we would not return as we had been totally spoilt by a competitor brand motel only a few days before in West Hollywood so our next stay in NYC will be with that brand. I'm sure there will be a generic response to this but after comparing the 2 Brands we will never stay at a RIU again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Fantastic locaction. Great for spanish speakers since most of the hotel staff speaks spanish. Small but great rooms. Two problems, one minor. One major. Both in the rooms.If someone turns on the bathroom light the whole room lights up. This is definitely NOT GOOD in the middle of the night or in the morning...Second...THE ROOM HAS NO DRAWERS. This is really unbelievable. We stayed 10 nights and I guess they want you to leave off your suitcase.The fact that the room design is modernistic and minimalist is no excuse. Are you kidding? No drawers???
user_name:
GeorgefromMexico
San Pedro Garza Garcia, Mexico

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was really nice. The check in staff were very nice. We didn't have a wait to check in. The room was clean, but as others have said, small. Another thing we saw from others was the water leaking under the shower door. Overall, the room and hotel were perfect. The location was perfect for Time Square and there's a subway station nearby. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, no problem.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for three nights at beginning of September. Check in was quick. Room small but very new and clean. Huge TV. did not spend much time in room as we were just around corner from Times Square which was great. Bar seemed busy all the time. Coffee shop was great for snacks. Got a great rate and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We chose this hotel because we were only in town for one night and wanted to be able to walk to Broadway for a play we were seeing.We asked for early check in but when we arrived there was not a room ready for us. Not a real big deal but it is nice to freshen up after traveling by bus. We dropped our bag off and went to lunch. We got our room at around 2:30. It was a bit of a mess reclaiming our bag as there was many bags in the storage area. Once we got to our we noticed our bag was torn on the top. I don't know if happened when it was stored but it was not ripped when we dropped it off. I should have said something but my husband didn't want to make a scene. The rooms are small but very clean and modern. The hallways are very dreary. They look like a prison with the heavy doors and drab color walls. We were on the 22nd floor and had a decent view. One thing they never told us was that you needed your key card to work the electricity in the room. I fumbled around for a good ten minutes before finally calling the front desk. Over by your door is a slot you put your key card into and that works the electricity. The only other issue we had was that the shower door was almost impossible to open. It was stuck. When we did get it open we never shut it all the way again for fear of being stuck in the shower!We did not eat in the restaurant as Hell's Kitchen was right around the corner.. We went to a McDonalds for breakfast as we were not going to spend $28 per person for breakfast. The little grab and go store they had was nice. Pricey but had a nice selection of snacks. Overall a good visit but nothing spectacular.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My friend and I stayed in Riu Plaza for 7 days - this location was close to Times Square - subway access - within walking distance to the Hudson river - I walked to see the aircraft carrier Intrepid. visited all the usual tourist attractions including walking the Brooklyn Bridge, I took ill late one evening and the hotel staff went out of their way to make sure I was accommodated. My friend and I also speak Spanish fluently and we found out the the hotel is owned by a family in Spain - most everyone spoke Spanish. We enjoyed the stay and would definitely stay there again in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Location does not disappoint! So close to Time Square, easy walk to Central Park, Radio City Hall and much much more. Hotel lobby is lovely. Crisp , clean and inviting. Check in was smooth and effortless. Rooms are good. Beds are comfortable. Across the road towards 9th Avenue is the Bourbon Grill Restaurant. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 5 nights here at our honeymoon and it was perfect! Got a small gift from the hotel and a nice greeting card because of our honeymoon. Nice room at 28th floor with a lovely view. We will come back!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location in the theatre district. Newer hotel, very industrial looking, small rooms with zero character.Concierge is horrible. Hard to believe in NYC but the concierge desk is understaffed and their knowledge and recommendations were worthless. There are dozens of other much better hotels to stay within a few blocks. We won't be back.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 5 nights at this new hotel situated one block from Times Square - perfect location. Welcome was warm and friendly and the staff were helpful throughout our stay. Our room on the 9th floor was very comfortable - plenty of room for a short stay. Ate breakfast in the restaurant - excellent, though didn't dine there in the evening. Being in the Hell's Kitchen District we were spoilt for choice for where to eat. The small hotel cafe and shop was poorly stocked and items overpriced. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for a short stay at an affordable price. I'd definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed for two nights in the Riu Plaza. Very clean and modern, loved the number of lifts available no wait at all. Check in was efficient didn't mention the resort fee but we knew to expect it anyway.I was hoping to get a view but we were on the 5th floor at the back of the hotel so nothing to look at other than apartments behind so this was disappointing however the room was clean and modern albeit narrow but hey you are in NYC!Location was great less than 5 minutes stroll to Times square and right on the edge of Hells Kitchen so lots of lovely restaurants to choose from.We had breakfast as part of the booking and it was ok, standard hotel stuff really, bacon, eggs, pastries fruit etc. The restaurant was smart and cleanWe parked in the next street (W46th) booked online direct with Icon parking $80 for 48 hours, a great service and a short walk to the hotel.I would probably choose an alternative next time as hotels are in abundance in the city but this stay was just fine for us!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We got an offer for £489 sterling for 3 nights and paid around $789 when taxes and charges were added. Reception staff were welcoming and the lobby was beautiful. Room was good enough size with big wardrobe. TV was huge which was great. The bathroom sliding door I liked I know other people had complain about this but I thought it was a cool feature. Would definitely stay here again and was literally down the street of American Eagle on times square!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Loved the location and so close to Times Square! The room was very small and basic. There was not much room to store our luggage. Modern looking hotel but never had any personal touch. It felt very clinical.
user_name:
Donna C
Alexandria, Scotland, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location is very near to Times Square but not in it which was nice. We found it a good base to visit uptown or downtown Manhattan walking or via the subway. There are lots of places to eat and drink nearby. We had breakfast there one day and it was the best breakfast we had during our stay. Yes, it was not that cheap but you got much more for your money that most of the places nearby. The room was clean and modern and the staff were always very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Service is really slow. Staff not so friendly. Overall mot a good experience. Service at Fashion bar was awful. Not wasting time or cash here again. Quite upsetting! It was a fun nigjt until we ended up in this place. Needs to be seriously worked on!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights at the Riu Plaza. The hotel was clean and had great A/C which was important in 32C humid heat. The bed was comfortable and bathroom was fresh and modern. However, the problems started on our first morning when we were woken up (jet lagged) at around 8am by a fire alarm. We ran out into the corridor with other confused guests in their underwear. It stopped about 10 seconds later with no announcement and we went back to bed with a nice dose of adrenaline. Two other mornings we were woken up by intercom announcements before 9am about fire alarm tests. So out of the 5 nights we stayed, 3 we were rudely woken up by this system.Having consulted the front desk about this, we were told this was NYC fire regulations and that the FDNY can come in any time to test the alarms. If this is true or not, I cannot say, but I've stayed in New York many times before for weeks at a time and have never experienced this before. If anything the management need to be working with the Fire department to do these at more sociable hours. To top it off, the front desk did not even offer an apology and were almost hostile in their approach - always something that puts me off a hotel.So all in all a pleasant place to stay, but let down by early fire alarms and a poor front desk service. Given the choice of hotels in Manhattan, I would looks elsewhere next time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First of all, if you have a car don't stay there. They don't have a parking. They charged 56$ for valet and parking then when arrive the time to take your car you have to go by YOURSELF to take your car at 3 streets corners from the hotel and when you complain they say they can't do anything for that...The room stinks a lot. You have to ask the hotel when you want a clean up. When we ask for it, the person took all our personal papers on the night table and threw it in garbage! When we leave we ask for a cart for all our luggages we wait more than 1 hour in the room to have it. They forced you to buy wifi 26$ even if you dont want it. Probably the worst hotel i've been in all my life. I've travelled in a lot of hotel around the world and the worst is the Riu in NYC. Everybody around me will know how worst the hotel is.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My daughter had her 18th birthday this September in New York and we stayed for 6 nights at the Riu Plaza in Times Square. The position was fantastic, a 2 minute walk to Times Square yet some lovely quieter streets to the side and behind the hotel just minutes away.The hotel was very clean and the staff welcoming and efficient.We were on the 6 th floor, which if you're a light sleeper like me, is a little loud at the front of the hotel where we were as the noise never fully stops. I'm sure on a higher floor it would be better. We were given the option to move to a higher floor but didn't in the end.As others have said the showers did leak badly but we just put towels down to mop up and the room and bathroom were always spotless when we came back in. The cleaners were great and very smiley and polite.The hotel grab and go bar was good, didn't try the restaurant but all in all would recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I am not happy with this hotel and I really expected more.The only good thing is that they gave us the room pretty early, so thats a plus. Service is not good, breakfast was average and buffet was not good, tables were very near one from another, not confortable at all.Rooms are very small.The worst thing is they lost a package with things I got from Amazon and they didn't recognised even with the "delivered" confirmation.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in this hotel for just one night during a weekend trip to New York City. The room is very small. It looks modern, but not what I expected at all. But the location is great, just 2 blocks from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Good value for such a central location. The rooms are modern, bright, and clean. Despite being a busy place, we never had to wait long for an elevator. The staff were particularly friendly and helpful. Excellent choice if you want to be near Times Square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: stayed in king bed on 28th floor. For new york room was reasonable size but do no expect a large room. Great location for theatre district. Room spotless and great housekeeping. Elevators are super fast with little wait. New hotel and i guess they are trying to work out the kinks.Negatives: arrived by car at midnight - took 1 hour of standing in line to check in which i find unacceptable, left message for day manager whom never called back. No parking garage, while valet parking is offered a a reasonable price for NYC had to wait 1 hour for car to arrive on labour day monday.That being said woul definitely stay here again and great value for what you pay.Hopefully management will address above issue

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: So I just spent two nights here. So to start, the lobby was gorgeous, very well decorated, gave me high hopes for the hotel. The staff were very matter of fact, not pleasant nor displeasant at this point. They just did their thing and sent me on my way. I got out of the elevators and as walking to room all I could think of was I was in a dorm, or office building. When I got to the room, it was bright and airy as others mentioned. I had a double bed room as it was what was available. the two beds were pushed together. (see photo) I suppose if you were sharing the room you could redecorate but who wants to do that. As for this room I would not recommend it for any more then a single person or a close couple. The bathroom had a frosted glass separating the shower and the room, with the light source coming from beyond. So what does that mean? Shadow dancing. You can see everything that is happening in the shower if you were sharing the room. On top of that they left 6 shampoo, 6 conditioner, 6 wash and 6 lotions every day, very bizarre. There was hair left in my room on the floor from a previous occupant, and although the hotel is new, they painted it a flat white, which in the small rooms is already showing massive signs of suitcase rubbing against it. Pros: -Great location, 5 minutes from times square, 5 minutes to hell's Kitchen, just a few minutes to the subway-beautiful lobby-nice new bright buildingCons:-a double bed with the beds together-extremely utilitarian and sterile feeling-hair that wasn't mine- lots of scuffs and signs of wear for a new hotel So the big question, would I stay here again. Honestly probably not. There are so many good hotels in NYC, the price on this is average, and the overall just so so.....

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: King size Room on 8th floor overlooking corner of 8th Ave and 46th street. Clean fresh and bright.Well insulated and not disturbed by noise at night. Friendly and efficient staff. Room ready on arrival at 11.20am!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights Sept 16. Beautifully styled hotel, very modern room, although quite small, but perfectly adequate, loved the bathroom. Ironing facility, hairdryer, safe and fridge all available in room at no extra cost. Wi-fi was spot on, no problems at all. Good view from the 25th floor, could see a little of the billboards at Times Square from our window. Hotel lobby is beautiful, plenty of areas to relax or hang around. Check in and out was instant, no queues. Luggage was held following check out as we had a later flight. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food but plenty of great restaurants close by.For a great italian try Patzeria Family & Friends a couple blocks up on 48th Street - the food and atmosphere was great. We also stood inline at Shake Shack on 8th Ave as queued out the door every time we passed, great burgers and worth the wait.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great value. We had a wonderful stay in a very clean and comfortable room. Staff was very friendly. Location is close to everything. Highly recommend if you are looking to stay close to Times Square. Easy access to subway and bus lines. Room was on the small side, but that is expected for any hotel in Times Square :) Pillows and bed were extremely comfy, great black out curtains, noise level a little loud but expected for the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had the opportunity to stay for five nights in late August early September. The hotel is close to Times Square and some great restaurants and market eating areas. The hotel is busy and only on our last night did we have any trouble with noise with a guest singing opera at about 2am in the morning. Otherwise I cannot fault the hotel or the staff.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 1 night before a cruise and was very impressed with the hotel! It was clean, modern, and very comfortable! The room was small, but had everything we need! Great location too, just a short walk to Times Square! We'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A warning to travelers who like to send packages to the hotels where they stay. Unlike almost every other hotel in New York and the US in general, where the mail room will gladly hold packages for guests until their arrival free of charge, this Riu has recently implemented a new policy where they return packages to the sender if the guest in question will not be arriving within the next three days. If the guest in question is scheduled to arrive within this short time period they will charge her or him five dollars for each day they hold the package. As it is almost impossible to ensure the exact date a package will arrive, this new and surprisingly unfriendly policy means that those of us who like to take advantage of Internet shopping when we travel to the US will now have to do without.I am not sure if this has become a universal policy at all Riu hotels or just this one in particular.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First Observations: The sun-flooded, artistic, high ceilinged lobby and smiling, efficient, accommodating international staff are a welcomed sight after a long flight and the hub bub of transit from the airport. My wife and I travel to New York often and are seldom in our hotel room. The Riu Plaza New York Times Square was so inviting that we made use of the hotel's cozy bar, lovely modern patio, coffee shop and restaurant. We found the prices for meals / drinks a little high but this was offset by the unbelievably reasonable nightly rate for such nice accommodations. I believe we paid $175 / night...an unbelievable rate for New York, even for the most basic accommodations.Location: The property is on the corner of 8th Ave and 46th Street, right in the heart of the theater district and only a short block from the heart of Times Square. Surprisingly, the street is quiet most times of the day. The Rooms: Comfy beds, fresh, modern decor, floor to ceiling windows for lots of light, The bathroom area is spotless and has a roomy modern walk in shower. There was a small desk area and a large flat screen TV. We could not have been more pleased.As was shared, my wife and I are in New York often, and as such, we are aware of the range of prices for rooms in a great location. The Riu Plaza New York Times Square had the best room rate and location. The service was excellent. We could only assume that the great price (booked through Booking.com) was due to the property drawing attention to itself as it breaks into the New York market. I would highly recommend a stay at the Riu and I'll be returning on my next New York trip.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We are recently only back from this hotel and it was amazing. Bang central! times square is literally 3 mins away !! Such a gorgeous hotel inside .. breakfast is really good with a selection of everything to offer . Rooms are just comfortable size but always clean and tidy . Staff were friendly and helpful, there is a bus that comes to collect you at the hotel to take you to the airport if your leaving to JFK not newark. But as you are located in times square the bus to Newark is 5 mins away and then your journey can be up to an hour from this station. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After booking a hotel through hotwire for three people in one room, the hotel tried to give us a king sized bed. After I explained that it is supposed to be for three people,and that putting three people in a king sized bed is not only impractical it is not comfortable, they told me there is nothing they can do expect charge me an additional $76 a night for the room. The manager was extremely unconcerned, impersonal and rude. Hotwire even got on the phone with RIU corporate and was not able to get anything fixed. After a long drive from out of town, I had no choice except to pay the extra fee. The rooms are all tiny and the same size. The king sized bedroom is the same size as the one with the two full sized beds that were smashed up against each other. There was no room in between the two full sized beds at all. There was a pull out couch that when opened up you could not walk to the window or open the fridge. To charge me $76 for the same sized room when it was not even my mistake is obnoxious. The plus side was that the hotel was clean.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just one block away from Times Square, was great location. Family with three kids (9,11,13) was snug fit in room but it's New York and spent time exploring city on short stay. Modern room and bathroom. Recommend high floor. Staff all helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza recently. We use the Riu chain a lot but have never stayed at a Plaza before. The location is superb, really central but on a quiet street. We had a double room with 2 double beds. The beds were really comfy as were the pillows. Only one chair in the room, though there was plenty of room for two, maybe something could be done about this in the future. The toiletries in the bathroom were lovely and plentiful. As has been mentioned on this site the shower leaked but we simply used one of the many towels stop the water going everywhere. We found all the staff really helpful. Not a cheap hotel but then none are in this area. Would happily stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First the positive: great locationNegative: not friendly, overprized bar, even for NY standards small rooms, not soundproof at all. You can hear everything that happens in the hall. We stayed in NY before and in a RIU hotel before and this was not what we expected...

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location with stunning view. Room was small but a nice size for 1 person. The bed was huge and very comfortable. Nice shower even though there was some technicalities. Really nice modern interior - would recommend and will be staying again in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 5 days in middle August. Was a great base for exploring everything ny had to offer. Early morning runs in Central Park - reached in 10 minutes; Broadway; history museum and MOMA; Empire State and Rockefeller.... Ground zero/ Ellis island/ statue Liberty and Greenwich all walkable but takes about an hour as does Brooklyn bridge. Hotel was clean and modern. We had family room for 5 which included 2 doubles and a sofa bed. Not very spacious but as we used just as s base was fine for our needs. Gym was empty and well equipped. Location makes this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family of 5 stayed in this hotel in August. The hotel is situated right next to Times Square and is perfectly located for all major sights- Empire State, Top Of The Rock, Grand Central, Chrysler Building. The hotel was clean, modern and the staff were extremely helpful especially the bell boy. The rooms were very modern and even though we only spent 2 nights in this hotel, room service was daily, fresh towels being delivered.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I've been working in the hospitality industry long enough to know and understand how to deliver exceptional and memorable service no matter what environment you're in. However, I can easily say I have left with a memorable service one can write about... when it comes to respect and customer service this place left me fuming, from hotel bartender, to guest services, and yes even management. They all seemed as if they hated their jobs and you were their worst nightmare by just even looking their way. On the other hand, cleaners were on point, the hotel is modern and chic, well located, its a shame but not new a factor that the hotel staff are the ones dragging it down when it has the potential to be a boutique and modern luxury hotel. Just to touch base where it all began...They lost our reservation, made us wait, and not even for a second they felt like they cared a single bit to even apologize, and that is just 5 percent of what happened, really not worth talking about the rest, unless corporate would like to hear more about this. If I were the hotel General Manager I would terminate effective immediately the manager for starters, then properly train the staff with "basics" of service and hospitality! If you are looking for people to make you feel welcomed and special on your Birthday or any special occasion then do your self a favor and stay somewhere where people appreciate your presence and away from this gorgeous facility.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The RIU Plaza is a 5 minute walk from the middle of time square making it the perfect location for any holiday makers to stay. Check in/out was fast and simple. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were a decent size by New York standards and were very quiet considering all of the traffic below. There is a subway stop one block away allowing easy use of public transport. Wifi and other amenities included in the resort fee worked well.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 1 week as a family in a deluxe room, the hotel was spotless and extremely modern looking which I personally really like ! The service we received was fine no issues, our room was a little small compared to what we are used too and lacked a coffee machine which I believe is essential on a vacation, the gym was nice an like I said early it's wonderfully modern.Location is spot on so I would certainly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: New motel - very nice! Good size for New York standards. Very modern decor but still comfortable. We had 2 queen size beds. Bathroom smallish but a great shower. It did leak a bit outside the shower door but no big deal.There was a bar size fridge but no tea/coffee making facilities in the room (apparently common in the USA - a shock for Aussie's as we expect this in our motels). This made it rather expensive for the trip but worse - an inconvenience for the morning cuppa!The location was excellent!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel's got a great location just a few blocks always from Times Square, Broadway theaters, Port Authority Terminal, Fifth Ave and many other major NYC atractions. You may ask prior to your arrival for a room on the top floors to have a great view of the city and they'll give you one acording to availability.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is brand new. It was beautiful. The artwork, the atmosphere, the sleek deco in the rooms. The keycard to turn on the lights and tv was a great thing. The shower was different. 2 shower heads and we had to figure out how to get both to work. :-) We also had a leaking problem. The shower leaked into the "bedroom". We informed staff. They came once and looked at it and we thought it was fixed. It wasn't...still leaked. A new hotel should NOT leak!! When we called again the mechanic came and informed us he would recall it but it would take 8 hours to "heal". So...we waited to do it in the morning. We had 3 people in our room and there was really not a lot of space in the room. We figured with the price point there would be room and space, but there really was not! The location was perfect. Within walking distance to almost anything you could need!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here before & after a cruise vacation, the hotel was great lovely comfortable rooms, nice bar and great location 15 min walk to Central Park, 5 min walk to Times Square. Lots of restaurants & bars nearby too. Would definitely recommend & stay again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: On a recent trip to NY I stumbled upon a great new hotel.Knowing the Riu chain of all inclusive reports I wasn't sure how it would be in NY , but for one night I was willing to give it a try.What a mistake. A mistake that I didn't book it for the whole trip! Very impressive, brand new and as nice as could be.Next trip I will definitely stay there if If my schedule warrants the area.On a side note, I stay in whatever's area my first appointment is in so I sometimes stay in more than one hotel during a trip to avoid getting stuck in a taxi and end up later than normal.A little crazy but it works for me.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay at the modern Riu Plaza. It is right in the heart of NYC and 1 block from Times Square so perfect for going to the theatre. Purchased theatre tickets from the cut price "tkts" centre in Times Square which offers 50% discounts and all but the latest shows (Hamilton) were available during our stay.You can walk most to most places from the hotel - Rockefeller, Empire State and 5th Avenue shops are all less than 30 mins away. The Grey Line tour centre is also just around the corner so you can purchase tickets and get on the open top bus in 2 minutes. We took the uptown and downtown 48 hours hop on / off pass which was great to visit the likes of Central Park, Guggenheim and the 9/11 memorial within the financial district.The hotel provided excellent buffet breakfasts from 7 through to 11am which really sets you up for the day ahead and you are spoilt for choice with restaurants of all descriptions within a few minutes walk of the hotel. The hotel does a great value lunch menu at $12.50 if you are around.The hotel is very new and maintenance work is still ongoing here and there. Our junior suite room was very clean and bright with a king size bed and sofa bed. Both were pretty comfy and we had plenty of space for our needs. The shower was great, a very swish glass affair with lots of room. The room also had a large whirlpool bath which we never used and to be honest it was a waste of space but we did try it on the last day but the motor was faulty - not running for more than a few seconds.One other minor niggle, one blackout curtain wouldn't quite close so let light in early in the morning. We did report it but it was never fixed so take a clothes peg to clip it together! The sink unit had obviously had a serious water leak at some point with the wooden surround being badly swollen. A shame given the age of the hotel but some of the workmanship did leave a bit to be desired and the furniture was somewhat light and flimsy. On the plus side, the air con was cool and very quiet.We did buy an explorer pass at the hotel which got us into 7 different attractions at a reduced rate - very worthwhile, especially as it allowed us to bypass the normal ticket queues. Just look for the prepaid lines. They also arranged our return airport transfer by a company called volatour, we booked a 3 door sedan but he turned up in a sleek white and very long limo at no extra cost. A great end to the holiday.Big Tip, NYC does not do travellers cheques. We had a few left from a trip to Orlando where everyone accepted them but here Bank of America and Wells Fargo were the only 2 places we eventually found to exchange them.You can ask for a late check out on the morning of departure but there is no guarantee, we did get a complimentary 1 hour which meant a 1PM check out.Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here for its location and style. Just need to fix the teething troubles, minor niggles and sort out the maintenance issues - it could be almost perfect.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We visited the restaurant in the lounge and had a horrible experience. We were greeted by a person at the lounge area that directed us to a table. As soon as we sat down, they moved us to another seat because "that table was not ready. "We then were visited by our waitress who kindly gave us menus (but one of the menus contained simply the shell of the envelope and didn't have the menu details. )We asked her details about foods because we have food allergies. She was unfamiliar with the menu as it was her first day! We immediate asked to speak with the chef who did come our. The chef understood our allergies and our needs, and our waitress was there to take the order. However, they got 3 of the four orders wrong. We asked for the two steals to be medium well. They were both rare. We asked for roasted potatoes to be roasted with olive oil (instead of canola) and of course they were not. My wife's potatoes were supposed to come with a pesto and they didn't. We showed the waitress the steaks as they were far from medium well. We then worried about whether the potatoes used olive oil instead of canola. She went back to the chef and came back smiling in approval that they had used canola (completely unaware that we wanted it to NOT HAVE CANOLA). Then we asked for the chef to come out and look at the steaks. He did. He acknowledged that they were FAR from medium well. He then said that they were quite busy back in the kitchen and that with a new waitress they had a made a mistake and that they would correct it. So, he took the steaks back while my wife and son finished their foods. They returned the other two meals (the steaks) OVER DONE (burnt)!My daughter couldn't finish hers as it was too burnt. When we went to pay, a manager approached us an apologized. She offered a 25% discount. However, when they brought the bill, it didn't have a discount. She then corrected it and I have her my card, but the card processing machine wasn't working. I literally had to follow her to the hotel lobby to complete the awful transaction. Needless to say, I will never go there again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We came to the hotel and had been promised that our room reserved. "We overbook," was the answer they gave us since the room had been given away. They offered to put us in two separate rooms. The room we had was a so-called suite for three people. We took the two rooms. We would have been better off keeping the two rooms since the "suite" for three people was the same size the one room for two with a couch thrown in to sleep on making it impossible to maneuver in the space that was left. They did give us vouchers for breakfast; it is $24 per person for an all you can eat buffet. It wasn't great, to say the least. And later we discovered a restaurant at the port authority that was similar except it looked better for $15. When you have a room with more than one person, you must be aware that the bathroom are translucent, and you hear everything that goes on in them with an echo effect on top it. So if anyone gets up to go in the night, you will know from the light and the noise. The only good thing about this place is its location and believe me; they make you pay out the wazoo for it. They are better and more comfortable hotels in Manhattan for the same money. I recommend that you go there. The quality is a little like a very expensive dorm room.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is rather new and some things should have been taken care off better. Rooms are painted white and that is rather delicate. We also experienced some noise from the hall. Our room had two queens and a sofa, so the four of us had plenty of room. Unfortunately with this set up, there is not much space left for suitcases. I was positive about the concierge service, we used it to book hop on hop off tickets and our transfer to the airport. The bar is quiet, breakfast is not cheap. There is a small coffee and pastry shop as well.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We had just arrived after a 7 hour international flight and long ride from the airport the night we tried to check into this hotel. To us, it was 4:30 in the morning and none of us had slept on the plane. When we arrived, we were upset to hear that construction issues made our room unavailable. Surely this was something that could have been foreseen at some point within the preceding 24 hours but no attempt had been made to forewarn us. We were told, by TWO staff members, that we would get a credit on our card for this night. When we didn't see the credit on our account after two weeks, we contacted the hotel. They denied that anyone had made this promise.They offered a complimentary night for our next visit. When I explained that it would be unlikely that we would be back in NYC soon, they replied very curtly that this was all they would offer (along with a list of the restrictions of that offer). For a family with two small, jet-lagged children, this inconvenience led to many more inconveniences which seemed a little more tolerable with the knowledge that we would get compensation. We made spending decisions based on this expectation.We are so disappointed that they did not stand behind their staff's promise. Very poor customer service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, a block to time square and Broadway, great restaurants in the are, walking distance to hell,s kitchen. Modern looking, clean, nice rooms, rooms have a small fridge which is a plus, no coffee maker, but I thinks that is a NYC thing, make you pay for coffee. Nice bathroom.Hotel has a bar, restaurant, but with so many good restaurants around, we only went to the bar and the Grab and go for breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The washroom has a frosted glass exterior, and the door isn't a proper door but a sliding glass door. If you are going with friends or what not, and like basic privacy. I wouldn't book this hotel based on the sub-par doors and lack of privacy. If you're going alone. Bob's your uncle. If you're going with others, stay elsewhere.What were the designers thinking? They may be on trend with design and cutting costs, but not with what people want.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Got the chance to stay at the RIU Times Square during their soft opening in April of this year at a very convenient price! The hotel was not quite running with all services in place -the restaurant was not open yet - but there are so many places in the area this was not a problem. I believe the hotel is now fully running. The hotel itself was brand spanking new so everything was extremely clean. The beds were so comfortable, it was almost a pity to get up in the morning! We had a deluxe with 2 queen beds and the room was very spacious with a desk and small area with sofa. The bathroom was beautifully done and we particularly enjoyed the big shower. There was also lots of space to store luggage and hang clothes! I would go back to the RIU in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: There is nothing wrong with the RIU plaza as such, just nothing which gives it any character or sense of occasion. And there are some very helpful and attentive members of staff - it's just a shame that they weren't on duty when we arrived. I don't think I have ever experienced a more lacklustre and shambolic greeting - there was clearly a problem with our room, but no-one actually thought to talk to us clearly and directly and we were left standing for what seemed like an age feeling very uncomfortable and lacking any reassurance that all was going to be ok. There was no attempt to 'sell' their solution to us, and although we were given a free breakfast to compensate us for the fact that what we had booked (nine months ago!) was not available, I had to suggest (quite forcefully) that this might be a nice move, they clearly weren't going to offer it. The breakfast was fine, but nothing exciting - just like the entire place really. Rooms small, but clean and comfortable. Nice toiletries and generous provision of them. But very expensive for what it is.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: RIU is a beautiful hotel in a great location. Everything was very modern and clean. The entire staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms were small, which is typical in New York but they were very nicely decorated and very well kept. The only disappointment was the lack of privacy in the bathroom. The frosted door and shower did not offer much privacy. Walking distance to shows and Times square. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This beautiful hotel is nestled next to a Hershey's Candy store in Times Square. The lobby is beautiful. The service clerk was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. I had requested a lower floor and they wanted to put me on the 27th floor. So I asked them if they had anything lower. He searched and searched until he successfully found something on the 15th floor. That was just fine with me. Then I had something that I needed cut off of my wrist and another gentlemen came running over with a pair of clippers and proceeded to cut it off of me. They were great and very helpful. The hotel room was very nice. It had a very clean smell to it, the room was good size, the bathroom was full of toiletries, clean towels and with very plush bed spreads and pillows. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is on Time Square so it is so easy to just step outside and get involved in all of the activities that were going on. Make sure you visit the Hershey Store for some of their great Candy. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, anything that you need just ask them and it is yours. I only have one issue. The Buffet. We went to breakfast and the waitress wanted to know if we were on the Free breakfast list. We told her no, so she took us up a few stairs and sat us down at table and said then have the Buffet. Ok. that seemed ok, but what no one told us was the price of this Buffet. I went around the corner to the Buffet table was quite surprised. It was a long table with several pans with little candles under them. One of them had some eggs, another had bacon, and one had potatoes. You could toast some bread but the toaster did not brown it. So you had warmed up bread not even brown. You could have cereal, or a waffle. Then the bill came and it was $70.00 for two breakfast. I was so surprized. The free breakfast that you get at the Hampton Inn had more to chose from then this Buffet. So I learned my lesson, the next time I stay at this hotel, I will defiately not eat at their restaurant. This is the only bad think I can say about this hotel. The service was great, so was the location of the hotel, the rooms are clean and smell nice. I would stay here again, as it is so convient to the Subways, and entertainment just outside of your door. Great Hotel. Two thumbs up for me, just skip the reataurant if you are on a budget.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is lovely and modern. The staff are great. They were really helpful as when I arrived they didn't have note of my booking (which I did through British Airways 3 months prior). When I showed my proof they took copy of it and advised us not to worry about it, advised they would take it up with British Airways and gave us a room. The room was spacious, cleanliness great and decor lovely.The only thing I wasn't keen on is that it is a frosted glass partition which separates the toilet and room. This wall is next to the beds, so if your friend/partner gets up during the night for the toilet you can get woken up with bright light shining on you. (I thought it was the curtains opened and sun shining in.lol). If it would wake you up, you should maybe get an eye mask/cover.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I wanted to stay in New York for a Sunday into a Monday to see how New Yorkers Sunday-funday. I was looking for a hotel in the Times Square area so I could have easy access to Penn Station to take Amtrak back to Philadelphia and into work on that Monday morning. It a nice April afternoon when I arrived at the hotel from overnighting in Lower Manhattan. The hotel lobby was a hive of activity: guests checking in and guests waiting for rooms and curious folks popping in to check out the new hotel in Manhattan. First of all, the hotel is located a 4-block walk from the Times Square–42nd Street/Port Authority Bus Terminal Subway Station. The location really couldn’t be beat. I could go anywhere I wanted in NYC that the subway went from my location. With the subway, taxi or über for Sunday Funday with easy. The front desk clerk was busy checking me into my room, part of four clerks facilitating the line of guests. We had a brief chat about the opening of the hotel – the end of March – and they were in the middle of their soft opening – since the hotel restaurant wasn’t open.
