He was said by end of May the hotel would be officially opened. Because of the soft opening and to get all the kinks out, the rates were discounted at $114.99 a night. This is why I snatched the room up. The décor was very contemporary and the lobby was donned in sleek gray, silver and white fixtures with pops of lilac and red. There was plenty of room in the lobby to make yourself at home on the spacious black sofas. You can feel a hint of Riu’s native modern Spain in the atmosphere. The deluxe king bed felt sizeable for New York City due to the vast amount of white furniture and fixtures. The bathroom was tucked by the door and fitted with a translucent glass wall to let light pass but provide privacy in the shower. All these touches made the room feel spacious. The room was accented with cream and lilac and a piece of artwork emphasizing a NYC landmark. My view was straight down 47th Street and I could see the Broadway lights. At the end of the trip, it was safe to say that It was a very modern, comfortable room and hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Spent 4 nights here and were a bit apprehensive to stay given it's a new build. However, Riu did not let us down. Location was great. A 2 minute walk from Times Square- close enough to be amongst everything, but just further away enough to be awoken by the noise and walk home safely. Riu was walking distance also to Herald Square- another main area for shopping (where the original Macy resides). Cleaning service was great and no problems with the shower leaking, although I know of a room who did have this issue. A very modern hotel with generous sized beds, and state of the art amenities. It was great having a fridge in the room with fully working air conditioning as well. The concierge is very helpful! I recommend taking the subway to the Statue of Liberty.Overall would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Perfect central location and the bedroom was bright, airy and had a fantastic view and big comfortable beds. The staff are helpful, friendly and welcoming and the lobby and bar are lovely. 2 mins walk to Times Square and the bus stop for the hop-on hop-off bus tour is on the corner of the block. Didn't eat breakfast here, as it seemed very overpriced but had a great breakfast at Times Square Diner and Grill (48th and 8th). Have recommended this hotel to others and will stay here again without a doubt.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent 4 nights at the Riu Plaza and after reading previous reviews I was a little apprehensive but needn't have worried! The hotel is fab, the lobby is very impressive, check in took about 5 minutes (at 5pm). Our room was a family deluxe, 2 doubles and a sofa bed. Granted there wasn't much storage space but we managed fine with 2 adults and 3 kids inc a toddler! Beds were comfy, view over the Hudson River was amazing, bathroom was fab, shower never leaked once. I know some people have issues with the shower screen but it wasn't an issue for us, you can only see silhouettes when the lights are on. Housekeeping was spot on, air con throughout the hotel was very welcome! All staff were pleasant and helpful. We used the restaurant a couple of times, food was good, not the cheapest but worth what we paid. We used the grab and go cafe once, it's very expensive for what it is and I wouldn't use it again. The only gripe I would have is that the walls are thin and you can hear a lot, unfortunately our neighbours were rather noisy one night (kids running round screaming at midnight!), but after a polite word they settled down thankfully! All in all, we had a fab stay, location is so central, would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Worst check in experience. The staff is not professional. We have a RIU class diamond card, we requested early check weeks prior to our arrival, it's one hour past the regular check in time and still no room. The staff is unfriendly, and not professional..

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here 4 nights. The staff were helpful but the lunchtime service in the restaurant was slow. The room was clean but not large. There was limited clothes storage space but the room had a fridge. We had no issue with the frosted glass shower room - nice touch. One day housekeeping didn't leave us enough towels so we phoned the front desk and were told they would send someone up. No-one came but the next day housekeeping left us enough. My husband has to come to New York for business in September and would definitely stay there again but they have no availability for his dates.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is located in an amazing area of New York city , it is Big and beautiful. I really do recommend it for those who are excited to tour the Big Apple :) it is extremely close to the Broadway musical area , Time Square and a decent distance to central park. As I arrived I was greeted by a gentleman at the door who directed me to where I would be Assisted with my Luggage. I was assisted by a lovely gentleman by the name of Juan who was very friendly and professional. The staff as a whole were good and you can tell they enjoy their job. Once I was in our room , I noticed how truly beautiful the decoration were is a decent size room , the bathroom are extremely clean and modern.I had a partial view of time square were got a sneak peak of the lights and the movement that went on in the area. The only down part to our stay was the food my fiancee and i would've loved to have more options inside the hotel. But there are plenty of places around where anyone can grab a quick meal. Overall this hotel is nice and I definitely recommend it , Good JOb !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very well located , practically on Time Square. There's a large, elegant lobby and an inviting bar as one walks in. The rooms are small but very well designed so space isn't a problem. Unfortunately those that face 8th Avenue are quite noisy in spite of what appear to be good quality double glazing windows. I'm on the sixteenth floor at the moment and it's becoming clear that the favorite local pass time for drivers here in Manhattan is honking the car horn.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Small, noicy room.. Small street so if you dont hace space to park ussual in this part of manhattan is a mess to come ot of the car with luggage.No restaurant open after breakfast and a cafeteria that is a bad an expensive try of a starbucks... Don't bother!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a great stay at the Riu Plaza New York Times Square. The hotel is located in a great area with easy access to Times Square and Broadway. It's also close to the hop on and hop off bus routes, Central Park and various other tourist spots.The hotel is now fully open and has a lovely big, bright and clean reception area. Staff on the reception desk are efficient and helpful...some do still appear to be learning the ropes though. There is also a concierge service within the hotel where you can pick up city maps and attraction leaflets etc.The bar and restaurant area has a lovely relaxed atmosphere and we enjoyed a couple of meals which were well presented and tasty. The snack and evening meal menu within the hotel is also reasonably priced. Staff working in the bar area are superb and very friendly.Our room was clean, tidy and spacious enough, however, strangely didn't have any drawers therefore it is worth taking extra hangers with you for the wardrobe. There is also a safe, ironing board, iron, hairdryer and fridge in the room. The hotel also houses a cafe where both clients of the hotel and non guests can purchase breakfast items, sandwiches and coffee. The food and drink which is available is good however it can be busy due to the hotel allowing non guests to use the facilities...can mean standing in a long queue. But it is more economical than the $24 breakfast.Weighing our visit up, we will definitely return to the hotel and would recommend it to family and friends. Looking forward to returning.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This newly built hotel is right on restaurant row, across the street from my favorite restaurant, so I had to try it! It's lovely, nice size quiet rooms, great location if you are there for theatre. Probably the newest hotel structure in the district, if you need new!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The King room we had was amazing . Bright, clean, great view of the street. Located right on Restaurant Row - excellent location. We were able to check in early at no extra cost. The facility had a very modern look to it.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We really enjoyed our room and the views it provided. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Very quick and easy walk to Time Square and the Broadway shows. There were a lot of great little places to eat in the area. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked 2 night in Midtown Suite but when we arrived at the hotel there was no room available for two nights , only for one night. Because we had tickets for the Statue of Liberty for the next day we decided to take the room and search the next day after the visit on booking.com for a hotel for the night. So we booked one night in this hotel on may the 10th, we payed 178 US Dollar for one night. I signed for that amount and we get the key for the room. At night it was very cold because of the airco. There was only a sheet on the bed. On top of that there was a construction drilling on the outside of the hotel that made a terrible noise all night long. When i checked out that morning i told the lady on the frontdesk about it. Instead of listening to the comment she said tha i had to pay extra for the services they provide like Wi-Fi etc. ! I said that i don,t pay a penny more than i signed for and the manager came and said that they make a file and that we hear later if we have to pay or not. I was and am not amused about this hotel and for me personal i think it is to expensive for what you get. I stayed in much cheaper hotels in New York that provided much better service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I had a very bad experience during checking out at Riu Plaza Times Square. I write this review for people going with their car.The hotel doesn't have parking and you have to use valet parking. I stayed there from July 01 till July 4 for a total of 3 days. I gave my car for a valet parking. I paid during the check out for the parking fees. When I asked for my car, they took my voucher and I was told that waiting time is approximately 40 minutes. We waited in the lobby, and when the waiting time was abnormally long I asked again for my car. There were confusion and after some phone calls they told me they didn't find my voucher and I should go by myself to the parking IPARK on 48st w and that what I did. At the parking, They asked me to pay again but for 4 days because they parked the car at 2:04h PM and received the claim at 2:33h PM, so they charge one extra day. I was obliged to pay a total for 4 days at the parking lot again to get my car. I went back to the hotel, the manager was unable to explain to me why I paid twice for parking at the hotel and the parking lot? And she was unable to cancel the extra day parking charge despite the long waiting time at the hotel lobby. She canceled only the parking fees charged in double during the check out at the hotel. I believe when the hotel choose a parking, it should assure a minimal quality of service. I write my experience to help other people avoid the same situation. The manager was unprofessional.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location is excellent, a stone's throw from Times Square. Clean rooms and bathrooms, friendly service. Size is what you'd expect for a major city and fit one large suitcase and one small suitcase easily.Showers do flood the bathroom (many have already noted this) and request for more towels went ignored! But bathrooms were otherwise functional and made good use of a small space. Business centre printer wasn't working but staff kindly printed our documents at the front desk.Disappointed that we booked for my partner's 30th birthday and put that on the booking and there was no acknowledgement from staff about our trip for this special occasion.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The trip was great. To stay at Riu Plaza was even better. The hotel is new, modern and comfortable. Their rooms are beautiful. They hire good and friendly people. I felt pampered as soon as I stepped into the lobby. Special thanks to one of the staff - doorman Danny - who helped me with transportation, and directions. I greatly appreciate your courtesy and professionalism.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I've just stayed here with my partner for a week, I must admit I was really apprehensive to staying here after reading many bad reviews but our stay was great.We arrived at about 5pm so check in was easy, literally less than 5 minutes. However, they do take a security deposit of $200 on a credit card. Last time I came to New York, I stayed at the Wellington and they took a $70 security deposit from my normal debit card. So I was a bit surprised when the man said $200! But there was no problem and about 2 days after my departure the funds were released back onto the credit card.The room was clean and tidy, there was no dirty bedding. The room was cleaned every day, and we were left fresh towels. The shower does leak a little bit but if you shut the door properly, the only water leakage is when you step out of the shower. Other than that, the shower is actually quite amazing!I can see what people mean about the walls looking old, as there are a lot of black marks, but I guess that's what comes with having white walls!The wifi was really fast, just like having wifi at home. I face-timed home most days and had no connection issues whatsoever.We never ate at the hotel, so can't really comment on food. However, breakfast is advertised at $24 per person I think, plus taxes and plus a tip for the server! Instead we paid $9.95 for a breakfast buffet at Sbarro which was next door to M&M's world. Half way through the holiday, the hot water did go - the only thing we can say was a negative. When I called front desk, the woman did seem eager to get off the phone. She said she was aware of the issue and that they are working on it. So it was a cold shower that morning. When we got back to the room in the evening, it was ok heat wise, but wasn't ideal. The next morning it was back piping hot but the sink tap didn't run hot for the rest of the holiday. But it was not a major problem really.Check out was fairly easily too, they have an easy check out option but I was never told about this at the start so I didn't know how it worked. So I joined the queue in the lobby and was checked out within about 15 minutes.The hotel kept our luggage until 5pm when we were picked up from our transfer.Over all it was a really nice stay and I would be more than happy to stay here again! That being if the price isn't to rise, I would pay any more than what I paid during the 'soft opening'

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was apprehensive based on people's reviews of the staff. But the price was right so I booked anyway. Could not have been more pleased. Great location for access to theater district. Very clean and new hotel. The staff couldn't have been nicer (despite reviews to the contrary). I got there early expecting to just check my bag but my room was ready and I was checked in minutes later. (To be fair though, at 3:30 when I returned a bus had just dropped off a lot of people so there was a long check in line) But I can only speak for my experience. Every staff member was very nice. I couldn't figure out how to turn on the AC. The young man at the front desk talked me through it in 30 seconds and we had a good laugh over my missing the obvious. The bartender was sooo nice, she made me my special mocktail and it was delicious. At night when I returned seemed like a lot of staff covering the elevators and each and everyone said good night to me. I felt very safe. My room was super clean. Not huge but I had room to maneuver. (I spent little time in the room other than to sleep). I was on the 11th floor facing 8th avenue and did not hear a sound. The bathroom was clean and nice. I would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
pcthrpy
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location is perfect for spending time near Broadway. You could not get a much better location. It is a Spanish chain and most people working there speak Spanish.The decor is beautiful and the room was very small but tastefully decorated. The thing that is not great is the amount of time taken to obtain your car if you park with theirservice. It took about 45 minutes at 5 pm. The price was $46 which is a value for 24 hours in NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Brilliant location - pristine interior - bright entrance and welcoming staff - building easy to spot - adequate size room - fabulous bathroom albeit a fun style glass cube - excellent. Cost $90 taxi single from Newark. Great choice of eateries and convenient to Broadway theatres.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here 5 night with my husband on our first trip to New York. I thought the location was great for us, as we were sightseeing. It's near the Theatre District and Time Square, about 5 min walk from each. We got the NYCAirporter to the Port Authority Bus Terminal and just walked from there, it's about 10-12 mins walk away. The hotel is really big so you can spot it rising above the other building as you approach. It's a newly built hotel, very Morden and spacious. They have a bar/restaurant which looked really nice but we didn't go in and a coffee shop which was quite reasonable for coffee and snacks. Staff were really friendly our whole stay, always someone there to great us. The bellboy will look after your luggage once you've checked out if you have a later flight or whatever. The room was modern, clean and tidy with a gr at big window looking out onto the Main Street which was great to see the bright lights and the goings on if the city. Don't worry, they have blackout curtains too though! They provide plenty of towels, nice bigs ones as well as shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and body lotion, which were all lovely. My only thought would be that the bathroom is basically a big frosted glass box within your room, you can see the silhouette of whoever is in the shower and the glass sliding door didn't completely seal shut so depends how comfortable you are with your room mate! so if you like a bit more privacy when you are using tha facilities it's might not be the best for you - there's a big to so you can always pop the TV on though! This didn't bother me but thought back to being in that 'new relationship stage' I might not have been so happy about it then. Overall though I thought the hotel was great and I'd more than happily stay there again. There was loads of food and drink places near by, including some quieter side street too. Also the Grey Line City Sightseeing bus has a stop just on the opposite corner so was super convenient for our bit of sightseeing. You also get free wifi access too!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My wife and I recently visited New York and stayed at the Riu hotel on 46th / 8th Avenue from June 7th until June 17th, (10 nights). What an excellent choice it turned out to be. We were aware that the hotel had only recently opened and like all things new there was an air of trepidation which was soon laid to rest. The hotel was chic, tastefully decorated and our room 802 really nice and quiet. No police sirens or hooting also great air-con which was appreciated, in light of the high outside temperature.The glass walled shower room was a nice touch. The hotel is situated in an ideal location with easy access to Times Square and Broadway and the Metro. The hotel restaurant had recently been opened and was really nice with well presented food. The bar area is comfortable and well stocked and requesting a non alcoholic drink was never a problem. The staff were very welcoming and our thanks go to Luis, Jason Maria, Desiree and Marcia who throughout the 10 days made our stay relaxing due in part, with their friendly attitude.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: No ice bucketsNo coffee makerHad to call every day for linensFloors not cleanedShower stall is frosted glass so everyone in room can see you taking a shower at nightGo to another place - not there

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We chose this Hotel, being newly built but the rooms are too small and toilette is also very very small, its look like we are in Europe. It do not gives a feel of America.Check-in is very late after 3pm, we are a family of 4 travelling from INDIA, having 4 suitcases, the suitcases are even unable to fit in the room. Their left no space to walk.Staff is nice and helpful. I have requested for Laundry service but after 24hrs they have returned it back without laundry, which you do not expect from a Luxury Hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Poor professionalism from check staff at front desk.Lovely hotel cleaners, and pleasant guys at front desk taking the luggage. Holiday was tarnised by the hotel trying to charge me twice and it took repeated communication with UK based travel company to sort this out and clarify the situation.Front desk staff need further training in dealing with customer complaints and resolving accomodation / reservation problems. Clean rooms, comfy bed , good location, no water in room / ability to make tea . Feel the stay should have been 4 stars not the one am giving today. !!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Beautiful new hotel close to Times Square. The door men and bell boys were amazing but the front desk people were hard to understand, interrupted a lot and I found people on the street knew more about locations. Our shower leaked into the main room and upon check out they Sprung us with a further $65 service fee for using the wifi which we assumed was free (it's free every where else!)Air con was a bit dodgy and the bed felt like it was going to break every time you sat on it. Great hotel if you don't plan on staying in the room long.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and parents. I cannot fault this location, you cAn see the bright lights of Times Square from your room (if your up high). It's very modern and chic and the rooms were lovely. Big comfortable beds and all the amenities you need including a fridge! Shower was powerful and room decor was lovely. Reception is nice too although the staff could have been a little more happier? Did not use breakfast and only used bar once. There is a nice outdoor bit where you can find and eat but again I didn't use therefore didn't like the fact I hAd to pay a resort fee. There are too many nice places in nyc to eat so why eat in hotel. My only other complaint was that I didn't get room near my parents. We were separated by 9 floors even though we were on same booking. Surely they can see their bookings before hand and try and accommodate? But it didn't spoil our fun. I would come back to this hotel. Rq a high floor for nice views!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at this hotel last week, 15th & 16th June. It is less than a 5 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel is new modern & stylish. The rooms are very clean although a little small, with no tea or coffee making facilities, but this is New York. I was on the 28th floor at the top of the building. The views were great. The bed very comfortable, the staff friendly. If I happened to be going to NY again this is where I would choose to stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We have just returned to UK after a week at the Riu. Yes there's a fee and yes it's new and developing but it's a lovely hotel, great bar and restaurant and a rare outside patio which was a great place to kick back after a late night with a a few top shocks! Staff were great. Check in on time with no hassle, room was bigger than I had imagined after some of the negative reviews. Shower, bed, TV all high standard. Nice views and brilliant location. Diane reade round the corner, grayline bus company and others stop on 8th a few feet away, great Irish bar across the road with a roof terrace. A few minutes walk to Times Square which is far enough away to be honest. Not on a subway line but a short walk to 49th or 42nd street. Great pizza options for the slice addict nearby. Brilliant diner along on 9th avenue called Galaxy diner for breakfast. Highly recommend a number 9 smoothie! Awesome as they say over there. If your in any doubt take a chance it is our third trip and by far the best hotel we have stayed in. Yes there have been negative rviewsabout the shores flooding etc but that didn't happen to us. Just a really nice experience and the hotel made the holiday special. will have no problems recommending to anyone. Also very quick access to Newark via taxi. Win win.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: hotel is nice clean and very well located, rooms are quiet, the elevators are fast car parking available next streetthe staff is friendly and the area is safeI will say this hotel is very good and if I have to stay in new york again will stay here

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Booked this hotel 3 months ago from Australia. I should have known better as there were only 2 reviews at that point & both said the same thing. Turned up for there booking only to find they hadn' t opened for business yet. I asked my agent to check before booking it to make sure they were open for business. She did this & all was good, so booked the room & they were very happy to accept it. One week before we were to arrive & our holiday already commenced we recieve an email from our agent informing us they were over booked & had moved us to a differant hotel. (Not happy) All complaints fell on deaf ears. I do have to mention though that they gave us our first nights accommodation in the new hotel for free. Turns out they are only partially operational & still have a fair way to finish but they are still taking as many bookings as they can. Make sure you have a back up plan.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of the hotel is great! Easy walk to the heart of Times Sq, Theater District, Rockefeller Center and the subway. And, if you are taking cruise out of Manhattan, like we are, very convenient to the piers. Customer service was great! We had a pull out sleeper and we realized it did not have sheets on it. When I called to request them, the employee not only insisted in pulling the bed out for us and making it, she also checked our towels, toilet paper and other bath needs and replenished everything. Without us even asking! They also stored our luggage before check in, as we arrived at the hotel about 5 hrs early due to a early flight. There are a few cons to this hotel though...sometimes modern is not practical for families. The tempered glass shower enclosure is what separates the bathroom from the main room. It can be interesting when you are traveling with your family that includes teenage boys. Though you really only do see shadows while showering, it's just weird. Also, an all white room is not going to wear well with suitcases and such constantly hitting up against them. To be a brand new property, walls were already fairly scuffed up. Overall though, I would stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in the beginning of June, really have nothing to complain about :) We were very happy about this hotel, room was clean, plenty of towels and everything u need in the bathroom! Beds were very comfy as well, room was a bit small for 4 people (family room) but when in NYC the only thing u need is a good bed to sleep in and a good shower so double check! Staff was very friendly and helpful! And the location... just perfect! Close to Times Square but not noisy! You can even walk to Central Park, really in the centre of Midtown... would def stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This place is close to all tourist-oriented attractions you expect to see around Times Square. The very hotel doesn't offer breakfasts, but has a small cafeteria downstairs (with basic pastry and drinks), as well as a lounge bar. Rooms are neat, nothing to complain about. I had some issues with the staff - they gave me a wrong receipt (I was in a hurry to the airport to check it) and we had some confusions with payments, which was a major downside - apart from it, a good place to stay if you don't plan to stay indoors for a long time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location, new and updated. Right in the heart of all the action. Would have given five stars but had some issues with service after normal hours. Requested extra pillows from front desk - told they would be right up 45 minutes later I called and cancelled. Walls are a bit thin and noise carry on the halls- request a family friend floor if your not planning on a party yourself.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed in May at this new hotel rooms are nice but we had air conditioning problems and there is no ice!! They urgently need ice machines on all floors. Location is excellent just a short walk to times square.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Had a really good experience at Riu Plaza (still have no idea how I should be pronouncing it after 5 days there). Staff were friendly and helpful, particularly when advising on when we needed to be picked up by the shuttle to get to the airport in time. It's a great location if you're planning to spend your time on broadway - about 5-10 minutes walk to all the major theatres. And with loads of great places to dine with in the same block.The rooms were all clean and tidy, with a decent amount of space. Beds were comfortable. We were only on the 6th floor, so we still got a bit of noise at night from the street, but not enough to majorly disturb sleep.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived early no rooms ready, we went out out came back 2 hours later (check in should be 3 we arrived back at 4). Rooms still not ready. We had 4 rooms booked all our rooms were changed (due to not the correct sleeping arrangement or not ready). There is only 1 lift that will take you to floors 29 and 30 away from all other lifts and not told. After a day out in New York came back to find that one of the rooms had not been closed after being cleaned and open to anyone. House keeping left to somewhat desired. Reception lacking knowledge of their computer systems. No Glasses in rooms.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After reading some negative reviews about service and room size we felt a little apprehensive about our booking here however we found the complete opposite from some reviews. Our delux double was a good size with plenty of room for sitting on the settee and sleeping. TV and air conditioning worked fine. Very clean and everything new which was lovely. Beds very comfortable and we slept well. For a hotel so central it was very quiet, we were on the 8th floor and had no problems with the lifts. They came quickly and provided an efficient service. The staff were polite and helpful and we had no problems checking in or out, very efficient once again. The doorman was particularly helpful in recommending good breakfast diners and with directions. Bar was open until midnight and staff were friendly. Foyer and bar were very modern and spotless. Location was great, near to everything but a very busy area if you like the quiet life it may not suit. Great restaurants nearby with an enormous choice of price and food. We ate very well! Only things hotel could improve on were, tea and coffee in room would have been nice but there was a coffee shop in the foyer, also a different design of bathroom door. Ours was sliding with a gap so privacy was lacking, a proper closing door is needed on a bathroom. We did not have a problem with the frosted glass walls, you could only see shadows from bedroom. The design was lovely but not really practical for people sharing who are not couples. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We nearly changed hotels after reading some really bad reviews but decided to stick with it. We're so glad we did. This hotel didn't disappointment. New, modern, clean. Our room was bigger than expected with plenty space around the bed. There's a double wardrobe with full width hanging rail and a shelf above. The toilet had a long shelf under the sink so plenty room for the toilet bags. Water leaking from the shower wasn't a problem as we used the smaller shower head and not the big rain shower head. The window had blackout curtains, net curtains and plain curtains so the room was dark during the night. The only very small negative is the only available electric socket near to a mirror is in the toilet. Not handy for hair straightners when you're partner is waiting to use the toilet. There's a full length mirror in the bedroom but the socket is about ten feet away. The reception staff are great but the security men in the foyer didn't ask to see a room keycard so anyone could enter from the street. Wifi was a good strong connection even on the 24th floor. Overall I'd have no hesitation visiting again and would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I have just spent 5 nights (6 days) at this hotel and would recommend it. We had read the reviews before we went but had already booked the hotel a few months ago so just accepted that with it being a new hotel it might have a few teething problems. I will answer some of the negatives people had posted.The hotel has a strict 3pm checking in time and generally go to that we had arrived about 2pm and just had a coffee and cake while the hour passed. It is true we had travelled from the UK so it was a 6-7 hour flight and then the train from Newark Liberty International airport to 32nd street and then a short (about US$12.00) ride to the hotel but that fine as the hotel posts check in is 3pm. We took our room on the 27th floor over about 2.45-2.50.We did have difficulty with the air conditioning but that was down to us not been able to operate it. Once we found out how to operate it, it was good. Maybe the hotel could place instructions in the rooms on how to operate the air con. The shower was excellant and although some posters have said the showers leaked we only had a problem if we did not close the cubicle door correctly.All the staff we came in contact with were really helpful and a special mention to the lady in the cafe who went out of her way to make you feel at home. She will know who she is but just to make sure she did have a problem with her right arm which when we came home was heavily bandaged.Rooms were well cleaned and the meals in the restaurant were in my opinion quite reasonably priced for the area.Some posters have mentioned noise and maybe because we were on the 27th floor we did not have any problems but I suppose the hotel could fit darker coloured curtains as it is quite light in the rooms.Rooms are small some people said but I would say average size for a large city and even some said no place to put your suitcases. We had two large suitcases and one went in the closet on the top shelf on its side and the second was stood up beside the ironing board in the closet so no problems.The young man on the door got us a taxi to take us back to Penn Station and while we waited we chatted about the upcoming presidential election and the upcoming UK referendum and it was good to hear a outsides view on the stay or leave campaign in the UK.The location for the theater district is great as the hotel is on West 46th street and 8th avenue with Times Square less that 5 minutes walk away.I would definitely use this hotel again on my next visit to New York.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel was great. Can only comment on room as we didn't eat there. Bed was queen size and very comfortable. Room serviced everyday. The odd minor issue or request we had to call reception for was responded to promptly. We would stay here again, no concerns at all. The only negative comment I have was that I emailed the hotel before our visit as I was worried about some reviews on the hotel. I wanted reassurance as this was a special trip. My email wasn't responded to!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Being a travel agent, this review is consistent with neighboring hotels near Time Square. I gushed about this hotel to my colleagues in the travel industry and it takes a lot for me to gush, as I see many hotels and resorts all over the world.BRAND NEW, lobby is sexy, modern and chic all rolled into one. LOVED the decor (check out my pics) with swanky seating in the lobby, COOL lounge/restaurant, street side coffee shop for people watching,what else do you want? OH yes, the rooms, little smaller than possibly the Marriott Marquis, BUT well equipped. Great comfy King sized bed, nice TV, great rain shower with separate hand held, one sink but nice storage. Has hair dryer and ironing board with iron. Desk had outlets but no USB as is common in new hotels. FREE WIFI worked GREAT. There is a daily resort fee of around $13.00 per room per night.Bathroom is not huge, has a frosted glass wall that separates the bedroom and bathroom, can't see anything, just shadows. We had the top floor with a partial Hudson River view and sky scraper view, outstanding to see at night. Located...less than 3 minute walk to restaurant row and Times Square, GREAT LOCATION and 3 minute walk to Subway.We also had dinner one night (have to review the food as well) and I have to say, best hotel/restaurant dinner I have had in a long time. FRESH Grilled Fish is what I had and my hubby had 12 ounce steak, so tender and juicy. We ate in the brightly lite courtyard which was quiet if you did not want to hear the bar/lounge clients. Pricing is LESS than most restaurants nearby, so worth a try if you stay here.I WILL be going back there FOR SURE!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel was everything we hoped for. Nice View, close to main streets, the Intrepid, subway, etc...They were still "building" the hotel, but from the top floor no noisy.The clerk and doorman were great advisors for our escapes around in the city.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Not sure what all these people are moaning at...hotel is completely beautiful and the staff were nothing but super friendly and helpful...even printing boarding passes for us! The room was great, as was the shower, it never leaked however if it did a towel at the door might be an answer! Location is perfect and we never heard any noise from outside. Rooms were cleaned daily and toiletries topped up.As an improvement I would maybe suggest some form of drink to be available in the room. Everything else was perfect, gutted to be home. If I am to ever go New Yprk again I would love to stay here!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just returned from this hotel and was impressed with the rooms and reception. We had a low floor(we asked for a high floor before we arrived) at the back so not much of a view but it was quiet. Staff are still finding their feet as the hotel is new so they need to up their game a bit. Left shopping bag in room, contacted the hotel 3 times on my return to see if they found it but they never got back to me. Quite disappointed with the service., Concierge does not start until 9am which is late if you want out and about and was not very helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent last week there and we were a bit worried after reading some of the reviews. Glad to say the worries soon disappeared. The room is bright and well decorated with a comfy bed, good toilet and shower and the sound proofing against street noise is far better than the last hotel we were in on 8th Avenue.Some previous complaints were about the white walls in the rooms having marks on them already. There is a skirting board around the room and to me the marks on the walls are being caused by people careless with their luggage.The shower leaked slightly but that's caused by the water running down the inside of the door and out onto the floor. I mentioned this at reception and was immediately offered another room. An extra towel along the bottom of the door solved the problem and towels were changed every day. Anyway, it's hardly fair to blame the management and staff for a design fault. The sink has a large shelf underneath so no problem placing toilet bags. Complimentaries were renewed every day.The only sounds we heard in the corridor at night were made by people who came in late ( no problem with that) but then they didn't care who heard them shouting or banging their door.The staff were very friendly and smartly dressed and seemed to us to be efficient, especially Hansel who went the extra mile when we were having trouble arranging our airport transfer.He stayed on the 'phone to the shuttle company for a very long time and when he solved the problem he even brought the information up to our room.We never even looked at the restaurant menu after paying $21 plus tax for a small glass of wine and a beer which was not much more than half a pint. That was the only time we were in the bar.For anyone who wants a light breakfast visit A Slice of New York Pizza Cafe which can be found 2 minutes outside the hotel. Turn right into 8th Avenue and it's 2 doors along. The pastries in the morning and pizzas at night are very good. Last but not least wi fi is excellent.All in all we would definitely go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: An amazing hotel at the center of New York. Just 2 minutes away from Times Square. Rooms were very clean, neat, beautiful, with very nice view and many amenities. We asked for a higher level just for better view and the stuff happily satisfied our desire. Very nice decoration at the reception and in the rooms. This hotel must be very new or recently renovated. I highly recommend Riu plaza hotel at Times Square for everyone.... Thank you for our pleasant stay there!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We just recently stayed here 1st to 5th June & while the hotel itself is fab there are a few things they need to sort out. First of all check in with barely any line took far too long... We were 25minutes in total at the desk checking in & then we discovered that because we had two reservations (first one for 1st to 3rd & second one for 3rd to 5th, we decided to extend our stay 2months BEFORE we went on holidays) we had to come back to the desk on the 3rd, check out & then check back in which took another 25minutes, surely with modern technology they could of just checked us in the first day for all 4 nights!! But that aside, the room itself was lovely, very modern, loads of space, fab rain shower, very comfy bed, fully working air con, full cable tv. The hotel is literally 1ave over from Times Square. The fashion bar is ridiculously expensive, $15 dollars for a glass of prosecco, needless to say we didn't spend too much time there. Right around the corner on 9th avenue you have an array of pubs & restaurants for you to choose from so I'd suggest going there if you don't want to pay a fortune for a few drinks. Just also be mindful of the resort fee which is $25 per night & only covers the gym, wifi & cleaning, it does not cover calls like other hotels. Overall we were very satisfied with the hotel & we would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Although this new hotel is situated near to Times Square it has a quiet and less hectic feel about it. The reception area is modern and welcoming with clean bright decor and the bar and cafe off the lobby are both comfortable and clean. Our room on the 23rd floor was spacious and had great views over rooftops towards the river. The room was spotless, with super comfortable bed and pillows. There was a fridge, and an ironing board/iron and safe in the closet. The shower room had everything you needed. (Yes the shower design did mean that water leaked onto the floor but we used a towel to mop up. No problem! The toiletries were nice but the tall, slim bottles kept falling over!)This hotel is in a great location near to lots of bars and restaurants. It is a new build so some "snagging" can be expected but It didn't in any way detract from our overall positive experience.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here recently 5 consequtive nights with my friends. I was aware of the pre-opening clitches and some bad reviews before arriving but I still wanted to see it myself. Okay, first of all if you want to stay at the Times Square, it really can't be much more central for this price. And yes the prices overall in NYC are insane considering that the price you pay, in many other cities with the same amount of money you would be pampered like a king. RIU Plaza makes a good effor though, however the decor is a bit too mix of Asian colors and European minimalistic style making it look a bit cheap for my opinion. You can see that the hotel has been built in a cheap way. Especially the corridors leading to rooms are really pale and naked without any carpets. So ALL the noices will come to the rooms. Elevators on the other hand are super fast, which is nice! Wifi also is a bit unstable and it's annoying to put the password all the time.We had a double queen room for 3 people so it was okay with two big queen beds. We all could open our luggages and you can still move at the room so that was okay:) Bathroom is modern and minimalistic style. Overall the room is fine and the beds are comfortable. There is a small gym downstairs which could need some heavier weights and more machines. Now I would call it more like a gym room.Our stay was fine and I could return if the price do not get much higher after the pre-opening. When traveling with friends, RIU is a good choice.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great hotel for visiting new york city. Every highlight is at walking distance. Rooms are not that big but luxurious. Nice food. Great service and people. Roomview is a big plus. Would recommend it to anyone

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Wow what a beautiful hotel updated and modern with decent size rooms for NYC. Upon check in 2 guest in front of us at 6:30 pm (check in is 3pm) had to wait for rooms to be ready, surprisingly they said ours was ready. Our room was nice and new and bathroom was great except we notice the shower floor had not been updated and had very old rust orange tiles. Ok fine until I turned on the shower to warm up the water, turned around a minute later and water was flooding bathroom. Called maintenance and they brought a bunch of towel to soak up and to create a barrier in the shower so we could shower (it was 11:45pm). We ran the water again and it went over the barrier and flooded our room and our luggage! Seriously how can you rent a room that doesn't have a working shower???? We called the manager who offered to change our room, which we did in the am just so we could shower!!! It took us an additional hour to change rooms with front desk visits and the packed elevator!!! We again spoke to the manager who said she would work out compensations, but were told the hotel general manager couldn't do ANYTHING for us and gave us the email for corporate RIU- Really????? I have email them 6 times, called RIU corperate, and called the hotel directly and have gotten nothing in response and NO compensation. Don't waste your time staying here there are so many great hotels in NYC to choose from.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The RIU Plaza Times Square is a brand new hotel just steps away from Times Square, great restaurants, and theaters. The hotel is decorated modern with a touch of minimalist. The rooms are on the small side, but par for NYC hotels. However, they make the most of the small space; mini-fridge is located underneath the nightstand, desk is at an angle to allow room to walk around the bed, desk chair has square legs to allow the garbage can to slide underneath, bathroom vanity is a slab allowing towels, toilet paper to be stored underneath. The beds are very comfortable and the comforter/sheets were soft and clean. To conserve energy the lights/air conditioner only work if you place your room key in the slot by the door.The doorman were helpful and courteous, the front desk employees not so much, there was an imposing security guard checking room keys before you could go near the elevators.Cons: No carpet in the hallways, you could hear tapping of shoes from people coming and going at all hours of the day and night. The adjoining room door had a gap underneath it, so light came into our room, I had to shove a towel under the door to sleep.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: An impromptu trip to NYC made possible by an airline voucher and an online deal for the "soft open" of Hotel Riu. Um - WOW! All I know is that I don't usually stay in places this nice... especially not steps from Times Square!!! We came in for a whirlwind 36 hours to see 3 Broadway shows and walked EVERYWHERE from here! Even better, our room was spotless, even the standard view was great (um, Times Square!), and the staff was super-friendly and helpful! Overall just a spectacular experience - how everyone imagines NYC should be done, but then gets there and realizes they can't afford it - well, at least at the soft open, we did!P.S. The only caveat I would say is that the hallways are stark and echo-y. When there were very few people on our floor (they told us some floors weren't even complete yet), it wasn't much of a bother, but if you had a packed floor - well, we were around the corner, down the hall, and the second to last door away from the elevators and we could hear everything anyone said even at that distance! Maybe they hadn't finished sound-proofing!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Amazing location just couple blocks to Times Square. The Deco is clean and modern. great customer service especially Glyndy at front desk, she was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are decent size for NY and Wifi was good. Would Def come back to this hotel .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: New hotel. good service. Best location at Times square . Staff are also nice and helpful. All rooms which we have booked like Deluxe Family Twin - 2 Double Beds And 1 Sofa Bed - Twin Family Deluxe all are very well .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Located just a block away from Times Square. This is a brand new hotel , the interiors are warm and nice and the Lobby is big and gives a welcome feeling, rooms are reasonably good for New York Standards. Breakfast is quite good and so is the service.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is at a good location close to Times Square. Unfortunatly the desk is working more than slow and it took us 30 minutes to check in. Rooms are rather small, but okay. You will hear everything going on in the street, the windows are not thick enough.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having read a number of negative reviews about this place we were a bit apprehensive about our stay there. On the whole we were happy with our stay here. The Rui Plaza looks great on arrival with a bright spacious hallway.We arrived around 1.00pm and checked in straight away - no queues! We were also able to go to our room early as it was ready. The room was bright and tasefully decorated. Comfortable bed, good storage space and a decent sized bathroom with a shower.After showering the first morning, water had seeped out onto the bathroom floor and into the hall of the bedroom area. We reported this to reception and was told that this was a teething problem in many of the room. A repair was carried out and the following day there was water on the bathroom floor only. After another visit to reception another repair was carried out. After that there was still a little waster seeping out.The breakfast bar was open and on the first two days a continental breakfast was available. On subsequent days a selection of hot food was introduced and the price of the buffet went up to $24, plus service. The quality of the food was mostly good, but I feel the price was expensive - but then I found most prices in New York expensive!The staff in reception and the breakfast bar were fine. The situation of the hotel is very good - just 5 minutes to Times Square.You also have to pay for wifi which worked fine.I would be happy to stay here again, but would look for somewhere close by for breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We knew when we booked into this new hotel that it was a soft opening. Now a soft opening means that the rates are lower but that the hotel is testing themselves in running the hotel. So all in all we did expect some hiccups here and there, but on the other hand we had an affordable deal. We were given a room with a balcony! What a view! Only very few rooms have a balcony so I suggest you inquire about this. The room was small, - nowhere to put your suitcase, but it was also modern and nice. There were a few design flaws which I wouldn't have expected from a new hotel, and I hope there is an embarrassed designer somewhere behind it. The cupboard with the mini fridge was too big, so it reached over the window and the curtain couldn't open at that end. The shower was leaking out on the bathroom floor. The bathroom door could not close 100%, so it was open for all sounds etc. The concierge's room for storing suitcases was much too small and they did not have a system how to store the suitcases (one big mess).I hope quality control or snagging will fix all these flaws in the near future. When you enter the hotel there is a bar/restaurant on the left. This is a very smart place, white and beautiful design with posh toilets. I really liked this place - with friendly staff.The hotel is situated within 5 minutes walk to Times Square, Very convenient to move around, also by metro/subway. However can I suggest that you learn all about the subway before you enter the train station as there is no help anywhere, nor in the trains. Bring a subway map.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First the good points...Location is great. On Restaurant Row, between Hell's Kitchen and Times Square. Walking distance to Port Authority. Beautiful new hotel with attractive lobby and public spaces. Our room was on the top (30th) floor, corner room with a great view. Room was small, but nice, clean and modern. Beautiful glass enclosed bath with a shower. The first issue we encountered was after what we thought was a seamless check-in with the front desk. When we reached the elevators we were told they weren't functioning and we would need to use the service elevator. Not a big deal, it was just around the corner and we just had a couple of bags we kept with us. However, when we got around that corner there was a long line of guests waiting to use it. We waited several trips before making it on. Once on the elevator we noticed it only went as high as the 28th floor. We exited there and looked for stairs. A housekeeper directed us to a staircase. After climbing the 2 flights, with our bags, we found ourselves on the roof! Not a rooftop meant for guests, but the roof. We turned around and went back down. We found another housekeeper who brought us to a different set of stairs. These stairs did bring us to our floor, but not a good first impression! The elevator issue continued throughout our 3 night stay. They weren't always down, but frequently. We also learned there was a specific set of elevators to reach the 30th floor. Something the front desk failed to advise at check-in. One time we were waiting for this elevator for several minutes behind other guests. There were bellman and other staff milling about. No one mentioned that the elevators weren't functioning! I had to go and ask the front desk, who insisted that they were functioning. Nope. On our 2nd night the fire alarm went off at 1:30AM. It was a loud alarm and rang repeatedly. After several minutes there was an awkward announcement not to leave your rooms. That the issue was being investigated, but there was no danger. The alarm and subsequent awkward announcements continued for the next hour. There was never any acknowledgement of this inconvenience. No complimentary anything. Another issue had to do with housekeeping. Every time we would return to our room after housekeeping had serviced it, the room would be unlocked. Every time. The door needed a tug to lock properly, and they clearly were not aware. The last thing I'll mention, and this is just odd, we witnessed housekeeping staff cleaning a large area of floor by the elevators using their feet and scrub sponges. Pushing the sponges around with their feet. They don't have a mop?? There was a general feeling of inexperience and lack of training. The staff seemed unable to deal with the many issues they were facing. I would recommend staying away for a while.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having stayed here from the 9th to the 20th May - I have complained to RIU customer service for 2 weeks now without any response to my emails. GREAT SERVICE - ruin someones holiday and then just ignore them after....I am now writing this review so other people do not encounter the issues we did. First and foremost this hotel service is shocking and they don't deserve to be open.Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 11 nights. Worst hotel stay ever - encountered problems on a daily basis. I have a letter of support from Joana Tormo Calatayud (General Manager) attached to this review.The general manager does not mind me posting this negative review as she detailed that "She doesn't care what is written on TripAdvisor".Summary of issues:Monday 9th (First night) - took 2 hours to check in to room 2213. Shown various rooms and reception staff were not very helpful. Require re-training.Tuesday - Door to room left open. Noticed at 4pm; therefore must have been left open all day. Nothing was taken luckily.Wednesday - Door left open again. Informed reception. Air-conditioning not working in evening, informed reception who said they will sort issue. Issue not resolved for 2 days and got fed up of chasing.Thursday - Still no update on the air conditioning and asked for rubbish to be cleared in room. Nothing done.Friday - 6am loud bangs on door. Was maintenance person to look at air con. Told him to go away. Ruined sleep.10pm noticed water leak in the ceiling on entrance and the bathroom in two parts. Above A/C unit on electrical part - very dangerous!!! Wife slipped on entrance and hurt leg. (incident raised by hotel manager). Rang reception who sent person to take a look - said would send manager. 30 minutes of waiting and no reply. Had to go down to reception and moan.Put in room 2001 and had to re-pack and got in new room at 11.45pm. Was told to speak to Diego in the morning.Sat - Spoke to Diego and said will type up incident report to definitely get compensation. 6pm when came back no feedback. Constant chasing and other staff knew nothing of problems. One even stated we had been moved back to 2213 (old room) - but this was not true! Room pass also stopped working. Told to speak to Joanna in the morning!Sun - Came down early and asked to speak to Joanna. She could not be found and another staff member pretended to be the manager - after I moaned the real Joanna turned up.New issue with 2001 - shower water leaking into whole bathroom and into the landing. Causing a leak in the room below and very slippery and dangerous. Told can move room but we said don't want to as haven't come on holiday to keep moving and re-packing. Have lived with issues since that day. Asked for 6 big towels to put on the floor!!! Not a way to spend your holiday.Monday - still water leak from bathroom shower. Continually had to chase Joanna as she was never available and no updates provided.Wednesday - No Joanna again in the morning. Said would be back at 1pm. Came at 1.15pm. After speaking to her said I would need to go direct to RIU and she would support our claim with a formal letter (attached). Thursday - late checkout requested since first day and only sorted after a week. Told housekeeping want room cleaned due to water. Said will be cleaned. When returned at 1pm room not cleaned - complained and said that will be resolved. After waiting 30 minutes and moaning again they then came. This got us late by 30 minutes. We also arranged a taxi via hotel to go to JFK for $70 - when got downstairs was late by 10 minutes due to housekeeping. Porter said that taxi man has gone (staff had given it to someone else) and we need to go with another person he has arranged. When we got to JFK taxi man requested $89. Again the hotel let us down!As per the above the issues are not normal - this ruined our stay! Which is why I have posted this review to help others.Paid $4228.90 for the above hotel and look at the service and issues I had!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We went for one night on Memorial Weekend...May 28-29, 2016. I was so afraid to go because of some of these harsh reviews. I paid a high rate because of the holiday weekend so I was double skeptical. Honestly the traffic and the parking situation was the most frustrating. Valet is $46.00 yes is high but when we got there we quickly opted for that service. The Hotel is very clean and the decor is very contemporary and fun. The rooms are a bit small for sure but I mean if you are only going for a few nights it should be such a bother. We stayed on the 26th Floor is has a balcony....LOVEDDD it !!!! Great view. The staff was friendly and helpful.... I would recommend this hotel any day. I had a great experience. I really dont know why some ppl are so hard to please. It was worth the stay...plus the location is perfect.....Cudos

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is smack dab in the middle of Times Square and Hell's Kitchen; so is pretty quite all things considered. I loved the accommodations and location so much I actually extended my stay. Clean, modern, compact, safe, comfortable,and perfectly located. I couldn't ask for more. Also they had glassware for those curious but no room service. Perfect for one or two people. I don't imagine the micro setup would be ideal for a family traveling with small children.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I've stayed for a few nights at this hotel and I've really been surprised that it has a 4 stars rating. Positive things first: The location is excellent. You are a few feet away from time square and the subway station. For my first touristy visit in New York, I couldn't wish for a better location.However the hotel itself was quite disappointing.It seems to me that since the opening of the hotel, the rooms were never entirely cleaned because there was so much dust from the renovation everywhere in the room. In front of the window was a pile of crumbles and dust which was quite disgusting an there were already stains on the walls of the room.The sheets of our beds had disgusting stains, even when they were changed by the housekeepers. There were still big visible stains on "clean" sheets.We didn't get toilet paper for 3 days in a row. Even the last roll we had in the bathroom was gone, for whatever reason. We often didn't get any handtowels, so I had to call the front desk for both items, that sould have been provided.The bathroom was a pure nightmare. You don't have any privacy because the sliding glass door doesn't close properly and you can literally see the person sitting on the toilet, through a big gap between the door and the wall. How romantic... If this isn't horrible enough you can also watch when your roommate takes a shower because the shower is behind a foggy window, where you can clearly see the contours of the person taking the shower. You could also clearly see that the bathroom wasn't properly cleaned. So thank you very much Riu plaza for those traumatic and embarassing moments I had to endure due to this terrible bathroom while sharing a room with my brother. The bar was also a fail, because they didn't have many on the drinks they had on their menu. At the end, the staff had to go n buy me a bottle of sparkling water at the hotels own little shop, because they had none. Well, I've could have bought this bottle on my own for a cheaper prize than what I had to pay at this bar. They even bought the wrong drinks (white wine instead of red wine) because they didn't know their own menu. Another highlight were the 50$ I had block on my credit card, for every night we stayes at the hotel. So I had to save 250$ on my card until the end of my stay, which is quite a rediciulous amount of money, when the hotel offers such a bad service.Thank you also to the lovely lady on the front desk who didn't take me serious when I told her about the dirty room. She told me off by saying that the renovation on the floor we stayed was already finished a few weeks ago and that the rooms are clean. No apologies, nothing.What great customer service...

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great stay at this new hotel. Staff were polite and very helpful. If I was to complain it would be no coffee or tea facilities in room and the coffee shop doesn't open till 9 so had to walk out to get a drink in the morning. Doesn't help having jet lag so sleeping pattern all over the place so it would of been helpful... Would stay again

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked the family room or suite that had two full beds and a pull out sofa. There was more than enough room for the four of us to sleep and have our bags. The shower wall kinda of see through though so if you're conservative you may not like that!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Just check in last night after 8 hrs drive with 3 babies under 3.Check in was fast not like what i have read. Unfortunately one of our room was not clean.. Looks like someone had just left.. Dirty towels everywhere, bed is not made... So on and on.. On the other hand the hotel is nice, very modern.. I will check back later

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It's a stunning new hotel with modern vibe. Reception was good and staff was polite and helpful, The room was nice but minimal .... especially in the bathroom there is no place to put your toiletries. This hotel charged their guests $52.00 Facility Fee that included in-room internet and wifi.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Arrived in New York from a very long flight from Western Australia, to be informed that they had no room available.Even though we had booked and pay 3 months in advance did not count for anything. Advised us that they had made arrangement for us to stay in another location down the road, so if we got in a taxi and paid for it they would reimburse us tomorrow for the money.This did not happen however we were put in a taxi and sent to another hotel, whom also had no room. After 3 hours our travel agent in WA found us a room.When we went back to the RUI in time square for the next night, they still did not have any room. We are still waiting for our money to be refunded.Further more the manage could not have cared less for these issues and would never recommend people to use the venue.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Decided on this hotel due to location and the fact that it's a very new hotel. Bad reviews such as the leaking baths are real and lack of general amenities, plus a exorbitant prices on the hotel meals. That apart, the hotel is new and nice and in general we have no issues with the cleanliness, Internet and location. Most of the staff are polite and helpful barring one by the name of Alia. On 2 occasions when we engaged her at the counter she was disinterested and had no desire to helping us, yet she could be happily chatting up another guest while addressing our request. Perhaps she thinks we are lowly Chinese she should not be engaging as she has a condescending tone towards us.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: stunning new hotel, modern vibe fell inlove the moment i entered through the doors. Recpetion was fair, rooms nice but too minimialistic .... especially in the washroom just no place to put your toilettries other than the floor really

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After reading the negative reviews I was a bit nervousBut let me tell you the hotel was fantastic the rooms are very modern Beds are great no carpets that makes it extra clean The only down fall the shower does leak not a big deal Location 100%% Close to everything

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: You can't beat the location in the Times Square area. It was the perfect spot to stay if you are spending most of your time going to the theater.The rooms are very small, the beds very comfortable, and it was very quiet. It did not have much space to put clothes. The bathroom sink lacked counterspace and there was no room to put anything. The biggest issue was the shower. It leaked, and I'm not talking a little. The drain is not big enough to handle the water flow and the edging to keep the water in the shower didn't keep the water in. The water leaked all over the bathroom floor, under the door, into the room, and out into the hall. When I spoke to the maid, she said "I know. Most of them do that. I'll bring you more towels." So my fix was to use extra towels and build a "dam" every morning before anyone took a shower. The other issue was no ice machines in the hotel. We had to go downstairs and ask for ice at the bar, and they would give us a few glasses of ice. But, the hotel is brand new, so it sure beats staying at some of the older places. Once it works out the "kinks', it will hopefully be a better place to stay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We spent one week at this new Hotel, and were very happy with all aspects of our stay. We understand the hotel is brand new and staff are still learning there duties, but everyone was making a good effort and offered great service. When we stayed the Hotel restaurant was not yet open, but allowed us an amazing rate for our stay. The Entrance to the hotel is very luxurious and immense amount of time went into the finishes. We appreciated that they accepted our luggage a full 5 hours prior to our check in time, to allow us an early start to our trip. The Room was very clean, and well laid out. Internet connection was really good. If i was going to dig for anything negative it would be that my feet did not touch the ground on the enormous toilet in the room, also not the most comfortable. Avery unique part of this room is the etched glass shower wall that is attached to the sleeping area. (Note if staying with a friend, this might be a tad awkward) Because the restaurant was closed we relied on the Cafe in the lobby, they offered some great baked goods, juices and coffee but the line can move very slowly (Waited 20 minutes for a water and croissant) Recommendation to the hotel, would be to have the till located a the start of the display for those that are not ordering or waiting on coffee can make thru quickly. Location is outstanding, from our room you could see the screens from Time Square. (17th floor facing 8th street) Within walking distance of some big attractions i.e. Broadway shows, fine Dinning all forms of transportation and Hop on Hop off bus stops and about 15 minutes from central park. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and the staff, the gentleman at the font door were excellent for advice and always really friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I recently stayed at the RIU Times Square with my mom and two kids. The hotel lobby is nice and location very good, but unfortunately the positive review stops there. Upon check-in the bedding in the room was not clean, stains and hair on the bedding. We requested it be changed and it was addressed. The hotel restaurant was to be open and wasn't the full weekend we were there. However, after seeing the prices in the snack café that was open, I'm glad we didn't dine at the property. Very over-priced for food, many other options within walking distance. We tried to seek assistance from the concierge for a restaurant recommendation in the area that would be kid friendly but no-one was available at the desk even though it was Friday at 2 pm. The doorman suggested subway or Fridays. The most upsetting experience at the hotel was when we asked the door man on Sunday to assist us with getting a cab to the airport, JFK. Fortunately we knew it is a flat fee of $52 to JFK. He told us he secured us a cab for $70 to get the airport. When I questioned why not the flat fee of $52, he suggested that the tax and tolls plus tip got us to $70. After securing another taxi, I learned that the doorman was "collecting" the balance of the fee because he was referring the ride to the taxi. Basically the taxi would give him $15 and then we would pay the cab $70, but we were not supposed to know about their "side deal". This is very disappointing and dishonest that you can't trust the hotel worker to be of honest service to the guest. He even went so far as to bring out bags back inside after I asked him not to so that he could prevent us from getting in another cab that wasn't part of his side deal. I would not recommend this property. Many better options in the area. They have much to improve with their soft opening.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked at the RIU through Hotwire and then became very worried when I read the reviews. I have walked out of many a hotel before, I consider myself picky.This hotel does not deserve all of the negative reviews. Great location! As they say location, location, location! Steps away from Time Square, 42nd Street, Broadway, Hudson River, Hells Kitchen and with good walking shoes 5th Ave, Madison Ave and Central Park. Last year we stayed outside of the city and trained in, won't do that again. It is so nice to have a hotel you can rest at for few minutes before heading out again. Customer service was great, room was small but to be expected in a city where every square foot matters, staff quickly responded to requests for extra towels and pillows. I was very worried about the bathroom as so many said it provided no privacy --- not an issue at all. We could not see through the shower wall as many claimed.I do agree with the comments about it looking run down after only being opened a month. The place is very clean and new but white walls in the hallways and bedrooms was a mistake. Owners should consider painting them very soon and in another colour.We will be back !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Overall we liked it a lot simply due to cleanliness, modern feel, and location. Amenities were nonexistent.Location was awesome, literally 1 long block (8th Ave. to 7th Ave is a "long" block) from Times Square. We could see some of the spectaculars (light up billboards) from our room on the 22nd floor. Minor downside is that it's 4 "short" blocks (46th street to 47th street is a "short" block) from nearest subway station, but that's a very minor negative because it's a fast walk. Check in was easy, no problems except ~5 minutes wait. I did express check out since we didn't have any extra charges, so that was as simple as dropping key cards in a box. Because the hotel is so new (opened March 2016 I think) everything is very clean and in great condition. The room was small, but didn't bother us since we don't need much "extra" room. Again, room very clean. The bed was comfortable. But there is a lack of amenities. We asked for a toothbrush, a sewing kit and a fork, none of which they could help us with. For a 4 star hotel I thought they would at least have a sewing kit or fork (even a Super 8 will have those!) They charge $13/day for wifi and water, but they never replenished the bottled water. So what exactly am I paying extra for? Obviously it's not the amenities. I would still stay there again for the great deal we got ($196/night +$13/night extra charge).

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The brand new hotel (january 2016) is very good located in the city. You are next to Times Square, not far away from different metro stations and restaurants.The rooms are nice, well decorated, modern... but maybe not a lot of place to put the cloths on...If I can go to New York back, I will definatly go again to the Riu Plaza!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Our room was very small, and extremely noisy. Walls must be paper thin, as our 16th floor room was so noisy both from the street and hotel. Front desk staff had us down to come the following week. Despite seeing all my paperwork, they advised me to contact my travel agent in Australia! As we knew our arrival was early in the morning, we had paid for the night before, but had to sit in the lobby for 2 hours while they cleared their paperwork. Then when I asked how it was going, the receptionist threw the paperwork across the desk, and was not at all charming.In our room, the bathroom had a water leak. The air con kept adjusting the temperature to freezing, and the television kept turning off.The grab and go had very little to offer besides sandwiches and cake. No breakfast appeal there.
