The only positive about this hotel was the location, but we noticed that there are many more hotels around that area to choose from.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Riu Plaza from 16 May to 21 May and loved it. We were a bit concerned reading some reviews. However, our room, 1220 was excellent. It was clean, comfortable and very close to everything being just off Times Square. There was a slight problem with a leaky shower but this was much better by the end of our stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - courteous staff and a light, new hotel! Four stars due to the shower problem, otherwise five.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Smallish rooms (but bigger than "boutique" hotel rooms), not very quiet controlled. While not a big thing, the views of New Jersey are great but not through the dirty windows. Snarky General Manager, expensive and slow coffee shop in the lobby. OK for the price, but not one to write home about.
user_name:
DANCEshow
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First of all. It did the job. Provided us shelter for 7 nights and had a comfortable bed to sleep in. Lot of people say it's a perfect location. To me not. Why you need to be so close to Times Square and Broadway shows? This area is noisy and expensive. Yes this hotel is in restaurant row 46th street and all the dining places in 9th avenue is close as well. But you truly get better food with more reasonable pricing anywhere else. You really don't get the perfect NY vibe here either. And for that reason I won't return to this hotel. I prefer Upper West side or East Village. Our room was superior king which are corner rooms and bit bigger than normal deluxe rooms. Views were gorgeous but windows are so dirty it's ridiculous. I know this is a new hotel and they're still some construction going on but dirty windows equals indifferent behavior. There's not enough storage for your clothes for a long stay which truly is a shame. Room is pretty though and as said earlier we both really loved the bed and the pillows. Towels were good quality as well. Too bad they didn't make the rooms soundproof as they advertised earlier. You hear everything from corridors and outside as well. If a light sleeper you really need to use ear plugs. Staff was not rude but not really nice either. I always got help when needed but honestly they either are new to the customer service or they don't care. No greeting in the morning or evening when passing them in lobby. Few days I tried to get eye contact with them but nada. If you wanted a greeting you needed to say it first and be loud enough for them to notice. Not a biggie but it would be great if they would show they care about us even a little. They didn't welcome us in check in or didn't ask how we liked our stay in check out and didn't welcome us back someday. To me that's pretty weird. Hope they start training their staff soon. Little things count! If you have booked to stay here don't worry this is an ok hotel which has lot of potential to become A GREAT hotel with some tender loving care. :)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I read so many bad reviews prior to my wife and I staying there the weekend of May 13th. I admit I was a bit nervous.... First of all, The location is AMAZING. Right next to times square, a nice walk to Central Park and we even walked to Grand Central. Upon arriving there, I asked if they had anything higher up than the 8th floor that thy had us in, The lovely gal behind the desk told us to hold a moment, then came back to tell us that she had something on the 24th floor and that it was a free upgrade she was giving us! Totally cool.Sure, the rooms are kind of small, but large compared to many other places I have stayed in New York City. And the styling and cleanliness were Excellent. The TV was huge and the room was beautiful. The bed was incredibly comfortable. It was very easy to get extra pillows as well. ALSO, it was perhaps the best hotel shower I have ever been in. HOT hot water, 2 shower heads and it was very spacious.The gym in the hotel is pretty awesome as well. Set away from everything else and even has bathrooms with showers right outside the doors. Had a water cooler inside with cups and Poland Spring water. The TVs were Huge in the gym as well. Perfect for when you are on the treadmill or elliptical. They had free weights that went up to 50s too. The housekeepers were all very happy and glad to assist you in any way you needed. They always had smiles on their faces and asked if you needed anything.The bartenders were totally cool and made some great drinks! We brought our own bottle of wine onto the patio\courtyard area, which was totally cool, and the bartenders brought us waters and glasses. and were always asking if we needed anything.I WILL stay here next time I am in NYC. It was truly a wonderful experience! Highly recommend to all!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The Hotel Riu is just opening and despite other reviews I found the hotel clean and comfortable. The rooms are a bit "industrial" and a little loud because the floors aren't carpeted. The beds were comfortable. We had a suite. There was plenty of room. The bathroom was huge and laid out well for a family. The staff was gracious and helpful. I asked them to have my car brought up and the luggage loaded at a certain time and they delivered.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotels in Times Square are extremely expensive and the rooms in a low cost hotel are small and less than comfortable. This hotel is brand new. In fact, not yet fully completed. The upper floors are still under construction as well as the shopping arcade. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The rooms are huge and spacious for NYC. You can't beat the location. The bedding and linens are the best. The service was impeccable. Go for it before they complete the construction. I anticipate their rates will increase substantially. I have stayed at other Rio hotels in Panama and Mexico. They do not disappoint.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was able to book Hotel Riu in April. The room was nice but if there were more than 2 people in the room it would have been way too small. There was not a dresser in the room so we had to keep all our clothes in our suitcases. The bathroom was nice but the shower leaked water all over the bathroom. We spoke with housekeeping and they told us that we were not the only ones with the problem. Guess it was a design problem. We used more towels than normal but it was for the water on the floor. The front desk help were all very pleasant. For me when I travel to NYC i am barely in the room. All I want is a clean room, nice location, friendly staff and close to the subway. This hotel offered all of that at a decent price for NYC.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in a perfect location,a stones throw from Times Sq,Broadway and Hells Kitchen, totally central.RIU is brand spanking new and upon arrival this is reflected,the lobby and rooms are super clean ,fresh and modern.Corridors to the rooms could do with a bit decor as they felt very 'cold' and prison like.Rooms are functional and adequate as nobody goes to NY to sit in their room all day.The only thing required would be a coffee facility either in the room or in an an alcove of the corridor,perhaps remove the fridge and replace with a tea and coffee option.The hotel has just opened so with everything just give it time, there's always small teething probs,it's the only way to tweek and improve.The staff were exceptional from the boys on the entrance,reception,engineering and security.I stayed here for over a week and by the time I left they felt like friends.I can not thank the staff enough.A big hello from Oman to Yamil,Nyma,Prisco and Maurice and everybody else I came into contact with.A great big Thankyou and I wish you all the very best.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is brand new, in the heart of Times Square. It's walking distance from the metro and has restaurants and bars all around it. It has a bar, a cafe, and a place to leave your luggage until check in or after check out until check out flight. The service is great, and it has all working amenities.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stay elsewhere! I usually stay at the W or the Waldorf when I go to NY but as I was browsing I saw there was a new Riu opening in Time Square. I have stayed at the Riu in the Caribbean and it was great. I assumed it would be the same! I was totally wrong. I called the hotel early May to see if they were open because they had not opened yet at time of booking. The phone rang and rang and then just hung up on me. After 5 attempts someone answered. Yes they were open. The day before our stay I called to ask a question and same experience. No one answered and it took me about 5 attempts trying differed extensions. Again the phone would just ring them hang up on me. So we arrive on May 14. The hotel was nice and clean but not like the photos on the website. The photos were either from a different hotel or photo shopped. The room was small and screamed IKEA. No problem if that was it I would not be wasting my time on a review. The temp was set at 69 and cold air was blowing. We set it to 73 but nothing changed. We tried over and over and set it to 80 but no change. They don't tell u that the rooms are set so that u can't manipulate the temperate!! There were no blankets on the beds. There was something over the mattress that was a bit thicker than a sheet. So dah!! we were cold. I called and asked for someone to show us how to adjust the temp because at this point we had not realized that it could not be changed. I also asked for 2 pillows and 3 blankets. There was a sleep sofa but no pillows or blankets!! After half an hour I called again and repeated my request, another half and hour goes by and nothing! I went to the lobby and asked and was told someone will be sent. More waiting and a woman brings 3 blankets and 1 pillow with no pillow case! Fine so I go down again and ask again for someone to come adjust the temperature and one more pillow. They again tell me to go back to the room, this time I insisted I wait until someone got me a pillow and sent someone to adjust the temperature. They gave me a pillow ( no pillow case but by this point I didn't care). A nice technician came up and informed us that we had 2 options. Turn off the AC or keep it as is, there was nothing between off and 69 degrees. So we asked him to turn it off. I understand that it's a new hotel and there are kinks to be ironed out. But the concept of '' HOLD ON WHILE I GIVE A CRAP'' displayed by consumer service was taken to whole new level. Only one woman named Karen seemed to really care about customers complained, ( I was not the only one who came down to verbally request things because the phone calls were ignored) everyone else had an I don't give a crap attitude). I could have stayed at the W for $100 less and had a much better experience but lesson learned. Never again!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: They just open so I thought they would be on top of their act!2 Elevators not working out of 6.Service at the bar is very bad, they don't come and see you, you have to go and ask for drinksDirty Windows Dirty bed sheetsInexperienced personnelBad designVery loud in the roomNoisy in the rooms halls no carpet Sheep renovationOtherwise new bathroom modern new furnitureYoung inexperience staff

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: After reading previous reviews I was not very excited to stay at the new riu and almost switched to another hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly made who spoke fluent German. Very nice! Unfortunately that was the highlight of our stay. The rooms are small, all new but decorated cheaply. Who could hear the neighbors and the slamming of the doors on the corridors. Basic amenities in the bathroom were missing. Mini bar was empty. And the facility fee for water that no one gets is a joke. Sorry but the new Riu is no more than a very good 3 star hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Very nice new hotel located on the street called restaurant row. Convenient location for many reasons. Many great restaurants on same street and on 9th Avenue. My favorite restaurant in entire world is on the same block - Meson Seville. Times Square is a short walk away and so are many theaters. Good access to subway and buses.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a brand new hotel. Located in the heart of Mid Town / Hells Kitchen. Rooms war specious for New York situation. Unfortunately we got our suite at 6th floor only but have been surprised by the space we got. Expecting two rooms (1 master and 1 living room with sleeping couch) we got a perfect set up with little entrance onside bath and separated toilet and 2 full equipped (king, and 2 queens + flat screen in both rooms) separated sleeping rooms - the best for a couple and a third family member. The missing living room was never a problem nor a discussion - who want to stay at the hotel room longer than necessary in such a wonderful and agile city. Staff was very friendly and helpful at any time (lobby, door man, concierge, security, house keeping). For sure rooms have been cleaned very accurate every day. No problems with the air-con heating (was cold at night) and cooling during the day.Extra requests have been fulfilled with in a blink of an eye - even at busy times. Beautiful lobby with nice decor and comfortable couches. The location is in a great location! Close to broadway shows and plenty of great restaurants and bars. We will come back again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Positive aspects: central location in New York, 2. Convenient breakfast place in the hotel called Capital Grab and Go 3. Fast elevators 4. Very friendly staff!!! Negative aspects: restaurant inside the hotel not yet operational, hotel is quiet new,Overall, highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: At first glance this hotel looks new (which it is) and feels new but on closer inspection it fails in every other department. Very unfriendly staff and very rude, the 'grab and go' coffee shop is more like grab and wait (20mins with only 2 people in queue).Bar area only just open but for how long I don't know ($24 for bottle of beer and a whisky). The rooms are very small and the showers leak all over the bathroom and into the main room. We asked for clean sheets three times in our week long stay and never got one change, rooms were never swept and toiletries were not replaced. The most shocking thing of all was a sum of money taken from our room while we were out. All we got was 'sorry I thought it was for me' on a piece of paper. Not even a face to face. Reception were not interested and neither were management.Do not go to this hotel unless you want ripped off and insulted.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: When I read some reviews of this hotel it makes me wonder why people bother staying away from their own home if they criticise such small issues!We had no problems checking in - waited about 5mins.We had no problems checking out - there was no queue when we got to reception at midday.The bedroom (double deluxe) was lovely, no smaller than any other hotel I've stayed in in various countries. At the end of the day, it's a base rather than somewhere you're going to be staying in for hours on end.The beds were very comfortable and there were spare pillows in the wardrobe.The bathroom was also lovely, yes, the glass is a little revealing if you have the light on but we left it off (I was with my mum & sister) when we had a shower. The shower did leak a little but we put a spare towel down where it was leaking so didn't have any issues after this.We stayed on the 8th floor, yes, it's noisy with traffic outside but I bet any other centrally located hotel is the same. Anyway, I always wear ear plugs when I'm away.The location is amazing - one block away from Times Square and all the Broadway theatres. The only gripe I have is that the guys (concierge?) in reception asked me who I had booked my return taxi back to JFK with and I said Dial 7. He said they would rip me off and they use a company that charges a flat fee of $72 including tolls and tip. I cancelled Dial 7 and they ordered me a taxi which was very prompt but charged me $72 plus tolls (we didn't go through any tolls), plus tax and plus tips. I was really annoyed about this but because I'd already left the hotel I couldn't follow up with the guys in reception. I wish I'd kept with Dial 7.Other than that, all good and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Pre opening discount month.hotel is new so some problem occurred during check out. But it's ok. Everything new I like it.some suggestion . Body lotion ... Coffee machine( many place don't provide coffee machine but ...)

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A brand new hotel which is experiencing growing pains. The bar and coffee area just opened and aren't yet running smoothly. There is no restaurant. However, not a problem as there are plenty of eats just steps away and a Starbucks on nearly every corner. The rooms are tight as expected and housekeeping needs improvement. Had to keep asking for shampoo and to pick up dirty dishes / garbage. Also, need to actually damp mop the fake wood floors and dust over the beds ! The bathroom is adequate but has a sliding door which isn't very private. When you turn on the light it spills into the room so whoever is sleeping will be disturbed. Poor design , it's simply a modern fiberglass box which leaks from shallow shower tray. Great location for theater goers. I don't care for Times Square as it's too busy with lots of junky souvenir stores. I would rather stay in a quieter area next time.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First of all I have never posted a review of a hotel before but I feel like I need to warn people to stay away from this hotel. From the first moment we walked in to the hotel it all went downhill. We arrived early and was told our room wasn't ready. We understood that because we were early and check-in was not until 3. We were told to call back after 3 to see if the room was ready. We were out and about and tried to contact the hotel and couldn't get anyone to answer to see if our room was ready. We came back to the hotel and it was not and found out that the reason our room wasn't ready was because it hadn't been finally completed from the construction. I couldn't believe that they had rented me a room without it being ready! I demanded a room that was equivalent or better than the one I had reserved which was a junior suite. They gave me a double bed room which was a downgrade (2 double beds pushed together) and told us that they would try to have our room ready by the evening or the next day. To say the lease I was furious especially since I was paying $400+ per night to stay at this hotel! We agreed that we would accept getting into the room later or the next day. After going to a Broadway show and getting back at 10:30 they told me that the room was still not ready and that it would be a little longer. We finally got into the room around 11:15 that night. I really don't think they cleaned the floor before they told us it was ready because I was walking around the room In socks and they got dirty in no time of being in the room.I was very, very disappointed In the junior suite. On the website it shows the room with a king bed and a sofa bed which was what we needed since I was on a trip to New York with my 2 daughters. The picture DID NOT show that it was an open floor plan and that there was a soaking tub in the middle of the room with a glass shower and toilet area which gave no privacy to anyone. It was a good thing we were all girls, but it still was not acceptable! Through the whole process of being upset about the room and the inconvenience of the hotel, not once did the manager (Diego?) come from behind his desk to apologize and try to make things better. He could have cared less that we were unhappy. I guess that was what made me so angry. Later we realized that we did not receive our robes or slippers that were included in our package. So we had to ask for them which should have already been in the room. There was also no complimentary bottled water in our room or ice service at the hotel. On the last night, my girls and I went to go grab dinner and see a comedy show. We left the hotel around 7 and when we came back the door to our room was wide open! When we called down to the front desk the women told us that she was going to send someone up to "show us HOW to close the door". How rude can someone be? Obviously we know how to shut a door. How dare you tell someone you are going to show them how to close the door! Security did come to the room to make sure nothing was missing and we showed them that even if you left the door half way opened it closed on its own. We started to think that engineering or housekeeping had been in our room while we were gone but didn't understand why they would be in our room at that time of the evening since our room had been serviced earlier in the day. The issues we had with the hotel are totally UNACCEPTABLE. They could have been avoided and been handled differently with customer service. We will never be staying here again and will not be recommending this place to anyone. Don't let the pictures on the website fool you either. The rooms are not what they seem to be. The rooms were small and the appearance on the website may show that this is a 5 star hotel but it's not! The gym was also not what it appeared to be on the website either. It looked huge on the website and it was actually small and had few pieces of exercise equipment and no ventilation They also did not have any sanitary wipes to wipe down the equipment after use which I thought was unacceptable. The only good thing I can say about his hotel is that the doormen and the security officers were the only ones who seemed like they cared about our stay. Even though that made us fee like someone cared, it didn't make up for management of this hotel. I still can't believe that the manager did not offer an upgrade to our service or to comp us for the inconvenience we had. To be honest, I feel like I could have stayed in a 2 star hotel, been a lot happier and saved myself a ton of money! It was so disappointing, because I had planned this special Mothers Day weekend with my daughters in New York and staying in this hotel made the weekend a disaster!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Horrible!! Came down sick from sink water as per desk clerk! Promised reduced rate on another stay NO response from manager!!! Don't stay here!! Reported to hotels.com hotel did not answer phone!! Sick for three days!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Not quite sure where to start. I suppose the first thing to mention would be that I work in finance for a large hotel group in Europe, with one of my hotels just having undergone a £20m refurbishment program, so I know somewhat what I am talking about. I also worked in operations for a long time before moving to finance.The positives first:The hotel is in a great location and brand new (couple of month old) which can bring its challenges but overall its a nice property. 2 Blocks from Times Square but away enough to enjoy some more local restaurants and bars with some great ones being on 46th Street. Room size is average and rooms are appointed nicely, the decor is very modern (and a bit bland in my personal opinion) but nice nonetheless. Beds where comfortable and linen and towels where good quality.The not so positive:Due to the nature of 600 odd rooms, check in can be a bit lengthy with some queues, but was still quick enough nonetheless. The building is new and I would expect some teething issues, which I can overlook quite easily.My biggest bug bear was that the Air Con did not work. We were on the 22nd floor and it was hot outside so it was even hotter inside. Ave temp. was 82F. Opening a window did not make much sense and since there was roadworks outside the hotel, at night time it just wasn't an option. Hence the nights where ridiculously uncomfortable. The bigger issue was that during my stay (4 nights) I must have complained about 10 times, to be told every time that it would be looked at! It was finally "fixed" on the day of departure! Once I was standing near the concierge desk waiting, with one staff member passing me about 10 times but looking right through me. There seemed to be no interest at all and staff quite frankly seemed overwhelmed. As it turned out the air con was not switched on (which was heard by numerous guest) and was the main talking point in the lifts. For me this is the biggest issue as when booking a hotel, I am paying for a comfortable nights sleep and it was just impossible to have that.I therefore complained on check out about the air con and I asked for compensation, as simply the hotel failed in its purpose in my eyes and @ $275 odd a night, i feel it is warranted. I did not expect anything comp but a $25 - $50 reduction per night would have been appropriate in my eyes. The receptionist told me I had to speak to a manager, which was fine. After a small wait the manager arrived only to tell me that he is not authorized to process refunds, as a Manager, and that all such requests need to go through their central office and that he would leave my details with somebody contacting me. This was 2 1/2 weeks ago and sure, no one contacted me. For me this is the most ridiculous procedure ever and quite simply a delaying tactic in the hope that people could not be bothered taking it further, which is probably the case most of the time.Whilst I still enjoyed my stay most of the time, I would never choose to stay in another RIU again, regardless how old the hotel or where in the world. Customer service & more importantly satisfaction is achieved by dealing with issues and problems there and then, and not with having to leave my details in order to not to be called or contacted anyways.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I had made a reservations months before my arrival May 4, 2016 and when I got there, they did not have my room available. They tried to find a room at another hotel and was sent to one that it did not have any available rooms and was sent back to the Riu hotel. When they finally find a room for me to stay, it was 2:30 in the morning and I had to walk to the place, which after checking in, I got to the room at 3:20 am and had a 8:30 am meeting. The whole situation was handle very poorly by Riu Plaza Hotel and they blamed the booking company for the mistake, even though it was confirmed by them and by me the day before my arrival.
user_name:
Manolo Z
California Hot Springs, California

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: If you want to walk into the hotel past people loitering outside and smoking around the hotel's giant ashtrays, then this hotel is for you.If you want to book a hotel for a certain price that then charges a mandatory $13 a day for WIFI and water (except there wasn't water in the room) and a $50 security deposit, then this hotel is for you.If you want to stay in a new hotel that already shows signs of wear on its walls, then this hotel is for you. If you want to stay in a hotel that does not include an additional pillow or blanket in the closet or a bathrobe or slippers, then this hotel is for you.If you want to stay in a hotel where opening the shower door means knocking into the hand-held shower head on the wall, then this hotel is for you.If you want to stay in a hotel where the hot water doesn't get hot, then this hotel is for you. If you want to stay in a hotel where the shower door enters into the shower so that you cannot reach your towel unless you open the door into yourself in the shower in order to reach the towel, then this hotel is for you.Well, those were the things we discovered when we stayed one night at this hotel that occupies a former parking lot. It's not a hotel where I will "park" again. It's NOT for me.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The location of the hotel is great - Times Square is just a block away along with all the theaters and lots of other attractions in a walking distance (although subway is a few blocks away so you have to do a bit of walking).The hotel looks pretty new (or totally renovated).I would give it rating 5 if not two problems. A smaller problem is lines on the reception, both when you check in and when you check out (hint: pay for the hotel when you check in, that way you can do express checkout later). They seem to have some problem in the system because during the checkout they first told me one amount I owned, then the system printed a receipt for a much bigger amount, then when I pointed it out it took them 5 minutes to correct it - that probably adds up to the queue size.A bigger problem however is the design of the shower stall. It leaks water when you take shower and also when you open the door. If you just take shower once a day you have a soggy bath mat; if you take it more than once before the room is cleaned up, you end up with puddle on the floor. See my pictures.Guys, it's 21st century! I know that the problem of non-leaking showers has been already solved - I see hotels with shower stalls that don't have that problem, maybe you should learn from them?

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A quick girls get away for the weekend. The location is exceptional, you can walk to so many restaurants, a show, times square, or a subway stop that gets you everywhere else. The bar was not open yet, but the pantry was. The staff we encountered was polite. We did have an issue with the door keys, and based on what maintenence said it seems to be a common occurance. The rooms are not huge, but nicely sized by New York standards in my opinion. My only complaint would be that you have very little privacy in the bathroom or shower. The door to the bathroom is a slider, and all noise carries, and the back of the shower is frosted glass that is next to a bed. With the back lighting you see the person in the shower. It might be award if you are traveling with someone other than spouse or close family. The rooms was quiet, except for the door to the hall, the maids start knocking at 8 and we heard that very clearly. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here 22nd April-29th April-We had requested a room with 2 beds,but were given a room with a double bed.we went to recception,where i showed them my confirmation letter requesting 2 beds,me and my daughter were then taken to another lovely ,clean room with 2 double beds,we only had 1 pillow each,i rang reception,and within 5 mins a woman from housekeeping arrived with 2 more pillows.Our beds were changed every single day,the room was cleaned and was spotless every day,10 out of 10 for housekeeping.The showers were fantastic,and the toiletries were very nice,The beds were so comfy and cosy.We were on the 15th floor and never heard any noise at all.The most helpful person was the concierge-Yamal,he was so happy and pleasant and,,polite knew so much about the area,and always happy to help and always had a happy smile ,,I would defifnateley stay at this hotel again-keep up the good work .

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here the 1st week in May and there was still works going on around the hotel. Despite this, the Hotel was very clean, the staff really friendly and it has everything needed. The bar opened during the week and looks fantastic, the staff are professional and the prices in line with local bars and restaurants. The location of the Hotel was perfect for us, it's only 5 minutes walk to Time Square and is surrounded by plenty of places to eat and drink. We stayed on the 21st floor and it's quiet (for New York) despite the main road adjacent to the hotel. We will be returning later in the year and will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here last weekend in a family room, 2 parents 4 kids. The room wasn't huge but we had adequate room for all of us. We were on the 19th floor, on the north side of the building. The view was nice and it was very quiet. The hotel is fairly new so the accommodations were immaculate. The lobby was large and very nicely appointed. However the hallways and room were nice but very stark, think white everything and very little decor. My wife commented that the hallways felt like a hospital. The beds in our room, including the pull out couch were very comfortable. The bathroom was set up in a good way and the shower was awesome! We could have stayed in there all day! There is no carpet in the rooms/hallways our had a grey faux wood laminate flooring. Check in was a breeze. Check out was a breeze. The hotel is about 4 blocks away from subway stations, and we were always able to get a taxi right in front if needed. It is a two block walk to times square, a 15 minute walk to Rockefeller Center, so very conveniently located.Now a couple of not so great things (keep in mind I think its is just because they are so new): When we got to our room we didn't have any bedding for the sofa bed so I called the front desk for some. They finally brought some at 2:00AM. The concierge was completely worthless, she didn't know anything, not even where we could order a pizza from! Lastly they ran out of printer ink in the business center and never replaced it while we were there. Overall great place to stay and would definitely do it again!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed on the 15th floor facing the street. Even though I am a light sleeper I had a good night's sleep both nights. The location was perfect with Restaurant Row and the Theater District right outside the door. The room was immaculate, bed comfortable, and a bathroom with a decent size shower. My husband loved the extra fluffy towels. We would definitely book again.
user_name:
KathyC82
Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well my husband and I are currently at the Riu Plaza New York. This hotel is very conveniently situated near Times Square.We checked in early evening and went for dinner at a nearby restaurant. We returned early as we were tired and ready to retire. Our twin beds looked inviting (although the pillows appeared to be rationed to only one per person, a bit mean) so we got ready to hop in.Luckily I pulled back the bedding first. Well in all my years of staying at hotels I have never been so disgusted. The beds had been made to look as if the bed sheets had been changed. The pillow case had been replaced but the sheets had not There was a plastic tag in the bead, black woolen fibres and body hair. My husbands sheets were stained, had hair and biscuit crumbs. Made us feel sick.I got dressed and went down to reception to ask for another room. When i explained to the receptionist that my husband and I had nearly slept in the dirty beds he seemed disinterested and told me he would send someone from housekeeping to change the sheets. I asked if housekeeping would be long and he said 20 minutes.I returned to the room and we sat on the sofa and waited and waited till gone 11pm. I was just about to go back to reception when I heared a woman across the hall complaining, to what appeared to be a lady from housekeeping about her leaky shower. Anyway, i asked her when housekeeping would be sorting our clean bedding problem. She looked at me and said she had no idea about our problem. She said she was really busy and had a huge list of problems to sort that night.We just wanted to go to bed so I told here to bring us some sheets and we would re-make the beds ourselves, which we did, after the lady had taken pictures of the dirty sheets. So to anyone booked into the Riu Plaza I say "check your beds".I can't see how this hotel could possible achieve 4*. The rooms are very cheaply and hastily put together. 1 pillow each is 1* stuff. That sums it up for me.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: When we checked in we were immediately shocked by the tiny size of the rooms which were both misrepresented in the online photos. I measured roughly 9x8ft TOTAL. We were also overwhelmed by the smell of fresh paint and so I went to speak to the front desk about it. They offered a more expensive room that didn't smell and I immediately said no.I asked to be checked out and for a refund and they refused. We ended up going to a new hotel due to the fact that we felt unappreciated and ripped off but also because of the smell. The hotel charged us for the entire 3 days stay even though we were in the room for less than 20 minutes. The staff was rude, hotel sterile and claustrophobic. There are far better deals with larger rooms. This place was NOT worth the $900 they stole from us on our honeymoon!!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This hotel is really nice!!! It's new, clean & the staff is super friendly. My business partner & I stayed at Riu, when we were in town for a trade show...it's AMAZING!!! We prepaid online. Check-in & check-out were super easy (absolutely no hassle or inconvenience). Most importantly, the location is perfect!!! You are literally within walking distance of Times Square, maybe a 3-5 minute walk if that. Love love love!!! Fyi-1-There is a refrigerator in the room. 2-They don't have a restaurant on site; but, don't fret because there are endless possibilities nearby. 3-The lights are a little tricky. You have to insert your key into a device near the door. The key must remain in the slot, until you leave the room, if you plan to use the lights. Enjoy!!!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location amid Time Square area. Walk to many theaters and eateries. Staff well trained. Loved Hanna in housekeeping, she kept everything neat and clean. Rooms smaller but design and colors appeared to enlarge area. I'd rather have a smaller new clean room in a great location with great staff. Only negative no coffee in room and there was no fresh Decalf coffee downstairs. They wanted to give me Sanka instant packet for $3.00 . No no no!! Make a pot of Decalf people...

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I came to check in a bit early (circa noon) and there were no rooms available. This isn't too bad as I was early and that I would need to come back in 3 hours. They did not have a process to text or call if a room was ready earlier. So I asked if I could get a wifi pass and work in the lobby. They could not give me any wifi because their system completely broke down. When I asked for recommendations of a place to go they sent me to the concierge who tried to charge me $10 for a wifi pass in the lobby. When I refused she sent me to Starbucks. It was raining and so I asked if I could use an umbrella. (I had to go to another desk for this). The first bell man said I could buy one across the street! The guy standing next to him must have realized I was frustrated so he just said, hold on....and went to find me an umbrella. That guy was the best employee I met! When I came back 3 hours later their system was still down and I had to wait another 30 mins until they could identify a room that was open. They just don't have their stuff together. Stay away for a few months until they get better or hire new people

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed during 'soft open' for a very competitive rate due to the restaurant not being open.The hotel lobby looks very nice and spacious, check in went smoothly. The lifts are very good and fast.The corridors and rooms look more like a budget hotel - that was fine as we paid a very reasonable rate, had I paid the full rate I think I'd feel little let down;- the decor is very plain and looks bit cheap, incl. bathroom being a box inside a room with a glass wall (so if you turn it on at night the bedroom is lit)- no real privacy in the bathroom as there is a sliding door that leaves gaps- no real glasses, paper cups in the bathroom- toiletries are terrible design, really difficult to use- standard hotel hairdryer with a short cord- sound proofing is bad, you could hear everything from the corridor, and similarly everything from the rooms to the corridor- a/c in the room was faulty so had to switch rooms (seems like a common problem as the front desk immediately asked whether the a/c was buzzing)- the hotel has only been open for few weeks, yet the a/c in the second room already had some water damage marks as had the shelf below the bathroom sink- the coffee shop downstairs is very expensive - go to Duane Reade around the corner instead for snacks (smoothie in coffee shop is $8!, less than half at DR)The nice stuff:- staff were very friendly and helpful- location is excellent just couple of blocks from subway (easy connection to JFK for a fraction of a cost of a taxi)- comfortable bed- fridge is nice for storing own snacks- nice views from 18th floor- good wifi

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I was excited when we walked in and saw the new, lush building. Meh, that's where it ended. Check-in and check-out lines are ridiculously long, even with 5 people working the counters. Next, the rooms and structure have great potential, however... All white in a hotel doesn't make sense. The walls already looked like the hotel has been open for months, even though it is only open a few weeks. The room, at first sight, is very appealing. There are faux wood floors, modern bathroom design. But there are so many flaws. First is the bathroom box is basically in the bedroom, with lots of open crevices. This gives the person the bathroom very little privacy. Next, there are no clocks, making it hard to figure out what time of night it is... because trust me you WILL be up all night. We were on the 18th floor and all we heard were doors slamming from halls, ambulances from the street, and LOUD LOUD LOUD music all night until about 4 a.m. We called the front desk, begging for another room, anywhere else not facing the street, but I was told they were filled to maximum capacity. The one plus were the elevators that were very quick, but the paper thin walls and windows did nothing to prevent the noises that Times Square produces on a Saturday night. This was not our first time in the area, but we surely wouldn't be able to justify another night at this hotel's full price in the future. Also, they should consider a night light or something softer so that if you need to get up in the middle of the night, the room doesn't look like a photo cube to do so. You'll know what I mean if you experience it. Lastly, why isn't there a quicker key drop for check out? Doesn't make sense to wait on line again. Unless the night here is free and you don't mind being up, consider elsewhere.
user_name:
Always4Travelling
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and was very impressed. The hotel is in a great location, close to subway and of course times square. Rooms are not massive but are good size for New York. Very friendly staff overall really impressed with the hotel considering we stayed during the soft opening.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Was in NYC to see Hamilton and this hotel was just down the street from the theater! In fact the location was great in general. Close to Times Square but not right in the heart of it which is what we wanted. Also close to many of the theaters and the subway was only 2 blocks away. Convenient if taking subway to and from the airport.We were on the 19th floor and didn't hear any of the city noises. Rooms were clean but small. We didn't mind b/c we were hardly in our room but that is something to keep in mind. Restaurant and bar weren't open yet. (Which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. It would have been convenient if it were open).Overall we had a lovely stay. I would stay there again and recommended to my friends.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: First off the location is very convenient. Close to shows, subway and restaurants.The hotel is new and looks modern, and the Internet was good. The experience would have been better for us if the following are improved:- Check in process was very slow and rooms were not ready before 3pm, so don't bother with trying early check-in.- Rooms were not cleaned well, saw crumbs on the floor in my room.- Water leaked out of the shower door excessively.- The conditioner and lotion bottles were the worst design. It was very difficult to squeeze anything out.Would come back for location but home some of these minor improvements are made.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: PositiveHotel is in a great location, a block or two to Time Square and plenty of bars and restaurants to suits all tastes. Staff on check in and check out were helpful and efficient. Hotel is very nice so room are clean and user friendly, really comfortable bed. I'm very likely to return to the hotel due to location and quality of the rooms.NegativeThe room does lack a coffee machine or even a kettle for that early morning brew, there is a coffee shop on site but this doesnt open until 7am. Currently the hotel bar is still awaiting its licence so isn't open, which is a really shame.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Great location. Nicely decorated ,clean comfortable room. I only wish I knew that the restaurant and bar were not open yet that was very disappointing .I would stay again. Was with teen girls and they loved the décor. There was a coffee shop in hotel that I noticed upon departure that looked good. The doorman and bell hop were very nice >I WISH I got there name. You are able to leave your luggage in a locked storage room after you check out which was great

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We booked this hotel at a discount during their 'soft opening' (not all services are up and running). Great location on 8th & 46th, steps from theatres and restaurants. Brand new everything. Contemporary design with efficiency in mind. Great base from which to explore the neighborhoods around Times Square. A little less hectic than being on Broadway and has attracted a continental crowd familiar with the RIU brand. Lucked out on pricing and impressed by hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: As everyone has said its a new property in a great location, they need to work out kinks still.Rooms are supper small, but Nicely decorated. Have stayed in Riu properties in Antalya Turkey and Negril Jamaica previously, overall they do a great job.If you join their Riu Class which is their frequent guest program at check in they have no interest to credit you or take your # at check in or out its on you to go online and do that. Just one more thing to have to do,

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: It is a very new hotel, so as the previews reviewers have said, it needs a little more time and practice to be ideal. The lobby is gorgeous, the reception people are super sweet and helpful, and doing the best they can. During the peak hours the check in and check out process can take long tho. I had no problem with that. The corridors leading to the rooms are all white, with no other decoration and look a bit like a hospital or a... prison :)However the rooms are very nice. A nice size, very clean and new. The bed is super comfortable (a bit on the harder side, but for me that is perfect). The bathroom is cool too, and in my room (324) there wasn't much of a shower leakage problem as many others have pointed out. I would have some negatives to say about the quality of housekeeping, since I had some issues with that in my room, but I suppose that might be the problem of one person not doing his/her job properly and that got communicated to the management. Another thing - the housekeeping started banging on the doors already a little after 9 am (check out is noon), which I find a bit rude and have never seen before in any hotel. Especially considering there is no way to get checked into a room before 15 pm. So that makes you feel a bit unwelcomed. But I'm sure once they get all of their facilities in order and houskeeping trained this has the potential to be an excellent place.The essentials are great:Location - perfectBed - perfectShower - perfectTowels - softReceptionists - friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is a brand new hotel. I got a great deal for an over night stay that I couldn't pass up. Paid $114 with taxes for a room for the night. Hotel is brand new and very clean. Rooms are not overly big but are clean bright and have sufficient room. Nice bathroom with walk in shower, large closet and a nice size flat screen TV on the wall. My room was on the 25th floor at the end of the hall with great view of the river. Staff was very friendly. Beautiful lobby with nice decor and comfortable couches. The bar and restaurant were not open so I can not comment on this. The location is in a great location! Close to broadway shows and plenty of great restaurants and bars. I'm sure after their soft opening the prices to stay here will be quite pricey. Glad I got to stay here now. Only negative comment is that it took almost an hour for our car to be retrieved from the valet parking area. They did warn us about this so we did call ahead before checkout so we didn't have to wait so long in the lobby. Would stay here again if the price is right.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stay in NYC on business travel most weeks. I found this hotel to be a disappointment. I waited in line to check in for 40 minutes. The room it's self is small and the décor looked cheap. The hallways have hard floors and I heard people going by all night. The bedding felt cheap and wasn't comfortable. During my 2 night stay, my room was never cleaned or restocked. There were 2 paper cups to drink out of the first night but once I used them, I was without a cup to drink out of.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I feel that we really got lucky with this hotel in NY. It's brand new and the price was low for NY. It's located in Times Square which was a fun experience for the whole family, especially our kids. The rooms were very clean, the rooms size was fine for NY (I stayed at more expensive hotels with smaller rooms), the view was gorgeous (we got a room on the 25th floor), the staff was very helpful. As I mentioned earlier, we got really lucky with this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Note: this post comes after waiting for one week to the hotel to respond on our many claims.We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and we really had a terrible experience.We went as part of our honey moon to New York and we decided for the Riu as we had previous experiences with this chain in the Caribbean which were really acceptable.Stay started with an hour of waiting in line to check in. When we finally got in the room noticed a 2x2 meter room with space for nothing, very poor on accesories. Later we noticed that Air extractor in the room did not work so we had to deal with our natural smells for quite a while until decided to open the window.Worse came later when trying to sleep. Temo in the room was about 80 fAC was not working, so they sent a maint. Person to solve the problem who commented that ac in our room was not working.We made an official complain the next day at front desk, but nobody seemed to care to much. We then new that AC was working although due to NY regulation they couldnt turn it on until some specific date (why did they sent a maintenance person at 1 am in the morning the previous night??)In any case, never got a reply from the hotel to our complains, we tried to solve this before going to trip advisor, maybe a discount in the first night or similar...Nothing.They believe is fair to keep charging above 200 USD pero night for a hotel that is still not 100% working.Definitely RIU owners should hear about this... Only positive commented is location.Thanks RIU for making our honey moon a couple of days to forget!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: My family and I rented two rooms for three nights at the Riu a week ago. The hotel itself was excellent -- the rooms were very clean, bright, obviously brand new, and quiet. I stayed in a room on the 5th floor with two double beds and found it to be more spacious and quieter than other NYC hotel rooms. The shower was excellent and the mini fridge was an added bonus. The only problem we had was with the staff. Time and again there were serious issues that took a lot of time to settle (for instance we had problems with the check in, check out, horrible car park, false charges on the bill, confusion about lost and found, rooms were cleaned when we had do not disturb sign up, etc.) that made our experience less than satisfactory. For instance, the check out took 2.5 hours (!!!) because the incorrect charges took so long to settle. Overall, I give it a 3/5 because I care more about the quality of my sleep than the friendliness of the staff, but I do think that there needs to be some major training before the hotel can be given the 5 stars it really deserves. I hope to return to Riu in the future once these issues have been settled.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I really like the RIU family of hotels... I stayed at the RIU in Cabo San Lucas and couldn't have been happier with my stay. So, I wasn't sure what to expect from staying here, considering the RIU Plaza New York Times Square just opened a month ago and they're currently in what they call a "soft opening." Some of the previous reviewers had mentioned some new opening growing pains such as long wait times checking in / checking out, no air conditioning, disorganized valet / parking service, etc.However, I think that the "kinks" that other reviewers experienced might now be worked out or are in the process of being worked out... because I thought my stay was wonderful.1) Decor - very modern decor and I loved the fact there was NO CARPET anywhere! Even in the halls (see picture) and the rooms themselves. I'm asthmatic and this was AWESOME. Not to mention, it means that rolling your luggage around is easy peasy.2) Front desk check-in / check-out - there was a line for the front desk but they had at least six people working and the line moved VERY quickly.3) Staff - I thought the staff was very friendly, helpful and plentiful. I think with the initial soft opening, they might not have gotten all of their staff at the RIU Plaza, but there were tons of staffers in the lobby area who were approachable for questions.4) Luggage storage - my initial impression of the luggage storage process wasn't wonderful because their small little room was stuffed and luggage was overflowing into the concierge area, so luggage was randomly put everywhere making it difficult to locate your bag when you came to pick it up. But, the next day, when I picked up my bag, I noticed that they had moved the overflow into a larger room and had worked out an effective system where luggage was organized by the anticipated "pick-up" time and by storage tag.5) Comfort (air conditioning) - because of the previous reviews that stated the hotel did not yet have air conditioning, I called the hotel before I booked my stay and received confirmation that they had turned on the air all throughout the hotel just two days prior. I can confirm that the air conditioning was working when I got there and in my hotel room.6) Valet parking - Some people have asked where you can park. As with nearly all NYC hotels, RIU Plaza provides valet parking (and valet parking ONLY). This will cost you $46 / day. OUCH, but I think what most hotels charge. I did not use the valet parking service, so I can't attest to how long it took to get your car, but I can tell you that they had a dedicated valet parking service.7) On-site restaurants - the full-service restaurant is not yet open and when I asked the front desk said it wouldn't be open for at least another month. Consequently, there is no room service either. There IS an attached coffee shop with "grab and go" food. I'd mention too that the hotel is located in the heart of restaurant row... you can walk out the main entrance and have a plethora of dining choices right within a couple hundred yards.8) Location -- This location is freaking unbelievable! It is one block away from the heart of Times Square. It's also right in the theater district. I was in room 2315 which was the southeast corner of the hotel and I could see glimpses of Times Square but most of it was blocked by neighboring buildings. You have magnificent views of the Hudson river on the other side. If you're familiar with the area, the RIU plaza is directly catty-corner to the Theater District Shopping Court.All in all, I have to say I more than enjoyed my stay at the RIU Plaza. While there might be just a few more kinks to work out, I would say that they have earnestly been working hard to get the hotel up and running to the same level that I've experienced at other RIU hotels.
user_name:
pingelizabeth
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Chic, modern, boutique style. Fabulous bright airy lobby with really friendly attentive staff. Lovely outdoor courtyard area. Trendy bar and restaurant. Rooms are very modern, clean and very comfortable with a huge superb walk in shower. Rooms have a free safe, iron/ironing board, hairdryer and amenities. Great location just off 8th avenue with lots of superb restaurants on your doorstep. Would certainly chose stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Stayed in this hotel this past weekend. The hotel was well kept and looked great. The staff is the first thing you see and they definitely make you feel welcome. Everyone was great, valet, house keeping, admin, all were great. its 5 mins away from time square. You do not need a car. But if you have one its about $50 overnight. We went for a birthday party for the weekend and used the hotel's car service. Valet staff was more than amazing. They even got us a limo last minute since car service wasn't available. It was great and I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. Plus there is a little coffee shop attached to get a quick bite or coffee before you hit the road. Clean, friendly, and amazing staff!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A friend and I recently stayed at the RIU on our trip to NYC. I was excited to stay there because it was a new hotel, we got a great price and I have stayed at RIUs numerous times internationally and always have a great experience... until this trip. Let me start by saying that hotel is in a great location in midtown, it was brand new and very clean and the rooms are a decent size for NYC. The problem that we encountered was with the staff at check in/check out and dealing with them after we got home. To make a long story short, my friend and I split the cost of the hotel, each paying our own half upon check in. Upon check out, we were asked for our cards again and the woman who was checking us out had a hard time understanding that we wanted to split the cost between the two of us. She even asked a manager who was not helpful and mumbled "I don't understand the visa system" and walked away. After a half hour, we both paid our portion of the room and left. It wasn't until three days after we got home that I noticed a second charged from the RIU posted on my account. I called the RIU, asking why I was charged again and was given the run around. I was told I wold be contacted by the end of the day and wasn't. The next day I called again, say run around and I asked numerous times to speak directly to the manager and was told I couldn't but I could email him and he would email me back by the end of the day. I emailed him and still have not heard back and it's been 4 days. My bank is disputing the extra charge but the lack of customer service is horrible. A hotel is only as good as the customer service and this hotel has none. I am very disappointed that this is the staff that RIU hired to run their NYC hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I'm not really one to care where I sleep as I go places to do thing and do not what to feel obligated to spend any time in a room. That being said (see previous sentence), it was fine for the price. I've paid more for less in NYC before and the location is great if you want to take in some shows. I've seen this chain in other cities but this is the first one I've seen in New York-- it is very new and I get the feeling the lack of name recognition and newness was what caused it to be low priced. By the time you read this it will probably cost twice as much (Paid about $125 pre-tax). Even at that price if you are the type that likes new, clean rooms you will like it. Only complaint was there was no place to put anything down in the bathroom. Like nothing. Maybe because it was an accessible room but I imagine people in wheelchairs need a place to put their toothbrush too.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Everyone was wonderful. The hotel is fresh and new and the staff was very helpful. We stayed and went to see two plays. We took a taxi to and from Penn Station and that was it. We were able to walk comfortably to everything we wanted to see and do. The cafe had great coffee & fresh squeezed orange juice to start the day.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: The hotel is new and clean, good location, but hotel is still basicly under construction. No services, no restaurants, no breakfast, no air-conditioning, really too many no words for four star hotel.I was really dissapointed when staff at reception promised that air-conditioning will be ok after technician will come and repair it. Then in the morning a construction man told that there is no air conditioning even installed yet (on 20th of april).

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: A brand new hotel midtown Manhattan, close to theater district. Well run, friendly, clean, modern... Only part of hotel is opened, but everything works. A great place, especially considering run down and/or overpriced alternatives.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: This is my first time giving a 1 rating for anything. I was extremely disappointed with the service I received from this property. I travel to NYC at least 6 times a year and have been to different hotel with different rating class but this time it was a beyond repair.The good stuff: The location is prime. The hotel is located a block away from Time Square (46th and 8th). The hotel is of course brand new so the rooms were clean and beautiful. The lobby is reminiscent of a simpler version of Cosmopolitan in Vegas. Clean and easy on the eyes. The property has a gym and grab and go snack store located in front of the hotel. I would still suggest getting your snack from Duane Reade (it's cheaper).Now the disappointing part. I know it's a new hotel but the check-in process was a bit slow. I was caught in the mix of hotel guests checking out but there was no warmth with their front desk personnel. The lobby was WARM! The outside temperature was in the high 60s but the hotel lobby feels like in the high 70s. It was uncomfortably warm! Now going to the room, for a big hotel chain, I was surprised that there was no complimentary bottled water (just a heads up for future guest). My room was located on the higher number and had a good view of 8th Avenue. Now, here's what got me, Day 1 was a bit cooler outside and I did not noticed that the A/C is not working it was set to 77 F. During the day, I leave the hotel to go around the city so I was never in my room until bed time. Day 2 was different, the temperature hit 82 F and I felt the heat in the room. I initially called the front desk to let them know that I think the A/C was not working. They told me, they are sending an engineer to check it out. When the engineer arrived, he too noticed that the thermostat is not working and instructed me to open my window (seriously?!?!) I can hear the sirens from the street vibrating in my room. The second time I called, they sent the same person to check the room. I told the front desk and the engineer that the hallway is much cooler than my room. He stated that at least my thermostat went down to 76 F! (Seriously?!?! From 77 down to 76 F?) He again advised to open my window. It's 11pm and they are expecting me to sleep with street noise going into my room? I finally asked to be transferred. The front desk called my room and informed me that they have a room for me on a different floor. (It gets better) She ask me to come down to the lobby to get my new keys (what kind of service is that?!?!) I was already in my pajamas, so I packed my luggage, dressed up, and exchanged my keys at the lobby at 1230 AM! I finally got my new room and I know my A/C is working because I can hear it and the room cooled down in less than a minute. At check-out, nobody at the front desk even acknowledge that fault, or even asked me HOW WAS MY STAY? I mean, is this how they run a hotel? I think the front desk needs a refresher on Hospitality. I was in a rush to catch my flight and I was not able to talk to the property manager.There was no service recovery or apologies from the property and I can say that even Howard Johnson have a better service recovery that this.Disappointed!

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Well for starters this is a great hotel. Their introductory rates are fantastic and definitely not what the stay was worth. The lobby is quite beautiful and huge. Checking in was a slow process but imagine the front desk agents are just settling in and that this may be a new system for them after all I visited a week after its soft opening. The elevators are a little small but are fast as lightening. I stayed on the 7th floor and it took the elevator less than 30 seconds from the time I got on the elevator. The halls are a little bare but they're huge and have window views of the city which are really just unrivaled. The room is extremely updated just see the photos I posted. I really enjoyed that the electricity in the room is controlled by placing your key in the walls soon as you enter. The room was pretty spacious (deluxe King). I loved the bathroom and window views. It was a fantastic experience. The thing I didn't love was how much purple is in the room. The service is pretty good. The Check in agent wasn't very memorable but I definitely appreciated being called in the room after checking in just to make sure I was satisfied. I encourage anyone thinking of trying out RIU Times Square to just go ahead and do it. It pretty centrally located and overall a great experience.
user_name:
pharaohkalai
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: DO NOT waste your $$ at this hotel. This is at best a 2* hotel. When you arrive it seems nice but all of that changes as soon as you get to your room. Rooms are very small. We had booked a Double room for 4 people and the beds are pushed together because of the lack of floor space. It is not advertised in the photos arranged this way making it look more spacious then in reality. The hotel only provides 1 pillow per double bed, NOT the traditional 4 pillows per bed like other hotels. So we only had 2 pillows for the 4 guests in the room. We called down for extra pillows(2) and were told,"I don't think we have any more extra pillows but I will check". I have never been to a hotel that has no extra pillows! The Double room provides a pull out sofa that had no sheets, blankets, or pillows available for it in the room. After waiting for the lobby to call back about the pillows, we inquired again. Again we were told that there were no extra pillows available. We requested to speak to management and were told that they would be there in the morning. So 2 of the 4 people in the room had to sleep with no pillow. Also we found out in the middle of the night that there is NO air conditioning in the hotel. Management and staff are very aware that they have no air conditioning and that is not communicated to guests upfront when checking in. The manager, Micah Polansky, then proceeded to lie to us and state that "no hotels in NYC currently have air conditioning." This is clearly not true as our hotel we moved to had no idea what they were talking about and it was 1 block away. It is a sham that the staff does not tell customers when they check-in that there will be no air conditioning and let the guest decide if they can stay there or not. I would have never stayed in a hotel with no air conditioning available and it is unfair to guests to not make them aware of the situation and then refuse to refund their $$. It is very uncomfortable to sleep in 80 heat, especially with no pillow. Beds are not plush, they are a very basic quality mattress and quite stiff, not 4* quality. Showers leak an excessive amount of water and you will need extra towels to make sure it doesn't leak all the way into the room. They do not provide irons to iron your clothes in the room as advertised. They do not provide bottled water in the room as advertised and there are only 2 paper cups to use. This is NOT a 4* hotel! I would never recommend staying here unless you are paying a 2* price and they actually get air conditioning, pillows, and fix the leaky showers!!!! Very poor guest relations when they are very aware of all these issues beforehand. This was a complete bait and switch...promising a new 4* hotel and giving you an unfinished 2* hotel. They also would not let me leave the hotel until they charged my credit card for the full stay, so I was forced to charge the full amount in promise of a refund because that department doesn't work on Sunday. I won't be surprised if that never happens.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Staying here right now and unhappy...My little girl is in theatre; we travel to NYC at least twice a month and stay at various hotels and have so far liked everyone we stayed, except for here. For what was hardly a bargain price, you get -- a room. And for a new hotel, you do not get a clean room -- at least we didn't. My daughter dropped the remote and it slid across the bare flloor in a corner; when I picked up it was covered in fuzz/dust. There is no comforter on the beds and the sheets are scratchy. I asked for an upper floor. We were given -- the third (could you put us any lower!) I travel enough to know better! (Marriott where are you tonight?) Also, I looked at my bill and it says I'm going to be charged some $13 resort fee. Resort fee? For what, there is absolutely no amenities at this hotel in the room or out...not evne so much as coffee maker. But my favorite is the few things that RIU uses to justify this fee -- didn't exisit, for us and that was supposedly a free bottle of water. Yep, Can hardly wait to take this up with the front desk. Didn't bother to do after checking in took forever. I waited in a line 3x. First - my fault. I forgot my license in the car. You'd think when I came back, they'd advance to the front line. Nope. Then when I got there, I was told...ready for this...they couldn't make a reservation for me that I had to go around the corner to the hotel computers and make an online computer, because they couldn't do it for me. What? So I played the game and went around the corner and made the reservation. Came back. You guessed it. Had to wait in the line - again!!!! This was after driving since 4 am. We love our trips to NYC and have met super nice people here. This place is bland, unfriendly and for the first time, we can't wait to check out of our hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Having just got home from an overnight visit to this property I thought I would shoot out a quick review. This hotel is brand new. Its european design is modern and clean. The rooms are small but comfortable and the location is great if you're visiting the Time Square area. With that said, management needs to work the kinks out. First, having to stand in line both to check in, and then again to check out is a giant waste of time. They require this as they charge your credit card for an additional $50 above your room rate union check-in for "incidentals". They then refund this fee at check-out. If I leave my credit card number at check-in, simply charge my room and any "incidentals" after I vacate the room WITHOUT making me stand in line again. Also, be aware that the air-conditioning in the rooms is not working. The windows in the room open so it wasn't intolerable during the night, but it was 78 degrees when the sun was out. The weather for the next few days calls for near 80 degree days, those rooms will be VERY warm. The clerk said that the air will not be on until May 1st. Lastly, the coffee shop is now open, which means that they no longer have complimentary coffee in the lobby and there are no coffee pots in the rooms. The wait in the coffee shop were long only to find out they had no cream.I understand that we paid a discounted rate for the "soft opening" and accept that there is work to be done. I would watch the reviews closely because when the rates go up, and the problems persist, I would not recommend this property. If they fix the problems it could be a very nice place in a excellent location.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights in April after booking an excellent deal directly with the hotel. It is in an excellent location, 2 mins and you're in Times Square and a couple of mins in the opposite direction you're in Hells KitchenPositivesLobby is bright and airy and modernConcierge staff smiley, helpful and always greet you with a helloBright room, decent size for New YorkOrganised a car to take us to the airport at late notice Fridge in the roomNew hotel so everything is nice and clean and bright Excellent wifi - fast enough to stream TV shows Safe in the room large enough for iPad and laptopNegativesFar too long to check inThe shower leaked everywhere (seems to happen with every modern shower!). Luckily plenty of towels to soak up the waterUnable to get late check out, just a flat no when we enquiredAs a few people have mentioned this hotel isn't fully opened so there are some niggles. Not all of the lifts are working, however we were never waiting for a lift for long.We will definitely consider this hotel when visiting New York again.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I work in NYC from Tuesday to Thursday so I do know the hotel scene here pretty well. This is a great addition, just stayed here during soft opening. Very friendly staff. Nice rooms, great beds and clean (new :) bathrooms. Will stay here again. Use any soft opening pricing, I am afraid this will be far more expensive soon.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed with my family at "Riu Plaza New York @ Times Square" for a week during April.I booked directly from RIU Plaza official website a room for 4 people, the day before our check in date. At our arrival they gave us a room arranged only for 2 people. We called the reception and we explained the inconvenient and after 30 minutes, the housekeeper brought us two more pillows and towels. We decided to ask an upgrade because the room was very small for 4 people, particularly the beds were 1,30 m for 2 people. The receptionist informed us about the price of this upgrade. At the same time we found the same kind of room at venere.com for a lower price than offered by the reception desk. We asked him if was possible to apply this price according to "best price guarantee" fare. He answered us: "no problem, it's ok we can apply the lower price". We moved to our new room and the sofa bed was not arranged. We informed the reception, so the housekeeper brought us pillows, sheets and blankets and she went away. We had to make the bed by ourselves. During our stay the room were clean in the late afternoon (5 o'clock PM) or early morning (8 o'clock AM). All day long other customers had problems with air conditioning so every hour arrived the engineer who knocked on every door asking if we called him. Restaurant and fitness area was closed. SURPRISE... At the check out they asked us 500$ more than discussed at the check in with receptionist. We also spoke to the front desk manager and he said the fault was with the receptionist when was said us that they were able to apply best price. In that moment we could cancel and re-booked on venere.com paying a little surcharge!!! This is something very serious because the receptionist represents a full-fledged RIU society. We filed a complaint against RIU and front desk. Finally, stay away from this disorganized hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: When you first walk into the hotel it's such a beautiful sight, but as soon as you get to your room that all changes. The rooms are miniature with barely any room to walk. That's not even the worst. Our bathroom flooded all the way into the room and out of the room. Soaking some of our luggage. When I called front desk to complain I was told that oh there's not much we can do it's an issue with all of the rooms. My friends and I were appalled. The fridge in the room was broken, the beds were so hard and uncomfortable and each bed had one pillow. I asked a housekeeper to point me in the direction of the ice machine that's when I was informed that they had none. I then called for room service and was informed that there was no room service. I asked about the restaurant I saw downstairs, and was informed that it wasn't ready yet. This Hotel literally has nothing! I felt unwanted as a guest. Like they didn't want to be bothered with our complaints. They have so much to improve.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed three nights, the lobby was beautiful and a nice place to relax. The staff was wonderful and everything was really exceptional. I will definitely stay there again.
