Can not say enough about the friendly staff. The only down side was two of the elevators were out of service however, it was only an issue during checkout\check in times. I give them a 10!!!!!
user_name:
fam5930
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the RIU Plaza in New York this past weekend for a family event. We knew the hotel was new, so we expected there to be a few hiccups, but we thought that based on other reviews, our stay would be uneventful. I wish that was the case.After checking out, we had to wait 2.5 hours for the valet to return with our car. We were not the only ones who had this experience and bonded with many of our fellow travelers who were stranded by the RIU Hotel while waiting for their vehicles. When I complained to the manager Joanne, I was told it wasn't her problem and that "this happens every Sunday." When asked how the management was working to solve the problem so that other guests didn't experience a similar situation in the future, she didn't have a response. To add insult to injury, when I explained that I didn't think it was fair that I should pay for the convenience of valet parking, since it was such a failure, Joanne told me I could not get a refund.I completely understand that issues arise during an opening. If there had been communication about the problems (only one valet driver), I would have been much less angry about the situation. I suspect most people are reasonable, but the management's failure to communicate with guests who were complaining and their inability to try to mitigate the situation only made things worse.I felt very bad for the doormen, who were taking the brunt of complaints. The doormen could not have been more pleasant and apologetic. I suggest Joanne take some customer service tips from them. Overall, the RUI Plaza in NYC is a 2-star hotel that has a fancy appearance and 1-star customer service. Save your money and stay some where that values its guests and where you will actually get the services for which you pay.

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We are staying at this hotel now and have to say it's excellent and the location is fantastic ! Our room is on the fifth floor and is very quiet , the climate control in the room works perfectly , their is a large flat screen TV , safe , iron and amazing bathroom with walk in shower . The bed is really comfortable and the decor is really modern ( even though it does still smell of fresh paint slightly !).The restaurant & bar are not yet open , but there is free tea, coffee , orange juice and water available in the lobby . The staff have been really helpful and always say good morning and help you with directions . Location is ideal , 5 minute walk to time square ( so near enough without the noise) and 5 minute walk to 42nd street subway . We switched to this hotel the night before we came to NY, as we got an amazing deal direct from their website . So glad we didn't listen to the scaremongers as its worked out great .I think the soft open deals are available all through Apri and would highly recommend it !

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I stayed at the RIU during what they advertised as their soft open. There was no food or bar service yet so I can't comment. The staff was warm friendly and helpful. My room was a deluxe queen on the 12th floor. The room was a good size for a NYC hotel. Bed more than comfortable and very nice modern appointments in the entire room. Huge flat screen TV and huge window to the outside. Free WIFI throughout the hotel. The standout of the room was the bathroom. Stand in glass enclosed with an overhead rain shower head and a handheld one as well. The location can't be beat if you are a tourist. Theaters and places to eat are only footsteps away. Subways are only a couple of blocks away.
user_name:
Scott B
Boca Raton, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: we stayed at the riu last night,the receptionist told us they are open for 11 days! i guess thats why the rates were so low at $150,its a steal of a deal....they only have standard rooms avail so far, suites aren't avail yet. up in the room, theres a slight smell of fresh paint, but didn't bother us too much. excellent shower and very comfortable beds. the decor is fresh and modern design. we stayed on 5 floor, didn't have a great view but the location of the hotel is awesome, close to times square.will definitely come back

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for spring break week of this year(2016) We made our reservation via there toll free number on THERE website.We asked certain questions prior to booking the room.The agent told us they took triple A for a 10 percent discount and that the hotel had a swimming pool.We have little kids and were ecstatic about the pool situation.When we checked in the front desk was very unorganized.I understand its a new hotel so we should expect some issues.The room was very clean thus it being new but it is very tight.We had a deluxe family room. 1st major problem-There is no pool here..2nd major problem-We didnt get the triple A discount...3rd major problem-WE HAD NO HEAT OR AIR FOR OUR ENTIRE 4 DAY AND 3 NIGHT STAY at over 300.00 bucks a night including all there lil fees.Engineering came up and basically confirmed it didnt work. 4th-Major Problem-We had no linen for the pull out sofa bed.5th-When you open the sofa bed you have no access to the refrigerator or the desk to sit and work.6th-After hanging out late in new york when we came to check in after being exhausted or keys didnt work.7th-We went downstairs and they gave us new keys....Those keys didnt work...I went back downstairs and they said my keys were programmed to the wrong room.8th-CValet Parking took almost an hour one day.A couple other days they couldnt even find my vehicle....I spoke to the manager of the hotel and he assured me he would give us some type of discount and get the triple a discount applied.He gives me a 100 bucks off and tells me they already took off the triple a discount.I said you think I am a fool the discount was never taken off.I have the emails...He gives me an email to send my complaint too and says they will issue a refund of some type.I get a reply back from them saying it takes up to 20 days to reply.I wouldnt stay here again even if it was free...To new,To small rooms, and horrible management.....I wasted over 1k staying here....

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: Hotel is brand new- basically appointed but obviously clean and new. Beds are comfortable but there is a problem with the air conditioning and we slept in the heat last night with the window open and were so uncomfortable. The staff is all new. They don't have any answers and we are locked in for another night. And it's almost 80 degrees. No management response. Don't stay here until they work out the kinks!!!
user_name:
MDfamilytrips
Gulf of Papagayo, Costa Rica

hotel_name: Hotel Riu Plaza New York Times Square
review_body: I did stay 3 nights after a last minute booking.The front desk employees are really helpful ( in particular Melanie) that helped me beyond expectation as she upgraded me to a better room and she accomodated my requests. Really appreciated it.The room is new, cleaned and well looked after with a large shower! It is a bit noisy as located in front of the elevator.The hotel has just been opened so still some works need to be accomplished, and possibly is why the rates are that low considering the great location. However, I would definitely recommend the Hotel if you plan to visit the Big Apple.1st April 2016, Luca
